Reviews.Author: Yuna T.
Reviews.Content: Good food. But I just want to leave a review for this one specific drink. One of their good cocktails, there's one called spicy concombre which was yummy! If you're in the mood for spicy cocktail, try this! I loved it. I'd come back for this drink again and maybe try other well known ones.

Reviews.Author: Desiree L.
Reviews.Content: A great date spot! How romantical...Beautiful ambiance, gorgeous view of DTLA, great food, rooftop bar is the cherry!Come here for brunch and mimosas/sangrias, enjoy the afternoon on the roof with some drinks lounging on the couch soaking up some Cali sun.Thursday or Friday nights are a hit-or-miss. Random crowds; business men and women, sometimes touristy, or a ton of Asians. Dinner on a Saturday night is ideal. Lounge on a couch and enjoy the live band or head up to the rooftop bar and enjoy the skyline view of DTLA. If you are just going to the bar on a Saturday night there might be a line outside and a line on the 13th level as well. BUT if you are "too cute to wait in line" they'll let you by-pass the line no problem-o! ;)I'm obsessed with the POUTINE FRIES! Goodness... it's like a mouth-gasm!

Reviews.Author: Caroline R.
Reviews.Content: The view of DTLA from their rooftop is gorgeous!!! We sat outside, of course, to take in the scenery! The dinner was amazing as well, had the filet mignon, medium, and it literally melted in my mouth. Also had their Mac n cheese appetizer which was also very delicious , not too cheesy. It was too dark to take Instagram selfies, unfortunately. Made reservations on a Thursday night at 10p, but we were running late so I called to bump it to 10:30p, their LAST CALL for dinner, n they were pretty chill about that. Got there and had a couple of drinks at the bar before we were seated. Gotta go back again! Honestly their prices are perfect!

Reviews.Author: Careline V.
Reviews.Content: NUMBER OF VISITS: 1WOULD I COME BACK: Yes...on a warm night...I'm typically not much of a party animal, a drinker, a social butterfly or someone who frequents the night life. Most of my life, I've been a home body. Only lately have I been out and about more. It might be new friends, midlife crisis (though I'm not that old), trying something new, or someone even told me depression. Whatever it is...I found myself here in the last couple of months. Like I said, I'm not usually someone that wanders out much, let alone the DTLA area...I think that's where this is. I came here with friends one night after having dinner at Bunker Hill Bar & Grill. The night was young and we decided to stroll down the streets of LA over here for a drink. There wasn't much of a line so we decided to come on up and have a drink. I forget the series of events, but you basically take elevators, stairs and whatnot to get to the top of the building. There, you'll find yourself outside with a great view of the city. It was a bit of a chilly night and I was wearing summery clothes as I was not expecting to be out so late. Plenty of people were there that we had to find a spot near the wall to stand, chat and have a drink. I don't have much else to compare this place to, but other than I was a little cold, I thought it was pretty cool to be able to see the city.Yeah, I'd come back here on a warmer night with clear skies....

Reviews.Author: Joanne W.
Reviews.Content: What a view !!! Definitely a sight for sore eyes haha. Came on a friday night around 7:30ish? We really wanted to catch the sunset while on the rooftop and we made it! We only came here for the rooftop experience so I'm not sure how the food is since they do have a restaurant downstairs. Although, I really do wanna come back here and try it! The view outside looks amazing while you eat and enjoy live music! Yes, they had live music as well~Tips -[x] COME EARLY!!!! The lines get pretty long around 9p I think? We left around 930 and the lines were already long![x] No cover charge I think? Just gotta wait in those lines, take the elevator, and stairs haha[x] Drinks are pricey! Roughly $14 a drink ... [x] Bartenders are okayy ... not very friendly and I didn't feel like tipping .. but did so anyways. [x] Drinks are okay ... Ordered a long island and didn't even taste right.. *hint the 4 stars instead of 5*[x] There is bathroom on the rooftop as well, except it's only one at a time haha. No stalls or anything so ladies, expect to wait for a bit!Overall, I had a great time here with my friends! We were here to celebrate a birthday and I'm glad it went smoothly! :) I would definitely come back here again just for the view and also to try their food~

Reviews.Author: Allan S.
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my birthday here and had a blast! Some highlights:-View: Stunning! The rooftop overlooks Pershing Square, which is so beautiful during the day and even more beautiful at night.-Service: Hit or miss. The bouncer was friendly and wished me a happy birthday after seeing my ID. The server (or manager?), not so friendly. Someone accidentally knocked my $14 Long Island Iced Tea off my hands before I had even tasted a sip, and the server told me she wouldn't replace it. I know this technically wasn't her fault, but replacing my drink would've taken the hospitality here to the next level. -Drinks: The Writer's Block was tasty, but the Lolita had a strange aftertaste which tasted like... puke. I kid you not.-To reach the rooftop, you have to take an elevator to the 13th floor, another elevator to the 15th, then walk a flight of stairs. There can be a long line at each stop, so come early!Perch had its misses, but the view alone made the long lines and pricy drinks worth it.

Reviews.Author: J A.
Reviews.Content: What an incredible experience. It was my first time at Perch this weekend and had reserved an outside table to celebrate my mother's birthday. When it got a bit chilly, I inquired about moving to another table (which I hear is usually IMPOSSIBLE), but within a few moments they switched us to the table next to the fireplace outside.The gentleman who deserves a big THANK YOU is Tony Cicero who was just the sweetest and most helpful person that night. Tony helped us switch tables, made sure my mom felt like a VIP on her 60th birthday and made sure we were enjoying ourselves.Tony went above and beyond and truly made our night wonderful.The live band was incredible, the service was perfect and the food was great!We ordered the baked brie, charcuterie platter, gnocchi, risotto, brussels sprouts, cauliflower, and an off menu vegetarian dish. All were great- especially the brussels sprouts!

Reviews.Author: Charles C.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Saturday night after waiting for about half an hour outside (Arrived at 10, got in at around 10:30).  A couple of friends had recommended this place as a nice bar to visit around downtown LA, so I decided to give it a shot.  I was put off by having to wait outside in the line for so long, but was simultaneously excited, because lines do serve the purpose of hyping up a venue, and having waited in one for half an hour, I couldn't help but wonder what I could expect upstairs.I'm not one to frequent rooftop bars and lounges, though this was definitely not my first.  That being said, I think Perch is a little bit overrated.  If possible, I'd give it 3.5 stars out of 5.  It just seemed a lot smaller than I would have hoped, and I remember mentioning to my party that it was extremely crowded up there but I had no idea why.  The outdoor area allocated to those who were just there for drinks was very small.  There's a bar inside and one outside.  I'm not sure if there were any differences in what each of those bars served, but we decided to wait at the bar inside to get drinks.  I checked the menu and ordered the "french maid," which turned out to taste a lot like a mint mojito, which I wasn't upset about.  It was actually quite good.  Despite the small size of the venue, the Perch did have a nice rooftop view of the city, and it was nice to be able to see the skyline from the 16th (?) floor.  Granted, we were by no means in the tallest building in the area, but that just helps to give me a better perspective of the city.Didn't stay for much longer, since we were asked to move away from the side of the balcony to make room for a couple who wanted to be seated there (who I guess made reservations).  Found out while leaving that there was actually a lot more room in outdoor area allocated for diners and reservations, so not quite sure why we got asked to move, but I'm sure they had a good reason.Didn't try the food here, but I've only heard good things.  In the future I'll know to make a reservation ahead of time, so I can actually take advantage of the seating, and not just stand around and feel like a nuisance to the venue.TL;DR rooftop bar, hardly a lounge, good for dates; either make reservations or just skip this spot

Reviews.Author: Jasper L.
Reviews.Content: Perch was good back in the day. It was more open and the crowd was younger.Fast forward and you've got a consistently "overcapacity" bar with a level of pretentiousness that is downright disrespectful.When you get through that ridiculous line in the front (we show up consistently before 9PM on busy nights), you'll be lead to a second line to get into the second elevator. Yes - this is not a simple process.Once you're up there, you'll be herded like cattle out of the area. The bouncers are so damn rude. We had literally gotten out of the elevator and he turned to us and said "you guys need to move out of the way. we are overcapacity and we WILL remove you."WHAT THE F*? Who says that to their guests?We then attempted to wait in line for the third elevator (yes third one) where they make this fake little queue to build hype about their true rooftop bar. By golly it is ridiculous because after waiting half an hour in line - there were maybe 20-30 people up there. This is of course, after being herded again by another bouncer saying we couldn't stand in line because we were blocking it.By the time we were up top, we had given up. Tired of the b.s. and just headed back out.If this was a one time experience, I would have let it be. But after 3 times of being here, I just can't do it more. Stay away from this pretentious bar that only talks the talk and wears the makeup, but doesn't walk the walk and is downright ugly without the faux-midcentury look.

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: The food was pretty good, but I thought it was pricey for what it was... you're basically paying for the view. It is a fantastic view.I had the Huevos Rancheros. The spicy tomato sauce was not spicy to me at all, and I didn't feel a kick, so if you're not a spice person, it's still a safe dish to eat. The portion size is good.I also had a bite of the French Toast. I think they use a croissant as a base, which made it super butter, and in turn, super delicious.My friends and I went in around noon. There was about 8 of us. We had reservations. Other than the price, the only other downfall is that we waited 50 minutes for our food to be ready.The music outside was really loud when we went, but luckily, we were seated in a corner outside, so the music wasn't that loud where we sat.

Reviews.Author: Minh-An C.
Reviews.Content: I re-visited an old college spot where I went when I wanted to feel mature and fancy. It was my first time going to a rooftop bar in the daytime and it was very easy to go straight to the top floor, unlike during peak hours (weekends and nighttime). You enter a building and take an elevator to the 13th floor (the button has a picture of a bird on it). Then you get out and go through another elevator to the 15th floor, which is the first floor of perch. I was greeted immediately by a hostess and told her I was only here for drinks so she allowed us to go up to the second deck of Perch.I went around 5 PM on a Monday and people were slowly trickling in for after work drinks. The view was really pretty in the daytime. You can pretty far from one end but if you face towards the tall buildings, you don't see much because all the tall buildings are towering and blocking your view. Nighttime has a great view of Pershing Square and all the lights of DTLA's skyline.On the first floor, they have lots of the heaters so even on a cold winter night, it is still pretty warm while you sit and drink on the patio. I have never gone to Perch on a weekend so I have never experienced it being super crowded and the long lines. I have always gone on a week night where it is less crowded and more tamed.Drinks are pricey but you are paying for a great view of DTLA. Dress code isn't too strict. Girls can wear sandals and get in. My friend was worrying that she couldn't get in because she was wearing Rainbows but no one seemed to check. But do dress up nicely because people do dress up at Perch!

Reviews.Author: Cindy S.
Reviews.Content: I loved this place, a great location to go to for some drinks. The rooftop view definitely makes this place fantastic.  I was hungry when I went and tried out the lamb sliders which were delicious! Our waitress was friendly but maybe a little to comfortable which created the opposite effect and ended up making the vide weird and just uncomfortable.  The host was very friendly and in regards to the pretentious feel people have previously mentioned, I didn't feel that here.  Besides the waitress, I had a great time.

Reviews.Author: Christina L.
Reviews.Content: This place is great. The elevator rides, dining area,rooftop area and views of DTLA from a midrise building create a wonderful experience. We got an order of the skewers, steak and shrimp. They were fantastic, I wanted two more orders!!! Tuna Tartare was good... octopus was insanely tender... Bouillabaisse was okay, a third of our shellfish came out closed and the broth wasn't to my taste. Mushroom risotto was pretty good....We ordered a few rounds of whiskey and thought it was pricey .... Until we saw the glasses. It's like a double shot, so definitely worth it. Our server Paul was fantastic. Always making sure we were doing alright and very patient with us while we were contemplating food or drinks or taking smoking breaks on the rooftop!Great place for a date or girls/guys night out!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer G.
Reviews.Content: This review is only for the view: The view at the Standard is much better although this place is nice as it has 2 levels with views and live music on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: The view is fantastic, upstairs the bartenders were helpful. I was looking forwards to going there. But, my first drink had a weird undertaste but I finished it, my second drink did also even though I changed up the ingredients, I told this to the bartender and they gladly tried to fix it. I think we finally narrowed it down to the ice so I had my drinks neat for the night. even after knowing the ice was tainted though they did not change the ice?  While in the restroom a waiter or Bus person was doing what you do in restrooms i just happened to notice he left the room with out washing his hands. I thought that was state law in food service?And finally after a few minutes in the dark drinking my neat drink I noticed the glass was chipped.All in all not very impressive and a little dangerous

Reviews.Author: Renuka V.
Reviews.Content: Took 2 mates who had just landed in LA from Tokyo to Perch around 5pm for drinks on a Thur before going for dinner at Bestia. Suffice to say, they loved the views, decor and we had beer and vodka+aperol cocktail which were the not-cheap happy hour drinks.

Reviews.Author: Cindy T.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful! Made a perfect sunday brunch day!

Reviews.Author: Victoria S.
Reviews.Content: Rooftop bar ONLY review-Weekdays: mostly business men and women, no line.Weekends: mixed crowd, crowded with a line before going to the very top of the rooftop. Mid-days weekday/weekend: laid back and chill. you can exchange words without yelling at each other. no line. straight elevator shot.Drink prices are typical for metropolitan cities. Good selection of drinks on their menu, so stick to it or get something on the rocks. Beautiful rooftop views none the less.

Reviews.Author: Amyth G.
Reviews.Content: We drove to Perch from North Orange County to celebrate the birth of our new child two weeks ago (the baby obviously stayed home with a sitter).  We had 5:00 PM reservations at Perch, got stuck on the 5 freeway and ended up showing up at 5:30 p.m.Accommodation:  5/5.  Perch called me at 5:15 PM to verify we were still coming.  When we arrived, they had our table ready to go.  That was great considering we were 30 minutes late.  Having said that... reservations are HIGHLY recommended (unless you're just going to the bar on the 16th floor).Ambiance:  4/5.  It was a fun experience taking the elevator all the way up to the "perch" where we were seated outside and took in the LA skyline while dining.  After dinner we went to the bar/lounge on the top of the building and took in an even greater view.  We never felt rushed.  We went on a Saturday evening, but didn't feel we were dining with a snooty crowd.Service:  5/5.  From the moment we checked in we received outstanding service (our server was Jordan).  The staff ensured we never had empty glasses, but didn't feel intrusive.Food:  4/5.  The octopus was succulent.  I had the filet while my wife had scallops.  Her scallops were soft, buttery and flavorful.  My filet on the other hand had to be sawed a bit (I asked for medium-rare but it looked medium to me).  We got a Pot De Creme for dessert and my wife loved it (I thought it was good but nothing special).  Maybe it's me, but I didn't dig the sea salt on the chocolate custard (although she did).Value:  4/5.  We'll defintiely be back to try some of the other selections on the menu.  Perch was refreshing based on its location and menu items, but a little on the expensive side for what you're getting.  My overall bias is 4/5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Lovella A.
Reviews.Content: I've been here for brunch,  dinner, happy hour and came here to drink.  Out of all times,  I think brunch and happy hour were the best times to go.  Brunch (Saturday and Sundays) has your standard items like egg benedicts and omelettes, but what I actually enjoyed was the French toast and burger! The French toast tastes/looks like a pulled apart cinnamon roll drizzled in syrup with berries for garnish and a side of bacon strips.  The burger with the garlic aioli sauce and fried egg is so juicy and the perfect cure for your hangover. Haha their sangria is also really refreshing as well and the carafe is totally worth it if you're with a group.  Only setback is that they don't offer bottomless mimosas, otherwise this would be my go-to brunch spot. HahaI've been wanting to go here for dinner because of all the yummy pictures on Yelp but sadly it looks like they cut a lot off their menu.  I tried the truffle mac and cheese, short ribs and the chicken with mushroom risotto and it was pretty good, but nothing memorable.  I'm pretty sure you can find a similar yet more savory dish at restaurants that actually specializes in food. The white chocolate bread pudding, however, was perfect.  I'd come back for this again.It's not my favorite place for a night out although the view of DTLA (more like Pershing square and some other buildings) is nice. I feel like it's the type of lounge where people go just to be seen.  You'll see a lot of people standing around and/or enjoying their dinner if you get there early, which I find pretty awkward. Haha. Their live band is a nice touch though! Drinks are moderately priced LA-wise and thankfully they don't skimp out on their alcohol.  Their happy hour is reasonable: several dollars off their cocktails, wines, and beers with a few finger foods included in their menu.Overall, it's a nice venue with a good view.

Reviews.Author: Lenny B.
Reviews.Content: Great restaurant! We (group of 4) went on a Friday evening but didn't have reservations. None were available until Saturday,but were informed the day before if we got there by 7, we'd most likely get seated. We got seated,but had to wait 2 hours! We didn't have a problem because we were enjoying the awesome view and great drinks! I had a couple Weihenstephaners and French Maids (cognac). Both were great! We had the surf and turf skewers. It comes with four and were quite tasty. For dinner I had the steak frites with truffle fries! DAMN, I could eat those fries for dinner without the meat! Food was delicious! I would suggest to make reservations or do as we did and get there by 7 and enjoy the view and drinks! If you want to go upstairs, you might have to wait. When we left around 12, they asked if we were done. It's like, 3 people walk out, 3 people go in! Didn't realize, but there's another line outside to actually get into the building. So get there early or get reservations!We will definitely return WITH reservations!

Reviews.Author: Mariah R.
Reviews.Content: I went here for the first time last night and I will never be back.The service my party and I received was the worst I've ever had. It was my friend's birthday and we show up to the bar. The man seated at the first desk and I struck up a conversation - very friendly. Go up the elevator to be greeted by a bouncer named Lorenzo, who proceeded to give my group, but mainly the birthday girl, the dirtiest looks.He ignores us for a couple of minutes as he is opening elevators for leaving customers and checking IDs of new ones, but refuses to acknowledge us. He then proceeds to say the birthday girl is too drunk and cannot come inside. With that, denied the rest of us from coming inside at well. This was ironic because many drunk-er people were definitely being let in and out of that bar as we stood there for 5 minutes.As we are waiting for the elevator to come back up so we can politely leave this bar and this awfully rude bouncer, he said some very inappropriate things to my party as he set on his perch in the corner and my group was nowhere near him, just trying to catch an elevator.He then proceeds to call Mario, the security guard. I'm sorry, but I am 5'1" and completely sober, why does a security guard need to come get my group when we are literally standing by the elevator trying to go back down.By the grace of God, our elevator opens up and we get crammed into an elevator with very drunk people who are also outraged by our situation, and we finally start making our way out of the bar.But of course, one last negative encounter has to happen with the kind man sitting downstairs who refused to acknowledge us on the way out.Never have I felt so disrespected and I will definitely not be coming back. You lost 4 customers tonight.

Reviews.Author: Josephine L.
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's my ghetto side lashing out but no Hennessy? Really? *sigh*Never had the opportunity to come during the mornings but if you are looking for a more hyped up night life, this is not for you. I loved the concept of the rooftop bar but drink prices were also off the roof. $40 for a splash of blue label over a cup filled with mostly ice? No thanks.Would probably come back for brunch but this place just doesn't hit the spot for me when I want to go out and wild it out for the night. Especially not if I have to wait in line to get in.

Reviews.Author: Grace C.
Reviews.Content: Came here for drinks one Sunday afternoon and saw that they serve breakfast. Came back on another Sunday and tried the food. One of the bartenders recommended their crab Benedict and the French toast.  That is what we ordered and were amazing. Also tried oysters, would not recommend. Great mixed drinks here. I like all their drinks with St. Germaine in them.

Reviews.Author: Sara A.
Reviews.Content: You know, I was a little nervous about this place after hearing very mixed reviews. It seems like at a certain time it can get a bit pretentious and snooty, however for brunch on a Sunday, it was absolutely perfect. Lucky for us southern californians we rarely have to worry about weather, and so on this perfect 80 degree Sunday, I couldn't have been happier.Sitting outside was relaxing and gorgeous. Looking around at all of the architecture is just amazing! The food was fine, nothing to rave about, but also nothing to complain about. The drinks were great, and again the view?! Did I mention the view? Okay, so sure it's not the best drink or best meal in town, especially downtown, but that view just doesn't get much better. So kick back with good company and relax, take in the downtown beauty.

Reviews.Author: Irvin R.
Reviews.Content: This is probably more a 1.5 star review than a 1 star, but since my date got the stomach flu because of this place, I'll skew it down. I'll just get down into it:The Ambiance: The ambiance was actually nice. Pershing Square and DTLA isn't exactly the most beautiful view, so don't expect a beautiful view by any means. The band that played was really good too, as is their music selection.The Food: Hors d'oeuvres were pretty good. The main courses, however, were terrible. I had their burger and asked for it medium. The fact that they couldn't cook a simple burger patty the way I asked for was the first indicator that the main courses were not going to be delightful. The meat was bland, over cooked, and the buns were stale. Worse yet, my date got the Salmon Benedict and got food poisoning because of it. The Drinks: Drinks were not bad at all, and as everyone else has stated, they are well made. Would I go again? Probably not. If I do go, it definitely won't be to eat.

Reviews.Author: Bree W.
Reviews.Content: A Los Angeles staple that everyone should visit at least once, Consistency is why I kept going back here. The food is always great, the cocktails are yummie, the crowd is diverse, the music is good and the view is amazing. What else can a girls ask for? The only thing that at times might be tricky is the reservations part. During my last visit I brought 10 friends (Yes 10:) with me, so we were a large group. We were running late, and I called twice to let them know we were on our way. Both times I was told we were fine as we were the last group for the large table. Upon arrival they had given away our table.. Disappointing as we were all starving.. I would have appreciated to get this info over the phone when I called, so my expectations were managed better. We had to wait for about 45 min and were then seated. So dinner turned into a really late dinner... So don't be late! Still have mixed feelings about how this went down, but it won't stop me from going back.Keep up the great work guys, you have a beautiful establishment!

Reviews.Author: Kellan M.
Reviews.Content: Had such a great time here!   Kayla was absolutely a pleasure to have as our server.  She was kind, personable and funny.  The drinks were delicious, with cocktails ranging from $11-14 for their speciality drinks.  We also had the skewers and the charcuterie plate - both were tasty but not big portions.  We will definitely return for the drinks and the view, hopefully with Kayla as our server!

Reviews.Author: Shanna N.
Reviews.Content: I am in LOVE with this place. We saw it walking around downtown and I just had to stop by for a rooftop terrace drink. It was pretty packed with a mixed crowd. All the windows/doors open to the beautiful sunset and warm breeze. First we sat at the bar on the 13th(?) floor, had a drink and ordered mussels. Then walked around the exterior, enjoyed the view and live music, then returned to enjoy of appetizer. Unfortunately, the mussels weren't great... they were super small and not flavorful - although the saffron garlic broth was yummy with the garlic crostini's, it was barely good enough to finish - fortunately we just wanted a little bite before our late dinner resos at another place. After we closed at the bar, we went to the 15th (?) floor - the higher rooftop patio - which was crowded but it was perfect timing to watch the sunset and take a couple pictures. I give this place such high ratings because it is beautiful, the energy and atmosphere is so so special, and regardless of how unappealing the mussels were, everyone in the restaurant who was dining looked happy and their dishes looked delicious! So I can't wait to come back for a full meal. This would be a perfect place for a group dinner. The entire place is just super kitsch, cute, romantic, and fun!

Reviews.Author: Jpse R.
Reviews.Content: Perch is aaesome. Dont listen to these pretentious snobs telling you the views arnt great or the food isnt great. Go. Have a great time. The waiting staff was FASHIONABLE. Get over it you hipster witch hunters. They were also ATTENTIVE, FRIENDLY, and reslly made me feel taken care of both times ive been here. The food was great. Had the octopus with crem freash, the eabit ravioli, the filet mignon, and the brazed rib.ITS PRICEY. But well worth it in my opinion. The live band was great. The drunks were well made and STRONG in a good way. Over all i love this place. Iff i camw here every night it would probably get old. But that could be said about anythere. Cannot wait to go back. It always exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Author: Carmen T.
Reviews.Content: It had a really nice view, and the dessert was great--especially the pudding bread. The main course was alright.

Reviews.Author: Alejandra C.
Reviews.Content: The perch has a lovely atmosphere with a great crowd at any time of the day. Whether you're here for brunch, drinks or dinner it's always a good time.If you're thinking of dinner or brunch you have to make reservations, otherwise the bar is always open but it could get a tad crowded. The ambiance it's perfect and classy!

Reviews.Author: George C.
Reviews.Content: Talk about a cool spot. We arrived by uber car and walked into this old building not knowing what to expect. The hotel front desk told us to take the elevator to the 13th floor. We arrived. We were greeted by a man in a suit with tattoos who approached us to inform is to take a different elevator to the 15th floor. When we arrived, we were not disappointed. The atmosphere of this establishment was vintage, modern and full of style!! Full bar located inside the restaurant with out door seating all around. There was even one floor above us with a rooftop bar with even better views! The drinks were to die for and then good was killer. Truffle fries were spectaculars and the Moscow mule was exquisite. Over all, is is a great place to come and enjoy the views of downtown LA and relax on some comfy couches and enjoy the company of good friends and loved ones. As we were leaving, there was a jazz band setting up on the patio!! Does it get any better??? Great place. Check it out! You won't be let down.

Reviews.Author: Jason P.
Reviews.Content: I proposed to my now fiancé at Perch in October. They were extremely accommodating to us and put us at a great table on the deck. Our waitress Kayla was amazing! Service was great and she was genuinely happy for us!6 months later, my family was in town and Perch was the first place I thought of to take them. It was also my moms birthday. As luck would have it, Kayla was our waitress again! My whole family loved the place and Kayla once again was an amazing waitress! I cannot recommend this place enough! The food is great, service is great and the views are great. We'll definitely be coming back again and again!

Reviews.Author: Hee K.
Reviews.Content: Slow serviceOrdered drinks at the table. Was taking literally forever. Waited about 20min and went to the bar. Got a drink and went back to the table. Drinks still werent out at our table yet!!!!They werent even busy this night!

Reviews.Author: Catherine H.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the perch, I've been several times with friends and on dates. It's always such a pleasant time. I've never had a problem with long lines but then again I never go during peak hours. Usually I go on Sunday nights. I purposely try to avoid coming here fri/sat nights. Last night I came on a date and it was again such a pleasant time. We ordered :Brussels sprouts - yummy! Specially with the bacon! Wild mushrooms - delicious! Pan roasted chicken was a bit too salty for my taste but the meat was super tender. Scallops were yummy but again a bit salty for me. The white coconut tea is super yummy! Service was great, checked in with us with out being annoying. The only thing I don't like is how close the tables are, I always feel like I'm eavesdropping on other people's conversation unintentionally. But it's LA, almost all restaurants are like this.  I highly recommend coming here with friends or on dates or taking out of towners here to enjoy live music and spectacular views!

Reviews.Author: William M.
Reviews.Content: This place was great and usually I don't like bouncers but Lorenzo was very nice and respectful when I go to places with my girl I don't like the look bouncers give so I'm impressed with this guy

Reviews.Author: jeenee y.
Reviews.Content: Great place to just plainly hang out and listen to live band(s)Roof top can get a bit chilly, but its ok! they have heat lamps all around!Pros:Foods all great! cocktails..made strong at first...then the 2nd and on gets juicy :/Great Service, very friendlyMAKE RESERVATIONS!Smokers... go to the upstairs of the roof top!Cons:If your lucky you'll find parking on the street... but after 7pm. Otherwise, park across the lot or next to it Pay the parking... NO VALIDATIONCan def get crowded in and outdoorBut will I come back??..... yea why not!?

Reviews.Author: Melissa L.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful. the view is amazing once you get up on the rooftop. The bouncers were super nice and no line so we breezed through everything. We have nothing like this in Hawaii so it was a real shocker for me at least.. I wish they had more bartenders or wait service. We didn't stay long but it was nice to see.

Reviews.Author: Amy W.
Reviews.Content: My review is for the rooftop bar, not the restaurant. Pros:-no cover charge, unlike the Standard ($20 cover on weekends)-LA at night is pretty-outdoor lounge seating-urban chic ambience-live music -good for large groups-next to Pershing Square Park & major transit stops (ie: Metro station, Silver Line stop for 626 folks) -free street parking on Broadway after 6pm Tips:-drinks are pricy ($12-$15 each for cocktails) but well-made (pre-game beforehand) -prepare to wait in line to get in. I've heard the line gets long at 9pm. We arrived at 11pm on a Friday and didn't have to wait longer than 10 min to get in, luckily.Overall, a chic & casual rooftop bar.

Reviews.Author: Carolina S.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Perch a couple of times and each time I step onto that roof, I am always mesmerized by the city views. It is best (in my opinion) to go at night. The drinks are pretty pricey, but stiff. I haven't had the opportunity to dine at their restaurant, but I really want to try their food one of these days.The people that frequent this lounge are, for the most part, business people and  caucasian. The bartenders aren't too friendly, but they are usually busy with other patrons. Our waitress that night was very nice and she was readily available to drink orders with a smile. I should have gotten her name!My friend and I (we were about ten ladies) found two couches to sit on and thankfully, we were not asked to move. Unfortunately, you have to make a reservation to sit at one of their tables.They had a live band outside playing jazz.The views make for beautiful photos! There is no cover to get in, but you must dress up a little!

Reviews.Author: Thu-Ha T.
Reviews.Content: Great company + delicious food + awesome view + great service = A night to remember!We had 8:30pm reservations for a party of 10 for our friend's suprise bachelorette dinner outside on the 15th floor towards the back. The food was amazing and hosts and waiters were friendly and efficient. It was a bit chilly outside but there were heat lamps.The view of the city and Pershing Square was beautiful. Live music was great! There's also rooftop bars, lounge chairs, tables and fire pits.We had a prix fixe menu that consisted of a Hors-D'Oeuvre, Plat Principal and Gourmandise and suprisingly, the portions were generous:)I recommend:1. Baked Brie (fennel, pecan, wholegrain mustard aioli) - oh my!2. Caesar Salad (grilled  hearts of romaine, artichoke hearts, parmesan) - so good!3. Herb Crusted Salmon (shrimp, wild mushrooms, english peas, roasted red pepper coulis) - deliciously amazing; the salmon was cooked perfectly, no dry at all and the skin was well seasoned and nice and crispy; the veggies and coulis brought everything together...def my fav4. Steak Frites (flat iron, maitre d butter, bordelaise sauce, truffle fries) - truffle...need I say more? :P5. Orange Cardamom Creme Brulee (and shortbread cookies) - good for cardamom lovers*Dressy attire *Valet parking $9 in the front of the building and take elevators up to the restaurant/roof top*Definitely make reservations for a tablePlace gets crazy packed indoors and the line for the elevator in the restaurant that takes you to the rooftop gets long. Staff are there to help guide you with the elevators as you can get lost lol!

Reviews.Author: Judy Z.
Reviews.Content: I love coming to perch, but rarely ever on the weekends. Why? because it's FREAKEN CROWDED! I don't want to spend 20 minutes waiting in line downstairs, then wait another 20 minutes in line upstairs to get to the rooftop. Because that is what will happen if you come on friday or saturday! I usually come on Thursdays or Sundays, it's a lot less waiting and you can actually grab a seat on the rooftop bar, relax and enjoy the view! I've been to Ace Hotel's rooftop and I think the view at Perch is 10x better because it's located at the heart of downtown! My favorite drink here is the spicy concombre (= cucumber in French), if you love spicy food, why not a spicy drink? It's delicious, order it! Also, the Lolita is really good if you want something fruity and sweet! On certain days there is also live band! Parking of course is a pain, but it's free parking in loading zones after 6 PM, and there are usually tons on Broadway! Otherwise there's two paying lots close by you can park it. The lot across the street on the left of perch, next to the metro station, is one dollar cheaper than the one on the right side of perch and sometimes if there are no workers there working, you can get away without paying!

Reviews.Author: Seth G.
Reviews.Content: This review is for the rooftop bar only, not the restaurant (which looked very beautiful).I've been told "you have to check out Perch" for awhile now. I finally got my chance this past weekend , and it was very nice. Delicious (yet expensive cocktails), a good selection of craft beers, and incredible views of Downtown Los Angeles (too bad one of the views is of the still embarrassing Pershing Square park).A cool place to grab drinks with a view, especially on a date.

Reviews.Author: Tomaso F.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite spots in DTLA. Most every night, they have live music on the deck outside the restaurant level with a view of the skyscrapers. Perfect ambience! You're sure to take pics of that view and post 'em on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.... just to show your friends whatever they're doing at that very moment isn't as good as what you're doing; you know how our subconscious evil innards will go off on tangents like that..Haven't had full on sit down meals here yet but the appetizers and drinks with the ambience are worth the visit. Did split another pasta dish on one Happy Hour visit that was worth ordering again as well.FYI, When you enter the building, you're greeted by personnel who guide you to the elevator, then when you arrive at an upper floor, are greeted again by another person who guides you to the next elevator so you can find your way.Can't recommend parking since we've never driven here...our condo is in walking distance and walk when we go here. I do know the Red Line train stops at Pershing Square that is half a block away so if you're drinking, take that train. (FREE ADVICE from this former firefighter/paramedic who has seen many nasty wrecks over his lifetime). Perch is a great spot. I say check it out.

Reviews.Author: Eyal G.
Reviews.Content: It was my first time there. The pluses: 1) The staff was friendly and professional. They were able to provide us a table outside upon request. The server was also attentive and professional; 2) The food was very good. We had the beet salad, filet mignon, and a flat iron steak. We were impressed; 3) The view and the ambience are very nice, assuming you sit in the right area which leads me to the minuses:1) The outside table they gave us was located around the building in an area that I would consider an afterthought. It was in a small, narrow strip facing south and away from all the action. Almost like we didn't belong with the rest of the patrons. And as small and tight as the seating area was, they kept trying to shuffle tables around us to accommodate five people that really should not have sat so closely next to us, but they did anyway. It was disruptive but they did apologize to us; 2) The music - I don't often use this word but in this case it applies. It was cheesy. A small live band playing Linda Ronstadt type of music. I would expect to see something like this at the Dresden Room (which is more of a mockery) but not on a rooftop in downtown LA. It did not help that the speaker above our heads was blown, which I informed the server of. They would be much better off with the DJ that later spun; 3) this is a minor point but our plates kept spinning on the glass table top as we were trying to cut our steaks. I think a tablecloth would've helped.So my three stars rating is really a combination of five stars for service and food and one star for location and the music. I would go back again to be seated at a better table on a night during which the live band was not playing.

Reviews.Author: Alyxandra S.
Reviews.Content: Can I say I was underwhelmed? Maybe I had been hyping this place up for too long in my head but I'm sure there are other places in LA that have just as great of a view without the cost or trouble of fighting a crowd. Pros:- Great service. Everyone was very nice and helpful. Make a reservation at least three days ahead of time!- Pretty decor.  1920s French. Think Midnight in Paris (also a drink  there :))- Separate tiny bar outside to accommodate more people -View. Overlooks Pershing Square and is gorgeous at night. Cons:-View comes with a cost. There is a separate elevator or stairs (didn't waste my time waiting) WITHIN Perch that takes you to an even higher floor. But you have to wait in a massive line, whether you have reservations or not. - Food was ok. I've had better for cheaper. - Poor selection of beer. I know it's known for it's frou frou drinks but sometimes people just want decent beer. - typical, douchey LA crowd -pretty tiny and easily overcrowded I know, I know this place is all about the view and maybe if I didn't have to wait in a whole other line to get the best view I would've been a lot happier. Alas I only got the second best view. And that's not good enough! Lol

Reviews.Author: Janeane B.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place!It is a great rooftop restaurant and bar. I love the Standard, but this is MUCH better. A much more mature crowd and the food is DELICIOUS!!Definitely get the Steak Frites!Went here for my birthday and couldn't have been happier. Great food, fantastic view, wonderful atmosphere. One of my favorite places in LA.

Reviews.Author: Tien L.
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my birthday here two years in a row. The food was so-so for what it costs, so I probably won't come back for a big meal. However, I may come back for their happy hour on the rooftop. The view is beautiful from the top deck, and there are several comfortable seating areas.Last night, they had live music on the 13th floor (the floor on which the restaurant resides), but there were speakers on the 15th floor (rooftop) that allowed you to hear the live music. Raquel Rodriguez was singing live last night, and I fell in love with her music. I ordered a glass of the marius blanc wine, and the bartender was very stingy with the pour. the amount of wine in my glass was similar to the amount of wine that is poured into your glass during a wine tasting. However, it wasn't a wine tasting, so I didn't get 4 more pours. My boyfriend ordered the writer's block cocktail for $12, and it was mediocre. The portions are very small too. The rooftop bar is so crowded after work that the bartenders seem agitated by the sheer number of people trying to order drinks.I was surprised by the lack of racial diversity at Perch last night given that it's located in a diverse area. I felt like I was reliving my Texan childhood.

Reviews.Author: Quinlan F.
Reviews.Content: I like rooftop lounges.I like bars and good food too.Perch has all three, but there are some things I dont like.I don't like the layout.  Its too hard to move about.  I think the business is doing too much at once.  I also feel the service is not up to par.  The views are great, but until they figure out how to make more room  and better service its whatever with it.

Reviews.Author: Ben R.
Reviews.Content: Do not order oysters!! I only been here once. But I could be there on their bad night. It seems like almost everything that I had ordered were way too salty. I literally felt that someone pour over a whole bottle of salt over my oyster!! They were terrible! The main dish were alright. They were salty, but not nearly as bad as the oysters! The only thing that I would consider decent is their Salmon and Cods.

Reviews.Author: Rick K.
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time finding this place after I parked. When I did find it, they had many lines. You have to get into line to pass through the bouncer and take the first elevator up. Once you get to the bar, you have to get into line again and pass though another bouncer to get to the rooftop. Once you're there, you get in line again to get your drink. I suppose if you like standing in line, this is a pretty awesome place. It doesn't seem like they have bottle service or anything like that, but I could be wrong. I'll only comment on the rooftop and the ambiance. I thought the view of the city from the Perch is very very nice. The environment is friendly, and I think you can even meet people if you wanted to. I wouldn't say this place is super upscale or exclusive, but it does have class to it. I enjoyed my friend's 30th birthday party here, and I'd be glad come back again if I have to. 4 solid stars.

Reviews.Author: Melisa G.
Reviews.Content: This place is the perfect definition of 2 stars to me. Some good things, some bad things, so it balances out and leaves me with a "meh" feeling, take it or leave it.The patio is clearly the big drawing point. And the decor and music were both amazing. And I think their spirits selection is actually quite good. I've never understood why people complain when their favorite brand of whatever  isn't carried, there are so many great spirits out there that you've never tried.However, considering the great spirits selection I didn't think the cocktails themselves were very good. And while the price point doesn't bother me, it does if the drinks don't match the pricing, which they definitely didn't. I wasn't impressed with the food the last time I was here so I didn't try it again. Perhaps if the service was a little warmer I might have been inclined but I always get the feeling that they're doing me a favor by taking my order. We sat at the bar, about half full at the time, for a solid 5 minutes before even being acknowledged by the bartender who had glanced out way when we sat down. Not cool or hospitable.So my advice, go to the outside bar since it's tiny they have nowhere to hide, grab a beer or glass of wine and enjoy the view.

Reviews.Author: Lyn C.
Reviews.Content: Night time is better than day time.Day time: Sunday brunch-  ambiance is nice and the food is hit or miss.  For example:  baked brie...HIT!  Delicious and amazing.  Salmon benedict: MISS!  because crab cake benedict came out and I already took a bite out without realizing it wasn't what I ordered and got too hungry to wait for the waitress.  The crab cakes were okay but my favorite crab cakes are back in SJ and these aren't the same.  Service was just okay.  I thought for a nice place like this, a) my order would be correct and b) our food would have come out faster and we would have been checked on more frequently.  Night time:  I like this rooftop better than the Standard.  The view is similar but I like the vibe and staff better.  Come out to play at night.  You'll have a better time.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia C.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Wednesday night. It was a little crowded for my taste, my friends and I couldn't find anywhere to sit! Thankfully the two redheads behind the bar were super fast and friendly (I forgot there names) they  said there was another floor we could eat at but we had already had dinner. Considering how nice the girls were and the amazing view I might have to come back another time with my husband for dinner.  Minus one star for how crowed it was, and the music was putting me asleep.

Reviews.Author: Emma T.
Reviews.Content: WOW, what a wonderful,  wonderful Brunch, a pure Culinary Delight (no PUN intended), LolThe FOOD, OMG we all had the French Toast and Berries,  OOTW, my hubby had a side of Eggs and Potatoes and even a Bilinni. I had the French Toast and a Bloody Mary,  the BEST Bloody Mary in LA. The French Toast is to Die For and the Berries were Soooo Fresh and really good.All of you that know me know how I feel about Customer Service,  that is a must for me.  I would rather have bad food than Bad Service, however this place desires an Oscar for their Customer Service and the Oscar goes to JORDAN our server whom you will see pictured below.Never once did we need to call Jordan to our table, he was Point On during the entire morning,  not one complaint about the Food and certainly not the service.As I always say Treat Yo Self.This is definitely a wonderful place to take a date, family or friends even clients. We will add this to our list of Fav's and will certainly become a regular.We will Treat ourselves not only to Sunday Brunch but Dinner as well.Before I forget the Drinks are BANGIN and I am okay with the price,  because everything else is so Cool.GREAT PARKING, how Dope is that, great parking in LA :-DEnough of my thoughts,  Go Treat Yo Self! :-)

Reviews.Author: Julia Y.
Reviews.Content: PROS:ambiance crowdseparate dining area with live band 16th floor has a beautiful view of DTLAdrinks are strongdon't need to be on a 'guestlist' to go to the bar/lounge CONS:crowded waiting in line to go upstairs to the 16th floor rooftop

Reviews.Author: Angela K.
Reviews.Content: Perch is one of my favorite DTLA spots. I love the rooftop dining and the live band is always great. It can be a little difficult to get into on a weekend if you don't have a reservation, but the hostess is always pretty good at getting you a table. Their happy hour is also really good. It's probably a little pricier than other happy hours, but the food is good. The ambiance is unbeatable. There's an outdoor parking lot right on the corner of 4th and hill for about $6. Melissa was my server this past Thursday night and she was awesome.

Reviews.Author: Bridget K.
Reviews.Content: Very much a hipster hang out: very loud and busy. Struck me as a bit over rated. Food was fine and the views of downtown are great, but the overall scene is just too loud and in your face (...and we were there on a Saturday morning for brunch!). Waiters with blue hair and piercings, etc. Not for us but I'm sure very much the thing for some others.

Reviews.Author: Erica C.
Reviews.Content: The rooftop bar is awesome with a great view of DTLA at night. There was a bit of a wait to get up there but we ordered drinks & waited for our turn in line.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla C.
Reviews.Content: The outdoor patio area was very cute especially on a warm night with all the city lights around you.  Service from the elevators, host, busboys, and I believe the manager were nice & friendly.  However the waitress we had was kind of abrupt and abrasive that I felt almost intimidated by her.  She was not warm, welcoming/inviting, or friendly at all.  Pinky and I had come from dinner in Anaheim so we were full, but could fit in a nibble and a couple drinks.  I had wanted to try their cheese & charcuterie plate thinking it would be extra yummy bc it's a French spot, so we went with the Fromage + Charcuterie starter to begin with.  As for drinks, we wanted to try some of their signature cocktails and asked for some recommendations from a different waitress and decided on Spicy Concumbre & Lolita.  Although this other waitress wasn't much help as all she did was read us the list of ingredients straight from the menu -_- Bc we weren't hungry I asked our intimidating waitress if we could get the dessert menu while we look at the regular menu for things to nibble on.  (She didn't seem too happy that we weren't ordering any main entrees.)The cocktails were not our cup of tea, we found them to be too strong.  Too strong?!  If I'm saying a drink is too strong it has to really be too strong bc I like my drinks on stiffer side.  I could barely taste any of the St Germain which is the only reason why I ordered it in the first place.  Pinky and I just slowly sipped our drinks while regretting not ordering our usual wine.Fromage + Charcuterie plate, so underwhelming.  Nothing stood out to me.  The cheeses were both mediocre while the charcuterie meats were flavorless.  But for $16 for that lackluster plate, we ate it.Our waitress rarely came around to check up on us, nor did she bring us the dessert menu.  Although I don't want to eat a full on meal I never say no to dessert, but by then Pinky and I just wanted to finish our drinks and leave.  It took a while to get our bill and another long while for our change.  At one point I thought our waitress assumed all the change was her tip, but the manager eventually came out apologizing for the wait.Overall I might come back.  Maybe for wine with Pinky and girlfriends, but I wouldn't want our waitress from last night and I don't know if I'd want to eat here just because they couldn't even get a simple cheese & charcuterie plate right.

Reviews.Author: Nathan P.
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation through opentable.com for 10:30 PM and I arrived at 10:43 PM (they allow a 15 minute grace period). I was greeted by Tiffany and she was very busy at the moment, but told me that I will be seated within 10 minutes. I went to the bar and got a pale ale and my date got a red cabernet. We got escorted to our table by Dwight and gave us a bar menu, stating, "After 10:45 we cannot serve from the full menu."I said, "My reservation was for 10:30 and this is my first time here; I want to make this first experience memorable."He went and checked on our arrival and then he brought us a full menu accidentally knocking down my drink. I was not at all angry; he immediately brought me a new drink. He was very accommodating and courteous by moving us to a larger table with a grander view of the DTLA buildings. Dwight, thank you; you're the man! My date ordered a prime rib: medium-rare, this was melt-in-your-mouth tender and the portion was generous. I ordered the ravioli: The shell was al-dente, the inside packed a punch! The sauce was a godsend and I stole some fries from my date to dip it in that sauce. Alice was our server and she was really perky, enthusiastic, and attentive. Enjoying our drinks, food, and the view, Alice came out with a surprise, complimentary dessert; it was a pudding: with some fruit and sea salt lightly sprinkled on top. The salty-sweet combination was harmonic.Tiffany, the greeting hostess, came out to our table and asked, "So what are you guys doing after? I can provide you a list of all the 'hot' bars in the area." That was so kind of her but we did come for the bar here. She did give us some great recommendations and was compelled. As we were about to leave, Dwight stopped us on our tracks and said, 'You must check out the roof-top bar, follow me." He escorted us past the line and to the stairwell; to my amazement this bar was gorgeous. I had to drive home, so my girl got a cosmopolitan: the bartender put so many layers of alcohol/mixer; it was so sophisticated.This was my first time here and my experience was nothing short of perfect. The staff here really went above-and-beyond to fulfill my expectations about this place. I cannot wait to come back soon and explore more of their drink and food menu.

Reviews.Author: Ashley W.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing because of the ambiance. The food is pretty bland. If I were to return it would definitely be to drink and enjoy the view. -lovely date location (On the plus side they stay open until 2a on weekdays)

Reviews.Author: Lucky S.
Reviews.Content: Great first date place. If not perfect first date place. Lovely patio/lounge area. The view... so beautiful.  I actually found parking on the street rather easily, but there is also a big lot across the street. Think sign said $8? Worth it!Only draw back?  Crowd appears to be a mixed bag.  The crowd (on this night) was largely tacky twenty somethings. Maybe there is a club at the facility. Yet! I would totally go again. Just would be thoughtful about who I invited in case the crowd was random.

Reviews.Author: Char C.
Reviews.Content: LOVELY setting if that's your ish. Been here 2x and both were solid nice experiences1) Jazzy live music, comfortable couches. You can dress to the 9s or just plain Jane, but the atmosphere is def chic. We made reservations 1 week prior and were seated in the outdoor patio overloooking the Pershing Square Rink. We had the bunny frou frou, scallops, gnocchi, and poutine. Now its been a while but I remember liking the gnocchi and poutine. We also basically tried everything on the dessert menu and we were overall satisfied with dinner but even more, loved the experience and our knowledgeable server, but you're basically paying the good bucks for the view2) Came out for a boys night to check out the LA night lights. It was past midnight on a Saturday and there was still maybe a good 30 min wait total from outside the building to the two elevators to the final staircase leading to the lounge upstairsNot too cramped but no seats either. Crowd was pretty mature but the situation was lively. And then you've got the view, so who can complain... certainly the bouncer who was trying to get me off the ledge

Reviews.Author: Sarah K.
Reviews.Content: Fun place to take a friend visiting in town or to try to impress a date. Nice evening rooftop view. Casual seating with fire. Pricey drinks 10-12 but they are really good and really strong. Hot Cucombre - cucumber, jalapeno muddled with sugar and lots of gin. Big fan of this! 5 stars!!Ginger drink (I forgot what it's called) - this was good but I liked the hot cucombre drink better. It tasted exactly as described. I don't remember much about this drink because my first was so strong. I think that's a good thing.3 1/2 stars overall but rounded up to 4 for the nice service, delicious drinks and ambiance. Luckily we came on an off night. Hardly anyone there and we got our drinks and a seat right away. Docked down cuz I can see it being annoying if it's super busy. There's only one bartender upstairs, limited seating, really pricey, only 1 paper menu for all the customers and only 1 toilet for each gender.I would come back to try their food.

Reviews.Author: Dani H.
Reviews.Content: Fun to get drunk on a saggy couch for Sunday brunch. Good burger, sh*tty bloody mary.The host and hostesses look at themselves in any sort of reflective surface they can find a LOT. But they are cute and charming--hard to stay mad that they ignore and/or forget you've been waiting for a table for 2 hours.People watching is solid. Just go for brunch and get weird.

Reviews.Author: Mehnoosh A.
Reviews.Content: Perch LA is one of those places you go for the great view. The food was decent not like it was the best food I've ever had but it's what I expected. The view was amazing. It's definitely a great place to celebrate a birthday or special occasion. It's a bit pricey for 2 the bill was around 80 dollars and that's without any alcohol btw. But there's an upstairs that you can wait at that has a beautiful view as well and when I went there was live entertainment I believe in peak hours. The service was decent. It was my birthday so they gave me a complimentary dessert which was really good and definitely made it worth the money. I would go back only for a special occasion. But I definitely agree if your looking for a beautiful view of LA this is the stop.

Reviews.Author: Lina M.
Reviews.Content: Wasn't too impressed. Nice of the city. Didn't like being crammed in the elevator for several floor with other guest. Not ideal if your claustrophobic or a germ freaked. Nothing really grabbed my attention in the menu so I had the Baked Brie, it was okay. Seems more like a great place for happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Sara T.
Reviews.Content: This place gets 5 stars for the FOOD. The drinks get 5 stars too - although the bartenders are seriously all sour with attitude - I would give the bartenders 1 star - because that is all they deserve for their terrible "i don't have to be here" attitudes.  They are super condescending and grumpy and already mad at you before you even place your order.  The ambiance of the place is great, and the people that frequent the place are pretty snazzy.  It's a great place to have a sit-down chat while unwinding.  It is loud and busy, but somehow this creates the intimacy which I most enjoy about the place.  It hasn't really lost its sexiness since it started, but the crowd has gotten a little fuzzier.  Drinks are pricey but delicious, and the service is quick.  The view is great and this place is way cooler than the Standard and more bougie than Ace.  I like to go there and get a little tipsy and pretend i'm having the best time ever with a bunch of peers who respect me - this obviously isn't the case and I leave there after dropping 60 bucks and making no friends but enjoying the fact that I am growing old and lonely in the beautiful city of Los Angeles like all of those who came before me.

Reviews.Author: Amaya S.
Reviews.Content: I only drink to review,  I review because of you,  you make me drink.  Blame yourself! Last year as we were walking to brunch we saw what looked like a lush rooftop experience.  After some investigative work I found out it was Perch. So what do I do,  I bookmarked it like any sane Yelper would do. Fast forward to now and me and my friend staying at the Biltmore. Perfect time to see what Perch is all about. Once you are in the building you take the elevator up,  and you are greeted by a very charming man.  At least we were.  Perch had two levels: 1.) More geared to dining 2.) More geared to just drinking. On the top level there is plenty of seating,  sun and views.  The lower level is enclosed and shaded. The bartender was great and she recommended our first drink. Writer's Block ($13) - pear vodka,  St. Germain, lemon juice,  champagne.  Amazing. My absolute favorite.  The drink is a little,  uh..... tiny.  But it packed a punch. Next we tried......Midnight In Paris ($13) - cognac,  fair quinoa vodka,  creme de peche, lemon,  orange.  This was another good choice too, it furthered my ongoing buzz. Alex, I think that is his name...... was HOT!!!! I couldn't stop looking at him lol. The only thing that was horrible was on my way to the bathroom I saw someone propose and it made me realize just how single I am.  I left lol. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Author: Kristijana O.
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and service. The view is so worth going and the live band on Friday night was great. The good was good. The baked brie was ok but would not order it again. Salmon was excellent and so were the brussel sprouts... We will be back for drinks and the amazing view.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: I have been to this place a handful of times now and it has always been decent. However, this past weekend I went after going to the Ace Hotel the weekend previous and I really appreciated this place. The thing you have to realized about going out in LA is that you need to have a strategy and a plan to get in to popular places or else you will have a miserable time and write negative reviews on Yelp.I came for a bday party and I showed up by 9:30pm and there was a line starting. I got in with a couple of friends and immediately went to the top of Perch (there is another line). Luckily for our friends who were with the bday boy they had friends in line already when they arrived at 11pm. If they didn't have a friend in line they would probably have to wait an hour.To the important points of the night, the ladies were really hot and the crowd was very diverse, which I love. I did not talk to anyone outside our group so I cannot attest to the general friendliness of the ladies, but they were definitely attractive. I do wish they this place would have more bartenders that work a bit faster when it is busy, but no one ever takes my brilliant time saving and money making advice. At least the drinks are pretty good since they have the whole mixologist approach here.Final advice: Come early and pre drink. Go directly to the top and chit chat with the lovely ladies asap before all their friends arrive.

Reviews.Author: Nick A.
Reviews.Content: I was completely shocked. My Mother (who was visiting from Palm Springs) and I were recommended to eat here for Mothers Day. We were asked if we had a reservation but they could seat us inside. The outside patio has amazing views of Pershing Square and Downtown LA. Drinks and Truffle Cheese fries were ordered and served promptly. About an hour later we saw our waitress who had been attended nearby tables that were larger chatting with co workers then disappeared. I asked a buser to ask for the manager. At this point I was able to hail down our waitress who went to check on the food and said it would be right out. Keep in mind we have seen three tables get served who came in after us.My order of French toast came out at this point while my mom was not served. On Mother's Day!!! I touched the French toast and it was cold and lifeless. Her food came out after a few minutes and was burnt and disgusting! Our waitress arrived in which we asked for the check. She insisted to take the food via doggy bag. Then talked with her manager about the situation for what seemed like 5 minutes. He then approached us and compensated the meal and apologized. He then brought up that it was Mother's Day! Way to rub it in douche bag! We got up and left immediately walking by our waitress who didn't apologize!!!By far the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant and implored me to write my first ever Yelp review! There was also some crazy homeless men yelling and about to get in a fist fight outside of the entrance! Yikes! It ruined my Moms Mothers Day!

Reviews.Author: Andrea Z.
Reviews.Content: Never again. Came here before and had nothing but good things to say. But now, ugh I can't stand when I'm with a group of people that want to go here. BELIEVE me, I do everything to change their mind, and we go elsewhere!My husbands best friend planned to celebrate his engagement here, as in, he just proposed and we were to come her to celebrate. He made reservations for the group and was given great customer service all the way up to the day we all arrived.We arrived, and they wanted to split the group and seat us at 2 seperate places! Not even tables, couch set ups that were seperated! That is just insane, we came to celebrate together, not be divided so the newly engaged couple would have to walk back and forth.Needless to say, we were out of there after 5 minutes of being seated, and the staff just did not seem to care.I just can't support establishments like this.

Reviews.Author: Christina M.
Reviews.Content: Loved:-The viewLiked:-The food-The atmosphere-The outdoor seating areaDidn't like:-How cramped it felt-The upstairs bar ( they need A LOT of work on it for it to be what they're going for)If you're looking for a rooftop bar in DTLA, I would recommend The Standard. So much better than this place.

Reviews.Author: Jim L.
Reviews.Content: The restaurant is on a rooftop. Other then the fact that the weather was cold and we were seated outdoors, everything was fine. The crew was very accommodating, the chicken dish is highly recommended. We also ordered the Ceaser salad, it was pretty good I would come back here

Reviews.Author: Cerina M.
Reviews.Content: Was there yesterday again, and our waiter Peter was amazing . So I just had to write a review. He was so professional and  yet funny!! Had a even better time because of him :) Can't wait to go back there!!

Reviews.Author: Lisa W.
Reviews.Content: I often find myself underwhelmed with these uber trendy downtown bars and restaurants.  If I am to brave dreadful downtown traffic, one way streets, sketchy and expensive parking lots and risk getting mugged on the way to and from and my destination, I expect that the venue be exceptional.  I had my doubts about Perch, but this place did not disappoint!  Come during off hours if you really want to sit and enjoy the ambiance.You have to take two rickety elevators to get to Perch.  It is a hassle to get to, and I can only imagine how horrid it would be to come here on a Friday or Saturday night and have to endure multiple long lines.  But once you step foot into the restaurant, you will know it was all worth it.  The view is spectacular--the surrounding buildings all exude so much architectural character. And when you're up so high, away from the polluted streets and buzzing cars, you cannot help but be inspired by the gradeur and ostentation of downtown Los Angeles.  The ambiance is dreamy and sophisticated.  The terrace is romantic, the furniture is charming and the French music and lulling breeze make you feel like you're on vacation somewhere magical.They have happy hour on weekdays from 4-6 with reasonably priced food and drinks starting at $5.  I would recommend a Royal (a glass of bubbly with a shot of liquer-they have 6 different flavors!).  Food is tasty.  Service is good. People here seem a little pretentious, but what else would you expect? On weekdays it is not too crowded and you can probably be seated without a reservation.   If you'd like an outdoor table though, I would suggest to make a reservation just in case.

Reviews.Author: Anne A.
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time at Perch. Salmon was delicious. The cheese plate was plenty. The view was amazing. We got there just before sundown and the  view just got better with time.

Reviews.Author: Rose G.
Reviews.Content: Like other yelpers 13 floor to the 16 floor except this one time 16 floor was close! GREAT! The only reason why I came here was because of their amazing view. I was celebrating my bfs bday nd hoping to show him the city since he hates coming out to LA. I was hoping to change his mind. Anyways Our waiter (can't remember his name :/ ) he was great nd very attentive.  BTW keep ur eyes open nvr know when ull see a celebrity or someone famous. Apparently " according to my bf" a basketball player was there but I had no clue o.O? Lol

Reviews.Author: Gerald C.
Reviews.Content: My birthday festivities ended here a few nights ago. Glad I was finally able to check it out, as I've been meaning to for a while. For a Wednesday I thought the crowd was decent: not too crowded but not empty. For a group of 10 of us we were surprisingly able to get some seats on the 16th floor and just relax and drink. I had a whiskey sour, and unfortunately it was much more on the sour side. What does it for me though are the views. I'm a sucker for rooftop patios and bars, and I also love DTLA so you get both of them here. I like the decor and atmosphere here more so than compared to The Standard's trendy/club vibe.I'd like to do some day-time drinking or brunch here sometime soon. From there  I can truly decide whether this is three stars (or more or less) in my book. Since it was my birthday I also didn't have to pay for anything, so I'll be more cognizant of what the food and drinks are like because I've been told it's pricey. Nothing beats hanging out with your friends with the DTLA skyline as your backdrop!

Reviews.Author: Anne B.
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Perch is the heart of Downtown LA & it is quite the hot spot. REASON FOR GOING: Both my friends & coworkers recommended this place to me and I wanted to see what was all the rage and so planned my birthday dinner here for a group of 10. Friends came out to dine and drink in LA from Orange County & San Diego for my birthday at this specific location. EXPECTATIONS vs REALITY: Perch really lives up to its reputation. The staff were all very friendly and helpful from the get go. They were so welcoming and completely unpretentious, which is different from the LA stereotypes held by people outside of LA. FOOD: We ordered the mussels, seared salmon over veggies, filet mignon with potatoes and asparagus, several drinks such as the penicillin, variety of beer, some wines, and other drinks such as a gin and tonic, and mojitos. We had quite the group of people so everyone pretty much ordered everything on both the food and drink menu. It was fantastic. Everything was delightful. The food is mostly French cuisine, but it wasn't heavily garlic and butter based like most French places. It was decent delicious food for the venue for what it was and the drinks were strong and delightful.AMBIANCE: I came on a Saturday night - It was packed and vibrant; and the energy was palpable. It was crowded at the bar and the live band played beautiful classics in the jazzy jazz style. We sat at an intimate table for 10. I absolutely love the classic decor and high ceilings on the 15th floor. Dinner & drinks were served & fabulous. We then moved up to the 16th floor for more drinks and to bask in the view... Let me tell you, the view is unmatched. Highly recommended venue and the ambiance both inside and outside was just stunning.CLOSING THOUGHTS: It really is the most romantic spot and although it may not be the best for a large party of friends to dine, it is great for a close group of friends. I was lucky to have a table for 10 people who all greatly enjoyed the night at Perch. I also heard the brunch here fantastic. Be sure to make reservations via Open Table. I strongly recommend doing that; you can bypass the line that way in the evenings. I don't know about brunch, but I'll be back again soon to try the brunch menu and, of course, enjoy the view from this fantastically elevated resting place.

Reviews.Author: Mitch C.
Reviews.Content: Great balance of food, ambiance, chill and hip!!

Reviews.Author: Krista T.
Reviews.Content: Been here twice and both times surprisingly really enjoyed the food, but I think I got lucky with what I ordered, and by lucky I mean did my Yelp research a bit before hand.MUST ORDER the brussel sprouts. I had them both times and have been dreaming about them since. They have bacon in them, and I usually don't like bacon because I think it overwhelms food, but it worked perfectly. They are sweet, savory, crispy, and all around vegetable perfection. Steak Frites - steak was delicious but I surprisingly didn't really love the truffle fries like other reviewers. Didn't really get that truffle flavor for some reason and they were too salty. However the steak was so good I'd probably order this dish again if I return. Pesto Gnocci - Yum! Rich but not too rich. The pesto is not overwhelming, which I was worried about. Would order again.Surf and Turf skewers appetizer -  the sauce on them was delicious! Also the wine servings are very very generous :) I enjoyed my glass of sauvignon blanc but not the pinot noir

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is always very busy... But that's what's so great! There is a band playing every single night and it's a fun, trendy environment. The food is delicious. The views of the city are breathtaking and the prices are very reasonable.I come here all the time. It is one of my favorite restaurants in downtown. :)

Reviews.Author: Francoise G.
Reviews.Content: A surprisingly classy and clean place in the middle of a not so nice downtown LA. Try to RSVP if you don't want to end up at the bar. The staff is nice in general. The bartender was really good. One thing: I had a delicious dessert: the chocolate pudding. The presentation was awkward though. I mean the first thing that comes to mid was it looks like dog poo! I'm not sure the chef wants us to have a thought like that as soon as the dish comes out. So something to think about for that particular dish. (See my pictures)

Reviews.Author: Yuna S.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Wednesday night for my birthday. Ambience was nice and the view is great. Be sure to ask Jesse for drinks!

Reviews.Author: Kazushi I.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a bit pricey for the food you're getting, but hey, you're paying for the experience right? (The experience only ends at Perch if you screw up) But really, even getting to the restaurant is cool. It is a bit of a hassle and kind of a pain to find if you have never been there, but going up two different elevators made me feel like I was a secret agent or something.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie A.
Reviews.Content: Love the rooftop seating area at Perch.  I went there on a Saturday night - it was crowded, but such a great place to have a drink with friends, relax, and enjoy the live music/surrounding buildings/and comfortable atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Todd N.
Reviews.Content: This is Downtown LA and why not have a rooftop bar/lounge/restaurant? We got amazing weather, great views, and of course yummy food.I've always heard of this place through my friends and have just been dying to go.  I finally made a trip out here for Sunday brunch and was very excited.  My friend and I went at around 11AM.  This place does get busy!  We were lucky that there were only us 2 and the wait for a table wasn't that long.  The party behind us had about an hour wait.  The crowd is definitely late 20s, early 30s with some families there too.They have a great menu option of different breakfast items.  I wanted the salmon poached egg dish, but unfortunately they ran out.  I was quite disappointed; I opted for the other poached egg dish with ham instead.  It was still really great and the eggs were cooked perfectly.  We also ordered a bottle of champagne with a glass of orange juice.  The waitress was so kind to help us out and told us that the bottle is a better value for the money as it was $25 total for the bottle and orange juice while buying it per glass is $8.  Definitely would recommend this place to all my friends and families for something that really captures that LA culture.

Reviews.Author: Honorary S.
Reviews.Content: Love the view from the rooftop, it's to die for! Their cucumber martini is my favorite. Their Perch burger is delicious .. Overall great place!

Reviews.Author: Letty A.
