Reviews.Content: I'm going to express myself (express yo'self!) at the risk of never again sipping on a tasty penicillin or delicious truffle fries. I work in Bunker Hill and have been frequenting Perch for quick drinks for over a year now. Last Wednesday a colleauge and I showed up for a drink and truffle fries. Let me set the scene for you: Sunny Wednesday afternoon. 5pm. Busy bar area, not busy lounge area, mostly empty outside patio. We exit the elevator and are greeted by 2 hostesses who ask us if we have reservations. I say "No, we'd just like a quick drink and fries." From my experience, it seems that as soon as someone says "No, I don't have reservations" a gear clicks in their head and they turn on the attitude. I ask if we can sit  in the currently empty patio and they say no. I ask if we can have fries upstairs they say no, no food upstairs. We're told we can sit at the bar. We walk over, it's busy. Let me just say this is routine, a little dance we dance every time I visit Perch. I've obliged in the past- and the bar was just fine. What would you do when there's still an hour until 6pm dinner reservations start and the bar is packed? Yeah, we walk outside and sit at the tiniest possible table. It's worked before. We sit down and are approached by what I'm guessing is one of the managers. In snarky fashion she tells us these tables are reserved for dinner parties after 6. I say it's 5pm. We're ready to order now and will be done before they need the table. She thinks about it and says "let me see what I can do" meanwhile... the clock keeps ticking. She comes back with a waitress and says we'll take care of you but we need the table by 6:15. AGREED (wasn't that what I proposed initially?) So we get our drinks and fries and ask our waitress to bring the bill so that we're ready to leave. She says not to worry, no rush. THANK YOU finally someone's friendly. The clock keeps ticking. People have trickled in but the patio is still mostly empty. We pay the bill. It's 6pm. It's a sad thing to sit there, watching the sunset, high atop DTLA and realize you can count the number of times you've had good service after more than a year's worth of visits on one hand. It's really that sad. Please lose the snooty, pretentious attitude and let us just enjoy an hour before your dinner rush or let me take my fries and drink upstairs. It's simple really. I want to give you business but I expect you to be NICE. Why make things so complicated?

Reviews.Author: Vivian M.
Reviews.Content: I honestly have a love/hate relationship with Perch!It's not about the food, it's about the experience!! If you're here to celebrate, it's def a fun place ! Brunch, Friday/Saturday nights are very fun! Or if you're taking someone on a date. And it's all because of the breathtaking view.However, if you're looking for a good bite, Perch is NOT the place! The service sucks. They're not exactly rude they just .. don't care. LOL. they'll take a while to bring the check and stuff. ehhh like I said I'll only come here for a good night out! Don't think I'll be back with the intentions of having a great meal

Reviews.Author: Chanel B.
Reviews.Content: The view of DT LA is wonderful, especially at night time however, the food is not up to par with the price. I'm not one that minds paying for good food, this place is very cute but the food isn't .

Reviews.Author: Lacie M.
Reviews.Content: let me tell you this is an amazing place, not only is it romantic, but the view provides such a stress reliever, the food is amazing ! I wouldn't say it's as French as LA can get but it's pretty up there. They have a great selection of pairing wines to go with the food.i had the FILET MIGNON which was grilled asparagus, potatoes, and some bearnaise sauce. It was AWESOME and I'm actually craving it now. But above all my service was Great! my server was Robert, He's genuinely attentive and polite. And he recommended my dinner since I was indecisive. The entire night he basically picked out my food since I didn't know what half the things on there were. He was patient and funny with my husband and I. This place is just perfect from the view, the food and our amazing server. The price range is a bit high but I wouldn't mind spending again and again it's totally worth it. :)

Reviews.Author: Jessica B.
Reviews.Content: Spent my birthday dinner here and it was beyond fabulous.  The food was amazing, well prepared, delicious and a good variety, as were the cocktails.  The service was wonderful, everyone was very attentive, and even when two steak orders came back at the incorrect temperatures, instead of just swapping it with the other person at the table, they really wanted to make it right, took it back and prepared them both again.  They swiftly corrected the error and brought some complimentary dishes and just took really great care of us. And the white chocolate bread pudding for my birthday "cake" along with the chocolate whatever goodness that was - wow, party in my mouth.  So good.  The view is great, and the band that played was really good.  We ended dinner around 10:30 and the place turned into a hopping bar.  There was a DJ in the corner, a line to get up to the rooftop bar, as well as outside on the street just to get in. It definitely gets busy and crowded on the weekend, but the ambiance, food and service was really great.  Highly recommend Perch, for a celebration or anything else!

Reviews.Author: Miss Rockwell D.
Reviews.Content: The octopus, pork belly and chicken were phenomenal. I had the Lolita drink with him instead of vodka but it was perfection. It was a Thursday night and it was crowded so be sure to have reservations. Service may be slow but the view, food and music made up for that. I enjoyed everything about this place. Everything worth it.

Reviews.Author: LaVonne M.
Reviews.Content: I liked the view. The food was average, nothing to rave about. I've had A LOT better, I've had a LOT worse. I think I will stick with the drinks here, since really, it's all about the view. The tables were cramped but the outdoor dining area is very limited so that was to be expected. The service was great. We were seated right away and the waitress was helpful and attentive. Honest opinion, skip dinner and go for drinks and sociable atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Chester N.
Reviews.Content: I can understand in LA that the amount of rooftop lounges are few, so this would justify the pretension Perch possesses.  If you come unprepared, then prepare to be herded like cattle into a slaughterhouse.  The line to get in is ungodly at prime time.  This is the line just to get into the elevator to take the elevator to get to Perch.  Your best bet is to make reservations for a table and you're whisked in like a VIP as you mutter "see ya suckers!" under your breath.  Your table most likely won't be ready at the designated time, but who cares, you're already in.Once inside, you'll wonder why anyone would wait in line for an hour to get in.  There's really nothing super special, unless you're totally into "The Hills" type scene.  The views are nice, but the novelty wears off.  Table service is relaxing, and you're nicely sectioned away from the budding bromances of 20 somethings trying to prove their manhood by downing smirnoff ices.I can't say you'll have a bad time here, although the potential is there depending on the crowd.  As long as you don't have to wait the line, the sky is the limit with how the night will turn out.

Reviews.Author: Segran R.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Perch last night and we absolutely loved it!! Tiffany, the hostess made our experience a lot more pleasant. She had two rose tatoos near her collar bones. She was very sweet and sat us in a very good table. My boyfriend ordered the steak frites. It was very tasty and tender. The fries had yummy gooey cheese. I ordered the My Fair Lady drink, it was a bit on the sour side. After dinner Tiffany went out of her way to seat us putside bc we wanted to have dessert outside. Overall we were very happy with the dinner, ambiance, and most importantly Tiffany's hospitality. :)

Reviews.Author: V T.
Reviews.Content: Like most places in Downtown, timing matters.  If you go to Perch on a weekend night and expect to grab a table for a party of 10, .... you, my friend, have lost your marbles.  Happy hour is a great  way to enjoy Perch's scene without breaking the bank.  I made a 6pm reservation through yelp, and then arrived around 5:00 so my friend and I could enjoy the upper level bar and its view. We were lucky enough to catch a live performance of a sultry jazz/spanish guitar duo who were singing covers of 90s rap and hip hop.  Aragorn and Olivia.   It was magical.Quick Tips:*  Make reservations*  Plan to deal with paid parking lots and a funky elevator system*  Dont miss the sunset!

Reviews.Author: Gian V.
Reviews.Content: Went here for ladies night out on a Friday and was sorely disappointed! One star for service but giving it an extra star due to the decent view of downtown. Upon arrival there's an open entrance with bouncers doing the typical ID check. Mine just happen to take about five minutes. I let that slide and went in still optimistic. Take the elevator to the 13th floor (gasps! The evil 13!!!) and be prepared for a shady ride up. Then step off and take yet another rickety, outdated elevator to your final destinatoon. Jk theres more waiting.  There was a wait to go up to the rooftop bar which is fine, until the attendant became anal and asked my girlfriend to scoot over a foot to squeeze into the corner along the wall. Is a foot really going to help with the line? Did I also mention it was incredibly stuffy? After the stuffy wait,  we were granted access up the prestigious rooftop bar via two flights of stairs. When do we stop going up???If you want to get a table, make sure you ask for it before going through all the trouble of getting up to the rooftop. You can't make reservations over the phone even if you're there already.Service was mediocre and unattentive. We had to ask for our drinks after our dishes came out.Just a trendy place with psuedo manners and a bunch of snobby waiters. Save yourself the time and hit up another rooftop bar.

Reviews.Author: Niks O.
Reviews.Content: I love the idea of this place and the view is beautiful. Drinks are nothing super exciting. I came for dinner once with a few gf's for our "anniversary" and the food was good, no complaints I just don't know if I'd ever be like "let's do dinner here again!" What I do like is they had live music while we were there in the downstairs part, and then the upstairs is a little more open. I would come back to grab a drink or just hang out but nothing specific made it amazing for me.

Reviews.Author: Quisha H.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Saturday night for a few drinks and didn't really car for it. The rooftop has a small bar with two bartenders that unfortunately moves at a snails pace. The old fashioned I'd ordered was good but apparently the last one they were making for the night because they ran out of stuff to make it with even though it was only 10:30 0_o.The crowd here is very pretentious, you come to see and be seen, which just isn't my scene. On the bright side you at least have an awesome view of DTLA. Line starts getting long around 10pm on the weekend, so if you want to pass up places that are actually awesome to come here I suggest you do so early.

Reviews.Author: Esther K.
Reviews.Content: I've heard all about how the view of downtown LA is beautiful from the rooftop of Perch, so of course I had to come here on my birthday for some rooftop drinks with Dena O. and JQ. The entrance to the building is unassuming but helpfully says PERCH in large letters. You take the elevator to the 13th floor, where you get off and then get on another elevator to go to the 15th floor. This takes you directly to the bistro, which is where you would go if you wanted to have actual food here. I had read on Yelp that the food here was not good, so we completely ignored the bistro and took the stairs to the rooftop (16th floor). In case you are wondering, there are restrooms available on both floors (the 15th floor one has three stalls, while the rooftop one is just a room).We walked to the bar and ordered drinks. Dena got a glass of red wine but Joyce and I both got cocktails. She got the Lolita (Fris vodka, St. Germain, grapefruit juice, cucumber, champagne) while I got the Writer's Block (pear vodka, St. Germain, lemon juice, champagne). The drinks were pretty similar and both came recommended by the bartender. I'm not sure which one I prefer; both are light and refreshing without the taste of alcohol being overpowering. I liked both of them, so it's a good thing JQ shared a lot of her drink with me. Thanks JQ!When we got there all the seats were taken so we just stood near the bathroom area so we could put our drinks on the wall, but it didn't take long before a few seats opened up. We quickly walked over and took them... and refused to leave because we didn't want to give them up :P Of course, since we're on the rooftop, it got cold soon, so we had to leave eventually because we were freezing :P But of course I can't end my review without mentioning the view... which is beautiful. It would have been nice to come here around sunset because I'm sure it would have looked even more spectacular then, or at night so I could see all the twinkling lights of dtla, but the view in the late afternoon was still lovely. Would love to come back here again if I'm in the area (and have already paid for parking nearby) in the evening :)

Reviews.Author: Anthony T.
Reviews.Content: Took my cousin from london here on his birthday and i was very disappointed. This was also my first time coming to this place, the view is awesome that i can't complain, but the service totally sucks!!!! i would give the service a  -5, the waitress we had was so lazy and mind it was not a busy night as well. They also ran out of their ahi tuna tartar can you believe that??? A fancy place like this would ran out of food to serve!!!

Reviews.Author: Juliet S.
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I decided to treat ourselves to a fun cute dinner.. A bunch of friends suggested this place. The hostess and Malia were beyond amazing and they knew we wanted a table by the glass for a great view. All the service we got here was super good. The view was amazing we definitely wish we had boyfriends to be romantic with but whatevs hahah The food came out super fast. Amazing truffle fries and Brussels sprouts We will def be back soon with more friends

Reviews.Author: Sunny D.
Reviews.Content: It almost feels like some people writing for Perch didn't even really open their eyes or palate and instead were swayed mimicking/regurgitating words from previous reviews.Food:Bland.  How could anyone have the right to say anything more? The risotto was something I could have heated up from Trader Joes, chicken was slathered in something that tasted like canned sauce, and the cheese plate on it's own was a huge joke. It actually made me a little angry looking at it. People dining out these days are on a kick for the whole restaurant experience.  In turn restaurants (especially the new and trendy ones) are responding to that new interest in awesome ways - making sure every plate is in perfect detail, or has something neat to offer.  OR if it's not innovative then at the verrrry least make an attempt to ace the traditional plate.  Perch FAAAAILED.So a cheese plate - AT A FRENCH RESTAURANT ... now how on earth could you have f'd that up? They did. They did! Now if that was messed up imagine how badly the other food could have been messed up.Ambiance/Décor: Ok cool, so Perch you win here. But this part seems like the only area where the restaurant took the time and care to win people over. I admit, I was torn between making us reservations at Church & State or Perch.  Since we would be coming straight from a show at Nokia Theatre I thought Perch would be much more convenient. It was the fact that Perch has a lounge located in the back that became the deciding factor on where we were going to have dinner.  I never like having to rush off to another bar after dinner.  Places like Perch have the right idea - including a lounge to hang out after dinner.But now that I have eaten the food at Perch - I wish we just went to Church & State instead and dealt with finding another bar afterwards. ***Perch is only worth your time for drinks***.  Trust me - avoid dinner here.View:Ok for realisies?!: "The best most spectacular view in DTLA".Really I try to over and over again to tell myself that people in LA aren't THAT retarded and sometimes other cities are too harsh on the residents here. But people of LA it is becoming damn hard to defend you. JESUS WHAT VIEW?! I had the view of a cement parking lot during my meal - nice dodge you've got parked over there!. Just because you are on a high rise doesn't mean you necessarily will have a view ... we definitely did not.The waiter picking up the check even had the balls to say: "I'd ask you how you liked your first visit here but judging from your seats and view I'd say you loved it" ... .NO ACTUALLY. I actually think this view sucks and your food sucked too. 3 points only for the awesome DJ (so good!!) and entertainment: hipster watching.Conclusion:I am convinced the owner/planner of this restaurant was 95% concerned with attracting the young twenty something drinking crowd, 4% concerned with butterflies and 1% concerned with the food they would be serving.  Even when entering the restaurant there is a long line for those that want to enter for the bar/lounge.  Immediately after seeing that I should have known this place is not for food - its for booze and mingling.  So all in all great place for drinks (if you're in the area but don't expect much for your palate here, you'll be let down if you do.

Reviews.Author: Eddie Z.
Reviews.Content: This was my first time here and I have to admit I had an awesome experience.  Staff was great, the food was beyond excellent.  Everything was tasty and they took orders correctly. Oh and did I mention awesome fucking view I feel like I'm on top of DTLA looking down at the little people, little poor people "JK" just joking.

Reviews.Author: Jeff P.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a couple times with friends and family. The place is hard to notice from street level, it looks like you are entering an old office building. There is a screen in the ground floor lobby that is usually playing Charlie Chaplin next to a security guard, and then you have to take two separate elevators to get up to the venue.Made the mistake of trying to go there for dinner once without making a reservation. They said that they were totally booked for the night and the only spaces available would be if people don't show up, otherwise they have a dozen people ahead of us.With that aside, the few times I went there were to just have drinks at the rooftop lounge. The prices were average for that type of upscale establishment, drinks from around $7-$12. It has a beautiful panoramic view of downtown LA which are hard to beat. Its somewhat hard to find a seat there on the rooftop, you'll probably have to wait a little while to snag an area for yourself. Recommended for a nice place to hangout with your friends during the week. I walked by it on a weekend and there was a giant lineup down the road to get in.

Reviews.Author: Lemon C.
Reviews.Content: For a view of the city over drinks or dinner,  ideally just before sunset. It has gorgeous views from the rooftop and you can eat indoors or outside. They have a great cocktail menu. You can only make reservations 3 weeks in advance. On a Monday night they had multiple live bands play. The cauliflower was amazing. The homemade gnocchi was good but a small portion. Loved their dessert and cocktail menu.

Reviews.Author: Manish B.
Reviews.Content: I hosted a cocktail - dinner at the Perch restaurant for about 15 people on the 24rth June 2014. From the time that I made the reservation , I knew we were onto a winner. I live in Dubai and made arrangements to set this up with the "perch girls" remotely ! they are amazing , and deserve some sort of award in customer service.The venue is exquisite , the ambiance in extraordinary and the service par excellence. I had booked one off the terrace's for this private event . I could not have asked for more.If you are looking to impress your guests with a venue that shows that you have arrived without the pretentiousness of a michelin star restaurant , where the service is relaxed yet prompt , where attention to small details is done as a matter of second nature and the "perch girls" make you feel right at home then you cant go wrong with this establishment.Special thanks to our server "Paul the superman" for keeping up with the demands of my ever-thirsty guests .

Reviews.Author: Naoshad S.
Reviews.Content: Came here a few times, sat and wed night. Attractive girls. Everything is awesome about this place aside from the shitty, horrid music.

Reviews.Author: Mike P.
Reviews.Content: So, my coworkers and I came here for a small farewell drinks/dinner.  After dining, we decided to hit the lounge on the rooftop.  One of my coworkers brought cupcakes for the celebrant to take home.  Of course, no outside food allowed at the lounge, which is understandable.  So, we asked the bartender at the lounge to hold it for us and we'll pick it up before we leave.   There was a change of shift or break time with the bartenders as we were about to leave.  The reliever didn't know where the cupcakes were.  So she (and us) looked at the bartending area.  We finally found it only to find that 1 cupcake was missing and 1 that is halfway-eaten.  I'm pretty sure the relief bartender was responsible for this and she just didn't care and just pretend like she had nothing to do with it.  This was the worst experience ever!  It's like when you bring your lunch to work, put it in the community fridge and find out that someone had eaten half of it.

Reviews.Author: Romster R.
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend here for her bday dinner a night before her bday party. She fell in love with the place.Made reservations a couple weeks in advance for a Friday night dinner out on the balcony. Very romantic. Amazing views. Surprisingly excellent tasting food!Host and server were very polite and professional. They were on top of the fact it was her bday(it is tacky to have to mention it when you are there).Definite 5 star place. Best spot for a date night or drinks with friends.

Reviews.Author: Taleen B.
Reviews.Content: We came here for my moms birthday and I loved everything about this restaurant!!!! The service is incredibly fast. The food and drinks we're delicious. Definitely will come back here for a date night!!!

Reviews.Author: Joseph F.
Reviews.Content: Very very nice lounge/restaurant! Great for a date or just with the guys. From the rooftop to the staff, I have no complaints.

Reviews.Author: Erin H.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars - nightlife3.5 stars - brunch/ lunchI came here 2x in 12 hours! So I'll break up my review into 2 halves.NIGHTLIFE:When I first drove by, I saw a massive line at 10:30pm (or so), and I started freaking out. According to our Korea study abroad reunion plans, we weren't planning on going in until 11:30 or 12ish. Luckily, one of my friends knew the owner/ was a regular patron, so we were able to skip the entire line (with a group of 12, no less!).As this was my first time, I had no idea what to expect. We went up the elevator to a small room, then into another elevator which actually led to perch, and then started taking it all in. It was hard to tell what was exactly going on in the dim lighting, but it seemed like a pretty poppin place. We headed out to the patio area. It was a bit chilly that night (so ladies, def bring a jacket. There's no coat check, but it's worth keeping warm). Drinks are pretty decently priced. Maybe it's cuz I've only been clubbing a lot in DTLA, but I was pleasantly surprised when drinks were like $10 (i.e. 1 Macallan 12, 1 vodka soda with a splash of cranberry, and a beer = $30). This isn't really a dancing spot, more bar/ loungey - lots of people talking and drunkenly making out in the corners haha Regardless pretty cool place. The view is great, venue is classy, a great place to go out!Last call was at 1:40am. This might've been my only point of irritation. Too early.~~~~~BRUNCH/ LUNCH:Luckily, my friend's AirBnB was literally just across the street from Perch, so we eventually got up with a hangover and decided to go to Perch for food (just 2 of us by this point). This was on a Sunday morning/noon.It looks really good in the daylight. Almost everything that was a wall with windows was now open, so there was so much air and natural light flooding into the place. We got pretty lucky and got a seat right away (if you have a bigger party, def get ready to wait). We sat "inside" but it was right next to an open door/window, so it was basically like sitting outside but in the shade! yelp.com/biz_photos/perc…Here's what we ordered:- bloody mary: it's pretty big, didn't ask me how spicy I wanted it, but it was still pretty good (not spicy though)- mon petit cheri: my broken French translates this into "my little friend" and it comes in a little glass bursting with so many flavors. It's really an interesting drink. There's goose cherry noir, creme yvette, ginger, champagne - I don't even know what those first 2 ingredients are. Not sure if I'd recommend unless you want to try something completely random. It gets stronger as you get to the bottom. yelp.com/biz_photos/perc…- perch burger: to be quite honest, this was like a gourmet IN-N-OUT burger in terms of seasoning and dressing but with a fried egg on it. It was a really messy burger but obviously tasted pretty good. Got it cooked medium rare with a side of fries (you can choose salad if you want). The fries are regular (not sure if you can upgrade to the truffle ones). yelp.com/biz_photos/perc…- #13 benedict: your standard eggs benedict (they have other options as well with salmon or crab). These were ok although they were a bit salty for my taste. These came with a side of house potatoes. yelp.com/biz_photos/perc…Overall, while the service was good, the food tasted ok. It wasn't bad but it wasn't really stunning. If anything, you're paying for the ambience and the view, which are awesome.

Reviews.Author: Vidya K.
Reviews.Content: This place is all the buzz among going Los Angeles folk. A friend had previously recommended Perch to me because of the great views. Previous to coming here for dinner, I skimmed through the yelp reviews for this place and I was a little disappointed. I read a lot of complaints about long lines, bad service, unspectacular views, etc etc. So I went to Perch with lowered expectations and I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed my dinner!The first thing I noticed upon being there was that everyone was very well dressed. Heels on women, Jackets on men. I felt really underdressed in my sandals and dress from work. We arrived earlier than our reservation time. We checked in and then went and got drinks at the bar on floor 16. I had a Spicy Concombre and it was soooo delicious. I wanted another but our table was ready a full 20 minutes early! While we waited, we found seats in the lounge area right next to the view (which consists mostly of the Deloitte building). Dinner was delicious. I had two glasses of a Napa Valley Pinot noir, the ahi tuna appetizer, and the salmon for my main course. All were absolutely delicious. My friend had the steak and frites and his truffle fries were amazing. We were seated outside and I was pleasantly surprised by the heat lamp placed right behind me! So I enjoyed my dinner, my company, the view, and I wasn't cold! Perfect in my book. I would definitely come back here, maybe for brunch next time. 4 stars and not 5 because this place is expensive. Come prepared to spend a lot of $$$$

Reviews.Author: Joi S.
Reviews.Content: I came here for my after Birthday brunch and really loved it! The location of course, food, service and live jazz were all great!I wish they had valet but we parked in the lot across the street which was fine for us. We had a 12pm reservation and was seated right when we arrived. We sat outside with amazing views of DTLA and even though we were seated around a little corner area we could still hear the jazz. We couldn't see the band though, I'm sure if you come early like right when brunch starts you will have a seat right where the band is, none the less we enjoyed our seats. Our server was very nice. She came over right away and welcomed us and took our drink order. My hunnie had a mimosa and I went with the Mon Petit Cheri. The bartender definitely didn't skimp on the alcohol, it was actually a little too strong for me...I asked for some juice to add to it. It was good but I think I'll stick with a glass of wine or mimosa next time lol. With all my birthday drinking I did the night before I didn't need anything else super strong. For our food we ordered the Huevos Rancheros, french toast with berries and shrimp pasta. The food was absolutely amazing. I really loved the way my eggs were cooked on my dish. They we rent over cooked but just right. The yolk was oozing out on my plate which was the perfect compliment to my huevos rancheros. The salsa and beans were great as well. The french toast was huge, sweet and berries were fresh. My hunnie really loved her pasta as well. The portion was great and pasta was cooked very well. We were able to share the french toast since the portion was so big which was very nice. I think the prices were reasonable as well. Each dish ranged from $10-$25 which was great considering you can enjoy the live jazz on weekends as well. Would I come here again? ABSOLUTELY!

Reviews.Author: Katie K.
Reviews.Content: Five stars for customer service! Heading to Perch tonight for the first time for husband's 40th birthday drinks and our pre-dinner plans got messed up, so Anna was able to help us out with a last minute reservation tweak. Great experience so far and can't wait to go.

Reviews.Author: Julius S.
Reviews.Content: Perch is the place you want to visit when you want to soak in LA's beautiful city skyline, day or night. You take two elevators to reach the lounge and as soon as you step outside, the view is nothing short of amazing. Tip: come a little earlier so you can enjoy the sunset and avoid the longer lines at night. Don't come here to eat, the food is pricey and the portions are rather skimpy (difficult to share with a group of people). My friends and I ordered a couple appetizers (baked brie & octopus) and we each had only one bite of the food before it was all gone. It's really best to grab a drink from the bar, take a seat, and revel in the atmosphere. They also have music from live bands/singers which lighten up the ambiance. I love Perch, purely for its incredible venue and city views.

Reviews.Author: Jellie M.
Reviews.Content: This is a new cool hip place in downtown LA. I work there & I love DTLA. I'm happy that more cool places are opening up there.  The prices were reasonable for a place of that class. I think the specialty drinks ran between $10-14 maybe $15. The drinks I got were really strong!!! My scientist friend suggested I can kill the germs in a lab with the amount of alcohol in my drink!! More bank for my buck! ;)

Reviews.Author: Ann K.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 but I'll be nice and round it up to 4.Amazing views of the city but long long lines.Great ambience for a night out with friends.Tried almost all the entrees here such as the salmon, gnocchi, salad, chicken, and tuna tartare. They were alright. Gnocchi was slightly better. BUT...the Steak and Frites was right on the money! Super addicting. I wouldn't have expected any less from a french restaurant/bar.

Reviews.Author: Spanky S.
Reviews.Content: Incredible views, delicious food and cocktails and funky live music. What more could you ask for?!........great date night spot with a nice mixed crowd on a Friday night.Braised short ribs with polenta was nice a flavorful as were the steak and frites. The server we had was knowledgeable and pleasant (we actually ended up seeing him the next day at the grocery store and he was again, very nice lol).I forgot which cocktail I had but I remember it being delicious. My date enjoyed his as well and he is not even a big drinker.I'd definitely recommend and I will be back this summer for some more good eats and good views!

Reviews.Author: LalaNlove A.
Reviews.Content: great atmosphere for friends night out and date. I love this New York style roof top lounge/restaurant. I had girls night out there,didn't try any food but drinks were good.Oh and also Almond cake was to die for! Out waitress  Liliana (i think) was the best! i would definitely come back and ask for her.I love that for a little i felt like i was in New York again! Crowd was cool too,i would say very high end place.

Reviews.Author: N K.
Reviews.Content: Amazing ambiance, great food, extremely friendly staff. I go there for their Sunday brunch, they have the best French toast in town!! Perfect  place to take a date or even just to grab drinks/food with friends. I always ask for Jacky and/or Nicole the best waitress' ever!!!

Reviews.Author: AMMBMJ T.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic atmosphere, incredible views, knowledgeable and friendly service without pretense, fabulous cocktails, all good.  We will be back.

Reviews.Author: Wendy W.
Reviews.Content: Perch is the type of restaurant I would love to live at.  The furniture is beautiful, the decor is beautiful... there's nothing I want more than to sip a mimosa all day and enjoy the breathtaking view.However, this place is PACKED and it's fairly pricey, too, even for just brunch.  I had the crab benedict and she had the steak-frites with truffle cheese fries, and both tasted great.  Although my friend and I both enjoyed our food, I'm not exactly sure if it was worth the splurge.  Also, the waiters are really attractive.  Maybe a means to come again.

Reviews.Author: Chloe M.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant setting is incredible. The views are spectacular and the decor is so intimate and romantic. I recommend going right at sunset on a Thursday or Sunday when it's not as busy. The staff were all very friendly to us and the live music is perfect. I ordered the Steak Frites which was delicious, but my boyfriend said the Salmon wasn't all that special or else I'd rate this place 5 stars! Definitely recommending this place to friends!

Reviews.Author: I S.
Reviews.Content: I am giving an extra star after yesterday's visit to Perch. They have improved their food.

Reviews.Author: Manuel A.
Reviews.Content: I love their champagne special on Sundays!! You can't beat $12 for a bottle of champagne and an amazing view. The service can vary depending who waits on you, but overall everyone is nice and happy. Their desserts are the bomb! I've been here tons of times, but never had any food except the sliders. The one time we did want to order food we waited 45 minutes!!! The bartendar that took our food order didn't put it in!

Reviews.Author: J. W.
Reviews.Content: Just insanely good. The views are the best in the city, atmosphere was tremendous, great staff - and I have no clue what people are complaining about with the food. The tuna appetizer was perfect and I have had the brussels sprouts from pretty much every restaurant I can - and nothing can touch these. Prepared perfectly with a brown butter, parmesan AND bacon!?!  Incredible. We had the salmon, scallops and steak frites. The truffle fries were a treat. And the steak was actually cooked medium rare. Usually if you order it medium rare it comes out cold and bloody - not so here. Yes - if you build any place up too much it will suck. Just go and enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Author: Aimee G.
Reviews.Content: I love going to Perch.  I have been several times with my friends and always have a good time.  The space is beautiful, the drinks are delicious, food is tasty what more could you ask for.  Try to get up to the 16th floor if it is open, when the sun is setting the view is fantasic!

Reviews.Author: Mimi K.
Reviews.Content: I was here for on 4/4 for my birthday, we made reservations for 7pm for 6 ppl.  We were having a good time, catching up with friends, having drinks and dinner, and didn't know 3 hrs passed by so quickly.  And out of nowhere, we were asked to leave bc the rest of the reservations were getting backed up. If they had told us there was a time limit, we would have made plans accordingly.  Also, our waiter, Chris, seemed to be in bad mood, so I asked if everything was alright.  His dry response was, "I didn't know my mood was being analyzed".  No smile.  You're in service, your job requires you to be friendly! This place is over-hyped and nothing great except for the great view, but that's not perch's doing, that's how DTLA looks like from any downtown rooftop.  To end on a good note, the drink The Writer's Block is very good.

Reviews.Author: Blanca V. S.
Reviews.Content: Had a 1:30pm reservation on a Sunday for brunch. We got there and they sat us right away in the outside patio as requested. I ordered the French toast with bacon, which was very yummy! My friend had the huevos rancheros which he enjoyed. We also had two mimosas. Overall the food was pretty good, the view was beautiful but the service wasn't ALL that great. I would definitely go back though :)

Reviews.Author: Silly C.
Reviews.Content: The crowd here was very relaxed, I liked the atmosphere and of course, the view. The drinks were good, not too strong or light. The server, the first time I went for a friend's birthday, was easy going, easy to talk to, and had great drink recommendations. The second time I went, again for a friend's birthday, we went to the roof top. The bar tenders there were more about being quick than nice, so they did not make drinks as well. It was also a busier night. But my friends and I left happy. Parking at the pershing square is the best option (I think it's $8, not sure), but there's a closer lot for $10. and they hold your keys, so you might have to leave by a certain time to make sure you get your keys back.The food there is okay, but nothing special. People mainly go to socialize and drink. Not many seats on the roof, and the floor with tables are for people dining and you do need to let the host know you would like to be seated.

Reviews.Author: Monika H.
Reviews.Content: Went to Perch last week for the first time and loved both the view and food! ParkingWe parked at Pershing Square underground lot - it was $7 flat rate after 5pm I believe. Service (5/5)1. We made a reservation through open table and confirmed through both text & call. It was very simple and convenient, and our table was ready when we got there (even though it was a busy Friday night). 2. The staff was very friendly and service was quick Food (5/5)1. I ordered the salmon plate for dinner, it was amazing & the chef was able to prepare mine without lemon upon request (I'm allergic).2. My boyfriend ordered the steak frites which we also loved - the steak was perfectly cooked medium done. The truffle fries that came on the side were so good we were fighting over them until they were gone. 3. DESSERT! All the choices looked drool-worthy but we eventually decided on the white chocolate bread pudding. It was the best bread pudding we had tried before, and was hot, fresh, and yummy. The berries were a perfect topping to match the sweetness of the white chocolate. THE VIEW!! (5/5)Our reservation was for 6:45pm, a perfect time to witness both aspects of the restaurant.  Before the sun set, the balcony canopy remained open allowing us to sit out under the LA sky. As it became dark and chilly, the retractable canopy was opened to cover the patio and the atmosphere immediately changed from cute day view to a romantic setting.

Reviews.Author: Richard A.
Reviews.Content: If you love a pretentious atmosphere, you'll love this place! They've got elevators that lead that Lead to elevators, wait in line to get in line! Whaaaaaaaaa! You can find at least 3 guys in a sailor stripes blue and white shirt who love to roll their eyes! I bought a bottom shelf shot of vodka for 12 bucks...12 bucks Great view though!!

Reviews.Author: Andrew W.
Reviews.Content: The bar is pretty interesting...what is up these stairs?aww! cool! you can go on the roof! look at the view!AAAAAaaand That is where the cool-ness of it stops. sure it's nothing wrong with the club/bar whatever you want to call it, but with the the number of clubs and bars in LA growing each week, you have to do something that changes your location. something where people will think let's go to [your club/bar] tonight!

Reviews.Author: Phyllis L.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the first time last night!  Surprisingly, I liked it!  I'm not crazy about crowded places but this wasn't that bad.  The view is pretty cool from pretty much anywhere you sit.  There was a very good live band playing.  The ambiance was just altogether very good!We had the brie - and boy, was that delicious!  I had the filet mignon and I must say, it was the best FM I've had anywhere!  Who is the chef there?!?!?  He/she gets kudos from me!  I can't wait to go again!  Maybe I'll try Brunch to see how it all is during the day!

Reviews.Author: Rita W.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING atmosphere, no cover, great quality / loaded drinks, but keep your eye out for any chairs/tables that open up to secure a spot for your group. :) So you're at the Perch Hotel. Go in there, take the elevator up to the 13th floor. Then go take another elevator to the 15th floor (there'll be a bird on it, so you can't miss it), walk around pass the restaurant area, onto the rooftop. They have a list of their signature drinks, and the few that I tried were amazing. They have happy hour from 4 - 6pm, and the usual $12 - $14 drinks become $7, but the signature drinks are limited to PENICILLIN (famous grouse, lemon juice, agave nectar, ginger liquor), HEMINGWAY ON THE BEACH (greenall's gin, luxardo, lemon juice, angostura), and one other, depending on the server (Coup De Coeur). I'd recommend Penicillin if you love ginger. It's a great drink, though I developed an aversion toward ginger years ago. If you love mojitos (my favorite), they have the Spicy Concombre (Plymouth gin, cucumber, jalapeno, lime, mint, St. Germain) and the French Maid (cognac, lemon, cucumber, fresh mint). If you don't like those little twists to the classic mojito, you can just order a classic one. It'll still be loaded with awesomeness. I was impressed. Though this rooftop bar is nowhere as high up as the floor I work on at another downtown LA building, you'll still get an amazing view.

Reviews.Author: Susie M.
Reviews.Content: No denying that this place is nice. How can you not enjoy the gorgeous view of downtown LA from the roof. But do yourself a favor and don't come on a weekend night unless you intend on a) not eating b) waiting for a long time c) and as a result: long service times.The staff was nice, but it's like herding cattle there on the weekends. Drinks are fine and food is good enough. It's just hard to enjoy without a drink in your hand or food on your plate.

Reviews.Author: Jezabel C.
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend brought me here the other day for our five year anniversary. neither of us are 21 so I really don't feel like we got the "full" experience, but it was still a nice little place! we went when the sun was out and it was really pretty. we tried a "mock-jito" and it was bomb and I can't wait to go back and try it when I'm 21 hahathe food was okay.. I got a Caesar salad which was decent. I've had better! I also got the bacon mac n cheese which was also just decent. my bf got the "little bunny frou frou" which I thought was so sad!! it was rabbit ravioli and although it tasted good, I couldn't let myself have more than one bite cause I felt too sad eating a poor little bunny.overall, it was a cool little spot. the best thing was the "mockjito" which makes sense because it's more of a drink place than a food place. I recommend going at night and when you're 21!

Reviews.Author: Dominique P.
Reviews.Content: This place has become a zoo and the staff couldn't be any ruder & more obnoxious... Not coming back for a long long time...

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: this place is super cute. the rooftop is just adorbs. but that's what you pay for; the view. the drink's are absolutely delicious.  it's also 14$ for like 3 sips (I had a drink called writer's block) which i was ok with since i had great company. i ordered the chicken with the wild mushroom risotto because i was feeling like some risotto that night. it was meh. chicken was pretty dry. risotto was ok. it wasn't anything spectacular that i couldn't cook at one. will i go back? maybe for brunch. not so much for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Ravi K.
Reviews.Content: We came here for my wife's birthday. The view from the restaurant is amazing and there is decent food. If you do not have a reservation then you will have to wait for a long time

Reviews.Author: Rebecca L.
Reviews.Content: Actors. Actors as far as the eye can see. Everything is alright, but overpriced. Service is surprisingly good.

Reviews.Author: Mimi L.
Reviews.Content: Finally the weather got warmer, after rain, it was a beautiful Sunday, went back to Perch for a brunch this time, we have never had a meal there, was always just drinks. A little late for our actual reservation time, but we still got seated at a table next to glass walls in the beautiful patio. With sunshine, plants and nice views of downtown LA, it looked like a promising great brunch time, and it was! The brunch menu was limited, not too many choices, but they serve fresh oysters, available during Sunday brunch only, at least they have some seafood and vegetarian choices, we started off with a bottle of French champagne, it was special price too, ordered orange juice to make tasty mimosas of course.Brunch food:Fresh oysters on half shell, with housemade cocktail and chopped onion vinegar sauces: the sauces were very good, full of flavors, we asked for tabasco too, the small but super sweet fresh oysters tasted so good with the sauces, loved them!Smoked salmon Benedict: the poached eggs were perfect, of course I loved smoked salmon, the hollandaise sauce was very light, could have used a bit more flavor. Flat iron steak frites with truffle cheese fries: steak was fairly delicious in medium rare, the cheese fries were very light too, again could have used a bit more flavor, considering it was truffle cheese flavored.Desert:White chocolate bread pudding, with strawberries and blueberries: it was the best among all the dishes we tried, I only indulge in sweets once or twice a week, besides diet reasons, I don't like sweet things too much, glad the pudding wasn't too sweet, it was just right for me! The brunch was pleasant, I had a Bloody Mary with goose in addition to champagne, it was tasty. Our waitress was very friendly and polite, it was very slow from time to time, she appreciated our patience, we just didn't mind taking time to enjoy the sunny weather and the live jazz band music, it was lovely. The tab was $137. I really liked the fun, relaxing and energetic atmosphere of Perch, the food was good but not great, the flavors were lacking, the portions were on the smaller side. The drinks are better than the food in my opinion, and they are reasonable priced from $12-14, I particularly like the Lolita specialty cocktail, strong and refreshing. I'd come back for an early dinner to enjoy the nice patio with views at sunset hours, since it's summer, or just drinks in the afternoon or evening, meals or drinks, or both, it's always good times at Perch for sure! Ps. Public parking across the street, it's $6 flat rate on Saturdays and Sundays.

Reviews.Author: TG G.
Reviews.Content: To start off, this place is purely about money from what I could see.Took my girlfriend to this place because of all the recommendations from my friends as well as the high yelp review. Set a reservation about two weeks in advance. Wanted to make the night special for her because we do not go out to fancy places very often. We were on the list and made it past the front doors and up the elevators. When we finally got to the host, the trouble began.1) Once we got to the host and I checked in with her, they said the wait would still be another twenty minutes. This was more of an annoyance, but since we were already there and the restaurant was clearly busy, agreed to wait.2) After about fifteen minutes, we were called. When the reservation was made, specifically told the man to make sure we were not in the middle because my girlfriend gets nervous being in the middle surrounded by people and as close to the side of the balcony as possible for a great view. The accommodations were important for two factors: one, because we both are childhood cancer survivors and feeling comfortable is important for our health and 2) because these instructions were stated in the reservation, which was completely understood. We were seated by the "reservation manager" (a strict looking woman that had her hair up in a bun) at a table that was as far away from the balcony as possible without being inside. The table was a small table right next to the doors to the balcony. The music speaker was just about touching our feet and was blasting loud. We could barely hear each other talk.3) When seeing the table, told the "reservation manager" of the accommodations that was mentioned when the reservation was made. She told me, that was impossible to seat in a specific seat because that is not how they operate. They seat each costumer when the first seat is open.4) From there, she went on to questioning me about the reservation as if it were an interrogation.  When did I call? Who did I talk to? Am I sure I remember the call correctly? Felt more like a suspect than a costumer. She also added we had to wait for all the people that did not have reservations to go first if we wanted to wait for a different table.5) Finally, we agreed to sit there and the "reservation manager" said if an empty table opens up, she would gladly let us know. 6) Here is the kicker... A empty table did show up and we quickly asked the waitress (who was very sweet) if we could switch tables. She was completely fine with the switch. We never saw that "reservation manager" the rest of the night which means, she was not going to even tell us a seat had opened up. The food was good despite the price, but the service was awful. Would gladly go to a quiet, respectable coffee shop than that money hungry zoo.

Reviews.Author: The Mermy G.
Reviews.Content: The view from Perch is AMAZING.  Its the only reason Ive come back three times.We arrived and were told that we would need to wait about 15mins for our table.  Not a problem, the place was busy.  Then they tell us to have a seat and they would find us. So we sit down near the bar at a table.  Within two minutes, Ms. Happiness the waitress comes over and rudely tells us we need to get up and move because the seats are for reservations only and to go and talk to the hostess.  Seriously, what a witch.  She pissed me off so bad that I asked her well where do we sit and she says not here maybe at the bar.  The bar is clearly full.  So the hairs on the back of my neck go up and we move.For me, this set the tone for the rest of the afternoon with this place.  Again, the view is amazing and there was a lovely breeze I couldve easily taken a nap.  The food was ok even though my mom loved her beet salad and baked brie.  I had the eggs benedict and all three in my party shared the french toast.  We also enjoyed Bloody Mary's.Overall, not sure Id come back.  Maybe to have a drink upstairs and enjoy the view.  Other than that, one bad apple can ruin it for everyone.  I think that chick ruined it for us.

Reviews.Author: Amanda P.
Reviews.Content: I went here for drinks after work with some friends and we all had a great time! Although it gets crowded (we went on a Thursday night) it has a cool vibe. The rooftop is beautiful and it's a great place to just grab a drink and mingle.

Reviews.Author: Jessica M.
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoy the whole package  when dining out. Perch offers a beautiful ambience, views, really good food, live jazz. You couldn't ask for a more perfect evening out. I sampled everyone's meal beet salad, salmon, octopus, scallops, Brussels sprouts, veges, I loved it all. I usually prefer to cook at home as most restaurants disappoint. Make a reservation as even on a Wednesday it was hopping.

Reviews.Author: Ashley A.
Reviews.Content: Flawless service, atmosphere, and food!!!!! We came yesterday 4/11 (on a very busy Friday night) and we were still well taken care of. We began with the fromage plate. It was delicious and well portioned. Presentation was very neat and professional too. The bunny frou frou pasta dish was next- so AMAZING. It was cooked perfectly: savory and cheesy, well seasoned creme sauce,with a spicy tangy kick. Michael, who I assumed was one of the hosts for the evening, got us our menus and waters, taking the initiative necessary for good customer service! Soon after, our assigned waitress Elizabeth checked on us consistently. My friend and I were very impressed because we noticed Elizabeth was also taking a large party across from us- but managed to still provide great service for everyone. The two did their absolute best in accommodating our needs, and we appreciate it very much! Wonderful staff.I highly recommend this place to everyone, a (somewhat) hidden treasure in downtown that everyone can enjoy.However: beware! when we left after the dinner (1130pm) the line was quite LONG. Luckily, we were able to avoid that by arriving at around 930/10.also! the Friday night DJ played a KILLER SET!!!

Reviews.Author: Cristina M.
Reviews.Content: Perch is the "new" rooftop hot spot in DTLA, which is why I made a dinner reservation for my friend and I. The crowd starts to buzz around 9pm, so if you would like a quieter dinner stop by a couple hours before and enjoy the sunset. Even with the preparation, we weren't able to get the outside patio seating as I requested. However, we were given the option of lounge seating by the band or to wait an extra 30 minutes. If you are in no rush, take it easy, and enjoy the views from the second deck upstairs. We were seated well under 30 minutes. Don't expect authentic French cuisine, but do get the pork belly and white chocolate pudding. Some plates will surprise you for a bargain price. We spent under $100 for a dinner for two! I then asked the host if we could move to the lounge area by the band. He was very accommodating...come to think of it, all of the staff was friendly and extremely efficient. It made the ambiance that much more enjoyable! Highly recommend a visit! Well done, Perch.

Reviews.Author: Sabrina A.
Reviews.Content: I love me some Perch!!I went for the first time with a friend of mine for dinner. I forget what my friend had but I had the delicious Gnocchi with a side of brussel sprouts. The brussel sprouts could've been better. They were super hard to chew!! The best part of Perch as you can see from the pics is the view. You can get a nice table outside with a gorgeous view of downtown. You can then work your way up to the top level for drinks and a lovely romantic view. Also a great place for groups of friends. It's very chic and hip!

Reviews.Author: Angela W.
Reviews.Content: Take my Husband here for his birthday ! Great customer service , great food and drinks! Outdoor lounge is pretty cool too. Food : we got the pork belly( something to die for) , mussels ( omg the soup base is so creamy!!) . Steak fritz was on point ( I ordered medium rare and it was medium rare! Oh god knows how many times I order a medium rare steak but come out medium ) Just on the side note: perch was nice enough to offer us dessert free of charge because it was my husband s birthday! The white chocolate pudding really completed our night out. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Claire W.
Reviews.Content: Really interesting, trendy bar scene. Veryyoung LA. Who knew LA loved Ray Bans so much. Anyways back to Perch... Beautiful, detailed decor with some great views of downtown LA. They have wonderful patios with 3 bars. The waiters were attractive and the security guard ended up letting us up to the roof and cut the line since it was my birthday. Very impressed with their bread pudding. I would highly recommend. The warm vanilla with blueberries were to die for!Go here if you are looking to experience the trendy night life of LA.

Reviews.Author: Clint T.
Reviews.Content: Amazing service!! We had a group of 12 and the staff was very accommodating. Good was all top quality and made perfectly.

Reviews.Author: W Ellen F.
Reviews.Content: Good, if pretentiously named food.  VERY SLOW Service.  If you're trying to make a show, be sure to give yourself at least a 2.5 hour window.  Really.  The server came over to us after our appetizers were cleared and asked, "Any dessert?"  We had to inform her that we hadn't received our main courses yet!  Really.  Slow on refills of drinks; slow on getting the bill to us and paid.  Ahi Tuna Tartar is good and shareable.  Goat cheese green salad is just okay.  Salmon and Loupe de Mer were good.

Reviews.Author: Esther L.
Reviews.Content: This place is probably def a place to visit when you're in la. A rooftop bar with a nice view of pershing square. It's a lovely place to go to for brunch on sundays and a nice place to stop by when out and about in downtown.

Reviews.Author: Benjamin H.
Reviews.Content: We went to Perch for a company happy hour yesterday.  The reviews on Yelp were middling, so despite the rooftop setting that I love, I approached it with some reservations.  The experience was above my expectations, and the 4-stars overall is a strong indication that I will certainly be inclined to go back in the future.We didn't make reservations - a big mistake - because they were wanting us to run through some hoops for reserving a section for a large party.  We had around 15 people, which was not quite enough for the conditions they had for reserving an area, but too big for just "finding" a spot for everyone to congregate.  So you must take that into account.  This being the case, they were still very nice about letting us occupy the corner outside section on the 15th floor, which offered spectacular views, until another party needed it at 7pm.  They kicked us out at 6:30pm to set up for the party, but that is completely understandable and they did go out of their way to make sure we were taken care of up to that point.  We moved indoors at that point, a few of our party left, and rest situated ourselves around the bar and soon found several seats to occupy at the bar.The server outside was pretty nice but a bit slow, although that may have been the crowd rather than general lack of attention.  It got crowded by around 5:30.  The bartenders inside were great, including the really cute one that knew how to extract the tips.  All-in-all an attractive staff with surprisingly good customer service.  The manager(?) was a pretty studly looking guy who went out of his way to make us feel welcome.  Much appreciated.The food was not bad at all - beef sliders, cheese fries, bruschetta, and mac & cheese were all very good although not quite great.  Their happy hour (4-6pm) has some great deals, including $3 microbrew, $6 wines-by-the-glass, and apps in the $4-8 range.  Debating if dinner would be equivalently worthy, might go try it one day.  But to be sure, Perch is definitely worth the patronage as a bar with its more than adequate food, lively atmosphere packed full of mostly 30-somethings, and an absolutely divine space overlooking the city from the 16th floor.

Reviews.Author: Cat N.
Reviews.Content: Here's how you get to the Perch. Enter the building and go up on the elevators on your left. Go up to 13th floor, go out, sometimes there's a guy there guide you to the other set of elevators because they're kind of hidden. Get on those elevators and go up to 15th floor and you arrived. Sums it up, you have to travel on two different sets of elevators. A lot of work for going out to eat but the view you get is AMAZING!!!!!!! I was visiting from Dallas, TX and friends took me here! I feel so spoiled with such a good view! dinner on sunset with good weather. What more could you ask for? the drinks were awesome but food was even better. We pretty much ordered everything on their happy hour menu. But i can't speak for all because i didn't eat much. I only tried two things. I liked the meat plate and cheese plate a lot! it had different variety of nuts and fruits, too. Not just cheese and meat. I also got to taste the spicy nuts. They're also not spicy but very spiced up. It was seasoned with curry so it's not pepper spicey. Just flavorful with a lot of spice. You wont get the taste when you eat it, it's the after taste that kick in that makes you go ohhhh so flavorful! ehhehe. Anyway, good spot to hang out with friends!

Reviews.Author: Laura Y.
Reviews.Content: I was breath taken when I had my first sip of drink here-- the crisp air and the tall beautiful buildings of LA surrounding you is surreal. It feels like the night is serene and silent when you're up there... And as soon as you take the elevator ride back down to the first floor, you realize you're in the busy city of LA. I would say this is one of the best bars around in DTLA. Not because it's a rooftop bar but they just executed everything perfectly-- the lighting (dark and romantic), the soft music (either a DJ or jazz band, depending on the night), the comfort (chairs, tables, fireplace), the crowd (not ratchet like The Standard Rooftop Bar). My favorite drink here is My Fair Lady. It's pink, delicious and makes me feel girly. If I was more down for alcohol and not a wuss, I would order an old-fashioned-- matches the ambience quite well! As for food, I've only ate here once and ordered the filet mignon (not usually a meat lover but the ambience of this place had me feelin' fancy for the night!) and it was actually pretty good. The bearnaise sauce on top made the steak tasty! I don't know how often I would come here for food but I definitely will come back for drinks at night. Brunch looks pretty good so maybe I'll drag my boyfriend here for mimosas and some delicious brunch!

Reviews.Author: Angiee J.
Reviews.Content: Came here on Thursday night. Didn't eat, went straight up to the roof. The view is amazing and so is the vibe; very relaxed and chill. There are seats placed all around and a few fire places.There was a huge line for the drinks, but I'm sure it was better than other really busy nights. Ordered a My Fair Lady and it was delicious. Definitely plan on coming back. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: aland f.
Reviews.Content: This is the worst setup for a bar in LA. What they neglect to tell you when you reserve a private party upstairs is that no food can be ordered from the rooftop location. So your party members have to break off and seek solace on a lower floor (and due to fire code, they can't rejoin the party without a two hour wait). Who knew that a large party drinking would want to order food?Stupid planning, never coming back.

Reviews.Author: Nicole W.
Reviews.Content: This place has the worst hospitality. I made a reservation for my 30th birthday. When we showed up they told me they couldn't find the reservation. I waited 20 minutes out front with a cake in my hands and 7 of my friends while they tried to search for my reservation. After 30 minutes of waiting they told me I'm sorry but you have to get in line. I talked with the assistant general manager who then told me that she couldn't seem to fix our problem so should get in line. Are you kidding me????? I can't believe your management would treat a customer like this. I will never recommend  this place to anyone. Actually, I will be telling people the awful experience you guys offered me on my 30th birthday.

Reviews.Author: Sonal P.
Reviews.Content: i love coming to Perch as often as I can. Whether the weather is hot or cold - the views from this rooftop are spectacular. You definitely feel like your right in the heart of where all the action is from above. There are heaters outside to keep folks warm, in case their stiff handmade cocktails don't get to you before then. I love the ambiance here and the crowd can be hit or miss depending on how great the weather is outside. There is always a huge line to go up to the second patio. My suggestion is to wait until later in the night when people aren't just arriving or get there early enough to grab yourself and your crew of friends a spot in the corner.

Reviews.Author: Rachel M.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write a review of this place for some time, having been here on many occasions. Probably important to know that if you are only looking for a really excellent food experience you could find it elsewhere. Trust me there are many better restaurants than this. Although the food is good, I don't think this is necessarily the reason you come here. Cocktail menu is seriously excellent, the bartender knows how to mix drinks well and I have never been disappointed here. If you come here I suggest taking your time, relax, sit back order a few drinks enjoy the view.The decor is really lovely, it's probably one of my favorite places for the decor and view alone. And honestly, this is why you come to perch. To sit back, relax with friends, enjoy a few drinks and just know that the food is secondary.

Reviews.Author: Matt K.
Reviews.Content: BRUNCH AT PERCHGold crusted vestibule,the tarnish on your ornamentsays you've seen better days.Never the less,a jeweled elevator opensand lifts my luckto the thirteenth floor.A pink bow-tied man in black slicks his hair and points me past a purple curtain;another elevator.Two more and I disembark wood paneled bravadoto the sunlit marble of Perch,where I am not on the listso I sit myself down at the bar.We order oysters,but don't really prize 'em;just a rouse to fit inat a place like this. Clam to mouth,I admire the puckering lipsof the woman to my left.When she's not sucking on a Bloody Mary in places like this,she sings ragtime;dressed to the nines.I like her andI like her friends,headed back to San Fran.The people who come herefeel they belong at places like this.A waitress walks byinaviator sunglasses.She smolders,like Tom in Top Gun,but I imagineRisky Business; how she'd looklike Tom in tighty whities. Anyway,this is L.A. and everyone is at least attractive.The staff is no exception,though I am.My eggs benedict is half way decent. Good hollandaise,but the yolks are over medium.I recognize the potatoes from my grocers freezer, cooked in peanut oil;at a place like this?At least they are garnishedwith a fresh sauté of onions and peppers.I lean on the barand glance over."This place thriveson its own exclusivity,"I tell my friend.His omelet is nothingspecial; he agrees.Don't come to be on the list.Don't come to be fed any bliss. Butcome for the bar girl;how she smiles, almost puritanical,as she pops a celery stalkinto your tall Bloody Mary.L.A. from the fifteenth is nice but she's the sort of view I'd comeback for.

Reviews.Author: Kathy S.
Reviews.Content: Food: Ordered a side of truffle fries, herb roasted salmon, and pan roasted chicken supreme. Truffle fries were stuck together because they were covered with cheese. Definitely ate with a fork. Mushroom risotto that came with the chicken was decent. You definitely don't come here for the food but it wasn't terrible. Drinks: Ordered champagne with St. Germain. Didn't come out in a champagne flute but more like a small saucer.Service: Slow but apologetic on a Thursday evening. It wasn't terrible and I wouldn't complain about it. Ambience: You go to Perch for the view. Indoor seating with bar and patio sitting. They had folky/soothing love music then a a female started spinning around 10. Eclectic crowd probably mid-30s to 40s. Some were jeans and some were in 3 piece suits.Location: Heart of downtown. You can park across the street for $6 (Thursday) so probably a few bucks more on the weekend.  Take 2 elevators and follow the bird. They'll card you after 9 or so.

Reviews.Author: Josh A.
Reviews.Content: I have been here several times but this last time convinced me that it could become a regular spot. The food was great, the drinks decent, and the service improved from the other times. Definitely the best rooftop in DTLA.

Reviews.Author: Steven N.
Reviews.Content: Came with my wife for our 5 year anniversary and OMG!! All I got to say is that this is the best place on earth. You must come at night it makes all the difference the view is amazing, the food is OMG!! I don't think I have eating anything this good in my life. The drinks are out if this world and dessert is off the chart. I cannot believe I have not heard of this place before. Will defiantly be coming back but this place is so special I think I will save it for special events.  The service is too notch and very professional. The have valley parking which is great so you don't have to worry about parking since it's down town.

Reviews.Author: Aneta S.
Reviews.Content: This place is really beautiful.  The view is outstanding and it's nice to come before sunset.  I felt like I was taken back to the 20s and 30s and I can just imagine the fabulous partying that was going on.  The food was ok, the seabass nice and clean but the veggies it came with kind of blah...  It's a great place to come just for the ambiance and worth bringing out of towners.  Will be back again.

Reviews.Author: Emily S.
Reviews.Content: Risotto was delicious!

Reviews.Author: Vinh N.
Reviews.Content: Food is decent, drinks are not bad, bow ties are fake.  But the reason you go to Perch is the rooftop bar that has a great view of DTLA and is free of a cover charge.Dress to impress and bring a coat, if not for you than for the lady as fire pits and heat lamps seats are snatched up quickly.  Check their calendar for nights with live musical entertainment.

Reviews.Author: Jane H.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to check this place out....and I finally got the chance to see what this rooftop lounge is all about. I like the way we enter the lounge and the decor is chic...it adds a bit of curiosity to the mind. Once on the rooftop, I can see why the view is amazing. You can see just about everything in LA! It was an awesome view. Unfortunately, I was here on a windy day and it was a bit cold. The host who showed us to our seat was gracious enough to have the fire place turned on for us. This is where it gets slightly disappointed. We sat for almost 10 minutes before anyone came to offer any type of service.  I serioulsy waited that long. I made eye contact with the manager but he made no attempt to jump in and help nor ask for staff to come and help. That rubbed me the wrong way. By the time our host came, there were no apology or an introduction to her name. Se we called her, "uh, excuse me".We ordered really light since we were killing time. I ordered the mojito and spiced nuts and my friend ordered the fruit plate. The mojito was made so weak, I thought I was drinking soda with flavored mint and lemons. I wish I wasn't kidding about that. The nuts were whatever and so was the fruit plate....nothing spectacular and nothing tongue tingling. Don't get me wrong.....I would still come here for a nice kick back night out because the view from the rooftop is amazing and the atmosphere is inviting but that's the extent of my next stop here.I hope the evening service is much better than the happy hour service, that's for sure.

Reviews.Author: Dan R.
Reviews.Content: Always a great experience here. The best view LA dining has to offer can be found downtown at Perch.Tip: Make a reservation BUT make sure you ask to be seated outside. Otherwise they might sit you inside without an amazing view as they sat us on our 2nd visit. I booked very last minute and there were plenty of people trying to grab a table, so we took it. Not a big deal.The first time I came here we sat outside though and the view is unlike any other.One thing I will say though, on our first visit my friend ordered a crispy fried piece of duck with bone-in on top of a black rice. My description of it is horrible, but IT WAS DELICIOUS. So... on my 2nd visit I was really excited to order it. They had no idea what I was talking about. The waitress said she had been working there since they opened and still had no idea. It's almost like it's a secret! She brought me something that was kinda similar but an appetizer and no bone-in, more like a croquet. I swear I have a picture of it and I'll post. Does anyone know what I'm talking about? I wish Perch still had this! I want to go back specifically for this dish but will be back regardless.

Reviews.Author: Diann S.
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to try this place since i'd seen fellow Angelenos take beautiful pics on the rooftop. Me and my girl got here at about midnight and ended up getting free parking on the street. *miracle* We waited in the line for about 15 mins and rode the elevators up to the 15th floor. When we got in there were a lot of people so we decided to walk around and check it out. We basically chaulked it up to a place to have a couple of drinks with your BAE and sit (if you can find a spot) and enjoy a lowkey night of someone else's company. We on the other hand were on a mission to party. We enjoyed the view it was lovely for sure. The DJ was playing the jams, but no one was even swaying. We were wiggling around and spotted some ladies trying to dance in the corner too. We pointed at each other but realized  there really wasn't a place to truly feel the music. We got bombarded by guys trying to take a pic for us -__- and then made our way inside to get drinks. For two drinks a Vodka Cran and a specialty drink it was $21. Kind of expected so I wasn't surprised. I got the Penicillin and it was really herb-y. It had such an interesting taste and hit me in the taste buds and came in one of those 20s style glasses. We tried to get to the upper area but there was a huge line. We decided that for that type of night that wasn't our scene so we bounced, along with a lot of other people who got to say they tried it.

Reviews.Author: Phoebe C.
Reviews.Content: Perch feeds into today's instantaneous, selfie-obsessed, and over-sharing twenty- to thirty-something culture. Perched on the thirteenth floor and smack dab in downtown LA's skyline, it makes for the perfect background of any Instagram photo. Add on a foreground of a culturally diverse group of friends with a hip array of cocktails and perhaps a bonfire 'round the group. "Let me take a selfie!!!"Good luck finding a place to sit though...you'll have to channel the ravenous, merciless vulture in you and not play nice. IMO, I enjoyed the nighttime ambiance more than the drinks itself, the hassle getting onto the thirteenth floor, up to the rooftop terrace, and line into the restroom. In short, Perch may be the new black...at least until a younger, hipper version comes along!

Reviews.Author: Sebastien B.
Reviews.Content: Trendy place to go, awesome view on the skyline of downtown L.A. Friendly service, and nice cocktails to have. Pretty young people inside (20-30yo)Bouncer was awesome, some serious laugh with this guy, u rocked my nite man

Reviews.Author: Mimi D.
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times and the decent overlook from their rooftop bar is their only saving grace. Though it's in a cool, historic building, we came to eat n enjoy the ambience.. I mean, that's mostly why must places mark up their prices, right?? Food was lackluster as was the snotty crowd. (Though, I'll admit I didn't try any of the more popular items on the menu since I'm not really into fries m stuff.) Perhaps it was just the few times I've been there but this place seems to bring out the snob in everyone.... Including me?? LolHowever, conveniently, there's a huge paid lot directly across the street from Perch and u can park there for a flat rate of 6$.IMHO, they've earned themselves the big three Os: overcrowded, overpriced n overrated. Plenty of other RTBs downtown.

Reviews.Author: Malisa D.
Reviews.Content: Meh. Came here for Sunday brunch without a reservation. They opened at 11am, my friend and I got there at 10:50. The lady/manager at the front told us that most of the tables were reserved and decided to sit us at a wall table. There were only roughly five tables being occupied and they were all outside. We were the only two inside and she still decided to sit us at the one table that had no view whatsoever. Then a nice curly haired handsome gentleman saw what she did and moved us to a window table... That's sweet of him, but already dropped our mood down a notch... And made the manager look bad. Later she came up to us and said "so how do you like your window table." As if we were privileged to be sitting there. Excuse me miss, your view and restaurant ain't all what it's cracked out to be first off, and secondly... We didn't asked to be moved, we were generously moved. Anywho. --------FOOD---------Crab cake Benedict---- aren't poached eggs suppose to be gooey with yolk... Um way over cooked our eggs- see picture! More like a poached over hard maybe a slight medium egg if you ask me. Truffle fries--- pretty amazing! If you want to go here for the view that's not even a WOW factor then ok, but personally I'd only come here to get the truffle fries with whatever aioli sauce it comes with, it's that good. I think because they drench the fries with cheesy-ness which always makes me happy!French toast---- I think it's cleaver to use croissants instead of sourdough or other breads, which makes it a little crunchy at the ends, but in the middle my toast was a tad soggy. I think because it's a croissant it's kind of hard to judge how long to cook it because obvi the ends are going to crisp up and well instead you get semi memorable French soggy toast. They do not have any specialty coffees, so you can get a coffee, espresso, and pretty much the minimal add ons. Thank God we came here so early because beware people are waiting for hours to get a table, luckily there's a bar with open seating and a full brunch menu as well. Will most likely never be back, except I would like to see the top level----it's a bar/lounge---they don't open that area up until 4pm though. 3 stars- one for our lovely busser who deserves to be a server with his attentiveness, one for the nice curly haired manager who was kind enough to move us, and one for the truffle fries and the mon petit cheri . Everything else---(well I enjoy live music too) wasn't star worthy.

Reviews.Author: Steve S.
Reviews.Content: C'est la vie. Brunch date with my wife before a Laker game. I chose Perch because it was close to Staples Center and they had Oyster, my wife's favorite. First time trying out the reservation feature of my Yelp app through open table. Really easy. I got an email confirmation and even a phone call to confirm. I like it. I got an 11:30 am reservation, but wanted an 11 am one (when they opened, since we were going to the Laker game at 12:30 pm).
