The lady calling to confirm said it was okay to come early and they would try to accommodate us. I appreciated that. Also first time here. The building is classic (another word for old lol). You take a classic elevator to the 13th Floor, then take a different elevator to the 15th floor. We arrived a few minutes after they opened and checked in with the hostess and we got seated. But not outside by the fire place like the couple behind us.  As the lady taking customers to their table was passing our table, she told them they were the lucky ones, they were getting the good table. Twist that knife why don't you. Me & my wife just look at each other and smiled. C'est la vie. Our view not so good. Here's the rundown:Cafe Latte & Capucino - not hot. How does that happen. It was barely warm. Disappointing. Baked Brie - "creamy whole grain mustard aioli & apple-fennel slaw" now we're talking. Great appetizer. So creamy and with the aioli was really good. The apple-fennel slaw, I didn't care for it, but my wife loved it. All yours my dear. Lol. It's small though, I could have eaten a whole one. Oysters - the best of our meal choices. It came with a  mignonette and a cocktail sauce. I preferred the cocktail sauce. Baby Beet Salad - "watercress, goat cheese, tarragon, apple hazelnut vinaigrette" it was just okay for me. Crab Benedict - "two poached eggs, two maryland blue crab cakes chive hollandaise sauce, potatoes" egg was perfect. The crab cakes were okay, maybe a bit more fried crust would have made this a better dish. My issue, after we got the oyster. A couple of minutes later while we were still savoring the oysters and not even half way done, our main courses came. Poor timing. Were we being rushed? The oysters were very good. The food as a whole was just okay 3 1/2 StarsThe experience, not so good. Minus 1 Star and rounding down, I don't think we'll be coming back.C'est la vie.

Reviews.Author: Andi S.
Reviews.Content: Ahhh finally a mature relaxed chill crowd aka ADULTS more like a 30's + something crowd! I'm not sure what it is but lately I've been spending some free time DTLA and very much enjoying my adventures.  Decided to check out Perch for a cocktail for the very first time on a Friday night.  So yea, when our UBER driver dropped us off we were a bit turned around but not to fret, all you need to do it look up, scope out the buildings and look for lots of lights gleaming from the 16th floor? Easy breezy, no lines , no cover charge, just a click of a button at the elevator.  You will take two elevators to get to the top bar/ lounge.  I had no idea what to expect and when we walked off that second elevator the DJ was spinning to the right, bar to the left and lots of peeps just chilling amongst their crowds enjoying cocktails. Super chill vibe all throughout! One would think we would have an issue finding a table on a friday night right?  Nope, walked along the patio outside and there was PLENTY of SEATING, a nice fireplace and popping heat lamps all over to keep us warm!  Nice views of Los Angeles , and  I think overlooking Pershing Square?I can't speak much about the food, we had an order of the brussels sprouts to snack on, eh 2.5 Stars.  They were doused in some kind of sodium packed sauce, lacked the crispy char we all love on our sprouts!  Pass.I had my usual, The Andi, greygoose martini with a twist and is was the PERFECT chilled temperature you would want in a martini! The lady ordered a Manhattan and holy hell that shit was strong and just bitter......honestly I think she ordered the wrong drink tehe, however our waitress was awesome and gladly returned her drink for a glass of red.  Service 4 starsAmbiance 5 stars, I could definitely see myself returning for drinks and maybe I'll give the food a second chance but after reading other reviews I think it's hit or miss.  Worth checking out!!

Reviews.Author: Rory O.
Reviews.Content: What a great place to take someone special.  The drink specials are out of this world, especially the spicy gin drink. The hors d'oeuvres can be a meal just by themselves.  The entree selection is quite nice and we opted for the Salmon which truly was remarkable.  Oh did I mentioned the drink menu...yea, really nice.Oh once your done with your dinner the upper story lounge provide a distinct 180 view of the immediate downtown city skyline - very cool.  It got my attention that's for sure.

Reviews.Author: Jessica B.
Reviews.Content: I LOOOOOVE this place!!! This is by far my favorite restaurant in Los Angeles. The food is delicious (I recommend the braised short ribs with polenta), the wine is tasty and you cannot beat the view! I went here for my anniversary to have dinner and wine at our table. Afterwards one of the employees recommended we visited the rooftop. I am very glad we did! We sat on the roof (and its smoke friendly for all you smokers out there)... filled with elegant views of the skyline, fire pits and french music to make the ambiance incredible. I take all my friends and family here when they come visit and they fell in love with it as much as I did. I will definitely be back a few times before I move out of Los Angeles. It makes for a perfect night if you want to treat yourself and have a lovely dinner along with a glass of wine to enjoy after on the roof. Thank you Perch! I can't wait to come see you again!Also: if you plan on just going to the rooftop for drinks, make sure you come a little early because it gets to full capacity quickly! Around 6-7 would be the best time for the weekends. You could probably pull off 8-9 on the week nights. Also, I have heard their brunch on Sundays was pretty fantastic... I will have to try that sometime :)

Reviews.Author: Sara P.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Perch for drinks and also dinner, however, the dinner was a bit underwhelming. First off, the view is great and the service has always been attentive. The food is just lacking a bit. We started with the baked brie which was good, but the wholegrain mustard aioli was not. I had the pan roasted chicken supreme for my entree, and the chicken was moist, but bland and the wild mushroom risotto could not hold a candlestick to my mom's. Okay, so maybe I'm a bit biased, but I was just expecting so much more. My friend had the steak frites, which he attested to being decent, but not the best he has had.Besides the food, coming in for drinks is quite nice, unless it's overly packed. If you could snag a seat on the patio and watch the band under the night sky and city lights, it's quite relaxing. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Alex C.
Reviews.Content: My first time here was amazing !! Me n my friend were having trouble with reservations due to our poor planning. And the reservation manager ginger seriously saved our lives ! She was so sweet n very understanding and gave us great advice since it was our first time there. She was so patient with us n did everything she in her power to make our dinner great. She personalized our set menus as well. She is a great representive of the company. I have had so many bad experiences with horrible customer service it is great that they have someone with great hospitality skills. The roof top is the bar n the floor under the roof is the resturant. The view is amazing !!! The place is a lil small so make reservations in advanced. Very classy place. Amazing drinks not to strong. Just right with a nice lil kick. The food is great when you have a big party it is good to get the set meals. We got the cheapest which was the 45$ set menu. Yiu would yhink the quality would be poor however the food was amazing !!!!! The toasted brie was wonderful! N oh my goodness the truffle fries were mouth watering. The steak was very delicious.  I got mine med rare it was perfectly cooked n the meat was very tender. I didn't really like the orange creme brulle however but the cookies that came with it was delightful! ! The host I forgot his names he was very nice, energetic, and very personable! He introduved himself n made sure our table was perfect. While we waited upstair in the bar for our table he came n got us n took us to our table. I like the music that playef there it was french music super cute. Not a place where you would go to party. But a wonderful place you can go snack. Drink. N talk with a breath taking view. And fantastic service.

Reviews.Author: Gohar H.
Reviews.Content: I came here with my bf to celebrate our 4 year anniversary. He already has written a review about this place and I couldn't hold myself back from writing one more. At the time i was 20 few weeks away from turning 21. We got up there and the bouncer had asked to check our IDs and I wondered why if we came here only to have dinner with a nice view. we proceeded to show him our IDs and he looked at mine and literally said: "Well, I can't let you in" then pointed at my bf and said "he's not a problem "... uhhh what? he said the only way he would let us in is if we gave him $20 low key...because he could get in trouble for letting anyone under 21 go upstairs after 9 pm (it was 9:10pm btw).. he told me that since this building serves alcohol, they do not allow people under the age of 21 after 9pm. I have been to A LOT of restaurants that serve alcohol, I've sat at bars and had snacks (without drinks) no one has everrrr told me that just because the place serves alcohol, then I can't go. Anyway after giving the bouncer or whatever he was the $20 because i was so disappointed & wanted to walk away from there, he let us go upstairs. To the Perch Management:I loved the place & the food was good. But due to your poor customer service by your bouncer/security guard and his unprofessionalism by asking for $20 to let us in we will not be coming back and if asked for our opinion about this place we will not recommend. I do not know if he had lied about the 21+ rule after 9pm but even so if it was true then he had no right to bribe us and let us in..now isn't that the rule?

Reviews.Author: Daria K.
Reviews.Content: Paul is the best waiter ever, so special customer service and food. Best place for brunch. Will recommend it to all my friends, just make sure to make a reservation in advance for a best table outdoors.

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: Should probably have looked for street parking before parking in the lot across the street but the vibe couldn't be wasted looking for parking...Admittedly inebriated man running the parking lot was chill...Elevator bouncer guy sang my friend happy birthday, a departure from escalator bouncer guy at The Standard...made the usual checking ID jokes and went up the second elevator to the actual bar/restaurant. *Note: Elevators take forever here and drunk strangers in elevator usually =bad time :(.The atmosphere is pretty cool up top, and the two bars is convenient. The crowd is on the older more male side based on what I saw, so my female friends got into trouble..View is pleasant but there isn't much to do besides stand in the main square or sit around there. Pretttty cool place to stop by.

Reviews.Author: Rose V.
Reviews.Content: It's my 42nd birthday and I thought I'd let Yelp pick a restaurant.  Yelp you made me very happy! PERCH has amazing food and great drinks. The view of downtown is spectacular. Our waitress was very attentive. PERCH brought me the best bread pudding with a candle to make my wish.

Reviews.Author: Alouicious O.
Reviews.Content: visited perch on a thursday night - we had an early reservation - 6:45p.  we were able to get in and seated quickly with no problems.  the view is spectacular - it's called perch for a reason - you're literally perched on the terrace looking out over downtown.  the food was very good - had the pork belly and octopus appetizers which were both spectacular.  our waiter was great - he took care of 5 of us with great efficiency... drinks never ran out.  it is not fast food - so expect to spend some time here.  what may be slow food service to some is just part of the experience for others.  enjoy the time to take it all in - especially if you can be there for sunset.  they had a great rooftop band playing as well - great singer and tight rhythm section - perfectly mixed for the environment.  not too loud, not too soft.  i can see if you tried to get there later than 7 where there would be a wait, but plan ahead and make an evening out of it.  great experience - food was really good.  you're paying for the experience and it's a really nice setting up there at sundown.

Reviews.Author: Mel A.
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this place one star because the only thing that really makes this place a hit is it's view. I came here about a year and a half ago and wasn't impressed with much of what they had to offer. After making reservations for a specific spot in the restaurant, I was seated at a table that was less than a foot apart from tables on my left and right. Felt almost as if I was having a dinner party with strangers. When I mentioned that wasn't the table from my reservations they said my name wasn't listed and if I wanted the spot I ASKED TO BE RESERVED, that it would be a hour wait. I was in a good mood and I was not about to wait one hour so I decided to take the cramped and small table we were offered. I ordered their steak and fries and wasn't flattered with my food at all. I asked for medium well and got a practically raw steak on my plate. I did send it back and when it was returned it was still very bloody on the inside. I chose to ignore it and eat the parts that were edible. When I asked for my check, I gave about $25 more than my bill to the server and I waited for my change. The waitress came to say thank you and have a good night without even bringing my change back. Now I was going to tip her about that same amount even though I had a lousy experience, but how dare you keep the change without asking first or even letting me give it to you myself! The money is not the issue, it's about the principle. I don't think I'll be visiting Perch anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Sidney Z.
Reviews.Content: Solid bar for the view and a couple drinks. I wouldn't go there for dinner as it is a tad pricey and not very good. I've been there for the skirt steak and burger and wasn't a fan plus ended up spending much more than it was worth. If you do end up venturing out there for dinner, then you should definitely make reservations in advance as even on a Wednesday night it gets busy. The creme brûlée on the other hand is always really good so I recommend going for a drink and dessert to enjoy the fantastic view of downtown. It has a nice romantic feel with the string lights, couches and fire pits. Drinks seem to generally be between $10 and $15 from what I've experienced after going a few times. Sometimes the people working there come across kind of pretentious but I've also had some nicer people. I usually get double-carded there because I look really young which is always funny. Favorite drink: penicillin - sweet, sour and tasty! All and all definitely worth a visit or two!

Reviews.Author: Eunis H.
Reviews.Content: I used to go here often. Weekday HH, wkends and Sunday brunch. Really nice rooftop venue over looking the Pershing Square & the downtown. The view- It's gorgeous.1. I love the staffs there (the original clan)Super friendly & genuine people. Really hard to find that at trendy venues these days. Head security, bartenders to the door master are all really cool. 2. Trendy spot for age 30+ crowd. Always crowded3. Old fashion drink-FTW4. Line can be ridiculous, which means people are willing to wait to get in. 5. Brunch was really good. Sunday mimosas, lobster salad & seasonal oysters, with their specialty baked breads. Delicious!6. New management. They keep changing managers! I miss the old Perch vibe. Its different now =(7. Music can be better!! I do like how they mix up the music, from Jazz to Kaskade-alike-music, but sometimes, its bad. Good mix of different types of music is important. Some Fridays and Saturdays they have a DJ. Still, meh. 8. Street parking or Valet

Reviews.Author: The M.
Reviews.Content: I classify this as an upscale place that allows you to soak in the ambiance of LA eloquently. I would rate the food at 3.5 stars, however the rooftop setting and antique style furniture makes for a breathtaking experience, giving it an overall 5. You are coming here not for food or drink (though their fine wines are divine), but rather the overall experience that you would not get at most other establishments. 5 - Among my top choices for it's type, and would travel out of my way for revisiting.4 - Would definitely revisit (if convenient)3 - No reservations against revisiting (e.g. if my company wished to go), but more likely to explore elsewhere2 - Poor experience, would strongly oppose revisit, unless absolutely no alternatives available.1 - Boycott at all costs. Would rather skip my meal, or be without product/service altogether

Reviews.Author: Kevin N.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Monday night. The place was pretty packed, it might have been because the day after was NYE. The rooftop patio offered an awesome view of DTLA coupled with live music. I was disappointed that the upper level was closed off that night. There were a ton of tables open on the patio but apparently these were reserved for dinner (even though it was around 11 already...)I don't even remember what I ordered, some cocktail with citrus and ginger I think. I ended up just finishing it as I was thirsty and sober from waiting at least half an hour to get drinks. I think the bartender was just particularly slow that night...he mentioned something about just getting off a 16 hour flight.We didn't stay long as we decided to switch venues to continue on a night of barhopping. I wouldn't mind coming back again as it's worth it just to take in the view. Hopefully, service will be better the next time around.

Reviews.Author: Rhome F.
Reviews.Content: So I decided to stop by at Perch for my usual Sunday brunch routine based on the reviews from fellow Yelpers. Upon arrival, it was quite impressive. The decor is spot on, lavish, comfy chairs everywhere, bulky wooden tables, gorgeous lighting, and a spectacular view. As far as atmosphere goes, its absolutely impeccable. For the crowd on Sunday, it was mostly good looking 20 somethings. Our server was energetic and nice, even though we could tell he was VERY busy. We ordered a pitcher of sangria to start with, and we were very happy with our choice. It tasted fruity and fresh, and had a nice kick. For my meal, I had the Smoked Salmon Benedict. Honestly, I was a bit underwhelmed with my dish. My eggs weren't poached properly, they were over done, and both the potatoes and my hollandaise lacked flavor. I was a bit disappointed, considering its an $18 brunch dish, it should've wowed me. Thats the only reason I didn't give a full five stars. All in all though, I'll definitely be back to Perch, even if it is just for drinks, because the overall atmosphere is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Dragos A.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. two roof tops, three bars, great people, retro decor. Trust me, you should come here. Or don't so i can get it all for myself.

Reviews.Author: Wendy H.
Reviews.Content: I am diggin' this historic downtown meets modern chic vibe of this place.I've been here a handful of times and of all these times it was on a weekday so it wasn't at all crowded. I love it. The rooftop view is AMAZING. Once you enter the building, you take an elevator up to the 13th floor. Then you enter another elevator to take you up to the 15th floor. Then you have a choice of staying right where you are to dine/drink or take a flight of stairs up to the rooftop. Drinks here are decently priced and the crowd is a more of a sophisticated one. My Fair Lady is my favorite drink here. Yuuums. Oh, and the bartenders seem to have heavy hands. =)

Reviews.Author: Vadim d.
Reviews.Content: Great for drinks and the views. Great decor. Disappointing food. Very mediocre in that department

Reviews.Author: Amanda D.
Reviews.Content: Sunday Jazz was sassy and fun. Good view from the rooftop especially during the night. It's higher than the standard hotel and less of a line.  Didn't get a chance to try to  try the food maybe will some day. As one of the few rooftop bar in LA, this place is worth a visit.

Reviews.Author: Lucy K.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch with my girls and we absolutely loved it! He view is stunning, we were lucky and the weather was amazing. Actually TOO Sunny, they had to open some of the awnings to cool us off.  There was some new orleans type of band playing music that just set the whole mood right.The only mark off I have to give is when we got the bill there was a burger on there that we never ordered. Had to bring it to the waitress attention so she could correct it.But with that said, everything else was great! We polished off a couple of bottles of champagne and had the peach puree to go with it. They don't give you much of the puree but just enough to really enjoy it.We started off with the cheese fries. IT came with ketchup and an herb aoili that was phenomenal. They weren't as cheesy as I expected but definitely good. i got the #13 Benedict, my friends got the smoked salmon Benedict and huevos rancheros. Everyone was really happy with their dishes. Our benedicts had the perfectly cooked and runny egg with hollaindaise. I definitely want to try this place out at night, because if brunch was that enjoyable I can only imagine dinner

Reviews.Author: Samantha C.
Reviews.Content: tired food and slow service in a beautiful space with good live music.service was painfully slow.  seemed understaffed.food was so bland and sad for brunch.baked brie was overbaked and tasted like a frozen trader joe's appetizer.when asked, the server told us the basket of baked goods was not that great.  totally appreciate an honest opinion, but why can't they serve some amazing baked goods?burger was dry and tasteless even with their sauce.would have ordered more food but it took so long even to get this order going, we didn't bother.  nice live music though!

Reviews.Author: Xiaolin W.
Reviews.Content: I live right across the street from perch, so this is my go to place when I want a drink or a bar date. The rooftop bar has a gorgeous view. All the people that have been here with me all love it. I feel bad when I see other ppl have to worry about parking ;)

Reviews.Author: Angel D.
Reviews.Content: Everything is perfect. From the food to the service to the amazing views. It's perfect and what dreams are made of. The food is able to stand alone but when coupled with the ambiance, it just makes the entire experience amazing.

Reviews.Author: Desmond A.
Reviews.Content: Guys, come on your selling over-priced bubbly and providing a beautiful city scape skyline in DTLA and you don't have blocks of solid ice for your Old'Fashion type drinks, that's just stupidly ridiculous. Get your ducks in line, your getting revenue for days just by opening your doors and being in a pretty atmosphere in DTLA. The 4100 off Sunset, close to Sunset Junction, has blocks of ice for the drinks that need them, and their basically a dive bar/biker bar.Get it together, please.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra B.
Reviews.Content: I didn't eat, but the view is amazing.Great for drinks and good conversation.Vibe: Classy & Relaxed.

Reviews.Author: Sush R.
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Amazing view. Delicious food. Great service.

Reviews.Author: Vendy L.
Reviews.Content: The hip bar has all its attraction in its location and view, as with most la bars its ambition to be hip and cool comes above its need to feed and water it's guests. I wish it had what few cool places posess which is the ability to enjoy all its customers and not selectively based on the cool / hip / famd factor, just sayin!

Reviews.Author: Rookie J.
Reviews.Content: Love the city view and the ambience.  You can see everything in LA!  The weather got warmer so it's perfect to hang out at the rooftop.  The food and drinks are good too.  Friendly staff and great service. Perch is a perfect place for a date! (And also hanging out with friends).  We came here for dinner and we both really enjoyed the place. The only thing that I don't like here is parking.  But overall we had a great time here and we will definitely come back!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer M.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food, great cocktails, and great ambiance. The staff wear bow ties. I mean, right? Everyone is very hip. Obviously.

Reviews.Author: Roheen S.
Reviews.Content: Upon walking in, I wasn't happy with the hostess that wears the glasses.  She was extremely rude and almost ruined our experience.  I am a restauranteur/entrepreneur from NYC and come to LA quite often.  I would come back only because of the hostess/waitress Tiffany with the red hair/tattoos along with the view!  Tiffany was extremely courteous and a great conversation.  My fiancé and I would only come back to be served by her and enjoy the views.  Thank you Tiffany!

Reviews.Author: BB T.
Reviews.Content: Dear Perch,Listen, the view is pretty cool.  I GET IT.  But, having a reservation for 8pm and then getting seated at 9:15 will kinda derail any view for me.  I could literally be looking at the surface of Mars.  Call me old fashion, but reservations are made so that you're not waiting around.  Seriously, look into it you guys.  I think it's Chapter 1 of the "How to Run A Restaurant" book.We had drinks at the rooftop bar beforehand.   Which is a few floors up via an elevator. They're supposed to text your phone when they're ready to seat you....But, as it got later and later we grew concerned.  Did they get our phone number right?  Should we check on it and lose our seats at the bar?  What if they're ready for us and...?  The prix meal was pricey and wasn't bad...But, at this point the food needed to be NEXT LEVEL to win me over.  And it wasn't.  On top of that, the service was slooooooow.  One couple to the left of me were getting so annoyed that they flagged someone down to "please hurry up with the dessert."  The house band was pleasant (maybe the best thing there?), the view (again) was great...But, for the price and the actual food served...I mean, there are so many great places to eat in LA you guys...By the time we left, there was a HUGE line forming inside of the place...And ANOTHER line outside...A couple told us that "tonight was actually light, it's usually busier."   I really can't imagine that.  Peace out, Perch.
Reviews.Author_Location: Griffith Park/Los Feliz, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Shinda S.
Reviews.Content: Best filet mignon I had in LA when I visited. Great music and service.

Reviews.Author: Alex K.
Reviews.Content: I loved Perch! Such an amazing rooftop bar. It's got a cool ambience and an awesome menu. We were brought here while visiting some friends in Century City. We were really impressed with the atmosphere. Think Parisian veranda. Tried the cucumber-basil martini **i think**It was bomb. Loved that they had late night food available that WASNT your typical bar fare. We ate Truffle Mac and cheese, chicken and shrimp skewers, and the ahi tuna poke. Everything tasted flavorful. It was a bit pricey but what else do you expect at a hoppin' rooftop bar?! Loved it. Definitely coming back. Minus one star for the claustrophobic elevator experience.

Reviews.Author: Eileen K.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view of DTLA, and really refreshing to be on a rooftop on a slightly chilly LA evening. I went on a thursday night around 10pm, and was able to walk in with no line or wait! (I'm sure weekends are crazy though) So the rooftop felt a little empty-ish, and the crowd older. i don't really go out in DTLA, is that how DTLA is, or is it bc it was a thurs night? anyway, i think this would be a great place to have a night out with your group of friends, esp on a thurs night with no wait and ample rooftop space. if you're going out to meet people, i dunno if this is the right place (on a thurs night at least) anyway, it was a beautiful venue and will go back with a big group when i get a chance. can't say much about the drinks bc all i had was a shot of tequila..(don't ask...)

Reviews.Author: Clara P.
Reviews.Content: unually pretty view in the middle of not so pretty downtown district. we went to the restaurant but went upstairs now and then for pics and such, and it was good. $5 parking lot next to the building, so little hassle for the location. got seated promptly with reservation, and our server, paul, had sense and kept us feeling well accomodated. good stock of scotch - our group had rounds of variety. they are pricey ($14~$25?)per shot but the pours were generous. we ate down the list of small plates on the menu and all of them were very good. im guessing it came out to about $600 for the 4 of us.

Reviews.Author: Flowr B.
Reviews.Content: I'm about my brunch and I'm about rooftops. Whenever I feel like getting fancy and splurging a bit more I come here. West coast Cali weather is a blessing and to indulge and soak up the sun with some fun, the perch holds a very special place in my heart.Setting is everything. The view is beautiful and captures the best of downtown. The live jazz band is the cherry on top! The menu for brunch is delicious and you can't really go wrong with anything especially if you pair it up with a few rounds of mimosas. Cheers and bottoms up!Reservations highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Brianna T.
Reviews.Content: This is a review for the rooftop bar.Weekends are pretty busy. It was a good 20 minute wait alongside the wall to the staircase in the restaurant. I felt kind of claustrophobic because it was so packed that night. Waiters had to squeeze between us and chairs and passing people. I agree with a reviewer about how it felt like they were herding cattle.When we got upstairs, I was able to relax and enjoy the night air. The location and view is nice. One of my favorite things about rooftop bars is the fact that you don't sweat your face off and, if it gets chilly, can count on the alcohol in your belly to warm you up.That's pretty much all I can give this place. Getting drinks was a nightmare because it took forever. The bartenders were really slow and unfriendly. There was a huge crowd of thirsty people huddling around the bar, which made the whole process much slower. I felt like every time we left for a drink and came back, we were wasting our time waiting in line by not spending it with the people that we came there with. Really annoying.The bathrooms are nice, though.That being said, Perch is ok. Definitely not a place I would frequent, but if I'm ever feeling appreciative and itching for a view of the city, I guess I wouldn't mind coming through.

Reviews.Author: Aaron H.
Reviews.Content: Best place for a Saturday brunch in all of LA.  Forget Geoffrey's in Malibu.The Saturday and Sunday bands both do really smooth covers of your favorite classic 90's/00's songs.If you come here for a drink at night, try to avoid stepping on the homeless just outside.  I'd take a start off.. but, well.. homeless gotta sleep, too!The price per person is actually in the $$ range and not the $$$ range. This place is very reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Mia N.
Reviews.Content: Love it. Good music, drinks, service, location and view. Near pershing square, too cool.

Reviews.Author: Kimmy T.
Reviews.Content: The view was great 15 floors up.  It wasn't too crowded.  Laidback vibe, not as pretentious as other reviewers said.  There was a line but it moved really fast and there's no cover.  Really easy to get in.  I loved the décor.  Food looked and smelled delicious.  Bar was busy but drinks came fast.

Reviews.Author: Dana D.
Reviews.Content: Loved it! New go-to for me.The management was very kind to me and my party. There was a huge line to get to the rooftop at 10:30. Maybe come early, or go later? The line looked like it would never die down. However, when we got to the rooftop, it was beautiful! Great view :)

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: Eating here makes me want to use nouveau words like "poppin'" and "fresh."  The crowd is glamorous (or at least trying to be).  Don't expect much from the food - people don't come here to eat, let's just say that.  The drinks are great, and they had a nice blend of inventive options and standards.  It's very crowded, and even if you eat in the resto you still have to wait in line to get to the rooftop bar.  But this is a lovely place for a quote night out end-quote, and you'll have the bill to prove it.

Reviews.Author: Italia P.
Reviews.Content: The most fabulous time...I planned a 25+ person party at Perch (actually Bar 13) and had the MOST INCREDIBLE SERVICE.  Working in production, the team expects almost too much sometimes and was happy every step of the way.  From the service to the DELISH food... WHAT A SPOT.  Anne Giapapas is the most fab hospitality manager.  Wonderful!

Reviews.Author: Laurie A.
Reviews.Content: First impressions of Perch are that it seems chic but comfortable, and the view is stunning.  Outside seating wasnt too cold because they have ample heating, and the staff are friendly and attentive. We had an amazong beet salad to start off with, but  the best dish of the night was the gnocchi with squash, it was earthy and creamy and delish!!  For dessert we had the bread pudding which is something i have to try on any menu I see one.  I would highly recommend this place for date night or girls night out since the roof top bar is awesome and just an easy trip upstairs.

Reviews.Author: S.C C.
Reviews.Content: Booked reservations for Saturday Brunch with the sister at 11am because I heard it gets packed. Easily enough, they weren't booked up yet. Yay! for beating the crowd.We ordered the french toast with bacon and Bellinis -- everything was pretty tasty but portions are a bit small. Honestly, I came here for the view and it was literally amazing! great views of downtown LA. There was a live band during our brunch session which was nice. Our waiter was superb, came to check on us regularly.I would recommend coming here again because the view is spectacular and staff is friendly. But the food could be improved, portion side and maybe change up the brunch menu.

Reviews.Author: Florence S.
Reviews.Content: It was an "ok" place. Pros: -  Roof top view is beautiful and a good place to mingle; we had a good time celebrating our friend's birthday which had more to do with the people we went there with more than the place we were at.-  We were only on the main floor for a short time but it seemed to be much better place to hang out because you have the sofa's, food, and balcony with the ability to hear the music than the rooftop.  Maybe we'll try this place again but on the main floor and for dinner too. Cons:  - Waiting in a line to get up to the roof top was crazy and, although it is a beautiful view, not worth waiting an hour or more-  Lemon drop martini was not very good; others mentioned their drinks weren't very good either-  You can barely hear the music playing on the rooftop which maybe was meant to be that way so you can hear each other, not sure.

Reviews.Author: Margery C.
Reviews.Content: I've had this place booked marked for quite sometime, and truly I feel like one of the the last people to check this place out. As far as the place is concerned it was pretty cool environment. Well decorated indoor and outdoor patios, live DJ, fire place , really cool heat lamps, a great view of Los Angeles and chill crowd of adults - yup adults,this is not the place for the early 20 something's. After reading the reviews, I may have to come back for brunch. But I ordered a couple of things from their late night and cocktail menu. I had the manhattan (pass), which I later returned for a pisco ( yay!), we also ordered the undercooked Brussels sprouts doused in a sweet sauce out of a can.  Service was ok, the waitress tried to convince me to enjoy my drink, but nah ... The cocktail was crap so I went with something else and I am glad I did.Food  2 starsCocktails 2 starsService 3 starsAmbiance and vibe 4 stars

Reviews.Author: Tiffani S.
Reviews.Content: You're going for the view- nothing else.The food is pretty gross. I had the skirt steak and French toast for dessert. The French toast was good, fatty but good.Steak, Wayyyy too much fat and grease with a slab of butter on top- not the business.The staff was pretentious for no reason- it's not Beverly Hills ladies and gentlemen, take it down a few notches. Besides, the service was horrible and having a reservation apparently means nothing. The couch benches outside on the patio were mostly empty and for some reason me and my boyfriend couldn't sit there?? Hmmm awkward. Anyway, go for the view and a drink. Nothing else is worth it. &Possibly the French toast if you feel like gaining a few lbs. ;)

Reviews.Author: Khat S.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views!! If you're looking for a chill spot with great views and ambiance then this is your spot. The wait to get in however was ridiculous . They also need more bartenders because it took a good 15-20 mins to get a drink order in. Once the drinks were made, they were superb! Great spot, just takes too long to get a drink .

Reviews.Author: Candace L.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in Perch Saturday afternoon for a drink.We had come from Grand Central Market and were walking off our BBQ lunch in the neighborhood when we stumbled upon the building.We'd had reservations for brunch before, that we missed but this gave us the perfect opportunity to check out the place.Live music was nice, temps were nearly 80 degrees so it was quite warm outdoors - we snagged two seats at the bar and enjoyed a glass of sangria and mango mimosa.Drinks were not over priced as one may expect at a place like Perch.I wasn't overly impressed watching the brunch options exit the kitchen, so I'm not sure I'd chose to return for food but its a fun place to grab a rooftop drink.

Reviews.Author: Lauren V.
Reviews.Content: I recently celebrated my best friend's birthday at Perch.  We had dinner and finished the evening with drinks on the roof-top.  I work in the hospitality industry, so I was very disappointed with the service.  The host team was amazing, however our server and the bartender upstairs were below average.  The food was okay.  I spent $20 on a plate of gnocchi that was average.  Our waitress was below par.  It took 15 minutes to order a beer / glass of wine.  I received my food before my drink.  I was missing a place setting and a glass for water.  No one bothered to ask if I needed anything. As we made our way to the roof top, the view was stunning.  However, the bartender was dismissive.  She had friends visiting and was more interested in talking to them than helping me.  I look young, but that does not mean that I don't have money and won't tip well.  I always tip 20% +. The view is worth a drink, but I would not recommend dinner.  I don't mean to be negative, I'm just hoping that the serving staff can improve their service. I would love to return and have a better experience in the future.

Reviews.Author: Rob S.
Reviews.Content: Wow amazing atmosphere.  Music playing while you take in the beautiful downtown skyline.  To top it off Kristine the "red head" bartender was delightful.  She also makes a great Old Fashioned.

Reviews.Author: Yvonne K.
Reviews.Content: Food was good but service was great. Might have helped since we were one of the first few parties to arrive for Saturday brunch. Shared the baked brie and truffle cheese fries before our main courses. Baked brie was yummy but small. Probably something better suited to share among two rather than our party of three but we made it work. The small round of brie was cradled in the perfect amount of pastry. It was pretty tasty with the mustard and slaw they served on the side. Truffle cheese fries were cheesy and came with both ketchup and basil aioli i think. It came in a pretty big bowl/plate.. We were pretty stuffed with fries when our entrees came. French toast was good and pretty light but after all the cheese and fries I wasn't able to manage eating it all. Waters were promptly refilled, food packed up very nicely and it was never difficult to get their attention. Also liked that they offered a sample of the sangria before we committed to a pitcher. View was nice since I had never been in the middle of downtown LA before but I hear it is better at night.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia Y.
Reviews.Content: Review for dinner service only:My boyfriend and I had dinner here for a late Valentine's dinner.We shared the ahi tuna tartar for the appetizer. It was delicious! I'm a huge fan of tartars but this one is high on my list.For our entrees, my boyfriend had the sea bass special. Couldn't quite catch everything the waiter said was on the plate, but the fish was placed over some kind of pasta. It had a light and clean taste.I had the steak and frites. It was really good. I believe the frites were truffle fries. The portion of the fries were too big to finish.Overall, the dinner was great. Not the most amazing food I've had, but still great.It can get really noisy because of the seating arrangements. We were seated right next to a bigger table with a louder party, so we had to constantly lean in to talk. Haha.Our server was very friendly, but extremely busy, trying to cater to multiple parties in such a crowded place.Since they're known for their bar and rooftop view, I will definitely have to come back again. I would advise making reservations for dinner so that when you finish, you can begin lining up for the bar from within the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Juliet L.
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this place 5-stars for the amazing view, ambiance, and great customer service. Live music! I always take out of towers and friends here. Their Happy Hour is a must otherwise you end up paying too much. Ask for the drink with Jalapeño for an extra kick. Will definitely come back soon.

Reviews.Author: Kevin Bobby N.
Reviews.Content: I went here for the first time for a birthday celebration last week. You have to go through 2 elevators get there. Definitely built the anticipation up even more for me. When I arrived, my first immediate thought was, "Wow, classy." Seems more like a date night type place.  It's very dim lit, and the dress code is dressy. There's a live band on the first deck in the patio area too. The ambiance just really sets the mood. If you bring a girl here and don't score, you fail at life... The rooftop is where its at though! Extremely beautiful view overlooking Downtown LA. My friend and I were discussing how nice it is to see LA from this perspective (Calm, quiet, and peaceful).Drinks at the bar surprisingly weren't too expensive either. I was expecting to shell out a lot more with this place leaning more towards the upscale side. If my memory serves me correctly, I bought 3 amber lagers for only $9. Most definitely will be coming back to this place.

Reviews.Author: Vivienne N.
Reviews.Content: Came here with my roommates for a girls' night out, at around 9-10pm. Elevator was kind of scary to ride in--sort of like the Tower of Terror ride at Disneyland. But we made it up in one piece haha. Place was really hoppin', so if you want to sit and enjoy your drinks, it'd be wise to make a reservation. The ambience here is amazing. There are tables inside, if you want a more dim-lit atmosphere. But it's the outside that really sells the place, where there are tables with heated lamps and live music, that are accented by a rooftop view of the downtown LA cityscape. It's the city at its finest. A Hollywood moment.FOOD AND DRINK (4/5):For a lounge/bar, I was rather impressed. I ordered myself some California Ale, which was a bit on the stronger side, but had a nice wheaty flavor to it.- MAC'N'CHEESE (4.5/5): Rich, but not too heavy. Made with white cheese and had bacon in it.- BRUSSEL SPROUTS (3/5): My table enjoyed it, but I wasn't a fan. I thought they weren't seared enough, and the glaze was a bit too sour.- GNOCCHI (5/5): The gnocchi were cooked to perfection--chewy, but still had a nice potato-y (sorry, I can't find a better word) texture to them. The pesto cream sauce was light, and didn't overpower the dish with garlic or any other notes. One of the best I've had anywhere.OVERALL (4.5/5):The inconvenience to get to Downtown LA is a bit much for me, and the prices are steep. But for the ambience, experience and quality of the fare that you get, I'd say it's worth the occasional splurge. Perfect for impressing that important date. Just be wary of the elevators. Yeesh.

Reviews.Author: Marissa L.
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Perch and right away the staff was super friendly and the view was phenomenal. It took a little while to order and get our food. When the food arrived I had received bacon instead of sausage. Before I had the chance to ask for the correct order the supervisor, Kristina, came over to apologize for the wait and my sausage was out in less than 5 min. She then offered to buy us a round of drinks and my heart was stolen! Kristina and all of the Perch staff have made a regular of me. I'll will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Kofi T.
Reviews.Content: The Perch is fantastic. The ambiance is perfect for a date or just a gathering of friends. The brussel sprouts, pork cheek, scallops, and bouillabaisse were all delicious. I have been here a few times and it never disappoints. It does tend to be very busy on the weekends, but Sundays seem like a great time for a dinner date. Bring a coat if its below 80 degrees, the wind picks up on the roof and it can get chilly quick.

Reviews.Author: Vatche K.
Reviews.Content: Amazing spot, friendly staff, great drinks, hard to find anything wrong with this place. Yes it's pricey, but for a rooftop lounge in the middle of DTLA, it's not that bad for a date night.Food was amazing too! Steak frites was delicious, especially the fries that came with it, seriously. As for the drinks, I've tried the Pranqster Belgian beer and the Penicillin cocktail. Great stuff!

Reviews.Author: Donna G.
Reviews.Content: We had a large group come by for Happy Hour. We grabbed a spot in the corner and made room for ourselves. The waitress and management were very nice to us.  I got the macaroni and cheese, which was so good. My friends got burgers, which they also liked.The view is gorgeous. I want to go back on a hot summer night. We got theire while it was daylight, and stayed until it was well into the night and the buildings were all lit up. Beautiful view.I took off one star because as the evening progressed, it seemed our waitress got more confused. I think they were understaffed. It got to the point where they would just bring out a hamburger and ask "Did someone order this?" They were so busy that they couldn't keep track of the orders.At the end of the night when we wanted our bills, I started to feel like we were being held hostage because we wanted to pay. It was taking forever. The waitress was just way too busy. Finally, she came over and collected our payments.I will definitely be going back. The food is great. The view is amazing. Very friendly staff and management. They just get really busy as the night goes on.

Reviews.Author: Melissa S.
Reviews.Content: OK, I think the rating is for the ambiance and the setting really - it's a nice and interesting view amongst the high rises, and 16 floors up, you wouldn't realize that you're near a somewhat ghetto part of downtown.I really only stopped in for happy hour after work at 5:30 pm... what the heck, I only have 30 minutes to get all my drink orders in? Happy hour runs from 4 pm to 6 pm, and I wish it ran later... but not like they need to, because it seems like they already have a sufficient client base already.A little pricey ($5 for a draft at HH - I feel like that should be like normal price), but I guess you're paying for the scenery. I had a HH slider for $2.50 and it was small but good... and juicy - napkin necessary.Definitely weird coming here for the first time and understanding how to get here. It took an elevator ride to the13th floor, and then an elevator ride to the restaurant on the 15th floor... and then we took the stairs to the 16th floor once the roof opened at 6 pm.Get up to the 16th floor right when it opens at 6 pm if you want a seat for you and your party, or else you'll have to hover and be quick in case other people leave.

Reviews.Author: Anna N.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, were invited to a birthday party on the rooftop so we decided to grab dinner beforehand. We sat on the patio on a warm summer night and it was great. The food was delicious. I had the pan roasted chicken supreme and my boyfriend had the scallops. Service was OK though. Our waitress did disappear for a good half hour which was highly disappointing for an upscale place like this. Afterwards we went upstairs had a few drinks and celebrated with the birthday girl.

Reviews.Author: Irma P.
Reviews.Content: So my girlfriends and I did not get to enjoy the downtown view from the patio last weekend. Rained like crazy! Nevertheless, we had such a great time!I made RSVP for 7 @ 7pm on a rainy Friday. The table was ready for us when we got there (granted I was fashionably late). No attitude whatsoever from the staff. I didn't order drinks so I cannot comment on that. However, one of my friends ordered the spicy something something that has gin in it and the whole group ordered 2-3 more after.We shared 3 appetizers and 4 dessert. We each ordered main dish. My rabbit ravioli was perfect! The sauce was not too salty or too sweet. I was way too hungry to take a picture, sorry .... Plus tax and tip, we each forked out about $50, which was not too bad at all (drinks were paid separately).

Reviews.Author: Meredith C.
Reviews.Content: I adore this place. I don't live in Los Angeles anymore, but when I travel for work and am anywhere near downtown LA I do try to make it out. I love the ambiance, the crowd, the music, the food, everything. I especially love the truffle fries and its incredible cheesy goodness. I have had some great bourbon drinks and they do a fantastic job with Old Fashioneds. I've gone when there was a DJ and when they've had live music. The last time I went they had a live band and the singer was phenomenal, singing both old school and Top 40 covers. I had a reservation of 6 and they were more accommodating than I expected when people were trickling in late. We were able to get seats at the couches and we had a great time. I think it's always better to visit if you have a reservation, place gets busy right after folks get off of work so it can be difficult to find space at the bar or the couches. If you can get seats outside, especially now that the weather is getting better, you should. I don't think they take reservations greater than 6 people though so may not be the best spot for large parties. Everything I've ever eaten or drank has been phenomenal. This will always be one of my fav spots in Southern California!

Reviews.Author: Sara A.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view of the downtown, we came for drinks. This is one of the spots I will remember forever because my boyfriend and I came here for our second date. He had a family birthday party that night so he picked me up while I was living downtown in one of the lofts by staples center and brought me here. It's a pretty big place. I remember there being a lot of young fun people. One of our best first pics was taken here.

Reviews.Author: derrick B.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a friends bday last week.  We had a large party meeting us there but we wanted to have dinner first.  Was told by the hostess that they overbooked and no tables were available.  Rather than leave and come back we asked the hostess to possibly put us on a waitlist if someone cancels.  She said she would try.  We waited about 30 minutes and space at the bar opened so we ordered drinks and appetizers.   30 more minutes passed and I went back to the hostess who was awesome by the way and she said she was still  trying to get us a table.  30 minutes later I go back to the hostess but this time I am introduced to the manager,  Dwight.  He explains that they are overbooked and normally don't put anyone on a waitlist but would make an exception for us (its about 530 pm at this point)    DWIGHT CAME THRU!  keeping his promise he was able to seat us and we ordered dinner which was all very,  very good and then our other friends joined us.  We stayed there until 1:30 AM!!!!!Great view, great food and great drinks from what my friends said.  The star of the show  was dwight and his staff.  Thanks for making our first time a pleasant one. We will be back again in the future and this time  we will make a reservation. Lol

Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner last night ! MAKE RESERVATIONS!!! When we left the line to get in was crazy long ! I couldn't believe how many people were in line to get in this place. About dinner ... Seat right next to the fireplace which was nice.We ordered the beet salad-10 OMG the goat cheese on this salad was AMAZING! The salmon-6 was not horrible wasn't wasn't super good ... My girlfriend order the chicken with rice which was also just ok. The place itself is very nice. Brunch to me is way better but then again it's always nice to see downtown at night . Our server was great... Very friendly and would always come to check up in us to make sure we were doing ok. I would for sure come back!Thank you Perch/Melissa

Reviews.Author: Jenny S.
Reviews.Content: ROOFTOP BAR in DTLA with "apertif hour" (happy hour) Mon-Fri from 4-6pm, COME AT 4PM for the best seating on the patio.. it fills up fastlove the atmosphere & that apertif hour is during sunset BUT there's unfortunately a building within direct line of sight of the sunPerch is on the 15th floor but you first go up to the 13th floor from the main elevator, then transfer to another elevator where you push the BOTTOM button to call another lift to the rooftop which is equipped with heat lamps if it gets coldONE GRIPE: we were told that we could not keep our patio seats after 6 pm---truffle fries: not bad, comes w/ 2 dipping sauces---penicillin cocktail: $7 for this cocktail, which was pretty good considering i don't like dark liquorNOTE: there's a flat rate parking lot on 4th st and Hill for $5 which is cheaper than the $14 my friends paid for the lot across the street

Reviews.Author: Mandi T.
Reviews.Content: mmm yummy drinks here. I really come here to drink. Food? Meh. you don't need food. hahah. It's a gorgeous view of DTLA, and if the library and the park area is showing movies during the summer, you can watch from here as well. Faves - pink lady (a vodka frou frou girlie martini drink, packs a punch tho). penicillin (famous grouse, lemon juice, agave nectar, ginger liquor), and the gimlet? er. gin drink.They have an aperitif hour aka happy hour Monday to Fridays 4pm - 6pm. There's food on that list too, but hey, who's eating?!?!? hahah Just a mini list of their offerings - Wine is 6. Beer is 5 (I can't remember what their offerings are) Certain cocktails are 7.Cocktails can be a bit pricey after happy hour, but you go for the ambience. I've had issues with reservations here where they have "lost" it and then can't accommodate the party. As an alternative we went to the upstairs bar area. Or there is downstairs at Bar thirteen. So meh, and docking a star. Lines can get long here after 9pm, where you have to wait outside before getting onto the elevators. There's valet parking available, lots across the street, or if you don't mind hoofing - street parking around the area (usually free after 8pm - but ALWAYS read the signs!)

Reviews.Author: Jonny S.
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the 16th Floor rooftop lounge at Perch.  Unparalleled romantic views of DTLA.  Perfect for Valentine's night.  The fireplaces are a nice touch. I have yet to try the restaurant.  But, I will soon. The location is just too amazing to not comeback.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie M.
Reviews.Content: Came here for mother's day....not very impressed.  I am always in Downtown LA so the fact that it overlooks Downtown is not a plus for me (although it may be for other people who don't get out much).  Service was slower than slow.  They have several different kinds of egg benedict (regular, salmon, crab cake).  We had a table of 6 and 4 had one of the egg benedict dishes and 2 had the french toast.  All of the egg were overcooked - think hard boiled egg and flavorless, the potatoes were potatoes and the french toast looked more like a dessert than breakfast.  Would I come here again - NO.  Plus the outside of the building reeks of urine.

Reviews.Author: Anjelica S.
Reviews.Content: Don't come for brunch on a weekend. It took at least 15 minutes for someone to check on us, about 20 minutes to get our check and it looks like it's going to be another 20 minutes to have our check picked up. Are you kidding me? Not coming back. And definitely not recommended.

Reviews.Author: e j.
Reviews.Content: The food is ok but the ambiance is WONDERFUL!  They also have a singer that will perform for a lil bit on the outside patio. We ordered scallops, bacon mac & cheese and the brussel sprouts. Scallops were cooked well but the sauce/sweet corn was a unique combo. The Mac & Cheese and Brussel Sprouts were delish. DEF recommend for a date or nice nite out with friends. Would love to come back here again!

Reviews.Author: Claudia R.
Reviews.Content: OMG the view.  THE VIEW.My office has a company party here and it was awesome.  Cocktail party on the roof - WOW.Private dinner downstairs -  WOW.  The food was so good.  The staff was super nice and attentive.  I had a great beet salad and gnocchi for dinner.Park across the street for $14 before 6pm or $6 after 6pm.I love this place!

Reviews.Author: Sung K.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the places I always take my friends when they are visiting from out of town.  It has amazing views of the Downtown LA buildings and It very swanky!The only downside are some of the bartenders.  I love the drinks, but they are really really stuck up and RUDE!  On the very very top floor there is a small bar.   The very tall female bartendersnever smiled.  I ordered a Jameson Ginger w/ ginger beer instead of ginger ale.   She forgets and makes it with ginger ale.  She looked at me and said...."oops" and hands me the drink......seriously?  oops?Our group decides to go to the other bartender, slim red-head.  She was super nice and had great customer service!  I really love Perch and will continue to take my friends there.  We will just make sure to go to the right bartenders...

Reviews.Author: Veronica R.
Reviews.Content: I don't know how I feel about downtown LA. I hate being inconvenienced and I feel like downtown LA is the epitome of inconvenience. Traffic, parking, pretentious crowd. Came to celebrate my friends nieces B-day. Got here super early. Around 8ish There was no line and went right upstairs to the roof. The view is amazing. Ive seen people compare it to The Standard. Which i also think is ok. Both views are great. Best part of this place was that people form a line at the bar!!! I was so impressed with everyone!!!!! Im so used to having to elbow and wave my hands in the air for attention from the bartender. So this was a nice change. I suggest if its 2 of you waiting, split up and try both lines. B/c they move at different paces and you'd be surprised. I heard later that by 9ish there was a 1-2 hour wait to come up. WHat?!!? i don't think anything is worth that. SO my advice come early b/c if you have to wait it is not worth it!!!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa D.
Reviews.Content: Feel free to take this review with a pinch of salt as I only had the pleasure of having the "day time" experience at Perch.  I cannot personally attest to the night time scene, although I plan to very very soon!  We had absolutely gorgeous weather the day we went and it wasn't too crowded.  I have marked this as THE place to take out-of-towners who have never experienced L.A.Several things stood out to me about this place as soon as I reached the 15th floor.  Major highlights include:- Old timey ambiance - mismatched period furniture gave it a comfortable stay-a-while feel, but without compromising the class. Think Downton Abbey parlor rooms without the stuffy decorum. - Genuinely friendly down-to-earth staff  - as opposed to the snooty and stiff waitstaff most of us are use to at "it" restaurant/bars downtown- Breathtaking views of Downtown L.A.When I went:On a beautiful Saturday afternoon for a leisurely brunchWhat I've had:  (1) Assorted Breads and MuffinsVerdict ---- Delicious, the scone was one of the best I'd had (moist, not crumbly) and that jam... heavenly! (2) Perch Fromage PlateVerdict ----- Great cheese selection (could have used more substantial portions of the cheese itself) but came with great raisin bread and fig spread... divine combo!(3) The Perch Burger with Side SaladVerdict ------ One of the best burgers I have had in recent memory... seriously.  Just remising about it now is making my mouth start to water.  Made with gruyere cheese, a fried egg and garlic aioli.... good god! How can I ever order anything else? The bun was also toasted to perfection.  Might be the best thing on the menu... I'll probably never find out what to compare it to. (4) Build Your Own BubblyVerdict ------ Name says it all... choose from orange juice or peach puree. I went with the peach, myself.  Very fresh. Nothing like a great mimosa on a beautiful afternoon.Ambiance:The inside parlor area was just gorgeous.  Being big into antiques, architecture, attention to detail, and Downton Abbey, what's not to love? Cathedral ceilings, sweeping arches with light pouring in from every window. I very much wanted to collapse into a dusty library chair and savor a good novel. That's how comfortable it feels in there. The outside wrap-around balcony is gorgeous as well. Plenty of tucked away corners with comfy seating, heat lamps and fire pits to keep folks warm on blustery days (or nights). And a performance space for bands with plenty of half-moon seating around the pseudo stage to enjoy the show!Service:The hostess, our server and the manager were all lovely. Our server was very attentive and down to earth, just my style.  After the meal, we wandered around admiring everything. We'd heard there was a rooftop bar, but that it was closed until 6pm.  When asked the hostess (Malia? Melinda?) if it would be possible to go check it out, after getting the green light from her manager (Alex), she was only too willing to give us a private tour!  Total sweetheart.  Felt like we got the royal treatment!  And none of the stuffiness you typically get in downtown.  All the staff get a big thumbs up. Entertainment:The afternoon we were there they had AWESOME hot jazz ragtime band playing for us called The California Feetwarmers. Think tubas, banjos and washboards... oh yeah, freaking awesome.  I grabbed their card before heading out.  Check out their website here: californiafeetwarmers.com   I wonder if they do parties?Prices:This ain't no taco shop people. This is prime real estate high above the grimy streets of L.A.. The prices reflect that, but they were by no means jaw-dropping.  I would say this is for a special occasion though.Location:Right on the corner of South Hill and 5th, diagonal from Pershing Square.Parking:  Big parking lot across the street.  It's one of the biggest and most convenient in L.A., although word on the street is its going to be developed - Noooo!  For now, it's a $6.00 flat rate on the weekends, but as always, bring cash. Hours:During the week they don't open until 4pm, but they go until 1-2am depending on the day. On the weekend, however, its 11:00am until 1:00am (Sunday) or 2:00am (Saturday).  Have brunch first, go out and hit the streets of L.A., and come back later for the party at 6:00pm (when they open the rooftop bar). Bottoms up!

Reviews.Author: Dongkyoon H.
Reviews.Content: It's got a great view.  Good bartenders.  Lots of cocktails options, even for guys.But the place is really crowded, moving from place to place will take forever, getting drinks takes forever, and the staff seem to think they're some kind of royalty."A-OK", as the 3-star rating suggests, but not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa A.
Reviews.Content: Love this place it's a nice environment with life entertainment and a beautiful view of downtown Los Angeles. So make sure to charge your phone because you'll definitely want to take a lot of pictures I recommend this place to those who aren't familiar with the Los Angeles area, this will be a good way to really look at the city day or night. -Vanessa xo

Reviews.Author: Neal R.
Reviews.Content: Perch is AMAZING!!!  We did a private event here, which we organized with the incomparable Stella Neveu.  We had a semi-private area on the 16th floor and it was just perfect.   Of course they get top marks for the setting...it is just beautiful up there - splendid views and French music - it doesn't get any better than that.The food was really great too - we did passed hors d'oeuvres, an antipasti tray and a lovely selection of desserts.  The cocktails are soooo delicious.I would highly recommend them for any event, especially if you want to impress clients or people from out of town-- thanks so much Stella!!!

Reviews.Author: Annette K.
Reviews.Content: Great service... The best views in town... Courteous from telephone agent, manager on duty Dwight. Our server Kayla always a gem. Every guest I have introduced to this place have been imiressed. The only thing  noticed this time was that when we went to the roof to smoke each time we had to use the stairs. That was a drag.

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: Good service, good vibe.  The place can get too crowded at times, but when it's not, it's just cool as a cucumber

Reviews.Author: John T.
Reviews.Content: Went to this delightful place after seeing the Clippers get Man-Handled by the Suns! Such a sorry game...but Perch had made me forget about the game because of the beautiful views (my girlfriend + lights of downtown LA). Luckily we did not have to wait even a minute because we had came here on a wednesday night at 10pm when some people started to go home.We first had sat outside, but their heater had broke and they were kind enough to move us inside in which was still a great ambiance. The waiter was extremely fast and efficient in taking our orders. We couldn't resist the cheese truffle fries as soon as we read it on the menu. It was delicious! We also ordered:The Mussels - great with a nice kick to it Juicy Pork Belly - just as stated in their name...very juicy and delightful!Octopus - not a big fan of octopus (because of the texture) but loved this! Mac & Cheese - good, but not great!We also ordered mixed drinks which had mixed well with our dishes.The food here was absolutely flawless! Would definitely love to come back here to try their other dishes.

Reviews.Author: Erin T.
Reviews.Content: A few recommendations: 1) Try the truffle bacon mac and cheese with the best smoked bacon you'll ever taste2) Order a fancy cocktail or two (or three) 3) Enjoy some conversation and mingle with the folks4) And last but not least, take in the amazing views of downtown LA (especially at night)

Reviews.Author: Jerome S.
Reviews.Content: First off, the view and ambiance is truly amazing! But, anyone can provide a great location and ambiance, it was Kayla's excellent service and hospitality that truly made my experience worth while! She was warm and inviting without being too scripted! I'm a service trainer at another restaurant so I truly critique servers performance. She was amazing! The food and drinks were also great! Go for the Lolita if you're into vodka. If you're more of a cognac person you have to try the One Night In Paris!!

Reviews.Author: Maegan La Mamita M.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Friday night with some friends who wanted to go somewhere fancy. I had never been to a LA rooftop bar and was feeling down after not getting a job I wanted so why not. Despite the rest of my party arriving 15 to 20 minutes after our reservation and having two additional people, the hostess sat us with no problem. The drinks are spendy but tasty. I had the Lolita which was nice. My friends were happy with their IPAs. We ordered some small dishes because the food prices are also high. The pork belly was especially tasty as were the truffle fries. The mussels were meh - I wouldn't order those again. There was a jazz band playing outside on the terrace which was nice. The decor - shabby French chic. Fun spot for people watching as well as many couples come on dates and single ladies all dressed up with super high heels and tight dresses showing off their fake assets. One of my friends found the spot too pretentious. I thought it was fine. None of us were really dressed up, service was fine and yes the view is pretty. I'd go again.

Reviews.Author: Claudio A.
Reviews.Content: Alright, so I absolutely enjoy this place. Been here plenty of times mostly for the rooftop bar/lounge and it never disappoints!This past Sunday my lady friend and I were looking for a place to grab dinner so we decided on perch. Called in for a same day reservation about an hour before. We showed up, got sat inside... We kindly asked if they had anything available outside. The host was very helpful, and gladly helped us make the switch to an outside table. Had a delicious meal! We tried their Salmon, and their steak with fries! The truffle/cheese fries were amazing! All in all, service was great, wine was delicious, food was good(a little pricey) but the view never disappoints.  Definitely a great experience! High five to the hosting staff(African American gentleman) for accommodating us on the spot! Yah, I'll keep coming back!

Reviews.Author: Tia S.
Reviews.Content: If your going after hours, they make you stand in line forever before letting in.... I will NOT be back... And that's terrible for someone visiting LA...

Reviews.Author: Daniella L.
Reviews.Content: Love LA this place has a great view and ambience.  Love the background music as well as the simple decor great drinks they are pricey but it's LA if you get hungry downstairs has a small french restaurant delishes

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: Food was just blah.  I ordered the halibut and it was completely tasteless.  I know it's an insult to the chef to ask for seasoning but my fish needed something.  I added lemon and salt and that made it at least edible.  Drinks were super yummy.  Vibe is nice.  AMAZING view.  Nice crowd. I decided to go back another time and give it a second try.  I ordered the chicken supreme and my friend ordered the filet minon.  I hoped it was just the halibut that sucked.  Nope, the chicken was plain.  The only flavor was on the gooey skin.  I could have made a better steak at home.  Again, everything was flavorless.  Am I missing something?   Is flavorless, bland food the new cool thing and someone forgot to tell me.  The only thing that I would go back for are the yummy drinks and the view.  Eat before you go.  The food gets 0 stars.  The two stars are for the drinks and view.

Reviews.Author: Annie T.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE the ambiance of Perch. Their interior design and outdoor balcony creates this homey/relax feeling; that itself made me fall in love with this place without even trying their food. The restaurant is perfect for a Sunday brunch or even a classy night out. Food:I came here for brunch, so I can only judge food off of that menu. 1) French toast: 5/5 this was my absolute favorite. I always order french toast no matter where I go, and this one is by far one of the better tasting ones. It has a unique fluffy texture to which I cannot describe, so you should just order it and try it yourself!2) Crab benedict: 3/5 This was pretty average for me. The side of potatoes that it came with was soft and well cooked. However, nothing about this dish really wow'd me.3) Salmon benedict: 1/5 if you're craving for salmon, I suggest you go somewhere else. The combination of flavors for this benedict just didn't complement one another. I did not even bother finishing this dish.I'm not originally from LA, so if you're from out of town, I suggest you check this place out! The view is to die for. I suggest making reservations ahead of time or coming in a tad earlier to sit at their bar. They serve their full menu there so you'll be fine. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Dirrrtybird B.
Reviews.Content: H-Y-P-E.....what does that spell.... HYPE!!!!! Which is exactly what this place is. I went there for brunch. The food just plain sucked, the server was so freaking rude I thought I was on an episode of punked, the family series. He spilled water on our table, said nothing and just walked away. I thought hmm ok? Then spilled ice on my mom, once again said nothing and just waddled away...yes waddled. A true head scratching wtf moment. Didn't come back once to ask how we were doing. I had the eggs Benedict which were extremely disappointing. I don't mind the one star because the sangria was pretty good. Got me all loopy. The only highlight of the my experience there.

Reviews.Author: Dylan C.
Reviews.Content: The roof top bar is great, but Christine behind the bar is AWESOME

Reviews.Author: Kathy N.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place!!!I went here last Friday night with a group of friends. We predrank some Ciroc and I was pretty buzzed from it so I will try my best to recall all the details from that night. Our IDs were checked at the entrance near the elevator and we took it up to the roof top. The place was packed but we got the bartender's attention right away and didn't have to wait long. The crowd was a good mix and this was a good thing since I'm so tired of the all-Asian crowd in OC with every bar or club that I go to there.We grabbed our drinks and headed out to the balcony area and selected a table at the edge overlooking the beautiful city lights. The waitress came out after about 20 minutes to check on us so hooray again for the wonderful service. This place is good for pretty much any event that you have in mind. I'm planning to go back there this Thursday for a girls night and try some of the food. It would also make an excellent date night with that someone you wanna impress. Or maybe I'm just a city girl at heart and is a sucker for the magnificent city lights of LA. :)I will definitely be back for more!

Reviews.Author: Richard W.
Reviews.Content: The perch is one of the places I like to go. I've probably been her 10+ times. There's a locals line which is sweet, but they usually stop taking people around 1am. It's a casual dressy vibe.It's a great place for a summer night and an evening with friends.

Reviews.Author: Hayley S.
Reviews.Content: I went to Perch somewhat on a whim with my cousin, his wife, my brother, and my cousin's friend (who lives in LA) while I was back home for the holidays. I didn't know what to expect other than "DTLA rooftop bar". There was a bit of a wait to get in, then we went up and up to the 15th (I think?) floor where we stepped into a large lounge that looked like a cross between a mod LA deck and a Prohibition-era speakeasy. There were some tables, couches, a medium-sized bar, and open doorways to the deck, which has an incredible view of the city. We managed to snag seats on some couches, but beware: seating was hard to come by without a reservation at a table.They had some killer-sounding cocktails but I stuck to my budget diet of their lower-end champagne. Prices were average to high, but not outrageous. The service was fine -- nothing bad to report but nothing spectacular either. The crowdedness was definitely wearing on the staff a bit.Before we left we knew we had to go to the actual rooftop. Unfortunately, there was a line to get up there, but it only took 5-10 minutes. Once we were up there it was completely worth it. There is another bar and even more unencumbered views of LA. I highly recommend it for a nice date or swanky evening out with some friends! Also, if you're willing, parking was free and easy on the street (over toward Broadway). Good way to save a few bucks by avoiding the paid lots.

Reviews.Author: Nika C.
Reviews.Content: If you come to L.A. to visit me, I'm taking you here. It's my favorite L.A. spot for drinks and good conversation. It's classy without being stuffy, the cocktails are tasty and the rooftop view is amazing. What's not to like about Perch? A nice place for nice company.

Reviews.Author: Rich B.
Reviews.Content: Lovely decor + fancy drinks + rooftop bar in downtown LA = Yes.Great spot for a snack and a drink and to enjoy the sun and breeze.

Reviews.Author: Una J.
Reviews.Content: Great place for a date at the rooftop.Modern chic mood, nice live music, great view It is so romantic here and food is delicious also. My boyfriend and I both love this place :)

Reviews.Author: John P.
Reviews.Content: Follow the bird up the elevator...To begin... we showed up at the door and we were immediately greeted and seated... 10 seconds maybe.  This was actually my second time here - my first time was while I was house hunting and I was just blown away.  This time - still blown away, just blown away even more, in particular with the fact that I thought I knew what to expect.  Perch was packed.Drinks - to perfection.Food - from appetizers to entrée - superb, impressive, and truly worth it.ch was packed.If you would like to be seated - make a reservation, dine late - 9:45PM is still early to eat ultimately!Enjoy the live music, before the DJ kicks in - both had me singing at the table, hey why not, I'm with friends right - they love to hear me sing - maybe not :-)I don't live in DTLA (Down Town LA) so I probably won't go back in the next few months, but when I do, I'll ask myself why have I waited so long...I went, you should go!

Reviews.Author: Bambu Y.
Reviews.Content: Love         It! Come and enjoy a cozy old style bar. Get a awesome single malt and DON'T miss the Truffle Poutine! A ma zing!

Reviews.Author: Serena C.
Reviews.Content: Great place for a date. I felt like a princess here. :) Great views, interesting drinks, delicious French food. The deserts are amazing.  I highly recommend reservations if you want a good spot.

Reviews.Author: Patrick Shane D.
Reviews.Content: Great location, classically beautiful interior, and terrific view of downtown.  One of the most interesting and appealing bars in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Author: Lauren M.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere and decor. Good food. Took clients here for a business dinner. Everyone had a great time. Sat 11 comfortably and had a table where people could all talk to each other. Also had a preset menu. Waitstaff were all super friendly and responsive!Ordered: -Drink: Lolita. Good at first, but was too thick and sweet. Also a glass of Chardonnay but I forget which one. -Appetizer: Caesar salad. Too fishy for my taste. -Entrée: Salmon. Good. -Dessert: Chocolate pudding with berries and sea salt. Delicious. Just as you'd expect for salted chocolate pudding. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Author: Ari O.
Reviews.Content: I love Perch, I come almost once a month on Sunday nights to listen to the band perform and grab a drink.This night, we decided to actually make reservations and get dinner.
