When the hostess showed me our table, I asked if we could wait for a different one (I don't like the tables that are really low to the ground; I don't want to hunch over my food!). She said it was no problem and we grabbed a drink while waiting. She sat us at a much better table and I was really pleased with her hostessing.Dinner was fabulous, we had the skewer appetizer (amazing) and I got the steak frites (as did my friend). The truffle fries were DELICIOUS. My one complaint was the cook on the steaks. I asked for mine medium rare, but it came out rare (medium rare should be a little more cooked through but still red; it was just red). My friend asked for medium and his was still very red as well.In all fairness, we could have sent the food back and I bet they'd have cooked the steaks a little longer for us. But the food was still delicious. I also got creme brulee which was fabulous.The biggest bummer for me was that I come on Sunday nights specifically because there's a live band that plays till 10pm. This night, however, one of the neighbors called in a noise complaint and the cops came to tell the band to be quieter! Instead, whoever manages Perch just told them to stop playing completely. I was really disappointed. I'm sure Perch has the proper permits and the noise ordinances don't start till 11pm. I wish they hadn't let the neighbors bully them into making the band stop performing- the band is my favorite part. Hopefully next time I go, they don't cut the band off early.

Reviews.Author: Dan P.
Reviews.Content: I've only been to the rooftop bar, which provides a super awesome view of Pershing Square and downtown L.A. The crafted cocktails are great, a little pricey, but great. If you're a fan of ginger crafted cocktails try the Penicillin.

Reviews.Author: Mac M.
Reviews.Content: Last Saturday was my second time at Perch for dinner. The food here is really something special. Sitting at my desk today, I am still thinking about the octopus appetizer. Next time, I would order this all for myself. It was heavenly. The octopus was just so perfectly cooked and seasoned and served in small slabs (more like slices of sushi).Other winners: rabbit ravioli, steak frites, gnocchi, short ribs and the roasted Brussels sprouts (sweet & charred). The cocktails are wonderful as well. My choice was the "writer's block" - served in a champagne coupe. It just oozed fancy.My least favorite item this visit was the mushroom risotto which was just slightly too al dente and not very interesting. All of the staff was kind and helpful Waters were refilled constantly and plates cleared with (almost too much) efficiency. It's loud in there - with people at the bar, others waiting behind a velvet rope to go up to the rooftop bar. I have a feeling that this contributed to a few missteps by our waitress, who was not 100% on point with us, though overall was really great. All in all, we had a lovely experience in beautiful Perch restaurant. The lively atmosphere and the bustling about of waitstaff and the spectacular view, all contributed to a really memorable evening with friends.

Reviews.Author: Noojume N.
Reviews.Content: Very Trendy place to get together with friends. The view is beautiful and sitting outside on a summer night will have you love the place. Expect it to be packed.

Reviews.Author: Keith D.
Reviews.Content: Great food, great service.

Reviews.Author: Robin S.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to check out Perch for a longggg time. However, on Friday/Saturday nights, the line is always out the door. Like 45-to an hour wait. I hate waiting in line so I said screw that. I went to a Downtown LA Happy Hour Meetup event at Perch on a Thursday night, instead of a weekend night. Perch is definitely a gorgeous spot with beautiful views of Downtown LA. The drink prices are reasonable as well. I just ordered a beer so ended up paying $6 for a beer. The drinks are definitely less pricer than the Standard in Downtown. The crowd during the weekdays is more business/upscale. Great for groups and if you want to be amongst a gorgeous view while enjoying your conversation! I have not tried the food yet but would love to come back for dinner or brunch! It would be awesome if Perch could build a pool as well. They could generate more revenue that way! Parking Tip: There is a lot across the street for $5 after 4PM.

Reviews.Author: Ethan R.
Reviews.Content: Such a New York feel! I really enjoyed coming here. Make sure you have reservations beforehand though. Food was good too. 5 Stars all the way.

Reviews.Author: Jenni O.
Reviews.Content: Went here last night.Likes:-Nice view.-Drinks are fairly priced. I got a tequila sunrise for $9.00, which I thought was quite reasonable considering Perch is known to be a high class lounge/bar.-Lots of places to sit down.-Even though the lounge is an open concept from having all the doors open as well as most of the lounge being situated outside, you won't feel too cold. They have heaters around to make you feel comfortable.Dislikes:-The wait to get into Perch is long and quite ridiculous. Got there around 10:00 P.M. It took us about 45 minutes to get into the lounge. Also, there are different floors, so we had to wait a few minutes to go from one floor to the next. -Also, I talked to a friend who was about to go to Perch the same night as me but left after seeing how long the wait was. She went around midnight. It seems that anytime you go, it will probably be a wait (Unless you go super early and beat the crowd). Recommend:Yes. Make sure to dress classy, it's a more upscale lounge. Also, I suggest taking uber, lyft, or a taxi, so you don't have to worry about the horrible parking in downtown LA.

Reviews.Author: Mark G.
Reviews.Content: Stunning views of downtown LA, perfect decor and ambiance.   Great place to see and be seen.  I would give the food 3-4 stars if I had it anywhere else, but eating it at Perch made it a 5.  Live music on the patio was a nice touch too.  I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Diana W.
Reviews.Content: Local bar up on the rooftop. Two stories. Dead but chill on weekdays, and packed on weekends.Been here so many times, guess never had the time to crank out a review. Great place to chill. FREE entrance but long lines and possibly at capacity.  Live music during weekends, super crowded.Weekdays here is great! Great to spend some quality time with friends with a great view and fireplace. Parking: Possible to find $5 parking lot a block away.

Reviews.Author: Seth H.
Reviews.Content: The Perch really does deserve five stars. Let me break it down for you. Secret elevators, gives you the feeling like you're about to make a drug deal. Drinks that are so pricey you'll definitely drink enough to take the sting from your wallet. A view that says "yep, I've arrived". If you've ever wondered what it feels like to live completely pretentious and look down on the poverty stricken downtown area from a view high above the clouds then patron The Perch.

Reviews.Author: Suzane C.
Reviews.Content: Juicy roof top view for brunchWhat a hidden gem in the middle of downtown la near the jewelry district. Going up to the top of the building, it was a whole different world.  The view is amazing and the music was soothing. There was a live band that played really good songs. We didn't have a reservation but we didn't have to wait too long to get a table. The ambiance is very chic and trendy. The servers were very good and the decor was very cool. We ordered from the brunch menu. Got the crab cakes, the brunch burger, and $25 sangria pitcher. The crab cakes were good, but very small and the price was about $25. The brunch burger was very good, and the fries tasted great. The sangria was not that great. The fruits were in the cups so you didn't really get to taste the full flavor of the fruits. The sangria tasted watered down. It was definitely not one of the best sangria. Another thing that happened that was disappointing was getting a cup with lipstick. I had already poured my sangria on the cup and saw the lipstick mark. Not sure what the server did but she came back with the same full cup of sangria without a lipstick mark. It's a nice place to chill but I don't think the food and drinks are all that great. It is definitely more for the view and exclusivity that is appealing to come back to this place.

Reviews.Author: Emily W.
Reviews.Content: A lovely Sunday evening enjoying great friends! Inviting reception from the hostess, perfect seating on the 15th floor balcony for  a 5pm dinner reservation on a warm summer evening. Enjoyed a few Lolitas without cucumber, baked Brie with a side of warmed baguette and butter, surf and turf skewers. All delicious! Next, dinner. In a party of 4, each ordered a different entre-pan roasted chicken, pan roasted salmon, iron steak and frites, chicken with beet salad. Portions were satisfying, leaving us satiated with room to share a dessert.  A warmed white chocolate bread pudding topped off our meal. The jazz ensemble played an urban set of contemporary and classic smooth jazz arrangements. Attentive service throughout the dinning experience. After the sun set, a wrap was plenty for warmth, heat lamps were nearby if we needed more. Looking forward to enjoying another evening on the rooftop at Perch.

Reviews.Author: Nataly W.
Reviews.Content: The crowd was okay, place is pretty fancy. My experience was amazing really great drinks and appetizers the view of LA skyline is why I love my city so much! Would def be back to have some leisure time with a group of friends!

Reviews.Author: Lauren M.
Reviews.Content: Wow, some of these reviews are harsh, but I can understand how everyone has such high expectations of this place.Personally my experience here was flawless.  I came here with my girlfriend for an early Valentine's day dinner.  Maybe it was just because it was Valentine's day weekend, but this place is loud, especially indoors.  Luckily we were seated promptly outdoors, and in a quiet little nook by the fireplace and an awesome view.My girlfriend really liked her whiskey sour, and I was happy with the size of the wine glasses.  Our food was on point- we shared the truffle fries and loved them, and she had the herb crusted salmon [super delicious, not overcooked] and I had the gnocchi [really rich and heavy].  Our waitress was polite.  She made a small error in our order early on, but immediately corrected it.  It was busy so I can't hold it against her.  I'd highly recommend Perch as a great date spot.  In the future I'd like to do brunch here...maybe some mimosas?

Reviews.Author: Jenna C.
Reviews.Content: The food was not worth the trip to downtown LA. The restaurant itself was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Author: Matt K.
Reviews.Content: I love this venue.  After going here about 1-2 times a month, I learned just to order appetizers and drinks.  The experience and coziness of the venue is what you get.You feel like you are on Tower of Terror ride in Disney on the way up, and then you end up with the second best view in DTLA (the Standard is my personal favorite)Start with apps and drinks (make a res and ask to be seated outside)  then move to the top floor and try to find some couch space.

Reviews.Author: Andy G.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! The food and ambience is great and the staff are always so friendly and give great service. I tend to go here during the week (the weekend crowd is a bit low class) and have dinner and drinks at the bar. Big up to Jennifer and Joelle! They always make me and my buddy feel very welcome whenever they are there. The other staff are also always very friendly

Reviews.Author: Rosemberg E.
Reviews.Content: Early birthday celebration , great food , a drink , music , amazing view , and great company.  Make an early reservation.

Reviews.Author: Matt G.
Reviews.Content: Super good food!! Great wine list and drink selection. Great music and vibe. Get there early or make a reservation!

Reviews.Author: Brenda S.
Reviews.Content: Good place in downtown for business meetings. Food atmosphere, good view, good drinks. Live music may be a little loud if you are close to the performers.

Reviews.Author: Michael Y.
Reviews.Content: Just because  I'm giving 4 stars does not mean I like the place. It's a one time thing and only because it's my wife birthday. Food is expensive but it's French. Hell with French food. Over priced and lack value IMO but apparently not everyone agreesHence the two hour wait if u have no reservation.

Reviews.Author: Caity P.
Reviews.Content: Not good for vegans (vegetarians, ok, but not great). Sun is a bit too direct. Ambiance is nice otherwise, and the view is great. Service is good, but the waiter was just a bit strange (nice but strange). Pricey too!

Reviews.Author: Ming Y.
Reviews.Content: The Perch is absolutely beautiful. The view is amazing, the way they decorated along with the arrangement of furniture is amazing, and there's a live band! I am usually annoyed with live bands but its not distracting music, its just great conversation/food eating music. It is a bit pricey, but you're paying for the experience.

Reviews.Author: Matthew R.
Reviews.Content: I go to Perch for dinner about 4-5 nights per week. The setting is nice, great location. The music is usually decent. Sundays through Thursdays are the days worth going because it's a zoo on the weekend. The crowd is a mix. There are local bankers and consultants as well as East LA hooches and downtown hipsters. The best thing on the menu is the boeuf bordelaise, followed by the filet mignon. The burger is decent, but needs quality lettuce. It has a great patty but uses Subway style lettuce. My favorite bartender is Joel. He's funny, attentive, makes a good drink, knows what he's doing, treats people well, and makes people feel welcome. Jennifer is awesome as well. She's hardworking, attentive, and great to talk to. Eddie, Sean, and Justin are great as well. John makes the best Negroni you've ever had.The management is attentive and nice. The food is good, and overall it's a great place to socialize. The crowd is very diverse, but overall, it's an interesting night out on most occasions.

Reviews.Author: Andrew P.
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was pretty good! Obviously it helps that it's a rooftop location with outdoor and indoor seating with amazing views of Downtown LA and the city. Food was extremely good although I will say that the orange creme brûlée that we ordered was just ok. I can say that I've had better. In terms of service we weren't really impressed - it was average. Our waitress was average. She wasn't very lively but was still nice all around. It's just interesting because we've been to plenty of non upscale restaurants many of times with a better waitress. Really, that was the only reason I took a star off. Also, we REALLY enjoyed the fact that they had a live jazz/r&b band playing most of the night. We really liked the music they played! I also forgot to mention that we made reservations for a table of 4 (mother's birthday) also requesting if we could sit at a table that's next to the downtown skyline and they had a table reserved in the most perfect spot. Kudos to Perch for doing this for my family! Will be coming back in the future.

Reviews.Author: Cameron P.
Reviews.Content: I imagine this place being really cool and all if you were treating yourself to a night out in DTLA coming from Upland or the valley (wherever those places are) but really, it's just another bar with a decent view but nowhere as good a view as The Standard. Kind of a hassle to get up there too... take the elevator, then take some stairs, then you get on the human slingshot and if the winds are blowing just right, they'll launch you right onto the roof.Bartenders are friendly and quick though so that helps a lot. But mostly a bunch of younger kids who pre-partied at their apartment in North Hollywood before coming here to nurse their well drink (can you put some more ice please? also maybe a splash more soda?) for the next three hours.Meh.

Reviews.Author: Mrs C.
Reviews.Content: If you plan on going to Perch, remember that the ambiance is more important than the food, no matter whether you are going there for dinner or for brunch. That being said, the food isn't terrible but the view more than makes up for everything. During the day, the rooftop acts as a respite from the busy traffic and smelly pollution. The air is fresh, the sun is bright and the space is airy. At night, the view is spectacular and the top level rooftop is a great place to grab a drink with friends. I have only been there for brunch and drinks at night. Both times I was not disappointed by the ambiance. The drinks were typical DTLA priced drinks (around $15). Brunch offered several different items. I ordered an omelet. It came with a side salad. The portion was just right. The omelet was standard as was the salad. The service was good but due to high volume, it got difficult to flag down our waitress after our dishes came. TIPS: -Make reservations during peak times to avoid a long wait. Opt for an outside table.-Location can be tricky if it's your first time. Be sure to check with security in the lobby.-"Bird" insignia in elevator button marks the first floor rooftop of Perch. The second-level rooftop can be accessed through another staircase.-Parking can be difficult; find a cheap lot and walk

Reviews.Author: Ben B.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend accidentally made reservations for the wrong night, now given that we came on a Saturday the line was wrapped around the building! The hostess downstairs was very friendly and accommodating, she checked if we can still be placed on a waiting list upstairs for dinner. As soon as we got upstairs, we spoke to a manager right away and immediately with no questions he tried to accommodate us as quickly as they could. They gave us a table overlooking the city outside and as soon as our server came he immediately apologized for the wait! He was very pleasant the whole time even though he was very busy. The service throughout the evening was impeccable! Food- we ordered the Salmon entree as well as the the Rabbit dish called "Little Bunny Frou Frou" which was surprisingly unique and tasty. The manager came to inquire about our evening and needless to say we are defiantly coming back to this place.

Reviews.Author: SABRINA M.
Reviews.Content: The view is breathtaking in the evening. I have only been here once and only had dessert so I can only give 4 stars, but the view and ambiance alone is worth the visit. Next visit I hope to bump it to 5.

Reviews.Author: John V.
Reviews.Content: First come first serve.  Small amount of seating, great environment!  They allow smoking!!!  Bring sunglasses or a hat if you plan on spending alot of time up here.  :-)

Reviews.Author: Anna C.
Reviews.Content: The place is located about two blocks from the red and purple line so super easy to access via public transport. There's the one silver lining in this place it was all downhill from there.We arrived around 830 and the line was about 100 yards long, we thought no big deal the line will move fast, we were wrong, it took about 45 minutes to get in. Silver lining there was no cover. After we take an elevator ride to the bar/restaurant, and the place was relatively crowded, and difficult to move around, our friends ended up being on the top floor bar but low and behold there was a line to get to that bar, ironically we couldn't get in line because the line was full, so we were waiting to get in line for the line at the next bar... Kind of lame if you ask me The crowd is also a bit ghetto, witnessed a couple girls about to fight as they had drank too much... Really it's THAT KIND of bar... Given the location and venue I expected a little more class from the crowds, but I guess not. There are better bars in DTLA with shorter wait times. Just walk down the street...

Reviews.Author: Nick G.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a friend while we were in town.  The space is beautiful as are the views and ambiance.  The service was also good.  No denying this is a trendy spot.  They had live music that evening, and it was fun looking out over LA with great entertainment.  Our dinner while not bad, was not quite up to par with everything else.  I ordered a pasta with mussels and had quite a few dead mussels in the dish.  The kitchen should of caught those before sending the dish out. Drinks were pricey, but well mixed.

Reviews.Author: Michael A.
Reviews.Content: Went there last night w my girlfriend. Food was really, really good and the view can't be beat. Drinks were good but a bit pricy. Guess that's the trade for the view!!Have to tip my hat to "Jerry" (older security guy?) who found my girls cell phone that she left at our table and caught us on the street as we were leaving to return it. Really cool new find for us. We will be back.

Reviews.Author: Jared K.
Reviews.Content: I personally do not care for this place, the food is ridiculously over priced and the drinks were average at best. I get what they were trying to do but I just think it failed miserably. The only thing going for this place is the view from the top.

Reviews.Author: Italia N.
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid bruncher and love trying new places. Especially those with a great view and outdoor seating. Perch did not disappoint! My sister had two eggs, potatoes and bacon. I had the huevos rancheros which also came with potatoes. I have to say those were some of the most delicious bfast potatoes I've ever had! They had the most amazing crunch but were so moist and soft on the inside. Both our dishes were great.. We also shared the french toast which were to die for. We also enjoyed some cocktails. My sister had the sangria and loved it. I beyond fell in love with the French Maid. I'd go back just for that drink! I've never had a cognac cocktail before but my gosh, it was delicious. perfectly balanced.

Reviews.Author: Reena S.
Reviews.Content: A+ for Ambiance: Beautiful & HistoricalA for drinks & appetizersC- for dining. Salmon was overcooked and lacked flavor. Steak Frites was requested medium rare and was served medium well, and the frites were plated gloppy.  $100 meal could've been prepared better on a Forman grill. C- dessert. I ordered the creme brûlée and it was ok. I would only make another visit for drinks/Appetizer & the view.

Reviews.Author: Carla H.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner on my birthday last month with a girlfriend. We had made reservations, so we were seated right away. We got to dine in the patio which was a perfect spot to devour the lovely view and ended up being my favorite part of the restaurant. Our waitress really took great care of us, if only I would've remembered her name to give her a shoutout. I had the Caesar salad with shrimp and a bottle of pol clement brut, which was very satisfying! Only one con was when we were on our way to get to the rooftop bar after dinner, the line was really crowded, it wasn't long but we waited for half an hour, it was surprising to see that amount of people on a very chilly night.

Reviews.Author: Tevaundra P.
Reviews.Content: I wandered in here on Saturday afternoon and Immediately fell in love.  The view is gorgeous, the decor is amazing and our bartender Christine was super amazing.  I ordered the mon petite cheri and it was delicious.  This is my new favorite spot.

Reviews.Author: Thea M.
Reviews.Content: What I like about this place first of all, is the ambience. It's romantic, hip, & upscale. The view is amazing and the cocktails are not as expensive as the food, which is also considering the quality of the drinks and the food. I came with my husband on a Monday night hoping it wouldn't be packed as it would be on weekends. We had an easy transition waiting at the bar to our table. Not too long and the rooftop bar was one of the best things about this place. Really good cocktails and reasonably priced than other restaurants. I actually wished we waited longer for our table so we could stay at the rooftop bar.We got to our table. The seating was great. Next to the balcony with the view of Pershing Square. I see the menu for the first time and there didn't seem much of a list or selections. A little skeptical, I chose the Scallops w lobster -- which our server told us was one of his recommendations, and my husband the steak. The food came a while, and here it is -- it wasn't up to par with the hype. The steak --I've had better, and cheaper. The scallops were cooked perfectly, but it was hard to down with all the salty sauce it's been sitting in --and that's coming from a girl who loves a little more salt than most other people. My husband enjoyed his some cheese aioli fries although I'm not much for soggy fries.Service was ok. I'm not sure who to blame for the server not really hearing our screams across the noise of people chattering and on top of it the music, or if he was just plain inattentive.Overall, I'd come back with girlfriends for drinks, or the husband to enjoy the view. But to eat? If I want my money's worth, I'll eat elsewhere worth the price.

Reviews.Author: Christina P.
Reviews.Content: When do you crave a rooftop with a view? Usually a hot night or a sunny weekend day. When are the worst times to go to Perch? See previous answers. You'll probably find that everyone in LA has the same idea as you because, sadly, there really aren't very many rooftop bars and restaurants to choose from. So unless you're a small party, coming at an odd hour, or made a reservation, you're probably going to be SOL, hovering around the area until the hostess can seat you. While I normally wouldn't hold it against a place for being busy and in demand, a friend of mine recently took all of these inconveniences into consideration and called ahead to reserve some space for friends for her going away bash on a Sunday afternoon. They told her that she would be fine just coming in and grabbing a table, but then when we arrived, they said it was probably impossible to sit without a reservation! Luckily, they took pity on us and eventually grabbed us a little table area, but it wasn't nearly big enough for the size of the group. I think that if you're going to constantly have a wait for your outside tables you should have a more clear cut system of taking reservations or at least give correct info when people call in to ask. Other than that, Perch was all right with me. The decor is super cute, and like I said you can't beat the view, especially on a clear day. As for the drinks, they're pricey, but expected from a place like this. The food I had bites of, including some potato chips and sliders, weren't all that impressive, but I think their brunch menu is supposed to be much better. I'd recommend this place for a 2-person brunch planned well in advance, and nothing more. It's just too inconvenient!

Reviews.Author: Van N.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I would suggest making a reservation here for dinner and staying late into the night for drinks. My friend and I were playing hostess for the weekend and decided on Perch for dinner. I made a reservation on a Friday night at 9:30pm through Opentable. When we arrived, we were promptly seated in the outdoor patio. I was a bit confuse when our hostess directed us to our table. It was basically patio furniture with two tiny tables. It didn't feel like I was able to have dinner. It felt like I was getting bottle service at an outdoor club! But, I got over it pretty quickly as the area was close to a the Jazz band playing that evening. Since we were in the corner, we had a bit more privacy. The food was good. We ordered the Steak Frites, Pork Belly, Octopus, Truffles Poutine, Little Bunny Frou Frou, and lots of alcohol. Out of the food items, I highly recommend the pork belly appetizer! Overall, Perch is definitely a great place to take company too. There is good food and their cocktails are divine. Another plus, the waiters here are good looking!There are lots around the area, so don't be too concern about parking.

Reviews.Author: Zeke I.
Reviews.Content: I had brunch there this past Saturday with my friend because I was in town.  I love this place!  I could tell it is a old building that has been quasi-modernized but it still has it's traditional feel.  We actually had reservations for Sunday on accident but since we were there relatively early for brunch, they accomodated us and put us in the corner (which was ok since our reservation was our mistake) . I'm a French Toast guy and that is what I ordered.  It was excellent!  It came with fresh berries.  They also had a live band  which was was singing modern songs in a bluesy type way. Since I do not live in LA, my knowledge of other spots is limited but I suggest this place for others looking to eat and chill in a rooftop setting in downtown LA.

Reviews.Author: Vy M.
Reviews.Content: This place is good for a romantic date night. The rooftop is very pretty with the skyline of DTLA. The food was just okay and it was a bit pricey. Like most places in LA, most people go here for the atmosphere. Reservation is recommended at least a few days in advance (especially for Friday or Saturday.) We got a Sunday night 8PM reservation on Friday night. The host can be a bit b*tchy. My friend that made the reservation said the host wasn't so nice on the phone. Our waitress there however was very nice and friendly. What we ordered: 1) Baby beets salad- IMO, it was the best dish that we got that night. It was fresh.2) Roasted brussels sprouts- it was a bit salty. Not overly though. Maybe a little lemon on top would make it better.3) Bacon Mac N' Cheese- this was the least favorite dish of the night for me. It was a bit dried and overly cheesy (not a good cheesy, overly cooked dried cheese.)

Reviews.Author: Amanda M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food and drinks! Service was well and of course the view is to die for! Minus 1 star because of the long wait for our table although we had reservations and it's only a Wednesday night!

Reviews.Author: Halley K.
Reviews.Content: I didn't have to wait in line to come here, but I saw a loooong line of a 100 or so people waiting to get in. This place would NOT be worth waiting that long in line. Sorry.Otherwise, the ambiance and views are nice. I didn't get a chance to try the food as it was REALLY crowded. I would be willing to come back on a weeknight or any other night when it's not so crowded!I would also recommend making a reservation. Maybe it would help with the line situation.

Reviews.Author: Sun H.
Reviews.Content: I love downtown bar hopping. This is definitely one of the prettier bars for sure. I have a thing for views so anything on a rooftop is a plus for me.Never ate food here except for the truffle fries that did not taste like there was any truffle in it at all. Plus they were hard.. Our server was rude and unattentive. Other than that this place is a good spot to chill. Loungy, chic and nice.

Reviews.Author: Kelly K.
Reviews.Content: Had an interesting experience here. My friend was having her birthday here so I decided to check it out. I was told to use her name at the door to bypass the line outside, but the chick refused to let me in, said she didn't have a party under that name. My friend sent down her friend, one of the bar managers, who was a complete 360 in terms of hospitable. He made me feel very welcome in his establishment and was very courteous to show me up. He also stopped by once we were all upstairs to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. So if you don't get stuck with the bitchy door woman, you'll have a good time.Upstairs, it's nice inside. The main bar is kinda small, but it's really just a hotel bar. There's other booths to buy drinks outside though as well, so you shouldn't have to wait too long. The view is nice, I suppose, as far as views go. You're really high up and can see buildings in the distance. But come on, it's downtown LA. It ain't pretty. Downtown LA is probably the ugliest downtown skyline in the country. But if you like being up high and breathing in that smoggy air, go for it!We didn't make it upstairs for dancing, so I can't comment on that. But from what I could see, seemed like a good time. All in all, clean and swanky.

Reviews.Author: Park Y.
Reviews.Content: Cool place, seems classy... but not too classy? (Mostly because of the crowd.. some dressed up some ratchet) Drinks are pricey but normal in dtla. The area its in is pretty cool, ordered a writers block and then hennepin beer, both were okayyy. A lot of first come first serve seating on the 15th floor, didn't have any trouble finding somewhere to sit and chill for the 2-3 hours I was there. Went from comfy couch inside to the fire pit outside which was nice. A nice spot for a drink when youre trying to bar hop in LA, but was good for only about an hour for me then I was over it..the rooftop (16th floor) if you arrive early then its fine, but after 10 the line seemed pretty long to get up there and honestly I don't think its worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: M K.
Reviews.Content: Loved! Beautiful view and vibe. The top top is cool but I loved the bar below surrounded by diners and live music. A definite new favorite. Brussels sprout apps were a+

Reviews.Author: David U.
Reviews.Content: For some reason, it took me a long time before I finally got to try out this place. Now, I've been here multiple times in the past couple of weeks.There are not many rooftop bars in DTLA, so it already has that going for it. There's a restaurant/bar with outdoor seating on one floor, and an open area/bar on the top floor. It's a different vibe between the two floors, but both are nice.Had food and drinks on the lower level next to a fireplace before going up to the top floor for more drinks. If you're going on a Friday/Saturday night, i would recommend making reservations at the bar.It overlooks Pershing Square which is nice right now because of the winter decorations. I'm sure I'll be back again very soon!

Reviews.Author: William C.
Reviews.Content: My favorite Rooftop Bar in Downtown LA and possibly the entire world (for now).The view at the roof at night is breathtaking the first time you see it, and ditto for second, third, fourth, etc. It's about 15 floors up with Pershing Square and the more prominent Downtown office buildings and hotels visible with plenty of seating and gas-lit fire pits. I love the decor; while it is French inspired, it's also got very classic 50's-60's Downtown Los Angeles ambiance to it. All in all, the entire rooftop experience is surreal; it's really the perfect place to have a somewhat casual-classy night with friends.Drink prices are fair and the bartenders are always super nice and have a heavy pour. I like how they change up their craft beer selections from time to time. No Natty Ice here, bros.Food is decent, too. I especially love their burger and fries, among other things. Good luck getting seated here for dinner if you just walk-in, though. Reservations are a must unless you want to take your chances at the free-for-all seating at the lower-level bar.If you're coming here on a Friday or Saturday for the rooftop level, be sure to arrive by 9:30pm or expect a wait. Not only would you have to wait at the ground level, but once you take the elevator up to the "lower-level bar," there's another line to get to the top. I can see why this would piss off some of the other Yelpers here, but I understand why Perch does this. Without these measures, the top level would be overcrowded and ruin the experience. The second "line" usually isn't that bad, and it requires some cunning to get into at times, but it's worth it.Lastly, there's no cover charge here, which is a HUGE plus for such a classy establishment in Downtown LA.I'm in love with this place and I will definitely be back again and again.

Reviews.Author: Sam N.
Reviews.Content: I came here and had a great time and an amazing view of Downtown LA!The Drinks are a bit pricey but the crowd is cool, the service is great, and the ambiance is incredible.I really love Perch because if you have read any of my previous reviews, you would know that I recently had a date here in downtown LA and I continued my date here recently.I really enjoyed Perch because it made me realize some important life lessons on my date here that I would have never learned otherwise. I really don't get emotional in my reviews, but I will say that this place is awesome.I highly recommend you check it out! :)

Reviews.Author: Nida K.
Reviews.Content: I've heard a lot of people talk about Perch over the past few years and I finally had the chance to go last week when I met up an old childhood friend. We found fantastic street parking right near the entrance and took the elevator on up. We got seated inside at a table where the chairs were way too low for the table and we swore we looked like midgets. We asked if they had other chairs or seat cushions and the server just looked at us like we were crazy. Ok then, I guess that's a no. So we dealt with it. We started off with a bottle of wine and ahi tuna tartare to start. I started to glance around and check out the surroundings. There were lots of people around the bar and in the restaurant in general. Quite the place to be in LA I suppose with its sorta hipster, sorta Gatsby like decor and atmosphere. My friend order the scallops while I ordered the Steak Frites. The food was decent, but I'll just say this. I've had a way better flat iron for half the price in London. You're definitely paying for atmosphere here. The truffle fries that came with my meal would've been good if they weren't so soggy. Not exactly sure what they did but they must've doused them in truffle oil or something. After dinner, we made our way upstairs to rooftop bar. Now this was a beautiful place to spend a night in LA. It's not really that high but it's still a lovely view of downtown and all of LA's lights. Make sure if you come that you make it up to this top level and enjoy a drink or two.

Reviews.Author: ChickaPea P.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch on saturday afternoon and had a great time! I highly recommend reservations if you want a good seat on the patio because when we arrived at noon the place was packed and the only seating available was inside. They had a fun rag tag type band playing and the place was a blast. The food was decent, nothing to rave about but lets face it, you come here for the view and experience not the food. The drinks are nice and strong and everyone looks like a model so I say a win win. Parking across teh street is easy and affordable at 6 bucks a car.  Great place to bring out of town friends and I can only imagine how great this place looks at night when the top floor opens up.

Reviews.Author: Sandee T.
Reviews.Content: It took me how long to finally visit Perch?* YES - Rooftop bar(s) & lounge.  Two floors, one covered, one with DT skyline.* YES - Valet parking.* YES - Great bartenders & cocktails.* YES - Good mix of crowd on a Friday night, though ratio of guys:girls was pretty high.* YES - No cover!* WOA:- Plenty of DT lots nearby and metered parking, just didn't feel like walking far.- Open till 2am at which time, they promptly kick everyone out.- Serves food on the lower level with reserved tables.I'll be back~

Reviews.Author: Jason H.
Reviews.Content: Firstly, arriving for sunday brunch we found a street space right in front of the building entrance to Perch, and sunday is free parking on meters so the day already started great.You take an elevator upstairs to floor 13, then a 2nd elevator to floor 15 where Perch is located.  as everyone raves about, the view from the balcony tables (where we sat) is great, we overlooked the park below set up with the winter ice rink.  The entire ambience and decor of the restaurant is fantastic.  Very art-deco, and if it werent for the "scenesters" in their baggy tshirts and shorts, you'd almost feel like you'd gone back in time, which would be kind of cool for Perch to do a "vintage theme" evening where a dress code is enforced and people put some effort into looking nice.The food here is fantastic, just plain top notch dining.  The food is made with finesse and they don't do "by the numbers" cooking on items you think you already know.  There's actually some thought put into every dish.  Also, their red sangria is amazing, def recommend getting a carafe with your meal.Finally, big props to General Manager Tony, a great pleasant guy, and made us all feel very welcome.  Definitely a place to come back, and next time will try taking the metro, as the Perkins Square station is literally across the street so if you dont want to fuss with downtown LA parking, that's a great option

Reviews.Author: Jessica M.
Reviews.Content: While its a fab place. Customer service is awful. They really need to learn how to treat their clients. They don't allow anyone to sit anywhere. It's overcrowded and the prices are not that great. Its the same as the standard. As a native angelino, I would say this place was great when it had just opened. It's overrated now :/ I've never given any restaurant 1 star but this place really earned it!

Reviews.Author: Mel L.
Reviews.Content: There is no view more beautiful than Downtown LA at night. That's why you should do yourself a favor and visit Perch and ask for a rooftop seat.THE FOODI came with a group of four, and we ordered things to eat family style. First was the Pot Au Feu (braised short ribs with polenta, fried red onion, and watercress). It was melt-in-your-mouth fantastic. As tender as my imaginary French lover. Next, we got the Little Bunny Frou Frou (ravioli of rabbit, heirloom carrots, parsnip-brioche crumble, salami). I never found rabbit to have its own distinct taste, so I liken this dish to a more elevated, delicious chicken ravioli. Then, the Pan Roasted Chicken with wild mushroom risotto and jus de poulet. I liked the chicken enough, but the risotto was ah-mazeee.For dessert, our waitress suggested the White Chocolate Bread Pudding and the Pot De Creme. The latter I just found to be a nice but safe way to end a meal. The former is a different story. OH, DAT WHITE CHOCOLATE BREAD PUDDING THO. I normally hate white chocolate, but this bread pudding was an explosion of delight on my taste buds. Everyone at the table was singing it praises. THE SERVICEI'm beating myself up for not remembering our waitress's name, but she was an absolute pleasure. She made excellent recommendations and was as personable as can be. Perch should be very proud to have her on the staff. We all loved her.THE ATMOSPHEREBeautiful. It's romantic without being super obvious, and you feel like you stumbled upon a private party in the middle of the city. I couldn't get enough of the lights and the views. The rooftop slays me. There is also a live band and a lounging area right in front of the band where you can sit and nurse your drinks or dance to the music. FINAL GRADEA // Perch doesn't simply rely on its location to sell itself, and that is much appreciated by yours truly.

Reviews.Author: Dieu P.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the first time on a beautiful weekend afternoon. It was mellow, sunny, and you definitely get a great feel for being in the heart of the city.  Highly recommended for tourists and locals to stop by. I had a champagne for nine bucks, but saw there was food and coffee as well. Can be romantic. A great spot to network or go with friends to hang out and chill, have drinks.  Loved the experience and will definitely try to come back more frequently. Perch on.

Reviews.Author: Vicky G.
Reviews.Content: The view at the Perch is absolutely gorgeous. I came on a Sunday night, and could see DTLA all beautifully lit up. The bar is on a roof, with plenty of space to sit and stand. People were very social, talking to other people besides the ones that they came with.The truffle fries were amazing. The perfect level of flavor and grease for when drinking.  There is no real dress code and the drinks are standard prices for DTLA. I think my fries were a bit pricey $12-$14, but there were a lot of them, and well worth it. I would definitely like to come back in the day as well!

Reviews.Author: Sarah J.
Reviews.Content: I know how much people LOVE this place but to be honest, I wasn't impressed the two times I went - but it could just be me.. Located on hill and 5th with valet parking and also a huge lot across the street for $6 - not bad at all considering all the other lots in the area. THE LINE was painfully long, literally if you're waiting in heels like I was. Not only was the line long and painful, you still have to deal with girls who think they're so hot they can just cut right at the front by standing next to your group - no bish, you gotta wait like everyone else! Once you're in, you take the elevator to the 13th floor, where you will take ANOTHER elevator to the 15th floor where the restaurant is and wait in ANOTHER line to get up to the sky lounge. .. there has got to be an easier way dear god ain't nobody got time for thisssss.The workers look miserable once you get up to the restaurant area - they prob don't wanna deal with the ppl waiting in line to go up. The first time I went there, we actually had to wait in the stairway - super illegal and against fire code, which is probably why they changed it. Either way, still a bullshit system in my book - especially when you finally make it up to the lounge and realized there ain't that many ppl up here.... wtf was I waiting for all these time. View was incredible, I won't take that away. But I am definitely taking myself away because it wasn't worth it for me. Can't speak for the food but the lounge was A-OK

Reviews.Author: Amy B.
Reviews.Content: The outside of the building was nothing fancy...  Once you walk in you must take two elevators to get to the patio... First one that takes you to the 13th floor and then another which takes you to the 15th...We went on a Friday night around 7pm with no reservations, and were still seated fairly quickly...  The waitress was amazing. She was friendly and went out of her way to suggest other fun places to visit downtown. The food was really good as well. We ordered brussels sprouts, filet and salmon. Everything was cooked to perfection and had tons of flavor. The smoked eggplant sauce that was served with the salmon provided a unique taste that is worth trying again. The drinks we ordered were also delicious. After dinner we went upstairs were there was a bar and another patio overlooking downtown. Upstairs the view was picturesque. Overall it was a fun experience and I think worth doing again.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay H.
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by all aspects of this place. Had we not been lucky and gotten a table right away without a reservation, I might be singing a different tune. We walked up on a Thurs evening and it was packed. The hostess' reaction didn't look promising when we told her we didn't have a reservation. It was as if the gods wanted me to experience Perch, though, because another host walked up and said he had a table for two open immediately if we didn't mind sitting on the patio in front of the band. Umm, not at all!The band was great: a deep-spoken pianist backed by cello and drums. (Sorry, I don't remember his name.) They did some great covers and provided great background music for the busy roof-top restaurant. And overall, the place has a great vibe, lots of energy and kitschy warm decor.All the food we had was delicious! Started with pork belly and baked Brie (two separate things). Both were so tasty and just melted in your mouth. For the main course we shared gnocchi and steak frites. Again, soooo tasty. The truffle fries with the steak were especially good. Gnocchi I've had before was really heavy, but this fortunately wasn't. Despite being full, we both couldn't stop eating. For all the wonderful aspects of Perch, I'd definitely like to come back. And I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Author: Darlene B.
Reviews.Content: Not my all time favorite place, but it does have amazing views of DTLA. since I'm from, SD, I'm not very fond of LA in general and I've only seen the not-so-great side in the day time.Drinks are not cheap, and my Moscow mule wasn't made exactly how i like it, but the bar tender had beautiful eyes lol. If you don't find a seat, the standing around isn't ideal. Once my friends and I found a seat, we were able to converse better.  I'm confused about the attire, I wasn't too dolled up, but I saw others that were definitely casual. The line to get in can be a bit of a wait,  we were socializing so it made the time go by.  No cover, a huge plus side!  It was also weird because they'd play one good hip hop song, and then change it up. I would get pumped them not, lol. Put a bird on it (Portlandia reference)...that's how you get to the top!I definitively have pros and cons. The restaurant looks more appealing. Maybe I'll try to eat there next time.

Reviews.Author: Chloé C.
Reviews.Content: **Review solely for the rooftop bar/loungeYou can expect to pay for parking at a random, overpriced parking lot around the area. The place is kind of hard to notice but it is an older- style almost hotel looking building. You could also expect to not get dinner reservations here unless it is over a week in advance. You go up an elevator, greeted by security who presumed to card us sketchily- which was not really the vibe I was looking forward to the moment I got here... but anywayThe view is BREATHTAKING and it really is a wonderful place to bring any visitors or people who want to experience LA. You can see all the buildings and skyline, and at night time the lights make it really nice. Some nights there is a cover fee for entry to the lounge, my guess is usually on the weekends. There is usually a live band/singer and the environment is just relaxing. There are some older single men looking to meet women, there are groups of people coming straight from their jobs presumably in downtown to just grab some drinks, and there are quite a few couples enjoying each other's company. There does seem to be 2 levels of the outdoor lounge, the hostess told us we could only go to the very top, which I have heard is false... because we told her we were not going to eat at the restaurant. At the top level, you could see the lounge under you one level down which is where the live singing usually is.

Reviews.Author: Elysse P.
Reviews.Content: I think I fell in love with DTLA the very first time my friend took me here. The rooftop view is breathtaking; I was hypnotized by the city lights. I think my subconscious decided that night that I would be moving to L.A... and voila. Here I am. Thanks, Perch!Take 2 elevators to get to the top... and one more to get higher. The view, the view, the view. Perfect lighting, fireplaces, plenty of seating. Great place to enjoy a drink and lounge around, but an even more spectacular place for a sit-down dinner (along with drinks too of course). Seriously, make dinner reservations and have dinner.. ESPECIALLY on a Friday/Saturday night. You will avoid the annoying line and get to enjoy amazing food at a table overlooking the view. THEN after you can mix in with the crowd and continue to get your drink on. (You're welcome).Classy, slightly pretentious crowd but not to the point of disgust. Relaxed. Perfect place to go to when I want an excuse to get dressed to the nines... which is always ;) lol. Highly recommend: +POT-AU-FEU+Truffle poutine+Squash gnocchi+PORK BELLY

Reviews.Author: Charlie S.
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to come here...but the service is weird. It took forever to get a beer...we were not offered water or the opportunity to order appetizers like the couple next to us.  Looks like us brown folks aren't too welcomed here.

Reviews.Author: Ara K.
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is standard except that it has the most beautiful view of DTLA, but that's about it. I absolutely hate the lines here. If you come late, there's a line outside to get in the building. Once you go up to the actual bar, there's another line to get to the rooftop. Once on the rooftop, another line for the bar. My gf made dinner reservations last week and we still had to wait about an hour to get our seat! Terrible. Just keep in mind that there will be A LOT of waiting if you go late and I don't think it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Kelley L.
Reviews.Content: Made reservations via OpenTable, and they also send you a text to confirm/cancel your reservation an hour before your appointment. Admittedly, it was my first time eating at a rooftop in DTLA. The views of Pershing Square and the area are absolutely gorgeous.I ordered:- "My Fair Lady" cocktail - it was interesting and very pink. Though I am not a fan of cocktails, it was pleasant.- Ahi tuna tartar - absolutely amazing. There are two sauces: teriyaki and hot sauce. I personally prefer the spicy sauce over the teriyaki, but it was good.- Steak frites: the steak was cooked perfectly. I love my steak rare, and it was cooked just the way Parisians would enjoy it (maybe I got really lucky), so this was definitely one of my favourite parts of the experience. The truffle fries were very damp and soggy, unfortunately, and were "OK."The service was good. I really liked our waitress - she was very engaging and friendly. The manager was also nice and made sure everything was going well.Overall, a great place to relax and hang out with friends. I went to the rooftop bar and the view is slightly better than the restaurant's, given that it has a 360-degree view of the city. However, it is crowded and seating can be difficult.

Reviews.Author: Haroutioun S.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely love this place. Delicious food, colorful atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Anne A.
Reviews.Content: I'd go for the drinks and view of the city in their outdoor patio. They had a live entertainment on a Monday we visited.The ambiance and the view of DTLA is main draw to Perch.  I had the charcuterie plate and a glass of Cotes du Rhone celebrating a friend's birthday.The prices seem overpriced for the food and drinks, but for a place like this, it is to be expected.

Reviews.Author: kee h.
Reviews.Content: experiencing an earthquake 19 floors up, outside, in dt LA?! SCARY! But, the drinks, food and view were great.

Reviews.Author: Chandra C.
Reviews.Content: The view is incredible and completely worth coming here!

Reviews.Author: Mike J.
Reviews.Content: Took my Girlfriend here to celebrate her graduation. Awesome place, very vintage look. Took us straight in with no wait. Food was great and drinks were good. Waitress was funny too. Made the experience that much better. Oh did I mention its on top of a building with a view of DTLA.

Reviews.Author: Vincent L.
Reviews.Content: Perch is solid and one of my favorite downtown destinations to visit. Although the food is a bit overpriced, you don't go to Perch simply to eat the food; you go there for the total experience. Whether it's the venue's old school feel, the great city views and people watching, and/or the live music, Perch has all the ingredients for a fun night on the town. And while hardly an original recipe for success, it's a tried and true one indeed.4 solid stars for Perch.

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: This place.. really depends on why you are going out on a Saturday night.For the record, I had a great time here because I was with a great company. To be out with a group of friends for a casual(ly fancy) night, this place fits the bill right. Night view, live band, rooftop bar... not too shabby.For the food, you can have a much better meal with the price you pay at Perch. I  had their halibut which came out completely overcooked. For $30 per plate, I expect a better meal.The service was extremely slow, but wasn't unfriendly. When I left the place, I couldn't help but wonder why all these mediocre places have such amazing spots in downtown. The Standard bar and Takami or something... they both have the gorgeous night view of the city while other excellent restaurants are stuck somewhere in the smelly corners of Spring, Main, and other shitty streets.Bottom line: Perch is a gorgeous restaurant, but the view comes with a pricey menu.

Reviews.Author: Robert C.
Reviews.Content: So I've been to Perch twice. Once before for a friends little get together, which was cool (except for the drunken Korean group that came in wasted at the end, but that's certainly not the restaurant's fault) and then once to have a beautiful dinner date. Officially, it's a 2.5 to me, but I'm rounding down.So why the two stars? Well young grasshopper, let's go down the list why I like and dislike this place.The Good:- The view is spectacular. It's not the tallest building in DTLA, but it's certainly tall enough. As a result, you get a lot of good lights, good views, and when the weather is fine like it was both times I was there, you really do feel like you are Perched on top of DTLA.- The Ambience (when not crowded) is perfect french bistro-y without feeling too hipster-ish. Yes, it's got the hint of hipster to it, but it's either I'm not feeling the effects of them anymore, or it's been dialed back just enough to be fairly quaint and wonderful. This effect however is severely hampered when it's overcrowded. I mean, having people in suits and dressed up looking nice is fine, but see my "The Bad" for details on what I'm referencing.- The Food: It's really freaking good. I love it. Came out super quickly too, which was of some comfort - The Cocktails: Also really good. Kind of expensive but considering the rent for the spot, it's understandable. Very well made and balanced - if you're not careful, or otherwise sensitive, you can easily get tipsy here. Signs of good bartenders (who also looked amazing, both the men and ladies).- The Music: They play live music, mostly jazz (from my experience), which is a rarity in DTLA now a days. I mean, the only other place is what, Blue Whale? And bonus here, you get food and drink!The Bad: - Floor Management/Crowd. I have no problem with a place being popular. I have no problem with crowds. I have no problem with lots of stuff. But when I make a reservation, and I show up on time for the reservation, having to wait over an hour before we're seated, and having the bar be super crowded, and otherwise feeling somewhat abandoned by the front desk. I'm not cool with that and that's where a lot of my dislike is stemming from. I understand from a business standpoint you want as many heads in as possible, but I feel that the balance between price per head, and customer satisfaction has been tipped more for the PPH, rather than the satisfaction.To light, in my dining experience here, I checked in, and was told about 45 minutes, and that I would be texted when the table was ready. Checked back at 45 minutes (Hey, cocktails and conversation helped pass the time) and it still wasn't ready. Over an hour later, and based on my own checking back (i.e. the hostess never sent the text) our table was finally ready. Starving, slightly boozed up, and now we can finally order? Massive downvotingAll in all, I like Perch, or rather I really want to like it. I like the vibe at the tables, or outside, or at the bar. However, I dislike it when things don't get started on time, and further when things are followed through, which I think the floor management dropped the ball on, in my opinion. Will I go back? Absolutely, but I won't try for a reservation, unless I hear things have improved.

Reviews.Author: Daniel B.
Reviews.Content: Great view and ambiance. Welcoming staff, clean bar, patio and restaurant. We had the Lamb sliders, brussels sprouts and ahi tuna tartar. Although the tartar could have used some more umf...everything else made up for it absolutely. The spicy concombre is a must try. I'll be back for that burger and concombre for sure.

Reviews.Author: candace r.
Reviews.Content: I am in love with Perch. I want to give them 5 stars so bad but the service is to blame. I first came here for an event put on by my school. We were given free drinks and appetizers and had the top most floor reserved to ourselves. I instantly fell in love with the view, the drinks, and the food.I then decided to spend Halloween here because the theme was Great Gatsby and I just love everything about that. Boy did Perch put on a wonderful show! They had a fire juggler/dancer guy and beautifully dressed girls walking around on stilts! They also had different music on the different levels for a nice variety.I recently came here on a Monday to try out their happy hour. We ordered the nuts, truffle fries, and bruschetta. Everything tasted great except the truffle fries. $5 crafstmen was delish too. Now about the service....but a little background info first. I am picky about service wherever I go because I think it's important to feel that your business is appreciated in a setting like a nice restaurant or bar because quite frankly, it's impossible to find politeness anymore on the streets of Los Angeles. With that said, if I go to a place like Perch (and pay for parking to go there too), and order generously, I expect to be treated nicely. That's all. I'm not talking over-the-top kiss-assy or anything like that. So I guess Perch just falls a little short of my expectations each time I go there. All of the other things I love about Perch definitely make up for my disappointment and I'm hoping this changes when I come here for a full meal and test out their service in that way. At the end of the day, this place is not nearly as bougie as everyone makes it out to be. If you want a breathtaking view of LA, you have to come here at least once.

Reviews.Author: Vandana J.
Reviews.Content: The place is fun, the bartenders good. Not thrilled about the drink selections and the overpricing of avg drinks, but you can ask the bartenders to make what you want. Great place to bring out your out of town friends to get a good view of the city. I usu don't spend too much time there bc it starts to bore me actually - maybe it's too tame or music is bland, lots of potential to be better though...

Reviews.Author: Marthie D.
Reviews.Content: OH you so fancy huh?!Well I certainly felt all fancy going here. You have to take an elevator to go here. And you know what floor to go to because there is a lovely perch next to the button. SUPER fancy. But seriously though, this place IS fancy. It has a pretty view of Pershing Square and you can look all around DTLA from the balcony. I have only drank wine here, which made me feel super fancy. And I have also tasted their brie in the bread (not shabby). I didn't have to pay to get in here, nor did I have to wait in a long line (week day). BUT I have seen some heavy lines on weekdays and weekends. Women with heels, beware.

Reviews.Author: Frederick C.
Reviews.Content: so where would four dudes catch up after a year of me being stuck in NEPA?PERCH!Now I think rating a club or lounge is super subjective and usually unfair to the venue itself. Usually everyone slams the place because of some terrible experience (most likely relating to alcohol) but seriously, if you go and enjoy the point of what Perch is about (which is the view of pershing square), I would say it's quite enjoyable. This ain't your place if you're looking to twerk. This is my second time back, the first time I went, no line, shot up the first set of elevators in less than 30 seconds (there's two sets you have to ride in). This time I went back on a weekend and the wait was about a hour (technically longer, but my party held the place in line for us). The place is more casual in general but I do believe there is a dress code (long pants at the minimum), although there were definitely some underdressed people. The overall feel is a dinner setting with an outside area to lounge, sit around and chat. I haven't been up to the very top of perch but from the main room (the area you first enter) and the outdoor area, I would say it's a good place to catch up with old friends due to the acoustic nature of an open window/door lounge. The music isn't top 40 (good DJ by the way when I went....probably underappreciated) and the music isn't blaring loud where you have to raise your voice (which I hate). The crowd has always been a mix (both ethnicity and age) on both times I've gone, which is nice.I would say drinks were appropriately priced. I cannot really rate the food since I've never had any. There is valet parking outside and pershing square has some parking as well.Overall, we had a good time. the outdoor fireplace is pretty sweet too, although its in a corner by itself and usually some party is sitting by the fireplace. This place gets pretty popular during the summer and if you come during the winter, I recommend a jacket if you're going to sit outside.warning: when the ladies of our party wanted to dance, we started yelping nearby places. so come for chatting but not for the dancing

Reviews.Author: Lori B.
Reviews.Content: My hubby wanted to take me out to a nice brunch for my birthday and we picked here because of the fantastic view of downtown LA! Food was amazing, service was decent (they were super busy that day) and the view was the cherry on top! They also have this awesome bread pudding which is to die for! Definitely worth checking out if you"re an Angelino like me. ;)

Reviews.Author: Alex W.
Reviews.Content: Nice rooftop bar.  While most mention the Standard in the Rooftop Bar conversation, Perch, in my opinion is way better.  The prices are a little bit lower, there is no cover charge, and the view is just as good if not better.That said, it was very crowded when we went though we were lucky to be able to grab a couch inside.  There was a long line to actually get up to the rooftop, which was a bit of a detraction, and I personally just have issue with waiting in line at places.  Also, the drinks are still expensive, though reasonable I suppose given the fact that you are at a rooftop bar downtown.The food seemed a little more reasonably priced but given the time of night we were there it felt uncomfortable to order anything.  We ordered one cocktail which was superb and another from a different bartender that was undrinkable.  Fortunately, when I went up to the bar, I went to the first bartender, who asked if she had made it to which I replied she had not, but she offered an apology for the poor quality of it and replaced it with a better one.Knock the beer prices down a couple bucks for a reasonable pilsner to accompany your girl's sure-to-be overpriced cocktail and no lines for upstairs would make this a five star review.  The views are great and girls love the spot so it is sure to please for a date.

Reviews.Author: Geoff C.
Reviews.Content: What would you get if you put the building from Ghostbusters in the middle of rusty downtown (LA Times, not the fashionable Skid Row area), with a bar/restaurant with a view reminiscent of Manhattan, within striking distance of every part of LA so you're ensured and interesting crowd...Perch.Well there you have it.  I have not had food there, but the atmosphere works for groups, parties, out-of-towners, or an intimate pair.   One of a kind in LA.

Reviews.Author: Roy C.
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful time. Service was great... food even better. Loved the ambiance. Very cool for drinks after work or a romantic diner with special one.

Reviews.Author: Audrey H.
Reviews.Content: Love this place!!!  Went to the rooftop for a friend's birthday and had the best time. Amazing views and Kristine makes the best Manhattans!!!

Reviews.Author: Ran P.
Reviews.Content: This place has a fantastic view of downtown LA. The drinks were pricey($12-14), but the good vibes and great view definitely make up for it. I suggest getting the mojitos here, they're pretty good and the bartenders make them strong.  Making a reservation is a good idea(especially on the weekends) because it starts getting really crowded early. Don't expect to find a place to sit at a table or the bar if you arrive anytime after 8! Overall, this is a cool place to relax and have a couple of drinks.

Reviews.Author: Brian W.
Reviews.Content: My wife & I invited some friends along to join us on our first visit to Perch. Overall it was a very impressive experience. We made an online reservation for 6pm but chose to arrive at 4:30 to watch the sunset on the roof, enjoy some conversation & get in on the Happy Hour specials too. The Penicillin was the winner drink & the mini-hot dogs were great for appetizers. Once the sun went down the heaters came on and kept us all warm as we enjoyed our evening into the dinner hours. Live music fired up around 7pm & it created the perfect atmosphere! Great band too!We had split the salmon for dinner. Very good. The Brussels sprouts were off the charts good & the risotto is worth a try too. Overall, the food was way better than the some of the other Yelp reviews had indicated, in my opinion.  The staff was very welcoming, friendly, attentive & fit the vibe of the restaurant. This was also a pleasant surprise based on some of the other reviews I'd read. Smile more in LA & people will smile back.  We'll make this a staple stop on our LA list &   we recommend that you go enjoy Perch too. It's one of the better kept secrets in LA for now!

Reviews.Author: Yam Yam C.
Reviews.Content: A cute place with great view of DTLA that I want to become a regular....But their cocktails are below mediocre and food is even less inspiring.  I wouldn't come here for drinks or food - what other reason would I go to a bar - but would come any day for the gorgeous view at sunset.

Reviews.Author: Caity D.
Reviews.Content: A couple of friends and I had the nicest time at Perch last night! The views were stunning, and the food was phenomenal. It's definitely a splurge if you're on a budget, but it's well worth it if you feel like treating yourself -- just for the gorgeous atmosphere alone.We had the sweetest server, Kristin, who not only made some excellent wine recommendations, but was all in all really fantastic at her job. My friends and I had a lot of catching up to do during our 3+ hour dinner, and Kristin never made us feel rushed; she was super friendly throughout the whole night. After dinner, she surprised us by sending us a dessert on the house! We were so pleasantly surprised and really appreciated her thoughtful gesture. It's servers like that who can make a dining experience truly spectacular, and I will constantly recommend Perch to anyone looking for a great atmosphere, delicious food, and terrific service.

Reviews.Author: Nikki E.
Reviews.Content: Crowded on weekends. Service can be really slow. My bff had her birthday brunch here, the server had an attitude and no apologies when she got our order wrong.  Nevertheless, we still had a great time because of the company and the view.  This was last year so couple of month's ago, another friend had a birthday here. Decided to give this place another chance, this time service was a little better.  If you want to order food just go directly to the bar.  They had a live band on  friday nights and of course, the view is just amazing.

Reviews.Author: Michelle T.
Reviews.Content: Want to have a great brunch with a view? My advice to you, skip the benedicts and burger and get the  CROISSANT French Toast!AND DO NOT COME with a large group. Do your group date somewhere else, cuz if you came for the view, they will not seat you outside for a larger group. We were 10 people and they could have easily sat us outside, but it's their policy and they were not allowed to break up our group either, as we suggested. So we had a wonderful view but only when we took a break from eating to step outside on the patio. My salmon benedict and potatoes was just ok. My egg wasn't very runny as I usually get with my benedicts. Half our table ordered the Perch burger and they all thought it was just ok. BUT FRENCH TOAST WAS AWESOME!yelp.com/biz_photos/perc…I usually think French toast is good, but never wowed, but their version uses CROISSANTS, and it makes a huge difference. Why have I never had CROISSANT FRENCH TOAST before? Theirs comes with 2 big pieces with some berries, syrup and 3 big pieces of bacon. It costs less than most of their other items and it's the best thing on the menu IMO. So Get THE FRENCH TOAST, come with just a few people and make a ressie and ask for a table outside if you're lucky and finish off with their yummy gelato. It will make for a much better experience!

Reviews.Author: Yael S.
Reviews.Content: It was the first time I went to a roof top bar in downtown LA and I loved it there! The Perch overcame my expectations, the views from this bar are absolutely incredible, the city looks gorgeous. I went there with a few friends to take some drinks on a Saturday night and it was pretty crowded, but we still were able to walk around without problems. The roof is not too big, and finding a place to sit is pretty much impossible. After a couple hours there we were able to sit around a fireplace and it really made my experience so much better. It was getting chilly up there.There is a big parking lot right in front for $6 flat rate. Not bad considering you're in downtown. I expected it to be worse.

Reviews.Author: Megan H.
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this is the place. We find it almost irristable to pass up a visit when walking around DT; if even just for a cocktail and a brief "taking-in-the-view" moment unique to penthouses, roof-tops, and mountain peaks. The food is fabulous, and the happy hour is fantastic. At night Perch is the perfect place for a romantic dinner for two, or an intimate group dinner and drinks. It seems like the perfect place for a private party too. The live bands I've seen have all been Jazz / blues / french-contemporary. Not much room for dancing, but no one in LA ever dances anyway. The door man is a really great guy too. Very nice to chat with outside the first elevator. Dress code enforced at night, men.

Reviews.Author: Caitlin P.
Reviews.Content: Come here early because the line gets ridiculously long. I recommend arriving before 9. If u have reservation at the restaurant,  I think you are able to skip the line and go straight to the dining area, if ur table is ready. Drinks are strong. The mac and cheese and brussel sprouts were really good. Its a bit more spacious than the rooftop bar at the standard hotel. But I think u get the same view at either place. Vibe at standard is a bit more hip while perch has an old school feel

Reviews.Author: Danielle E.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner and drinks. I was beyond amazed by the breathtaking rooftop view of downtown. You can see the whole city lit up. I can't wait to come back. Their food was good too. I would make a reservation so that you can sit outside-the inside is kind of dark.

Reviews.Author: Lennon M.
Reviews.Content: Meh. The outdoor eating area has fantastic views, but the food is sub par at best. For a $150 dinner for two, I'd expect much more. Service was accomodating, but a bit snarky.My wonderful gf brought me for a bday outing. Wish we would have gone to Chili's instead.

Reviews.Author: Roland R.
Reviews.Content: LA has SO many brunch spots from bottomless mimosa deals to AYCE menus that it's hard to pick a place.  Well here's why you should go with Perch!- AMBIANCE!  It's a rooftop restaurant with a wide open feel, very chill & NICE VIEW of DTLA.  The staff are easy on the eyes and friendly (at least most of them) and the clientele are not hooligans.  - BRUNCH FOOD is VERY GOOD and REASONABLY PRICED (most dishes are in the teens).- They have a bottle of sparkling from France (but not the Champagne region) for $15 and it's PRETTY GOOD!  - LIVE MUSICPerch is also good for DINNER.  While I admit that the food at dinner time is sometimes hit or miss here are some of the dishes that were a solid HIT! - Baked Brie - very good- Pork Belly (yelp.com/biz_photos/perc…) - AMAZING, I love my SWINE and they do it RIGHT here!!!- Bacon Mac & Cheese - fantastic, specially with the.......wait for it.......SWINE!- Truffle Poutine - my wife is Canadian (read - poutine expert) and she LOVED this- Steak Frites - good quality beef and nice flavorAND for the big MISS, the ahi tuna tartar.  But then again, you don't go to a French restaurant for tuna tartar!  That's my bad!  Cocktails and glasses of wines were in the low teens.Bon Appétit!

Reviews.Author: Neha C.
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE SERVICE! we reached 15 mins early and said we would wait for a table outdoors. The hostess had us wait for 40 mins at the bar, where I ordered a bottle of wine, was given the wrong one (which was actually a cheap $6 bottle they were charging $30 for- was not even on the list it was the by-glass wine) when we received a text saying our table was ready it was actually inside so at this point I was mad! told the manager about the wine situation (they refused to give me the wine I ordered and let me pay the difference) and the fact that we waited over an hour for a table that was inside. Anyway, 15v more mins later we were seated outside and the manager came as said he would send me our bottle on the house. NO YOU IDIOT, I already paid for the wrong bottle so it was not on the house, just $10 difference that was free. Anyway, my time is worth more than that! we ordered the food which was disappointing to say the least. The golden beet salad with blue cheese had all stems and no cheese and maybe a single piece of a golden beet. $300 later I can tell you I was guilty I didn't feed all the homeless people in downtown LA instead of throwing my $ away at this place with the MOST incompetent staff I have ever seen in the restaurant industry.

Reviews.Author: Genny C.
Reviews.Content: Luckily I came here relatively early on a Saturday night! By the time we left at 11PM, the line was all over the block. Came here for a quick drink after rejected by another bar because we do not meet its dress code (landed straight from SF - did not expect to go to a bar). Luckily, Perch was a lot more reasonable! The place consists of two floors - the highest two floors of the building. The lower floor mainly consists of the dining area with the outer patio for drinks. The second floor, where I was at, is a patio bar. Beautiful view and wonderful atmosphere.Would highly suggest this place for a chill drink!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy S.
Reviews.Content: The hostess staff needs to step down off their PERCH and be a little less snotty. Last time we were there, we didn't have a reservation. We came with friends for drinks before dinner nearby and were told (with attitide) we needed a reservation to sit on the patio. Today we called to make reservations for drinks on the patio this weekend and the holier than thou hostess informed us Perch doesn't take reservations for the patio. When we explained our previous experience, she whipped out that Perch attitude and said we had it wrong. OK... dont worry Perchie People, you don't have to work so hard to get us to never come back.

Reviews.Author: Sandy D.
