Reviews.Content: I have been here for brunch and for drinks at night and I really like the location.  It's in a beautiful building in downtown la and has a great outdoor patio.The brunch portions are a bit on the smaller side but all very tasty.  We got the baked Brie to share and it was very good.  We also got the muffin plate.  It was simple but great quality.For my entree I got the three egg omelette and it was good.  It only comes with potatoes.  I added a side of turkey sausage.  My friends got huevos rancheros and it looked great.The pitcher of sangria was very good.  $20 and it made about 5 glasses.Parking was across the street on hill dt. for $5.There is also a metro stop right there.

Reviews.Author: Jessica M.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to have a few drinks after dinner and she suggested we go to Perch. When we got there it was quite busy, and we were after a place to sit outside, we were lucky enough to be helped by the wonderful Michael. He found us a beautiful seating area, right next to a fire pit with some amazing views! Michael is an asset to Perch and was so helpful! We would definitely go again because he made the experience that much better for us.

Reviews.Author: Jade R.
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews but after the service I received I felt compelled to. We visited Perch to celebrate our anniversary. We were seated quickly and our server, Chris, approached us right away. He was so nice, attentive and helpful, he made suggestions and explained the dishes and answered the questions I had. We ordered The tuna tar tar, steak frites, scallops and creme brûlée. The food was absolutely amazing! Chris went above and beyond for us, he refilled my water probably 5 times (yes, I drink a ton of water!) and always had a smile on his face. He also gave us some great tips on places to go in LA and really made our meal enjoyable. Top notch service, incredible food and a great view! I'll be back! Thanks for making our night so special!

Reviews.Author: Mya G.
Reviews.Content: I came here with my boyfriend for his birthday for Sunday brunch and over all the experience was pleasant. We were greeted right away upon reaching the 15th floor and although we were 35 minutes early for our 1:15pm reservation, we were seated right away. I ordered the French toast and my boyfriend ordered the Shrimp scampi, the French toast was phenomenal. It was prepared croissant style with fresh fruit on top. The only issue was that at times the waitress was slow on service. I asked for a refill of my coffee about 3 times before it was actually refilled and the waitress seemed to be over booked. Overall, i didn't mind asking for my coffee more than once, the view is completely stunning and the ambience of the restaurant was breath taking.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P.
Reviews.Content: Spent my birthday with my girls at Perch. The food is amazing, great ambiance, music and view! Highly recommend this place! Thanks Perch for making it such a special night.  XO

Reviews.Author: Maria G.
Reviews.Content: I would have given this place 5 stars for their nice decor and amazing view of dtla, but had to take out two stars for their ridiculous line that we had to wait in for almost an hour (and I HATE waiting in line!). I guess if you are a resident of dtla (i.e Evo condo's) they'll let u right in. BUT there's another line to go up to that takes you to the rooftop bar (and there's no cutting in line for this one). So if you don't want to wait in line, go there early like at 9-10pm and no later than 10:30 or else you will be looking at 1.5 hours of waiting. Didn't get a chance to have dinner here but def. will be back here to check out their food, and hopefully I'll be able to add more stars to this.

Reviews.Author: Tuanni P.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved Perch! Yesterday was my second visit for Brunch. With $25 pitchers of Sangria, live music and a great selection of food iys hard to not feel satisfied. On my visit yesterday I was more than satisfied.I made a reservation ahead of time and requested to be seated close to the band. Although I was 20 minutes late the host still made that happen. I had a party of 10! The service was great, both friendly and attentive. The food was better than I excpected. On my first visit i had the baked brie. Not prepared very well and i was not impressed. This visit I ate the Steak Frites. DELICIOUS! The steak was cooked perfectly Medium and was served with chessy truffle fries. Everyone at my table was happy with their selection. I especially liked and also the main reason for my second visit with 9 friends rain or shine was Mia Sykes! This singing diva is amazingly talented. Let me just tell you she sang  a Fifty Cent rap. She sings a lot of cover songs and makes you forget that they are not her original songs.The bonus was Aston Kutcher and Mila Kunis. Its always nice to see celeberties dining in the same place as you. Gotta love LA! Btw, they were down to earth, frienndly and low key.

Reviews.Author: Bertha B.
Reviews.Content: We had 7 pm reservations and we weren't seated until 730! The food was very under seasoned.....the wait staff was non existing, but the busy boys were in pint with drink refills. Good thing I always carry tapatio in my purse!!

Reviews.Author: Scott S.
Reviews.Content: I've been here several times. When they first opened, I thought everything was great. The drinks were tasty, the view was awesome, and it wasn't ridiculously crowded. As the word got out, Perch got more and more popular. Good for them, but bad for us. It turned into a pretentious place with a rude staff.Bottom line... the view is great, but the staff is extraordinarily (and unapologetically) rude.

Reviews.Author: Mark F.
Reviews.Content: In a town full of restaurants with mediocre to poor service this place brought poor service to a new level.  I'm at a loss for words from the hostess to waitress to bartender.  I've never had a sense that people carded less.  And the food was mediocre at best to a short rib dish that was entirely void of flavor and totally mis-cooked.

Reviews.Author: Jorge A.
Reviews.Content: I went there for Happy Hour on a Thursday afternoon on the rooftop. The crowd started to trickle in at 7pm. It was a nice evening in Los Angeles and a lot of people were at the place. As the night went on, we got hungry and went downstairs. I had the Steak Frite which was reasonably priced. I got my dinner and lets just say I will be back just for that dish. The steak came with a delicious side of garlic type fries. We  then left and continued our night at another  nearby establishment.. A good place to socialize and catch up with friends.

Reviews.Author: Jenny K.
Reviews.Content: it seemed that the elevator took forever to get to the lobby. we waited and waited...i even asked the guy if there was only one working elevator. nope, all three were working. going up was okay. we get to the 12th floor. then are redirected to another elevator to the 15th floor. greeted by friendly hostesses, we check out the bar, see that there are tables, then walk out to the patio area to see the view.then we decided to sit at the bar area. before we decided to visit perch, i called to see if there was happy hour (it was a saturday). the lady who answered the phone replied, "yes, we have happy hour from now (4:05pm) until 6pm". then when we go to the bar, the bartender told us that they didn't have happy hour on weekends. she was knowledgeable about the drinks. we had a drink and the mixed nuts. couldn't stay too long since we had to tend to the metered parking. now, the elevator ride down took forever (no wonder we waited in the lobby for such a long time to get up). stopped at 11, 8, 5, 2... there was no one there. the elevator just stops. in fact, on floor 11, there was just some plastic wrap. we didn't know if it was really a floor or not. we'd like to go back from brunch someday. 3.5 stars

Reviews.Author: Imran H.
Reviews.Content: So maybe Saturday at. 10 pm isn't the best time to go. Line is long and moves at a snail's pace. We got in after 30 min. , but only because we knew someone who lived locally. Once your in it's definitely a swank little joint with a Gatsby feel to it. There are places to sit, but you need to be seated. The line to the 16th floor was ridic so we decided to get a table outside on the 15th floor and order some food. Bad call. Waited for about 15 minutes and no one came to our table. Fail. There must have been a miscommunication, but either way it was no bueno to say the least. We left and decided to lineup to meet our party upstairs.  The line was actually moving this time. Once we got up there the it did not even seem that crowded.  Typical. I'm sure they have rules and regulations to follow *eye roll*. Seemed a bit over hyped to me.One thing not hyped was the view. The scene was refreshing and it made LA look that much better from where we were at. The fireplaces added a chill vibe and fit the scene to turn up an "L" if your about that. The bar was much less crowded on the 16th in addition. Cliche " I wanted to like this place" quote had to be dropped, but I really did. It was just ok and seems better to be at on a less busy night when the service may be a little more on par. I will have to come back on another night,  maybe earlier.

Reviews.Author: Lenna D.
Reviews.Content: Do not expect to be seated at the time, or near the time of your reservation. It's amazing how many reviews I just finished reading about the horrible service and issues with reservations. For my bday this past June, my husband made reservations for us and a few friends. Well, as it turns out, this place is definitely not the place you should invite a large group of friends and expect to have a good time. There were 10 in my group...we had reservations and they didn't seat us until about over 2 hours after our time. UNACCEPTABLE. We all were chatting and drinking leading up to the point that we sat down. Then, a server spills an entire glass of water all over me!!! That was it...after being seated for about 10 mins, we all decided to call it a night and get the hell out of there. We were all starving. The manager was trying to apologize, but there's nothing you could have said to us to change our moods at that point. It was horrible because my husband felt like it was his fault that I had a crappy evening...it wasn't his fault.I do blame the owners/management of this place since obviously they ARE NOT READING THEIR YELP REVIEWS. It's not just me, there are other bad reviews out there for your consideration.I've never given a bad review and felt that I could help others out by sharing my horrible experience here at Perch.

Reviews.Author: Diego G.
Reviews.Content: Good food, but bad service. Hostess was till haughty for my taste. I'm all for fine dining, but they were a bit rude and we had to pretty much fight for our table by the ledge. Not a pleasurable experience. Pity too because the food and setup is all very tasteful. Need to work on hospitality.

Reviews.Author: Julie M.
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Perch four times now and it seems to me the management has failed to instruct their hostess to show kindness and respect to the patrons who who try to squeeze in this joint.  Unfortunately, this establishment gets overly crowded and so these talentless flock of LA high life wannabes are left to exact skills to coordinate In which they don't have.  Once, I waited for a table that never happened. As I was leaving, the group of haggard hostess standing straight faced and important, I said to them, "thanks for the table" (as if). One little pigeon shrugged her shoulders as though she "knew" but didn't care.  I will be pleased to see the Perch under new management one day. It will happen since I am only one of many who are offended by the pretentiousness of this faux upscale hangout.  I've visited places that make the Perch look like a dive bar, yet treated with respect and dignity.

Reviews.Author: Chanel C.
Reviews.Content: God knows I love a good rooftop bar. The view from up top is breath-taking both at night and during the day. Downtown just looks so spectacular when you aren't walking on the ground level by all the homeless people and trying to dodge the urine on the ground. The view is better, air smells fresher, and the people don't live on skid row.I can honestly say that Perch makes an AMAZING BLOODY MARY. The flavor is complex- sour, salty, spicy, sweet, and smokey. I don't know where the smokiness comes from, but man...it's good. My boyfriend's office is on the 2nd floor of this building so I come here quiet frequently. I'm not the biggest fan of the bougie crowd that comes here, and this places turns into a clusterfuck (with a line around the corner) at night...but nonetheless, it's beautiful.

Reviews.Author: Ashley H.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING VIEW! Great place to grab drinks and dinner. They had a small band playing that was absolutely amazing! I went on a Wednesday and it was still really busy. We still got our food and drinks in a timely matter. We made reservations so we got seated right away. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Anthony N.
Reviews.Content: It's a good place for happy hour and beautiful view especially during sunset . It gets crowded and loud so be ready for that but I've had a pleasant experi

Reviews.Author: Lynn C.
Reviews.Content: Great place to have brunch at. The food, service, and music was great. Love the energy and atmosphere the restaurant gives. Be sure to make reservations and arrive on time before they give your table away.

Reviews.Author: Sonya T.
Reviews.Content: It's no secret, j'aime Perch! Been coming here for years. I must write a short review from this weekend, just to say:Awesome DTLA rooftop lounge. Always a breathtaking view of the city.Great live music. Order the truffle fries. Seriously, order the TRUFFLE fries.Cheese plates and Charcuterie.Always a good looking bunch.I'll never get weary of that Parisian charm.

Reviews.Author: Solomon J.
Reviews.Content: No cover,  short line,  what more can you ask for? Two levels for your viewing pleasure!  Staff is friendly and courteous!  Must see!!

Reviews.Author: Steve B.
Reviews.Content: The place is nice and has a nice view.  Tables are small and crowded and not very comfortable at least for me.The food was good and our waitress was very nice.The location isn't that great and parking was expensive.  I was told they had valet after 7pm, but we were early so we had to park at the lot across the street.Not a bad place, but nothing that makes me want to go down town for.

Reviews.Author: Rosemary T.
Reviews.Content: Friday night my friends and I celebrated a surprise birthday dinner. We had an awesome time. The staff that assisted us were very friendly. Joy was our lovely host who was on her 2nd day of training. She happily led us to our table. Because it was a birthday and none of us have been there before, we purposely chose this place because of the "scenic view" and reviews based on yelp. We were sat near the door which we were more hoping to have a "view" that everyone was raving about on yelp. I asked our host if it was possible if we could be seated on the patio for the rooftop view. Although it was her 2nd day and she was unsure of the availability, she was awesome with her customer service and willingness to find out. She reappeared with the ability to give us a nice patio seat. Thank you JOY!When we arrived to our new table,  we were very hungry, but cold at the same time. Thankfully Corey, the restaurant manager, came over to our table to see how his customers are doing...we were doing awesome, except our birthday girl was super cold. I asked if there was a way we could move to the direct corner (best seat table in the patio in my opinion) with the 2 heaters. He immediately made it available for us! How awesome was that?! No hesitation. He just replied, "let me help you transfer your stuff to the new table." Corey took care of all of our needs. Checked on us every so often making sure we are all good. Thank you Corey!As for our server, Ashley was awesome. I especially had a bunch of questions regarding food and drinks. She suggested excellent wine. I loved both the red and white wine she suggested. When it came to desserts, she also suggested the bread pudding for our birthday girl - which was awesome and buttery. She was very prompt and didn't leave us hanging, always making sure our water and wine was filled. She was pleasant, honest, and kind.The Perch was the bomb! Thanks again!Also, I'm not sure if they always have a band/music every night, but that Friday night, there was a band.

Reviews.Author: Grace Y.
Reviews.Content: A good place to have a get together or a bday party.Food is whatever's. Tried to shrimp and grits, pork belly, bibb and bleu salad. Overall, food is salty and overpriced. You're pretty much eating here only in order to reserve a table for later on the night.Asides from the food, it's a great place to have a couple of drinks. Classy with a great view of downtown.

Reviews.Author: Christopher S.
Reviews.Content: We went to Perch for a second time last weekend and as always the food, service and ambiance was fantastic. It is not cheep (spent a good chunk of change) but in my book good things are not cheep and cheep things are not good. With that being said I would have given 5 stars here. Unfortunately we had a an interesting experience at what became the end of our dinner. Once the bill came we paid it and the manager (I think) came over and asked us to vacate the table. I get that we had a large(r) party and we took awhile to order but that seemed like a logical thing to do since we have an early eve reservation. It was a very nice eve with good friends so spending a bit over a few drinks felt appropriate. It all just seems like it was handled poorly (abrupt). This is a great place to eat and the atmosphere is fantastic. Just don't stay too long... What, too passive aggressive?

Reviews.Author: Pier H.
Reviews.Content: The ambiance here is wonderful but my meal was a bit disappointing. If you come for the view and live music you will have an excellent time. We were celebrating a birthday and made a reservation for four. They wouldn't seat us until our entire party made it there which I thought was unusual but not a big issue. Once seated we had the appetizer meat and cheese plate which was good. Our entree's were a little but if a different story. Two of us had the little bunny frou frou which is a ravioli dish made with rabbit meat. It tasted great, however all we got was a taste!! There were about 6 small sized ravioli's in the dish which were just enough to cover the bottom of the bowl it was served in. We were still really hungry afterward. The plate was more like an appetizer than a main course. The other dishes ordered were the fish which was ok and a steak which was very good. We ordered desserts which were all pretty good, and the drinks were nice as well. The view here is killer. Go for that and the drinks and you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Author: Michi S.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Great service from the hostess waitress and even security lol. I ordered the steak frites and that was DeeLish! Cocktails were great too. After eating we went to the bar on the roof and they had music and mingling. And great view of dtla! I will definitely come back!

Reviews.Author: Paula N.
Reviews.Content: Where else can you get a beautiful view of the city without paying a hefty price just to go in? Perch gives off the grown-up sexy feel, not to be compared with typical venues in DTLA. If you're looking for something more intimate, this is a great place to go. Just be prepared, the wait to get in may be long, and the trek to the top (15 stories up!) may be quite a trip in itself, but the spectacular rooftop view makes it all worth it. There are bars on the 13th floor, and rooftop, so there'd definitely not an excuse to be without a drink. I didn't get to dine in, however, by the looks of Perch on a Saturday night, make sure to place a reservation in advanced, as this place is packed!Attire is dressier than most locations in LA. So dress to the nines and enjoy a beautiful night in DTLA!

Reviews.Author: Bryan C.
Reviews.Content: Lovely gem hidden on top of a building. Very nice atmosphere, I believe it is 21+ with some family group exceptions. The food was amazing!! I had the filet mignon with rosemary baby carrots and asparagus. With a side of poutine! Everything served quick and perfect! Not a single bad thing to say. Our waiter, was frequently checking in and making sure the evening was well taken care of.

Reviews.Author: Ryan M.
Reviews.Content: This is a follow up to my previous review (which evidently was deleted).Ok this experience just gets odder and odder by the minute. A vertically challenged person dressed as cigar-smoking Cupid just came hopping around shooting people with invisible arrows. Is this Beacher's? A nightmare? How on earth is this place billed as a classy establishment?  I'm all about banter and having fun but this is straight WEIRD.It is now 10:15 (reservations were for 8:45) and we're still waiting at the bar with my lovely date!Perch mgmt should personally reach out to each couple that was seated over an hour late with a formal apology IMO. We saw some couples getting comped drinks from the maître d -- wasn't clear why some received this treatment and others did not.

Reviews.Author: Janet T.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this place. My girlfriend and I celebrated our birthday there in December, we were pretty satisfied. As you walk in, you notice the interior design, the dim lighting and everyone just in there on world enjoying this place. Great atmosphere!!The night we went, Tuesday, they had a live jazz band, they were really entertaining! They have outside seating which looked lovely. I actually had reserved for outside seating but was seated inside. It wasn't a big deal tho, plus it was a bit cold outside. I didn't get much to drink at the bar but everyone that was sitting there looked pretty happy and loving the drinks. Our plates were pretty boring but didn't taste so bad. I wish they can add more the plate to give it a little more umph. but overall, I would eat there again. Definetely would go back!! Really loved the view of the city, loved the lighting and the atmosphere!!

Reviews.Author: Taurus H.
Reviews.Content: I took my mother for dinner.  We had reservations at 6:15 on a Wednesday and were offered our choice of inside or outside - we chose outside next to a fireplace.  We were seated immediately.  The waitress and other staff were attentive and unobtrusive.  The food was good.  I had filet mignon with asparagus and little potato things and my mom had steak frites.  I liked mine and she liked hers.  Quality of meat was good.  Drinks were good - we were not adventurous and had standard cocktails, but there are a world of newfangled drinks to explore.  Wine list was broad.I had been managing my expectations for dinner based on the number of reviewers that were underwhelmed with the food - but we had a great experience.  As others have noted, views were beautiful.Good place to park is underground at Pershing Square.

Reviews.Author: Scott M.
Reviews.Content: From the beginning I knew this wasn't going to be a good place to eat. The amount of time it takes from being seated until your order is taken is a good indication of your dining experience, it was doomed. The semi-friendly staff and the view were the only good things about this perch. Saturday's brunch was horrible. The items ordered was the bread assortment, fruit platter and omelet. All totaling $32. The bread assortment was at least a day old (more likely two days old).  The unknown muffin was still wrapped in the vendors backing wrap, sunken, with a harden dried out top, the interior was so dry it fell apart. I imagine the blueberry item was once a scone but even if it was and even fresh, it would've been too dry then. The poor croissant, oh hell, how do I describe it's pathetic state...I won't because some things are better off staying dead. The framer's market fruit platter was more like the fruit left behind from yesterday's farmer's market....not even cold, the melons were so bad and mushy, the pineapple with brown edges weren't even a Dole standard, the berries, oh those poor berries. Ugh...The omelet, lets not drag out the unimaginable, so all I'll say is canned mushrooms!!!  With canned spinach!!!Never again, ever! Please head my advice and do not ever waste your time or money on this disaster of a perch. Maybe....one could think of perching here after seeing a full page ad in the LA Times appears apologizing for representing themselves as a restaurant. And the then announcing that the Perch is under new management and a new "real" executive chef has replaced the imposter wannabe.

Reviews.Author: Helen C.
Reviews.Content: Perch is a lovely rooftop bar with a great view of the city. The bartender was wearing  a bowtie and suspenders - I approve! I was worried it might be chilly but there were a few fire pits around. They serve fancy craft beers I haven't seen before. Overall, my first rooftop bar experience was great.

Reviews.Author: Phillip B.
Reviews.Content: I planned a surprise Birthday/Engagement party at Perch on Saturday, 3/8/14. This process began five weeks before the event. The coordinator for my event was Stella N. and she was AWESOME! Her customer service was way above average. Stella, who doesn't work on Saturdays, was there on my arrival to ensure everything was going as planned. Who does that?!?! She single handedly made this event one we will never forget. I had a table with 23 and everyone was impressed with the food, drinks, service and ambiance. I had read reviews from 2012 on Yelp and saw very mixed reviews which made me second guess my choice. I was informed that Perch in now under new management and many changes have been made. This proved to be true. The food was amazing! I cannot wait to visit there again as this place will always have a special meaning to me and my Fiancé. THANK YOU STELLA!

Reviews.Author: Bella N.
Reviews.Content: We had the best seat outdoor by the clear glass overlooking the library. The view was breath taking. Its was my 30th bday. I was with my man on cloud 9.Than the food came..............I would say as bad as it gets. Embarrassing bad. They are lucky I didn't jump just so I don't eat the food.ohhh and the roof top smelled like a toilet pipe had burst. I was informed by a stranger that the smell is normal there since its a old building. Did I say this was all after spending $200Go enjoy the rooftop view and drinks. Stay clear of the food.EDIT: Just noticed the category for the food says French. LOLI stayed in france for a summer and the food here is DEFINITELY NOT FRENCH

Reviews.Author: Stella Y.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to come here for a year now and finally got my Perch fix! It was hard to find since it was narrow and in the middle of 2 giant buildings, but look for the sign with the bird. I got to the rooftop bar on a Friday a little past 6 when it opened and was able to choose which corner of seating I wanted. I was able to save a spot in the corner for my group with an awesome heating fireplace dome in the middle and a gorgeous view of downtown. I got the "french maid" which was refreshing and strong. I definitely felt it at the end end of the night so that was worth my $12. Selection was pretty limited. I think they may have more of a selection downstairs where the restaurant is. Overall, Perch made my Friday night nice and relaxing. I would love to chill here every week if I had the time. It's mostly for the ambiance but it would be a great place to come with a group or if you want to impress a date. The music was low and it wasn't loud, so I was able to hold a good conversation. Will be back!

Reviews.Author: Wendy V.
Reviews.Content: This place is overrated. Hear from everyone it's always hard to get in cuz it's packed, which is kinda of true. Took us awhile to get in. Met a girl there outta town on a visit and she told me the bar was rude so I didn't even bother going to the bar. That's the rooftop, the bar downstairs seems friendlier. This place...I'm still effy.

Reviews.Author: Jack G.
Reviews.Content: This place definitely has it's pro's and cons!PRO(s):- beautiful rooftop view of of downtown LA. (unique compared to other bars w/in the perimeter)- has a fireplace to keep your hands warm.- faculty is friendly.CON(s):- not many seats to accommodate everybody- pricey- had to sit there with couples swapping spit all around us. So it has a couples environment feel to it. Didn't feel appropriate to go there and just enjoy a drink with friends.

Reviews.Author: Tawny V.
Reviews.Content: Came here rooftop on a Sunday afternoon. They have a restaurant upstairs and a wrap around patio. Very nice view and on Sundays they have a band that plays anything! Staff was very helpful and the bartender was amazing! Their drink list is unlike any other. The only downside was the price of drinks were a little steep.

Reviews.Author: Cara C.
Reviews.Content: great rooftop, great bar, I think the food and waiter service was ok... but I love the roof for drinks!

Reviews.Author: Jojo L.
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for brunch because we had a large party.  It was a bit confusing because they emailed over the pre-fixe dinner menus and I asked if they sent over the correct menus, and they responded yes buuut then a few days later, Gerry, the manager emailed me separately their brunch menus- ehhh?  I also asked if they would be seating up indoors or out (because it was one of those swelter LA weekends) and they confirmed inside since we had such a large party but when we arrived then led us outdoors.  There clearly weren't any open tables inside at that time so I didn't say anything because I didn't want to wait even long so we just sweat it out under the umbrellas.  Luckily, the mimosas & sangria definitely helped.  I ordered the baked brie and shrimp scampi.  Brie was solid. I liked the scampi but the shrimp were a tad over cooked.  Finally, they took super long coming out with all of our desserts that half our party had to go downstairs to refill our meters and we just requested the 3rd course to-go! I had fun because we had a great group of friends together and enjoyed the view but the food was meh.  I'll echo the sentiments of my fellow yelpers: Ok for a special-ish occasion because of the "cool" atmosphere. Over priced if you're casually in the mood for brunch.

Reviews.Author: Erica S.
Reviews.Content: Dined here last night with 7 other girlfriends and had a blast! The food and drinks were yummy and the view was uh-ma-zing. ProsI had a peach-champagne drink (that my friend made up) and it was a hit!"Writers Block" - grey goose pear, saint germain, lemon juice, champagneBrussel Sprouts - bacon, soy sauce, oh and deliciousness. OMG, this is a MUST TRY!Pot-Au-Feu - braised short rib that is so tender you can pull it apart with a forkConsIt was very noisey and crowdedThe elevators you have to take to get up there are O-L-D, so bewareDrinks were served in those tiny LA glasses (that everyone hates)We had a wonderful server named Ashley that was cute as a button and gave us excellent service! So great that I had to compliment management about her. If you're reading this, THANKS, ASHLEY! We appreciated it.We dined here on a Thursday and it was super crowded from 8-9:30 PM. I can't imagine how cray-cray it is on a weekend night. Whew! I am glad that I was finally able to try Perch out. It's been on my "list" for a while now, and well, it DID NOT disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Floyd A.
Reviews.Content: Beautifully done interior. Great views from terrace. Decent service. Good was not good Meat was ordered well done - served pinkAnother meat ordered medium well - served redDessert - bread pudding (waiter said most popular) was DRY. To stop in for drinks might be the best option

Reviews.Author: Tristan K.
Reviews.Content: Just went here for my first time for brunch. The atmosphere was really nice and the location is fantastic. Sitting having drinks and brunch 15 stories up is great! We had no reservation so we had to wait at the bar for a bit so next time I would call ahead. Crab Benedict was great!

Reviews.Author: Diana V.
Reviews.Content: Sigh...This view is amazing! Was here for the first time this past weekend & let me tell you, it was f'ing great! :)First of all, I had to take the biggest piss of my life and the girls out in front let me skip that annoying line to pop to the ladies :) -Cudos to you for allowing my bladder in :). Lol. And also for letting my manly man escort me :)As soon as I handled my biz, we hurried to the bar to get some sip & off to the balcony we go. We sat right next to the fire when some A-shuns got up and slacked their seat :) It was perfect! We had an amazing view of our city. I really sat there and appreciated how lucky I am to live in such a beautiful place :) -Gay moment.Everyone need to come here before the cold hits us and the fog eats up all the lighting in these beautiful buildings. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.-P.S. The DJ needs to be a little louder.

Reviews.Author: Rob S.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is 5 stars - great rooftop restaurant in downtown LA.  The food is OK - maybe 3.5 stars.  Just about everything we ordered was too salty.  We ordered the surf and turf skewers, salmon, flat iron steak, short ribs, and scallops.  The portions were all very small.  We got the white chocolate bread pudding for dessert.  None of the dishes really stood out as being great.  The service was really terrible.  We would order drinks and our server would just forget them, then apologize.  We asked for water, extra napkins, and she forgot those as well.

Reviews.Author: Daisy K.
Reviews.Content: I parked at the Pershing Sqare lot, which is a flat $5/6 after 6pm. I had to orient myself a little to figure out where Perch was in relation to where I parked, but it's really just a few minutes to walk to the restaurant / bar from this lot.As others have mentioned, there isn't a large sign to guide you there, so in a sense you do feel like it's almost exclusive... Except for the part when you get up there and there's about 40 people waiting to get to the rooftop and another 20 waiting to get seated at their tables! Ha - so, if you want to eat, make sure you make reservations ahead of time!With reservations, we were seated within 5 minutes in the outside patio and had a great view of the downtown area. I'll be honest though - I've seen better, so I'm not sure why everyone's saying it's so amazing of a view when you can get a much better experience at so many other downtown establishments.We ordered:Ahi tuna tartar: delicious tuna tartare served with crispy wontons, green onions and avocado with ginger soy vinaigrette. A good light appetizer - but not outstanding.Little bunny frou frou (rabbit ravioloi) - A light portion of ravioli rabbit with carrots, parsnips and diced salami. It was really delicious but the ravioli was much less meaty than I expected. It was very light, but left me feeling hungry for more by the time I was done. Gnocchi: Served with mushrooms, asparagus, mint and sherry wine. Also a light portion, but the gnocchi was made perfectly and had a great flavor to it. Hemingway on the beach cocktail: gin based drink, which is light and dreamy. Bartender recommended this because of my penchant for sweeter drinks. It didn't disappoint!Writers Block: grey goose pear vodka, st. germain, lemon juice and champagne. Also very light, but heavy due to the contents of the drink. Still sweet with hints of fruit. After dinner, we stood in line for half an hour to go to the rooftop. Once we were there, we were pretty disappointed. I think this place has a lot of hype, but it was just a bunch of hipsters standing around and there was not enough seating for anyone. We left after 10 minutes and hung out at another local bar.Overall, the food was solid and so were the drinks, but I'm not sure I'd come back here again.

Reviews.Author: William M.
Reviews.Content: Perch is where you go to feel like you're a big-shot after watching the entire season of Entourage in one day. The rooftop is a trendy LA scene, and a magnificent view, as long as it's dark enough to not notice how smoggy the city is.Fantastic drinks, with the qualities that come along with quality: expensive, and takes so long to make that you wish you ordered two. If you're looking to chill out for a drink after work, take in the view and live music on the weekend with friends, or eavesdrop on 'producers' who only have their name accredited on YouTube, Perch is a good time. Just be sure to double-fist drinks ;)

Reviews.Author: Will W.
Reviews.Content: High up on the 16th floor, this place has great views of downtown. It's not the highest vantage point so there's random apartments that are around the building. If you're lucky/unlucky maybe you'll get a voyeuristic view of people having wild monkey sex while you're enjoying your cocktail. I went on a Thursday night and the atmosphere was good, there was a good number of people but it wasn't too crowded.  They have some interesting drinks on the menu with the cocktail prices about $12-15 . I liked their spicy cucumber cocktail, it was refreshing with a good spicy kick to it as well. They also have some pretty interesting and tasty desserts. I did not try their entrees so can't comment on that.The only thing that really marred my experience there was that the maitre d' or one of the hosts there was a bit of a douchebag who had a shitty attitude with our group that was uncalled for. -1 star for that.

Reviews.Author: Libia Z.
Reviews.Content: Before coming I would highly encourage you to make a reservation! If coming on Friday, Sat or Sun I would suggest even making it a day before! Everything I had to eat was absolutely delicious! Service was great! If you get a chance, check out the rooftop bar! The view is absolutely breathtaking!!!!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie R.
Reviews.Content: Perch transports you to a Parisian heaven! I absolutely loved the place :) RooftopViews, live jazz, amazing food and chic service. We ordered the French toast, best I've ever had, along with the burger, yum yum (but nothing exciting). Their brunch menu includes bottles of champagne, so we opted for the $15 bottle along with a side of the peach purée rather than than the OJ for mimosas. We got out of there under $70 bucks with tip! Afterwards we frolicked around the terrace and watched the live jazz band for a while. It was the perfect Sunday Brunch!

Reviews.Author: Brooke V.
Reviews.Content: Booked on OpenTable and they called to confirm reservation the next morning.  I then requested outdoor seating.  They placed us on the corner of the glass enclosed balcony near the live music.  Music not too loud, three performers, and very nice accompaniment to dinner.  Being in the corner gave us a GREAT view.  Highly recommend Sunset time as it allows you to see the LA skyline in the daytime and then watch it light up at night.  Such a lovely evening.  Have been there on a weekend before and came on a Monday night this time which was still crowded but much more preferable.  Food is a little rich for my taste and the filet mignon was a little more done than requested (medium).

Reviews.Author: Lauren H.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a happy hour. I loved the look and feel of the place. My champagne cocktail was delicious (fairly small, but at happy hour pricing I won't complain too much about that). I had the brie en croute but it was mostly pastry, albeit fine.I would like to come back here for a full meal, will update then.

Reviews.Author: Jack S.
Reviews.Content: Was fortunate enough to get a great table on the terrace next to a fireplace.  Amazing.  Perfect table between the view, the fire, and the clear chilly night.  Our food was good, the servers were good, and the manager made a genuine and sincere tableside visit.  The prices were very reasonable in relation to the value.  I ordered the steak and fries which was good, but I honestly wasn't even paying attention to the food as I was so caught up in the wine, my wife, and the view of the city.  Hard to get this table, and it was not the first one at which we were sat.  It took some convincing to get moved to a better table.  Other than that, 5 stars for sure.

Reviews.Author: Kylie L.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places you drop by mainly for the view. Located in LA's Pershing Square, you're whisked away from the rather grimey ground level to the sultry rooftop level with breathtaking views of the LA cityscape. Tip-Come for sunset and watch the sun go down to catch the best of both. The drinks were meh, I don't remember anything too special. The food was passable. We ordered the truffle fries and a couple of other things. Nothing stood out and would've been happier eating somewhere else. The inside lounge area is nicely decorated with vintage couches and a '20s feel. Stop by for a few drinks, take a few pics and then hit the town.

Reviews.Author: Ken T.
Reviews.Content: We were early diners and had a very romantic rooftop corner table. Our server was so great, offering recommendations and so enthusiastic about the menu- Sea bass and roasted chicken with mushroom risotto--- ooooohhh. Dessert, white chocolate bread pudding, was to die for! Perch is trendy, many young people, the bar was packed and we just loved it. It's in a wonderful old building that sports amazing original architectural features. The view is outstanding and we loved the ride up to the 15th floor in the original old elevator. Do make reservations, do dress nicely and do enjoy great food, great service and a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Emily P.
Reviews.Content: Of course, the view is gorgeous. I really liked the food. I had the rabbit ravioli and it was incredibly flavorful. My friend had the short ribs and the meat was so soft. I liked the drinks too. Pricey, but I didn't expect any less.  We also had the white chocolate bread pudding and oh my God, was it amazing. The one caveat was the service. Our server was nice but the place was just so busy, she wasn't very attentive and it was difficult to flag her down.

Reviews.Author: Jana A.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I heard about Perch from a family friend who told me it was a great place with awesome views and ambiance.  He was so right!  It was interesting trying to find it with no signage on the building. It felt a little like a top secret club or something.  When we got there and were directed to the elevator, we took it to the top floor where we were greeted by a hostess.  She was very nice and helpful; for that matter, everyone we encountered was wonderful.  Our server Liliana was very friendly and  gave us great suggestions.  When we told her that it was our anniversary she seemed genuinely happy for us (I know that is her job but it seemed sincere anyway).   (I should mention that we do not drink and I know that servers hate that because they figure it will be a small bill and tip).  Soon the manager (or assistant) Kristina came over and congratulated us also.  She had an appetizer sent to us which was terrific.  After our dinner on the terrace Kristina returned to see how we enjoyed the anniversary dinner.  We told her it was wonderful and she offered to take us to the rooftop lounge.  That was beautiful and what a view!  Since we don't drink, we didn't want to stay very long but what a magical night!  I can't wait for our next trip to LA so we can go back!  Kristina and Liliana made our 24th anniversary wonderful!  Thank you Perch!

Reviews.Author: Adiss E.
Reviews.Content: Such a cute place with nice views and plenty of room in the patio. Make sure to take a heavy jacket for your companion ;)

Reviews.Author: Fiona Y.
Reviews.Content: The view is spectacular here. The atmosphere is very upscale, ritzy but not cheesy if you know what I mean.. Come here for the delicious cocktails, mussels, celeb watching, and best view of the downtown LA skyline that a restaurant has to offer.$5 parking a block away in the public parking lot.

Reviews.Author: Henry O.
Reviews.Content: This is a really cool venue... if you can get in. It does not make sense how this place manages who gets in and who does not. I realize the place is a restaurant that turns into a bar at night, but it seems like a waste of your night if you wait in line. If you can get there early, please try to do so. If not, try eating here and just staying inside afterwards. The space is pretty limited for people that come here for drinks. There is a separate elevator once you are inside to get to the rooftop. There was another line for the so we decided to stay on the level before. I think this place is strictly for the view because there is nothing special with the drinks. If you can wait 2 hours in line and it won't ruin your night, give this place a try. If not, try other spots around the area which will accommodate you and your party a bit better.

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: Ascending to Perch is a fun precursor to a night of fun drinks in a classy atmosphere. I prefer the rooftop over the first level, as the first level seems more dedicated to people who wish to dine at Perch.The roofop is always full, but not packed...which is nice because it allows you to socialize without having to squeeze past people to move.An extra dirty vodka martini with three olives and a seat by the fire any night, please and thank you!

Reviews.Author: Jeannine R.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner to celebrate my birthday and I absolutely loved it! The ambience is very mellow and hip to say the least, but very much enjoyable. We sat in their balcony and the view of the city was gorgeous! I took so many pictures of everything, from the food to the view to the restaurant itself. I love how different it is and how classy it feels to be eating at the rooftop restaurant. Our server was very helpful and attentive. He made sure we were happy and comfortable the whole time. It's a romantic spot, but not the best for privacy. The tables are very close in proximity so you're able to hear the conversation right next to you, but it's still a wonderful experience. They also had live music when we dined there and it just added more "pizzaz" to the evening.The food is a little overpriced but I thought of it as paying for the experience. How often do you get to enjoy a rooftop dinner? I mean c'mon. So if you look at it that way, the prices made sense. We ordered the ahi tuna tar tar for our appetizer and it came with two sauces that paired well together. One may have been sirracha from what I tasted and the other helped balance out the heat and acid of the hot sauce. The tuna is served with crispy wonton tortilla chips as well. For my main course, I ordered the scallops which came served on a bed of lobster chunks and corn in a miso broth. I paired it with a white wine and it was completely divine. The seared scallop was cooked perfectly and I loved how the saltiness of the broth brought flavor and just the right amount of seasoning to the dish. My boyfriend ordered the steak frites, which was a flank steak served with an abundant amount of garlic aioli fries. The steak was tender and the fries were delicious. For dessert we ordered the white chocolate pudding served with fresh fruit. I thought it would be overwhelmingly sweet by the description I read in the menu, but it was just the right amount of sweetness that gave you enough desire to finish the whole darn thing.Our experience was enjoyable and we would definitely return for more!

Reviews.Author: Damaris A.
Reviews.Content: I was just here last night. We were invited to this bar by a friend, it was our first time coming. We werent aware of how fancy the place was so we werent dressed casual but were determined to have a good night anyways. Most of the staff was very welcoming, except for the very extremely rude bouncer that was managing the line for the 16th floor. Seriously he just yelled at our whole group because we were tying to get in line n told us to wait by the bar. I thought this was supposes to be a classy place. Im sorry it was our first time we were a little bit confused ):  it killed our vibe so we just left. Im sure its a great place to go other nights wen its not too crazy but never the less one rude emplyee can ruin the whole experience.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer A.
Reviews.Content: Picked Perch for dinner after a tradeshow. We had 8:30 reservations on a Thursday. The place was busy but not packed. Our table was waiting for us when we arrived. I made the reservation through Open Table and requested to be sat outside to enjoy their famous views. Our table was just barely outside. Next time I will ask to be seated near the fireplace. We had the pork belly appetizer, two glasses of pinot noir, steak frites, scallops and chocolate custard. Bill came to $125. Our server was helpful and allowed us to take our time. Being 34 I thought the place might be crawling with 20 somethings. It was a nice surprise to find a mixed crowd. The staff made me feel comfortable even though I wasn't wearing my 5 in CFM shoes! I can't wait to go back again for Sunday brunch with the girls.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa C.
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this 3 stars because of all the trouble we had at the beginning of our night at Perch. My girlfriends and I came here for the first time ever. We'd heard so much about it and were pretty excited to try it for our annual xmas dinner!We made a reservation because we wanted to sit outside. Although we were only 10 minutes late, someone had taken our seats and the restaurant did nothing to reserve it for us. We had to wait an entire hour before something opened up. The first hostess wasn't easy to deal with and made us feel like we were doing something wrong for wanting to sit in the section that was supposed to be reserved for us. Luckily the night turned around when a hostess named Malia graciously helped us to find another comparable seat. Our server Carlina was really great and suggested the best cocktails! The food was excellent, the ambiance was perfect and the view was unbelievable. I highly suggest making a reservation and be specific about where you want to sit. Of course be on time! I wish I could give this place 5 stars but the service in the beginning was pretty bad.

Reviews.Author: Veronica H.
Reviews.Content: Review for the bar only:Yes the drinks are pricey, there might be a line to get in, people dress to impress or casually cool but you get to mingle with some really nice good looking people. I have been to Perch a few times and I have never left disappointed. Great vibe, awesome music and the staff is fun. What else could you ask for?There are plenty of seats with no bottle service requirement. The view is great and I love this place! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Ruth V.
Reviews.Content: We always come here for desserts n appetizers plus the wines, great selections. The ever delicious pudding, oh my! my never ending craving is always satisfied. As usual, reservations is a must so u don't hav to wait. Their appetizers is one I say the best, of all the restaurants I've been n Dtla. Although its a bit pricey n servings r small, we always order double portions. The best of all is the customer service, I've been here 5x n its always a pleasurable experienced n well entertained. Plus the nice view n ambience, I always recommend this place to my friends

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn M.
Reviews.Content: If I could give this place a zero I would! I literally just order some dirks and the "bartender""some rude girl" at the roof top just argued with me. I ordered a drink and she looks at me and told my friend okay what do you want with a bitchy attitude..... Okay what is this place thinking hiring rude employees. I tried giving this place chances but I'm DONE! I will forsure tell my friends NEVER to come here! Worst customers services ever!!!!!!!! Don't spend your money!!!! I'm sorry that your freaking out that "your too busy" beyond pissed! And drinks are shitty! I could of done them myself

Reviews.Author: Stephanie G.
Reviews.Content: Last night was my first night at Perch and it was the most horrible experience. This place is horrible! Don't go! There's 3 lines you have to make to get to the stupid rooftop. Yah, I'm sure there's a nice view of DTLA but screw that I don't want to make lines that resemble Disneyland lines. We waiting about an hour in a half outside and we were very excited that we were actually inside and on the elevator going up. When we got off the elevator we noticed there was another line to get to the next floor. The 2nd line was long too! They try to distract you from worrying about the line by asking you if you want to buy a drink. Were 4 girls so we were obliviously tired of standing on our heels in the stupid lines. I very nice security sir gave us a chair to sit in while we wait. My friend was sitting in the chair for about a minute and than comes another security guy who said he was the head of security and literally pushed my friend out of her seat. He was VERY RUDE and VERY RUDELY told my friend "you need to get off now, get off! You are not suppose to be sitting here. Get off. I don't care what other people told you, I'm their boss so I tell them what to do and you have to get off". We were all astonished by his behavior. We understand that he didn't allow any sitting i guess but the way he talked to us was totally INAPPROPRIATE! He could of told us in a politer way and we would of been ok with it but his loud, rude, demanding tone of voice was out of line! I complained to one of the other workers and told him that its inappropriate to treat people like that specially after we've been standing the whole night making their stupid lines. We were so done with the place. Than they send us up another elevator and that still wasn't the rooftop because there was a 3rd line to make before we can actually get to the rooftop. We finished our drinks as soon as possible and decided to leave that fucking place. I will never go back to this place.If you enjoy making 3 long lines and waste about 3 hours of your life just to get to a rooftop than this is your spot. If you don't enjoy making 3 long Disneyland lines to get to a rooftop than avoid this place!! You can have such a better time somewhere else where you don't have to wait in 3 lines for 3 hours. AVOID THIS PLACE! ITS NOT WORTH IT! So to that security guard that was a total asshole to us... JERRY LEARN HOW TO TALK TO PEOPLE WITH RESPECT! TREAT OTHERS THE WAY YOU WOULD LIKE TO BE TREATED. SCREW YOU JERRY!I hate that to even post this yelp comment about this place I have to actually give them a star because in reality I wouldn't give them any stars. Probably WORST place in dtla.

Reviews.Author: Sonny T.
Reviews.Content: Ever since I came back from France, I have been on this French kick where I have developed an affinity for practically anything French or French related. I enrolled in a French class, started becoming a Paris-St.Germain fan for the sake of learning about Soccer, an palate for Bordeaux wines, French kissing random drunk girls (with their consent of course), fromage, and not bathing for at least a week. So upon my return I did some recon on places where I can take my new-found French friends to when they decide to visit our great city of Los Angeles. I have been looking to make a visit sometime here for quite some time, however I figured the first opportunity was the Thursday night right before Valentine's Day. I had a blind date that evening and decided to have my date meet me at the restaurant. Bar - Like girls always like to do, they like to run late; about 20 minutes late. Word of advice ladies, we don't like that. So I decided to get the party started early at the bar with a Pranqster Belgian; which was $8 bucks. I deducted half a point; because the bartender unfortunately wasn't as helpful as I would like, all I asked what beers they had on tap and he just handed me the drink menu and waited for me to make my decision. Poured the drink, didn't say thanks, just moved on to the next customer. I can understand he was busy, but I guess it wasn't something I expected for a establishment I had high hopes for. My date arrives and is a Cognac drinker, Hennessy and Coke was her choice and I reached for a glass Glen Livet 12 Year on ice. Bill was $30.00. I was down the hole at $40, so far including tip. Wait time - I didn't have reservations, considering it was Pre-Valentines night, my wait was about an hour and a half. Which I don't really think was bad at all. I am reading nightmares that other patrons cried about the wait time, I figured if you are with good company and the drinks are flowing; time flies. We opted to go upstairs to the top roof  bar which was a little more intimate and had an incredible view. Grabbed another round of drinks; she grabbed another Henn and Coke, I decided to go with their Mojito which rocked. Round knocked me back another $40. I am already down $80 and I haven't ate a single bite yet. Dinner - Received a text from the maitre'd letting me know that my table was ready. Got a great table on the north side of the building with lit candles and right next to side of the building. Amazing view. Got introduced to our waitress who was a total doll and extremely attentive despite being extremely busy that evening. We decided to stick with mainly appetizers since we were probably getting full on liquor. 1.) Baked Brie - $8.00/ I've had Baked Brie at so many restaurants to this point, there wasn't much I felt that made it stood out. Its a simple appetizer and I make it on occasion at home. I guess its just a staple that I have to get every time I go to a French restaurant. 2.) Truffle Poutine - $12.00/ It was great wherever our fries had sauce, but I felt that they kind of skimped on the sauce as we left most to the plate full of fries at the end of the dinner. 3.) Pork Belly - $12.00/ Oh my Gawd, WTF, its as if Angels came down from Heaven and made it themselves. This dish was the belle of the ball. Sure, its probably all fat, but the richness in the sauce makes me smile just thinking about it. I am ordering this again, the next time I come back!!4.) Ahi Tuna Tartar - $16.00/ I always fall for Tartar and they do deliver it here at Perch, sauce wasn't overwhelming or too sweet how you have to put up with an Asian fusion dish. 5.) Bread Pudding for Dinner - $10.00/ White Chocolate Bread Pudding done A la'mode. I don't remember my date eating it because I gave here the Heisman when it arrived on the table. I ordered another night cap to help sober me for my drive home with a bit of Kahlua. The bill came out around $78 after tax and we left our server with a nice tip.Ambience/ Service -  I love the view of the city and it doesn't get any sexier with a classy dinner if you are hoping to impress your other half. 90% of the staff was awesome and super friendly from the doorman to my server. Other than the bartender at the first bar, who I think may have gotten mugged on the way to work, I can't complain much else about the service. But here is where I deduct the last half star. During that evening, there was a live band outside doing covers on Sade, sexy, I can dig it. Followed by a DJ playing some light house music. This goes to the DJ, how do you go from house to playing Michael Jackson to the Cure followed by Justin Bieber. I get the Michael Jackson, because there are old people that eat there and think they are still cool by slurring the words to PYT. I love the Cure's Lullaby; but why in the World would you go from something great to Bieber and that Baby song. I should have just gone up and round housed the DJ off the 15th floor. I will return, hopefully the DJ hasn't.

Reviews.Author: Sayla E.
Reviews.Content: I had my Birthday here with 10girls.  The place is so over rated!! You have to walk up from one elevator to another elevator to get to the damn place-ladies wear flats! Dinner services took forever! Everyone was starving!!  The bouncer was a total jerk, he made everyone form a long line for nothing in order to get to the rooftop-when few of us got to the top to check it out...it was basically emptied??? So we all ended up leaving....I guessed maybe its a place to take your date-so better make sure she/he is worth it! The good thing about this place...beautiful view!!!

Reviews.Author: Becky B.
Reviews.Content: Today was my first at Perch. I loved it!I had the French toast and it was super delicious and filling. I extremely recommend it, you could not go wrong with this dish.Not only do I really like there food but the atmosphere is awesome. They have live music that is very beautiful for brunch! I will definitely be retuning!!

Reviews.Author: Christine L.
Reviews.Content: Perch is beautiful, day or night. For first-timers, getting in might be a little confusing. Perch is located on the corner of 5th and Hill and the entrance to get to the elevators is on 5th street. You take the first set of elevator to the top floor, exit and enter another elevator that'll take you to Perch on the 15th floor. There's usually someone there to direct you. Or it's usually so busy you can just follow the crowd.I recently visited Perch for Saturday brunch and was pleasantly surprise at how nice and peaceful it was. I hear it gets busy during brunch, so I guess we came on a good day. There were plenty of tables available, but most of them had a "reserved" sign on it... so best bet is to call for reservations first. Also, if you don't want to be directly in the sun, request for a table with shade.I was also surprised by how much I enjoyed my meal. I ordered the baby beet salad, and if you're crazy about beets like I am... order this salad! Portion size seems tiny at first because there's barely any watercress included, but the beets are plentiful and ridiculously delicious. The beets are tossed with diced apples in a yummy vinaigrette and topped with creamy goat cheese. The rest of my group enjoyed their meal as well. The Perch burger is enormous, so a good choice if you've got a bigger appetite. French toast was super buttery, so you know that's gotta taste good too. Overall, great meal and great outdoor brunch environment. $15 bottles of champagne + $5 carafes of juice for mimosas. I personally prefer their Bloody Mary's and highly suggest you order one too.

Reviews.Author: Linna L.
Reviews.Content: Perch is now my favorite roof-top bar in LA. It's unpretentious, chill, casual, and beats the Standard in terms of being perfectly located by other tall buildings to block the sometimes summer winds.The ambience is also really nice and invites drinkers to really take it easy after a long day of work. Only came here for drinks, so can't say anything about the food. Can't wait to come back! Oh, and don't drive yourself crazy by looking for parking, just valet downstairs.

Reviews.Author: Thuyvu P.
Reviews.Content: Went outside my comfort zone and this place was a totally different atmosphere. This venue is obviously known for their unique view of Dtla which is amazing, but sadly me and my boyfriend got seated inside. The waitress was nice and funny, so good customer service. We ordered the tuna tartar for the appetizer and I personally couldn't get enough...the sauce was really delicious. For the main course I ordered the pan roasted chicken with mushroom risotto, the chicken was good but nothing special what won me over was the risotto, it was so yummy and flavorful... My boyfriend got the Boeuf Bordelaise I took a bite and the meat was soft, moist and delicious the side vegetable were seasoned well too. Overall good experience, we also went to the rooftop to relax and enjoy our drinks, the ambience was nice but it was crowded and we were lucky to find available seating to just take everything in... Lastly, My fair lady was my favorite cocktail!

Reviews.Author: Nichole P.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view of downtown LA. You are seriously on the rooftop of the building.Drinks are pretty price but what do you expect when there is no cover.Tip: get there before 10pm! The second line in the perch dining area can be long.

Reviews.Author: Maruko X.
Reviews.Content: On the rooftop of Pershing Square Building, old-fashioned yet dedicated facilities, with high ceiling and stylish dedications. Weekend nights required long time wait if you come around peak time like 11pm. Nice bartenders and adequate services. Gorgeous night view of Los Angeles, took only one star off because you have to bear with crowded people around. Recommend metropolitan, cranberry vodka, coconut martini, Long Island here.

Reviews.Author: Giancarlo R.
Reviews.Content: Great place for a rooftop brunch in L.A.!Went to Perch for brunch on a noon on Saturday.  It felt like a hole in the wall at first walking in as the entrance was not readily posted.  You walk into The building and into an elevator to the top floor.  Then you take one more elevator that takes you to the rooftop.  The atmosphere was perfect as there is an indoor area beautifully furnished with large walls that open up into the patio area.  As far as the food for brunch, they provided an array of breakfast items and had a variety of eggs Benedict which I did notice.   The food was cooked perfectly and the poached eggs were a delight.  I expected the prices to be high, but was dumbfounded to see that everything was priced reasonably for those dishes.  The service was also great.Definitely worth it for the views, atmosphere, and amazing service and food.

Reviews.Author: Leanne S.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 starsI have mixed feelings about Perch. I LOVE the location and the view is gorgeous, especially at night.The food is pricey for what it is, but not bad.If you come on a Friday or Saturday night, be prepared to wait in line or get there early, like before 9:00 pm.Do NOT have a birthday party here. I have had two friends that have had issues getting all their friends in even with reservations.But, the drinks are fun and not too overpriced (for downtown), they often have live music, and it's fun to be up amongst the city lights.I know several people who have gone for brunch and enjoyed it. Recently I stopped by Perch on a Saturday at about 1:00 pm and we were able to seat our large group in the bar on one of the couches and ordered mimosas and walked outside to enjoy the view. It wasn't crowded or too expensive ($15 bottle of champagne) and we had a nice time.So check it out, but plan accordingly so you have a nice experience!

Reviews.Author: Rex M.
Reviews.Content: First time at Perch, and we will be back. Only came for drinks last Saturday afternoon, but really enjoyed the atmosphere; and after looking at other posts here, will definitely order food next time.

Reviews.Author: T. James C.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to grab a drink in DTLA.  I live in Santa Monica and there is no better way to wait out traffic than watching the sun set from the rooftop of Perch

Reviews.Author: Maryia K.
Reviews.Content: Went here with a girlfriend to celebrate her passing the CA bar exam.There is a valet service Thurs-Fri, but because we went on a Tuesday, I parked at Athena lot on the same block.Take the elevator to the 13th floor, hop out, then transfer to another elevator to go to the 15th floor for the restaurant.The location is beautiful - the french decor, the bar, the view of DTLA. Keep in mind that you are only on the 15th floor, so you are looking up at many of the buildings. Definitely not the most impressive view of DTLA (check out the Standard), but lovely in other ways.We had drinks and hors d'oeuvres. The champagne was spectacular -  crisp and served with a blueberry in small 1920's style glasses. I also had the Writer's Block, a cocktail with pear vodka and champagne. It was delicious - very light and not overly sweet. For hors d'oeuvres, we had the pork belly and a watercress salad. The pork belly had a great crisp coating, and was expectedly fatty on the inside. The salad was good - fresh, but nothing exceptional.The service was fine - quick seating, the waitress forgot to take a second order of drinks, btu quickly apologized. Overall, a pleasant experience. I didn't try the $40 main entrees, and can't comment on the actual food. Worth checking out for the drinks alone.There is a bar one floor up that is worth checking out for the view - don't count on getting a seat on a busy night, however.

Reviews.Author: Shari B.
Reviews.Content: Awesome views of DTLA, great food, friendly staff, reasonable prices, and THEY HAVE OYSTERS! This is the perfect place to lounge on a Saturday afternoon with some great friends to just shoot the sh*t. Who doesn't love shooting the sh*t?! Yeah, that's what I thought.

Reviews.Author: Eunice L.
Reviews.Content: Come here to enjoy drinks while soaking in one of the best views and ambiances LA has to offer!TIPS:-After you pass the bouncer, enter the first elevator and go to the 13th floor (has a bird sign next to the number). Get out of the first elevator, enter the second elevator, and go to the 15th floor!-Come before 10PM to avoid the lines. They strictly enforce the number of people that can be up on the rooftop due to safety codes so when the rooftop reaches capacity, you can only enter when another person leaves.-There is a restroom (one male and one female) to the right of the bar so you don't have to go use the one downstairs.-For the girls who prefer sweeter drinks, they have Lindeman's Peche Lambic beer here, my favorite!

Reviews.Author: Michelle R.
Reviews.Content: To the owners of Perch LA,I wanted to write about my experience in your restaurant. My friends and I love to dine out at different restaurants in the city, this time we chose your restaurant as also to celebrate my sister's pregnancy. But sadly, our experience was traumatizing, I have never been treated with so much disrespect. We made reservations for six on a Saturday night at 8pm, my friends came in early and 3 of us were running late. Female staff assigned on the ground floor did not want to seat my friends who were there because the party wasn't complete, understood. My friends waited until we arrived at 8:20pm, we went up and the girls at the reception said that they gave away our table, saying it with so much arrogance. We were annoyed at this point. We chose not want to fight or talk back, they told to wait at the bar and once a table has opened up, we will be informed. We didn't want to ruin our night so we waited. 40 minutes later I received a text informing that our table is now ready... One of the male hosts which I failed to get his name (African-American with glasses), led us to our table and so we sat. Two minutes later, he came back and made us stand up again, since that wasn't our table. While, the other group who apparently is assigned on that table we're staring at us. It we're very humiliated! He told us that our table was the one on the far most corner, which is not even a table. It is a sofa, and has a fireplace in the middle and a side table size about 1 foot high! How are we supposed to eat there? He told us in a very condescending tone to accept that table or wait for like 3 hours because we missed our reservations. We left without making a scene because one of us is pregnant and so she needed to eat right away, but we demand an explanation from the male hosts other girls on the reception that was on duty July 13, 2013 between 7pm -9:45pm: 1. Why was our table given away when we were only late for 20 minutes, other people from our party were already there. We looked at other empty reserved tables and asked one of your staff how come other tables were being held for more than one hour? She did not have an answer.2. My friends were there 30 minutes earlier and other staffs from the ground floor did not let them come up because party was incomplete. Understood, the staff from the ground floor knew that the rest of the party was going to show up, why was our still table given away after 20 minutes? We all saw parties being sat down even though party wasn't complete. Again, your staff did not have an answer.3. I hope your staff and management treats everyone the same way, with the same respect they would like given to them. What made them think that we would accept that table which doesn't have an actual table? Did they really think we would eat an $80 meal on our laps or on a table few inches below our laps? We are not desperate individuals.We felt belittled and humiliated by your staffs. We have had excellent dining experiences in top restaurants, such as restaurants of Chef Batali's Osteria Mozza and Otto, Chef's Jose Andres' the Bazaar and Jaleo, Mastro's, Huntley's Penthouse, and Chef's Ramsey's Rooftop, to name a few. Clearly, the hosts, staffs and management at Perch are not at the same level of professionalism as those fine restaurants. I hope you will replace your staffs because not only did you lose our business that night, but also our respect. Thank you,

Reviews.Author: Jeannette K.
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice, and both times I was disappointed by the wait. Even with reservations, they made us wait over an hour and half. Then doesn't that defeat the purpose of making reservations? Every 15~20 minutes one of us would go and ask the hostess, and every time she would say that we're next. For over an hour and half? We did not get any apologies from the hostess. The food was disappointing and came out cold. I did not bother to send it back. Who knows how long that will take? It was my idea to bring my friends here on my second visit, and I actually felt embarrassed by suggesting this place. No go!

Reviews.Author: aloura c.
Reviews.Content: This has been one of my favorite places in LA for drinks and dinner and music for quite a while now, but our experience Saturday night just made me want to come back more often. Even though we didn't have a reservation for dinner and they were super crowded (the place is getting popular!!) we were able to get seats at the bar and eat from the full menu there. Hiatchi was our bartender and waiter and even though she was slammed, she was the MOST helpful, informative, and polite bar tender I've had in a long time. She knew what to suggest on the menu and she was always keeping an eye on us despite the fact there were so many people crowded around the bar to get drinks and she was making drinks for her servers to take to tables also. We dropped our napkin and she brought us a new set up without even being asked. Same with bringing us water glasses after our food arrived. This girl is a gem and I hope they know how lucky they are!The Cesar salad here is great for vegetarians because the dressing is very light and doesn't have anchovies. It's a different take on the Cesar because they sort of grill the Romaine a bit and it tasted GREAT!The pesto gnocchi was awesome as well... as was the baked brie. Just the right portions and light, not too heavy, despite the cheese etc.The rooftop bar was wonderful after dinner and we could hear the cool jazz band from below. We really enjoyed hanging out with our friends and the view.

Reviews.Author: Heather C.
Reviews.Content: Lovely location, horrible service.The rooftop patio area is lovely and we need more places like this in LA!  It is a nice place to hang with friends and chat.  The fire pits are nice. They need more chairs, though!I was very disappointed with how we were treated, however,  I couldn't get a reservation on a Wednesday night any earlier than 8:45, so my 3 friends and I hung out on the patio from 7:30 until 8:45.  We were starving, so 2 of my friends got a Subway sandwich nearby and wanted to munch on it until our reservation time.  They were told by a staff member they would need to leave if they wanted to eat.  What?  We had all bought drinks at the bar, so it's not like we had just wandered in off the street.  Very disappointing.After hanging out for over an hour, we went back down to the restaurant at 8:45, the time of our reservation.  First, we were told they didn't have me listed.  (I had checked in at 7:30 when I arrived!) Then they said they were just waiting for a table to free up.  30 minutes later, we hadn't been seated yet, so we decided to leave.  If we are going to spend good money on dessert and drinks, I expect to be treated a bit better.Disappointed.  It was my birthday too.  :(

Reviews.Author: S D.
Reviews.Content: You go here for the view, specialty drinks, and Rabbit Ravioli NOT for late night hanging out. All I could think of while eating the ravioli is a white fluffy bunny and I'm eating it. The flavoring of the dish was good and the texture of the rabbit is shredded meat. I HIGHLY recommend making reservations because you do not want to be waiting for a table and such.  Btw, you get free dessert on your birthday. I love this place for the restaurant part of it but NEVER AGAIN for late night.I went here for a friends birthday on a Saturday evening and NEVER EVER EVER EVER AGAIN!!!! I waited outside for 1 hour to get into Perch.  It took another 30 minutes to get to the 16th floor!!! A total of 1.5 hours waiting in line!!!!  Tell me how ridiculous that is!! This isn't a club and I still have to wait that long. I understand that it is a small place to begin with but when there are 8 people leaving and only 3 people going up how the heck does that make sense?!?!  The bouncers say they won't let people up because they're at capacity..I go up an there is so much space and I so not feel like I'm in a sardine can. I suggest getting a drunk at the main bar so you can have something while waiting in line to head up to the top. Another thing that was aggravating was while waiting in line there's someone who tells the bouncer "I have so and so here with me" and then 7 people go inside while you're still waiting in line.

Reviews.Author: Myles R.
Reviews.Content: I felt it was time to write a review on this spot as I have been here more than a few times and will be back again this evening.If they had 3.5 stars I'd pick that as the option as a side note.  The reason I did not give four stars?  I can't think of one.  I may change this at a later date.  It may be that there are many great establishments downtown and I have become more critical.  I like this place for a number of reasons.  It is very easy to get to via the METRO (either Red or Purple line), just get off at Pershing Square.  It is less of a walk than a football field length.  From 7th St Metro Center it is one stop toward Union Station, a very easy trip.Music.  They have a nice calendar of live music.  While I may be a 1965-1969 San Francisco acid rock and blues fan and not much of a jazz fan there are times when I desire to see real instruments being played by real musicians.  They book some great folks here.The staff.  Everybody is terrific and they are on top of their game even when it has been crowded.  The view.  Impressive view from the 15th and 16th floor is one reason for many folks coming to this spot.  As a side note, there are many great places in So Cal that have views equally as impressive.  A few block away at Takami / Robata you will find spectacular views as well from the 21st floor.  One aspect of the view that many other spots may not
