have, even if they are higher, is that Perch is not a building dwarfed by large buildings next door.  The views are quite impressive and it is a great spot to take somebody you wish to show Los Angeles if they are from out of town.  This is also a great date spot or special occasion spot.  The place is classy.  Upscale but not stuffy.  I lose my flannel shirts and generally opt for a business shirt and sports jacket.  Work boots are replaced by western boots for the night.  Heck, if I can get married three times in western boots they an be worn anywhere. ;)There is indoor and outdoor seating and the decor is very nice.  Great spot to kick back with friends.The bar has an extensive wine list which includes a number of French Cognac and Armagnac selections.  The 16th floor bar is a cool spot to hang out after a nice dinner.  The food.  French inspired and very nicely executed.  Perhaps my rating is due to price?  There are less expensive spots downtown and more expensive spots.  Some of the starters are really quite good but some can be a bit pricey.They offer a cheese and cured meat plate appetizer that is made up of two cheeses and two meat selections but at $16 it may be a bit pricey for many.The baked brie is quite good at about half the cost of the cheese and meat plate.One of my friends always gets the mussels.  I abstain as I do not care for mussels.  They are more pricey than the meat and cheese plate.The Caesar salad is nicely done.  It is a good split for two folks.  Skip the chicken or shrimp options as they do not belong in a classic Caesar salad from  my point of view.A notable side dish that is hard to pass up is something they call Truffle Poutine.  French fries, truffle gravy, cheese and bacon.  I mean really .... full steam ahead ( you can run faster under full steam as your wallet is $12 lighter so you carry less of a load).  For me it is hard to pass up this item.Winners from the past we have consumed....The herb crusted salmon is great.  There are also shrimp, roasted peppers and mushrooms.The Bouillabaisse is excellent and another good dish to share if you are trying to keep the calories and $$$ down.  There are many kinds of shellfish, sausage and more than one type of fish.  It is excellent.The roasted chicken is good as is the short ribs but I prefer the fish dishes.I generally pass on desserts as my favorite Creme Brulee and Creme Caramel are made by a French fellow who also has a knack for building amazing guitar amplifiers.  But .... that being said there are a few items here that I love.  There is an orange creme brulee that is terrific.  The chocolate pot de creme is a total winner with berries and is as lovely to look at as it is to eat.  Last on my favorite list is their white chocolate bread pudding with a bourbon caramel crust.  Heck, I don't even like bread pudding but this one is a winner.   I think later this evening that Chocolate Pot De Creme is now on my mind for this evening.I guess that wraps things up.

Reviews.Author: Arturo M.
Reviews.Content: Came here for an anniversary dinner. It was amazing, my wife loved it. All the staff was super friendly and professional.  Great atmosphere I dressed a little but you dont have too. Very casual and laid back. Food was spectacular one of the best steaks Ive had.

Reviews.Author: Brenton B.
Reviews.Content: First and foremost this is a review of a dinner experience for a party of two with reservations made via OpenTable x1 week in advance.  I cannot speak to the experience of the long lines after 10p awaiting to make it up to the rooftop bar.Parking:  Obviously parking in DTLA is not ideal, especially next to Pershing Square.  However, there is a valet with very diligent attendants working there.  In particular, the service was great as they went above and beyond, since he was nice enough to allow us to pay after dinner when we had a chance to make it to the ATM to get cash.Entrance: Old building that the owner decided to build a rooftop bar and restaurant; so the elevator attendant and control panel itself (Perch bird next to the button you're supposed to push) are expecting you if you are going after business hours or on weekend.Host: Very pleasant; found our reservation right away and seated us at a reserved table with excellent views.Ambience: Very en plen aire feel with astounding views of DTLA (in particular Pershing Square).  Depending upon where you are seated seems to determine more which type of feel you will get; some areas are more loungey while others are more intimate and romantic.  *Of note: the outdoor seating while great, is on the 15th floor where the wind chill can be a factor.  So definitely bring at least a light jacket for comfort.  Food: We tried hours dourves, main dishes, and dessert.  In particular the mac n cheese with bacon/panko was excellent.  I had the filet mignon for the main course, which was cooked perfectly to the way I ordered it.  Lastly, the white chocolate bread pudding with addition of gelato was a outstanding way to end the night.Drinks: Decent variety of wines and cocktails at expected prices for the type of location.  All in all a great place to enjoy a "fancy casual" dinner date night.  We will definitely be returning in the future!

Reviews.Author: Chris K.
Reviews.Content: Once again, this place doesn't disappoint. I came here again with a few friends Friday night. Unfortunately we decided to come here last minute so we weren't able to make a reservation. Once we got here we were told wait for 4 would take anywhere from 30 min to an hour. We were able to secure two seats at the bar for the ladies and had a few drinks. Throughout the hour, I went up to the host to check on the wait. Each time the host with a smile said that she would let us know when we were ready. Then suddenly without notice, the hostess comes up to me and says that our table isn't ready, but that there is a sofa section that is "first come, first serve" that just opened up and that we could drink and dine there instead. THAT IS AWESOME SERVICE. I was really impressed with her going out of her way to help us out. I couldn't help but to hand her a $20 to really say I appreciated her help. As far as food goes, I had the "bunny ravioli". Sounds disturbing, try not to imagine cute lil' furry friends. But I have to admit, it was delicious! Meat was really soft & moist, texture & flavor sort of reminded me of shredded beef. Sauce brought the whole dish together. They had a live jazz band that night, and brought in a dj to close the night off. A great place to have awesome conversations with friends. My guests were impressed that I suggested this place. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Author: Tucker M.
Reviews.Content: This place is an awesome downtown spot.  I was extremely pleased with the quality of the food, which was honestly, incredible.  The prices are high, but I supppose they'd have to be to pay for that prime rooftop spot.  I definitely recommend this place for a date, a meet-up with an old friend, or even a casual business meeting.

Reviews.Author: Chris F.
Reviews.Content: Carlina was our server and she was so welcoming, cool and accommodating to me being gluten free and vegetarian. The space is beautiful, the band was stellar and the food and drinks were awesome! Such a great spot and really gorgeous views!

Reviews.Author: Clara B.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere on the roof top,  invited a friend and he loved it especially since they had an amazing band performing, The Big Boys and Rachel was Rockin, performing her own songs and other famous songs such as by Amy Winehouse...We got an amazing table in front of the band, enjoyed the dishes which we shared, tuna tartar, mushroom risotto my favorite and than the chocolate mouse dessert.  I agree the menu is limited, however the few items we did have were good... I guess it's true what they say:  Location, Location, Location....I love the location and great place for those intimate dinners.. I have also had brunch here and it was lovely with live jazz on the patio...

Reviews.Author: cathy S.
Reviews.Content: Jadoré Perch! Great atmosphere,service,and food. We had a wonderful meal with jazz playing in the background and a great staff. From the hosts all the way down to the severs.Not to mention the view was great! Make sure to go to the bar upstairs.Mussels to start, with yummy Pork belly and Beet salad.  Pot Au Feu short ribs YUMMA, but the polenta need a dash of salt. My hubby was very happy with the Steak Frites and the bouillabaisse was delicious.We had the White chocolate bread pudding which was yummy, but ordered ice cream to top it off since it come with any whipped cream nor did they have any. My lil piggy  palate felt it didn't seemed finished without any cream on it.  Thus ordering the side of ice cream which we topped the warm bread pudding with, then it was game over.Otherwise 5 stars across the board.Lovely and I actually felt very Samantha Sex in the City for a minute.   Ended with a Instagram photo shoot upstairs at the bar:)Can't wait to come back

Reviews.Author: Nancy P.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views of DTLA and yummy food- nice place to take a date or to go with a friend or two. It gets really packed on the weekends wouldn't recommend this place for a large group of people.

Reviews.Author: Caroline K.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a few times now, once on a weekend night (had to wait in line for about 15 minutes around 10 p.m. and could not get to the 16th floor bc the line for that was too long), and a few times during the week.  Though they don't seem to have any Happy Hour specials, Perch always seems to be packed, mainly with Asians.  I wouldn't bother trying to come here too late on a weekend since I've heard the wait can be an hour or more.During the week days, you can take the elevator directly to the 16th floor until it reaches capacity.  Then you have to wait in line on the 15h floor near the bar.  That long line you see isn't for the restroom!  Both the 15th floor and the 16th floor give you great views of the city, but the 16th floor is smaller and more intimate.  They had live music a couple of times I was there, so it can get quite loud.  I haven't had a chance to try their food, either but I do recommend the Writer's Block (pear vodka, etc.) - really good drink if you like yours a little on the sweeter side.  It's pretty pricey at $13, but so is almost everything else there.  I was told they don't offer bottle service yet but would in the future.  It's definitely a nicer place to hang out with friends if you can 1) get in without much of a hassle (the doorman is super nice, though) and 2) grab somewhere to sit.

Reviews.Author: David A.
Reviews.Content: Had a really great time here, had a bite to eat then went up to the roof for a few drinks. Area isn't the best but the restaurant and view is spectacular! Portions are small but interestingly prepared and delicious

Reviews.Author: Tina N.
Reviews.Content: ***DON'T COME HERE UNLESS YOU HAVE TIME TO WASTE***Came here on a Saturday night for a birthday gathering and ended up waiting over 2 hours to get in. We arrived around 9:45 and didn't make it in until a little after midnight. Before coming here I was told Perch tends to have an older crowd and is a bit more on the classy side. I definitely saw the older crowd but not the classiness; I saw guys in sneakers, girls in what appeared to be skimpy clubbing wear (?) and maybe a few casually dressed people. The ambiance is a lot different from clubs, it is more intimate with lights wrapped around the trees, fireplace and music that isn't blasting in your ears. Drinks run around $12, there was a bar inside and one outside on the balcony. The bar at the balcony didn't have much of a line compared to the bar inside. The rooftop also has a bar, but there is only one bartender so expect to wait a while.The place overall is pretty small with a mix of people dining and drinking. If you've just arrived you'll most likely be trying to make your way out to the balcony dodging not only inebriated people but rude servers as well. If you want to attempt going to the rooftop there is a line that leads up to a stairway to get there (yes, more waiting). If you don't mind wasting your Saturday night away waiting to get into Perch, only to wait again then I'd say this place is for you but honestly I feel like there are a lot more options for a Saturday night in LA.

Reviews.Author: Montserrat G.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to this place and we really had a great time in the roof top lounge. The views are beautiful and just in general the ambience was great..lots of trendy people and the ones that we came across were nice and polite which is a big plus for me...the crowd makes the place so points for a nice crowd! There was a live band playing one floor below from where we were so it was perfect because it didn't get too noisy...who knows for the people who were on that same level but for us it worked out perfect :)I had a great experience and definitively want to go back and try the restaurant, then make it to the roof top lounge.

Reviews.Author: Hiroshi K.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a friends bday yesterday. Don't come here if it's past 10pm you will be waiting in line for at least an hour. Then you'll wait in another line for the elevator and another line to get up to the rooftop! (If you can even get up to the rooftop) The venue itself is pretty nice. It has a very intimate feel with fireplaces, lots of lounge areas and lights on the trees. The view is pretty nice and the music is just loud enough where you can still have nice conversations with people. Since it's pretty small it can get packed pretty easily. Crowd was mostly mid 20-30's and a few old people here and there. Drinks were a little on the weak side but the line for the bar wasn't long at all. One thing that bugged me were the waiters that were really rude carrying the food trays constantly walking by.Parking was easy at Pershing Square garage across the street for $7.Probably wouldn't come here again unless it's for someone's birthday or special occasion. I would rather go to Standard rooftop.

Reviews.Author: Steven J.
Reviews.Content: Been here a couple times now and each time I've had a good experience...until my latest one. I've came here for dinner twice on a weekday and the place was very nice with a great view of the city and outdoor seating, not too crowded . Food was decent but nothing to rave about. The drinks are what I really enjoy about this place. Strong with lots of flavor and specialty drinks that you don't find at your average bar. Those were all the good. Now for the bad. I came here on a Saturday night for a bday around 9:30pm and there was a huge line out the door. Took us about an hour wait to finally get inside. I didn't realize there is a 16th floor that takes you to the roof that has a better view and more room. To get here you have to wait in another line. After the hour long wait, we get inside and find out we have to wait in another line. I would have not gone there if the people we were meeting weren't already up there. That line took about 45 mins. I spent more time waiting in line than actually being there. I understand that there are capacity issues but that doesn't seem to matter when you are cool with the bouncers, they just let you right up and make the normal folks wait an extra 30 mins. I guess I just don't know the right people. Overall, I am not coming back here on a weekend as it gets way to crowded.

Reviews.Author: Sonia H.
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I came here to see what the hubbub about rooftop bars were and Perch didn't disappoint, but it didn't wow me either. We arrived at around 10:30pm on a Saturday night and there was a line but it only took about 20 minutes to get into the first elevator. Not too shabby! The guy checking ID's was also funny and was very friendly and didn't make things awkward when a homeless man tried to hit on my friend.When we got to the 15th floor, I immediately regretted not making reservations. (Btw, if you have 5+ people in your group, I don't think they take online reservations). Anyway, we decided that we're only getting drinks anyway so we headed to the bar area outside. It was super crowded but the atmosphere was pleasant and didn't seem snooty or pretentious. Also, the drinks were more affordable than other bars I've been to ($25 for a cosmo and a manhattan is not bad). The Cosmo was good and the bartender made it quickly but seemed to pay attention to detail (i.e. the lemon peel decoration etc). Overall, if you're just trying to catch a pretty night view of the Los Angeles skylines, this place is great. If you're coming here specifically for the drinks, you might be slightly let down as the alcohol content in each drink isn't as much as a dive bar would give. I haven't come here for a meal yet so if that happens in the future, which I hope it does, I'll have to give an update. But as of now, Perch is a cute, classy, rooftop bar that both locals and tourists would enjoy experiencing at least once.

Reviews.Author: Ashley S.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! If you are in the mood for New York-like ambiance and amazing food, go to Perch!  I came here the other night for dinner and had a great dining experience!  Nice music and breathtaking city views were the perfect addition to truffle fries, mussels, and their famous mac n cheese! While you are there, be sure to go up to the rooftop bar where you can lounge and look at 360 degree views of the beautiful city!

Reviews.Author: Samantha A.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Perch several times and in three different atmospheres.  I have been here late on Saturday nights, during happy hour, and for brunch.  I am hesitant to give this place a 4, but it is one of the first places I like to bring out-of-town friends when they visit, so I'll boost my score up.  First, I'll start with what I like about Perch.  One, I love the rooftop and French theme they have.  It's absolutely beautiful during the day and at night! I also like the happy hour specials they have.  It is a bit pricey, so whenever I can get a deal, I'm down! And watching the sunset on a rooftop in downtown LA is so nice.  When I  went there for brunch I liked the food.  For the price we were paying I expected it to be good (and it was) but I wasn't wow-ed. Ok, so there are a few negatives of course.  First being the service.  It really is hit or miss on the kind of service you will get there.  Some of the bartenders are so friendly and you can really tell they like being there.  Some are just awful! I took my family there for brunch last week and I was almost embarrassed because the service was so awful! I had raved this place for a few days prior, telling them that it's one of the best spots in DTLA (I think it still is) and how they'll love it, but they left a bit turned off.  There were six of us, so the gratuity was included, so I think the waitress really slacked off on her job with us, because we repeatedly had to ask for water refills and other drinks/condiments.  Anyways, all and all... the service is hit or miss.  Ambience of the place is amazing.  The atmosphere completely changes from day and night.  And it is still one of my fav places to go to in DTLA.

Reviews.Author: Amie C.
Reviews.Content: Came on an evening before a holiday off and there was a LONG, stagnant line outside. Didn't feel like waiting so I figured out a way to get in without having to go though the line ;) If you figure it out, don't think it'll work on weekends.We ordered the short rib poutine to share, having already had dinner elsewhere in DTLA, and it was surprisingly really good. I would definitely return for the food, lounge on the rooftop with some drinks, and hopefully be able to avoid the ridiculously long line that forms sometime around 9-10PM.

Reviews.Author: Wilson T.
Reviews.Content: I haven't had the food, but this is a wonderful place for a drink. Perfect view, with live music and it's very cozy at the same time. I'm not a fan of lounges and bars were it's always a struggle just to hear. Great times and great conversations at Perch.

Reviews.Author: Trisa T.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch on Sunday - and it was better than I expected! I view overlooking Pershing Square was great and their patio balcony setting has a great background-style feel. The food and drinks were AMAZING!! I had the french toast, which I am not normally a big fan of, but theirs was the best I've ever had! The place is pretty small so its a good idea to make reservations. Also parking can be a bit of a pain (as can be expected in this area) but there's a $5 flat rate lot right down the block. I would definitely come back - its a great place for a weekend date or with a small group of friends! The only reason I didn't get it 5 stars was because the service (hostess and wait staff) gave off that fake-friendly/pretentious vibe - but with good company and a few mimosas you really could careless!

Reviews.Author: Maral J.
Reviews.Content: I came to Perch for a going away dinner and it was the perfect setting. We had reservations for 10 and upon arrival 2 of our guest weren't there yet so the kind staff let us go upstairs to the bar and get some drinks while waiting. Once seated, our waitress was extremely attentive and nice. The food was delicious, I ordered the Steak Frites. The rooftop setting def makes this place aesthetically pleasing and so very romantic.

Reviews.Author: Jerry M.
Reviews.Content: Get ready to spend money at this place because it's expensive and you get what you pay for!Atmosphere:I went on a Monday night and it wasn't crowded. I went ahead and read the reviews first and everyone suggested that you make reservations. I too suggest that you make reservations, so you don't have to wait. The indoor atmosphere felt very cozy. If you decide to eat outdoors, you get to see the beautiful view of Los Angeles. Food:I was pondering on what to order and I decided to get something with meat and would fill my belly as well. I ordered the "Steak Fritas" which is basically a nice chunk of steak with a side of truffle fries. YUM! I think I gained 5 pounds after all that fatty goodness. My girlfriend ordered the "Herb Crusted Salmon" which is also great if you love fish and seafood. We also had an appetizer "Ahi Tuna Tartar." It was better than I expected because I'm not really the type that eats raw stuff but this was good. It had a side of crispy wontons with avocado. Makes me salivate just typing and thinking about the food again.Service:The service was fantastic. The person would give us our table and orders was really nice. They gave us refills for our waters in timely fashion and it was a great service. Recommendation:The next time I go, I will probably check out the rooftop and get some drinks. After our meal, I remembered reading reviews about a bar on the 16th floor. Unfortunately, we went on a somewhat rainy day and wasn't able to get drinks because they closed it for the night. But we still decided to go to the rooftop and check out the scenery. It was absolutely amazing! Beautiful LA city lights at night. I give this place 4 stars because it was great experience in my opinion.The choice is yours! Yelp-ya later!

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: [Reviewing Perch for it's bar/nightlife]  Perch is an interesting location - something not exactly booming for those looking to dance and club but more to mingle and have a nice conversation with a beautiful view of Downtown LA.  You start out by entering the fairly nondescript high-rise and enter the middle elevator up to the first part of Perch with the restaurant/bar/outdoor patio area or even further up in the second elevator (on the left side) to go to the rooftop patio and get an even better view.  Live music was there on a Friday night with a cool, excited band providing some nice tunes in the background and a DJ taking over soon after.  Drinks are fairly nominally priced for LA (around $10-$15 if I remember correctly depending on what you get) and were fairly well-made.   Parking-wise, the best bets are to find some of the cheaper parking lots nearby or street parking.  There's also overnight parking at Pershing Square but expect to pay a bit more (around $16?) and is really close to Perch as well.  The decor of Perch is light and cozy with seating inside and for restaurant patrons with the real beauty being the view of Downtown LA from up above.  It really is nestled into a nice area and there is a lot of good stuff to take in.  Again, don't expect to party it up heavily here but it's a great place to unwind or have a nice date.  If you have friends that say the urban Los Angeles area is not a looker - Perch is one of those locations to take them and give them a different view of the area.  As pointed out by visually aware Los Angeleities, you only have to look up (or in this case a little down) to see the beauty of L.A.

Reviews.Author: Cali T.
Reviews.Content: 360 degree rooftop view.  Located in Pershing Square, this bar is a good time.  The drinks are poured well, they don't hold back.  Live music on restaurant level.  If you're lucky during the summer, they have live bands out in Pershing Square.I didn't try the food here.  Next time!This is definitely a good place to bring a date.

Reviews.Author: Jolyne C.
Reviews.Content: Oh Perch, you have so much potential.So, my bff who knows about all the new, fun hot spots, tells me about Perch. We decide to celebrate our friends birthday there.She gets there extra early and reserves a spot on the top floor.I arrive around 10:15 pm. Found parking around the corner at a shady looking parking lot for $3.75. I hold my breath as I run down the stairs to avoid the reek of urine. I walk a block and arrive at my destination. (They do offer Valet btw and street parking if you are lucky)There is a serious line out front. So, I patiently wait, and wait, and wait, while my birthday girl sits alone up stairs. :(35-40 minutes later I finally get in.I take the lovely elevator up and arrive at the 13th floor.Wow , this place is sooo pretty! And its packed. The decor is lovely, the furnishing, everything about this place is classy, except the staff. The balcony and dining area are filled with lovely creatures enjoying their Saturday evening with friends.I call my friend, because I can not find her. Alas, there is a second level that is only accessible by a second set of stairs/elevator. Low and behold, there is a line to go up one more flight of stairs. Sigh, really?So, I ask the security guard, yes, there was a security guard at the end of the "stairs" line. Is this the only  way to the top? He had a major attitude and replies "YES" but we are at capacity and I can not have you wait in this line. You need to come back when the line has gone down!I explained I have been waiting downstairs for 35 minutes, its my friends birthday, can I please just wait here so I can join her asap. He said No coldly and told me I should go to the bar :/Oh boy. I go to the bar and find another friend lost in the shuffle, experiencing my same dilemma. We order a drink, and explain to the bartender our situation. She rudely just gave a blank stare and attitude and replies " How can "I" help you?" (extenuates on the I)I am an LA native, and I am reminded why I hate going to places like this.If it wasn't for my friend waiting upstairs I would have high tailed it out of there.Our group starts growing downstairs as more birthday guests arrive. We finally get our way up to the holy grail, THE ROOF TOP!and man, is the view is spectacular. It was so freeing to be away from the noise, the crowd, the mean security guard, and freedom on the roof top. Beautiful serene skyline of downtown all lit up. Although they said they were at capacity, it seemed to have plenty of room. More so than the dining area. The decor was cute, nice lighting, great music! The drinks were tasty $12 for a Vodka Gimlet, my friends had a Midnight in Paris, which was lovely. Josh the bartender was sweet, forgetful, but wonderful. I viewed there menu online and it looks tasty. I might go back to sample their menu, maybe at lunch or a time its less crowded.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: This review is limited to the way I use Perch -- just for cocktails, which I think, considering other reviews, is the safest option.  I've been three times, and it's always serene.  I use Perch as a launching pad, so to speak, for the Disney, the Colburn or, on Thursdays, MOCA.  It's a short walk up Hill to Angels Flight (update: closed for repairs, so take the adjoining stairs), where the plaza on top takes you past the Omni and MOCA and ends at the Colburn with a great closeup of the Disney.Actually, if you like upscale bar hopping, start at the Perch for a round, then walk over to the Edison, which opens at five and has some good Happy Hour deals; then it's a straight shot up 2nd to the Colburn/Disney.Frankly, I like a show before dinner, since dinner followed by a room full of oxygen suckers makes me nod off.  A light, late supper is a great way to talk about the show.  There are plenty of good, relaxing places downtown that aren't mob scenes.Prime time at popular venues is more about crowd control than service.  A place that packs them in just because it can has no integrity.  Attitude, giving away tables and slow service, reflect management that doesn't manage, management that doesn't give a damn.  That said, the service at Perch is a bit off-handed even when not crowded.  But drinks are honest and reasonable if you stay away from call brands.  Their mixed nuts are special.  Late afternoon, a Sapphire Martini (I know, call brand) and some munchies and the view are a perfect way to unwind or get primed for the main event.

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: Sangria Saturday!

Reviews.Author: Prairie P.
Reviews.Content: Sad to say, my experience at Perch was not that great.I came here on a romantic date and was really digging the vibe and the beautiful view from the patio - everything looked really good from the start of the date. However, as the night went on, my boyfriend and I experienced food that was above average served by servers who were way below the bar. Unexpected at a restaurant/bar that presented itself as if it would hold high standards in service!What really irked the most was that our server was so friendly to a Caucasian couple next to us but was icy cold and rude to me and my boyfriend. He even urged them to go checkout the rooftop bar, which he didn't mention once to us. I hate to think that people in L.A. still show racial favoritism, but experiences like this (and others) have proven otherwise.Dear Perch, please train your staff better! Until then, I won't be going back and definitely won't recommend this place to any of my friends!

Reviews.Author: Dave T.
Reviews.Content: I'd give it 3stars, but the 3.5star rating it currently has is too high.Edible food, but not nearly worth the $40-50 per person (drink and dessert included).  In fact, the mussels were downright bad (stinky), the main dishes were barely professionally made (talentless amateur could follow the recipe and do as well).  one star for food, one star for great view.

Reviews.Author: Aidan B.
Reviews.Content: Finally, I have always wanted to eat dinner here. Obviously I could've come myself but I wanted to wait for that one person to bring me. And it finally happened :) He had been boycotting this place because it blocks his rooftop lol. But gave in to bring me here. We walked over from his place and we're seated promptly. Ordered wine, the baked Brie and the herb crusted salmon. Maybe it was the company, the conversation or what have you, but it was perfect. When a man gives in to a boycott and gives you the last bite, that's when you know that he's got his priorities straight ;) "Let's make this our place, okay?" I adore him. It was truly a great date :D

Reviews.Author: Lourdes N.
Reviews.Content: A fan of the mushroom risotto & truffle poutine fries - but no so much the crowd. I guess you are really paying for the rooftop view and the live band wasn't bad either!To start, i had a drink at the bar, the bartender gave me a smile and nod and i asked for the spicy concombre- which was basically a jalapeno mojito. the ingredients i don't know, but it made my throat and lips kinda burn- its a soothing cucumber taste then SURPRISE, Backdraft kind of fire in your mouth, and i was okay with it -spicy!!We waited about 15 mins for a table of 8 (with reservations). They sat us next to the DJ so it was harder to communicate, but it was fine because the DJ was pretty good. For starters, we shared poutine fries (to die for) and the baked brie- which took me one and half bites to finish. I ordered the chicken with mushroom risotto for my entree, with a side of brussel sprouts - married in great flavors: sesame, soy and bacon- also to die for. The mushroom risotto was perfect, not too strong, a light taste. I had a taste of my boyfriends rare steak frites plate, which was delicious. Our server was OKAY nothing great, for a big group I guess she was tentative, could have been better service i thought. To end my meal, i got the white chocolate bread pudding, which i recommend sharing because it was sweeter than sweet! but it was pretty good, i recommend to all bread pudding fans to try!

Reviews.Author: Morison W.
Reviews.Content: I was actually pretty disappointed with Perch. I had a higher expectation for this because of all the good reviews, but honestly, it wasn't even that great. The only good thing about it is the view. But if you want a good and more upbeat environment to make the night livelier, this is definitely not the place. It had the opposite effect of making us all lose our mood. Drinks were not necessarily the cheapest, but it is still cheaper than what you would pay for at a club. $13 for a mixed drink. There are two floors. The upper one was just a rooftop area, but it does tend to get chilly at night. There are too many people, so you will never get a place to sit. We stood there for like 1-2 hours, and the atmosphere just doesn't make you want to party. This place might be good for a romantic date or just chill with a significant other, but other than that, don't come here with a big group. We came with a huge group and we all were split into our own little corner. I mean, you can all hang together, but the way the place was laid out, it doesn't really make for a social atmosphere. If i were to choose this over the Standard, I would probably choose the Standard, even though I haven't been there at night.

Reviews.Author: Jen G.
Reviews.Content: Great view. Middling food. And that's being gracious.If you're already a bit tipsy--or if you just doing care about the quality of food you consume--probably not a problem at all. Order something simple and be done with the food. Sit back and enjoy the view. Until after hours that is, then run for the elevator.

Reviews.Author: Yvonne F.
Reviews.Content: Hello Yelpers,I've had the pleasure of having dinner, drinks etc at this beautiful establishment a few times. Whether its a quick drink after work, a night out with the girls, or a romantic dinner with your signicant other Perch always delivers with unquestionable service, delicious entrees, or their scrumptious drinks. My most recent experience was like no other as Tony Cicero and his staff attended and welcomed my brother, my Boston guest, and myself with quick and super friendly service. My brother said he felt like he was VIP!  Dinner was great but it was even better with the beautiful view and the live entertainment! See you soon Tony and staff

Reviews.Author: Leo C.
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for me and my girlfriend's 3-year dating anniversary. The food was okay - the Baked Brioche ended up being the best thing we ordered and I honestly would have ordered 3 more orders of it, they were that good. The ambiance was great, but I wish they gave us an option to sit outside (we were just escorted to our seat inside, which was a nice seat but not as nice as being outdoors with the night-view of the city). It's a bit loud, but they played live music which was cool. I'd go back, but not necessarily for the food or for a "special occasion" dinner - drinks and appetizers with friends on a night when we're trying to chill would probably be the right situation to return.

Reviews.Author: Yanely L.
Reviews.Content: View = amazing! Service was good, decor was vintage and i loved it! Drinks were good. I will live to go back soon! This is truly a gem.

Reviews.Author: DanVy N.
Reviews.Content: Not a fannnnn. We had to wait in this loooooong line before getting into the bar, and then waited in another line to get onto the rooftop ;(. This is not Vegas and we shouldn't have to wait more than 5 minutes to get into a bar. I don't even know why there was a line though - there was barely anyone on the rooftop!  I felt bad because our friends ended up getting out so they could wait with us in the line. It was also too noisy, so I couldn't even really have a decent conversation with my friends who I haven't seen in agessss. Lol I'm so bitter, but it's true!  The view was OKAY. Besides being on the rooftop, there's nothing too great about this place. Definitely prefer the Standard as a rooftop bar over this one!

Reviews.Author: Keila N.
Reviews.Content: I've heard a lot about this place.  Perch is by the Pershing Square Metro stop.  It's a hidden gem located on the 15th floor with a beautiful view of downtown.  The ambiance is relaxing, romantic and trendy.I stopped by here on a Sunday afternoon with my bf.  We sat in the corner facing Pershing Square park, which was nice.  We ordered Lolita and Red Herring for drinks.  We had the frog legs ($10) and mussels ($18).  The drinks were pricey, but good.  The Buffalo frog legs had a nice spicy taste to it, which I liked, but it was a bit on the tough side.  The mussels lacked flavor.The water service was right on, but the waitress service was slow.

Reviews.Author: Asia e.
Reviews.Content: Took my father here for his birthday. We had a marvelous time. The rooftop dining, the brilliant food and the music. It was quite a joy.

Reviews.Author: Jordan W.
Reviews.Content: Went for dinner and drinks with a few friends. The view is good, not great. The rooftop is a lot shorter than the surrounding buildings so you end up looking at empty offices. Appetizers had great taste, but could hardly justify the price. Service was ok. Our waitress wasn't that attentive and overlooked us most of the night. It took us a long time to get our checks.They had a live band which was nice. The line up to the top floor bar was so long we didn't bother to wait for it. I probably won't be back too soon.

Reviews.Author: Kevin T.
Reviews.Content: The Perch Questionnaire: Do you like drinking outside?  If YES, congrats! This might be the place for you! Perch is a combo restaurant bar perched atop the 15th or 16th floor of a building right next to Pershing in downtown with indoor and outdoor spaces. If NO, what's wrong with you?! But you're probably not a fan. Do you like food? YES? Good, they have that here! NO? You probably need to have that checked out...Do you dislike cover charges? If YES, good, spread the word.  There are some places in downtown that want to CHARGE YOU for going up to the roof of a building, where you as a patron, would almost be certainly be SUBJECTED to overpriced this or thats.  Perch is pretty fair about all of it.  No cover, no reservations required.  Prices are pretty standard across the board -- I didn't feel like they were playing up the gimmick too much? Are you ok with birds? How about bow ties? YES? Maybe...? Perch has a bit of a theme to it, but I don't think it's overdone.  There's bird wallpaper and little emblems here and there, but on the inside it's mostly a well-appointed bar with a pretty good mix of a crowd.  The bow ties?  There are a lot of bow ties on the staff (even the ladies) ... Which you might thing of as an obnoxious, trendy thing -- but the staff here was good and I didn't think the place was all that scene-y.  No?  You probably have a hard time going anywhere in LA buddy.

Reviews.Author: Kendra V.
Reviews.Content: Disappointing is the best way to describe this. If the idea of seeing the LA skyline on top of a tall building sipping on cocktails sounds fantastic to you don't go to Perch. Perch sits lower than most of the skyscrapers in LA and the view leaves a lot to be desired and makes you wonder if what you're seeing is even a view at all.It is also incredibly small. It feels more like someones small roof top than a beautiful rooftop bar. The wait is very long which is understandable. They can't let a ton of people on the roof at the same time because it's so small. There is only 1 bar and 2 bar tenders, the lines are extremely long as you can imagine. On top of that the drinks are very expensive. Perch is underwhelming and you'll leave feeling "meh". You're better off sticking to the bars at ground level (like The Edison) if you want your socks to be blown off.

Reviews.Author: Jamie K.
Reviews.Content: I recommend coming here during weeknights and not the weekend. The wait is definitely not worth it. What I love about this place is the seating and view of dtla. It's one of the most coziest spots in dtla.

Reviews.Author: Tyler V.
Reviews.Content: Very rude. Wouldn't seat us with 20+ open tables for dinner at 3:30.

Reviews.Author: Jessie T.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere was amazing! I love the attention to detail on the drinks and appetizers. Of course the view is not bad either... :-) love it!

Reviews.Author: Natalie M.
Reviews.Content: I went to this place couple of months ago and I didnt like it at all. the rooftop with the nice view was amazing but the service was terrible. So I wrote a bad review about this place and the next day I got this message from their manager:"Hi Natalie,I sincerely apologize for your bad experience. I don't want it to sound like excuse but Perch is our "new baby" and we're still working on getting the right people on board. That week we went through 4 new hostesses until we found a good one. We would like you to give us another chance and hopefully impress you. We haven't done it before, so I'm not sure what exactly we can offer you to kinda make up for this incident, but I would like to sent you a gift certificate. Would you be comfortable to share you address so I can mail it to you?Again, I'm really sorry.Marie A.''I didnt wanted to hurt anybodys business and I deleted my review without any additional details. Yesterday we went there with my friends and everything is just the same. the hostesses (a guy and a girl) were ignoring us and were rude with us.They said that the place was booked but the have available tables on Opentables.com We didnt care about this small details and went straight to the rooftop to enjoy the beautiful full moon and the view. The cocktails were great. I tried Lolita and I loved it. This idea of this place is great: french music, traditional painted floor tile, open fireplace in the middle of the tables but the service is what makes the place not " 5 stars". Anyway I like the time we spent there.

Reviews.Author: Ellen O.
Reviews.Content: So I've experienced the Perch on a weekend evening and Sunday brunch- both very different experiences.Friday evening experience: was heading to Perch for some rooftop drinks. Parked across the street in the lot for $6 because valet was no where go be found. I was told the bar would be open at 9- I arrived early to avoid waiting. I had to get into a line outside for about an hour before going inside. Workers were a little on the rude side. I had to get into another line to get up to the roof. So basically I didn't get up to the roof top bar until 11:00PM. I ordered a Lolita cocktail and it was absolutely AMAZING( keep in mind I'm an avid whiskey drinker and I usually hate cocktails). Sunday brunch: I took the metro and got off at Pershing Square- awesome- only cost $3 both ways. I made reservations on OpenTable- it's an app you can download for your smart phone and IPad. I had one of the best experiences. The table was ready for us the minute we got there-the hostess was super friendly, and our waitress was really sweet. We ordered a pitcher of Sangria for $20! The Bloody Mary was really good but super spicy!!! The butter fries ( I think that's what they are called were my favorite. The omelets were yummy- nothing extraordinary. The sunny views of LA were amazing- live jazz music- the whole package! I've been to the perch a couple of times. I would recommend taking the metro. If you go on a weekend dress up because they do have a dress code. I wish they would add more seating to the roof top though. Overall, one of my favorite places in DTLA

Reviews.Author: Dee S.
Reviews.Content: The drinks are pricy, but it's a great place to lounge around. There are some nice views, but it's the typical rooftop lounge in LA. Only thing is the female bouncer downstairs is on a major powertrip and is very disrespectful to other women.

Reviews.Author: Mia M.
Reviews.Content: Awesome place in a great location high above DTLA!!  Good atmosphere and a hip young crowd.  Will go again!

Reviews.Author: Doreen M.
Reviews.Content: YELP INSIDER TIP FROM DOREEN (AKA AZN PERSUASION):  3.5 mostly for the view on the very top floor (16th?).  Food came out fast, but nothing spectacular, very very very ordinary.  See my to tips.  They have live music and the open airy layout/patio which is nice.  *****I really wanted to like this place bc they got so much right, except the food.  It was so cold and windy up here.  Our food got cold pretty quickly.  None of the dishes were inspiring - very flat, one note, and missing something.  We got the popular mushroom risotto, fries, and oysters.  I would only come back here if others wanted  to.  For a good view I would go back to Rooftop Lounge in Venice, The Standard Hotel, Griffith Observatory, Yamashiro, SM Pier/The Lobster or other places in LA.

Reviews.Author: Rachel L.
Reviews.Content: Loved brunch here.The $15 bottles of champagne were great. I took the advice of other yelpers and had an order of pancakes and croissants. It was perfect for two people. We loved the view and atmosphere so much, after we ate we went around to the side and sat in some casual chairs and ordered another bottle of champagne and sat back and enjoyed the beautiful Sunday. Only minus is no valet. We parked in a lot and were harassed by a person asking us for money while we were taking our wallet out to pay the lot attendant. The attendant did nothing about it just watched the whole thing. Oh well, welcome to downtown.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan G.
Reviews.Content: skip to Pros and Cons below if you want to get to the point. My friend messaged me on facebook: "Yo! Johhnnny G. Waja doing tonight, wanna hang out?" "Hell yes!"He picked me up and we drove off into the distance of the smoggy yet hip city of what I call, DownTown Los Angeles (DTLA). A couple blocks close to 7th and Hill there is nice parking spot that is only $6 for the night, other places cost $10: fyi for cheap parking.Perch is different because when you enter you think it's just a random apartment building. But there are several elevators which bring you to the rooftop. Since the place seems semi exclusive you have two types of people there:i. Upper Middle Class - non hipstersii. Hella cute girls for a lounge. Yes, thank god I didn't have to spend anything but the place is not on the cheap side. I was able to score a few drinks by being gregarious enough with the patrons of the place. In addition, I saw a celebrity, who I have no idea of... he's on an HBO special. I congratulated him on his success (he was heavily flirting with some cute petite girl). After talking with a few beautiful ladies (I am taken but I winged really well), we left. Why? I bumped into a very attractive man and almost touched his crotch by complimenting his belt loop: he blushed. Then, he introduced us to his girlfriend, and we just meshed really well. They invited us to join them at a birthday party at some rooftop in LA. We accepted and had a blast there with free food, wine, and a bunch of friendly bisexual men. If you're homophobic you didn't belong at this party. Anyways, I had a great time, a night to remember.I also took a "souvenir" from the rooftop party. :D PROS:i. Great view of the place. ii. Bouncers, unlike most places, are very welcoming and cordial. iii. A nice date place as it is soothing. iv. Food is delicious. There french fries :Dv. Cuties everywhere.Cons:i. Bartenders don't really know how to make drinks (I asked for a sex on the beach and it turned out to taste more like lemonade).ii. The drinks are expensive. iii. Though a wonderful lounge, the space can be too squeezed in (if you're claustrophobic don't go). Restaurant, lounge, and wannabe dance floor makes it too crowded. Will I take my girlfriend here? Yes. The view and ambiance make me smile: relaxing.

Reviews.Author: Christina B.
Reviews.Content: Food was a 3-4 out of 5. Filet mignon was a tad bit dry. Excellent band. LOVED them! Probably one of the best jazzy playlists I have experienced in LAThe vibe is so great here. Classy, relaxing and a very pretty view. Dessert was good. Get the chocolate pot de creme. Service was pretty had. Didn't get served for ages even after asking for a server twice. Not cool. If I hadn't been with a birthday group I would have really annoyed.

Reviews.Author: Michel C.
Reviews.Content: Freakn' Fantastic Friday's!!!!! The live music they have on Friday nights is incredible!!!! I felt like I got a free concert while sitting enjoying drinks with friends. We only ordered an appetizer so I can't say much on the food, but confirm the baked brie was delish! However, it is small so keep in mind if you plan on sharing with a few people. The staff was great, we showed up late and added an extra person and they still sat us immediately and sat us where we requested (by the band).

Reviews.Author: Tony C.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place to take someone as an introduction to LA or on a date. It's a quieter, more quaint rooftop lounge compared to The Standard. Come on weeknights to avoid crowds and waiting lines to get in. The food/drinks are nothing special, Perch's value is mostly from the view. Go upstairs to get an even better sight of LA's skyline while sipping on your drinks near the fireplaces.

Reviews.Author: Melanie C.
Reviews.Content: Worst service ever. We came in, said they would text us when the table was ready. When they did call us up, they didnt even have it ready, they said it was still being set up. Ordered food. We came at 7 and food didnt come until 830. They only served the white people first. Not even kidding. We ordrred before all the other tables around us and our food was the last to come. It only came because we made a complaint. The dumb blonde server only checked up on us ONCE. Our drinks were not refilled. At the end when we got the check we even had to bring the check up to them to pay. WORST SERVICE EVER. Food was good, pricey and a little salty. But tolerable. Definately not coming back

Reviews.Author: Vardan P.
Reviews.Content: The food was good the ambiance is very nice and relaxed, the place is too small though but in general very nice

Reviews.Author: Vanessa B.
Reviews.Content: That one star is for the amazing background that I got for my picture up on the rooftop. However, other than the great view and maybe my cocktail, my experience did not live up to the hype that I've been hearing about. The beginning of the adventure was great, with the friendly bouncer and the two elevator rides up, but once we entered the restaurant was when the problems started. The main problem was the fact that our server was non-existent. We were sitting at our table for a good 15 mins with no greeting or water, and we had to flag down a server only to hear that they will find us our server. A male server (who wasn't even our server) finally took down our order for us; and then started to discuss which server was in charge of our table with another server, in front of our table. Oh, and we never got to find out who our actual server was, because he/she never bothered to stop by. We had to ask another random server for our check. The whole restaurant experience was like playing server roulette.

Reviews.Author: Andrea T.
Reviews.Content: I came to perch to meet up with a rather large group of friends from work for a couple of happy hour drinks. The place is amazing! Everything from the decor to the view. I had the server pick my drink since it was my first time here. She recommended the Penicillin. I don't typically drink scotch but the way she described it and how she reassured me it was delicious made me go all in. And she was right, AMAZING!!! We also ordered a good amount of apps to snack on. Truffle fries a must, sliders and hotdogs were delicious, truffle mac and cheese to die for! I would definitely recommend perch to all my friends. Food and drinks were great, service was amazing. I appreciate places that I can go and  despite how busy they are, receive amazing customer service.  Our server Jaclyn was amazing, even though we were a group of about 11, she was able to always be there when before we needed anything. And she was super sweet and helpful in making sure we had all the best things on the menu. She took the time to make sure we were all happy, always smiling making us feel like we were regulars. Very accommodating, brought over extra chairs for us. Will def be back again! Theres also a bar upstairs but it was closed till later in the evening, need to come back and check it out. Def take the time to check perch out, theres no place downtown that can even compare.

Reviews.Author: Cande L.
Reviews.Content: Vomit stink with a disinterested staff serving water in dirty glasses and a kitchen that closes 3 hours before closing (Sunday). No thanks.

Reviews.Author: Victoria V.
Reviews.Content: SO SO! The view is mesmerizing! (It deserves 10 stars). I LOVED THE view, the sky was so clear and beautiful. We could see all downtown lights and buildings. However, the service was no good at all. Hostess not smiling and even rude when we arrived asking for our table. And the food? The food was not good. It was not memorable, no flavor.  As much as I loved the view, I don't think I'll be going back anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Mr. Critic X.
Reviews.Content: Place is chill. Valet is steep but in that part of town, better off doing it. the spot was awesome...a bit pricey and not the best views but a good place to get on the roof and unwind.

Reviews.Author: Alex A.
Reviews.Content: Great view and good drinks.  Brunch is great on sundays highly recommend, food can get a bit pricey at times but overall the Sangria is a steal :)

Reviews.Author: Vivian S.
Reviews.Content: Are you either:1. A successful, hip socialite?or2. A dude looking to court a girl over a romantic roof-top meal?Then this place is perfect for you!  Amazing LA skyline views, upbeat atmosphere, solid food and great music sets an intimate mood for this roof-top restaurant located on the 15th floor.  Pick a warmer night to venture to this place, dress up (but not too much) and order the truffle fries and a few beers.  Music tends to be better on the weekend!

Reviews.Author: Jimmy F.
Reviews.Content: the place is very nice, well decorated and the service is okay. a bit pricey if you're ballin on a budget. the bartender was a bit rude and some of the patrons aswell. but all and all its worth checking out.

Reviews.Author: Dan P.
Reviews.Content: Food is pretty good here, but you're coming for the view and and atmosphere.  I'd make reservations before you go.

Reviews.Author: Brenda H.
Reviews.Content: I've been here three times. Their drinks are kind of pricy but they're definitely good. The Lolita which is has grapefruit, cucumber and champagne is worth a try! Their gin tonic was also the tastiest I've had so far. The rooftop view is amazing and they have cute trees strung with lights everywhere. It's a perfect view and a nice place to drink and talk

Reviews.Author: Cindy S.
Reviews.Content: Loving  this . Just hanging out With my buddies . Very chill spot to relax have a couple of drinks with a bond fire going on . Very lovely. So recommend this place if you want to hang out without the loudness and crowds of people .

Reviews.Author: Joe P.
Reviews.Content: From the entrance down on the street level to the elevator ride up, this place was amazing! The service was great and the view at night was spectacular. We both ordered the Pan Roasted Chicken and ever since then I've been trying to make my way back to Perch to go have it again! sooo good! Just the right amount of intimacy for a date night but also a place you could go and have drinks just one floor up at the bar. If I'm not mistaken it also looks like a scene from the movie Seven Psychopaths was filmed up here too haha

Reviews.Author: Brittany L.
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this place. We came here for my roommate's birthday and had 12 people total.PARKING: I parked across the street at one of those lots, only $6 so it wasn't that bad and I didn't feel like fighting or looking around for parking. WAIT: We had dinner reservations so we didn't have to wait in the line (but I hear there is no cover, so around 10 when we came out there was a huge line!)If you try to book it for more than 12 people you will have to go through their event planner so keep that in mind. ATMOSPHERE: They sat us outside right on the edge of the rooftop, which was perfect.  There are glass/plastic panels that keep you from falling off of the edge but my boyfriend remarked they are a little lower than most places (like elevate) so it didn't cause any problems when taking pictures :PThe seating was kind of weird because they were couches with low tables so eating was a little difficult but most of the other people I saw had regular tables with candles etc.  The lighting is low with candles, christmas light types strung around and it was a nice warm night in LA.The view was OK, I wasn't super impressed and I think you're only on the 15th floor or something.  There was a live band playing while we were there though, which was a nice touch.Lots of greenery too.FOOD: I thought the food would be only OK or even bad but what we got was GOOD.  Sure, they are small but what do you expect for a lounge? Pork belly - it was a substantial piece, and it came on a huge plate even though it only took up 1/4 of it but it was TENDER, FATTY, and TASTY.  With a bit of a crispy edge. Rabbit Ravioli - tasty, a little spicy (maybe the salami?) and probably had like 5 pieces of ravioli? Light sauce too.Overall, a good place for a bday dinner or maybe coming with a date, not sure how it would be if you just came to drink though.  The inside is kinda small and it would be cramped.

Reviews.Author: Aaron Jae M.
Reviews.Content: This spot is all about the location. The view and atmosphere is absolutely amazing.The only thing holding me back from giving them five stars is that the service was quite slow especially considering there were not that many people there (it was a wednesday). It took 5-10 minutes from the moment we ordered until all four of us got our drinks (2 beers and a manhattan and a gimlet) and then we waited another 2-3 minutes for us to get the bill and sign it.

Reviews.Author: Thomas G.
Reviews.Content: If you love beautiful urban environments while nestled in little areas of plants and furniture while you enjoy an adult beverage this is it! That said, sip that beverage slow because at 12 bucks a cocktail you won't want another!

Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: Greatest host staff that I've met.  That is really amazing given the fact that they must be run ragged every night by the rooftop bar-goers.I had reservations and there was a little wait, but it was nice.  I got to take my date up to the roof and she loved it, they called us for our table too quickly.My server was really uninterested in her job, and even that didn't dampen my experience.What I thought was amazing was that when we left, we thought we'd go to the roof again.  Nope.  There was a line of trendy children waiting along the wall of the restaurant to get up to the rooftop.  That line was too long.  Then...we noticed that the line actually continued on the ground level and out the door.  They probably had to wait an hour to get to a bar on the roof.  Wow, lemmings.Go early, get the short ribs.

Reviews.Author: Jenny P.
Reviews.Content: Perch has such a great atmosphere! I love coming here for brunch, and the view of Downtown LA is incredible. It is a very trendy spot, which makes for a good excuse to dress up a little with your friends. I definitely recommend coming here!

Reviews.Author: Kris B.
Reviews.Content: This place is overhyped. They do have a nice view of DTLA, but the wait is just horrible. Food wasn't that great either. I had the scallops and it was toooooo salty! I've tasted better ones.  Really didn't meet my expectations. Service was awful... our server took a long time to come back to us. We had better service at the bar area. I would give this place a 2, but the bartender (I think he was from Scotland but I forgot his name) we had while we were waiting was awesome.

Reviews.Author: Farrah B.
Reviews.Content: I went here last night with my girlfriends. The parking was street or paid parking lots. The restaurant is located on top of the rooftop so you have to go through 2 different elevators to get up. The elevators were tiny. They sat us down inside right next to the bar. The waitress was very nice and helpful with food recommendations. She made sure that we all were taken are of. The food was not that great. I ordered the halibut and it was not tasty at all. I had to order bread on the side because it was just bland. We bright our own bottles of wine $20 corkage fee per bottle. The ambiance was old. The chair that I sat on was wobbly. I liked the music played, good service, okay food. The price was $200 for 5 people. When we got out from the hotel there were two bums sleeping in front. Not cool.

Reviews.Author: Grace S.
Reviews.Content: My friends always rave about this place, so I decided to check it out for myself. Perch is a nice rooftop bar. The drinks are very expensive though. My friend ordered "my fare lady" cocktail, which was pretty delicious. I ordered a cocktail as well, but I don't remember the name. It tasted just like grapefruit juice! Yummy! The bar has a nice view of downtown. Very pretty and romantic. Nice place to go for a date! Just a note of caution, there is usually always a line to get into Perch (or at least all the times that I have come).

Reviews.Author: Anita C.
Reviews.Content: An hour wait even you have a reservation?! That's totally not acceptable for a Sunday night which is not even packed! We had a reservation at 8:15pm, arrived there around 8, got a couple drinks, checked back with the host about the table at 9. She said it would be ready soon! Then she started going to outdoor seating and looking for a table!!! Finally we got a table at 9:30...Ordered the ahi tuna tartare, scallop and the halibut with a truffle fries. Generally food is not bad! Price was reasonable too for the view they having. But the cocktails are relatively in a small portion compared to others!They have a restaurant with a rooftop bar upstairs! Not a bad place for hanging out and getting drinks with friends!

Reviews.Author: Ivy W.
Reviews.Content: Perch is one of the few, if not only, non-Asian lounges that I love. I don't frequent it as often as I'd like to, but I've had a good time each time I've been. My favorite thing is probably the decor and ambience -- romantic, elegant, very French. Not to mention the beautiful view of the city; definitely one of the nicer views within downtown. The crowd is very diverse, and it can get pretty packed on a weekend night, so getting a table and finding a place to sit can be a hassle. However, for this review, I'd like to focus on Sunday Brunch.In our most recent visit, my boyfriend and I went with our friends to discuss an upcoming weekend getaway. Making reservations via Open Table, we had a table reserved for us. However, your party will only be seated if everyone is present. George W. and I were running late so our friends couldn't be taken to our table, and hung out at the bar while they waited for us. After arriving, we were immediately seated.Our friends ordered an Arugula & Endive salad ($12) and Huevos Rancheros ($16), while George W. and I got the Perch Burger and French Toast. Our group shared Assorted Homemade Breads and Creamy Truffle Cheese Fries. The Perch Burger ($16) was great, consisting of aged ground beef, brioche, shallot, lettuce, gruyere cheese, garlic aioli, and a fried egg. However, the French Toast ($14), served with vermont maple syrup, brown sugar, bacon, and fresh berries, was a little underwhelming. Delicious croissants, a blueberry muffin, and a orange cranberry muffin were included in the plate of assorted breads ($6). The Truffle Cheese Fries ($11) is probably the best thing Perch has to offer -- definitely recommended if you ever visit Perch, day or night.And what's brunch without champagne? Like most of the surrounding tables, we got a bottle of $15 Pol Clement Brut and added a carafe of peach puree for $5. I personally would've preferred orange juice, but I was outnumbered 3:1. We had the recommended Orange Cardamom Creme Brulee ($10) for dessert, and it was terrible. The caramelized top layer was too thick and broke in large pieces, while the custard underneath was practically a liquid. Do not get this!The food at Perch is overpriced for the taste and quality you get, as the majority of the plates were mediocre. If I ever visit for brunch again, I'll only order croissants, truffle cheese fries, and champagne. It's not a lot of food, but for the view and ambience? Worth it.

Reviews.Author: Tim G.
Reviews.Content: I have been an owner/investor in 5 major restaurant chains, so I do know a little about the business.  The pros.  The food was superb.  Started with the baked brie and finished with the scallops.  My guest had the steak with the fries in a truffle oil/cheese sauce - yummy.  She also had the "writers block" drink - very good.  Waiter (Walker) was excellent - very attentive. The cons - the hostesses.  Snotty and rude.  I had booked a reservation online, and when I arrived I was told that the tables with a view outside had a separate wait list. When I asked how long, I was told that there were two parties ahead of me and than it would be 30+ minutes or more. So I unhappily ate inside. I looked outside and noticed 3 tables for two that were not being used.  During dinner, I looked over and 2 of the 3 were never used - ever.  If it were my restaurant, I would fire the hostesses and start with some people who were customer friendly.

Reviews.Author: Catherine K.
Reviews.Content: In LOVE with Perch. Their brunch is fantastic and their dinner is fantastic. If you're not worried about your waist line absolutely get the parmesan truffle fries! Tuna Tarte Tarte & the scallops are delish too!

Reviews.Author: Giji F.
Reviews.Content: Well aloft the busy Jewelry district, you will find yourself surrounded by great vibe, light conversation, and great staff at the Perch. The interior is phenomena. Speak easy lounge style yet lets not forget we are still in LA.  Live female vocal and drinks floating around. I don't know about the food coz I was drinking too much... ...I am happy that everybody dress to impress. Don't we forced to see enough fugly people at work?

Reviews.Author: Tesia K.
Reviews.Content: Hype central. Lines for days, one to get in and another one to go to the upstairs bar/deckWe had a reservation for dinner so we were able to bypass some of that and had a great view of the cityscape, it wasn't so high up that you were overlooking the city, it's like you were a little bird perched right in the middle of the buildings downtown.I already ate so I ordered the fromage and charcuterie plate so can't say much about the food there but my bf's tiny steak was sinewy and he couldn't eat a lot of the already small portion.Very small space that's overcrowded but I liked the music and it was a nice place to experience

Reviews.Author: Alique B.
Reviews.Content: Get here around 9:45/10pm and you will give Perch 5 stars too!Great drinks, and a beautiful view from a lovely building. I love the "my fair lady". You can also go upstairs to a "VIP" area, but in prefer the patio on the main level better.

Reviews.Author: Rashmi V.
Reviews.Content: This review is for their Sunday Brunch only.  I recently came here on a Sunday with my girlfriends they said that they have been trying to get in for months, wow!  I was sooo excited to finally try this place because of all the hype.  I have to say this location is pretty cool, you take the elevator up and than get out and take another elevator which does give this place a lil pizazzzz.  My friends were already seated and we were seated in the outdoor patio area, the sun was shining right on me and our server was kind enough to move the umbrella around.My friends had already ordered drinks they ordered mimosas and sangria, I don't drink so I can't really comment on it however my friends did enjoy the sangria but they said they did have better elsewhere.I ordered the french toast instead of the bacon I replaced it with potatoes, food came out and I was excited, the presentation as nice.  The french toast had strawberries and raspberries on top.  So let's start with the potatoes, they were cold and not cooked, they were actually under cooked and tasteless, they were cooked with bell peppers but there was no seasoning to the potatoes, I was so disappointed.  The french toast was good it wasn't greattt.. It was sweet and more flat, it had an nice sweet taste to it but I was expecting something different it wasn't fluffy like I expected it, it was good but I wouldn't order it again.The atmosphere was nice, they had live music playing and you had a nice view of Downtown but the crowd was okay.  It was a different crowd of all ages, I actually expected something else.  The service was okay, would have liked a refill on my water without having to ask for it.All in all it was OKAYYYY...I did convince my friends to go up one floor to the very top top roof and we did enjoy the panoramic view of downtown and got some great pics but I wasn't impressed with the food.  My Mom makes better french toast.  All in all it was okay, I honestly wouldn't come back, overpriced and I guess you are just paying for the ambiance! =/Oh and we also ordered desert the creme brule, once again that was alrite too.  WIsh they had better selection on desserts

Reviews.Author: Kali M.
Reviews.Content: I can't speak to the social scene as I totally ignored it; my husband and I took my visiting-from-out-of-town mother so we were hardly there to mingle.We are not typically downtown folk, so dinner on top of a high-rise with views of city lights?  Out of the ordinary for us, and I truly enjoyed the change of pace.  Our food was phenomenal.  We did semi-family style, and on the table were:Bacon Mac n' CheeseRoasted Brussels SproutsWild Mushroom RisottoHerb Crusted SalmonPan Roasted Chicken SupremeI tried a bit of everything and didn't have a single negative thing to say about any of it.  Standouts for me were the Salmon and the Risotto.Easy flat-rate lot parking across the street (especially if you're there on a weeknight).

Reviews.Author: Lu Lu S.
Reviews.Content: Cool spot, tasty food, mignon with new potatoes was excellent...yum! Views of downtown skyline from the cozy patio seating. Deserved 5 stars until my husband got a long piece of hair in his bread :(

Reviews.Author: Graeme H.
Reviews.Content: I think I'll go nest somewhere else. I came to Perch on some recommendations of some co workers.   I'm not sure if it was an off night, but we didn't have the elevated experience we were hoping for.I called that day to make reservations, which I then called back to confirm.I showed up and of course they didn't have my reservation.  They asked if I received a text message response but when I told them know, they asked for my phone number, which they identified, and finally, after five minutes found my reservation.  They refused to seat us while we waited for our party (who were downstairs on the way up)We were seated and seemed like an eternity went by (because it did) and then we finally flagged down a waiter.  Not the first waiter who walked by, just the one who happened to not ignore our waves and shouts.    That waiter said "let me get your waiter"10 minutes go by and she comes back and says "well, I guess I'm your waiter" We then had to ask for menus.    We ordered the Chicken and the Steak.  The Chicken is VERY salty and the steak was much too dry.We also asked for heaters and they did eventually came but they decided to point them away from us for some reason.    Pros:  Downtown location if you are in the areaCreative Drinks (but smallish selection)View (if you happen to sit outsideCons:Snooty serviceUnclean restaurantA Happy hour drink can still run you $10 Happy hour food can also run you $10++Food I wouldn't write home about Its clear they staff aren't keen on making an impression.  The decor is nice, sure, and the live music is a nice touch, but beyond that and they view, thats pretty much it.  Don't come to eat.

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: Went here yesterday on the friend surprise Birthday party, very cool place, right on a top of the loft building. Bar full of different, interesting drinks between $10-15, delicious appetizers for very good prices. I leave in 4 blocks away from this place and it was my first time here, Looking forward to go there again!

Reviews.Author: Anhers M.
Reviews.Content: It was only last night that we were here and I had to review on my phone. Yes on my phone without a full keyboard so you know how great this place is!!We made dinner RSVP at 1030 which I suggest for everyone. "Our" man Dwight gave our table away cause we weren't cool enough but our table was ready after 10 mins of waiting.Kettle on the rocks was $17 (ouch) but it was full cup. Cute and super outgoing young men everywhere. If I wasn't married....I was so hungry and no shame that it was a lounge and everyone was casually drinkingOn the tab: Mussels - small mussels but it was juicy and the sauce was awesomeDuck sliders came in 3 and were delicious Steak frites was okay but their fries had creamy cheese on it and were amazing!!Brussels sprouts looked burnt but once again yummy!!!With two drinks and the bill cane out to be $126 tip inc for a group of 5 starving ladiesService was great but for a cute trendy restaurant their uniforms didn't match.. Pretty much I have nothing bad to say so I had to find something

Reviews.Author: M. Angelica R.
Reviews.Content: Had my birthday brunch here at Perch recently. I made reservations before hand and was disappointed to hear that an outside table could not be promised depending on how busy it is. But I was happy to walk right In and be told by the nice hostess that there were plenty of tables outside with a great view. Overall brunch was good. Mimosas were good and the vibe was nice. I had a wonderful birthday brunch.

Reviews.Author: J N.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the view, food, drinks and the happy hour prices.-4 for the service.The waiter serving us thought it was okay to let a few cuss words slip. I understand we're both young, but I expect to be treated as well as someone that is years your senior. The truffle fries were delicious and the champagne was perfect!But when the check came, the potty mouth waiter came back and asked how we would like to separate our bill. I wrote out what amount would go where for each card. He came back and looked at what I wrote and said, "I'm just going to split it 3 ways," and walked away! Um, excuse me?! I only got one drink for $5, why are you going to make it so I'm paying 12 dollars?! I tried to grab him but he already ran the card.....Very unprofessional and I was completely turned off by the lack of quality service. The bussers were the only people I received great service from. Customer service is super important to me. There are plenty of other places I'd rather give my business to.

Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: Here for several times at the place.It is highly recommended place as they are nice done here.Love their drinks and have  great collection must be checked after words.Price is so affordable and standard kind.Top to button is extremely outstanding.Losses one star for their décor as should be come.

Reviews.Author: Clara Y.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooftop lounge overlooking Pershing Square and Downtown LA! Been here twice already with the BF and his best friend. Great view, great food/dessert, great drinks, great crowd, awesome music! Love the ambience and the French inspired decor. Cute outdoor seating-comfy furniture, warm fireplaces, and cozy fire pits! Please note that you can only dine w/ reservations, unless you don't mind being waitlisted. Trust me, reservations will get you in faster and you won't have to wait in line at all! We ordered:Entrees:Pan roasted chicken supreme w/ wild mushroom risotto-juicy/tender chicken and delicious risotto!Juicy pork belly-very tenderAhi tuna w/ fried wontons-yum :)Roasted brussel sprouts-MUST ORDER, the bacon, sweet soy, and sesame go really well together mmmm :DDessert:White Chocolate Bread Pudding-MUST ORDER, the best bread pudding ever!!!Orange Cardamom Creme Brulee-yummy!We'll be going back for sure!!!

Reviews.Author: Liza P.
Reviews.Content: For the price, I found the food and drinks to be alright. They get 4 stars because the view of DTLA is absolutely stunning! Make sure to reserve a table outside, what the food lacks the view totally makes up for.

Reviews.Author: Marcos L.
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best places for brunch in LA, I've became a regular!! Not only does The Perch have an amazing rooftop view but the food and drinks are delicious. Outstanding service. Nice and cool vibe. Mature crowd.

Reviews.Author: Blah Blah A.
Reviews.Content: Loved the food and view! Mussels, fries, tuna tartar, Mac and cheese were all amazingness! A little pricey but it's a typical LA restaurant. Not a place to go with a big group of friends or a birthday ( if you're planning on having dinner) But a perfect restaurant for a date night or to go with couples or with the girls! Oh and amazing drinks but the drink with the jalapeño is way to spicey !

Reviews.Author: Lisa W.
Reviews.Content: This place is ridiculous! We were waiting in the line at 10pm til 10:45pm and they weren't letting ANYBODY go in, "except those who made restaurant reservations" this late?! yah, rigggght. If there's a line, I say skip it because the door lady will just ignore the line and won't tell you what's going on. I'll pass on the LA smog view any day anyways.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: I'm becoming a huge fan of Downtown Los Angeles and this place is one of the reasons why. What better way to spend a Saturday evening on a rooftop in the middle of Downtown LA with a gorgeous view, ideal temperature, and a snazzy band called Bird, Bird, Bird?
