The drinks are steep but you kind of expect that when you're out in LA at a place like this. Worth coming to every so often.

Reviews.Author: Christine T.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Perch a few times now. Each time here is always a lot of fun with live entertainment, good food and good company. On my recent visit, there was a live band that was playing on the outdoor rooftop. While waiting for a table, we grabbed a cocktail and enjoyed the live music as the weather was just perfect.We were sat in the middle of the restaurant/bar area.  For those who like to people watch this was the best spot  as you're able to get views of all angles.  We ordered the garlic steamed mussels, steak frites, and scallops. Everything was tasty especially the scallops and steak. Both of these entrees were seasoned and cooked perfectly just like how we asked. I wasn't too fond of the steamed mussels. It was a tad dry and chewy. If you plan on coming here, I suggest arriving before 11PM. There's usually a line forming with people trying to get in by the time I leave.

Reviews.Author: Catalina T.
Reviews.Content: The view of this amazing rooftop bar is truly indescribable and really unforgettable. You learn to love and appreciate the city lights and what the night life views have to offer here in SoCal. Showed up here a few months ago on a semi early Friday night and had no wait to get in. The place itself is a bit tricky to find since you need to walk into a building and then take the elevator up to the 13th floor and then take another elevator to the 16th floor where to the Perch is.  I truly loved the fact that there was NO COVER CHARGE for this place. As for dress code, pretty much anything flies here. You can be dressed up or casual but don't look like you rolled out of bed. The crowd is pretty mixed, young kids, older professional looking people to even some hipsters. Either way you will not feel out of place. If you are lucky enough, you will find a place to sit and chill while taking in the breathless view of the city otherwise you might be stuck walking around among the crowd with eagle eyes waiting for the next group of people to fly off their table so you can swoop in and take over. The place can get a bit crowded and I would suggest making friends so hopefully you have no trouble finding a spot for you and your friends. This place might not be good for groups unless you make reservations for dinner. Also if you go late or on a busier day you might find yourself having to wait on the long line going out and around the corner to just get in like I found myself just a few weeks ago doing. Unfortunately I did not want to wait an hour just to get it so sadly I walked away.Drinks: *My Fair Lady: - fair quinoa vodka, cranberry, lime, crème de peche $12The drink is well made and it's not strong tasting at all. I had asked the bartender for something with vodka and she suggested this drink to me. She seem to make the drink perfectly in which I was able to get the full flavors of all the ingredients with none being more over powering than the other. This drink was very easy to enjoy and drink for those that aren't into the strong alcohol taste.*French Maid - park vs cognac, lemon, cucumber, mint $12The lemon, cucumber and mint make this a refreshing drink with a nice park vs  cognac kick sort of like a different version of a mojito. The park vs cognac made this one of the stronger drinks I had without making me feel manly haha. *Lolita - Fris vodka, st germain, grapefruit juice, cucumber, champagne$14Served in a martini glass; this became my favorite drink here. The champagne definitely very delicious when it's mixed with grapefruit juice. A lot of people don't like eating grapefruit because of the bitterness but this drink made it all super delicious They also serve wine, bottle and draught beer.On average you will pay about $12-$15 per cocktail if that is your poison for the night. Do keep it class and not trashy here plus getting trashy will most likely burn a hole in the wallet. The bartenders were all super friendly and happy to suggest/recommend drinks for you based on your taste and cravings for the night.Classy place with a wonderful view that can be chill, romantic/fun and for sure a nice place to catch up with a few friends. The music was good and not loud so it was easy to carry on a conversation. I would love to come back and have dinner here or even brunch as listed on their website. Great place for sure to come an experience and remember why we love SoCal so much, which means an even more awesome place to bring out of towners too as well.

Reviews.Author: Johänna S.
Reviews.Content: This place is on the 15th story of a building and was such an awesome experience. It was so fancy I felt kind of silly for leaving my monocle at home. Their beer selection was really small, but I guess when you're fancy you don't waste time with such drinks like Modelo and such. No matter, my fiance and I had a few mixed drinks and spent our time looking over LA. Be fair warned the drinks are quite expensive and so is the food. My fiance and I had two drinks each and spent forty bucks. It's not a bad place. If you got the money try this place. Definitely perfect for impressing a first date or for those who love standing on top of a tall building screaming "I'm on top of the world!!" Either way.

Reviews.Author: Monyia J.
Reviews.Content: The building is in a not so desired part of downtown. There is no valet so you have to take a short walk down mini skid row. You have to take a few elevators up to the restaurant. The ambiance is nice but they don't have a sufficient amount of heat lamps during Winter. The lighting is very poor so read the menu before hand. The food is pretty good. I had the filet and dessert was great. The orange creme brûlée is the best I ever had. It wasn't overly sweet like most brûlées. The service was not ok. They duplicated items we ordered twice. It took forever between each course and to get our drinks; however, the drinks are very tasty.  I had my fair lady and I believe writers block and loved both although distinctly different. In short not much they can do about location so my advice would be to increase their customer service.

Reviews.Author: Jinhee J.
Reviews.Content: Came here on Mother's Day around 6:10 pm. It was empty. There were 6 of us trying to get a table on this lovely evening. We were told that ALL the tables were reserved from 6-7 pm therefore we could hang out at the bar. 15 minutes pass and one other party had walked in. We start lingering around the bar and one of my friends happened to be leaning on the couch. He was asked to remove his hat and lean off the couch.  You can't uphold a professional standard when those standards are contradicted by the hosts who are wearing street clothes. It's even weirder when the whole place is empty.The view is good but I don't ever plan on coming here again. Too pretentious for me.

Reviews.Author: Soo H.
Reviews.Content: After my fucking disastrous previous encounter at Perch, I had a surprisingly wonderful brunch here yesterday.I made a reservation for 12:15pm and by the time we rolled in, the place was already packed.  Between the two of us, we had the baked brie, the perch burger, crab benedict, white chocolate bread pudding, and raspberry creme brulee.  Oh yeah, and 2 pitchers of sangria... yes, two.  and yes, we were both pretty drunk by the end of that brunch. The total for this feast ended up being $113... which I think is pretty high for a brunch.  But then again, I do suppose normal people don't eat quite so much food at brunch.The baked brie was good - the pastry was pleasantly flaky but I wish the brie inside were more melted and gooier.  Otherwise, it was tasty.  My burger's only redeeming quality was that it had a sunny side up egg on it (which makes EVERYTHING better).  Otherwise, it was a very mediocre burger.  My date's crab benedict was better than my burger - poached eggs on crab cakes.  The desserts were surprisingly the highlight of my meal ... next time, I think I'll just get the brie and a dessert.  I have a hard time finding really good bread pudding, and this one was very tasty - the top was heavily drenched in some syrup though, so I imagine the whole thing was around 1000 calories.Their sangria is deceptively tasty btw - I couldn't stop drinking it, and I spent the rest of the day in a sleepy haze.  So beware of the sangria... but in a good way.  I saw several people seated at the bar too, so I imagine if you just walk in you could eat/drink there for brunch.  It was lovely to sit outside with a rooftop view in the middle of the day and eat and get drunk, though.

Reviews.Author: Joe T.
Reviews.Content: Ah yes, Perch, the latest in pretentious douchery.  Once you are burned out from the Standard and whatever other faux Hollywood spot, come on through to stand in several lines that put the lines at  Disneyland to shame.Perch, everybody, because you might as well be a fucking bird to get to the top faster.Okay, perhaps that's a bit harsh. But just skim down the reviews and you'll see the complaints run more consistently than your SPAM box filled with Japanese tentacle porn emails. Now frankly, I don't really care for the happening scenes. Simply because everyone else out there is doing the same thing you are, trying to get noticed; and guess what? Everybody's a nobody! Oh the irony.However, if at your own peril, you wish to continue, seems like you'll be in for a wait. Conventional wisdom says that if you want to scope out the place, go on Thursday Happy Hour. No waiting!No freezing!No dying!I'll get to that in a second. You'll zoom past the elevators and head right into the mezzanine that is the restaurant and bar. Retro decor, seemingly good menu, fat wallets required. However, skip to the outside and upstairs and you'll fine a pretty open spot and bar. Seemingly french music blares out the speakers while you're busy in love with the downtown los angeles skyline, taking pictures of it, and using some lame instagram filter to make it more noire. The bartenders are on point and the drinks are legit.Now a warning.Either have a spear or a rock handy. Because being 16 floors up leads to a much, much cooler environment. Should you not be dressed for it at night, be prepared to fight your fellow trendy cro-magnon friends who will not be your friends after they become aware of the scarce patio heaters available. Fuck the $10 mac 'n cheese dinner, because you will cut a bitch in order to keep feelings in your extremities. You're in it for the ambiance, unique drinks, and most of all, to cackle maniacally while you stare down at all the cozy minions on the street going about their business. Oh did I mention the view is great?

Reviews.Author: Angie M.
Reviews.Content: Since my last visit to perch the service has gone down significantly. Which is really to bad since I used to rate this 5 stars. The hostess didn't greet us we I had to greet her after awkwardly standings there.  I let her know we had a reservation for 3 and she said she needed to check if they had anything available. So I told her once again that I had a reservation. I guess she didn't hear me... anyway she asked my bame and someone else quickly sat us. The food and drinks were good I got the huevos rancheros and a bloody mary. Our server took our order right away and we didn't wait long for our food. We asked for the check and the waitress took forever to pick up the tab. I could see her standings talking to her co worker. After we went to the rooftop and it was packed no room to sit so we left and went to another bar. This was the first time that I came for brunch usually I go for dinner and the service is better along with a killer view. :-)

Reviews.Author: Pamela S.
Reviews.Content: Great spot. What a gorgeous view of DTLA. That alone made my night.I was very impressed my first time here. Early Monday night seemed like a good time to come.The fromage + charcuterie plate hit the spot, all of it was delicious.Superb service, really adds to the experience doesn't it?Loved it. Will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Aang A.
Reviews.Content: The view is amazingbut this one bartender ruined it forever . I told the bartender I was on a budget and looking for an economy beer. They said they knew what I was talking about. I had 4 beers throughout the night. When I got the bill it was $64 !I didn't even know $16 beers existed? And the bartender misunderstood "economy beer" for "luxury beer." Then she got mad I didn't tip her ! nasty trick.

Reviews.Author: Kathy D.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Perch several times now, and my daughter wanted to go for her birthday dinner so we went.  Wow...she was so disappointed, as was I.  They did seat us on time and in the location I had requested.  The waitress was so unfriendly and hardly came to our table.  Then we figured since there was 6 of us, she knew she was going to receive 18% gratuity...why bother. Then there was Paul.....he made our night.  He was always at our table, and with a smile. He was certainly more attentive and friendlier than our server. The food was a disappointment...everything was so salty!  The chicken, the steak and fries...tasted like it was soaked in salt.  The Little Bunny Frou Frou ravioli tasted like canned tuna, not rabbit. I'd go again for the drinks and ambience, but not the food.

Reviews.Author: Cassie A.
Reviews.Content: Make a reservation and your set for a good night

Reviews.Author: Kimberly M.
Reviews.Content: I came to Perch for the first time for my sister's birthday brunch and I loved it.  It was a very trendy rooftop restaurant with great views of Downtown LA.  It was very busy and it took quite a while for our waitress to take our order and for our food to be delivered, but other than that everything was fine.  We ordered the Charcuterie plate as an appetizer and I had eggs ( which were scrambled well and not runny), turkey sausage and potatoes as my meal. It was very simple and the portions were the perfect size.  They also had a live singer with a soulful voice who sang current hip hop and R&B hits.   I hate elevators and only being able to get in and out of the restaurant by elevator made me a little nervous, but overall I had a great time.

Reviews.Author: Annie S.
Reviews.Content: Friday nights are awesome here, but the line going up to the roof can be a bit discouraging.great foodgreat service

Reviews.Author: Kellie H.
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hang out spot or even for a romantic night out on the town :) We made reservations but was not seated by the patio side per our request... (hence the 4 star)Nonetheless, our waitress was helpful and the food was fine. Notice how I used the word "fine", it was because my $27 HERB CRUSTED SALMON (shrimp, wild mushroom, English peas, roasted red pepper coulis) were not impressive at all. It was decent don't get me wrong. I don't know care much about their scallops either (portion was so small) so the food really wasn't the priority for me.After the dinner though, I was excited. There is a whole other scene up on the rooftop. I felt refreshed and was mesmerized by the city lights of Los Angeles surrounded by people. There is a mini rooftop bar and the night view was stunning.There is also a public restroom which is a plus for the ladies (hey we gotta make sure we look good right). Overall, I like the place and if I am ever in town again I'd visit. Super romantic but it did get pretty crowded toward the end of the night, so make sure you go up to the rooftop early and grab a cozy spot with your honey near the heater :)

Reviews.Author: kerry k.
Reviews.Content: I've only ever been on a Sunday afternoon for drinks. Perfect place to go for that! It's mellow,gorgeous view and there was a swanky jazz band playing to add to the atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Kathy W.
Reviews.Content: Came here for some drinks with friends on a Saturday Night.RED HERRING ($12)- aperol, grapefruit juice, california ale, angostura- initially has an unpleasant taste but then it becomes acquired- definitely could taste the grapefrutFRENCH MAID ($12)- park vs cognac, lemon juice, cucumber, fresh mint- good tastes like a mojito- definitely recommend for something sweet yet refreshingMY FAIR LADY ($12)- fair vodka, cranberry juice, fresh lime, crème de peche- basically a cran-vodka but strongerENVIRONMENT: Most people come here because of the view from atop the building. Hence the name Perch. The view is okay since there is a lot of smog in the background. The view is also mainly of Pershing Square. There is a higher rooftop viewing but there was a line to get up there (though I'm not sure how others got up there before us). The view from the higher level is no different but at least there is more space up there. There are heat lamps to keep people cool.SERVICE: Decent. Bartenders do the best they can to serve the people. Just make sure you get your card back as our bartender dropped my friend's on the floor and forgot to give it back. There is also a line for pretty much everything: to get in, to get a drink, to go upstairs, to wait for the elevators, etc.Overall, decent place with a variety of drinks. It basically reminds me of a standing up lounge. There are seats available but mainly reserved for people who are there for dinner. Though I don't know why people would have a dinner here after 10p when it's so loud and many people walking around them. Don't know if I'd actually come back but it's a spot for those looking for a classy way to catch up with friends and want a more lit up environment.

Reviews.Author: Maki K.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Friday night just for drinks. Food pictures and the food people were eating looked enticing though, will have to come back to try the food then write another review.Details:-They have Happy Hour (HH) from 4-6 PM (not 100% positive, but I think only Mon-Fri).-Get there before 10 PM if you want to go up to the rooftop without waiting to see the amazing views of the downtown LA skyline since they have a certain number of people they can only let up there. After 10 PM, a friend who was lagging had to wait about a half hour to come up to meet us on the rooftop.-We had a difficult time locating it from the street as we were driving around. It's a little obscured. There is street parking, valet for $8, or private lot parking in the surrounding areas for various prices.Minus 1 star b/c: we were bummed when we found out we could only eat on the 15th floor, not on the rooftop. We really wanted to try the truffle cheese fries among other things. To eat on the 15th floor, you either have to have reservations or scrounge around for bar seating or these random couches that don't have "reserved" signs on them. Another reason for minus 1 star: there was only 1 bathroom for women and 1 for men on the rooftop that we could find. Women were waiting a long time to pee (and that's not good if you've had a few cocktails)!But all in all, I'm glad I came here. Now I know it exists, I will most likely be back to try the food during HH or come back for another girls' night out.

Reviews.Author: Hudson W.
Reviews.Content: Three starts for the atmosphere and the view. The service was pretty slow, we had to ask our server more than once for each round of drinks. The surf and turf appetizer is amazing, however the filet is pretty bad. Octopus appetizer was horrible. Go for the drinks and view but eat a mean meal somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: 16th floor, amazing view!Came here on a Friday night with his two co-workers. Nice choice, guys. Totally reminded me of the Rooftop Bar at the Standard Hotel, however, MUCH MORE calmer. (love it) So it takes two elevators to get up to the top. I like how there's two bouncer guys stand around at the second flight of elevator just to guide you where the roof is. By the way, listen to them when they say "press only the bottom button when waiting for the elevator" because you DO NOT want to set the fire alarm off. (maybe they should do something about that in case someone does get intoxicated and does press it...)As we got upstairs, open seats! Yes, there are two small fire pits and a few chairs and empty tables without chairs where you can use to put your drinks while chit-chatting. We were lucky enough to sit at the rocking chair area. We met a couple of people, and made some small chats. The drinks were $$ but worth it because of the ambiance. Sipping on something you like, enjoying the smooth music and having the people you like around you is the best feeling ever. Get the French Maid drink and make sure you have the lady make it, because she makes it the best. Avoid the African American dude, he made it too sweet and was not worth $12.Left around 10pm and damn there was a hell of a line. Line formed from the door to the roof top and from the bottom floor to the first elevator you take. I would prefer to come here early just so you can have a place to sit. Coming back? Oh yeah!Note: casual wear is fine. no need to really dress up.

Reviews.Author: Gregg S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, great atmosphere and view. The service was quick and professional, nothing to complain about there. We had the baked brie appetizer, I had the pot-au-feu short ribs and my fiance the chicken supreme, and shared the orange cardamom creme brulee. All were excellent, although there was maybe a slightly heavy hand with the cardamom (I like the flavor, but it drowned out the orange and vanilla a bit). The only misstep was syncing up the drink and food service; I was halfway through my entree before I was offered a new drink (after finishing my cocktail), and the after-dinner drink arrived long after dessert. Also, the spicy jalepeno cocktail is REALLY spicy. That's not necessarily a bad thing, but I was expecting a little hum of jalepeno and got a blast of heat (and I'm generally a fan of spicy food). Regardless, very well done overall and we'd definitely go back.Regarding the reviews about people having bad service with groups, this is not a big space, there are very few big tables, I'm honestly surprised they even allow reservations for more than 6 or so. I would not recommend this as a place for large groups, but for an intimate, 2 or 4 person meal, it's excellent.

Reviews.Author: Em L.
Reviews.Content: o7.o6.13I figured most people would be out of town because of the long weekend but apparently, I was wrong. We waited on line for over an hr :( The drinks were ok but don't get Red Herring or something, it's disgusting. The rooftop was ok, nothing special really. But it was still fun just to hang up there for a bit. :)

Reviews.Author: Joseph B.
Reviews.Content: Went for a birthday party with some friends. And reserved a section for us on the roof with our own bar tender. Had a great time with the weather, cigars, drinks, and the great view. The regulars that frequent the place are so-so but if you're going with your own group and the weather is nice you will have a great time.

Reviews.Author: Josie K.
Reviews.Content: the view is just AMAZING here!! i came for a friends bday dinner and we had a large group but had reservations so didnt have to wait too long. I wasnt too hungry so I only tried the appetizers. I ordered the bacon mac and cheese ($10) and also tried the fruit,meat, and cheese plate (about $16). i'd definitely recommend BOTH! mac and cheese was on point, and was a decent size considering it was 10 bucks. the meat and cheese plate was good but I wish it came with more jam for the bread. i wasn't a huge fan of all the nuts that came with the dish. service was pretty good and there was live music that night on the balcony! its a pretty nice place to grab some drinks with friends and listen to music :) i believe drinks were about 10

Reviews.Author: Steve M.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant/bar is one of the happening places in downtown la.  I came at 4:30 for drinks and it was mildly busy and pleasant.  I didn't want to come for the crowds, and as such, the happy hour menu with drinks for 5-6 dollars was nice.  Service was a little slow and the food was decent.  great views.  Worth a look.  I haven't checked out the club up top at night.  could be fun.

Reviews.Author: Selina S.
Reviews.Content: I can't say that I'm an expert at judging the quality of rooftop bars, but I loved coming here! their writer's block cocktail was absolutely AMAZING, not to mention the view from Perch is absolutely gorgeous!!!

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: The ambiance here is tough to beat.  A rooftop restaurant with a lot of character.  They had live music and even a guy working the elevator.  The food was really good, but the ambiance got it over 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Brandon S.
Reviews.Content: The views are great.  The decor is on point.  I am not a huge fan of live music, but I am willing to accept that I am in the minority on that point.We started with an order of the Bacon Mac N' Cheese to start.  It was very good.  It had a great creamy texture.  The cheese flavors were bold yet I could still taste the bacon.  The portion is probably best shared between two people, a maximum of three.For my meal I ordered the Steak Frites.  The flat iron steak comes with truffle fries.  I am a sucker for truffle fries.  The steak was prepared as requested and had solid flavor and texture for a flat iron.  The truffle fries were excellent.  The meal had great rich flavors.I also tried one of their signature cocktails, the Saint Cloud.  It was essentially a rye sour.  It was quite tasty.This place is a cool place to have dinner with friends or a romantic type date.  It is noisy, but the views and food make it worth it.

Reviews.Author: S L.
Reviews.Content: WAY overrated. The only thing worth the trip out here is the view. That's ALL. It is a really pretty view.Too trendy, and the crowd is MUCH older than I expected (30+ for the vast majority of the crowd). The rooftop bar is really small, seating is sparse, music can hardly be heard, and there aren't really enough fire pits to keep you warm.Overall, I was really underwhelmed. We left after about 20 minutes. I probably won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Alice C.
Reviews.Content: Great place to get drink and soak in the view of LA on a none weekend night.Place can get chaotic on the weekend with lines on the street, and the lines to get to the rooftop bar from the restaurant. Don't come here between 9:30pm to 11pm.The crowd are mixed, but could be a little heavy on the wanna be crowd who like to walk around in circle with the same drinks in hand all night long.

Reviews.Author: Cindy L.
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Perch is the cause of the worst thing about Perch. The best thing about Perch: the lovely rooftop (16th floor) lounge with a gorgeous L.A. view. Plenty of chairs (well, if you hang out near the chairs long enough, you'll eventually be able to snag one) & heat lamps. Not crowded at all and a great place for a date or just hanging out with friends. One of my friends had dinner there earlier and said it was delicious. The worst thing about Perch: Lines. In order to maintain the unsquishy environment in both the 15th floor (restaurant) & especially at the rooftop, you must bypass 2 lines to get there. The 1st line is to make it inside the building to take the 1st elevator to the 13th floor. From the 13th floor, you take another elevator to the 15th floor. If you choose to hang out in the indoor lounge/restaurant, hooray! No more lines for you. But if you prefer to ascend to the 16th floor, another line awaits you. They seem to be pretty strict about it since no one is allowed to the top unless people leave. So if your goal is the rooftop, make sure you are in the SECOND line no later than 10pm. If you have friends who like to arrive fashionably late, give them a fake earlier time (and yes, I've had to do this before...many times) to save the headache of half your party missing in action. Once you leave the roof top, you will have to wait in line again to go back up. - no cover - parking lot across the street ($6 flat rate) or valet - only 1 ladies' bathroom stall at the roof top- dress warmly if you plan on mostly hanging out at the rooftop - attire is dressy-casual - there's a DJ but mostly background music

Reviews.Author: Anne G.
Reviews.Content: I had dinner this week at Perch on the patio of the restaurant.  It was a Tuesday night and the place was pleasantly full and lively.  We were seated outside on the patio (the view is incredible) and our waitress, Kristen, offered us beverages immediately. I had a glass of their Syrah/Grenache blend which perfectly complemented our starters, octopus and a baked brie.  Octopus - There are certain dishes I ALWAYS order when I see them on the menu and Octopus is one of them.  This dish did not disappoint.  It was very fresh, tender, not at all chewy and left me wanting more.  The baked brie was a perfect starter as well, especially if you're drinking red wine.We split the scallops and salmon for mains.  Scallops were my favorite hands down.  The broth was simple and done well and has succulent lobster in it too, yum!!  Normally I don't order salmon but our waitress recommended it and I'm so glad she did.  This was a composed dish, not just the healthier choice.  The crispy skin of the salmon was out of control good.  It had the perfect crunch and kept the salmon hot and moist. I can't wait to come back here again! Next time I'm trying the Braised Short Rib...

Reviews.Author: Wendy K.
Reviews.Content: I go here for cocktails and the view from the roof, and that's all. I've had some lovely times here, but more often than not the experience is kind of not that great. The bouncers checking id's and wandering around are kind of jackasses (and I'm not going on nights when there is a line or anything, they just seem kind of bad at normal human interactions). I had an experience on the roof on a slightly crowded night where a guy on staff followed my friend and I around and kept telling us we couldn't stand wherever we were standing which made little sense and felt like a bad comedy sketch. The crowd here at times can be super tacky; loud, obnoxious people wearing cheeseball outfits who don't know how to act in public. Seriously, please don't have a full on makeout session on the couch by the bar before 11pm. No one is drunk enough to be able to ignore you yet. Other times, its not so bad, so I guess you don't know what you'll find...I haven't seen much consistency on what the good nights to go might be. I've ordered wine here a few times and not liked anything I've tried so I stick to the cocktail list now which is actually pretty great. I've never tried the food in the restaurant and I don't feel particularly compelled to. I was sitting at the bar in the restaurant area recently when my companion asked if they had olives. We were thinking highend-ish type french restaurant, most places have a nice little olive appetizer, right? The bartender said, "sure" and unceremoniously dumped a bunch of cocktail olives in a glass and placed them in front of us. Appreciate him attempting to accommodate a request for something that turned out clearly not to be a part of their menu, but we're still laughing about that one!

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth checking out in DTLA. Amazing atmosphere and speechless scenery.. can't get better than this! Came here around 10pm on Thursday, not a lot of people so we were able to get seats. Only got 2 drinks here, a little pricey but you pay for the environment. It's located in a hotel so you have to take an elevator up to the 13th floor (restaurant), after they let you in, you can either walk up or take another elevator to the 16th floor.

Reviews.Author: Alison L.
Reviews.Content: I heard a lot about Perch and was very excited to come here.  The view is gorgeous and I loved the decor, it was especially charming during the holiday season, you could see the skating rink in Pershing Square. The drinks in my opinion were a little pricey and weak, but the patrons were very friendly.I really wish I could give Perch a good rating, but the night was dampened by an incredibly disrespectful security guard. My friends were taking pictures on the roof top with their hands to the glass when the security guard rudely said to them, "that glass is worth more than ya'll."  We were so stunned by that comment that we didn't know what to say.  Apparently, this was not the first time my friend had had a bad experience at Perch. She came here with her boyfriend a while ago, and they were asked to leave the roof top area because they were reopening it. They asked the security guard if they could stay since they were already there and he replied, "who do you think you are? You're nobody."  I strongly hope management will take proactive action with their security and fix this problem. Belittling and offending patrons are not acceptable behavior and it gives Los Angeles a bad reputation.

Reviews.Author: Art O.
Reviews.Content: At the end of the day, this place was fun.We didn't have to wait too long in line and once we got upstairs and onto the roof it wasn't the scene that I thought it'd be (which is a good thing).On the way to the roof, the restaurant seemed very sleek and the food smelled delicious! I definitely would like to try this place out for dinner.The patio is what you come for though. It was a beautiful LA night and you can see all the downtown skyscrapers in all their nocturnal glory. It really does blow you away to see downtown lit up like that and to see the view from 15 or so stories up.The drinks - a manhattan - were good but of course expensive. Well, you do have to pay for that view somehow. And the scene wasn't all that full of LA douchebags as I expected. Yeah, there was a drunk young dude who was way too loud and bragging but it was his birthday so I tried not to let it bother me. Mostly just regular young folk trying to take in a new scene.I agree with Brittany L. -  I was pleasantly surprised by this place.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay H.
Reviews.Content: Food is ok but the service is horrrrrrible. Waiting for the rest of my life for a check and the entire time my coffee was gone and cold

Reviews.Author: F U.
Reviews.Content: come for the view. that's about it.

Reviews.Author: Nicole J.
Reviews.Content: This place has a great atmosphere! Dim lights, rooftop views, good music.  Fancy drinks and can be a little pricey.  I went there for my birthday with my boyfriend and 2 friends. Also would be a great date place.  Another reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because someone stole my phone off the table.  The bartender told my friend it happens 3 times a night so keep your valuables tight!

Reviews.Author: Brenda S.
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? My fiancé and I went to Perch for dinner on 10/6. We took the elevator up to the 15th floor where we had reservations for four and were seated right away. We took in the view over a delightful dinner and delicious drinks (you gotta try their house drinks). It was perfect. Tony, the manager, came by our table to check how everything was going.After dinner we went up to the 16th floor to enjoy some more drinks. The view is even more spectacular upstairs....and that is where my guy proposed to me. We had champagne to celebrate. It was all so perfect, the view was gorgeous, the ambiance was great, and it was all thanks to Anne who worked with my fiancé to set everything up. So I don't understand why people complain about staff when everybody we talked to was so friendly and always had a smile. I recommend this place for a date or drinks with friends. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Pat P.
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I'm a little desensitized to rooftop lounges, but I thought Perch was not worth the half hour wait that it took to get in.The space is quite large and there are plenty of varying views and ambiances to enjoy, but it's not spectacular by any means. It would probably never get three stars if it were located in New York City, but context is important, and that's why it gets three from me. The food, however, is horrible. The cocktails are decent, and at these prices you'd feel like you're back in New York. In any case, it's a lively vibe and an easy view of LA, so I wouldn't be opposed to coming back again.

Reviews.Author: Magen S.
Reviews.Content: I would have given this place a solid 4 stars, until I had one of the worst restaurant experiences of my life here because of one waitress. I've been here just for the bar and brunch before, and LOVED it. Great crab cake benedict (if I'm remembering correctly) and sweet service. However, I came back fairly recently to show my out-of-towner friend this beautiful rooftop restaurant/bar in DTLA. We were sat down and served by an incompetent server, Jessica. It took at least 30 minutes before she would come ask us for what we needed EVERYTIME and it was a slow night! She was rude, slow, and had a terrible, unfriendly "stink" face on. To top it off, she walked away before I could put in my order after my friends placed theirs. I'm not much of a complainer at restaurants, and typically I review very highly on Yelp. This was one of my worst dining experiences. As great as the food and drinks are, as well as the stunning view, it is very important that a friendly staff is hired at nice restaurants. I can't speak of the other servers at Perch, but I can say Jessica should probably re-learn restaurant service etiquette.

Reviews.Author: Brenda D.
Reviews.Content: The view is breathtaking,  get a seat on the patio if you can. The filet is amazing and overall most appetizers are delicious.  Can't go wrong with this place, gets very crowded on the weekends so arrive early for good seating!

Reviews.Author: V T.
Reviews.Content: Another place I heard from word of mouth. A bar/lounge in DTLA, a place to dress up classy and also serves food. Nice decor with a rooftop for views of DTLA. My good review is as far as it goes for Perch. This place has much potential but a few things that puts Perch on my crap list of places to avoid.A group of friends and I came here and it was my first time. We got there relatively early however inside was already jam-packed with people. It was expected though on a Saturday night. A few others in my group made reservations to dine there so we'd expect to be able to go up the rooftop. Only to arrive when the host tells us the Perch's rooftop area is rented out for a private party that night. I was disappointed. They should have called us up to let us know there would be no access to the rooftop. The whole purpose to go to the Perch is for the rooftop to get an amazing view of DTLA's pretty night skyline. Food-wise I cannot make a review on this since I didn't eat their food which sounds overprice. It is too bad their staff failed to contact us about not being able to access the rooftop.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: We came here for Sunday brunch and sat outside with the nice view.  Our waiter looked like Thor and wore a bow tie.  He wasn't that attentive but luckily the other staff that filled up our water was attentive.  The FRENCH TOAST is like an open face croissant in a pancake shape.  It was delicious.  The fruit on top was perfect and sweet.  The bacon was cooked perfectly.  I want to comeback for the HH and the rooftop!  The rooftop was closed during brunch and only the restaurant level deck is open.  They had live music with a band and the singer was like Norah Jones.  Perfect setting for a perfect brunch!  Make reservations beforehand!

Reviews.Author: Tom S.
Reviews.Content: Very fun vibe , live music with a cool deco theme. We had the shrimp/steak app which was fantastic, order it as is. For entrees we had the gnocchi and the beef rib which were both equally as good. Now onto desert we had the bread pudding which again was great. All in all the food is a home run the service is terribly slow our waitress couldn't have been slower which is why this review is a 4/5

Reviews.Author: Hugh H.
Reviews.Content: So, I decided to have my 30th birthday at Perch. Some friends surprised me with a dinner here so I was lucky enough to try out the food here!FOOD/DRINKS - 3 Stars: I ordered the steak frites (yelp.com/biz_photos/perc…), which was delicious. I was pretty much starving and I literally ate everything on my plate! The steak was cooked the way I like it... medium. The french fries were thinly cut. The prices were a bit high for what it was, but you're definitely paying for the ambiance and setting. I ordered a couple of drinks with coke and coconut vodka (yelp.com/biz_photos/perc…). These were really good. The food was nothing spectacular though I do have to say I was disappointed with the dessert choices. I expected something a bit more extravagant.SERVICE - 4 Stars: The service here was really good. Our waitress was very friendly and patient with us as we had some people that showed up late. So, she didn't rush us and continued to serve us drinks and appetizers.ATMOSPHERE - 5 Stars: The dining area is really nice and has great views. You can choose to sit inside. There are a few tables along with a bar area as well as couches. You can also sit outside which is covered and in some areas. There are also some fire pits and heaters as well. The decor here is very beautiful in here and yes, very French.BAR AREA - 4 Stars: The bar area is packed with people and you can generally go outside to the terrace/balcony area on the restaurant level and enjoy the views and live music. The live music was awesome and it was lively. I enjoyed the atmosphere though it felt like it was a tad crowded.LOUNGE - 4 Stars: So, the lounge area is fantastic. However, if you get here after 9:30PM, you could be in line on the bottom floor. So, you'll have to wait to enter the building and then probably wait to get into the bar/restaurant area in another elevator, and then wait in the stairwell to go upstairs to the lounge.The lounge has a long wait so I suggest you get there as early as possible. I think at a certain time they start to let most people to the roof. However, my party was in line for about an hour. So, we were in it for the long haul to get to the roof and enjoy ourselves.After finally getting to the roof, there is plenty of space. The bar is front and center with restrooms towards the back side of the bar. There also appeared to be a private party area as well. There are a few heaters and fire pits and of course, there were the amazing views. You have to remember to dress appropriately because it can get a bit cold. However, this place is definitely worth the wait.RECOMMENDATION: Get here by 9PM to ensure you can get to the roof on time or if you're having dinner, make reservations around 6PM to 7PM so you can finish by 9PM to avoid the long long long line. The view is amazing and definitely worth it. However, lucky for us, it start to rain a bit around 1:15PM so most of my party had left since they had to drive back to the OC/West LA. So, the downside is that if it rains, you're a bit SOL. Nonetheless, I will be back here to chill with my friends. This is truly a gem in downtown LA!

Reviews.Author: Sarah B.
Reviews.Content: I'd been here once before and would have given it 4 stars - decent, yet overpriced, drinks and nice atmosphere but with simply okay food.  After my experience this past Friday my opinion is so much lower and I'm unlikely to come back.  We were here for a birthday party and the mistake was having a sit down dinner as part of the party.  The appetizers we had were actually pretty good and somewhat reasonably priced.  The truffle fries and Brussels sprouts were very tasty; I didn't get to try the mac and cheese but it looked like it tasted good.  The entrees are another story; they are very expensive and the amount of food you get for the price can vary widely.  The scallops entree only comes with 3 scallops and the duck confit is just one little wing with sides.  Our friend who ordered it was very unhappy about the amount of food he got for how much he was going to pay.  On the other hand, the birthday girl got the bouillabaisse and it seemed like a generous amount of food.  My husband and I split the steak frites and it was also a good amount of food.  The steak was good but overpriced for what it is.The worst part of our experience was dealing with our waiter when it came time to pay.  Our waiter claimed we were $30 short so we all threw in more money to make up the difference.  He then disappeared for a while and returned claiming that we were suddenly $60 short.  When we asked how this could be he simply shrugged and disappeared.  No matter how we did the math this made no sense and it all seemed very shady.As the night went on the service became nonexistent.  During dinner the busboy was extremely attentive and I wish there was a way the included tip could have gone to him instead of our shady waiter.  But by the end of the night no one was to be seen and glasses were piling up.  When a glass broke it took forever for someone to come clean it up.  By the end of the night the bouncers who were kicking everyone out were very rude - I know that's their job but that doesn't make dealing with asshole bouncers any better.As a restaurant they are very disorganized and by the end of the night the bathrooms didn't even have running water and the bar said they were out of water.  Who runs out of water?To sum up what has become a very long review, NEVER HAVE DINNER HERE.  Perch is good for a drink and a snack or dessert.  But with the choices of similarly priced bars around this city and in downtown there really is no reason to go out of your way to come here aside from the view.  For me, the view is not enough to overcome the terrible experience I had here.

Reviews.Author: Maria R.
Reviews.Content: Friday, 3/22/13, 8:30 pmrooftop get-togetherOk, let's get some housekeeping out of the way:parking:  directly across the street for $6 after 6pm (this is the same lot the valets use)2 elevators: #1 to floor 13, #2 to floor 15 (not hard; there's a guard to instruct you)Floor 15 is the restaurant/bar; floor 16 (stairs) is the rooftop.Right so...Friday night. I'd heard a bunch about best view in DTLA etc.  At about 8:15, there was no line outside, entry to floor 15 was simple. At 8:30, there was a line to access the rooftop. I don't really 'do' lines; my tolerance is low. I started chatting with fellow line-chicks to take the edge off; the wait was probably about 15 minutes.  Rooftop Plus:Yes, nice view.Seating/bar/restrooms.Rooftop Minus:Certain areas were freezing - gale force winds freezing.They could use a few more heat lamps.Bartenders charged $1 more for my tonic water than they did at the downstairs bar...a view tax?Rooftop Warning: I don't suggest the rooftop, if you're bringing a group. It only holds about 140(?) and you don't know when it will get full. I was there with a giant group and lots of people never survived the line and had to bail. Wah wah waaah.Sidebar re Perch guards: I found them to be firm, but friendly. Fire marshals set codes, the guards maintain them.Oh and....I'm not a huge fan of long elevator rides, especially in old old old buildings. So. A major Shout Out to the guy in the elevator (plaid shirt, sleeve tatts - wait, that describes just about every guy!) who let me hold his shirt sleeve as we descended. And thanks to the guy who admitted, "I'm scared too!" Chivalry may be on life support, but it lives.As for the bouncer who screamed at me as I jay-ran across the street to the parking lot: Dude! Stop me before I run or shut it up. I need focus to run and you scared/distracted me. Jay-runners don't have time to process commands (but thanks for your concern).

Reviews.Author: Phong N.
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this place? Ambience: Perch is an amazing restaurant/bar, the views from up here is good during the day but amazing during those warm summer nights. Relaxing on the chairs by the fire pit while having a cocktail in hand is always good.Food: The food is good, a new take on some traditional french dishes, my favorite is the duck confit, the dish is done well. The cocktails are good, you can taste the alcohol but they're not overwhelming. Service: My experiences here has always been positive, I have never had a problem flagging down my server when I needed and they do not forget your request no matter how busy or slow it is.

Reviews.Author: Shilpa P.
Reviews.Content: This place is adorable. I came across Perch when I was bar hopping in downtown one night. No cover and no long wait on a Saturday in LA? Yes please. In addition, the rooftop views are beautiful, and the inside has a very cute, intimate ambiance.Drinks are a little overpriced, but I mean it is L.A. Perfect place to grab a drink and hang out with friends :)

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth N.
Reviews.Content: Like all good things they must come to an end. I liked this spot when it first opened because it was not pretentious and it had amazing views. Now I would rather just not deal with the line and rude line girl. The only time I will come here now is during the weekdays if that.

Reviews.Author: Yesenia L.
Reviews.Content: Pricey but worth it. Amazing views. Best to have a reservation. Great place to take someone on a date.

Reviews.Author: Kong P.
Reviews.Content: I went with my friend here and the view was excellent.  We also took an uber so parking was not a problem.The venue is very nice and the interior decoration is on the upscale side.  The only complaint I have is that it was more of an older crowd.  Now I'm usually not down for MILFs but I was pretty desperate that night (and very drunk).  In the end, I ended up making out with one in front of her 25 year old son and took her home.YOLO

Reviews.Author: Cat N.
Reviews.Content: I came here for a friends birthday.  Although we did not have dinner here, we enjoyed the rooftop.  Here are the pros and cons:Pros:- No cover, free all night- French inspired, really pretty decor- Amazing view of LA- Intimate- Live band- Bouncers were greatCons:- The wait (wait to get in, wait to go upstairs, wait to go in the elevator)- Parking across the street is $6 all night- Can get too packI recommend this place for a date or for close friends to chill and unwind.  Besides how pack it gets and minus the total of an hour wait, I love the ambiance and decor of the place.  Once you get to the rooftop it is really quite worth it.  They have a few heated lamps and fire pits outside for cold days but I recommend dressing a little warm.  I would love to come back here to dine and scope out their menu.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany W.
Reviews.Content: This review is purely for the happy hour (M-F 4-6).  This place is absolutely gorgeous.  To find the place, go into the elevator, press the button with the Bird icon next to it ("Perch", get it?).  Then exit and go to the next elevator, and press the button with the Bird icon next to it again.  That will finally take you to your destination.Sit outside sit outside sit outside.  Even if it's cold, sit outside.  The views are absolutely incredible.  During HH, wine and bubbly are $6.  They have daily specials for wine and cocktails.  Absolutely delicious.  We didn't really try that much food, but we did have the truffle fries, and they were mm mm good (:* They even put some cheese on it to make it even tastier.  LOVE.  Our waiter was so friendly and talkative--awesome service!  This is one happy hour you shouldn't miss out on.

Reviews.Author: S S.
Reviews.Content: Overly trendy, way too crowded, extremely over priced, portions are very small, staff is very rude and do not communicate with each other, way too small, not a fun place.It's like every other place in downtown or hollywood...I'm better off staying home lol

Reviews.Author: Sami H.
Reviews.Content: a wonderful sunday brunch.  i wore my salmon shorts and argyle sweater to what I assumed was something white people have been doing and just got bored of it and allowed color people to try.but then, all of a sudden, is that "all of the lights" by kanye being played by a live band? a beautiful afternoon overlooking smog, listening to kanye and enjoying some huevos rancheros.  bring visitors here, they'll love it.perch is a hidden gem.

Reviews.Author: Issa O.
Reviews.Content: My review is solely based on my first brunch experience at Perch. The place was actually fairly easy to find, we mapped it out and found out that there's $6 parking right across from the entrance so that was nice. Walked into the building and the security told us to take this scary broken down elevator to the 13th floor. As we exited another man showed us a better & not broken down elevator to take to the 15th floor.We made our reservations on my iPhone through yelp for 11:15am, we arrived about 10 mins late and had no problems getting seated. The only thing was that we were seated inside in an area where the sun was hitting us really bad so it got way hot! Seeing as it was our first time there I really wanted to be seated outside seeing as most people on the reviews say that's what makes the whole Perch experience. I asked our server (who seemed nice by the way) if we could be seated outside and was told all tables were reserved. After we ate our food, we ran into friends who were seated outside, turns out they called in just that morning, arrived there as they opened and were seated outside. What's the deal?!As for the food and pricing.. It was okay.. I think you're paying more for the ambience or the experience of overlooking Pershing Square/Los Angeles because the view was breath taking! I'm sure it's very beautiful at night as well. We ordered the Cheesy Truffle Fries (About $11), Perch Burger (About $16) and the French Toast (About $14). The Perch Burger was okay, we were starving already so I'm surprised I didn't want to devour that plate, but I would still prefer my In & Out Burger over this. The French Toast was made out of croissants which I was really excited about but.... It was TOO sweet and rich for me, and that's a lot coming from someone who can finish a whole bag of Hershey's Drops on my own in one day! It was okay on it's own, but they also served it with syrup and it just made it taste like you were eating pure sugar. The fruit topping did help a bit, but as much as I love french toast, I only ate like 2-3 bites of my $14 French Toast. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed the truffle fries though, I think it's a must when you go! The top crunchy parts are so delicious but once it gets soggy it starts tasting a bit blah. I was also able to taste their Sangria Pitcher through the friends we ran into, I thought that was okay, I like my sangrias to be fruitier.Went to Perch with the boyfriend hoping that this would be our new Sunday Brunch spot but sadly that hunt is still ongoing! We'll probably go back to Perch only to bring friends and family who are new to town to experience it, but otherwise, probably not.

Reviews.Author: Veronica P.
Reviews.Content: I have not eaten here yet so this review is only for the drinks. Pricey drinks but totally worth it because of of the great view and good ambiance. If you want to get to the rooftop bar which is one floor above the restaurant you should get there by 9 pm on weekends. Anytime after that you will have to wait in line which is LAME because its a bar not a club.

Reviews.Author: Nicole F.
Reviews.Content: hmm, idunno why Perch only rates an average of 3.5. I'd say more like a 4. My friends and I were walking around downtown in search of a venue that had no cover, yet was still open at 1am. Thankfully, my friend knew downtown pretty well enough to know that Perch was one such place. The fact that we'd have to take an elevator up to the lounge was pretty cool, instantly brought back memories of Vegas lol while waiting for the second elevator, there was a cool, old-school piano and we were playing it as if no one was there :DOnce we were on the top floor, I was amazed with the room and the patio area in the back. And the view!! I was definitely in love, and this was even before bday shots and stuff! I definitely felt like it was an 'SF meets LA'-type of deal, which for me, is the best of both worlds!A friend of mine got me a bday drink (aww he's so sweet lol), and we went outside to sit on some chairs while admiring the breathtaking view of downtown. My other friends were sitting near a fireplace, which I didn't get to see, but I guess there is a fireplace on the rooftop!I didn't really pay much attention to the crowd around us, but the noise level around us was pretty average. The DJ was in the room so we were able to make conversation in the patio area (this is important to me since one of my pet peeves is attempting to talk over noise, which I cannot do that well and then the other person keeps going 'huh?' and like leaning in awkwardly...ugh :)The drinks were pretty good! Not sure which bday shot my friend got me but it was tropical and pretty to look at. Meanwhile, the cranberry vodka (my fav) my guy friend got me was average (I mean, how different can other cranberry vodkas be from one another? lol).At the end during closing, the bouncers could've been a little more nice and professional, but all in all we had a great time considering it was the last venue we went to for the night. It was a good way to end the night. I would definitely go back and stay longer!

Reviews.Author: Jeff K.
Reviews.Content: never had the food here... but the views and lack of a cover charge already locks this place down in my books as 4 stars.to get to this place, you can park across the street for about 5 bucks.  then you follow the golden bird up 2 different elevators.  there's a piano right before the elevator to actually enter up to perch.  lol.... its old, but it works. there are two bars at perch, each one located one right above the other.  if the weather permits, go up to the outer bar. (you'll have to wait in a line to get to the upstairs bar)  you'll get to see a lot more.  and go early to snag one of the many seats.  if you're lucky, you'll get the seats around the fire pits... drinks are regularly priced, so no need to be surprised here.we went on a Saturday night and there was a dj doing their thang inside the bottom floor of perch.

Reviews.Author: President Z.
Reviews.Content: The location for Perch is great. Its in Downtown LA right by the Pershing Square Metro station. The restaurant itself is located on the 16th floor in a older building . The food is really good. We had the short ribs in mashed potatoes, Amazing! Perch is a must!

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: This review is for the bar at the very top of Perch, I'm not reviewing the restaurant or food. Got here at 9-930pm on a Saturday, got in with little wait or hassle. You take 2 elevators and then a flight of stairs to get to the very top top. There, you're rewarded with a sophisticated, beautiful view of the city. Getting drinks can take a while given few bartenders coupled with a throng of people trying to get said drinks. One of my favorite spots to enjoy a drink in downtown LA, I'm looking forward to returning to Perch.

Reviews.Author: Aida L.
Reviews.Content: LOVE the rooftop viewsPerfect for happy hourBring a light sweater

Reviews.Author: Sonia A.
Reviews.Content: I would have given Perch 2 stars if it weren't for the view - that's the best thing about the place. I've tried many things on the menu, but the food has always been underwhelming. For the price you're paying, you'd expect better. The ambience, however, makes up for it a bit. If it's your first time there, be aware that you have to take 2 elevators there (just press the button with the little bird perched next to it). The second elevator will be across the way with a piano next to it. Once again, press the button with the bird, and you'll be at the first level of the restaurant. Also note that there is usually a huge line to get in later on weekend nights. Reservations help, but they only accept them for parties that we dining there and your whole party must be present to be seated.Bottom line - it's a nice place to grab drinks, sit outdoors (preferably next to a fire pit) and take in downtown while listening to some live music. I like to head upstairs to the second level of the bar as it is easier to grab a seat up there. Great place to bring a date for a nightcap too.

Reviews.Author: Giss D.
Reviews.Content: The Penicillin is very good but the glasses are horrible, I feel like it's mandatory to have some spillage

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: I love this place, great ambiance, love the live band and the coziness, the only problem is the lines, if you get there late expect a big line to get in, and another one to get to the rooftop, other than that, is a great spot!!!

Reviews.Author: Karla M.
Reviews.Content: Took my parents here for my dad's 60th birthday.  Lovely ambience with a view.  The hostess and waiters were beyond lovely.   We started with the surf n turf, which was grilled to perfection!  Salmon was moist and well seasoned.  Topped off the dinner with white chocolate bread pudding which was a heavenly delight. Its a bit on the expensive side, but its good food minus the fufu crowd.  Down to earth vibe with top of the line food!

Reviews.Author: Daisy A.
Reviews.Content: Brunch! Came here on Sunday around 11:30...I had no reservation and was sat immediately (inside). The crowd was decent. A mix of families, groups, and some kids. The food was AMAZING. We had the arugula salad, egg white omelette, and truffle fries. The fries were phenomenal. Only complaint is the service. The servers suck pretty bad. Not attentive at all. They weren't even busy and they were horrible. Management really needs to do something about that. Other than that it was pretty goo. ,

Reviews.Author: Kirsten J.
Reviews.Content: I was enjoying the outdoor patio area with friends when the bald French manager shouted at me to move. There is no reason for a manager to be rude to patrons. Another staff member apologized for his conduct, which I did appreciate.***so the director of operations saw my review, which I wrote mere minutes ago, found me in the crowd, and apologized and gave me a free drink.  That is excellent service, so I had to change my review just for that.  Consider me impressed.

Reviews.Author: Divya S.
Reviews.Content: Great rooftop bar!

Reviews.Author: Abtin S.
Reviews.Content: Have been to Perch several times over the past few months and I really like the vibe and view.   This is a higher end longue...I would say a little bit trendier than The Standard.The line gets really long sometimes, but if you come before 10 or after 12, then you should be fine.  Also I heard that if you live locally in and around DTLA, then you get priority entrance to the club.The bouncer and the host at the entrance are super nice and both of them actually wished me an early birthday when they saw my ID...what other place in LA will do that.  The views of DTLA are amazing and it is a really good date spot or dinner with friends kind of place. The drinks are good, but pricey.  I do have one BIG negative, there is a female African-American bartender at the bar, and she does not know what the hell she is doing.  The drinks she pours are so weak that it is a joke, my vodka tonic literally had no alcohol in it, my date ordered a Moscow mule and she had to ask if there was alcohol in the drink.  Also she is so slow to take your order, even if there is no one at the bar.  It wouldn't be a problem, but you are making something like $12+ for a drink.  I totally recommend going to the other bartender who is a African-American gentleman who is fast and pours great drinks with alcohol.  Other than that issue, i think this is a great spot, lots of young trendy people and a nice place to have a fun time.

Reviews.Author: Artur P.
Reviews.Content: Customer service was horrible! The "bouncer" had to tell us that he gets $40 an hour and yet bribe us  to let us go upstairs to where perch is located. Once we got upstairs after 15 minutes talking to the guy, we were seated. The view is great, the food is good too. If you hire a "bouncer" make sure he's not bribing your customers out of money. Btw my girl and I went to celebrate our 4 year anniversary there and because of the "bouncer" we decided never to come back because for get the night got ruined by some bragging bribing "bouncer".

Reviews.Author: Matthew S.
Reviews.Content: Arrived with friends at 6 when it opened. Guard on the first floor was charming. Went up to the roof. Beautiful view. The waitress came. We ordered drinks. At 6:10, we were thrown out by a security guard whose asshole must be so tight it looks like a garden gnome's winking eye. Turns out, the roof had been rented for a private party. We had no idea--neither did the guard on the first floor, neither did the kind people who direct you to the right elevators. Neither did the waitress who allowed us to order drinks. Or rather, none of them thought to ask us if we were in the party. We, of course, had no idea--we just came to hang out.We received our drinks, started talking by the fire. At 6:10, the Incredible Hulk took a constipated dump into a cheap and badly tailored black suit and that constipated ill-suited dump walked over to our fire pit. It then told us chidingly we were not with the private party, that we had "slipped by" him and staff before they'd realized, and told us to go downstairs. He said "sorry" a couple of times, but he was monotoned, programmed, and emotionless probably because of a drunk dad who used to wizz on his head from the time he was 4 until he was 27 years old. There was no "sorry, our mistake," nothing. No "sorry about that, go ahead and finish your drinks and if you wouldn't mind adjourning downstairs after that, we'd really appreciate it." All he said was "sorry, you have to go" and we said "...right now?" and he said "uh, yeah" like we were stupid for assuming anything else. We told him we had no idea there was a party, and he said condescendingly, "didn't you check the website?" Which, I don't know about you, is what I always do before going somewhere. I go online and check the website. And then I write a handwritten letter to the establishment respectfully asking if I may attend, if only for a few moments, if I promise to remain invisible to other patrons. I also send a stool sample in good faith. I've never been treated so rudely, especially by a man who's penis probably looks like a baby's belly button. Seriously, this guy reminds me of a shitty second-hand sofa stood upright and then sewn into a cheap Halloween witch cape. Whatever, I'm sure he rocks his back and legs when benching at the gym and is a total wretched phony. So we awkwardly left and went downstairs. We told the host on the floor below what had happened and he was completely unsympathetic, but it makes sense, given that he was thoroughly enjoying his fantasy role as a broadway musical homeless man from the Victorian era, replete with a stupid and crooked top hat. There are so many better rooftop bars in LA where the attitude isn't that of an exclusive undergrad acting conservatory program full of brittle dickheads. PASS.

Reviews.Author: Bear S.
Reviews.Content: This is a good start for DTLA's upcoming scene.The St. Cloud cocktail is amazing. Actually tried to remake it at home. Food is expensive, I'd advise to go eat somewhere else first for dinner, then come here for some drinks and late night apps. The scene is amazing at night. Live music, comfy seating, and your surrounded by lit up high rises. Felt so shi shi.

Reviews.Author: Sue Z.
Reviews.Content: God. What's not to love about Perch. You literally have a 360 view of Downtown Los Angeles, and it's a surreal experience. (especially after the first bottle). It's imperative that you have a good group of friends with you, because this place does get crazy sometimes. The cuisine is french, and the wine list is good. There is valet, and try to arrive a little early, lest you like waiting out in the cold. When entering you have to go through a series of elevators to finally actually get to the place, click on the button with the bird next to it. It gets a bit chilly these days (jan-feb), but when it's not, you can lounge outside while listening to the free live music they provide. Food? The mac and cheese is noms, truffle fries (i mean who doesn't love truffle anything), the spicy tuna, the breads, the champagne. Have your carbs and eat it too, guzzling it down with some nectar of the gods. Sound hedonistic enough for you? It'll cost you a pretty penny to come here, but hey, we've all gotta live like kings once in a while.
Reviews.Author_Location: Playa del Rey, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Kent M.
Reviews.Content: It's on a roof.  I'm sold.  There are actually two rooftops.  Be sure to check out the second one.  The food was ok, so I probably wouldn't eat here again.  But I'll be back for drinks.

Reviews.Author: Jerome O.
Reviews.Content: Brunch. Sunny terrace. Overlooking Pershing square. Jazz band on Sunday afternoon. Nice food. Nice atmosphere. Been there a couple of times. Will be back many more.

Reviews.Author: T Rex E.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, but way to pricey for a mediocre diner

Reviews.Author: Marlon T.
Reviews.Content: I came here after midnight on a Friday night to meet up with some friends on the roof. Surprisingly, I didn't have to pay cover. You have to take a series of elevator and stairs to get to actual roof. I was stupidly walking around aimlessly looking for my friends on the lower roof. I didn't know I had to wait in line to take the stairs to get to the real top of the building.The view was amazing. A lot of people compare this spot to Standard because it's another rooftop bar. I'm not sure which one I like better, but Perch seemed a little more "classy-themed" while The Standard seemed more "fun-themed." Perch has nice fireplaces with limited seating while The Standard has lots of couches and a dance floor. Both are worth your while for sure. The Standard will charge cover and I'm not sure when Perch does since I didn't have to pay this past Friday night.A rooftop bar in a metropolitan city is one of my favorite concepts.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany N.
Reviews.Content: Dear Perch, If you didn't have such a great view, we'd be over.  This is one of my favorite bar/lounges in DTLA simply for that reason. I came here recently on a Friday night after dinner with some friends to grab a few drinks and to hang out.  To our surprise, there was a pretty long line to get it at 11pm.  I've never seen a line for Perch before, but I have come to this place at least twice before where the door lady told us we couldn't get in because someone rented out the space for their birthday.  Ok...I don't get why the door people make it seem like this is some high profile place.  I do understand that it isn't the biggest place and they gotta keep their numbers regulated, but I think you must take natural bar selection into play and people will leave if they think it's too crowded.There is a regular line and a "guestlist" line.  Though it seemed as though if you were a regular or friends with the door people you were let in right away.  The doorman here was trying to chat us up about nonsense to make our wait seem better, but i don't think we had enough urbandictionary words to keep up with him. Take an elevator to the 13th floor where you then take another elevator to the 15th floor.  If you want to go to the 16th floor you have to take the stairs.  Nice seating areas and fire pits on the roof.  360 view of DTLA.  Decor on the 15th floor kind of reminds me of a haunted hotel.  Drinks are good.  Music is okay.  Crowd is mixed.  Park across the street for $6.

Reviews.Author: priscilla d.
Reviews.Content: I am giving it a 4 , even though I think it really is a 3, but  I would go back, for drinks mainly. I just love the ambiance, and the place itself, the food should be better considering how great the place is. A better  menu is in need, the view is great, they have a good deal with the champagne brunch ( 15 bucks and not bad at all) to make mimosas! Make reservations , the line can be brutal.

Reviews.Author: Stacey R.
Reviews.Content: Because I had such a great time the first time I came here, I decided to head back with a few of my girlfriends for dinner.  We sat on the terrace and they accommodated us when we asked for a table near the stage.  BIG MISTAKE!  HUGE!  The band this time around was very below average and it was a bit less than excruciating, but I still wanted to eat and just the get heck out of there.We all ordered some type of steak dish which were all good I would say.  I think mine was probably the worst though.  I ordered the rib eye, but either the knife was bad or the steak was a bit rubbery to cut through.  It was medium to medium rare like I asked for, but the quality was 2 stars.  The best dish that we all agreed on was the brussel sprouts by far!  The service was 2 stars as well.  Our waitress would go MIA for a wee bit even though the place was dying down.  Would I go back?  Maybe.  The novelty has worn off a bit.  I might try it again during the summer, but for now I've had enough.

Reviews.Author: Lili K.
Reviews.Content: Pretty place with two rooftops, really!  There's a line to get into the second one, where you just take some steps to go up.No cover, nice views of LA, and pretty ambiance.  I think I'd love to have dinner out on the rooftop, too!  I had the St. Germain sour which was a nice 'n sweet drink.  I got it after I overheard the bartender suggesting it to someone who wanted a Midori sour, which they didn't have.  Sweetness!

Reviews.Author: Cheryl S.
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to grab a drink at a NY rooftop bar and I have yet to experience that. Until that day arrives, this will do for now.This evening my old co-workers decided to meet up for happy hour at Perch.  I had never been there before, but once I found out that it was a rooftop bar I became excited.  Another bar, other than The Standard, where you could enjoy a nice happy hour while watching the sunset was definitely music to my ears.  I set out on my adventure this afternoon, to check out this so-called "rooftop bar" in Downtown LA.  It was a hot day today, so I knew that the evening would be a typical summer evening in LA where the weather would be perfect :)With $5 parking on the corner of 4th and Hill, I was already off to a good start.  I entered the old Pershing Square building and was greeted by two small aquariums within the wall to my right, next to the security guard who pointed me towards the elevator.Up to the 13th floor I went and exited to the site of an old piano, tuned nicely, with  vintage pictures on the wall.  Another elevator greeted me on this floor and I was to take 2 more levels up to the 15th floor, which finally brought me to Perch.  I entered a French furnished room and proceeded straight towards the outdoor balcony where my co-workers were waiting.  There, I could take in the view of the breathtaking city before me.  It was still bright out, but in the meantime I could enjoy the hors d'ouvres and drinks from the happy hour menu that was brought to our table instantly.As the sun began to set and the night came out to welcome us, I grew excited by the jazz trio that played in the corner of the patio to which we sat.  Behind them, was a beautiful row of lit Los Angeles buildings and behind us, in a corner, was a blazing fireplace.  The crowd began to build, and there was no other place I would rather be than enjoying the atmosphere in that moment of time.Perch on a weekday is definitely a recommendation.  Check it out next time you venture downtown and want to hide from the traffic, for just a moment, before heading home.

Reviews.Author: ED L.
Reviews.Content: I must say Perch is quite a nice place to go for a drink.  The bar is located in Downtown Los Angeles in a building surrounded by high rises.  It is a roof top bar where people go to mingle and unwind after a long day at the office.  It is crowded if you go on weekends... especially on a Saturday.The place wasn't easy to find.  You may park on the street or in a parking lot around the area.  Read the signs first before parking on the streets.  L.A. Parking enforcement is getting really bad nowadays because of the budget problems going on in the city.  Perch is located on the rooftop of a shorter high rise building where you must take an elevator to get up.  It could be a bit confusing once you get to the top because I lost my sense of direction... without even consuming alcohol.  The view of the city is beautiful.  The gleaming lights, the crisp air (of smog) really keeps things interesting while you are there with friends. Be sure to bring a jacket when the nights are cooler.  It gets pretty cold up there regardless of the heaters. They have a couple bars inside, and another one outside.  The drinks are a bit more expensive compared to other places.  There is a nice fireplace outside to lounge around to bring out the ambiance.  They have patio chairs everywhere outside, while the inside have tables, and of course bar stools. It looks quite classy inside especially with the dimmed lights.  The music is pumping... but not exactly blasting which is good while you converse with others. I really like the place. People are quite friendly and nicely dressed.  It is quite hip! Cheers!!

Reviews.Author: Diana W.
Reviews.Content: I used to come here all the time when I lived downtown. Just went a couple of nights ago while in town. Sad to say, it's not what it used to be.First, the staff... RUDE! I mean, the hostesses set the tone for the night from the moment we walked in. Once seated, we had to ASK for a server to order, as no one bothered to come over and acknowledge us. And once we did order, we rarely saw our server after that. The busser was great.  Hope he was tipped out well. We asked our server for a dessert menu, which we got about half an hour later when we reminded the idiot. And I am EASY as shit to serve. I used to work as a cocktail waitress/server and bartender. My husband is a bartender. My ex was a bartender. I know the industry so I'm not just whining. The brussel sprouts were good. Ahi, okay. The bread pudding was horrible. But the food at this place has never been mind blowing. I now give it 3 stars. One star for being in DTLA (where my heart will always be). One star for the amazing view. And an extra star b/c I don't want to be that much of a bitch, even though we received the worst service I've had in a LONG time. Management needs to reassess their staff. Then again, maybe management is a reflection of the staff.

Reviews.Author: Jen L.
Reviews.Content: Came here on 07/25, a Thursday night. Missed my reservation and ended up waiting almost an hour for a table... If you don't have a reservation or think you'll miss it, definitely do not come here - it's not worth the long wait.The hostesses and host at the very front were pretty friendly - I guess management's been reading some of these reviews and doing its job? I ordered the Surf N' Turf Skewers, Baked Brie, and Lolita. The skewers and brie were great (but not necessarily amazing), and the Lolita drink was alright.If you're going to come here, come for the view (which, in my opinion, is only nice during sunset hours) and the live music.
