The band that was playing that night was amazing with its covers. Overall, Perch tries hard to seem upscale and elite, but falls a bit short. Would I come back? Eh. Maybe for the sunset view and the live music.

Reviews.Author: Erin J.
Reviews.Content: I love Perch!  Great food and drinks (Writer's Block is the bomb.com) and you can't beat the view.Definitely a great spot for a night out downtown.

Reviews.Author: Lucy T.
Reviews.Content: 15th floor, absolutely beautiful view. My bf and I arrived during happy hour, which the menu was pricey as expected and delicious (for the most part - mac'n'cheese could really use some work). Be prepared to bring a sweater of some sort as the heat lamps do not reach the "window" seats. Overall, it was a fun experience, great atmosphere - I would definitely come back (after a payday most likely!) with friends and significant other.

Reviews.Author: Keysha S.
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. It is literally a little perch at the top of a building in LA.... how quaint! I just sat at the bar and had a latte and took the obligatory selfies overlooking downtown LA, with all the other looky-loos. But it was nice. And I liked the live music. I'd be back!

Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: There are too many lines!! I must've been standing in 4 different lines to get up to the rooftop area.Ambiance:I like the modern decor and the vibe of Perch. In the restaurant area and patio, it's a nice place to have a dinner date. On Friday and Saturday nights, it's a great place to socialize and chill, which means it can get loud from all the people coming up and leaving the bar. I really liked the rooftop, because it's a nice lounge with a great view of downtown. It's perfect for those cool and warm nights in LA.Drinks:The drinks are cost more here, but that is to be expected because you're not only paying for the drink, but you're paying for the view and the lounge.Service:Standard, but could be a little more friendly.Parking:Expect to pay some money for nearby lots. Another option is to take the Metro and get off at Pershing Square since it's right there.

Reviews.Author: Jen Y.
Reviews.Content: OpenTable said the place had no availability within 2.5 hours of my requested reservation time so I opted to call in and scored a table on a thirsty Thursday night and specifically requested for outdoor dining.Although the entire party didn't show up on time, our reservation was honored as soon as most of us arrived. We just had to wait at the bar before getting seated.Myself and two others in our party ordered the Little Bunny Frou Frou which was rabbit ravioli. I've never had rabbit meat but since it was recommended by our waiter and fellow Yelpers, I gave it a go. It was DELIGHTFULLY TASTY! I also highly recommend the delicious truffle fries. My friends (Bostonians and Angelenos) and guests thoroughly enjoyed the ambience and views of DTLA although I don't think they're the most spectacular. The pro's: It wasn't crowded and there were no lines up the stairwell to the rooftop. Although it got chilly dining outdoors, we were surrounded by headlamps and had wine and cocktails that kept us toasty.3 stars for dining service5 stars for the food3.5 stars for the ambience (on a Thursday evening) and view

Reviews.Author: Kim K.
Reviews.Content: Came here last night with my boyfriend before going to see The Scottsboro Boys at the Ahmanson Theatre.  Arrived around 6:15pm and was seated immediately and luckily at a corner table outside.  The views are stunning.  The food was great.  Service was great.  Everything was great.  Wish we could have seen the view at night as I'm sure it's even more stunning.  By the time we left it was super crowded and got really loud.  But sitting outside is the best.What we had:Brussel Sprouts - DELICIOUS!Mac n Cheese - YUMMY!Steak Fritte - VERY GOOD!Short rib - VERY TENDER!Looking forward to going back in the evening.

Reviews.Author: Vy N.
Reviews.Content: Dined on a Friday night. Great ambience, live band playing Stevie Wonder, then later DJ. spinning.   Beautiful view with perfect weather. Let's face it, you're going to dine here for the location and ambience, not for the food, however I do expect good service. I made reservation for 9:30pm and didn't get seated until 10:30, and the server was nice, friendly but OMG incredibly slow.  We didn't finish eating until 12:30 and missed our 11pm engagement and it was only a party of three. Very disappointed in the service.  Would I come back again????? ehhh. . . maybe for a special occasion.

Reviews.Author: Amber K.
Reviews.Content: Love:+ the view+ ambiance+ bar upstairs / downstairs + seats next to the fireplace + DJWhy only 3 stars?- Our server added her own tip on our bill (on top of the tip she already got).  At first, I thought the server charged the wrong amount on my card, but when I contacted the manager to let him know what I signed and what was posted on my account was different, he apologized for his server adding additional tip on her own. Shades. - When I came here a second time, the bartender wouldn't serve my boyfriend alcohol saying he was too drunk.  I know when hes drunk, and he wasn't. Then, when I tried to buy two shots, she said I could only buy one because I was going to give the second one to my boyfriend. What if I wanted two?! Buzz kill..we left right away.

Reviews.Author: Ryan A.
Reviews.Content: This place is such a mystery to me. First, you line up outside, which takes forever to move. Probably a whole hour until we got in, which is ridiculous because we had to go through 2 different elevators. Then we reached what I guess is the second level of perch or something. It's the restaurant/bar area and outside seating with a performer. We had no idea where to go or what to do and there are no signs of where to go for drinks. It wasn't until we got in some long random line that we were able to go to the actual rooftop where all the fun was really happening. That's when things made sense. The view is beautiful and the many fire pits are appreciated. Also, the bartenders are great and the drinks are so strong. I got drunk after 2 drinks, which is nice since I don't have to drink a lot to get wasted. There was some bitch in the crowd though who yelled because we "cut her in line." First of all, bitch, there is no line. You crowd around the bar and get your drinks. That's how most bars work from my understanding after having gone to several bars in the past. Second of all, it only takes 5 minutes, if not less, for the bartenders, who are fast and great, to make drinks so she could afford to wait. And lastly, she already had a bitch face on so I'm sure the "line cutting" was just another thing to piss her off. But she can really just take her drinks and shove it. All in all, great and interesting place. The rooftop scene made me feel like I was in a YAZ commercial. If it weren;t for the many lines and no clear direction of where to go or where the scene was, I would rate this place higher.

Reviews.Author: Kim H.
Reviews.Content: Ok here is the scoop.  The food is above average.  But the food isn't want you are here for.  You are here for the ambiance and let's face it.  How many tall buildings can you eat and drink in LA?  This is a little of Manhattan if you ask me.  You can even take the metro which drops you off a block away!  The parking is right across the street on Hill.  The views are amazing.  The rooftop bar is awesome.  If you want to impress a date...this is the place to go.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S.
Reviews.Content: My first rooftop bar/lounge I've ever visited! It was great- the people were friendly, the atmosphere is very chill, and the bouncer and staff were pretty nice. I would come here again for dinner, or to just show my friends the LA sights!

Reviews.Author: Laura E.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place. For those of you complaining about waiting in lines: THIS IS NOT THE PLACE TO ARRIVE FASHIONABLY LATE. With that said, this should be the first stop of the night. My first experience at Perch was for a birthday party. We arrived early and were transfixed with the view and I was reminded why I love LA. The drinks are a little on the pricer side but hey, this isn't a dive bar and you get what you pay for. The bartender was extremely friendly and made me a yummy custom fizzy gin drink. Delicious.A few months later my sig fig and I made reservations for dinner and were promptly seated. The salmon was delicious and the creme brûlée was a dream. The view was just as breathtaking and the sunset was very romantic. The outdoor seating area gets a little cold but heat lamps are provided. Will I go again and again? Yes I will.

Reviews.Author: Paul T.
Reviews.Content: I love the atmosphere here and it's perfect for after-work drinks, net working, or for a date.  I would  not call this a destination for a Saturday night out with your friends.  Make sure to keep it classy when visiting or you might feel out of place.   It's perfect for people looking for a more upscale bar and restaurant vibe in LA. The Moscow Mule is my recommendation for your first cocktail.

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: Came to perch on a Friday night for a friends birthday. The line wasn't that long, but it took a pretty long time to get in. The birthday girl was already upstairs so we just had to wait in the line. We waited around 30 minutes to get upstairs. Once you go up 13 floors on the elevator, you get off and get onto another elevator to go up to the 15th floor. You get off the elevator and have to wait in another line in order to head up to the roof. WTF? A line and then another line?? Vegas doesn't even have 2 lines! lol Anyway, we waited and got some beers and waited some more. We eventually got up to the roof after another hour wait. The view was incredible! Beautiful downtown LA night lights with great friends. I guess it's worth the wait since they don't charge a cover. I'd definitely be back since one of my friends said the food is pretty good here! (Or at least the 3 appetizers that she's tried out). Parking: Not really sure how the parking goes here. There's a parking lot across the street and I know they also offer valet parking. I suggest coming here for the view and a few drinks and sit by the fireplace with friends. Or you can always make new friends!

Reviews.Author: Aly R.
Reviews.Content: Wow. I have been looking forward to coming here for the longest time. All my friends have been raving about this place so I begged my bf to take me for valentine's day. We got an 8:45 reservation after my bf had to send in a copy of his drivers and cc ( totally expected on vday). We received zero confirmation of our reservation after sending in his info and finally had to contact them ourselves, low and behold we weren't even put into their system and they tried giving us a later time. We finally got our 8:45 reservation after all that.We arrived promptly at 8:45 and were told they were running behind by 20-30mins (again normal considering vday)...... One hour later we were still sitting at the bar with zero acknowledgement from the managers or maître d. My bf went to ask how much longer till we get sat and he was told that there were 14 couples ahead of us, FOURTEEN an hour after our reservation!!!! Some couples were even getting drinks comped while the rest of us not even an apology. I work in the service industry so I get crazy nights and I hate writing bad reviews about a restaurant but come on. Not one hostess or staff member came to speak to the couples who had to wait for eternity. The poor bar staff were the most attentive and all they could do to keep us from passing out from hunger was to offer us some nuts. One hour and 45mins later we got sat, nice table, beautiful view and great sever. I enjoyed the food and the drinks we had but after all that our night was ruined and we left with zero want to come back.It is a beautiful place but just like a previous yelper said, you could be looking over the surface of mars and still nothing would be worth that terrible wait on which was suppose to be a romantic and fun night out. I will not be returning, and that's very unfortunate since it was such a cute place after the fact.

Reviews.Author: Selma C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing Staff great view!I was looking for a cool place to go with my date.  A friend of mine suggested this place and while it was a little far from my house, it was definitely worth it.They were super busy that night, but the staff still managed to be courteous and accommodating to us. Their service was fantastic and super attentive to us. The rooftop view of the city just made the night much more special for me and my date. Definitely worth checking it out

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: Amazing views of downtown LA, very cool hip vibe.  I've been here several times now and I really have to recommend getting there early in the evening if you're going for drinks on a weekend.  Not only will you end up waiting in line outside to get in for 30 minutes, you'll also end up waiting in another line another 30 minutes if you want to go up to the top level.  Wall to wall people, you won't be able to move.  I've gone on week nights as well and enjoyed it much better, you can actually sit down at a table and enjoy the view and gentle breeze.

Reviews.Author: Joe D.
Reviews.Content: The least they could do is smile...what's the point of working there if you look like you hate it. I guess if I had to wear those red bow ties I would be in a pissy mood too. We were a party of 12 and out server no doubt didn't want to take out group. She was snappy with a few of us when we tried to order drinks. It's a bar in an old building in Los Angeles. Places like this are a dime a dozen here and in every other major city in the Unites States. The only thing exclusive here is again..the little red bow ties they have to wear. The service overshadowed the food. It makes me wonder if two separate people are running the restaurant and roof top bar. Two totally different experiences. See my Yelp review for that...I'll be giving it 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: mychelle m.
Reviews.Content: I love the food here. The brussel sprouts ate not to be believed!! I order them again to take home:) The almond cake is so yummy, not too sweet. The cauliflower appetizer is heaven...all the entrees were fantastic. The waitress was sweet, the ambience is great. I have told all my friends to eat here.

Reviews.Author: Ali N.
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this restaurant. The views are perfect of downtown. The service was friendly. The decor was unique. The cocktails were fun and delicious. And the food was just amazing. Our group of four had to share everything because everyone's food was just too good to stick with our own. The favorite was the POT-AU-FEU, but we also got the bacon mac and cheese, the Arugula and Endive salad, the Rabbit Ravioli, and the Scallops. All choices I would get again. The first thing I did Monday morning was suggest the place to my boss.

Reviews.Author: Dawn F.
Reviews.Content: Came back to Perch for Sunday Champagne Brunch and it was spectacular.  Great vibe, fantastic food and amazing price for a bottle of champagne.  Will be back soon!

Reviews.Author: Lali N.
Reviews.Content: First, for Disneyland fans...the entrance reminds me of the Tower of Terror...very 1920s art deco. Be prepared to take 2 elevators...which is fine. It added to the excitement of going...We went there for a group dinner. They placed us along a narrow side of the rooftop exterior. At first, I wasn't so happy about it but it turned out to be perfect. We had the privacy we wanted but could easily hear the live music being played about 8 feet away. Everyone enjoyed the food...Steak Frites (the fries had truffle oil on it...mmmm)Baked BrieCaesar Salad (surprise! There were artichoke hearts in it.  Mmmm)Salmon and ShrimpPan Roasted Chicken with a Mushroom RisottoOrange Creme BrulePlus, you can't beat the rooftop view. The service was amazing considering we were a party of 20+...we'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Diana T.
Reviews.Content: Come for drinks & view NOT overpriced food. This is a really cool spot, lots to look at from the creepy wall art to the outdoor patio with a Bombass view of Pershing Square. Not to mention the treck through 2 elevators to get up to the restaurant/bar area.Drinks a bit on the pricier side. ~$12 for a mixed cocktail.

Reviews.Author: Teresa L.
Reviews.Content: I went to Perch for their New Year Eve's party. I prepaid for tickets, and the cost was high--$150 per person. I figured for that price, my NYE had better be awesome. ATMOSPHERE: Perch had three floors. On floor 13, there was a dance floor playing dance remixes of top 40 tunes. It remained mostly empty until after midnight, and that's when the dance party started. On floor 15, there was an outdoor balcony with a NYE ball ready to drop and a big band. The band was great, and they provided the space with a fun 1920s feel. On the roof, there was a cigar rolling station, and it had a beautiful view of downtown. My one complaint about the roof--not enough heat lamps. Overall, the atmosphere was welcoming and fun, and lounge was busy but never uncomfortably crowded. The guests were dressed to the nines and it just seemed like a party full of good looking people. The experience was sold to me as a Great Gatsby party, and that's what I got. EMPLOYEES: Upon arrival, my friends and I were greeted by the welcoming staff. Everyone, from security to the bartenders to the hostess, were friendly and they added to the Great Gatsby experience. COAT CHECK: Was free for NYE and that was a nice touch.DRINKS AND FOOD: The ticket price included an open bar and free appetizers all night. Each floor had its own bar, so one never had to wait to get a drink. There were also servers walking around with champagne so that was great. Each floor also had its own appetizers, and everything tasted good. There were cupcakes, ravioli, mini hot dogs, noodles, tortellini, etc, After midnight, however, they stopped bringing out new food items, and my friends and I were bummed. After drinking most of the night, that was when we were most hungry!  ALL IN ALL: The night wasn't perfect, but my friends and I had a great time. The ticket price was high, but I felt it was worth it for the most part.

Reviews.Author: Navpreet K.
Reviews.Content: It could have been better. I gave instructions when I made reservations but they were not followed through.I was very disappointed. Service was okay. French fries were yummy.

Reviews.Author: Bryan M.
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice romantic brunch that has roof top dining BOOM you found the place!! Took my girlfriend here and she loved it! i recommend making a reservation and to try their truffle fries!!

Reviews.Author: Rhumz M.
Reviews.Content: Attended our friend's birthday celebration here.  The rooftop lounge wows me looking out at the beautiful scenery of the city.  I guess it would be best to dine here when the sun is setting.  The ambiance was cool.  You can bring friends to catch up and have a few drinks.

Reviews.Author: Rachel C.
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience here in the beginning, but it got better towards the end of the night. Still not a fan though.So I got there around 10 or 11. Had to wait in the freezing cold outside to ride the elevator that takes you to the top. Wasn't troubled by this, because it's typical to wait in a line outside a bar. Once we got in, OH DEAR LORD it was so crowded. People were still eating at the tables, others were standing around. Many people were still walking around trying to search for an empty spot.So. My bad experience.My friends were on the upper deck, so my boyfriend and I were scrambling around trying to find a way to get to the top. Apparently you have to wait in another line to get to the upper deck. And this line was huge. So we wait in line, and a security guard comes and tells us that we're blocking a walkway. He told us to wait a little bit until the line dies down, and then we can get back in line once it's out of the walkway. We said ok, and decided to go get a drink. We were at the bar for about 15 minutes, and decided to go back in line because our friends were waiting for us. We get back in line, which is still long BUT we noticed there were different people waiting in line than from 15 min ago. So that means the line was dying pretty fast and the security guard was letting people in. The line was still long, but we were thinking the security guard would be nicer since he saw that we moved 15 minutes ago. NOPE. The same security guard told us that we needed to get out of the way. I told him we got out of the way 15 minutes ago, and no matter what people would be standing in the walkway. But he didn't care, and he just kept telling us to move. So we got a little bit out of the way, standing next to the line and waiting for it to die down. FUNNY THING IS, this security guard was letting groups of girls stand in line even if they were in the walkway. This made me angry, so I just stood in line. I guess the guy saw that I was pissed and let us stand in line. After this 30 minute debacle, my friends decided to just come down and meet us. -___- This ALMOST ruined my night.We went out into the patio, which is decorated really nicely. They put some pretty lights on their trees, and the view of course is amazing. I got a drink for my friend's birthday, and it had a lot of alcohol in it. This is good price-wise, but my friend couldn't enjoy the drink at all. It took a lot of convincing on my part to make her drink it. Lol. My boyfriend just got a couple beers the whole night. My friends had dinner here, but they didn't really have anything good to say about the drinks.Next time, if I ever come back, I'm going straight to the patio. I am definitely not waiting in line for that stupid upper deck anymore. I don't care how much better the view is up there. Thanks, mean security guard!

Reviews.Author: Isharde D.
Reviews.Content: Perch is a lovely dining experience. My sister made reservations for Perch for her birthday and when we got there at 10pm, the line to get in was out of the door. Because we had reservations, we were able to pass the line and walk right in. The ambiance of the lobby was divine as was the waiting area between the elevators (there are two you have to take to get to the 13th floor and the 15th floor) I don't know what is in between all those floors, and I didn't have time to wonder. Once we arrived to the restaurant floor on the 15th floor, we were greeted by a lovely hosted and seated by a well-dressed Maître 'D. The space was a bit tight; however, we were comfortable. The view was nice and the food was very good quality- although I was expecting gold specs in the mac and cheese. I did try the Writer's Block and the drink was delicious, although small- I almost wished I ordered the bigger drinks for the same price. We did not know that appetizers such as sliders were available- that was our fault because the website clearly says the menu changes for happy hour. The only damper on our evening was one of the bussers and the Maître D were discussing a matter and a glass broke nearby one of my friends. A shard of glass got in her shoe and she fished it out and was concerned that her foot may still have glass in it that she is not able to see. The busser immediately went to get management and also get my friend a clean wet towel to ensure she got the glass out of her foot. My friend expressed her concern to the first manager who immediately went to get Tony- I assume the general manager- and Tony came to our table twice concerned for the welfare of my friend. He assured her that if anything wrong occurred with her foot after she left the restaurant that she could call him and as an attempt to show good will, he took us up to the rooftop bar. By this time the line to get to the rooftop was rather long and several people were waiting, and Tony made sure we got past the bouncers and onto the rooftop. The rooftop was nice with fire pits and lounge chairs and we stayed a bit to drink in the scenery. Since the rooftop music was a bit more on the trendy hipster side (we are more of a neo soul crowd) we didn't stay more than an hour; however, the experience was unforgettable. I only didn't give the establishment 5 stars because of the glass accident, although I do feel that they handled the incident with care and urgency.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany M.
Reviews.Content: Cute restaurant and lounge in DTLA. We came on a Sunday evening so we really didn't get the crowded hustle and bustle of a Friday and Saturday night. The decor is phenomenal and the vibe was comfortable and loungey. Which was nice considering it is in the middle of downtown.They have a limited menu but the food was good and they prices were reasonable for DTLA in my opinion. Downfall, was they close the top rooftop early than the lower floor patio on Sunday. But the inside stays open later than the outside lower patio. Also, no food on the rooftop, so we had to eat downstairs. Confusing? I agree. It's kind of annoying to keep changing places with drinks and belongings in hand. And it is strange to have diff closing times in different locations of the same place. Overall, good service, food, decor, and views.

Reviews.Author: Pete C.
Reviews.Content: The drinks are pretty good.  The view was ok.

Reviews.Author: Michelle P.
Reviews.Content: 3rd time is a charm!!!After 2 successful trips to the Perch, I spontaneously tried it a third time a few weeks ago on a Friday evening after dinner at Mas Malo.  It was an easy walk through Pershing Square and I had arrived.  The 3rd time was even better than the first two.  I was on a date, and approached the Host with a request for a view and by the fire place.  The fireplace was already taken, but seeing we were on a romantic outing, he seated us around back in a rocking chair love seat overlooking DTLA.  It could not have been a better spot in the whole city!  There was a live band outside, the weather was clear and perfect, and we ordered a couple of nice tequilas which were surprisingly delicious even for my own picky tequila connoisseur tastes.  Service was excellent, and it was one of my top 10 most romantic dates in my life thanks to the Perch.  I am DEFINITELY a Full-Fledged fan.No cover.  No line.  No snotty people... just plus, plus, plus.  5-stars- I loved it and will be back over and over!

Reviews.Author: Candace L.
Reviews.Content: I would have given this place 4 stars - but I felt I got cheated when I ordered the Chocolate Pot De Creme dessert. It tasted like regular but really thick chocolate pudding and had a few berries over it. This was ehh...The VIEW however was beautiful! I would definitely come back just for it.Although it was packed when I got there (around 9:30 on Friday) it was easy to find tables.The drink menu is good - I ordered a glass of wine (can't remember the name) that had a hint of fruit. I like how the wine section has a little description (i,e. full, sweet body with grape...).

Reviews.Author: David A R.
Reviews.Content: Fancy French fantastic rooftop. You feel transported to another city, if not another time.Nifty decor and potentially original tile-work. A little hard to navigate your way to the damn restaurant and bar. I didn't eat here, but I did drink. It's a little snooty in tone, but I think that's why people come here. "If you're not paying $12 a drink it must not be good." is the attitude. I guess that's part of why they pump in the All-French pop music throughout the night.And while their "lemonade" was sweet and smooth, it didn't pack a punch and it wasn't so novel in the taste department either. The other mixology drinks didn't impress in their description, but I'm usually a straight up whiskey or dirty martini kind of guy. Now if they had some bacon infused whiskey, or homemade absinthe, or some unlikely mezcals maybe we could talk, but as it is, Perch has a DELIGHTFUL downtown balcony with amazing views, and that's the real reason to come here.

Reviews.Author: Jackie K.
Reviews.Content: Been here few times and I love this place. Drinks can be pricy here if you get one of those speciality drinks. Friday and Saturday nights are definitely the best nights to go. They have a main floor and the roof top! Both are awesome places to lounge. It is not the highest building in LA so the view isn't as great as possibly The Standard, but the view is still very nice and lovely! Drinks here, like I said, are a bit pricy, but good! Got a midori sour, whisky gin, and couple other drinks and none have failed. The Whisky Gin is damn strong! All I could taste was the Whisky, no gin.There is valet parking I believe. There are also plenty of lots in downtown to park in. If you come on a busy night, you will have to wait in line to get in. I've been here few times, but last night was the first night I had to wait in line to get in. People are nice here. Friendly and service is great! :D Not the best place to order food! I hear it is pretty pricy!

Reviews.Author: Braden K.
Reviews.Content: SUAVE!ambiance: reminds me of the top floor in marquee, las vegas. hotel lobby-esque vibes meet creepy mansion living room fireplace? ...i dig it!eats:baked brie.. a little to pungent, needed more complimentary snacks to help ease the flavorduck confit.. amazing! a little overcooked and the portion was a bit dry.steak frites.. GOOD GOD! the steak was cooked to perfection, but the real star was the..little sticks of deep fried crack rocks with bits of cocaine sprinkled all over the top! the truffle oil? like the tears of an angel drizzled all over adding intense flavors making these fries INCREDIBLE.probably the b-e-s-t fries i've ever had in my e-n-t-i-r-e life!!oh yeah, ordered a cabernet which i don't remember because all i can think about.. is those FRIES!treat yourself, don't cheat yourself.FRIES FRIES FRIES

Reviews.Author: Seta A.
Reviews.Content: Just LOVE this place. A cool trendy beautiful rooftop in Downtown LA. Been here three times, and each time was more enjoyable than the previous!If you don't know downtown well, plan your parking ahead of time, especially if you are there late night. Drinks are excellent. Service is great. And the view is breathtaking! More like spectacular. I didn't give the place a 5 because we had appetizers and they weren't great. Food that was served looked very good but it was very expensive, so we opted out for drinks and appetizers. Next time for sure, and then I will review again.I say just go and experience it yourself. One of the best places LA can offer.

Reviews.Author: Onjelle R.
Reviews.Content: Very upscale! Gorgeous view. Drinks were freaking expensive but it's Downtown LA. Make friends or you will be standing all night. It gets pretty crowded around 11. Early arrival suggested

Reviews.Author: Hailey L.
Reviews.Content: Best view in DTLA. I came here Friday evening (for the Happy Hour menu $5 beer, $6 wines, $7 cocktails) and Saturday night (just for drinks) - I guess I couldn't get enough. Friday night I tried their truffle fries, baked brie and sliders. All were delicious and reasonably priced since it was happy hour until 6pm. All tables were reserved for 6pm so I suggest making reservations if you plan on having dinner.

Reviews.Author: Denis S.
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that this review is going to be a bit biased because I met my girlfriend here, so obviously I have a soft spot for this place.  A saner Denis may give them 4 rather than 5 stars, but that's not whose writing this review. Perch is a gem.  A true gem.  Located on the top floor and rooftop of a downtown building overlooking Pershing Square, Perch offers great drinks with a view.  This is one of the few places people actually dress up for, the bartenders are all friendly and while they may not be the best mixologists in Los Angeles, they clearly know their way around a bar. Great place for to bring a date for a drink or to hang out with a group of friends.  Yes, it's more expensive than what a drink should cost, but you're also paying for the view, the atmosphere, the posh surroundings and the people watching.  So when it's priced the same as a shot in a disgusting club, is it really more expensive?  My only caveat is, do not stay for dinner.  The food is overpriced, over pretentious, over flavored and under-cooked.

Reviews.Author: Sam B.
Reviews.Content: The food is fantastic, the ambiance is truly impressive, and the service is very good.  I highly recommend booking in advance then calling ahead to ask for a outside table.  The lounge type chairs are very comfortable, making for an upscale yet relaxed dinning experience.  If however you are on a first time date or dinner meeting I recommend a table, still an impressive view just it may be a few feet away from the corner edges.My only suggestion are:Have their wait staff slow down a tad bit, they are overzealous in their attempts to clear tables (nearly cleared my wife's who wasn't done, but admiring the view). Make sure staff delivers food / deserts for all guest at the same time.  Had to wait ~5 minutes for everyone's deserts to trickle out.Give those who are in the restaurant priority access to the upstairs lounge.  Wanted to take my mother upstairs but the "limit" was already reached.  Disappointed but not a disappointing visit.  Mom was impressed :).

Reviews.Author: Christina P.
Reviews.Content: I hate to be that person because I never like to give bad reviews...but it must be done.  I have been here once before and it was very chill but my last experience was BY FAR the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my entire existence on earth.  In fact, the lady at the door was beyond rude and condescending.  It was a Friday night and I had come here for my birthday.  I had quite a few people with me so the lady says she cant accommodate us.  Okay then...but then she proceeds to go further and say the bitchest tone "HAPPY BIRTHDAY, have fun somewhere else.  I cannot have you guys up there when people are still eating and have you guys all stand around hovering over everyone."  Yes...we came to Perch to stand around and watch people eat. I was just surprised at how continually rude she was even though everyone in my party kept their cool. So this went on for about 5 minutes of her telling us she wouldn't let us in many different variations of her being rude and on a power trip. Yes, you indeed are better than me...you work as a door person. CAN YOU SAY POWER TRIP?!

Reviews.Author: Jenn C.
Reviews.Content: My favorite rooftop in DTLA.The GoodBar: Let's start with the obvious. The rooftop bar is spacious and the view is beautiful. It overlooks Pershing Square. There is also no cover. However, there is only 1 bar which kind of puts a cramp on things around 11pm when it starts to get crowded. Service: I have to give credit here. The service is great. From the hosts to the waiters to the bartenders. We were a huge kind of complicated (rarely quiet with tons of questions) party and they handled us with grace the whole night.Restaurant: If you cannot handle another line, you can chill here. It still has a bar and a nice view.Food: We tried a bit of everything. Nothing that will make you fall off your seat but good nonetheless.The BadLines: The lines oh the lines. A line to get to another line. I fortunately never waited in these lines. One, we come early either after dinner or just before 10pm. Two, the manfriend has a DTLA resident card. It bypasses the lines which makes everything a breeze. He is also able to bring his friends up with the resident card.Tip: Register for a resident card if you work or live in DTLA. If there is a line to the rooftop, grab a drink at the restaurant level. It gets hot waiting in the stairwell. The VerdictIt's a definitely a must visit if you're in the area. Whether it be for dinner, drinks or even brunch - the atmosphere alone makes it great.

Reviews.Author: Eden O.
Reviews.Content: This should technically be 3.5, but I was nice and rounded up :)Came here on a hot Sunday afternoon for some refreshments and appetizers. It was Mother's Day so all tables outside were actually reserved, but we got a table right inside the doors (all of which are open to the outside and view). The view is one of the best I have seen in downtown, you get the historic sense around you but the décor is upscale and modern inside.They have live music, a fun selection of drinks and great sounding menu items. We ordered the baked brie and truffle poutine fries, within about two minutes of ordering these items they were delivered. . . quick service is great right? Well the problem was that you could tell these were not made fresh for us and had been sitting under a heat lamp for a while.Servers were clearly busy so took a bit to get to ordering.I would definitely go back for evening drinks/music and just skip the food. Definitely worth checking out.

Reviews.Author: Kiwi B.
Reviews.Content: Happened upon this place by accident one Saturday morning, and what a happy accident it was! Had an impromptu early afternoon brunch of the Assorted Homemade Breads, French Toast (the best I've ever had! So delicious the syrup was unnecessary) and a Caesar Salad. The view was incredible, the ambiance exquisite, and the live music delightful. I simply cannot wait to go again! Thank goodness there's an elevator to get this little flightless bird all the way up to this 15th floor Perch!

Reviews.Author: Talar A.
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to try the Perch for months, I was so excited when we arrived on a Friday night, there was no wait and we were seated quickly. The view was amazing, but it took about 20 minutes to order our food and drinks.  Our drinks arrived promptly, but after another 40 minutes we were really confused why it would take so long to prepare food for a party of 2. We asked the waitress and about 10 minutes later she came back and informed us she had forgot to put our order in, she apologized and brought out 2 drinks on the house. We were annoyed, but people make mistakes so we patiently waited for our food.  Another 40 minutes passed and they FINALLY brought out our food... Wait not what we had ordered, but maybe someone else's meal? They brought me a small green salad when I had ordered the linguini, and my friend a swordfish- and he hates fish!Now we were pissed! The manager took about 15 minutes to come and speak to us and said 'I'm sorry, this is really unfortunate, but our kitchen is now closed'. I really thought this was a joke- I mean did we really just sit here for over 2 hours for you to tell me you're kitchen is closed?So we ended up leaving hungry and mad. This took the prize for the worst experience I have EVER had at any restaurant. Fine dining at it's worst.So they decided to give me and my friend a $150 voucher to come back and have dinner again.  I'm changing my review from 1 to 3 stars because...1. They seem to care about their guests. 2. Our waitress the second time around was great, attentive, brought our food out quickly, and pleasant. 3. They didn't have the drink I wanted, said that they were out of the ingredients?4. The desert was OKAY- chocolate pot de creme- dark chocolate pudding, I would pass on this unless you have an obsession with dark chocolate.

Reviews.Author: Sarah K.
Reviews.Content: So good! Went here for brunch and got mimosas and french toast-- seriously, the best french toast I've ever had. It's such a lovely rooftop area, and the waiters all seemed very nice. There's some street parking around the area, which I wish we would have taken the time to look a bit before just parking in the lot next door-- it wasn't very expensive, but sort of unnecessary I think.

Reviews.Author: Kristine J.
Reviews.Content: I love the French food, the view, the drinks. It's all just made the greatest combination for me. Definitely a big fan of this place. The rooftop view of DTLA and Pershing Square looks amazing here at night. The Little Bunny Frou Frou dish is a bit expensive but very delicious. Go for the cocktails. There's one drink I really liked, similar to a Midori Sour, but I forgot their name for it. Note: It gets really crowded after 11.

Reviews.Author: Shilpa Y.
Reviews.Content: Soooo content right now. This review is for the brunch. It was delicious, amazing, and beautiful. Get the French toast. Seriously. It's not like any French toast you've ever had. Also, a whole  pitcher of good sangria for $20! Also get the truffle fries. Basically just get everything.The service was great, I called them a million times to change my reservation but they were so patient with me. Also it's probably best to make a reservation because they always claim to be super booked up. It's really easy and you can make one from their website. You get a gorgeous view of downtown, and basically will have the best morning ever. It is a little pretentious but that just comes with the LA territory I guess!

Reviews.Author: Hana M.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a brunch bday celebration. We had reservations but had to sit inside because we had a large party, boo I like the outdoors.  We arrived late, 1:30 but we were seated promptly. Kudos to needing 2 elevators just go up, yeah you need an elevator to get to another elevator. Our party ordered a good mix of food. I ordered the steak with side salad, which was delicious. For not having many patrons and what seemed like a good amount of staff they were not very attentive to our table. In short:Good food, good sangria, good fries, meh service.

Reviews.Author: Mariana S.
Reviews.Content: Fun and different restaurant with a great view and live music. Interesting lithographs and photos on the walls, good food. Tables and chairs are mis-matched and unique. Fun and quirky place.

Reviews.Author: Jenn M.
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my birthday here with friends last Saturday night.  I enjoyed it very much!  I've heard of the long lines to get in so I intentionally told my friends to come around 7pm to avoid lines.  Sure enough, there were no lines to get in!Once you get inside, the view from high above is pretty amazing!  I just love DTLA and to see if from a rooftop point of view is spectacular!  You can go up another floor (or two, I think?) and there is another bar and lounge area.  The outside lounge area at the restaurant level is reserved seating only.  There's also a live band as well.  If I had to do it all over again, I'd get reservations so we can sit and enjoy the band.Drinks are pretty pricey but at least they taste good.  Bartenders were nice and attentive and were not pretentious for a fancy place like this.  Ladies, I recommend getting the My Fair Lady drink - it tastes yummy, it's cute, and it's pink!I would recommend coming here early enough to enjoy the ambience and rooftop.  You could always bar hop nearby later in the night anyway.  I would totally come back here again and maybe try their weekend brunch!

Reviews.Author: Joanne L.
Reviews.Content: BEST ROOFTOP BAR! If I had to take a girl on a date, this would be my top spot. Short and sweet...This place has it all: classy, romantic, intimate, awesome skyline view of dtla, cozy sofa seats, good selection of whiskey, good desserts and nibbles (surprisingly good food for a bar!), wines, heat lamps, trees decorated with lights. I am in love. If you can't woo a girl here, I'm so sorry brotha.

Reviews.Author: Juanita D.
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking views of Downtown via rooftop with a swanky cocktail in hand makes for a perfect night, any night.Note that sometimes Perch is closed off for private parties, bummer right? I literally live a block away and it's taken me MONTHS to try this place out. 1 elevator ride will get you to their inside lounge area - drinks & food are both pricey, but it makes for a great meet up with friends or a dinner date. Take another flight of stairs or elevator ride and you'll be on the rooftop!Rooftop bar isn't my favorite, there are 2 bartenders, but one is just to clean glasses... more of a support for the main tender. Happy you have help, but when their is a party + guests looking for a drink - Ithink you need additional tenders.... just saying. Oh and shake that cocktail a little faster, no sense of urgency which I didn't like.I had to go back downstairs to get a drink and then head back up. They have mini fire pits that will keep you cozy assuming it's chilly out.  Whether you're inside or outside I'm almost positive you will love this place!

Reviews.Author: George B.
Reviews.Content: I've been venturing DTLA for over 10 years now and I would always tell my friends: "DTLA is nothing like Hollywood".  Well I was wrong.  First was the Standard, then the Edison and the Perch will be next.I went to the Perch last Saturday night and was in line by 9pm.  I waited for nearly 40 minutes and the line didn't move so I took off.  I was 30-ish in line and one of my friend's friend was in front of me in line she didn't get inside until 11pm.  That's a 2 hour wait!!  Can this place really hit capacity at 9pm?  How come they weren't letting anyone in?  My friend had dinner inside the Perch at 7:30pm and he said it wasn't full at all around 9pm.Oh I get it, they want to have a long line outside so they want pedestrians to think "Wow, that place is happening!"  Sooner or later they're going to have a cover charge just like The Standard and Edison.

Reviews.Author: Lynn U.
Reviews.Content: The truffle fries were delicious. Must try! The oyster was also delicious. The salmon Bennedict was okay---nothing extraordinary. The bread pudding was good. The drink French Maid was also good (was my first one so I have nothing else to compare it to)

Reviews.Author: Linda H.
Reviews.Content: Perch has seemingly been the popular hangout spot in DTLA.  I was excited to see what all the hype was about.   In summary:View: not impressedFood: limited, mediocre Decor: classic, mix-and-match furnitureService: average, slow on a saturday morningDaytime vibe: ok, although the live music added a nice touch thoughNight-time vibe: pretty goodOverall: Just ok.

Reviews.Author: Carolyn C.
Reviews.Content: The view is where it's at!!!Came here for my birthday celebration. We made a reservation at 10PM for 12 people but I don't think were seated until 11PM. During our wait, we hung out at the bar and decided to check out the roof top bar. Although the view was nice, I thought it was too crowded. We just spent a few minutes up there for heading back down. Got a couple of drinks, but didn't really taste strong. Tasted more of the juice then the alcohol. Finally got seated in a secluded section, which was good and bad. Good because it was private for our people...bad because service was really non extinct. We were seated at a table that only half the group had silverware. It took them 30 minutes to get us menu even asking 4 people about them. Another 30 minutes for someone to come take our orders. The food did, however came out quickly. I had the chicken with rossioto. It was okay. Nothing was great, but it wasn't bad. I had some of my friend's truffle fries and mac&cheese, and they were okay. Fries was a little greasy and the Mac was nothing special. My sis seafood broth was tasty but again nothing special. Overall the food was alright, but definitely not worth the price. When it came time to pay, we couldn't find our waitress to get the bill. We had to go to the hostess table to see if she can send our waitress to our table. Got the bill and waited for someone to take it. Sat and sat and waited, until finally we just decided to bring it to the hostess table again because it was getting late. With this type of service, I think it would be so easy to have dine and ditch, but we didn't!!! Overall, the view is beautiful but the food is not worth it, like many have said.

Reviews.Author: Anna V.
Reviews.Content: Two stars for the view and two stars for the interior. It's a lovely place to hang out. The missing star - really, pricy and low quality cocktails. It makes me cry to think what  a potential a bar like this could have, and instead...  Long drinks are overiced and taste like water. The choice of cocktails is very limited and stronger cocktails all taste the same - that is, moonshine with herbs. Nothing sassy and enjoyable.

Reviews.Author: Michelle J.
Reviews.Content: On busy nites, local DTLA residents have a special line to get in, which is usually shorter. Have proof of residence.Favorite drink is the French Maid Cucumber drink, except that the last time I went, they didnt have that but instead replaced it with a Jalapeno cucumber drink. It wasn't as refreshing (because of the added heat), but still tasty in it's own way.SWEEPING VIEWS of the city, and the Building facade used in the recent Batman movies. go at sunset, to woo your special lady (or man). :)

Reviews.Author: Vanessa H.
Reviews.Content: Okay so I think my experience here would have been different had I done the following:1. Come on a weekend2. Not come during happy hour3. Had a party of more than 34. Come when the weather isn't absolutely perfect, and when it's not sunsetBut because I did NOT do any of the above, I had an incredible experience here. The view. The View. THE VIEW. Freakin' A, folks. How can you not love being in DTLA when there is a place like this? My friends and I all enjoyed the French 64, a deliciously spicy cocktail that is one of their more popular happy hour offerings. We skipped the food and opted for just drinks, as we were having dinner elsewhere, but the menu looked so interesting I was tempted to try some of the appetizers. Next time!Our service was exceptional. I even put in a last minute one-minute-after-happy-hour request and our server went out of his way to take care of it. Once we were done, it took a little while for us to get our check (and at $6 or $7 a drink, I wasn't going to complain!), but we were able to enjoy that much more of the evening air and I didn't mind that.I cannot wait to come back. Hopefully the stars will align for me again and I will be able to enjoy another gorgeous afternoon or evening here.

Reviews.Author: Patty C.
Reviews.Content: I'm still drooling/dreaming about the braised short rib...if you eat beef get this dish! Started with the French Maid cocktail and ahi tuna tartare. For dinner we had braised short rib, salmon, and chicken. Everything was prepared very well. Definitely going back for dinner with great views and atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Sharishta S.
Reviews.Content: Came for dinner on a Wednesday night with some out of town friends.  I made reservations on Open Table and called to request a table outside.  When we arrived we were seated at a great table on their patio close enough to hear the awesome live Jazz music and see the spectacular evening view of down town.  Our waitress was patient and very friendly.  Drinks were delicious and food was yummy, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Sally Z.
Reviews.Content: I love that their menu has both seasonal and anchoring plates. We called in for a dinner reservation, even though Open Table said they had none available. Plus points!Their drinks are phenomenal!!! I can see myself coming back for drinks in the future. Back to focus, we came for dinner. I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass in ham hock and was able to try the flat iron. I recommend the flat iron! It was moist and delicious. The sea bass was fresh and light, but I felt like the fish's great flavors were a little washed out with the ham hock. It was a good plate, regardless. Service was slow. Our waitress had a great personality and her energy was invigorating!Yes, the rooftop view is breath-taking.

Reviews.Author: Jessica V.
Reviews.Content: Made reservations at Perch for a big birthday and was a bit dissapointed, especially when the bill came. So, it was my sisters big 30th birthday and I thought, let's try perch. I knew it was going to be a bit on the pricey side but thats what you expect when you include the ambiance, right???? We arrived for our reservations a bit late, so that was completely our fault and maybe becasue of that they had to give our table away, but let me ask you...who seats a party of 6 at 2 tiny patio furniture tables? I had to go inside and let them know that we were there to eat dinner, not just for drinks b/c nothing else would have fit on that table. So, they moved us to the outside; which was fine and the table was bigger but the seating was so uncomfortable. Again, with the patio furniture, I don't get it. If we were going to do drinks then it makes sense but how do you expect 6 people to sit on a wicker bench and cut their steaks?Ok, so on to the food. It was good food. We tried the swordfish, steak frites, filet mignon and ribeye. The drinks were reasonably priced and so were the appitizers, We had the mac and cheese and the lamb sliders; which were very good. Overall, the  experience was nice, but if I'm going to pay $130.00 for 2 people then I at least want to be comfortable where I'm sitting. And who knows maybe they do that to help the turnover. I will also say that the service was great. Everyone was very friendly and accomidating; I just wish we would have had a more comfortable table. If you're going to go to Perch I would suggest going for drinks and appitizers and then going somewhere else for dinner. Your back will thank you!!

Reviews.Author: Kristen H.
Reviews.Content: sunday brunches are the best, haven't been here for dinner yet.service is ehh sometimes really good and sometimes you only see your waitress twice through your whole meal.. really depends on the time you go, the later the busier I have noticed.the oysters are phenomenal and go perfect with one of their bottles of champagne ;) live jazz music if you get there in the afternoon!perfect spot for a date or a (most likely hungover) morning with all your girls!

Reviews.Author: Josh L.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to meet a friend here for dinner and we were all slightly underwhelmed with the food.  The atmosphere was amazing of course.  I chose the filet and asked for it medium rare.  My wife had braised short ribs and our friend had a strip steak.  We also ordered some sides like the french fries smothered in truffle gravy and the bacon mac & cheese.  It may be a french thing I'm not aware of, but my filet came out in two portions, stacked on top of each other.  I've never been served a filet this way, but it looked delicious anyway.  I wasn't complaining at this point.  I cut into my filet and it seemed to have been cooked perfectly.  It tasted great.  After eating the first filet (the one on top) I cut into my second filet and saw how overcooked it was.  It was over done, but at this point, I've eaten half my meal and everyone was enjoying the view so whatever.  I just finished it.  My wife thought her short ribs were ok, not great, not terrible.My friend didn't complain, but left half his steak on his plate and refused a doggy bag.The fries with the truffle gravy were amazing.Overall, for the price I would expect a better filet and better main courses in general.  Ambiance is what you go here for.  Also, there seemed to be 7 or 8 hosts waiting to seat people.  Kind of a strange feeling walking in and seeing a line of 8 people staring at you.  Not sure why they need so many hosts but it was a little odd.  With so many great places to eat in LA, we won't be going back here anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Ezra C.
Reviews.Content: I would never go back there, service sucks, the worst service ever, I've been to 5 star restaurants and people are much nicer there than the people running this place. Only nice thing about this place is the view.

Reviews.Author: Katty V.
Reviews.Content: Went to a good meeting for having a great zeal and the amazing destination should be like that as such a great plus as well. Hour gone how I didn't understand at all. Highly recommendation of the place as such kind of grand of serious mood as too.

Reviews.Author: Illiana E.
Reviews.Content: New Years Eve.... AMAZING.First time at  Perch , came because of a friends recommendation. Loved it. I really enjoyed atmosphere. The view from the rooftop was breathtaking.I did not get a chance to try the food but I really enjoyed the mixed drinks. The bartenders were fast and friendly. There were two burlesque shows and a mini ball drop. I almost forgot I was in la the night was so magical. Can't wait to go back and try the food. Hmmm maybe for brunch?

Reviews.Author: Alexis J.
Reviews.Content: The first time and only time I was not able finish an Old Fashioned because of how disgustingly sweet and watered down it was. Good thing it only cost $16.

Reviews.Author: Dan M.
Reviews.Content: So I went to Perch not too long ago for dinner. I had been meaning to check this place out for a few months so was excited to finally have the chance to head out there. We arrived at the building which feels like it has 8 mysterious hallways and different elevators to finally reach the restaurant. We had arrived at the joint a bit early so we were told that we could sit at the bar or go up to the rooftop bars. We decided to check out the rooftop bar. Not disappointed by any means. The view is great on the roof and the environment is super chill and relaxed as opposed to the stuffy ostentatious typical LA bar scene. Ordered a few drinks and they were definitely strong but on the pricey end. It is also cold on the rooftop even with the heaters they had working so make sure to bring a jacket if you plan on standing outside for a while.Now I wish I had stopped with the bar experience but we had our dinner so I have to share the experience. Again we were brought to the balcony side and the view was magnificent. We ordered the bacon mac and cheese along with the truffle fries steak frites. The food was just Ok in my personal opinion. Maybe I just got a poor batch of the food itself but I was a bit disappointed. The flavors seemed a bit bland and overall everything felt like it had a pound of butter on it. I know French cooking can be like this sometimes but I was not overly impressed with the food. So in conclusion, this place is awesome for drinks and to chill with a group of people. Honestly do not think you would get a better view in downtown LA for sure so highly recommend it. Just come here for small bites and drinks and you will love your experience. I am sure if I had done just that my review would have been a solid 4.

Reviews.Author: Fanny H.
Reviews.Content: Perch is probably the closest thing you can get to a mediocre club in Vegas.  You wait in line for hella days and finally go in to find that the place doesn't quite meet your expectations.Some important things to point out about this place.- Dress code is "dressy casual," so think classy.  When Richard G. and I first stepped in line, we were a little worried we were underdressed.  You will find yourself surrounded by girls in heels and guys in dress shoes.  Watch out, this place is a big deal.- People note how it's sort of hard finding this place, but there was an adequate line forming early.  Once you see a crowd on Hill St, that will give you the clear sign that you're in the right place.- There are TWO lines to endure, one to physically get into the building and one to go to the actual rooftop bar.  You'll take 2 elevators (push the numbers with the bird engraving next to them) and find yourself first at the restaurant.  There is seating inside and outside, as well as an indoor and outdoor bar.  Hit up the outdoor bar unless you want to fight the battle to flag down a bartender; they're busy taking drink orders for the seated patrons so be prepared to wait (oh yes, more waiting).- The place is CRAMPED when you aren't seated, as you will be awkwardly standing in everybody's way.  There seems to be a good amount of room on the rooftop, but you'll need to wait in a slower moving line in order to get access.  For my impatient ass, I never physically got to the actual rooftop part of this rooftop restaurant/lounge.  Just a little disappointing.With that said, this place just doesn't quite deliver.  While the idea of drinking at a rooftop bar and having an aerial view of DTLA is initially cool, the wait time and organization of this place is not.  You will find yourself disappointed that this place is geared toward more of being a restaurant than a bar/lounge.Drinks are good.  Bartender was very intricate and meticulous in making drinks.  He didn't care about firing out drinks to keep the line moving, but instead made sure each and every single drink was made to perfection.  Do note that if you order a cocktail off their menu, chances are that the outside bar is not fully stocked to make the exact cocktail, but you'll get something close to it.  A compliment on the bartender's bowtie scored me an extra splash of Grey Goose so ladies, work your magic or flash some cash or skin, your choice.Live band was SPOT ON though.  I thoroughly enjoyed the live music and renditions of Michael Jackson and Maroon 5.  I say that was the highlight of the night.  I wouldn't have minded having a table outside and being able to listen to the band all night long.  Great ambiance.The next time I come back, I'll make sure to have a reservation with the restaurant, go early, have more patience, and have a lot of money to throw down.  Until then, I don't think I'll be seeing you any time soon, Perch.

Reviews.Author: Anh-Dao T.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to go for a view of DTLA. The music is great too, especially when they have live bands. The crowd is definitely more sophisticated than the crowd at La Cita down the street. If you go early, you can grab one of the comfy lounge chairs on the rooftop, but the best time to go is as the sun is setting. No lines at the bar and no one to block your amazing view of the sun disappearing behind the high rises. Oh, how I love this city.

Reviews.Author: Rinny P.
Reviews.Content: I went to a meeting at Perch during Happy Hour and the truffle mac and cheese was amazing. The view from atop is also a plus.

Reviews.Author: Brittney B.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the views, 3 for the food. Tried the chocolate moose tasted more like jello pudding from a hospital. But again I love the views and the band was great the singer reminded me of Macy Gray. The crowd us mixed mostly people in their late twenties. Highly recommend it for a girls nite out when you just don't want to do a club.Tip: first come first serve seating on the patio by the bathroom near the elevator.

Reviews.Author: Samantha R.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best place ever, I've only come here for a birthday and ended up waiting almost 2 hours in line but it was so worth it the second was for brunch and we had a reservation and we were pretty late for it so they sat us in this tiny little table and I was disappointed but stuck with it because it was our fault for being late ,however I decided to ask one of the hostess if she could put us outside because I wanted a view and she sat me right outside although the place was pretty packed. I'll forever love this place and can't wait to go back .

Reviews.Author: Fatima K.
Reviews.Content: The ambiance was amazing the view was spectacular. Who would thought that Downtown LA could look that beautiful. The quality of food was exceptional. We ordered the ahi tartare for our appetizer, it was really fresh and probably the best I've ever had and that means a lot because tartare is really not my cup of tea but this one was really fresh and not fishy at all. For our entrees I ordered the filer mignon and my husband ordered the skirt steak and fries. The fries were really good with the truffle cheese and sauce. The side that came w the filet was really good too. The bernaise sauce was perfect. Both of us thought our meat was overcharred even though we ordered medium rare. It had a bitter taste almost like there was a coffee crust. The food was good the ambiance even better and Luke out server was excellent. He made the experience great.

Reviews.Author: Nicholas M.
Reviews.Content: First off, there are two elevators and they are old man river; so be prepared. Not letting that stop me I made it up to top.Great view and ambiance. The service at the main bar and rooftop bar is way too slow. They should have one bartender just do beer and wine and another do specialty drinks. The food was very good and priced accordingly. The wait staff was cheerful and helpful. Great spot for dinner. Note: I would recommend coming here during the week and early. This place becomes a zoo on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Patricia K.
Reviews.Content: Great place to checkout if you're visiting LA and want a chill evening out with your friends. PROS:+ rooftop bar with a nice view of downtown LA + chill yet classy (no frills)+ drinks were reasonably priced considering the venue + friendly bouncers/bartenders/overall- good service+ no cover+ small venue, intimate setting, and clean-triple yayCONS:- arrived on a Friday night around 11ipm- waited about 40 minutes to get IN and another 20 minutes to move from the restaurant area to the rooftop bar; supposedly, the roof was "too crowded" but when we finally went up, there was a LOT of empty space (i guess it could be a safety precaution?)- NO AC in the staircase area while you wait- but not too bad because you can grab a drink downstairs and have it with you while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Jonas B.
Reviews.Content: This place sucks.The manager is a dickThe food is over pricedThe portions are smallI will never go back.

Reviews.Author: Danny N.
Reviews.Content: Disappointing.  The atmosphere was okay.  THe drinks are pretty expensive too.  Each drink is about 13-15 bucks,  This is a good place if you're on a date but for a group hangout, this isn't a good place.  There is limited seating on the rooftop lounge and its mainly couples there or a group of 2-4 people.  The only positive thing is that there is no cover charge.

Reviews.Author: Flora Z.
Reviews.Content: I took my parents there for Christmas eve dinner to experience DTLA's glittering night. The overall experience is great. We were warmly welcomed with a recommendation on happy hour cocktail of the day ( we arrive around 530pm ) and signature main course. The view from the dining table and rooftop bar are beautiful and gorgeous.

Reviews.Author: Debbie E.
Reviews.Content: Summary - Ambiance is great, food is decent, seating and service leaves much to be desired.Came here on a Sunday for the second time.  Had theater tickets that evening so we came early to get a bite and drinks pre show.  I won't repeat all of the elevator issues that others mentioned.  No line to get in but they did insist on seating us outside on one of the the coldest days of the year in LA, saying there was heat lamps.  Wouldn't put us inside saying the tables were too large for the two of us.  Needless to say, we enjoyed our entire meal shivering in jackets and scarves since there are not too many heat lamps to go around.Ordered glasses of wine, which took almost 30 minutes to bring out.  She asked what we would like to eat (it was limited menus given the hour of the day, we were OK with that) but we had different menus.  AND it turns out most of the items on the menus were not available anyway.  Duh.Took another 40 minutes or so for our food to come out in its entirety (the puffs came out quickly then nothing).  Summary of our food:Puffs - looks like the cream puffs you get frozen in Costco but those are so much more delicious.  These were supposed to have cheese in them but we didn't taste or see any.  The garlic aloili was pretty good.Bacon wrapped dates - Bacon.  Need I say more?  But I will.  The dates were good and soft, not rubbery.Truffle Fries - Cheesy.  Alone or to share.Burger - They actually heeded our request and cut it in half for us.  Lots of 'stuff' on it, the bun was also toasted.  Came with garlic fries.  I wouldn't say anything special.Tried to order another glass of wine, which took forever, so we had to pound it down to get out the door and to the theater on time.The view is good, and there is plenty of outdoor seating.  I would say this place is more of a get a drink or two in the early evening and then move on rather than stay and eat.So, after being there for over two hours for four small plates and  four glasses wine, the total bill was $99 before gratuity.   Yes, I get it's LA, but given the less than mediocre service and that we were freezing, it's a little pricey.  There are a lot of new and up and coming places in downtown that we will try.

Reviews.Author: Yenny D.
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this place is a bit hard to find! The sign on the building is subtle and you take an elevator to the 13th floor, get off, then take a 2nd elevator to the 15th floor for the restaurant. Luckily, there are friendly people around to direct you. The restaurant is cute, with a great view that we couldn't appreciate because it was rainy. Portions are small-ish but food was good (but pricy!). Our server was super nice and helpful. Cocktails are good too! I recommend Ze Green Tea.We went to the rooftop bar after dinner - they are very strict about capacity so you have to wait for people to leave in order to get up there if the roof is already full. We waited in the staircase until we could get up (maybe 10-15 minute wait since it was December and had just rained). The roof is very cute, only one bar and good rock-ish music. GREAT night view but would've been a greater experience if I had been warmer.

Reviews.Author: Deanna J.
Reviews.Content: The quick version?  AWESOME view, mediocre food.The view and ambiance get 5 stars, the food gets 2 stars (and one of those is for presentation only).Myself and two good friends came to Perch for dinner/Girls' night on 1/24/14.  I'd been before, but only to the lounge on the very top of the roof for a friend's birthday [that experience was fine/fun].  So this review is for the restaurant.Service: Our waiter wasn't rude but he certainly wasn't very warm or attentive.  I felt like *I* was serving *him* because I was the one going out of my way to be friendly.  Who knows the cause of his blase demanor . . . maybe his cat died that day. I will say, though, that the manager came over to check on us, and he was indeed very warm, friendly and professional, so kudos to him.Food:- I got the tuna tartar for my appetizer.  Lovely presenation, but virtually tasteless.  My friend started with the bacon mac n' cheese.  It was okay - tasted like [duh] macaroni and cheese with some bacon in it, but was on the dry side.- Main course: I got roasted chicken with mushroom risotto.  The risotto was meh - rice was a tad undercooked.  The chicken was cooked well (not overdone) but horribly underseasoned.  I'm not a "salty" person, but I had to add copious amounts of salt & pepper to add any flavor to this dish.  My friend got the steak frites, and even though she ordered her steak "medium", it was so red it was practically still mooing. (She didn't mind though).  That sucker really put the "red" in red meat.-Dessert:  I ordered the bread pudding against my better judgement (I'm spoiled: my mom makes the Best Bread Pudding In. The. World).  I was lured in by words like "white chocolate" and "boubon sauce" and "caramel".  Bad move.  It was dense, doughy, dry . . . completely overcooked. I *almost* ordered a side of ice cream to lend it some moisture, but not for $6 a scoop. I only ate half and pushed the rest away, which is saying A LOT considering I have a raging sweet tooth and will polish off just about anything with sugar in it.- Drinks: My friends got the French Maid and enjoyed it.  I got some cucumber lemon thing [I forget the name because it was, well, a forgettable drink!].Would I go back to Perch?  Maybe, but only the lounge/bar area, and EXCLUSIVELY for the views and ambiance.  The food was a complete waste of money.  On the rare occasion that I drop $60 for a meal, I expect delicious . . . amazing, even.  Sadly, I've had more flavorful food at my local Cheesecake Factory (and friendlier service too!).

Reviews.Author: Charlie C.
Reviews.Content: This place is hella cool! Perch is located on the 15th floor of some building that provides a wonderful view of DTLA. After a great meal at Bottega Louis my friend n I wanted to see what the hype is all about.  This place is the thee place to be to have a drink and talk.  I cannot wait to come back and have dinner here along with the amazing views!

Reviews.Author: Mary S.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here last night for our honeymoon. This was the first time that I had been to a place in downtown los angeles that had a view of los angeles from on top of the building and was a restaurant so I was out of words on how beautiful the view from the perch was. We came here late night last night and had some wine. They had an impressive selection of great tasting wine. We got red wine and finished 2 bottles and had some appetizers. They had a cheese plate with some other appetizers that was pretty cool.We got out and went even higher to the roof, sitting on the first floor of the perch was better because they had a outside area with a beautiful view that was covered and it wasn't windy or cold because they had heaters. for people that didn't mind the cold they were on the top top floor which was not covered but still had heaters.Very romantic place, classy and a great service + Food //// all around 5 star experience and a great night!!

Reviews.Author: Richard M.
Reviews.Content: Went to the perch with a few friends on Saturday night after a great dinner in Downtown. When we pulled up there was a line to get. My friend Harvey gets out of the sprinter van and next thing you know we're going straight in. The doorman was pretty cool. Up to the 15th floor and you can hear the music playing. In the corner the DJ is mixing some pretty good tunes.We get a table outside, totally covered with heavy clear plastic to help keep the elements out. We order a few drinks, some spiced nuts that tasted great and listened to some good music. The drinks are priced fair but poured with a stingy hand.The wrap around patio with views of the city, exceptional. You need to make sure you go to the perch with the right crowd and it can be extremely entertaining.

Reviews.Author: Irene W.
Reviews.Content: Service started out good, and went out the door by the end of the night.  I've had better food at a fastfood restaurant.  Truffled fries were soggy.  Beet salad was tasteless, and my orecchiette pasta with fall squash and escargot came without the fall squash and escargot.  When they took it back, they just tossed in the missing ingredients, which made the pasta chewy.  This place is good for drinks and an awesome view.  I wouldn't do dinner here ever again.

Reviews.Author: Joel A.
Reviews.Content: I dont normally write reviews but my experience tonight made me inclined to write about my evening at perch.I have heard so many reviews about this place and all of it was positive. The view 15 floors up provides a great view of dtla and the ambience provides a great romantic setting for a date. Because of the reputation and the reviews ive read and heard, i wanted to celebrate our anniversary here. I have no problems with the food and the venue. The food was delicious, hands down. However the waitress we had left me no choice but to rate this place 1 star. If it had been a more interested waitress and enthusiastic with her job i wouldve easily rated this place a 5. The waitress shall remain anonymous. To start off, after being seated we waited almost 20 minutes to be greeted by a server. And as she introduced herself, her saying "i guess ill be your waitress" made us feel very unwelcomed. She had a flat affect, and overall impression was very uninterested with us. As we had questions with the menu she didnt really provide us much information besides what is said on the menu. I understand that it is a very busy place but the fact that she couldnt for a quick second check in on us to see how we were doing except to pick up our empty drinks and ask if we wanted more i felt was unacceptable with no concern for her customers. I dont expect too much attention from our waitress.. But just enough to make us feel welcomed. Unfortunately that wasnt the case. And at the end, i wanted to take a picture with my girlfriend with a picture of the view so we can remember this anniversary... So we asked her to take a photo and she gave us this look that she didnt want to and took a few photos which ended up dark! By the time we realized the photos were dark she completely vanished and showed up almost 15 minutes with the check. She approached us with our check with a very uninterested manner and at this point it was clear we felt very unwelcomed.What im trying to say is: Perch is a really great place to have dinner. Great venue and great food. However, if you have this waitress... You may have a very horrid experience. Im willing to come back to give this place another try bc this is a really great place with great food but if i have that same waitress again, im going to make it known and request another waitress. Keep in mind im a very passive person.

Reviews.Author: Joe U.
Reviews.Content: This review is limited to the drinks and outdoor patio.  Great spot to come either before or after a Lakers game, especially on a warm night.  We were lucky enough to get right in and scored a spot on a couch upstairs on a unseasonably warm winter night.  The drinks were a little pricey, but it's downtown LA and any cool place is going to get you.  The Moscow Mule's are so tasty and go down smooth when you're overlooking the LA skyline! The ambiance is topnotch, and you can't beat the fireplace on the roof or the outdoor dining table for a dinner party.  Can't wait to go back and try some food!

Reviews.Author: Kristen C.
Reviews.Content: This place is uber trendy, but the good news is, you can hunker down and kind of forget the 'scene' once you get settled in. We met for drinks here. No reservations/bar sitting area, except on the 15th floor/rooftop. See hahnmade's description on how to get into the place. I haven't really eaten here, only had drinks. The view is beautiful and definitely worth going and taking a pic/instagramming/tweeting it and then leaving. The bar staff is okay, they're just busy and the restaurant is loud. So, if you're trying to chat good luck. We did have a star siting. Some guy from True Blood. But really, it's not worth the hassle of getting there/scoping/waiting for seats or fighting with other people for them/and the price of the food/drinks.

Reviews.Author: Hanz M.
Reviews.Content: Excellent lounge area for after dinner drinks and cocktails.  Spectacular views of DTLA skyline. Good place for just hanging out with upscale trendy crowd. Food is average.  Live bands on weekdays. Thursdays is a good day of the week to go since you don't have to deal with the weekend lines, it's still crowded but not as much as Friday and Saturday. Staff is friendly. Dress to impress. Park across the street for just 6 dollars.

Reviews.Author: Sherene H.
Reviews.Content: Celebrated a birthday dinner with friends yesterday and we were all very impressed with the ambiance, the view, the food and drinks.... but MOST of all the service. Our server Jessica was attentive, warm and en point all evening. We will definitely be back often. A plus for service, view and ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Jessica A.
