Reviews.Content: Didn't get to dine here but wonderful food smells drifted from the main dining level, so my rating is mainly based on the rooftop. I really wanted to give 4 stars for the awesome view and live band playing, but with $10+ drinks and having 5 to 6 of them  costing over a hundo for my boyfriend and I knocked that extra star off. Cute entrance and elevator ride to get to the actual place. Line wasn't bad to get in since we got there about 10. The roof view is great with the glass walls but overall not too much seating room, so ladies be prepared to stand as u mingle in heels if you didn't come early enough to claim an area! I did like the fire pit touch around certain seated areas though. Overall yes it was a pretty roof top bar, with music from a live band, and yummy drinks!  but I would've been just fine with drinks AND dinner at an fancy over a hundo place also.

Reviews.Author: Richard L.
Reviews.Content: The line to get into this place was a bit ridiculous for what you get.  I would say it took me about 40 minutes to an hour waiting in line to get into the elevator to Perch.  You have to wait in another line to get onto the second floor of the place, which is a bit annoying.  The drinks are average.  I had a jalapeno gin and some of their bottled beers (Scrimshaw Pilsner and a porter).  The jalapeno mixed drink had a kick to it, which I liked.

Reviews.Author: Richard G.
Reviews.Content: The typical first time visit of someone wanting to go to the classendary (legendary + classy) 'bar' that is Perch.Step one: Get in line really early.Step two: Wait forever.Step three: Wait some more.Step four: Get to Perch.Step five: Realize that you really AREN'T at the actual "rooftop view" of Perch.Step six: Get in line for rooftop bar.Step seven: Bail from line after you realize nobody's getting let upstairs.--This place can hardly be called a bar.  I waited outside at 9:20 to get in a bit past 10.  There weren't that many people in front of us.  So finally after we get up there, I am shocked.  This is a full service restaurant - with maybe an eighth of the floor dedicated "bar" space.  After you explore whatever space you can, you suddenly realize that you can go UP one floor to the roof...!...or at least you think you can.  There's another line that's even worse than the line to get in.  Long story short, you have to be the first in line to get to the roof.  Huh...?  I'm sure it'd be cool up there, but we couldn't do the whole waiting thing for much longer...It is good to note they have a live band on the Saturday night I came, and the music was totally on point.  You can't help but feel happy.I think a way to bypass the system is get a reservation for dinner (say...6 or 7 pm?), pay for overpriced classy food, and then get to the roof that way.  Otherwise, get ready to get there early. Dresscode is upscale classy, but honestly I felt like it was vegas clubbing status.  You CAN get in, just need to really be dedicated to going.  I recommend pregaming an hour before getting in line - you'll need it.

Reviews.Author: Tamikka R.
Reviews.Content: The experience began as I walked into the building. Then, the mystery continues as you use two elevators to get to the restaurant. It felt very much like I was entering a speakeasy. As we entered the restaurant, I was shocked by the high ratio of men present.  What a beautiful view! Delicious food. I got lost in the setting. Food: I had the bacon-wrapped, bleu cheese-stuffed dates (decent), wrapped brie (I could eat that all day) and flat iron steak with rosemary frites--Simple and delicious entree. I looked around at my group and no food was left uneaten. Service: The servers/management was great. We were there for a roof-top dinner that was planned in advance. Unfortunately, unbeknownst to us, the weather did not want to cooperate. When asked to move inside, the management was willing to accommodate us by rearranging the restaurant. We decided against it. So they warmed us with spirits! We were quite pleased. A smaller group of us stayed after to enjoy another couple (or two) by the fire after the larger group left. Our cocktail server, Kayla, was a delight. It was her first night at Perch. Definitely an experienced server. Overall, I will recommend the full experience!

Reviews.Author: Vicki L.
Reviews.Content: Decided to hit this place up as a last stop for our bar hopping night in downtown LA. We had a hard time finding this place because the entrance is just a regular door with a bouncer in front of it, so it's very easy to pass bye without noticing it.There's no particular attire requirement I don't believe but I was wearing a nice top and black jeans with some nice shoes and a leather jacket and got in just fine. My guy friend was wearing a collared shirt with a bow tie and jeans and regular shoes and got in too.You take the elevator to the 13th floor (so unlucky I know!) and then take another elevator to the the "Perch" level which is indicated by a little birdy sign next to the floor! Once you get in the bar is to the left and the rest of the restaurant is just seating for if you want to eat there. If you walk past the bar there's a nice outdoor area for you to smoke/enjoy the view. Honestly we were very disappointed by the view. We thought it was going to AMAZING, considering it's a rooftop bar but....it was just like any other view of downtown LA you could get from anywhere. There's also another upper level you can walk up to that has another bar, some outdoor seating and a view as well.Overall, the crowd is late 20's to early 30's, definitely not your standard 21 year old Belasco crowd.....so a little bit classier I guess? But overall my friends and I had a decent time. Unfortunately, we came the Saturday right before Christmas so it was SO EMPTY.  I talked to one of the bar tenders and he said: Normally you should try to get in before 10 pm on a weekend because otherwise a line starts forming. OR, MAKE A RESERVATION AND YOU CAN WALK RIGHT IN. Your reservation doesn't have to be for a table to eat dinner or anything. You can just make a reservation and just hang by the bar. So be sure to do that if you plan on coming on a busy night!!Nice place to enjoy a drink with a decent view. Wouldn't mind coming again!

Reviews.Author: Alyson L. K.
Reviews.Content: The rooftop bar:Waited 20 minutes to get to the top at 10:30pm. When I got there, the awaiting view was beautiful but it was cold and windy. It was also pretty sparsely populated. I don't understand why they want people to wait to get inside when there's no one there to begin with. We ordered an apple martini and a cucumber martini, and the  bartender said that they didn't have some type of liquor but promised it would taste better and boy, was he right. Had the BEST apple martini and cucumber martini, ever. I've had them everywhere but it was truly special. Get it!The food: The bouillabaisse, mac n cheese, truffle fries were delish! There is no lobster in the bouillabaisse (although the waitress asked the chef and confirmed that there would be chunks) but it was still very nice. The alcohol was expensive, every drink costed $12, even my miniature sized moscato. We also had whiskey on ice (they had no jack). The house cocktails called Lolita (grapefruit) and my fair lady (Hawaiian punch) tasted cheap and were disappointing. Like I said, get their cucumber or apple martinis. They're a little sweeter than usual but o so good.

Reviews.Author: Sarah J.
Reviews.Content: this place is nice, rooftop bar that overlooks downtown LA skyscrapers. beautiful view!HOWEVER, this place is sort of hard to get in because of all the lines. theres a line to get inside. try to come here BEFORE 10. lines not too bad. then you go up the elevator and perch is right there! BUT, to get to the rooftop, you have to wait in another line...once you get up there, its pretty, but there is only one bar and not that many places to seat. perfect on a date night though, to grab few drinks.

Reviews.Author: Aleni T.
Reviews.Content: If this is what downtown LA nightlife is like.......I'll definitely start ditching the comfort and convenience Hollywood (which I'm a resident of) and heading South on the 101 exiting Broadway! If you're like myself, and have gotten use to the rat race politics ratio game of Hollywood, you're in for quite a pleasant refreshing breath of fresh air.  Even the "Clipboard girl(s)" were FRIENDLY, INVITING, AND DOWN TO EARTH...thats when I knew I was no longer in "Kansas" anymore. The "positive" energy seemed to flow all throughout the bar...if the workers are happy, the patrons are too...and if the patrons are happy...a good time is inevitable. My only complaint...theres a line to go up to the roof, inwhich security seemed to be confused and not in sync as to where patrons can stand. I often found myself (and my group) getting shuffled around the bar depending on which security happened to walk by. Although I'm not 100% converted to DTLA, this definitely was a great start!tip: BOOK A RESERVATION FOR YOUR PARTY ON OPENTABLE.COM (advice from the clipboard girl herself)

Reviews.Author: Helena H.
Reviews.Content: Serious, Perch! Your service has got to get better than what my clients had just experienced.They wanted an atmosphere with a rooftop view. They wanted a nice simple dinner with drinks. What comes in mind? EVERY RESTAURANT IN THE WORLD. Ok, but in DTLA, we have a large number too. Perch is an amazing establishment, but but the way they treat their costumers just puts their service to shame. My client comes back from their experience from Perch with this story. They put their name down for a table for two. Decided to sit at the bar while they waited to grab a drink and maybe an appetizer. As they were half way through their drinks, they realized the one appetizer still hasn't arrived. Brought the attention to the bartender and 30 mins later, the dish was brought to them by the manager. Manager apologized for the wait of their dish...then added (and this is what really upset me), told them that the owner's friends were their, and they had to priorities to them!WTH? Are you kidding me? Please don't ever say that to a paying costumer that they are any less important to the owner's people! That was a dumb move. Then not even comping this dish, which probably cost no more than $15. When my clients decided to leave, he stopped by the hostess stand and asked if she got to (name) table yet. She stated that it was going to be about an hour wait. It was 3 hours later after they had came into Perch! Very disappointing.If it wasn't for friends who plan their birthdays here, I would probably not even step foot in there, unless it's during the weekday when they don't have a line of people waiting to get in and then another line to get up to the roof.

Reviews.Author: Amanda L.
Reviews.Content: The ambience is great.  If you are on a romantic date or a place with a view it is great.  The food and drinks are a bit pricey. I wasn't impressed w/ the size of the plates of food for 15 dollars.  I definitely recommend making a reservation on Open Table or call because otherwise, it can be hard to get a table.  Even w/ a reservation, we were definitely very close to our neighbors.  A bit too close if you want to have a private conversation, this isn't the place.  I finally went up to the rooftop (though the bar was closed) to get a better look and see what all the hype is about. I had been there twice before and the fire marshall had been called twice due to being over max capacity and lines up the stairs to check it out. It's a cool view, but you can see it something very similar from the main area.  *Go there from drinks, but there's better food w/ more pizzazz and bang for your buck!

Reviews.Author: La Tache W.
Reviews.Content: After a previous review, we went back for Sunday brunch. I had the crab Benedict and my husband had the salmon Benedict. Both were delicious.It was a beautiful day, so it was a perfect spot! I am glad we went back and had a meal instead of just beers and a snack. The place is a little pricey, don't expect to go there and spend less than $50 for 2 people sans alcohol.

Reviews.Author: Grace C.
Reviews.Content: View is awesome, bottle of vino is always good. Sit by the fireplace, or lounge around in the rooftop~Will go back sometime in the future to enjoy dtla nights with a drink~ahhhh btw not getting brie cheese app tho~ it didn't meet up to my expectation~ the cheese was engulfed in crostini~ and I didn't enjoy it at all~ should be separated in my opinion~ makes it more enjoyable with glass of wine. But that's just my two cents~

Reviews.Author: Ty S.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this spot!  Went early-evening on a Friday after work --- mainly to experience the sun setting (accenting the unobstructed view), while having dinner.You truly feel like you're in another world after stepping off the elevator and entering.  Can't wait to come again when the live band is in action.Ambiance -- 5/5Service -- 5/5Food -- 4/5 (wish the selection was a bit bigger)Pricing -- 4/5Overall experience -- 4/5

Reviews.Author: Christopher Y.
Reviews.Content: Brunch ReviewRooftop, rooftop, rooftop.  That's the name of the game in LA and Perch has done a fantastic job with this venue.  Rooftop!Highlights:- The service is unbelievably good here.  I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was super friendly, super knowledgeable and very pleasant.  Couldn't have asked for  any better.- The setting here is exquisite.  The outdoor patio has views that face South as well as West and if you are fortunate enough to sit in the side corner of the patio, views to the East as well.- Fantastic menu.  Everything from a fresh fruit platter to charcuterie and cheese plates for appetizers.  A delicious burger with a huge chunk of beef, crab benedict and delicious fresh oysters from the oyster man dude were all very tasty.  A full dozen oysters will run you $28 which isn't bad at all and they have a variety of selection to choose from.  - This isn't a bottomless mimosa joint, but they do serve bubbly by the bottle which on the surface sounds like it can get kind of pricey.  Fear not.  They offer everything from a $12 bottle of Pol Clement brut to a very reasonably priced bottle of Moet for $88.  Orange Juice is an extra $5 on the side.But overall I come here for the atmosphere which is absolutely amazing.  You won't be disappointed.TIP: Perch is located on the 15th floor, but the first floor elevator only goes up to 13.  Go up to 13 first and head straight out of the elevator to the second one which goes to 15.

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: Warning...the rooftop doesn't open until 3PM.The restaurant is ok.  The fries were good and then our waiter disappeared on us...Love the view, but you gotta be on the rooftop.  The restaurant doesn't give you anything much at all.

Reviews.Author: Yi Z.
Reviews.Content: I had to leave my Century City job early to make it to Perch for Happy Hour. Let me tell you, it was not worth it. Not only did I have to pay $5 for parking, the appetizers on the menu were so overpriced.  Everything was at least $6 and the baked brie (wrapped in puff pastry) was smaller than the size of my palm.  The bruschetta came with four tiny crostinis. Hello, that's not a good deal!  My French 64 drink, luckily, was a better buy.  I'm definitely glad I finally got to check out the amazing view. This is the type of place you bring an out-of-towner to impress them and that's all it's good for.

Reviews.Author: Michael V.
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, I like it more for the bar scene.  We were there for dinner and had a good time.  The service was excellent but the food is just ok.

Reviews.Author: marissa m.
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I went in on a Friday night, she checked in for a table for four at 7:21pm. We didn't get seated until 9:45pm, and that was after two of our friends had to leave (from starvation) and I went up to the front to tell them for the second time it was just two of us. The gentleman sat us right away as he felt bad we had been waiting for over two hours. I believe he was in charge, he was also scolding the other two girls as I firmly believe they did not know what the hell they were doing. They were still holding tables for people who were late and/or hadn't shown up. Then we sit, order our drinks with one waitress, then another waitress takes our order. We probably didn't see our waitress again (bus boys brought out food) until we asked one of the servers to go find her so we could pay the bill. We could not wait to get out of there. It was crowded with a really random mix of people. The food was amazing, but I can't tell you if it was genuinely delicious if it was just good because we were starving and waited three hours for it.I would not choose to ever go there again unless its an off-peak hour..and with a reservation.Terrible customer service, completely organized-not worth it at all to me. There are sooooo many other cool places to go downtown that are just as amazing that have their shit together. The view was great as well but again, not worth it to me.

Reviews.Author: Amahree E.
Reviews.Content: PERCH LAAmuse-gueules...    Move over Happy Hour and make room for Aperitif hour at Perch, people! I  mean it! Before leaving for New York City, last week I had the pleasure of indulging in the Pershing Square establishment...its ambiance... its décor...the entourage and last but not least...the company (my date:)   Rather than your  "typical" dinner/supper date routine , I wanted to really break  away from the mold this time and get creative.  That's where aperitif  hour  (4pm-6pm) came in. Needless  to say, we were both pleasantly surprised with the results. Personally, I've never been to Paris but she has and she was quick to point out that Perch did indeed remind her in many ways of several of the old bistros she frequented as an exchange student. Think  " A LA BICHE AU BOIS"... " LE BARATIN" or " LE PANTRUCHE"- All BISTRO staples in La Ville-Lumiere." This is a testament to Perch's  distinct and eclectic style. A mixture of chic, yet dull-colored furniture, exuberant light fixtures enveloped in a backdrop of LA skyscrapers...   Seeing as my date felt soooo  comfortable in her surroundings- I asked her to order for the both of us. No harm in that. I thought that  their selection of hors d'oeuvres was excellent so  one could do no  wrong with whatever choice  was taken. She chose:1) BAKED BRIE- Someone once told me that brie goes best with a glass of Pinot Noir. Try it with the Merlot  at Perch.2) PERCH FROMAGE PLATE- Fromage is French for cheese as in a selection of 3 cheese delicacies served to perfection.3) PERCH CHARCUTERIE PLATE- Best prosciutto/ prosciutto-mix I've had in a fine dining establishment. Mais a chacun/chacune son gout. To each his own.   FYI. I've already made dinner reservations for next month . See you again in a few weeks Perch!  My new hot spot!-tigre

Reviews.Author: Lyndsay T.
Reviews.Content: I recently moved downtown and had to check out Perch since I heard it had a great view and live music. Went with a small group of friends around 8pm. We made reservations and were seated right away. Chris was our server and he was great! Made some awesome recommendations and was super fun and helpful since we had never been there. We ordered the pork belly, baked Brie and mussels all to share. All delicious! For entrees I had the chicken with a mushroom risotto. And for dessert had the bread pudding. Will definitely be back soon! Thanks Chris!

Reviews.Author: Raina B.
Reviews.Content: Alright Perch, I give you best rooftop in LA. You get all these stellar reviews due to that for sure. I didn't have a full fledged meal, just some apps and wine but definitely enjoyed myself.Came here on a Thursday happy hour (Apéritif hour) and it was great. Not too crowded, got a wonderful plushy seat next to the window. It was one of those rare days where it was pouring in LA so the patio was closed off. Had some wine and small bites (see below) and had a pleasant afternoon with my friend.- Heirloom Tomato Bruschetta - Good, but pretty basic. You can make this at home.- Truffle Mac n Cheese - It doesn't matter who makes it, this dish is always amazing. WANT. SOME. NOW.- Mini Hotdogs - I didn't try these but my friend enjoyed em.** I did almost come back here a few weeks later for their weekend night scene and the line took foreva. I ended up getting out of line to go elsewhere so something to keep in mind for those of you looking at Perch for nightlife.

Reviews.Author: Les L.
Reviews.Content: Although there are roofs on every building in Downtown LA, there are far fewer rooftop bars.  This one is actually quite nice, a simple rooftop, some seating, striking glass walls providing for an unobstructed view of Pershing Square, and cocktails served in old-fashioned champagne glasses.  It was a pleasant place to hang out with friends and have a few drinks.  The old-fashioned champagne glasses hooked me - and I ordered the My Fair Lady - quinoa vodka, craberry, creme de peche.  It was fruity, girly, pink and was the precise type of drink that made you think you were drinking juice and not alcohol.  The only difficulty is that your friends may not be up there with you.  Perch is pretty hard to get into past 9 pm.  When we arrived, there was no real wait downstairs outside the building but that wasn't true when we left.  Not too long later, the line was 100 people long.  Once inside, you ride an elevator to the 13th floor, switch elevators, and ride up to the 15th floor.  The 15th floor is charming.  That's where the restaurant is and you literally feel like you've spilled into a French brassiere.  The decor, the French music, the waitstaff's uniforms, it's very carefree, bustling and elegant.  Did I mention, that's not where the rooftop bar is?  Just so you  know, eating at the restaurant is no shortcut for getting up to the roof.  Behind the bar on the 15th floor is a staircase leading to the 16th floor.  A stuffy, well-guarded staircase where a security guard lets no one in, if no one leaves.  He's pretty serious and I didn't see anyone get in based on short dresses, pretty faces, batted eyelashes, or the offer of money.  At 9:15, we waited about 45minutes in that hot, air-less, congested staircase to finally be let up onto the rooftop Perch bar but some of the party were too far back in those multiple layers of lines.  It's like the Inception of lines. After a awhile, we abandoned the pretty views at Perch for a venue where everyone could get in without waiting.  It is a place where timing matters a great deal and can be very much a lot of trouble.

Reviews.Author: Ness P.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to check this place out on a Fri night. Parking was easy! $6 right across the street. We got there around 1030pm and noticed there was a line outside as we were parking. At first we we thought it was going to be a long wait, but by the time we got to the building there was no line at all! I loved the atmosphere! Drinks were about the same price as if you were to buy drinks at a club. $12 for grey goose and pineapple. And it was strong!Great place to just mingle, catch up with friends, or just enjoy the scenery with your significant other. I'd definitely go again.

Reviews.Author: Jane S.
Reviews.Content: This was definitely a mezze-mezze experience. Yes, Perch was brought to you by the people who started the Must, but the Must girls moved on and so did a sense of hospitality, it seems--at least by a handful of folks who work there. It's a shame because they kind of ruined what could have otherwise been a great night. I arrived on time for my table, but my friend didn't. Didn't matter much because our table wasn't ready. Fine. No problem. I'll just wait at the bar. "Great, we'll come and get you when your table is ready." That's where our fun begins, folks. Seems like my party of one kinda overwhelmed the bar staff because, even though three of them had plenty of time to gossip about patrons and other staff, they didn't have time to help me out. I get it: You're busy. That happens. But I'd say that at any reasonable bar they at least acknowledge you, tell you it'll be a minute, or--if they're not on duty--tap the shoulder of a fellow bartender. I was freakin' invisible. AND THIRSTY. And bored. After waiting patiently for a FULL 12 minutes to be in the rotation (I timed that whizz), I pipped up. I got a flick of an eye from one tender, and was promptly ignored. I will say there was one fun read-headed bartender that was working her tail off at the other end of the bar. I wished I'd sat in Red's section, but instead I was stuck with three idiots who were so busy talking about themselves they couldn't get me a damn water. After a few more minutes, the guy whose eye I caught tapped the shoulder of an unworthy ice princess, (tall, skinny, model-reject with a scowl that's going to freeze that way) who sauntered her way over. Clearly I was bothering her daydreams of an acting career failed, because it took her 20 minutes to make my stupid drink. Honey, you're not the Auguste Rodin of mixology. Don't act like you are and don't take all night to make your masterpiece when it's a two-liquor drink that's on the menu.When I finally got my (too sweet) drink, my friend had arrived and we decided to check in on our table. Sadly, the dizzy hostess I first checked in with completely forgot about me and gave away our table. "I thought you left." I was waiting at the bar like I told you I would, darling. Now did you go off and spend all of your I.Q. points at Sephora? Then, with a long-overdue eye roll, stepped our savior. He's the adorable maitre d:  Short, black, dapper, and wears fantastic specs. He promptly cleaned things up, got us a table... then stepped over a few minutes later to ask us if we'd like to move, because the best seat in the house had just opened up. You kinda get the impression this guy is the unofficial "cleanup" guy, who bitch slaps the other idiots in the back. I hope he takes the bar tending Anne Boylen out back and gives her a good beheading. From then on, our night went well. Our waitress was DELIGHTFUL. The food was decent: I got a fish that was nice (while nothing spectacular), while my friend got an amazing pork-belly special. The chef really needs to give a tutorial to some other LA joints, because the pork belly was kinda perfection This was my third time at Perch and I'd recommend always getting a special. I feel like their on-menu items are always *good* but nothing I crave, but the chef really comes alive with his or her specials. After dinner we had originally planned to go to the rooftop bar, and our waitress urged us to do so. In the end, however, we decided to end the night on a high note by psychically telling the bartenders (minus the cool redhead) sayonara. You don't want to serve me? I don't want your mediocre drinks anyway. Don't you know the Varnish is a quick walk down the street? You might want to think about that and step things up. I'll take my cocktail business, and my tendency to over-tip when overjoyed, elsewhere.
Reviews.Author_Location: Griffith Park/Los Feliz, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Sarah D.
Reviews.Content: Went her for dinner the first time. Sadly the fried brie with raspberry dip and the Cordon Bleu Poppers are no longer on the menu - new Chef! So I was bummed about that. Got the baked brie to make up for it - comes with this awesome mustard and was all really delicious.Fine but wouldn't get again:- Frog Legs- Truffle FriesGood would order again:- Caesar Salad - Ahi TunaDelicious must orders:- Lamb Burger sliders- BRUSSELS SPROUTS!! HOLY CRAP! Hands down the best brussels sprouts I've had in my life. I am obsessed with them and order them everywhere and this place does them the best. Its the sweet soy and sesame, there is bacon but  I didn't notice it and it didn't matter.

Reviews.Author: JFong Y.
Reviews.Content: Perch is a great place for regular dining.  However, when it comes to hosting a party, Perch is extremely limited with option.  Patio has limited capacity, with an extremely unreasonable minimum charge.  Any party over 8 people has to have a pre-fixe menu with very limited option.  Tables were set extremely tight with hardly any elbow room.  The entire patio area was supposed to be reserved for our "private" party, however, other guests and even their live band people just came in and sat at the fire pit area for a good portion of the night.  How can this happened after we spent $2500?Cost per head is $125!  Perch is not a place for anyone to host a dinner party of 8 or more.  Extremely disappointing!

Reviews.Author: Morgan P.
Reviews.Content: Come for the view! The rooftop bar is nice if you don't mind the outrageous prices for drinks ($16 for a martini? And you MEASURED the gin? Absurd). Also, the bartenders and waiters seem a bit ... uninformed. For instance, I asked for a Beefeater martini one day and the waitress had no idea what Beefeater was. I also noticed that the bartender didn't put any vermouth in the martini (that's not a martini), and so I asked for some and she acted like I was speaking Swahili. Not a hard request. That's what a martini is.The food (I've only had brunch) is okay, but also quite overpriced. I had the omelet, which was a standard $12 omelet. I tasted some of my friend's filet (way undercooked) and my other friend's benedict (eggs also undercooked). I will do my damnedest not to come back, but I think some of my friends like this place so it may be inevitable.

Reviews.Author: Perfect E.
Reviews.Content: It gets 4 Stars for ambiance and 3 stars for food. You enter through an unimpressive building lobby and take two sets of elevators to reach the 15th floor .Goes well with the speakeasy ambiance you walk into. Very old school cigar bar looking inside area with old couches. The exterior was a well lit balcony with views of downtown . On a Tuesday night in early January I was able to overlook a festive ice skating rink and enjoy the outdoor fireplace. Went up the stairs to check out the rooftop bar, bar service was poor you had to get up to get anything but large seating area and lots of firepits. The Ginger beer was excellent with a shot of Jameson.Returned back down to dinner, the service was slow and menu was unimpressive. No soup one salad very minimal options.The best part of the meal was the appetizer, surf and turf kebabs these were amazing!! I shoulda ordered two for dinner at $18 each. Instead I opted for the short rib and got a fatty piece of overcooked 4oz rib, my friend ordered the steak and frites ... Fries were sogging and swimming in truffle oil yuck and steak was a cheap cut for $29. Moving on to dessert... Never got a drink refill by the way... Dessert menu was unimpressive opted for the Almond cake and got a 3 day old tasting stale cake..I would only return for drinks and hear the jazz band playing on Tuesday night . It was very romantic though especially if you can get a outdoor fireplace seat, slow dance in front of the band... Have after dinner drinks and maybe a late night kebab ahhhhhh young love

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Awesome view!! Very cool atmosphere and great for people watching.It's really crowded though. We ended up getting seated on the couch for dinner.Food was really good. I had the chicken and my fiancé had the escolar.I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: Lorena K.
Reviews.Content: Nice view from the rooftop. Ambiance was definitely nice but the food was mediocre. I ordered the flatiron steak with truffle fries. The steak was slightly undercooked and the fries had some kind of a coating that made it hard once it got cold. Overall the dish was ok for the price but nothing special that I'd remember. I'd only go back for the view and drinks.

Reviews.Author: Tom M.
Reviews.Content: Come For the Amazing City Views and Hip Crowd.Its probably a bit disconcerting when the best thing I can say about a restaurant is its view or clientel or the bar, but that's the case here.  But don't let their expensive so-so food scare you away, we take friends here all the time and they are amazed and have a great time. The view at night is pure Los Angeles skyline, of Bunker Hill.  It is breath taking.  The crowd is 20-30ish and quite hip.  Good bar, great selection and a strong pour.  The food is pretentious, trying to be fine dining without really bringing the goods.  Add to the displeasure is the fact that even if you have reservations, you'll wait for long periods of time, especially on the weekends.  A French restaurant is supposed to have lamb, usually lamb shanks or leg of lamb.  Not here.  They have short ribs, but are perpared bonless, so all the great marrow is not present.  Yeah, I know it takes extra time to cook them bone-in and then de-bone them--got it.  Personally, hit the place up after sunset, do a drink, look for your true love, and perhaps eat some french fries, and move on.

Reviews.Author: Juls C.
Reviews.Content: On the one hand, I really liked the beauty, intricacy and spirit of the Parisian interior room, it struck the right tone and is suave, definitely sexy.However, the bartender upstairs was snotty, snotty snotty and they tend to pick the genteel crowd, so if you're not dressed up to party, and instead come in office clothes, well, let's just say they prefer eye candy.Their food, well..was ok, standard French fare, no complaints. Not fine cuisine, but manageable and tasty.They had a martini cocktail list, which I found too sweet but some people prefer it.Wine list was good, however.To their credit, they served very quickly, and our waiter was professional, accommodating and courteous. Its a good space to be Tuesday nights, the band is fabulous, the interior familar and comfortable, I can recommend it with caution.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: I came here last night to celebrate a friend's birthday.  Parked at the parking lot across the street for $6!  Pretty good for DTLA.  Crossed the street, took the elevator up, and then ANOTHER elevator up, and arrived to a gorgeous view of city lights!!  I loved the atmosphere, comfy chairs/fire pits and the great company I had!  There are two levels for Perch.  The first one is the restaurant with an outdoor patio.  Not as much seating as the upper floor.  We eventually made our way up to the upper floor and was able to score a couple of chairs next to the fire pit.  HOORAY!  Drinks were good and not as expensive as I expected.  Got the birthday girl a couple rounds of drinks and chit chatted for the rest of the night.  We got here pretty early, around 9 PM and both floors were pretty filled.  By midnight, it was very crowded and the line for the ladies room was very, very long.  My only gripe is that one stall for a bunch of drunk girls is a pain.  At least the stall is roomy.  Large mirror - good for taking pictures :)My friends made the mistake of going down to the lower level and it took them at least an hour to get back up!  Supposedly their is a line if you want to come up to the upper level.  Definitely would come back for the great views and maybe try some food next time around!  Frog legs!

Reviews.Author: Richard W.
Reviews.Content: You get a 18ish floor rooftop view of downtown LA. Watch the ant-sized people ice skate at Pershing Square.You get people all dressed up around you.You get a LOT of people around you. The place is packed.You sit down quickly because you were smart and made a reservation.You enjoy their unique drink selection. Xingu Beer. Try it. Amazingness.You're girlfriend loves every second of it.Great night? Yes, great night.

Reviews.Author: Denny C.
Reviews.Content: Call me a debby downer.  Is this like one of three places to go out in LA?  Yes, you get a great view of Pershing Square, the ambiance is nice and memorable, and there are some good drinks, but I'm definitely not dying to go back anytime soon.I came here on a Friday night with a group of friends after a failed attempt at getting into the Edison.  The line to get in was out of control.  You'd think this was the only place to go out in downtown.  Thankfully, my friend knew some people and we were able to wait in a "special" line, getting in after only about 10 minutes or so.  Once we were in, I got a xingu beer and finished the night off with a shot of tequila.  The xingu beer (imported from Brazil) went down quite smoothly, and the shot was standard.  One of my friends really liked the Marie Antoinette; trying a sip of hers, I didn't think it was anything spectacular to write home about.  I should add that there's live music, too, doing interesting covers on some Top 40s.  It helps distract you from all the dressed up people awkwardly milling about.    Bottom line:  Maybe you thrive in an environment where it's super loud and crowded with hella people, the drinks are kinda expensive, and the views of the city are one of few redeeming things.  If that's your scene, more power to you and please come to Perch!  But feel free to count me out.

Reviews.Author: Jee H.
Reviews.Content: This review is for the lounge element, not the restaurant.  I have yet to eat there.  I've been here a few times and overall the experiences have been decent/good.  The decor and venue themselves are cool.  It has a sophisticated vibe you don't get in too many places in LA.  I like the upstairs open air rooftop area.  You get a 360 degree view of LA, the northern part.  It can get busy/crowded on the weekends and I'm not a fan of the line that sometimes appears.  The drinks are somewhat pricey/in line with what you'd expect from a place like this.  Worth checking out if there isn't a line.

Reviews.Author: Joseph H.
Reviews.Content: Perch has got some serious style... and we didn't even go the rooftop bar. Came here for dinner and it takes 2 elevators to get to the floor for dining. Vaulted ceilings with low lighting set the standard. We also sat in a small table facing most of the restaurant and bar. Nice lounge chairs instead of dining chairs at our particular table. A basic heirloom tomato salad to start. Salmon for the main dish. Solid entree along with a few bites of risotto from Rachel's plate. The only downside was the dessert. The bread pudding was a bit dry and came out piping hot. As we stepped outside on our way to catch a flick, a massive line had formed to get in. Next time, I'll head up to the rooftop.

Reviews.Author: Momo B.
Reviews.Content: I took my family who was visiting from out of town to this wonderful place. The food was delicious! We couldn't stop talking of how tasty everything was. Good food, plus amazing view, PLUS and amazing modern blues band playing?? Thank u for making me look good infront of my peeps! ;)

Reviews.Author: Justin L.
Reviews.Content: Nice rooftop bar (2nd floor) of the bar/restaurant. It reminds me of the rooftop bars in SD. Decent drinks...they do good craft drinks (i.e. not your typical club AMFs and Long Islands)...Tip: You need to take 2 separate elevators to get to the bar.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer M.
Reviews.Content: Something about rooftop bars yells "pretentious", and that's exactly what I was for the night I was at Perch. It was nice nonetheless though. They have two rooftops, one lower one that has more seating, etc. and an upper roof that is more standing-area and a bar (no food can be ordered at the top one). Service was all right. Drinks were all right, and the food was that as well, but a tad overpriced. Tried the pastry with brie and the truffle fries. May be a good idea to make reservations here if you're coming on the weekend.

Reviews.Author: Francine L.
Reviews.Content: Perch you are an awesome venue a little bit hard to find but if you get confused from taking the elevators just follow the little bird and it will take you up to Perch. The amazing views of the Downtown city is amazing. I would say it is really worth it. When I went here it was at night around 8:00 P.M, I found street parking and walked to the building on Hill Street. It doesn't look like much but once you get on top it looks a whole lot cooler. For dinner I try to have light dinners if I go out and eat at a nice place and I wanted to get a salad. They didn't have that many options but each salad sounded soo amazing that it was really hard to choose which one I really really wanted to grub on. I ordered the Baby mixed green salad which was $11.00. The salad price wasn't at all bad the the portion was just right for me. I can see it being a little bit small for others so be careful if you are starving then I would not recommend just eating a salad. The baby mixed green salad came with pears, candied walnuts, red onions, maytag blue and balsamic vinaigrette. If you don't really like a lot of dressing on your salads I would let your server know to put it on the side for an even more healthier option. The service was very quick once we ordered our food didn't take that long to get onto our table. I enjoyed the salad I had and my friend enjoyed the chicken. We both ate our plates clean and enjoyed the nice city lights. Highly recommend getting a reservation and also taking your girl out for a nice dinner :)

Reviews.Author: jackie a.
Reviews.Content: I brought my fiancé here for his birthday dinner and we loved it! It was a great view at night with the city lights. The food was great! The cocktails were really good. The bar upstairs is really nice to just grab and drink and enjoy the city lights. We will def. go again

Reviews.Author: N B.
Reviews.Content: Last night was mine and my boyfriends first time at Perch and can say that we enjoyed ourselves very much. It's a nice place with a great view of downtown la. We also enjoyed the music the band was playing. The food was delicious! We ordered the pan roasted chicken supreme and the filet mignon with truffle fries..DELISH! I would have given this place 5 stars but the service wasn't great. I called in to make reservations for 9pm and the girl on the phone suggested 8:45, so I took it. We got there right on the dot (if not a couple minutes early) and they said there wasn't a table for us yet so we waiting by the bar (hungry). About 9:20 we got seated and ordered truffle fries to start with our drinks. The tables next to us got their fries and salads etc before us, being that they got seated after us. Our food took a while as well. I would go back hoping it was just a bad night of service and not like that on a day to day basis.  :)

Reviews.Author: Dylan M.
Reviews.Content: This place is actually pretty nice. The worst part is the wait to get in. Even though this is at the top/roof of the building, the line forms outside the front doors, so you're left waiting on the street before being let into the elevators.I haven't had the food, but I came here to meet with friends for birthday drinks. The vibe of the place is chill, and the view is GREAT. Not sure if everyone knows you can go up to an even higher tier once your inside, but it was a lot quieter and intimate upstairs.

Reviews.Author: Eric P.
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the view around sundown. Bar never seems to get too crowded and the prices aren't bad either. When the bartender runs out of Absinthe and tells you it's possible to make a sazerac without that key ingredient, he is lying. It tastes like crap.

Reviews.Author: Anita C.
Reviews.Content: This review is solely for a Saturday night out on the rooftop bar I kept hearing about this place and finally got the chance to go for a friends birthday. The most important warning I got from several friends from their experience at Perch is to get here as early as possible. If you arrive here after 10pm, you should probably take your pretty little toosh and go elsewhere (a friend of mine came around that time and ended up leaving because the line wasn't moving at all).My friends and I got here around 9:40pm and had to wait in line for a freaking hour!! Finally got to the front of the line and one of my friends friend tried to work his magic by tipping the bouncer $100 to get a group of us in on the spot..and even then we STILL had to wait for another 15 mins and split the group up because the rule is they can't let anyone up unless people leave. They take their max capacity here very seriously. We finally make it in to their dinner/bar area to my surprise isn't even the rooftop, you have to wait in ANOTHER LINE just to get up there -___- and again, the same concept, they won't let anyone up, unless people come down. Waited probably another 15-20 mins on the fucking staircases with absolutely NO air running through that area and basically sweating our faces off! FINALLY, we make it up there and with all that time spent WAITING in lines, I headed straight to the bar for a damn drink to only find out...YAY!! MORE LINES!!!! Another 10-15 mins wait to get to the bartender.The view from the rooftop was just okay for me (the standard + bona vista lounge has better view). Cute/classy setting, mellow music, and drinks were ok; bartender makes a mean Lemon Drop Martini (def recommended). Overall, was it worth the wait? not really. Would I come back? most likely not..but if you do, my advice is to come here by 9pm or earlier and if you come anytime after that...all I can say: ladies, wear comfortable shoes.

Reviews.Author: Anaïs B.
Reviews.Content: Delicious cocktail at perch ,ask for the "the French Maid" with Cognac Park VS!! Amazing! Thanks to Max the bartender! Beet salad well done too! Great music, bar and view of downtown!

Reviews.Author: Kunal B.
Reviews.Content: The only reason it's worth going to Perch is for the view. It's damn beautiful and very nice when you're overlooking DTLA sipping on a bourbon, great feeling.However that's about it. Lines are meh, somewhat packed, and drinks are overpriced. First time I have ever paid $13 for a Makers Mark neat. Most DTLA bars I've been to usually price it for $10 tops. Still would recommend Library Bar, Edison, or Takami. However it's worth a trip at least once because of the view.
Reviews.Author_Location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Christine K.
Reviews.Content: What's with the big hoopla about this place? Rooftop bars are a dime a dozen in LV, NYC, and SD but apparently a rare commodity in DTLA. Came here on a Saturday night and there was already a line at 9 PM (really?!) The bar did have great views of DTLA but not worth that hellacious wait most people had to endure. Drinks were bad and there wasn't a "hip/happening" vibe since no music was played. Seriously people, just go to another bar/lounge/whatever down the street and save your time/cash from this place. Totally not worth the hype this place gets. Next!

Reviews.Author: Thea G.
Reviews.Content: If you're wanting to do the roof thing and are looking for something a little more romantic and French than the Standard, look no further than Perch, which has two levels of gorgeous, outdoor, light covered, French music filled wonderfulness.It takes two separate sets of elevators to get to the top floor, sort of like how the Standard has that extra elevator - I'm pretty sure it's just in there to build the suspense. Then you enter the indoor area of perch, which is sort of like what I would imagine a very very fancy hotel lobby in Paris to look like (I mean this as a great compliment - the room is stunning). On this level, a more casual seating outdoor area, and on the very top level of Perch, what I assume to be more just for getting drinks/general romancing/troublemaking.The night I was there was Tuesday night, where they had free music on the very top level. When we went to the top level, there were great musicians lit by warm glowing lights and a painter, and someone doing something with mirrors - the artsy rooftop party I'm always looking for with all the right artsy people. Perch has a pretty incredible drink menu - I was lucky enough to try a Writer's Block (which I guess is one of the favorites) - Pear Vodka, Champagne, Lemon Juice, St. Germain. YUM! Now just hoping it cures my writer's block for real. But I'm writing this review, right?Oh gosh how I look forward to watching the sun set here over the skyline while nursing another Writer's Block! A wonderful place to take friends, impress a date, or allow photo opps for out of towners, all in one.

Reviews.Author: Jasleen A.
Reviews.Content: The worst service that I've ever had in my life. I went there for a birthday party and the waitress was, in no nicer words that I can find to describe her, a c u next tuesday. A lot of my friends came and left at different times, but she was peeved that people were getting drinks at the bar. She double charged us for things, making the bill about $80 more than it should have been. She included a tip for our party, which she DID NOT deserve. She also told me she was going to bring out a birthday drink for me, which she never did (not that I needed one from the bar, just don't make promises you can't keep). She told us we needed to order from her so "she could pay her rent." You and everyone else, waitress...Needless to say, I think she should be fired, and I refuse to go back because of the horrible, HORRIBLE service.

Reviews.Author: Arshag D.
Reviews.Content: A nice place for a drink, with a decent view.The drinks are decent.  I've heard the food is good but have not had it (yet).Good for hosting birthdays or other special occasions as well.The only annoying thing is waiting for the elevator to go upstairs, otherwise no complaints.

Reviews.Author: Cris G.
Reviews.Content: This place would have been perfect if they would have had a DJ playing on the rooftop. Otherwise, they were playing a mish mash of tunes over speakers.  Some speakers were way too close/too low to the seating areas, making conversation a bit difficult at times.  But of course, the more you drink, the louder you get so eventually you can ignore the music.  Great view!  Drinks were really good, and boy, they snuck up on you!  We didn't eat because there was a 2 hour wait for food (!!!!).  Not a bad place to go! Minus one star for the nasty cigar smoke that seemed to be following us around until we finally found a spot that was not infiltrated.  Cigar smoke just has a potent, sickening smell that is no bueno.

Reviews.Author: Melanie K.
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say, I have heard many great things about this place and I really, REALLY wanted to like it. Let me break it down.I made a reservation to this restaurant for my birthday brunch with one of my girlfriends. After so much hype and talk about (due to the reviews) I was pumped  up to have a great dining experience.I have to comment that the view of the city is really what you're paying for. It was beautiful and especially on a nice sunny day like yesterday, you could see for miles. There's no place like LA. Anyway, we were seated outside and a gentleman brought us water, like most places do.We sat around for about 20 minutes without any server coming to see if we wanted appetizers, tea or coffee, etc. Being hungry, and could no longer wait around, going unnoticed, I personally had to flag someone down to even get our server. Apparently we weren't in their "station," so we had to wait for the server in ours. After receiving our appetizer, we asked to be moved indoors because the wind was picking up and we were getting chilly. That was no problem, then when we were seated inside we got our entrees, but our server was no where to be seen. It felt like she was MIA. During our entire dining experience, we probably saw our server 3 times - 2 of which I had to flag her down. With service this poor, my friend and I even contemplated about leaving without paying, just to see if our server would notice we were gone. Obviously we did not do that, but the tip definitely reflected the service that was provided.Like I said before, I have read so many reviews on this place about the atmosphere and really wanted to like this place. I think the best part of it was the view and I'm sure it would be even better at night. Honestly though, it was just plain bad. I think regardless of the amount of money I spent to enjoy an "elevated resting place", I think I left more stressed out than ever. I do not think I will be coming back here anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Sara C.
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was in my own BATMAN RETURNS movie. Where I'm having fine dining with the love of my life (who is batman), with the view of Gotham city (eerie yet romanitc), on top of a building.And then someone tries to kidnap me so Batman flies down the balcony (where the outdoor restaurant is) and saves the day while I continue to eat my skirt steak w/ cocktail in hand.Yeahhh... that was my experience. You'll feel like you aren't in downtown LA, or even in california....I loved this place.

Reviews.Author: Lauren L.
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: This place used to be cool. ....until it got popular. Seriously, on weekends, it's basically a rat pack! There are so many people squishing to get into the place. There's even a line to get upstairs to the rooftop. Whaat???I first came up here when it opened up, and it was seriously so sparse and airy with people mingling, walking around, enjoying the beautiful downtown LA skyline. You can't really do that anymore because it's become a pony show with people dressed to impress, as if it's a club. Not cool. I mean, i'm glad it's doing well, but it needs more crowd control and better service too, especially if you're allowing so many folks in there.

Reviews.Author: Jenn C.
Reviews.Content: Pencillin and Truffle Poutine fries were bomb, the view is beautiful, and i guess the people were beautiful too? Everyone was super dressed up, but I don't think there's a dress code since I wasn't dressy and they didn't turn me away haha.  Park in the Pershing Square parking lot; it's nearby and they have a flat rate of $16 (yes... it's steep... but if you plan on getting partying the entire night away until you're sober again, it's worth it).

Reviews.Author: Amy F.
Reviews.Content: Went here with my girlfriend. Yes the view is gorgeous. Drinks are fine. It's crowded so it  was very difficult to find seating....you basically have to hover around like a vulture and nab a seat when the group looks like they are about to leave (that's any popular bar/lounge in DTLA). It'd be nice if the music was more happenin' but oh well, nice place to chill with friend or on a romantic date.

Reviews.Author: Dennis Y.
Reviews.Content: Perch has everything going for it.  Its has a gorgeous view of Pershing Square and the rest of downtown LA; it has an awesome upper rooftop bar with amazing starry night experiences; and it has a great staff that makes your experience fun for sure.  The drinks are creative and original and fits the 20's decor of the place.  This place is definitely a fun place to bring friends and a date.  The menu is French inspired and is somewhat limited.  Been here twice and had sampled a bunch of the dishes on the menu.  From Steak Frites, to the mussels, to the tuna tar tar and the buffalo sliders.  Nothing spectacular but nothing bad either.  Definitely a must try place in downtown LA.  Especially if you want a great view.

Reviews.Author: Connie L.
Reviews.Content: Had a client meeting here and it offered a great view, relaxed environment and a pretty good hamburger. Would not mind having more business meetings here.

Reviews.Author: Leslie K.
Reviews.Content: I've been here 3 times in the past month and I don't know why I can't get enough of this place. It's probably cause of the phenomenal LA view both during the day and night time. The brunch is alright. A bit pricey for how average the food was but really, you don't come to this place for anything but the view. I had the crab cake benedict which was decent and the truffle cheese fries were actually pretty good. I think the best deal for brunch was the $20 pitcher of sangria and you can't beat the live music. Definitely one of my favorite spots in LA so far.

Reviews.Author: Ryan S.
Reviews.Content: Ambience - PerfectLocation - BeautifulJazz - greatService - Left some to be desired.  Got so bad that the couple next to us dined and ditched.  Waitress seemed to disappear for what seemed like hours, and offerend no apology for her tardiness to anyone.Other that than great Sunday afternoon bruch spot.  Can't speak for the nightlife, but for a pretty Sunday afternoon in LA...there are worse places.

Reviews.Author: Clara L.
Reviews.Content: Dirty glasses, rude  waitresses, unprofessional/sloppy/hates her life bartender, low quality crowd...The view is still deserving of one star.The food is whatever, drinks not worth mentioning...more for newbies from the west side or OC or Oklahoma who don't care so much about good food and great service as much as being as "LA" as possible, whatever that means. These hipster for-the-moment Downtown bars never stay good for long.

Reviews.Author: Anne D.
Reviews.Content: Perch is easily one of my favorite places in LA. I've only been here a couple of times on a week night, so I never had a problem getting in, never had to deal with lines, or a crowded elevator. It's a nice relaxing and romantic spot in Downtown LA for drinks and conversation. I much prefer this than The Standard if you're looking for rooftop bar in LA. It's more intimate and the vibe is just way better. The view is impressive and it's a nice place to go to on your first date (or any dates really). Get cozy in front of the bonfire outside and just admire the pretty city lights. Now for the drinks, seems like some people are saying it's not strong enough, watered down, etc. Well, I'm a light-weight so whatever drink I had was strong enough for me. I was just pretty bummed that they didn't have any Patron and pineapple for me though.

Reviews.Author: Marie J.
Reviews.Content: After 4 visits to Perch, I'm ready to write a review...I've gone here during different days and times.  Saturday at 6pm, Sunday during brunch and on late on weekdays.  I've always had a great time, sipped on really tasty cocktails (my favorite is the Irish Maid) and was never annoyed by having to wait for the elevators to ride up or stand around on the roof because it was never for that long.  I think the best time to go is during brunch.  But be smart and make a reservation in advance. I saw groups of people come in right before me who an hour later were still waiting for a table while we leisurely sipped champagne, munched on food and nodded our head to the beats from the live band they had playing.  Don't be those people.  Call ahead and plan your perfect Sunday!   Special shout out to the band which was excellent.  They played jazzy versions of different popular songs and really put us all in a great mood.  I guess my only complaint (i know, here is goes) is how incredibly drunk some people get there. Like face plant on the floor in a tiny skirt drunk.  Not a good look ladies.  Unless you were one of the creepy guys that saw their opportunity and swooped in to help those girls up off the floor and most likely into their bed later.  Not a good look for those types of guys either.

Reviews.Author: Sako P.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a friend's birthday for dinner and drinks. Ambiance : definitely a hit, the interior is really nice, filled with tables, couches, pictures of famous French people, and of course the outside patios offer an amazing view of downtown LA. The only thing I would say is that they sat us ( party of 10) at a table that was obviously too small for our party. So it was a bit tight and an awkward seating arrangement. Probably not a good place for a large dinner group. Most of the tables seemed more for 2-4 people, so that seems like the best size if you are gonna sit down and eat. Service: again, no problem here. All of our waiters were kind and friendly, though a bit clumsy. They knocked over the little lamps on our tables ( with actual burning candles ) over twice and dropped numerous knives and forks several times. However, I think this had more to do with the awkward and tight seating that I mentioned previously. Food: hit and miss. I tried some of the ahi tuna tartare, the Mac and cheese, shortrib, steak and fries, and bouillabaisse. As well as the crème brûlée and a pudding for desert. My short rib was amazing, very tender and juicy and extremely flavorful. The bouillabaisse was solid and the steak and fries got positive remarks from my friends. However, the tartare was not so great, I love tuna tartare and there was just something off about the one here. The Mac and cheese, maybe due to the bacon fat or something, was just not good. I love bacon everything but I think it just maybe was too much in this Mac and cheese, it was just too greasy. The deserts were just terrible. The bread pudding was just awful.Drinks: Their wine and beer menus leaves much to be desired. Though I love the inclusion of La Goudale (vive le nord!), their beer selection and the prices attached to them is a joke. The few different cocktails that we tried were good, namely writers block.Overall I give it three stars since this place is definitely somewhere to visit, though definitely go with a not too large group and maybe skip dinner and just drinks and snacks. The view is a perfect reason to go and the prices are comparable to other similar bars/lounges.

Reviews.Author: Travis R.
Reviews.Content: Only commenting on the bar scene.  Met some friends up here for a small reunion kind of deal from Chicago.  Main floor was packed and the tables were too close the main bar which was a mob scene.  Outdoor seating is the most beautiful in LA so far as I have seen.We spent most of our night upstairs on the roof deck which was bananas and way more roomy.  Service was fast and friendly.  I heard the food is good but didn't eat so I cant comment.

Reviews.Author: Jon S.
Reviews.Content: La-ti-da! This fine establishment doesn't allow shorts inside! Nevermind that it's Southern California and hot! But this only appplies to men. As the doorman to this dumphole was telling me "no shorts"he happily greeted a hoochie in daisy dukes.

Reviews.Author: Patrick L.
Reviews.Content: Definitely the BEST rooftop bar in Los Angeles.  The Standard has nothing on this particularly cause you have to pay to get in on weekends.  But the PERCH has a great vibe, with two floors on the roof as well as live music (they played MJ on the night we went).  Some of the PROS:  Great view, awesome/strong drinks, awesome decor.  The bouncer was awesome too...cracked several jokes to keep us entertained in line when we were waiting.Some of the CONS:  Long line!  there's a line to 1) get into bar on the roof and ANOTHER line to get into 2) the roof on top of the roof!  But regardless, it was a great experience and I would definitely come back.   ALSO, it gets CROWDED.  a lot of 20-30's here, even some cranky older drunk folk.  Other than that, Perch is definitely an experience, and a must-try if you are in LA.  You get a great view right smack in DTLA of places like Pershing Square.  It DOES get cold though, so bundle up!  Oh and don't dress like a slob.

Reviews.Author: Jake T.
Reviews.Content: Service is great, view is excellent, and the food is good not great. If you wanna eat outside dress warm, they also provide blankets which is cool. The drink menu is alright seems like it needed more complex options I am picky with drinks though. However the decor is perfect, fits that old classic time period of LA.On to the food, definitely get the frog leg appetizer, first time eating this and I LIKE IT! Lamb chop special for winter holidays was very good, seasoned right, and paired very nicely with the saffron rice. Blacked swordfish was a little dry for my likes, but not bad. Paired with the chive mash potato puree with lobster chunks, they definitely are not cheap on the lobster! As you sift through the potato puree you will be amazed on the size of lobster parcels found in it like a buried treasure. Desert: CHOCOLATE POT DE CREME - was very good, like a rocky road pudding with delicious seasonal berries. For pics check my blog @ pouredneat.blogspot.comCheck please...

Reviews.Author: Siao J.
Reviews.Content: Been here at various times through early evening, late night, week night, weekend.. and folks, this is an absolutely wonderful bar.  I knew it was going to be good because the ladies who run this place used to run Must Bar and that was such a downtown gem.  But before I talk more positively about this place, I have to rant a bit about some of the negative reviews here.  This is LA, there are mega millions of people here, and while this place is only two stories.. it's only so big!  If you're going to come on a late weekend night, it IS going to be packed and way full.  You can't hold that against the restaurant/bar-- it's going to be like that at any poppin' place you go whether it's a club in Hollywood, lining up for the new iPhone, or even just trying to a reservation at a popular restaurant last minute on a Friday night.  Now, the lower floor does serve food and reservations are highly suggested.  But that's a great thing, you actually have space to lay out a little bit, relax and enjoy a good conversation.  The staff here has always been friendly, and no one can really argue about the views.  Spectacular and truly a treat in downtown.  Being a French themed place, you can surely expect a variety of cognac inspired cocktails, but they do carry a pretty decent selection of other spirits.  One of the few places in town where you can find the Johnnie Double Black (a personal fav of mine).  To really enjoy this place to fullest, try to come on a weekday.  Late evening is good.  Came here last night as and the rooftop was the perfect place to enjoy the great outdoor weather, but also have some good places to sit and enjoy an intimate conversation.  It's really nice not having to shout at through your lungs to chat.  Didn't get a chance to stick around for it, but it looks like they have some live music on the roof later on Tuesday nights.  Definitely is rapidly becoming a good regular week night spot!

Reviews.Author: Tamara W.
Reviews.Content: I give Perch 3.5 stars because of the awesome view and ambiance. The staff is nice but a bit unorganized. I called a week ahead and made reservations for my boyfriend's birthday. I also, followed up the day before and reminded them that this was a birthday dinner and requested a nice table. Unfortunately, when we got there we had to wait and the hostess didn't seem to be aware of the birthday celebration. We ended up getting seated outside near the window quite close to another couple. We requested to be moved somewhere a bit more intimate, which they accommodated. Dinner and drinks were solid, however I think Perch is really better for drinks and appetizers than dinner. I've also been here during happy hour while live music was played on the patio and that was quite nice. Nice place to bring an out of town guest for drinks.

Reviews.Author: Sing Y.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place. This is my go to place for a lounge hang out with friends.  Location: Far enough from the heart of LA that parking is not too much of a hassle.  Usually when I get there at around 9pm, I get adequate parking on the street.Ambience: GORGEOUS! Since this place is located on the 16th floor you get an amazing view of downtown Los Angeles.  It is an amazingly beautiful place! I would definitely recommend you to go with a friend, a date, or for a celebration! :)  They have great indoor and outdoor seating.  Not a club place, if you are looking for dancing.

Reviews.Author: Jolene C.
Reviews.Content: Came for brunch and the view! It's a great place to hang out with friends and relax.  Came on a Saturday for brunch. We ordered the baked brie, the pastry was good, the brie was good, the apple slaw was good - it was just good! I had the crab benedict, the egg was poached to perfection, such that the yolk just oozes out - delicious! Ordered a pitcher of the sangria, that was good. The second order of drinks in the group was the mon petit cheri, my fair lady, and the light and balmy.  All of the drinks were good, I really enjoyed the light and balmy, and the spiciness of the mon petit cheri more. The my fair lady was a tad sweet for my liking. I would come back again on a Sunday for brunch because oysters are on the menu for Sunday!

Reviews.Author: Deme M.
Reviews.Content: One of the worst dinning experiences ever. The Maitre d was one of the rudest French snobs that I've ever came in contact with. I will go back but I'm def giving that guy the finger.

Reviews.Author: Jeff H.
Reviews.Content: Perch is one of those venues where it's difficult to review since there's a variety reasons for riding the rickety elevators up to the bird's roost.Brunch Review only Finally got around to trying brunch here. I was a bit wary after reading so many complaints about the food here. Still the thought of soaking in the glorious LA weather on a rooftop while sating Sunday morning gastronomic cravings and bragging about it on social media -- irresistible to any Asian scenester. The oysters were fresh and 3 types available. They were just fine. None were briny. A smidgen under $3/each if you order a half dozen.The mushroom spinach omelet was decent. I like Urth Cafe versions better at about the same price. The accompanying potatoes were forgettable.Crab cakes. Expensive at $22, you'd expect to enjoy these. Nope. They were moist hush puppies and bland. Filler to crab meat ratio was in con territory. My chef friend noted the hollandaise was improperly prepared via Facebook.They had a lot of waitstaff on hand to deliver food, bus used plates, reposition sun shades, and top off champagne and water glasses. My waitress was always in a rush to dash off from our table before I could finish my requests.The two seat chairs & tables are small and cramped. Better to come with a group of 3 or 4 and get a larger seating arrangement for comfort sake.The high maintenance palate crowd would understandably give it a low rating. But if you come knowing about the food issues and intending to enjoy libations, weather and the venue instead... it delivers on these expectations correctly. Hence a generous 3 stars, but they really need to improve lest the public's scornful wrath will hurt the business over time. Lastly, don't be a rookie. Bring a hat and sunscreen just in case. Duh you're outdoors.

Reviews.Author: Ayumi S.
Reviews.Content: SO. The bf of mine surprised me here for my early birthday dinner on Monday. You go up 15 floors and arrive at a very comfy looking bright (from nature) lounge area. The couches and chairs looked antique-esque..but it was nice! We were lead outside (rooftop) and we got a nice table right by the non-lit fireplace (it was only 6:30..it was still pretty sunny and warm) with a beautiful view of DTLA and the buildings. We were looking at the drink portion of the menu first, of course, and I decided to go for the My Fair Lady which is their French Cosmo w/ Fair Quinoa Vodka, Cranberry, Fresh Lime & Crème de peche. It was..mm not bad. Bf got the Marie Antoinette which consists of Cognac, Luxardo cherry liqueur w/ muddled black cherries & jalapeños. Me no gusta haha.  And strangely, our drinks kept spilling everywhere every time we took a sip. I spilled drops all over the menu, when I was using a straw o.o  I think the second drink he got was the French Maid which consists of Cognac, lemon juice, simple syrup w/ muddled cucumber & mint. I got myself a glass of wine which was the Domaine de Montahuc Muscat Organic (rich sweet & peachy) . I have no idea how to even try to pronounce that..but it was delicious! We decided to get 2 appetizers..cause we fatties like that, and our first one was the -Merguez Sliders $14three spiced lamb patties w/ cucumber riata. It was my first time trying lamb, and it was different. Pretty good though. Decent sized. I wanted the truffle fries, but since it was coming with my entree, I decided to go for their -Perch Fromage $15daily selection of three cheeses & accompaniments.They have their 3 cheeses of the day, and I honestly don't remember any of them. They weren't bad, but not my style of cheese. Though I ate em. As far as entrees go..I got myself theeeeee-Pan Roasted Chicken Suprême $25w/ creamy truffle cheese french fries and jus de pouletYUMMY!!! The chicken was very moist and juicy. The Jus de Poulet is the chicken juice that they have, and it was perfect. It really went well with the truffle cheese fries. MM :] It was a very good portion too. Loved it! Bf got the -Steak Frites (choice of french fries or salad) $26prime flat iron topped w/ a white truffle scented butter, french fries and bordelaise sauceHe chose fries..and he mentioned when we got our entrees, "Oh it makes sense.."FRENCH" fries.." I didn't even think about it either. We had a moment haha. But he really liked his meal as well :] We had to get some dessert tehee. I chose the -White Chocolate Bread Pudding $9served w/ bourbon sauceOH. MAH. GAH. So moist..so delicious..so flavorful..so..MM! I want some right fuckin NOW. It was very warm, and it just made my insides dance with happiness. I really enjoyed everything from Perch though. When it's night time, the view is beautiful. I love seeing the DTLA buildings at night. The lights..I just love it :] My bf knows me too well haha. The waitresses were dressed like French maids..which I found a little tacky, but hey..whatever :pI would definitely love to come back!

Reviews.Author: Laura P.
Reviews.Content: We didn't have resies so we sat at the bar.The crowd was a mixed bag - not crazy about everyone there but that happens.I got a Jameson on the rocks and a steak frites cooked blue (and done so perfectly) with fries. The steak was fantastic. The fries were good too. My friend got truffle fries that were really good and the ahi tartare which I didn't try but she said was just okay.The actual place is really nice. I love the outside terrace and the upstairs area where you can smoke and have a drink and almost feel like you're in NY. Highly recommend for a nice view. Would also be a nice spot for a classy birthday. Parking's valet or lot unless you get extremely lucky.

Reviews.Author: Foodlovadiva M.
Reviews.Content: Superb experience on a Saturday night. The food was delicious.My husband and I ordered the baked Brie and Heirloom Tomato Salad, he had the Duck and I the Special Gnocci, served with shaved Asparagus and wild mushroom truffle sauce which reminded me of the meal I had at a VERY fine and expensive restaurant in Paris named "Lasserre".We sat outside around the corner from the main restaurant floor and had a great view of the city. I highly recommend this place for fine dining.We went upstairs to check out the (overhyped) roof top bar, skip that and just stick to the restaurant. Loved the perfectly tuned live band that played soft, chilling yet upbeat songs aka Robin Thicke-Lost without You (often I hate the sound level of live music-too loud).

Reviews.Author: Beba S.
Reviews.Content: Date placeJust adorable!!!! Love it!

Reviews.Author: Jackie R.
Reviews.Content: A little bird perched and spilled the beans about PERCH!One word FAB!This is the definition of a fabulous brunch in DTLA!I mean live jazz, breathtaking views, champagne, European decor..you get the point.. So one fabulous Sunday morning my boyfriend and I ventured out to DTLA for brunch. Initially we were going to eat at Bottega but the wait was ridiculously long...so I immediately went on my bookmarked brunch eateries on yelp and BOOM we decided to give Perch a try. So the wait was rather long here as well but the bar is self seating...so we sat at the bar. I was a little sad because I wanted to sit outside with the live jazz but I guess I will be saving that for a SUMMER SUNDAY MORNING! Anyways I got a bloody mary which was nicely done and had a good kick!I got the waffles and my boyfriend got the eggs benedict which he fell in love with. Funny story, he had actually ordered the crab benedict. There was a miscommunication with the waiter and she got the regular benedict. When he asked if his benedict had crab she apologized and said she thought he ordered the regular. My boyfriend really didnt care, he was more then please with the regular benedict! Now the decor I cant stress enought how amzing it looks inside. Very 20's with amazing patterns furniture, carpets, paintings, even the stools we were sitting on were great. Not to mention the buildup to get to Perch is fabulous as well. You need to take two elvators. On the second elevator you begin to see the 20's decor start to kick in. I cant wait to visit Perch this summer. I will definitely be going for their outdoor jazz brunch!

Reviews.Author: Howard Z.
Reviews.Content: Points for the view, minus points for how impossible it is to go up to the roof roof.  There has to be a better system than just hoping and jumping on that short queue.

Reviews.Author: Cin M.
Reviews.Content: Hello Perch Management,I wanted to let you know that I experienced the worst customer service EVER at your restaurant.  My group was a party of 8 and we made reservations (initially for a party of 12).  This was for 8PM on Friday, 7/19/13.1.  For having had reservations, the male host with glasses was extremely rude and unprofessional.  With an initial reservation for a larger party, why is it such an issue that our party is now smaller?  It does not warrant a condescending tone.  Only three of the dinner guests were present (since we checked in at 7:40PM, 20 minutes early).  A polite thing to say would be: "We cannot seat you until your scheduled reservation time and most of the party is present.".  NOT: "You really need to let me know how many people are in your party.  Are you sure the count is right?  We really have limited chairs and the count must be exact (condescending tone)."  We answered yes, we are sure.  Then we were told to hang on a few minutes.  Okay.  After 5 minutes, the host suddenly waves at us to follow him to a table with only 4 chairs and only 4 table settings.  We have a party of 8 people.  Gradually, more chairs and table settings were brought over.  2.  The waitress was Liliana (server 119).  Did not greet us with a warm welcome or a smile.  Took our initial drink and appetizer orders.  As more people in our party came, she took their orders as well.  This was the only thing she did right.3.  The male "bus boy" that refilled our water glasses and cleared our table did an amazing job.  4.  The waitress never came back to ask how our table was doing or if we needed anything.  5.  It was my friend's birthday and the birthday dessert came out with an unlit candle.  We brought this to the waitress' attention and she acted surprised like she didn't know it was not lit.  We had to light the birthday candle using the candle on the table.6.  When it came time to pay the bill, we asked her for a pen so that we can write on the back of the receipt (how much to charge on the credit cards).  She rudely threw it down on the table.  After she took the completed bill with our payment, she rudely asked "Do you still have the pen I let you borrow?"7.  Bottom line: Liliana did not deserve the 18% gratuity.  I wanted to speak up but I didn't want to make a fuss on my friend's birthday.  P.S.  Service from beginning to end was horrible. From the host that seated us to the waitress that failed miserably...will be the reasons I will not come back. Food was excellent.
