Cocktails were excellent.  But I can get these anywhere else along with exceptional service.

Reviews.Author: S K.
Reviews.Content: CRAP.First off, let me just reiterate that I have been living downtown for nearly 11 years.  There are certain things restaurants need to maintain to succeed here.  Such as, a respectful enticing menu served by an intelligent but unpretentious staff.  We don't mind paying top dollar if you understand this simple concept. We see through that fake sh*t like a Playboy model trying to pass off her fake tits as "natural".  Downtowners are foodies.  I would dare say more so than our neighbors west of us.  Most of us are not into hype.  You better be ready for highly sensitive palates.Overpriced crappy food with the f*ckin worst service.  Notably the bartenders.  Especially the redhead with black rimmed glasses who looks like a throw back of the bad retro fatass  50's.  Talk about the worst pretentious attitude.  I could go on but it's a waste of my time.I can not believe The Must had anything to do with this shithole.  It was the best wine bar downtown.  I guess this is what happens when you see a smidgen of success.  Suddenly you have a french accent and think your shit doesn't stink.The Perch is for all you westsiders thinking it's cool to come downtown for dinner.  "Go ahead kids, it's all yours, and don't forget to tip our local neighborhood crackheads."

Reviews.Author: Betty N.
Reviews.Content: **GREAT DTLA ROOFTOP SPOT**Birthday group so no lines or cover on a Saturday night.Good space, vibe, and energy.Lots of cool-looking people in the lounge area.Rooftop was awesome and bartenders were super friendly and generous.There was a max capacity limit and you may have to wait 20+ minutes or so to get to the rooftop after it opens.Free drinks all night by generous and thoughtful friends. I was HAPPY.Loved the venue, the good-looking people, and fantastic energy here.RECOMMEND.

Reviews.Author: Markus N.
Reviews.Content: Places change, in degrees.  People change.  Once upon a time many moons ago at the end of the westward migration I was of the misconception that a fellow born and bred in NYC was obliged to hold LA in low regard.  And try I did, with incomplete success, isolating the obvious drawbacks from anything that might threaten this world view, holding the blinders to my head with both hands.And if LA cared what I thought it would have shaken its golden head gently, knowing that only one of us would suffer the consequences of this myopic perspective.Beginning 2001, when work had me downtown almost once a week for a year, I was given a second chance.  The turning point came perhaps the morning I spent atop Montecito Heights with the Hasselblad waiting for the sun to illuminate downtown, just me and the river and the skyline and birds that sing only at the break of day.  That morning, on that hill, I kind of started to get it.And yesterday afternoon, as I sat in the comfortable embrace of the cushioned rattan perched at Perch watching this time the shadows grow longer, I thought of it all.  I really like LA.  For me, Perch is a perfect vantage point for such (inward or outward) reflection.  It's also marvelous for just being, by yourself or with your bestie.  Good food, beautiful people, carefully crafted libations to slake your urban thirst.  Thanks, Ching T. (come back!) for turning me on to this excellent vantage point.

Reviews.Author: Bridget P.
Reviews.Content: An old friend invited me here on Friday night, and I'd always wanted to check the place out! I parked in the $6 lot across the street, which is a great deal for DTLA. Plus, I got to park my own car. I really don't like valet. There was a long line to get in at around 11, and a shorter line for downtown locals (although I'm not sure how you prove that.... just about everyone I know has an address on their ID that's different from where they actually live). It moved fairly quickly and I took an elevator up to the 13th floor, then one to the 15th. No cover charge, what what!Perch is one of the most beautiful spaces in the city. I never understood why LA doesn't have more rooftop bars; in SD they seem to be everywhere. Perch consists of the top 2 floors of the building. Incredible views of the city, fire pits, comfortable cushioned benches, potted trees with lights.... I loved it all. Although there are heat lamps, ladies may want to bring sweaters anyway because they're a little spread out. It's a diverse crowd, which also goes for attire. My friend told me to wear "club clothes," but I saw everything from jeans to ho dresses. I chatted with a lot of new people and saw people on dates, people who came to pick up on girls, people in groups of friends.... it's just a great place for anyone. I could see myself coming here often if I lived downtown. The ONLY reason I'm knocking a star off is because of the expensive drinks and the lines.... one to get in the building, and one to get from the 15th to the 16th floor, when the 16th floor obviously had plenty of space, and no reason for a line. There are 2 bars on the lower floor and 1 on the upper, which is nice. Drinks are around $14 each, but this is downtown. I tasted my friend's Moscow Mule variation, which was smooth and delicious. We both agreed it tasted a little like lychee but less sweet, and was also very deceiving. I asked for a Long Island (my usual) but was told they didn't have any, which was weird considering it was a full bar.Me: "So since you don't have those, do you offer something that's equally strong and equally delicious?" (It had been a long, rough, day, don't judge me).Bartender with an awesome mustache: "I can make ANYTHING strong."Me: "Anything, is that right?"Bartender: "Of course. Try me." Hands me the menu.I picked Perch's variation of a Manhattan, and sipped it the rest of the night. One drink. Fast forward to closing time, and I ended up sitting in my car alone after the bar closed, singing, and sending text messages I shouldn't send, until I could drive home. Lesson learned: do not challenge a bartender. You will lose.

Reviews.Author: Barry W.
Reviews.Content: *** Excellent city views from the rooftop deck here. ***Sunday brunch 11am- 3pm and cocktails all afternoonwith a DJ spinning lounge tunes while we all socialize.What's not to like on a beautiful sunny weekend day?Well, let's see ... you can accidentally drop your keys over their rooftop railing while leaning over the railing,like Janelle did. (lol)  But I am confident you'll put keys in your purse/pocket before enjoying panoramic view.*** No worries, they'll retrieve keys on lower deck. ***

Reviews.Author: Dani S.
Reviews.Content: Love the ambience! Didn't eat or drink here, so can't comment on that.The upstairs patio area has really comfortable couches with heat lamps. Great place to cuddle up with your honey, while enjoying a serene view of DTLA. Lots of good looking people here, patrons and staff. Definitely coming back for another mellow night.

Reviews.Author: margs k.
Reviews.Content: I've only come for apertif hour (from 4 to 6 during the weekdays.) They do a great kir royal here and have lovely rooftop views of DTLA. It's always packed!

Reviews.Author: Orsolya D.
Reviews.Content: LA has one huge asset other cities. No, I'm not talking about celebrities with big butts. I'm talking about the fact that we have several ways to impress our dates. We have restaurants with views of the ocean, views of the mountains, and even views of downtown skyscrapers. Not too many cities can boast all of that. One will instantly feel apart of the Cosmopolitan Downtown Elite when stepping foot into Perch. This begins with the fact that you have to actually take two elevators to reach the 13th floor (note: most older downtown buildings don't have 13th floors due to superstition). You either feel like Maxwell Smart on a secret spy mission or simply nauseated if you don't like elevators. Regardless, you arrive to a rooftop restaurant/bar which resembles the lobby of Union Station with couches, desks, dark wood accents and high ceilings. Take a step outside and you will be wow'ed by the setting sun, glittering lights of skyscrapers, and the outlines of tiny people below. You can't pretend it isn't beautiful.Our reservations were met with no problem and we received the prime table by the fireplace (as the birthday girl, I was happy about this). After some photos (it is necessary with such a view) and after my boyfriend had secret talks with the staff about my dessert celebration; I ordered a glass of Pol Clement Brut champagne ($8) while my boyfriend ordered a Kronenburg 1664 beer ($7). As I sipped on my champagne, which was very crisp and tasty, we ordered the Shake & Bake Drumsticks (Frogs Legs w/ lily root & garlic chips and a calvados honey glaze -- $10). I have always enjoyed frog legs and these were excellent. The highlight of frog legs is the flavor combination of chicken wings with a light fish flavor and texture mixed in. Perch's frog legs were crisp on the outside, tender on the inside, and with just the right touch of spices. The garlic chips and lily root were not only pretty esthetically, but also complemented the frog. For my meal, I ordered Boeuf Bourguignon Déconstruit (Braised Short Rib, thumb nail carrots, pork belly, candied garlic, and potato --- $29) while my boyfriend ordered the Perch au Noisette (Perch sautéed in butter and served on a tomato carpaccio w/ peas, leeks, and in a Bouillabaisse sauce --- $28). Service was speedy and our food arrived rather quickly. I was instantly gratified with the beauty on my plate. However, my tongue was not as I took a bite and found my food to be cold. I wasn't going to say anything but hey, we're paying hard earned cash for this, so I politely told the waitress the issue. She apologized and assured me another plate would be out asap. As I waited, my boyfriend ate his perch (I told him it was okay so don't frown about his manners!) which was buttery soft with a lovely seared skin. He was worried about the bouillabaisee but it wasn't overpowering and served the fish well.My heat-updated plate arrived and this time it was perfect. The short rib was cooked just right with the perfect ratio of juices running onto the plate but saucy exterior. The thumb carrots were not only adorable, but had a delectable glazed flavor while the potato (one small sliver) tasted like it was out of a slow cooker pot roast. The pork belly was a bit too soft for my liking but still had a lovely flavor and would satisfy the lovers of the latest pork trend product. A delicious meal which was actually even more delicious the next day as leftovers. Although I think Perch's menu is somewhat (okay, a lot) limited; it's elegance and yet non-stuffy atmosphere with amazing views is a perfect spot for a birthday dinner or simply to impress your next date. See? I told you we had it easy in LA...

Reviews.Author: Cindy P.
Reviews.Content: Go to the Standard instead.  Perch is NOT worth the wait or crappy service.View of DTLA that pales in comparison to the Standard.  -1 starHour-long wait when the bar is half empty.  -1 starCreepy old men that stare at you like they're hungry.  -1 starRedhead bartender that gives you attitude all night, pours you the tiniest shots, then alters your receipt to give herself a 30% tip.  -20395238579217065 starsGo somewhere else... unless waiting outside for an hour, getting mentally undressed by old men, and being robbed by a shady bartender is your idea of a good time.

Reviews.Author: Linh T.
Reviews.Content: I have had both dinner and brunch here and loved both. Brunch is especially nice because there is live jazz. There's something about mimosas and music that make Sundays so grand. The bread assortment is quite delicious with the croissant and muffin selection. I love the crab benedict... the eggs are always perfectly cooked and the hollandaise sauce is heavenly. The french toast is another favorite!For dinner, my seabass was perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were buttery goodness. The truffle fries are also perfectly fried. The fresh oysters that start dinner are also always delightful here. Great ambience here too with the decor, the servers all look great.

Reviews.Author: Sylvie C.
Reviews.Content: PERCH! You keep getting better. Had dinner there for the first time tonight, and tried almost half of the menu - was absolutely floored by some of the dishes. French inspired but entirely innovative; the dishes were all modern takes on French classics. The service was excellent - far, far better than my first visit (so I imagine that the service will only get better!) The only low point was...the napkins. No black napkin option for our black dressed and black suited crowd, so lint garnished all of our clothing as we walked out the door. But, a small price to pay for the wonderful experience that we had.The proportions were EXCELLENT. For three of us, we had seven dishes altogether, and didn't feel the need to roll home. 4 appetizers, 2 entrees, and 1 dessert made for a delicious, satisfying, but not overwhelmingly filling meal. NOT SO FRENCH ONION SOUP. Very good. Caramelized onions! Grilled bacon! Everything you could ever want in a soup. Could have been executed a little better - was a tad watery.CORDON BLEU POPPERS. I've never been a huge cordon bleu fan - always found it a little gross, but THIS. The best version of it I've had. The combination of swiss cheese with candied tomato...it exploded in your mouth (get your mind out of the gutter.) - 4 piece appetizerDUCK, DUCK, GOOSE. Um. Obsessed. I mean, I just love duck so much, but those TOMATOES again, those beautiful sweet tomatoes were such a nice add on to this little 'duck sammy.' The bread itself was also sweet, and great with the duck, but a teensy bit crumbly and difficult to eat. I still loved it. (3 piece appetizer)SHAKE AND BAKE DRUMSTICKS. I've never had frog legs before, so I've got no frame of reference here, but I loved these. The honey glaze they were served with complemented these buttermilk fried legs so well, and before we knew it, all six had disappeared. (6 piece appetizer)THE PERCH FILET. So apparently there is a fish called a perch! I'd never eaten it before, but I hope to eat it for every meal from here on out. Cooked to perfection, the fish was broiled, flaky, light, but extremely moist. Very well seasoned, and atop some very thinly sliced tomatoes drizzled in an olive oil based sauce. They came with gorgeous potato puree, and the combination of ingredients (there were many more vegetables on the plate) was delightful. I'll definitely go back for this single entree. COQ AU VIN. Interesting twist on coq au vin! Again, there were many components on the plate, but they all came together quite beautifully. Fried chicken oysters, chanterelle mushrooms, cipollini onions (my bf knows how obsessed I am with cipollini onions done right!). I loved the dish, but not nearly as much as I loved the fish.BEIGNETS. Yum. I loved them because they weren't overly sweet, but matched with strawberry jam and this AMAZING ESPRESSO WHIPPED CREAM. The whipped cream really captured the essence of espresso, and when matched with the beignets...I was so into it. The menu was far less expensive than I expected. The most expensive dish we ordered was $19 (for the coq au vin) and the least expensive was the onion soup at $9. All in all, a meal for 3 cost $150 for 2 bottles of wine, and 7 dishes. (And I'm so full! Normally I would've eaten far less, but hey, gotta take advantage of my parents passing through.) I didn't view it as classic French fare, so perhaps I had a better experience than those who were expecting as such. I thought the dishes were creative, and complicated, yet the ingredients all came together. The service was near perfect tonight, and still, I imagine they'll improve further over time! Restaurants need a little time to figure out the kinks. Perch has been around less than a month.

Reviews.Author: Andrea L.
Reviews.Content: J'aime Perch!!!  Its totally my idea of a perfect place to spend time with friends or work peeps or if you're lucky, your current crush!  Wink.  This charming, upscale, rooftop restaurant and bar is located on the 13th floor of the Pershing building right in the heart of downtown LA (Hill and 4th).  When I first arrived, as I stepped off the elevator, the sun was low and flooded the whole bistro and patio with a warm golden light.  It made for a lovely first impression.  The decor in this place is absolutely darling, especially if you have an eye for fanciful French design- which I do!  Perch is modern, cozy and elegant without being fussy.   We didn't have reservations, but we were promptly seated at a lovely table for two along the glass rail on the restaurant patio.  Glass rail is essential as to not block the spectacular view.  Around this time the sun was setting and it was a perfect August evening.  I was already quickly falling in love with this place.   The view is A-mazing!  The 360-degree vista of LA from this actual "perch" is romantic and dazzling.  Yes, I'm an LA girl, born and raised, who repeatedly falls in love with our own downtown skyline.  It, like the ocean, never gets old for me.  This view is truly an amazing backdrop for any occasion you find yourself here- business or pleasure.  The crowd looked like it was a mix of both.  I was here tagging along with my friend R. who was meeting some people for drinks, from a professional network she belongs to.  See?  Mix of business and pleasure...  So glad I went! She brings me to all the cool the spots!Le Food:We ordered two appetizers:Cordon Bleu Poppers $8.  These were like fancy chicken McNuggets... There were like 5 or 6 breaded chicken pieces stuffed with prosciutto and Swiss cheese, accompanied with a candied tomato remoulade for dipping.  They were good.  Perch Formage $14.  I adore cheese and wine, so this was the star of the evening for me!  It's a great value actually for a truly beautiful plate featuring a generous serving of three standard cheeses, two quality dried fruit choices, one with nuts, accompanied with thin crisp raisin toasts.  We paired this a lovely sauvignon blanc.  It was in sheer pleasure that I savored each bite from this shared plate, and it was quite enough for a meal.  Le Bar: I enjoyed the French wine... of course I did!  I always do!  But the cocktails here were quite incredible.  I started with the "My Fair Lady", their twist on the cosmo martini.  It was very delicious!  Le Bar II:After she and I delighted in our food and cocktails, we left the main dinning area to join her networking group on the second level deck/patio.  Here it was less restaurant/bistro and more of the lounge, bar/patio atmosphere.  Spectacular view still in place! From this bar I ordered a very lovely cocktail that was dark red, with floating berries in it... not sure of the name, but pretty sure I can say with confidence that the cocktail menu at this place is tight.  Je ne sais quoi: I must say I had a really wonderful night here.  Maybe it was the Parisian wine or the gin cocktails I was easily absorbing, but up on this deck, as the sun fell away and the lights came to life among the surrounding Los Angeles structures, I know that I paused for a moment.   I watched as my new friends talked and laughed and enjoy this fabulous summer night under the darkening sky.  I totally snapped a picture of the moment using my hazy intoxicated mind, which works by the way because I am recalling it and seeing it as I write these words!  I filed that moment it in my "remember this blessed life" memory file...   Now if that isn't "joie de vivre," I don't know what is... Come to Perch for happy hour, a date, or to chill with friends.   Snap your own "remember this" picture, file it, and remember it.  You'll thank me later! Bonjour! P.S. Come prepared to spend for Perch is fantastic, but not for the budget conscious.  Two shared appetizers and two cocktails each came to $85.  That was before we went up to the lounge where we had more drinks... Just an FYI.

Reviews.Author: Berna T.
Reviews.Content: If you ever decide to visit this oh-so-trendy DTLA spot, the only thing you need to hear is this: Justin, the bartender, is freaking amazing, and everyone should go there and seriously throw tips at him just because he is a nice guy.  He was the one shining star to our experience here, and he deserves a thousand stars on his own.I was super excited to check this place out, as the menu online looked great and my cousin had been there before, citing a very positive experience and the 360 view of DTLA.  When we went on Friday for my birthday, the experience left a very, VERY bad taste in my mouth.  We foolishly didn't make reservations but were told (quite pleasantly) by the host station that the wait was ridiculously long, but we were welcome to sit at the bar.  No big deal, our party of five managed to get seats at the bar, where we proceeded to order cocktails and some appetizers.  Our bartender (bitchy-faced female), was completely disinterested.  We inquired about one of the drinks on the menu and were met with a curt "we don't make that anymore".  She mumbled some excuse about them not changing out the menus yet.  Nothing to trip about, we ordered something else.  Our food came out, she brought out FOUR plates (we were a party of five). I didn't trip about that, I shared a plate with my fiance.  After our first couple of rounds, our bartender completely disappears for a half hour or so, so we asked the other bartender if we could order a bottle of Perrier-Jouet.  He brought out five glasses, poured the wine, and all was well with the world.We wanted to head upstairs to the rooftop bar, so my fiance asked to close out our bill.  Our bitchy bartender added a gratuity onto our bill... the menu clearly stated that gratuities would be added for parties of SIX or more.  So...bringing out FOUR plates and FIVE wine glasses...how the hell does that add up to six people?  I was not pleased, but I rolled with it because I didn't want to be the out-of-towner who makes a scene and gets kicked out of the restaurant on my birthday.It gets better.  After we had been upstairs, ordering more cocktails and glasses of whisky, two friends of ours arrived late.  It's not usually like me to ask if someone can cut in line, but I had a group of friends upstairs well into drinking mode and we had ordered bottles and figured it was worth a shot...so I asked the security guard if there was any way we could get two of our friends upstairs.  He brought up the manager, who barked at us to tell him exactly where our friends were (cause you know, I'm psychic) and when we couldn't give him the precise location in those five seconds, he was like, "Too bad" and turned and walked away.This is where Justin saved the day.  He knew we had ordered lots of drinks (and a couple of bottles).  I went to the bar and told him what was going on, and he left the very busy bar to run downstairs and grab our friends and escorted them up.  That is some seriously awesome customer service.  He was the ONLY person in the entire place that showed any sign of being HUMAN and he even declined when I wanted to order another drink on a separate tab just so I could leave him a big fat tip.Bottom line:  if you're a scenester, this place is totally for you.  I don't buy into the whole attitude-LA-club thing so if you don't either, you might hate this place, at least on a Friday or Saturday night.  Never again.

Reviews.Author: Diana I.
Reviews.Content: Woot! Review #500! I saved it for this great new lounge I'm almost in love with!This is a fairly new rooftop lounge near Pershing Square. The view is amazing!! WOW I absolutely love the view, especially because I'm in love with downtown at night with all the gleaming city lights. The lounge is very spacious and there's tons of places to sit both inside and outside. There's also a couple fireplaces with seats around it which I think are the best seats in the house. So cozy and romantic!The only thing I was a little sad about was they didn't have a cocktail menu available when I went a week ago. They just had well drinks, beer and wines pretty much. I think the cocktail menu might be available now though or sometime soon. I would definitely be willing to come back again. It's a great place for a date or for groups! It's a must-try if you like lounges and city skylines! :)

Reviews.Author: Scot E.
Reviews.Content: I was next door and I wanted to try the place so I stopped in.I like it.  J'adore la musique Française (Serge Gainsbourg, Yann Tiersen, etc).  Nice views from the rooftop.I had a nice time until I was leaving.  I had a few drinks and tipped 25%, my friend had 1 drink and tipped 200%.  The bartender returned to thank my friend and was obviously ignoring me.  I left thinking that I did not tip enough.  On my way home I wondered when a 25% tip was so little that it was not even acknowledged and I thought...  a 25% tip is fine.  I believe it was the staff that was rude, not me as a client leaving a 25% tip.

Reviews.Author: Emily S.
Reviews.Content: Perch is located at the top of Pershing Square Building.  If you're coming here, it's easy to park at the Pershing Square Underground Parking Lot.  The price comes out to $6.60 if you come in after 5:30pm.  (Either that or street parking).  The Pershing Square Underground Parking Lot is that it's open 24 hours and it's directly across the street from the Pershing Square Building.Once you get here, you take the elevator to the 13th floor.  From there, you take a second elevator to the 15th floor.  I came here for their soft opening Thursday night.  It was nice, but there is still a lot of work that needs to be done.  The bathrooms were kind of unfinished.  There weren't any toilet seat protectors in any of the restrooms.  Also, the women's bathroom door on the top floor (Perch has two floors) did not close.The bartender did not know all the prices of the drinks yet. (*which was fine*)  Service was good.   I liked that it was outdoors.  The views of DTLA were amazing.  All that was missing was a pool.  One negative however of it being outdoors was that there were people smoking all over the bar.  Cigars, Cigarettes.. you couldn't escape it.And, compared to, The Arsenal in Santa Monica ... the décor here was pretty old.

Reviews.Author: Arpi G.
Reviews.Content: I was brought here for dinner for a first "official" date...very cute and romantic place. The building is charming and view speaks for itself. My boyfriend and I both work in downtown LA, so we see beautiful views everyday, but at night time this was perfect. While we waited for our table, we went upstairs for a drink, we were seated on the patio outside, by a fire...super cute and romantic. Food was delicious! Great place for a date! Great vibe, not overly crowded and a great atmosphere and energy!

Reviews.Author: Christina S.
Reviews.Content: Once again another gem I found on Yelp. Unfortunately we had no reservations but we were still seated. If I had to describe this place it would most easily be meet with the words a "secret hiding spot" but come around 1130pm everyone seems to know of this place and we were left to not feel so special after all. But at any rate make reservations especially on a weekend. I liked that it had sort of a speakeasy vibe to it upon entering the building. There are no massive signs out front which tell you that PERCH is here! No, just a simple address and a vallet out front which is worth the $8 for parking with them. You enter two different elevators where you are finally lead into the restaurant itself. The place was busy extremely busy with dinning guest but latter in the evening people were flooding in at the bar so it became a scene after a while.Jennifer the bartender is hands down the best. She is amongst one of my favorite bartenders now. If you fancy crafted cocktails and not some run of the mill Makers and Coke then you will be satisfied here. I had a few "Le Libertine's" then I left it to Jennifer who asked what I liked and she came up with something that was good. I wasn't however feeling so good the morning after. I sipped a bit of the French Maid that a friend had.. Now dinner, because we really came to eat and not only to drink. So, we split an order of the Frog Legs.. I tried it and that's about as much as I can say. They were different, especially in texture so ya, they were good if you like frog legs.  My entree was the Caviar Salmon and my friend had the Fillet Beef. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING. What meant to be just dinner and a few drinks ended up in a very late night here.... This is now one of my fav. spots!!

Reviews.Author: Marian B.
Reviews.Content: Review just for drinks & lounge. NOT for the food because I don't go to Perch to eat.I go there because they make the drinks strong, bartenders are cool and the views of Downtown LA are beautiful especially at night. There are 2 levels. The lower one has more seating available so if you don't want to stand, hang out there. The very top is mostly standing room and you get a nice view of the garden/park below. Perch is a great new place to hang out with friends, catch up and drink. I like the decor and ambiance of the place. There is no blaring lopud music so you can actually hear your friends when they talk to you. If you don't want to go to a club and prefer a more chill place, check this place out.

Reviews.Author: Danielle B.
Reviews.Content: I'd have to agree that the weekends can get a little crowded here, and I'm not a big fan of long lines- but it doesn't prevent me from showing up every once in a while. I'm a huge week night fan for Perch-- the views and ambience can't be beat. Looking to woo your date? Take him/her to the top of Los Angeles. It's not the highest perch in the city, but it offers a unique atmosphere. The bistro offers live music almost every night of the week, along with top-notch bartenders ready to serve you exquisitely mixed cocktails. The menu offers wonderful classic French dishes. The options for seating outside are what made this place to me. Here, you'll find yourself engaging with other couples or individuals who are grabbing a drink with their friends or loved one after a long day downtown. People are friendly, the music soothing, the fire pits warming to the soul. It's true respite in a busy city. Check out their website for a calendar on featured music and swing by on a sunday to catch their lovely brunches!Check out my hobby blog for some other date ideas and a full recap on one of my favorite nights out at Perch.. everlovesting.com/2012/1…

Reviews.Author: Joanna P.
Reviews.Content: I came here for drinks and some bites with friends on a Tuesday. Atmosphere and view-wise, this place is awesome. I love that Downtown has a nice, but unpretentious place like this. Even though the evening was a bit chilly, we sat outside on the patio and were fine since there were plenty of heat lamps. The drinks were strong, and of course the company was great. But the food definitely needs work. We ordered a variety of dishes like Duck, Duck, Goose, Bone Marrow, Mussels, etc. but none of them stood out very much. If anything, we were left full and unsatisfied to a point where we had to find a taco truck.I would definitely come back here for drinks, but I would skip the meal.

Reviews.Author: Lisa S.
Reviews.Content: Came back for dinner a week later, and although it was on the pricey side, it was a lovely evening.The baked brie was great, but it was really small. The appetizer wasn't even enough to satisfy one person.The short rib was delicious. I loved the horseradish mashed potatoes and think all mashed potatoes should be made this way!The roasted chicken was good, but again, small. The fries were the best part, though. I could have eaten an entire plate of these all by themselves.The white chocolate bread pudding was amazing!  Sometimes dessert gets a little sweet, but this was perfect. It was sweet, don't get me wrong, but it didn't bother me for whatever reason. I could have eaten two of these by myself. :)

Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: This is not a restaurant. This is a bar with some bistro food, with a nice view and, occasionally, a raucous band (worthy of headlining a show at the Grove). If you come here for a nice dinner, like we did -you WILL be disappointed - NO - You will be INFURIATED :-0As we enter, we get carded by a bouncer - frustrated that no one responds to him on their way out when he says to have a goodnight. Someone even sarcastically says "it was the best -ever!" we thought he was just being a dick. Nope his sarcasm was spot on.We make it upstairs, gorgeous views. We're seated at a table that's pretty close to another large loud table. We think about moving then realize all the tables are really crowded together.I look at the menu and notice it's not exactly the same as the online menu. E.g. The beef bourguignon is now a beef pot Au feu and the coq au vin bites are nowhere to be found  We're given a plate of three small French rolls. Not warm, not soft. Not good.Our waiter comes over quickly, very insistent on taking our orders. Sounds good but we only know we want kir royals and mussels to start. He brings the drinks and asks if we're ready to order. We get the heirloom tomato and beet salad, french onion soup, fried Brie sticks and the beef pot Au feu. We mentioned we were going to split it all and asked if it was enough and he said we'd probably want more but this will do for now.I go to the bathroom and when I return the food was already at our table. Not just the apps - all of it. But no mussels. You'd think the mussels would be there too since we ordered them first. Why would they serve us EVERYTHING at once? In a restaurant that's outside? The food is going to get cold. What are they thinking? It settles in- this nice romantic pre-valentines day dinner that we were hoping for is now us rushing to eat all this food before it gets cold while some band you'd find at an Airport Ramada Inn is wailing guitar solos to a bizarre rendition of Que Sera Sera. Ironic? Who cares.The Brie sticks weren't sticks. They were hunks fried and served with some bad raspberry sauce that made the food taste sweeter than saccharine. Awful.The heirloom tomato salad was fine. I've had better... At Trader Joes.French onion soup was probably one of the highlights. Mostly because it remained hot throughout the meal.Beef pot Au feu was also pretty good but the meat was a little dry. And there wasn't enough sauce. There was a nice puréed whatever and some onion crisps - oh look here come the mussels.Yes, the mussels came after EVERYTHING else. Our waiter asked if everything was ok - the bread plate was still hogging table real estate, we weren't given new plates for the entrees (because they came out at the same time). We had to ask for someone to bring our waiter so we could ask him to take away plates (since every employee that passed neglected to notice ) and give us new silverware.After tasting the appetizers and the beef that we were nervous would grow cold (it did), we finally tasted the mussels and they were cold. Sitting in a broth this whole time on a night cold enough to warrant heating lamps outside, the dish we ordered first - came last, and tasted awful. My girlfriend thought it tastes like ramen.We asked for our waiter to take them away and we told him it was odd that everything came at once. He responded that we had mentioned we were sharing so he thought we'd want to share them all at once. And I responded that these were clearly appetizer and entrée plates - it said so on THEIR menu. To which he said if we wanted them coursed we had to ask in advance. You have to ASK a restaurant to serve you food in a certain order Astounded, I said to him that we clearly ordered the mussels first, and mentioned we'd 'start' out with that. To which he responded by basically repeating himself.He offered to take the mussels back to reheat but we said that we were growing full since he was wrong again - the portions were HUGE.About ten minutes later, he drops the check off and says he's ending his shift and to "take our time". But then how could we order dessert or more drinks since the bill has been given?We looked at the check and the mussels were taken off - BUT the bill said "100% didn't like it -$14" - check out the picture I uploaded for proof  Not a joke. Bro, it's not that we didn't like it, it's that you completely screwed up the placement of orders, the food got cold and we wouldn't pay for that bsDespite the dude saying we should take our time, he was constantly hovering over us, checking his phone. Eventually my gf put down her card. He comes back and puts the card right in front of me. My gf awkwardly said "uh that's mine" and the waiter said "I'm sorry, I just assumed." He was breathing down our necks when we were figuring out the tip. It was beyond unprofessional and uncomfortable. The rat chefs in the Muppets Take Manhattan had more tact than this guy.Just AWFUL!

Reviews.Author: Chuck S.
Reviews.Content: 3-stars, for happy hour (or as they would like to call it "aperitif hour") ambiance.  Yup, this qualifies as one of those places where you will be fined handsomely for roof top tax.  Beautiful venue, especially on when the weather is so conducive to being outdoors.  I was talked into coming here with a homeboy, who just couldn't shut up about coming here for weeks.  That said, coming here during the living daylights, it feels more appropriate for a casual date.  Still, you can use the Perch to grab a few drinks and kill time; all whilst watching cars scramble home during rush hour traffic.First thing about getting here... typical LA parking.  The street meters are like $3/hour, though careful 'cause you may get towed during certain hours. If you don't mind getting your wallet raped, there's the lot across the street charging $4 for every 15 minutes.  Go down a bit on Hill St, there's Athena Parking for $5 flat rate.  Thank goddess!  When you finally arrive on the 13th floor, you climb a few flights of stairs (or another elevator) and arrive to the lounge.  The hostess urged us to self-seat.  But ain't it ever tacky to see that 1/3rd of the seats were noted reserved by a paper sliver left on the table tops.  Some denoted time, like "Reserved 7:30."  I'm sure there' s a better way to handle reservations, but that's lazy management for you, I suppose.  And we were only the 3rd party there (and the youngest, where the chief demographics were very much aged mid 30+ professionals).  Hell, if I just got off work, I'd probably swing by and grab a drink too until rush hour's over.One thing about their "aperitif hour," the actual kitchen doesn't open till aperitif hour ends (4PM - 6PM).  Bummer.  Not profitable to hire your chefs for those 2 hours huh?  But you still get the happy hour menu, consisting of charcuterie, fries, cheese, and such.  I gave their happy hour $7 cocktail, a French 64 a shot.  Cognac, Kronnenburg, ginger juice.  Not really for me.  The ginger flavor battles it out with the cognac for presence, and takes the taste fight after the 10th round for a win-by-decision.  The ginger notes are just that much stronger, which is a bit unfortunate.  Also gave their Royal, their concoction of a sparkling wine spiked with a fruity liqueur of your choice.  Comes in this nifty old-school bowl of a champagne glass.  Looks like this:yelp.com/user_local_phot…You like that pic don't you??? Got a reflection of Downtown LA, mirrorcle world style.  Yeah, that was totally on accident.  Maybe it's just me, but I couldn't help but feel like the bubbly effervescence fizzles out sooner due to the higher surface area exposed to air.  Tastes aaaaiiiight.  It's not like it's the Thug Passion combo of Cristal and Alize Red Passion or anything.  I think I'll stick to a dry sparkling/champagne or some Kronnenburg next time.French fries? The size and shape suggest they may be similarly sourced as Umami Burger or McDonald's.  Though, the batch we got could've used a bit more time in the fryer for crispness.  Comes with ketchup, and another dipping aioli which was actually rather tasty.Frog legs: if someone told you they were buffalo wings, made with the legs of a cornish game hen and they ate it, none would be the wiser.  Eats like something that could be had at Yardhouse or Buffalo Wild Wings.  But you'll fiddle with more bones in your mouth, as you call it "buttermilk marinated frog legs, lily root and calvados honey glaze.  Fried brie is alright, but I prefer Izakaya Fuga's interpretation.  Perch has you dipping it in a raspberry roulade.  But Fuga gives you more creamy fatness for a dipping sauce.We did end up lounging for a few hours, shootin' the shit. Talkin' how a good friend of ours was all talkin' "bro's before hoes," and "GunPla for life!" Yeah, that dude's MIA now with his significant other (but it's cool, He's a nice guy.  He deserves to get laid, and often). I still had room to gobble up some lamb slider burgers.  Yummy, lamby, juicy taste.You know for service, we were treated as pretty forgettable.  I will say that the kitchen works fast.  They do.  Plates come out within minutes.  But speediness of service is the equivalent of 5600/bps modem dial-up into AOL.  Feel free to add any necessary screaming and shrieking sound effects.  But you won't be at a loss of who the waiters and waitresses are.  They'll be wearing bow ties around their bare necks.  Midway through service, they swapped a waitress on us.  Who knows why, 'cause the original chick was still walking around 'n taking orders.  At one point, I had to flag down a busboy (dressed in all black, no bowtie) and ask if he'd take an order from us instead.  Poor guy didn't look too happy.  He looked like he just f^%$ed his mom.  But he was definitely more helpful. Thumbs up to him.

Reviews.Author: Kate M.
Reviews.Content: Perch is pitch perfect. I entered a gorgeous art deco lobby at street level, ascended thirteen stories in a stately and swift elevator, climbed three flights of stairs, stepped out onto a rooftop, and took in my first view of the Downtown skyline from within it. It gave me pause.Soon, my boyfriend and I were sipping glasses of their juicy house red wine and a beautifully improvised bourbon and ginger at the edge of a small fire pit, discussing nothing in particular, listening to the likes of Gotan Project, and sneaking glances at the majestic art deco tower of the Title Guarantee and Trust Company building, at eye level, across Hill Street. The round cost $16 and was served in glass stemware, inducing sighs of relief and appreciation, given what one will pay for Chardonnay in a plastic wine glass elsewhere. The homey lounge furniture and planters lit with Christmas lights project an unpretentious, familiar charm.Bartenders and security guards were welcoming and warm and seemed excited about their new top floor office with a view. We were so enamored of the rooftop that we didn't explore the dining level, but looking over the ledge from above, it looked lovely.We hope for all the success in the world for Perch. That might mean waiting in a line to get in, or foregoing a chance to sit down at the bar, but it'll be worth it.

Reviews.Author: Eunice J.
Reviews.Content: The boyfriends were away so the girls came out to play. On a Friday night the 7 of us us cabbed it to Perch around 11-something. When we got there, we noticed that the line was long and stagnant, which was totally expected since I had read the warnings on yelp to go early... but girls will be girls and will always be late. Anyway, what we didn't expect was the bouncer who approached my friend who happened to be wearing a hot electric blue dress, asked how many girls were in our group, then proceeded to escort us to the front of the line and into the elevator. The experience getting into Perch was great for our first time, but I can see why that line takes so long.  I only saw one elevator going up to Perch.  After a short elevator ride, we got off at the indoor bar, had a drink, and then climbed a few stairs to get to the rooftop bar. The indoor bar had a classy, old-fashioned French decor and charm, and the rooftop had amazing views of DTLA, cushioned chairs to sit in, heat lamps and a firepit. Drinks were LA prices, which means not cheap, but I really appreciated the artisan drinks infused with amazing flavors. The crowd was mixed, mostly younger professionals and older.  It was the perfect place to have a chill night out with the girls.  Loved the friendly bouncers and bar tenders, the drinks and ambiance. Definitely a great place to hang out and grab a few drinks with a date or some friends.

Reviews.Author: Diana Y.
Reviews.Content: Take the elevator up to Perch, then take ANOTHER elevator to get to the roof. There's a really long line for the roof (didn't wait in it) and I really don't see what the big deal is. It's a nice setting though, definitely a popular place to go right now. Tons of Asians (because we Asians like to flock to whatever is popular at the moment). Not bad--not worth the hype enough to go back though.

Reviews.Author: Jessica E.
Reviews.Content: I visited The Perch two days ago with a small group of friends for Happy Hour, and had a blast. It's a short walk from the Expo line so we didn't need to worry about parking. The space consists of the two top floors of the building. One floor is indoor and has a really classy feel. The bar wasn't too crowded, and we had no problem getting our drinks. The bartender was really friendly!We decided to brave the wind and check out the top floor with the outdoor bar. It was one of my best experiences in LA thus far. The view was absolutely amazing. We sat huddling around a fire pit, sipping some wine, and catching up.  We were the only people brave enough to face the cold so it felt like our own private party. The experience really reminded me of why I love the city of Los Angeles. I look forward to going again very soon. I have a feeling this will be a regular spot for me once the weather warms up.

Reviews.Author: Ian W.
Reviews.Content: If you haven't been here yet, go. If you are looking to impress a date, client or just have a nice happy hour with some friends you are in for a treat. You enter the elevator through in an elegant lobby and are greeted 2/3 of the way up by another gentlemen who takes you the the elevator which leads to perch. You walk in to a very upscale restaurant and bar with a very pleasant staff. I suggest making a reservation and request seating outside near the glass walls because you have amazing unobstructed views of the LA skyline. There are heaters and fireplaces throughout the outdoor seating area too. As for the drains, all good. Food I have had the Filet which was good and my date had the Chilean Seabass which was amazing. For appetizers and happy hour I suggest the mixed nuts. They are delicious. So do yourself a favor and head over to Perch. I just heard that they are doing Sunday Brunch now too so that should be a great spot on Sunday Funday!

Reviews.Author: Cynthia A.
Reviews.Content: I give this place a solid 3.5...but I'm feeling generous today so I'll round up. Recently went on a Sunday for lunch and even though my friends and I had a reservation, we had to wait a while before we got seated because all 7 of us could not fit in the space they were going to seat us in. Good thing there is a bar, I got my mimosa sip on and patiently waited.The place is upstairs, not that big, beautiful, elegant, and classy. The view is definitely a FIVE STAR and I can only imagine how amazing the city looks at night. I would definitely love to check it out in the evening while I sip on some cocktails.FOOD: I LOVE Eggs Benedict but the #13 Benedict on the menu did not cut it for me. I got like 6 tiny cut potato squares to go along with my eggs, The ham tasted burnt, which set the tone for my meal. I've definitely had way better for a lot less $$. I don't think I'll dine there again but I would not mind sitting outside on the rooftop and enjoying the view. The atmosphere is pretty cool. There's a DJ that spins on Sunday...but, I think it was more like his iPod on shuffle.

Reviews.Author: Frank K.
Reviews.Content: 15 dollar beers??  seriously?  the view is great...next time i wanna see it, i'll head up to my friend's loft.15 dollars(before tip.  it's not the bartender's fault)??  goodness.   note to owners: there is no way i'd voluntarily go back at those prices.  paying nearly 35 dollars for two beers...you've gotta realize how that's gonna make someone feel.

Reviews.Author: Rukkmini G.
Reviews.Content: It was an amazing night! I was really thrilled with their service, no matter where you came from or what you ordered they were very pleasing. Food was great, so was the band outside!! Loved the place, would definitely recommend it!!

Reviews.Author: Wendy C.
Reviews.Content: Returned on a Wednesday night, the place is always so classy yet casual. to start had the oysters, im not usually a fan but WOW were they tasty!!!  the brie is one of my favorites, but i had to try  the frog legs,  tasted like delicious hot wings, the filet was melt in your mouth, paired with asparagus and a perfect hollandaise sauce.My absolute favorite part tho is desert!!  we had warm, sweet bread pudding and creme brulee that was silky and rich, yum!!!i will be going back asap!!! this is a hot date spot or hang out with friends, type of place....a little french paradise in DTLA....

Reviews.Author: Pierre H.
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING, great views, wonderful french interiors.  The lobby area coming in was very nice, felt like we traveled through time....  Staff & MANAGEMENT SUCKS.... Worse Customer Service EVER      I made a reservation on Open Table for 7:15, Monday July 1st. (which they canceled so I couldn't do a review on Open Table after we left, hopefully this one sticks)  It was my girl friends birthday and I wanted to take her somewhere new and classy.   They  had a great score on YELP.   In my Open Table notes,  I requested a outside table with a good view, as it was my girl friends Birthday.    On the day of the reservation,   I called at 3:30pm to again request a nice table with a view, telling her it was a very special Birthday dinner for my girlfriend, she replied with let me see what I can do for you.  She came back on the phone in a couple of min's and said no problem, they already have you at a table right by the glass edge.  I said  great thank you very much.      We take the elevator ride up, as we walk in the hostess stand had a couple people waiting so we sat on the couch, we waited for a few minutes and when I noticed no one was going to ask if we wanted a drink, I went to the bar.  There was a girl bartender sweating very badly ignoring me as she made drinks for the servers, I waited patiently and after I couldn't get her attention (even thou she was right in front of me, ignoring me), I got the other bartender to help me.    At 6:45pm  I went to check in at the Hostess stand  to let them know we were early.   She asked if we wanted to be seated now and replied yes we are ready when you have a table.  I reminded her that I requested a table by the glass. I watched for the Hostess to come over and let us know that our table was ready, but she never came over to us.  It's now 30 Min's later our reservation was 7:15 so it was no problem, by this time, I'm letting my girlfriend know that it's going to be a bit, because we are getting a glass railing seat.       Still the Hostess doesn't come over or call our name.  7:30  I again go up to the Hostess stand and ask, what's going on?  She shows me a couple tables that are getting up soon and that we can have one of those tables.  Again I see other people come in and get seated by the railing in the seat that she promised, I then complain to her that this is to be a special night for my girl friends Birthday.  She throws her arms up and says I don't care there wasn't any special requests in the reservation book...  I reminded her that I had no only told her, but that I had called earlier making the request.     Now 7:45 I went to look for a manager, finally I get a sever to get someone that could help.   The so called manager comes out (Jude, by the way NEVER would give her name, I had to call the next day to find-out, she's the one with the huge Tattoo on her neck, watch out for her), asks whats the problem?  I get up to talk to her myself and she walks away saying that she will see whats going on.... She returns and when she does I ask her to talk to me so that we can work out the situation.  She refused and wanted to talk right in front of my girlfriend, getting her more upset The manager "Jude" says that "we don't take special requests" to sit by the glass railing, but we could wait for one and most likely it will be 9 before your seated... what a Bit%h...              So, we agree that we will wait to get seated by the railing and after the so called manager "Jude" still wants to argue,  again walks away.  I decide to go outside and take a breather.  I look inside and shes back again arguing with my girl, she then brings us to a table right at the door way between the Hostess stand and the patio area.   Still wanting to put up a fight the manager girl keeps up her attitude, she gets so upset for what ever reason tells my girl, I'm going to get you kicked out of here! she turns to me and says your girl just hit me your out of here.... I was there the whole time and there was never even a hand jester of the sort.    10 min's later the real so called Manager "Erik Sorenon" (he doesn't give his name either, just his first, even when I ask for his card he hand rights Erik@perchla.com) comes out and tells us to leave and when I ask why?  He says because your girl hit my employee.  I asked for proof and he replied we have cameras, I tell him to press charges then and he replies just leave..  OK then lets see it, he of coarse doesn't have the time and can't explain why he couldn't come out and take care of the situation in the first place...  Perch your management has a lot to learn !   I have never been so insulted, humiliated, embarrassed and plain old treated like crap...   When I said we will leave, but we will make sure we leave a comment on YELP about this, he laughs and says, it will just be removed.... Perch is an Advertiser on YELP..so we will see

Reviews.Author: Candace M.
Reviews.Content: Welcomed back!Because of my previous 4 star review, I was personally invited back to Perch to mend any bad experiences I had here. My guest and I were treated ok the first time, but they managed to go above and beyond on our second visit. The management here really cares about the reviews they get, and do their best to make sure everyone gives 5 stars! If you're downtown, you must come to Perch. The views, spirits, live bands and dessert will make it worth your while! Wednesday nights have live jazz bands and an oyster bar. On the weekends, this is the place to be! Pretty much, there's no bad night to be here.  I've told EVERYONE in LA to go to this little gem, and I will be back many many times!

Reviews.Author: Anne Marie G.
Reviews.Content: This place is ALL ambiance!  The view of downtown LA is amazing.  The bar tenders are friendly and the kir royale champagne drinks are delish.  They have a great selection of liquors (creme de cassis, strawberry, raspberry, peach) you can choose from to give your champagne a little kick.  I didn't try the food, but I plan on it next time!Great place to hang with friends or bring a date.

Reviews.Author: Kristen B.
Reviews.Content: MY FAVORITE!I have been here 3 times now, the first time just after they opened & the subsequent times very recently. My first time here was with a group of girlfriends just for drinks. One of my friends had a cocktail that the bartender recommended, the name of which escapes me, but it was really good. I had the creme de cassis, and I loved it! There is a long list of these type of French bevs to choose from. I also liked the fact that the wine menu has a good selection of both red and white wine by the glass and by the bottle, and the pricing was very reasonable by LA standards. It is rare to find an upscale location in LA that offers wine by the glass for under $10!! Regarding ambiance, I walked in and I was instantly impressed. The decor is fab! Very classy. Then I looked outside and I was shocked by the AMAZING view. There is a lot of seating both inside and outside, so you never have to worry about being forced to stand all night. You can tell a lot of thought went into the design of Perch; it really is a gorgeous space. I would feel confident taking anyone here, from my parents to a group of girlfriends to clients. Men- if you want to impress your date, bring them here! Oh and the people here seem to be classier than at a lot of the other DTLA spots. I tried dinner here on my last visit, and everything was really good. I want to clarify that this is NOT "fine" dining. Some reviewers seem to complain that the food is not on par w/ other fine dining establishments in LA. The price point here is under $10 for apps, and $20-$30 for entrees... That price point is on par w/ middle of the road chain restaurants, people! That being said, the food is far better than these type of restaurants. I especially loved the seabass and the truffle fries. There is live music during the weekend, and the female singer can sing!! She covered everything from Etta James to Sam Sparro. I was a happy, happy girl.I will be back next weekend for a bday & I cannot wait! I also plan on trying the Sunday brunch one of these weekends. Perch, you have me hooked.

Reviews.Author: Joseph A.
Reviews.Content: With so many 4 star reviews a while back I had to check Perch out. We came  here on a Saturday night and there was a line. I'm impatient even for 10 minutes and so we left to leave it for a mid week evening.We came out on a Thursday night for drinks. No line downstairs and a clear walk to the elevator and up we go to the 13th floor which takes you to another elevator to get to the 15th floor penthouse. When you exit the Penthouse elevator, you walk into a room that resembles a hotel lobby with some French decor, however, with restaurant tables, couches, and a bar to the side. Outside is an open patio for seating and glass balcony rail without any obstructive views.From the 15th floor is nice view of Pershing Square, Biltmore, and surrounding buildings. Not the best view since it's only 150+ feet up but it's open with a glass rail. Similar view from The Standard rooftop bar.I was expecting signature drinks to be great for a place like this.  Actually, they were horrible, either that or the bartender didn't mix well.  Had the Jacques Collins and another signature drink that were a bit on the sour end, a bad concoction. Drinks were typically DTLA prices $12 each. I should of stuck with Le Beer!I wouldn't mind coming back for dinner another time. As for the signature drinks, I'll stick to whiskey with one rock next time.

Reviews.Author: Brent T.
Reviews.Content: -Subtract 2 stars for boys being on one side of the roof, girls on the other-Subtract 3 stars for the rooftop music befitting a graphic design studio in Latvia, not a French lounge in L.A.-Subtract 1 star for keystone cop doormen speaking into their shirt sleeves and fiddling nervously with their earpieces all night-Subtract 3 stars for two bars that have shot pretty far south of the mark on repeat visits-Add 5 stars for one of L.A.'s best rooftop views.Add it up and you get a one-star wish that this place will fold and a better-executed concept will move in.

Reviews.Author: Alexander H.
Reviews.Content: Non-pretentious, good looking crowd and did I mention that you don't need to be a VIP just to get in? Crosstown rival at the Standard can certainly get that way but I like this place.  Good music and vibes, it's a great place to wind down a long week sitting on top of the roof overlooking downtown LA.  Drinks are a lil bit pricey, 17 bucks for MacAllan on the rocks. I'm sure this place gets packed in the summer.  Keep it classy people.

Reviews.Author: Brenda S.
Reviews.Content: No! not unless you want someone to call you, text you and email you to confirm reservations.......and then when you get there......oh I'm sorry...I do see your reservation, unfortunately We don't have tables. We can sit you here? In a dark corner with two chairs that made me feel like I was a 7 year old on time-out. My boyfriend and I tried to make the best of it. Everyone makes mistakes right? We order two water down drinks which we didn't even care to finish. Paid and left. Never again Perch NEVER!

Reviews.Author: Sid P.
Reviews.Content: I finally made it back to sample the food...BAAAARRRRRRRRFFFFFFFF!But if you must -- stick with the appetizers.I have nothing else nice to say and my original review says it all.

Reviews.Author: Qanelle J.
Reviews.Content: I went to the soft opening last night all thanks to the 2 Jews and a Blonde.  A bunch of my friends came with me to enjoy the newest "hotspot" in LA.With a soft opening, I knew that the place would still be getting its act together, so I didn't expect service to be well polished or everything organized.Things I liked were that this place will have 3 floors. We were only allowed to see 2 floors with one being the rooftop.  Great views of the city, however, I like to view of DTLA Standard more because the location is surrounded by tall buildings.  The views are probably on par with Eleveate Lounge.  Perch only has tall buildings on one side and the other sides are the same height or shorter.  Perch has a lot of room, and from the max capacity on each floor, the two floors can hold about 300+ people, which is definitely a lot more than DTLA Standard.  For the soft opening, they provided a variety of cheese, bread, fruit, hummus, oysters, pastries, and frogs legs.  Benjamin the executive chef was kind enough to explain to me and others what he was serving.  I have a good feeling that at least the menu will be good.Since it's not fully finished, I noticed a lot of things not working.  Lack of water in the bathrooms at the end of the night was odd to me. Some of the cabinets lacked front doors.  I even saw a maintenance guy removing one of the bar's front cabinet doors.  In terms of aesthetic detail, this place won't blow you away when you see it.  If Edison's interior is the best in DTLA, Perch is no where near that.  In fact, I think Mas Malo's interior is a lot more impressive than Perch.  For some reason, it felt that the owners skimped on spending money on the aesthetics.The last negative comment I have was with Rachel, who is apparently one of the owners of the place.  While at the bar, I asked a person who was getting something from a cabinet about the establishment.  Since she was getting something from the cabinet, I assumed that she worked there and I wanted to get more information regarding potential private parties.  Rachel (who I didn't know was the owner at the time) was pretty curt and came off as rude.  She just said, "Go to the website and email your question."  I said, "Okay but who will answer the email?"  She said, "Listen, I'm the owner so I know where the email will go and someone will answer it."    Then she stormed off to go back doing whatever task was on her mind at the time.Even my friend was amazed at her 'customer service.'  Hopefully, she's in charge of logistics and doesn't teach her staff any customer service techniques.  I have a feeling that once this place opens and gets popular (which I know it will b/c it's the new hotness) attitudes of staff may become really crappy.

Reviews.Author: Chris R.
Reviews.Content: Note* this place is categorized as a lounge and not as a restaurant- the food service reflects this. Great Ambiance and good drinks redeem the 4th star

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: Had ressies for a large party and we had a reserved area (love the view).Take the elevator to the 13th floor. On 13 you will be directed to another elevator where you can go to 15 or the top level on 16.15 is the main area, cozy atmosphere, definitely comfortable. if this doesn't satisfy you head up to 16. On a cool fall evening it was still warmish lol, what with the fireplaces and heaters.Drinks are right at the level of being pricey but whatever.As far as the food on the night we went everything was under cooked in my opinion, much closer to rare than medium...Lamb sliders are good but you better like lamb...duh, but seriously tastes like lamb not beef so you better like lamb.Mac n Cheese was very good, loved the ham.Skewers are good but beef was almost rare.Truffle Fries are addictive! We ordered 4 or 5 orders amongst our group.* Meter outside are free after 4pm mon-fri but watch the signs** if you are simple beer guy heck if you really like beer get the Kronenbourg***I wouldn't argue with a 3.5 rating

Reviews.Author: Christie K.
Reviews.Content: Now this is LA! I don't know about the food at all because I didn't have any. I just went here to hang out with some friends. The cocktails were really good! Prices are what you'd expect for a rooftop bar (meaning $$). I love the laid back atmosphere unlike the Standard's roof top bar. And the music isn't blasting so I could actually hear my friends talking. Tip: Don't wear painful high heels, you might have to climb up some stairs

Reviews.Author: Qui C.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Perch twice in once week. I guess that's just how much I liked it. It's everything you imagined LA to be - cocktails, upscale bar food, city lights, crisp air, etc. Highly recommended that you don't come here with big groups though, it's not that kind of place. We waited in line to for the rooftop bar both times and it was worth it. The restaurant and lounge area just below that is pretty nice too, without ever having to wait. I haven't come here just for the food but I just might next time as some of the appetizers we ordered were delicious! Bring friends from out of town here. It's a good show-off place for LA.

Reviews.Author: The Mystery Englishman X.
Reviews.Content: Very hip very cool and great downtown rooftop views. Food was very good and service excellent. Can't really think of a negative. You need to reserve for sure while this place is hot. (If you are on the balcony take a sweater even if summer because it can get cool and breezy suddenly)

Reviews.Author: Kamie P.
Reviews.Content: Probably one of my favorite spots in DTLA, and a staple for taking friends from out of town. Classy but relaxed rooftop lounge with food (get the pork belly, truffle poutine, & squash gnocchi) and cocktails that are on point. If you dislike crowds, go during a weekday or make a reservation and skip the complaints. Perch is one of those well-rounded spots that's great for dates or going out with friends...or one of those nights where you feel like pretending you're at a NYC rooftop bar in summer.

Reviews.Author: Kevin S.
Reviews.Content: Such a great place. The view, the drinks and most definitely the gate keepers that give you entry to the wonderful place that is the perch. :)An iconic landmark for the DTLA bar scene.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth O.
Reviews.Content: If you go to bars to drink in the great decor, then you'll get a nice buzz from Perch.  But if you go to bars looking to drink and catch a nice buzz, then you'll be disappointed like I was with Perch.I organized for two-dozen of my officemates to check out Perch, a few blocks away from our office at the U.S. Bank Tower.  Frankly, if you want to great city views high above downtown, I may as well take my USBT elevator to the top and carry along a flask.  Because I'd get to drink more than I did than we did at Perch.I called ahead asking if they would reserve an outdoor spot if we came by around 5:30pm for a drink.  They took my name down, so we headed there instead of going to Chaya's outdoor area.  We got to Perch by 5:45pm.  The hostess promised to seat us somewhere outside, and then she took a phone call and had us standing around for 5-10 minutes (despite nobody else arriving at that time, because it wasn't super busy).  By then, my colleagues decided to start ordering drinks directly from the bar.  I tried to convince them that we should wait to order from our outdoor table, since I wanted to be sensitive to the wait staff person who would ultimately be waiting on us.  It's happy hour, and despite seeing about 4-5 wait staff walking around the tables, they only had one bartender working.  The hostess finally re-engaged us after her phone call to seat us at 5:55pm.  Again, I point out that there was nobody else waiting to be seated besides us.  And nearly all the indoor tables had "reserved" signs...despite being totally empty.  She seated us--while many of my colleagues continued to wait to get the one bartender's attention (she was clearly overwhelmed by the crowd); we got seated in what felt like an outdoor alley apart from the main crowd.  The hostess remarked that we had about 3 minutes left for happy hour, so we better hurry.  (OK, that's why we arrived at 5:45pm!!!)  Meanwhile, the whole time, none of the wait staff came by to take our drink orders.  Eventually we had to go inside to order our drinks.I had to explain to the bartender that we had been there 20 minutes, and that nobody came out to get our drinks.  She still charged some of us the non-happy hour prices.  Why get to a bar early enough if their service is so slow that you end up having to pay for the non-happy hour prices.I should have gotten the beer because my happy hour red wine tasted like it had been sitting in tin foil.  I'm a big wine fan, and yet my wine was so disappointing that part of me actually wished it was at least as good as Two Buck Chuck.One of my colleagues got one of their signature pink drinks...a modified Cosmo.  It wasn't cheap, and although she said it was good, it came in such a small glass that I thought that I've drank mouthwash with bigger pours than that.The interior is definitely cool.  I'll give them that.The view from up top?  Well, that novelty lasts for about 10 seconds.  Then you realize that you're looking down on Pershing Square.  If you've been to Pershing Square,  you know what I'm talking about.  Our office makes us park there, and people still worry about their safety, despite the army of security guards they have there.We discovered that there's a nicer second floor patio space where we actually could have had a nice table.  So we gave up our table downstairs.  After about 5 minutes, a manager told us that we couldn't be up there.  To his credit, he promised to find us a spot inside to replace the table we had given up.  So we took one of the couch areas that had the "reserved" signs when we came in.  I think they keep those signs there to give the impression that they're popular.  I doubt I'll ever take my officemates to Perch again.  Although the wait staff wasn't impolite, I'm not going to say that they're competent either.  Not if I have to go to a bar and go thirsty.You would have thought that Perch would want to make a good impression on a group of friends who work nearby visiting their bar for the first time!  But nope, that wasn't the case.  I'll stick to the all-night happy hours at Chaya, or even the food specials at McCormick's.Perch Management:  train your staff to be more attentive, especially to local firms that might have considered hosting other employee after-work events there.  I still don't understand the buzz about the Downtown LA bar scene.  Perhaps better on the weekends than during the weeknight happy hours.  When I first started working in DTLA, I imagined all these white-collar professionals all stampeding out of the skyscrapers and into the bars at the same time like in NYC.  But I have yet to find the great mix between drinks and people that exist in West LA.

Reviews.Author: Andrew N.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of the logistics of this place. You get in line outside, get your ID check, get on the elevator, and press the button for the 13th floor. At this point you're probably thinking, "Yes! We finally got in. That wasn't so bad." But wait, there's more! You get out of the elevator into an empty hallway and the bouncers direct you into a small, dark, and dilapidated room that is NOT a rooftop bar. It turns out that they have three bars on the 13th, 15th, and 17th floor.Perch occupies the 15th and 17th floor but you can't get up there if it's too crowded so they stuff you into Thirteen Bar. When there's more room upstairs, the bouncers will let some people walk up the stairs to the 15th floor. When there's room on the exclusive 17th floor (the real rooftop bar), they'll let you take the stairs up to the roof top. Needless to say, everybody's always restless on the 13th and 15th floor because they want to move up to the top. Was it worth it? I'd say yes. The rooftop is the best but if you're not too eager to get up there, the 15th floor is also pretty nice with an outside balcony that overlooks a decent part of downtown LA. The vibe and atmosphere are great. There are plenty of nice seats, chairs, and tables where people lounge around and enjoy their drinks. The drinks were pretty cheap for a rooftop bar and weren't bad at all. The crowd was pretty cool and trendy. Most of the crowd was Asians in their mid 20's to early 30's, probably in grad school or fresh in the workforce. It is a relatively young crowd compared to most of the other bars in LA (You know the one with all the creepy old guys? *cough*7grand*cough*) but I still felt like a kid here. Overall, Perch is a good place with a view to get a drink, sit around, and talk with friends.  I will probably come back, but I'm not looking forward to waiting at Bar Thirteen.

Reviews.Author: Del T.
Reviews.Content: This is DTLA at its best.City lights, skyline, and pricey upscale drinks.The food here is tasty, and small bites can really add to the drinks and night scene. Come here by 9pm to beat the last night madness. - reservations are always a great idea.

Reviews.Author: Rose K.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place. Beautiful views of downtown, great place to meet with friends have a drink or 2 and listen to live music. Would also recommend this place for dates. Will be coming back for sure.

Reviews.Author: Picabo S.
Reviews.Content: Ugh people!  Everyone that knows me, knows that I use Yelp like the Bible.  Wait, I don't use a Bible.  So I guess that was a poor simile because I actually do use Yelp.  Almost religiously sometimes.  Anywho, what I'm trying to say is that I was completely deceived by the Yelp reviews for this establishment.  So here's what happened:One evening during Perch's opening week, I happened to notice the valet stand and the plaque outside of the building as I was walking to my car after work.  I thought to myself, "Hmmm, what could this place be?"  I pull out my BlackBerry (yes, I use a BlackBerry you goddamn hipsters, don't judge!! ;P) and Yelp it.  There were about 20 or so reviews and all were pretty positive.  I got really excited inside and promised myself that I'd check the place out asap.  On Thursday or Friday of that week I ended up at Perch.  I expected a Villains Tavern/Harvard & Stone/Edison vibe times 10.  But when those elevator doors opened I definitely wasn't transplanted to some cat's pajamas speakeasy from The Great Gatsby.  Nothing hotsy-totsy about it, folks.Atmosphere/Decor - The decor is so blah.  It's almost as if they ordered the furniture from the same place Days Inn or Fairfield Inn purchases furniture for their rooms and on-site restaurant/free breakfast area.  I thought the vessels they served giggle water in were the bee's knees.  Upon closer examination the neat looking etched "grooves" on the rims were actually chips in the glass.  We tell the bartender and she's so unapologetic about it ("Oh ya.  We seem to have that problem with most of the glasses that were shipped to us.").  She didn't even offer to switch out the glass, we had to ask her to do it!  Dumb Dora. The Roof - Wanted to check out the roof patio/bar.  We walked past security dude #1 at the base of the stairs who just smiled at us.  But as I got to the top and walked towards the center of the roof I nearly got tackled by security dude #2.  Why?  Because I'm that irresistible, that's why.  I kid, I kid.  It was because a private birthday party was about to begin, they were "at capacity" (absolute rubbish), and that maybe we should try coming back later in the evening.  Come on Security Dude #2!  Maybe, just maybe, you should have communicated this to Security Dude #1 so that he could have performed his duties as a gatekeeper.  And maybe learn how to interact and deal with people verbally rather than tackling them because that would be swell.In sum, I was really underwhelmed and disappointed.  Mostly because the place has soooooooooooooo much potential.  So much.  I wish the owners would give this joint to me to redesign.  The thought of that makes me salivate because that's how awesome it COULD be.

Reviews.Author: Angelie D.
Reviews.Content: I went here a couple of Fridays ago for a girls night out. 15th floor is where you can order the food and enjoy some live music. This is your first stop. The view from here is pretty good. The decor is old classic vintage. There is only one bar, so expect some delay to your drinks. They only hold basic liquor and wine. You can't order an apple martini because they don't have the apple liquor. You can't order a 7&Coke because they think it's 7-up and Coke hahahah. You can't order a Vodka and pineapple because they don't have pineapple!!!! We ended up ordering vodka tonic and two cosmopolitans. The glasses were so small, I think I took one sip and saw the bottom of the glass! We couldn't even go up to the top right away. Apparently they close it down when it gets too crowded. We waited about 20 minutes before we were allowed upstairs. We get up there and the crowd seemed dead. It wasn't even PACKED! We take a couple of pictures of the view, which was great! Other than that... I was over it! The bathrooms were dirty and small. I would only go back if I wanted a very chill night where I can just sit down and enjoy a drink or two.

Reviews.Author: Nancy T.
Reviews.Content: Rooftop bar! Similar to the ambiance at... Villians tavern ( another great place to try in DTLA) , Edison, Cana Rum. Great for dates, friends, visitors.-Great drinks ($11-$13 per drink)-Awesome view especially in the evening-Seating ( couches ) + heaters- I have yet to try the food here, but I will soon!- My friend lives about a block away so we walked here..

Reviews.Author: Alen L.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Saturday night for a small gathering.Mojito: 3/5Margarita: 2/5Redbull Vodka: 5/5 (You can't mess this one up....)Beer Selection: 2/5My Food Rating = BAmbience/Decor: 4/5 View: 4.5/5Service: 4/5Clean: 4/5 My Experience Rating: ALocation: 4/5Wait: 2/5Hours: 4/5Parking: 2/5My Convenience Rating: B-Pros:- Nice rooftop view of downtown Los Angeles from Pershing Square.- The bouncer was super nice and friendly.
