He cracked jokes with us, and teased us a bit, and sort of looked like Bernie Mac.- Friendly bartender too.- Crowd was mostly young professionals and older.- The music here wasn't too loud, making it easy to hold a conversation.- No cover charge!Cons:- Long line/wait to get in.- Only 15/16 floors high, but this is LA not NYC, so who cares.- Pricey drinks, cocktails are about $14 each, served in the short glass.Tip: Take elevator to 13F, then walk across hall, take second elevator to 15F.Tip: There is a flight of stairs that takes you to the 16F.Tip: Go there in small groups or you won't find seats.Tip: Definitely make reservations in advance if you can.Tip: Very close to the Metro Red Line Pershing Square Station. Save yourself valetfee if you can.Tip: Bring a jacket just in case you don't get seated close enough to a heat lamp.Bottom Line: We had a great time. It's always nice to go to a place where the bouncer treats you with respect and the bartenders are friendly. The view here makes it even better. This place is versatile, a good place to have a drink with your co-workers, and yet romantic enough for a date. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Author: Joyce M.
Reviews.Content: A gem in the city.I really really enjoy this place. It's beautiful, cozy, classy, calm, and overlooks onto the Downtown LA skyline. I like it way more than the Standard. It's the perfect place to hang out with friends on a quiet night.The best things about this place are the Royals. It's a shot of liquer in champagne. I had the St. Germaine Elderflower and might I say, I could not even taste alcohol. They go for $10 a pop but are definitely worth it. I can't wait to come back here.

Reviews.Author: Kory L.
Reviews.Content: A group of us went to Perch last night.  The view is a 5 star.  The hostess told us they were completely full - no tables available.  I asked if we could just walk around and look, which we did.  We saw empty tables everywhere so we just sat down.  Drinks were ok - expensive but ok.  We took one look at the menu and decided to eat at Chaya - same prices as Chaya!  Service was non-existent - we finally got up and got our drinks ourselvesThe decor is down-market  thrift store but the view is worth the trip.I hope they get their act together.  Great location.  Bad service. Bad attitudes.  Expensive

Reviews.Author: ilana t.
Reviews.Content: Don't be taken in by the lure of a rooftop view like I did - twice. I will never endure the bad service, bad management, and amateur mixed concoctions again. First of all, I am a pretty easy customer, not likely to give a bad review, but this place is so exceptionally bad I had to.My last visit was for a friend's birthday party which was on the rooftop, oh wait, but not the first rooftop, the other rooftop, that you have to take an extra elevator... oh well, never mind, it's too confusing and you hopefully won't be subjected to the place anyway. Regardless of the path you take to get to the upper roof, the KGB security farces... ehem, forces... they have barricading the stairs told our group that they were at capacity upstairs. After 45 minutes of being given the runaround (I would have left if it were not that I wanted to give my friend his gift) we went up to the other rooftop to find a pathetic scene with generic house music, bad house wine, and that it was in fact NOT at capacity. Not sure what illusion they are trying to create, but the sunset strip vibe of the management is incongruous with the casual "French" décor and the view. What a waste of a beautiful location.

Reviews.Author: Sally N.
Reviews.Content: Had a spontaneous girl's night out at Perch yesterday.Drinks: I had My Fair Lady and my GF had Midnight in Paris. Both were good but alcohol level seem to be off for both drinks. Mine was wayyy too strong and hers tasted too watered down.Food: A-Okay. FROMAGE + CHARCUTERIE PLATE: I can totally put this together at home. Cheese cut, dried fruits, nuts, and chefs choice of 2 meats. Nothing really stood out to me. ARUGULA + ENDIVE: I love greens. This salad was very fresh and perfectly dressed. The cheese, grapes, and candied walnuts paired well with the vinaigrette. WILD MUSHROOM RISOTTO: This was okay. Just risotto and mushrooms. BACON MAC N' CHEESE: (without bacon) Good portion for the cost. $10.SERVICE: Horrible. Just horrible. Walked up to the hostess stand and was immediately asked to wait while we watch the hostess circle the patio. (keep in mind, we didn't even ask to sit outside) She returned and told us to follow her. She walked us to a small dinette table outside close to the outer railing. My first thought was, "man, tonight is really cold" and naturally looked up in the air for a heating lamp. (uh, why would you even think about seating us in this freezing cold weather WITHOUT a heating lamp and on top of that didn't even confirm with us if outdoor seating was even ok.) Anyway, i cut to the chase and told her I wanted a table inside. We got a table and was immediately greeted by the water server. He was simply just that, a water server. He told us our real server will be with us shortly. Smiled and left.7 min later: Server walked up and greeted us. Stared at us for a few seconds in silence and then told us she'd be right with us. Uh, my girlfriend and I looked at each other and automatically thought... AWKWARD! After she sped off, we pretty much watched her circle the whole dining area going about 100mph and definitely flustered with the work load. She walked super fast but didn't seem to bend her knees AND made weird 90 degree turns around everything. Maybe she thought she was holding her composure but we noticed the frustration she was going through. After a few more minutes of waiting for her to come back to take our order...I was already impatient and anxious to ask her about their vegetarian options. I asked and her one and only answer was SALADS. (she was affirmative with that answer might I add) Are you serious? That's it? After she said, Yes 2 more times....I  got pretty upset because in the back of my head I was more than positive an extravagant place like PERCH in "health conscious LA" had more vegetarian options than just salads. So that's when I pulled the menu back out and asked about the Bacon MAC n Cheese and Mushroom Risotto. Of course by now, she felt very embarrassed that she for ONE, doesn't know the menu well enough to recommend anything to me and TWO she was too in a rush to spend anytime on the menu presentation. I ended up getting the Mac n Cheese without the bacon and the mushroom risotto...AND a salad. We told her we were sharing these plates prior to her leaving the table but she never returned with small plates. Salad arrives and still no plates! We then asked the food expo to bring us some. He walked over to the cupboard behind us, looked inside, and walked away. My first thought was, they're probably out of stock on plates up here so he'll def go grab some in the back. NEVER RETURNED. We finished most of our salad but for the most part, it ended up on the table...THANKS. Ten minutes slowly past and finally our hot dishes arrived. They were all good considering how hungry we were by then. Server never checked up on us until the very end AFTER we finished our dinner. We asked for the check. Paid. Left. THE ENDTotal check was about $80. Not worth it.One star for this experience but I'm leaving 2 because I would like to give brunch a try sometime soon.

Reviews.Author: Andy R.
Reviews.Content: The View is amazing and the atmospher is also awesome 5 stars.  Now the drinks compared to other bars in downtown LA are just about average 3 stars.

Reviews.Author: Nicole D.
Reviews.Content: I went here on a Sunday night to their rooftop bar. It was really nice and very cute. I loved the decor of the place and how it had this old, vintage feel to the place. There were 2 levels, I stayed on the lower level. I was very pleased with the music. It was a combination of old and new songs and my favorite part about the music was that the female dj did NOT play house/EDM the whole time. =) The crowd seemed like an older crowd and there was a good amount of people but it wasnt too crowded (probably because it was a sunday night).The drinks were a little bit on the more expensive side but that was expected because its a unique LA bar. All in all, I was impressed but I'm not sure if I would go out of my way to go to Perch.

Reviews.Author: Tara D.
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd update my review with my personal favorite drinks/dishes from my most recent visit:- The Fancy Navel - although I'm slightly embarrassed to order a drink with this name, I loved it.  Requested it extra spicy and it was extra awesome.- House red was absolutely delicious and well-balanced for my meal (not sure what it was, but I'd sure drink it again.)- The Pork Confit Cassoulet (aka Pork & Beans) - pork three ways, incl. pork belly.  OMFG.  Running back for this one.- All three desserts hit the mark, and covered a nice range (apple fruit tart, beignets with dips, or a chocolate mousse with a touch of a berry compote.)I was not a big fan of the frog legs (mine were overcooked and had negligible seasoning) nor the 3/4 French (specialty cocktail - it was a bit like a too-sweet old-fashioned, but others might love it.)I continue to love the servers here.  I was here for a second pre-opening night, and while they didn't nail everything 100% perfectly, they tried really hard, and were patient and charming.  When this crew hits their stride, they will be a force to be reckoned with.

Reviews.Author: Casey C.
Reviews.Content: I love it here. Great atmosphere, great views, great drinks. Chill people, chill staff. I came for drinks and lounge, arriving on a Satuday night a tad bit before 10pm. There was a short line outside but we didn't wait long. And you could tell they weren't making you wait for no good reason. When we got up there, the crowd was nice, not too busy but plenty for interesting people watching and atmosphere. There was a live band/singer outside on the patio and she had a lovely voice. The music varied and I was glad it wasn't too loud. They had a good number of heat lamps scattered so it gave a bit of warmth in the cool night. They serve dinner but i never tried the food. Drink-wise, they are generous enough with the alcohol, while keeping the cocktails tasty. I visited 2 of their bars set up, one on the roof and one inside. Both made drinks well. I must say they have an awesome fresh ginger ale! My non drinking friend ordered that, and when I tried it and finished my own drink, I order that too! Forget alcohol, I'd drink that all night :) You can definitely taste the ginger, it is fresh, and not overly sweet. It's nothing like the usual stuff you get at the market and def not the coke/sprite mix some places use.

Reviews.Author: Andrea P.
Reviews.Content: "I hope this is better than Space Mountain. Or else I'll be freaking pissed." - my friend while waiting in the FIRST line to get into the building. We pretty much felt like we were waiting in line at Disneyland. We got there at 11pm and it took almost an hour until we finally got up to the rooftop.It's true, after you enter the building and go up to the 15th floor, you get to a bar/ restaurant area where you can get drinks and sit down before you get into the SECOND line to actually go up to the rooftop.The rooftop itself is kinda small (compared to the standard) but it's got a gorgeous view of Pershing square and all of the lights in downtown LA. Cocktails were strong and not as expensive as I thought they'd be (around $12 ish). Lots of seating, heaters and even a fire pit to keep you warm!They do Sunday brunch with live jazz from 11am-3pm, I want to come back to try that! The view alone makes the wait for this rooftop bar worth it. Also I can't complain cuz there's no cover :) Perch is definitely worth checking out and is somewhere I would bring visitors.COME EARLY (like before 10pm) to avoid the 45min-1hr wait in line.Valet parking $9. Between Perch and the Standard - Perch is bit smaller with a classy and old school French twist. The Standard is bigger, more mod with a pool and water beds. I can't choose.... I like both.So was it better than Space  Mountain?... I think not :P

Reviews.Author: Gabriela G.
Reviews.Content: PerchThe Super Hype of Perch made me think it was overrated; but when I got there for my friend's birthday celebration, I was blown away by the GREAT atmosphere it exuded. Classy, elegant, beautiful, clean, and with great views of the city we all Love.The rooftop was mellow and the perfect setting for a chill evening away from loud teenagers and smelly dives. Don't get me wrong...I love Dives, in fact, La Cita just a block away from Perch is one of my favorite dive bars in LA, but sometimes we're in the mood for elegance, architecture, open air and $8-$16 drinks overlooking the skyline.A more adult crowd was also relaxing. More elegant than most bars, men in suits, women in cocktail dresses and stilettos. Hipsters in their best bow-ties and combed mustaches sip amidst the wannabe Hollywood elite and the Downtown Entrepreneurs, amidst foodies and Cocktail aficionados.

Reviews.Author: bob t.
Reviews.Content: Cool place for a drink over looking Pershing Square.  Can't vouch for the food as we only popped in for a quick drink before catching dinner elsewhere on a Friday night.  We caught the end of the sunset and the view was really cool.  There was a couple sitting in an area with like 6 empty seats and we asked if it was ok for us to sit down.  The woman rather snootily replied that they had friends that were joining them.  I sat down and told her we'd happily move when they arrived - none of them did by the time we were ready to leave - Bitch!Definitely cool, expensive drinks but your paying for the view too.  Guy manning the elevator told us they had a band playing later, may have to come back and check that out.

Reviews.Author: Anita I.
Reviews.Content: elevator up to the top, drinks at the bar, free bread, amazing view, breezy summer night.  I love it all!  The space outdoors is really chill and they play some perty good musica as well. Def going to be my new go to spot. w h a t   i   d i g  tiny lights, fire place, view.

Reviews.Author: Violet K.
Reviews.Content: I liked the little bird next to the elevator button.I also like the location and view. Everything else pretty much sucked.1. Waitresses are SLOW!2. Drinks get smaller3. Food is HORRIBLE4. I asked for a fuckin straw with my 1st drink and NOTHING till my 3rd drink!5. I asked for the tab and waited 30 minutes to get it! 6. When they get me my new drink, I need to get my previous drink cleared!7. There is no eye candy8. Did i mention the food is horrible? Oh but the bathrooms had purple tiles!We ordered the bone marrow, duck duck goose, mussels and broccolini salad.Bone Marrow was good but the crostini that came with it was NASTY!Duck duck goose tasted like jam. too sweet and too much bread.mussels were the only decent item.broccolini salad was meh...

Reviews.Author: Connie L.
Reviews.Content: This is a really cute new rooftop lounge in downtown LA. For the rooftop, make sure you take the elevator all the way up then go up the flight of stairs until you're at the top. Only complaint is that they don't have a lot of different juice mixes at the bar. I ordered a vodka pineapple. No pineapple juice, no lemonade, but they did have orange juice. Other than that, nice place to come and have drinks.

Reviews.Author: Duke C.
Reviews.Content: Nice spot in DTLA to hangout with friends.Perch is a rooftop bar, but the feel is totally different compared to The Standard.  You travel up the elevators after being checked by the bouncers and Perch itself is somewhat of a hidden oasis.  Never expected a place like Perch when you're down there waiting.Bar isn't that big, and not very well-stocked.  I ordered an Old Fashion, but they serve it muddled, and not really a fan of muddled.  Tried a few special cocktails and while some were good, a few were forgettable.  I've yet to find the go-to drink at Perch, or maybe I'll just ask for a beer next time :P  Drinks are on the pricier side.Besides that, the laidback atmosphere is very welcoming and there's a nice view of DT too.  On the cold days, they do provide blankets and heat lamps, but the place isn't that big.  On the warmer nights, the place is popular and expect to wait a bit in line.  Also, if it gets too crowded on the roof, they do direct you towards the top floors instead of letting you up there directly.  Most people come for the rooftop so it's a little disappointing when you're stuck on one of the top floors.There are tables and seats, but people rarely give it up.  Younger crowd (students, young professionals).  Some nights it's like Asian invasion but generally, fairly mixed crowd.Overall, like the place!  I just need to find a drink for me at The Perch.

Reviews.Author: Momo O.
Reviews.Content: New favorite rooftop bar in LA! Great view, located on the 16th (&17th floor) of the building. The drinks here are DELICIOUS! The bartenders know whats up. The main bar on the 16th floor was extremely busy so it took my friends forever to get drinks but worth it. First drink I had was a mixed drink with gin topped with saffron.. interesting but tasty. Stumbled our way to the rooftop above the rooftop, and it was much less packed and there was another small bar. The bartender made me a special drink on-the-spot that was SO. GOOD. A mix of goose and 2 other french liqueur. And whats great about it is that the drink was delicious and only $8! Makes me so happy :) I'm coming back for the view and this special drink.downer: there's two lines for entry.. one for downtown LA residents (VIP line, no wait) and a line for everyone else. my friends and I waited probably about a half hour to get in.

Reviews.Author: Erika U.
Reviews.Content: Well, I like it. It's like the Edison on a roof.  I could probably get stood up here and I'd be aight. PRO: I could see my office building from their roof. CON: I could see my office building from their roof.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca M.
Reviews.Content: This would be a 4 or 5 star review, if not for a the hiccups they're still working out.We went on a Saturday evening for a friend's birthday, planning to drink on the rooftop until our 10:00 dinner reservation, which was the earliest we could get. HICCUP 1 - We arrived around 8:30, we asked if they'd had any openings so we could eat earlier, and the hostess pointed to one of the bar tables, all empty and marked 'Reserved', and said that was our table for the whole night, so we could eat whenever, go up to the bar whenever, pretty much hold court all night. Didn't make a lot of sense based on the reservation process, but good news!Our server, Josh, was fabulous. Asked and remembered our names, made great recommendations, and gave us good inside gossip. HICCUP 2 - The cocktail and food menus had just expanded, and he hadn't tasted everything - but that's management's fault. The drinks and food were all excellent. HICCUP 3 - Two people in our party were running late, and at 9:30 they texted to say they were stuck in line downstairs, despite the fact that they were included in our reservation and we had open chairs for them. After several visits to the hostess desk and an impatient manager, one of us went with the manager down all 15 floors to the line to get them in. HICCUP 4 - Apparently, the valets ask if you live downtown, and if you say yes, you get in a shorter line. Odd, and probably illegal.HICCUP 5 - Word was that the line consisted mostly of Asian club kids, and we'd heard there was a fight and someone puking on the floor in the previous week, so part of the strict line management was an attempt to keep club types out. As it got later, you could definitely tell that they couldn't decide whether they're a restaurant/lounge or a lounge/club. Low lighting, loud music, and prominent DJ suggest club, but strict crowd control and relaxed vibe suggest bar/lounge. That needs to be figured out.After dinner, we went up to the bar, which is gorgeous (although they don't serve the restaurant's signature cocktails - HICCUP 6.) At one point, two of our party went to the restroom - which requires going back downstairs - and, HICCUP 7 - after 30 minutes, came back to report that they had to wait in line again to get back upstairs. In fact, they only managed it when a fight broke out at the bar, and the guy controlling the stairs vacated his post. Listen Perch people, either find a way to let people pee hassle-free, or you're going to have a mess in those nice potted plants.At the end of the night, one of us went all the way down 15 floors on two slow elevators to discover that the valet was closed, and everyone's keys were at the bar. HICCUP 8. Nothing unusual about that system, but you have to find a way to let your patrons know.So if Perch can get their management issues worked out, it will be fantastic. If not, not.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany W.
Reviews.Content: I love Perch! Classy, elegant, and understated. Would come here over and over again for a quaint and low-key Saturday night on the town. Don't come dressed as a slut, wear something classy and trendy, as if you were a modern aristocrat.I came here on a Saturday night with the boyfriend. No cover! The elevators are a bit of a pain (and probably nightmare when it's crowded) but once you're out, you're transported across the world to a trendy Parisian lounge.Lots of seating area, so this is a fabulous place to sit and chit-chat with friends. The balcony is gorgeous with amazing views of Downtown. We sat in a cozy corner near a fireplace with a spectacular view of the Deloitte building to remind me of my imminent indentured servitude to the accounting giant. But that didn't stop me from enjoying my night.The drinks are quite unique and averagely-priced for a DTLA bar. We ordered a few rounds, which included the My Fair Lady and French 64. There was one more drink that my boyfriend didn't like, and we decided it tasted like one of those Chinese-boxed drinks that you find at Asian supermarkets. Needless to say, he was not a fan since we weren't expecting those flavors at a Parisian-inspired establishment.I didn't get a chance to try their food because the kitchen closed, but their food menu looks spectacular and I definitely will come back for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Mario P.
Reviews.Content: I came across this gem in Downtown on a weekday evening after leaving my office. I met up with a buddy of mine and we took the elevator to the top and we entered a different world. Definitely lots of folks rolling in style and overall pretty classy. If you reach the rooftop area you'll see that you're perched atop a building with an amazing 360 view of the Downtown skyline. The drinks are pricey but then again that shouldn't be a shocker. The live jazz band was pretty amazing and I definitely will be heading back soon. I look forward to hanging with good people and sharing some good conversations and catching a good buzz.

Reviews.Author: Ngoc V.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner for my BFF's 30th birthday and was very disappointed with the service. We had a reservation for 10 people at 8:45pm.  Most of us got there by 8:30.  When our whole party arrived at 8:45, we informed the front desk and they said "just a few more mins, they're cleaning the table".  Almost 30 mins later, we had to ask them again about the table.  When we finally got seated, there were no napkins or setting, and we had to ask the bus boy several times to have our server come take our orders.When the food arrived, everything was better. I ordered the Seafood Bouillabaisse and it was delicious!  Shrimps were huge and there were plenty of seafood.We were supposed to go to the rooftop bar after dinner, but by the time we were done with dinner (10:30pm), the line to go upstairs was quite long, and they were letting people in as people exited, so forget that. I would give Perch 1 star for service, 4 stars for food, 4 stars for venue (great view of downtown la, even just on the restaurant floor), therefore my overall rating is 3 stars.  Would I come back here for dinner? Probably not.

Reviews.Author: Byron N.
Reviews.Content: Perch is pretty darn nice!  I mean, it has to be.  How could you mess up a rooftop bar/restaurant with a great view?  The elevators to go up reminds me of something from Disneyland.  The atmosphere is elegant; there are paintings on the wall, dimmed lightly, and very fashionable employees.  Go outside and the recipe is the same: elegance with a view of parts of downtown.  We were able to sit on the couches, something you might have to fight for, and it was comfy; I felt like I should be smoking a cigar while stroking my mustache.  Prices are what you'd expect from a sort of high end spot.  I guess you get what you pay for, along with the atmosphere.  The crowd though, probably sets me apart from it.  It seems like a place more suitable for the older crowd, maybe close to 30's?  No offense! but that was my experience.  I might've been one of the only ones not suited up.  Maybe I'd come here more when I win the lottery.

Reviews.Author: Vicki T.
Reviews.Content: Originally, I wanted to pick Perch as the host for my recent birthday dinner.  I figure that since it's such a beautiful venue, I would just have friends join me for dinner and then drinks at the rooftop.  However, the dinner prices were a bit on the pricier side so I opted to just come here for drinks after dinner elsewhere.  This venue is gorgeous!  I love the exclusiveness it eludes by having to take a couple elevator rides up to the 16th floor.  The décor, music, and bartenders' attire all tie together very well to present a Parisian front.  For the evening, my friends and I occupied a section of seats near the edge of the roof.  It was a perfect night with fair weather and clear skies, optimal opportunity to be outdoors and admire the beautiful city lights of Downtown LA.  If your drink hasn't warmed you up yet, then there are a handful of heating stands that you can huddle under.  The drinks there are pretty strong and the bartenders are quite helpful.  If you're not sure on what to order, let them know your liquor of choice and they'll whip up an original creation right away.    Tip:  I'm not sure how the bathrooms are elsewhere in the venue, but the ones on the rooftop are single stalled per gender.  At the time I was there, the lock on the woman's restroom was broken, so it would be helpful to have a girlfriend on the lookout for you.  Also, came here a little before 10 on a Friday night and luckily avoided wait time.Whether with your girlfriends, a special someone, or just to unwind after work, Perch is definitely a beautiful venue that provides the opportunity to escape the hectic LA life.  Great atmosphere, classy drinks, soft music, and the chance to be between city lights and the stars - who wouldn't want to be here?

Reviews.Author: Niyera D.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful View, Beautiful Drinks, Beautiful People.....sounds to good to be true????Nay I say, NAY.....Tis the truth!!!!Perch allows you to see the architectural beauty of downtown LA.  It lets you see the beautiful gargoyle structures on buildings that we fail to see when we're running around during the day to get from A to B.This place is truly beautiful, the ambiance is magnificent (I think the whole idea of being on top of the gigantic City of Angels give you a euphoric feel, no??)Only thing is that the drinks are not strong at all and they are pricey...but it's worth....the view just takes all the your troubles away

Reviews.Author: Darlene Y.
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a spot in downtown LA just to relax with some friends and catch up, this is the place for you! Perch has two levels of indoor / outdoor seating. The style of the place is very different. I would have to say that the place has 30 different types of chairs/ tables. If you are into interior design you might like this place. The way the place works is that they always make sure its not packed where your stuck to some other guys shoulder trying to get a drink. The downside to this is that there a wait outside of the bar, and once you get to the main level and you decide to go up to the top level there is another line for that. The atmosphere is meant to be relaxing and calm. I didn't get to try the food but by the looks of other people's food, it looked amazing. The drinks range around 12$. If you want a relaxing night out with the ladies, go here. :] ENJOY!PS, THE VIEW IS AMAZING!

Reviews.Author: Ingrid R.
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my one visit to Perch. First of all, the view is amazing. I went in while it was still daylight and got to experience the beautiful transition between the daytime DTLA skyline to sunset to the twinkling, vibrant view of DTLA still active at nighttime on a Friday night. Most tables appeared to be reserved so we put our name down while we had some drinks. The drinks were a bit on the pricier side but they were pretty yummy craft cocktails. And I always rather pay more for something I cannot replicate at home. For dinner, I had the burger. It was good but not amazing. However, I had my first experience of FROG LEGS here. I did it more for adventure than thinking I would actually like it. They were served up like chicken wings - fried and with a buffalo type sauce. Surprisingly, I thought they were better than chicken wings. Very meaty, I kept thinking these had to be some huge frogs. They were also juicier.

Reviews.Author: Sandra G.
Reviews.Content: Bottom line- this place made me feel like a newlywed. I'm convinced that the Yelpers who gave Perch poor  reviews only gave the low rating so it would never get too crowded when they want a table. My Valentine and I had a reservation on a Friday night, 7:30. We started with a couple of Marie Antoinette's (signature drink) and ordered the bone marrow. The marrow was perfectly seasoned and super yummy. My husband and I both ordered the steak. I don't know what they did to tenderize that steak but holy crap- you could have cut it with a butter knife. Champagne drink with dinner. For dessert, we ordered the beignets and  cognac- what a great way to end the meal.I still haven't talked about the view. Sweet Mother of God- this IS Los Angeles. We frequently dine in DTLA but I loved this dining experience more than our beloved Chaya, Drago, and EVEN The Water Grill. We thought that the vibe was more our age (40ish) than other places that cater to a younger crowd. Best money we've spent on a meal since... well... last week.

Reviews.Author: Jen K.
Reviews.Content: Great views and a nice space, but with some service flaws.I've been there for a multitude of occasions:  a weekday happy hour, a Saturday night out on the town, and a Sunday morning brunch; so I think my experiences have run the gamut.Weekday happy hour surprised me with quite a few people up at the rooftop bar.  While the scene was pretty cool, they don't have a HH menu, so drinks were definitely burning a hole in the wallet.The best way to guarantee yourself an in on Saturday nights is to make a reservation for dinner.  It can be a pain in the a$$ otherwise and it's def not something that I would wait in line to get into, not considering the plethora of other bar options in DTLA sans line.  If you do happen to go for dinner, get the truffle fries!  Delish!Sunday brunch is super packed, again, to my surprise.  I was kind of taken aback by the interesting service we had.  First, they don't let you up until 11:00 AM exactly, so don't worry about getting there right on time if that's when your reservation is.  In addition, they were having "printer" malfunctions and only had a handful of menus that the servers were circulating throughout the restaurant.  You'd think that at a place serving brunch at $12-$25 a plate, they'd have the menu printed out the night before.  While the food was good (I had the salmon benedict, others the three-egg omelette and the fruit plate), there was nothing that I thought worthy of the price.  The portions were on the smaller side and the food seemed like pretty classic fare.  The Bloody Mary was good, though, albeit quite spicy.

Reviews.Author: Raymond M.
Reviews.Content: Perch is French like Tony Bourdain is French, unpretentious, interesting and avant-garde. It's got to be the coolest new restaurant in D.T.  You ride an elevator up to the 13th floor and exit to another elevator that then rides up another 2 floors to the restaurant, as they added a couple floors just for Perch.  You sit down to bread, butter and a special imported dead-sea salt, not really but some kind of salt, and a tapenade that is deliciously sweetened with cranberries, it was fantastic.  They have a full bar with a nice wine selection and I believe 3 beers on tap and keeping with the French theme they have Kronenberg, Fisher and Maudite.  The Maudite is fantastic, as are most of the other Unibroue labels, and more of the French I like, the Canadian side, this clean beer has all the benefits of a strong, high ABV and none of the pesky morning effects.  The appetizers, we had a few, were also really good, I would say the Duck, duck goose stood out the most.  The bone marrow didn't have enough fatty, marrow rich goodness I crave.  They take a large leg bone and saw it in half and I think this makes the fat a bit more fluid rather than gelatin- ness.  I really like it the traditional way where you can get down and do dirty things to it. I guess it's what you grew up on, but worth trying none the less.  Frog legs were bite size fried peds and their mini cordon bleus were just too easy to eat.  We also tried several main courses, each special in their own way.  The Perch a fish I don't ever recall having was nicely done and broiled to perfect doneness, served with a chinois potato (not actually sure if they were Chinois, but they weren't  your normal mashed ones) and peas.  The Coq Au Vin had great flavors and pieced together in individual bites, great flavors.  Benjamin, the chef, uses a lot of opposing flavors which when put together creates a whole different taste.  The beef bourguignon was my favorite and the only thing that could have made it any better would have been a glass of red.  It was delish and all of the accoutrements made it that much more spectacular.  This is a must try.  Ben you outdid yourself.  The desserts were also special.  An apple tart with ice cream, a chocolate mousse (again a glass of red would have done the trick) and beignets with a creamy coffee dip and I think something like vanilla bean.  The coffee really worked out famously and if you were smart, like me, you would have dipped the beignet into the mousse with the coffee cream, fabulous.   If you get the chance to pick your server, you would do well to choose Josh, who is knowledgeable, attentive and keeps the drinks flowing.  I know it takes all parts to make a good restaurant, ambiance, food, service in short "value".  Well Josh sure does his part and helps to deliver on the service end. Big ups Eureka!    Last but not least a special shout out to the ladies of the night, of that night, not "the night". The ladies behind the magic that is Perch.  Rachel and Coly, you two rock and deserve all the success your hard work will bring you.  Enchanté.

Reviews.Author: Bing Z.
Reviews.Content: It s a great place to hang out with friends . I booked it for our first formal date with my boyfriend. It s wonderful view and French Style food. The desert is wonderful.

Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: The view alone is worth 5 stars.Good and moderately priced drinks, attentive servers, and a great view of DTLA.  What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Author: Los Angelin O.
Reviews.Content: I'm sure I won't be the first or last to say that the only thing this place has going for it is the view. That's it. If you are looking to eat even average quality food with average quality ingredients put together with average imagination, don't come here; everything is below average. Though I did not confirm, I'm pretty sure even the fries were frozen. In the impossible chance that I ride the two elevators to come back here, I would never order anything with the fries again. This was the worst hamburger of its class (~$15 range) I have ever had. No taste, and I was tempted to ask for a side of ANY friggin sauce they may have in the back. I wouldn't get this again. I had the Jacques Collins ($10)--gin based lemonade--per my gf, it tasted like what sweet melted plastic would taste like. I couldn't agree more. Like the food, it reeked of cheap ingredients guised in sugars. I wouldn't get it again. $16 for the bone marrow. I didn't think I would ever feel disappointed with any bone marrow, but knowing that Church & State's is just a few miles away really pained me. I wouldn't get this again. Steak frites. The meat was decent. I wouldn't come here again, but if I ever did, I might get this again without the obviously previously frozen frites. Service was friendly but slow. Not sure if I mentioned, but I will never eat here again, and I would never recommend this place to anyone, especially with Bottega Louie and Colori and Church & State in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Jackie D.
Reviews.Content: perch.... I want to like you so badly, but you just can't perform. I have been here a few times since my first visit, but the drinks are always the same mediocre product. The views from up top are breathtaking, and I want to be able to pair that with a delicious, well crafted cocktail. BUT, you will not find that here ladies and gentlemen. Instead, you will be charged $28 for two poorly made, syrupy drinks. The bartender on Friday night (when you should have your most experienced bar tenders working) had to ask how to make a classic gin cocktail the Last Word. The end result was a mouth puckering drink filled with too much chartreuse. Bf ordered a sazerac and the bartender claimed that they didn't have a peeler (huh???) so she hand peeled a chunk of lemon and dropped it in his drink...how's that for artisanal? Please Perch, I beg of you, hire new bartenders or put your current employees through rigorous training. You get a crowd for location, but when your bartenders can't perfect classic drinks, let alone know them, you lose potential regulars.

Reviews.Author: Dora A.
Reviews.Content: Mostly for older crowds. There is isn't much space available. Very crownded when they have un-announced events.  The drinks are not great and are overly priced. The view is great and I recommend it for tourists, however if you want a more modern, youthful feel I'd recommend the standard. The drinks at the standard are better priced, bigger and are made much better and the view is also nice. At the perch don't sit on the "owner's" seat because they will make you get up even though there's no sign anywhere.

Reviews.Author: Julie L.
Reviews.Content: This is simple: 1.) Great customer service from the first step at the entrance of the building! Courteous and helpful. 2.) No cover charge; 3.) No required attire; 4.) Great atmosphere; 5.) Good food and, yes 6.) Clean bathrooms. Parking: We parked just south of 5th Street on the east side (there's a parking lot) for $5 for all night (we entered around 730pm or so). We perched at the Perch and so thankful that we did. We got a view like birds probably have often-- view of the Downtown Los Angeles area. The nightview is great b/c of the building and building lights. The building that the Perch is located at is very cool looking/feeling. Old but antiquy and historical feeling. Upon entering, there is the main area where there are tables and loungy type seats. Also, the bar is located here. Then, there is an outdoor area with many many loungy seats and tables. We walked in without an appointment and didn't have to put our name down or anything. We just walked through the main restaurant area where there are tables, etc. and straight out onto the rooftop area. There were seats available. Servers come to you and provide you with menus and there you go-- order and hang-out! Cold?? We went on a day where supposedly LA had a storm. Even during a day where it had rained a ton and later rained again, it was warm because of the heating lamps, etc. It was soo soo nice! Smoking?? Yes, I'm not a big fan of cigarette smoke. There were a few people who smoked but not many.The food is so presentable and pretty good. We ordered "Shrimps & Grits", Fries, and the assorted meats dish called "?? Chautercerie (spelling?)". They were pretty yummy. "My Fair Lady" is a yummy drink.Check it out!! Call if you want to actually have guaranteed seats. Again, we were able to just walk in and sit in the lounge areas, which I think many people do. Hope that you find yourselves perched at the Perch!!

Reviews.Author: Chris D.
Reviews.Content: I'm reviewing this as a restaurant not a bar.  For a drink after work and a nice view, it's obviously just fine.  But this is a bar first, and maybe a restaurant third. Read through the reviews-- the view of bum filled pershing square is the only thing that impresses most of them.  And notice that those reviewers seem to live in far off towns without any buildings over 10 stories.  The frequent complaints about service also couldn't be more true: almost humorously bad.  Cluttered table, server who disappeared long enough to have gone for a run, hilarious pseudo-french menu that has changed constantly, merely edible food that is just sort of a fatty mess (order the cheese plate-- at least they didn't make the cheese themselves), gimmicky apps that are designed to impress novices but make any restaurant look foolish, servers who hilariously and persistently mispronounce basic french food items, ("we'll have the porc ree-yet." "Oh, the RILL-ETTS?"  But, if you're just some guy who wants to take a girl somewhere not too expensive and you know she doesn't know a thing about food beyond the fact she needs to eat less of it, this may be the place for you.  Otherwise, it's a waste of a nice space that will probably be gone by this time next year.

Reviews.Author: Chip M.
Reviews.Content: Looks like they are still working out some kinks, but this place is here to stay. Here's why:Detail: the bird on a perch in the elevator as you ride up next to the floor you're supposed to push- first 13, then 15 means that they pay attention to the little things. The decor is well thought out and they'll find things to add that make this place even better.View: It's the only outdoor rooftop west facing view I've seen of the LA skyline while eating- you are next to the Title Gauranty Building and look out onto Pershing Square and the Biltmore with the office tours of the Financial District behind you. Hard to beat the view.Decent Food: It's creative and french, I had the beef bourguignon, and it was very tasty.Eclectic Crowd: It will be interesting to see who winds up making this place their hangout, but it may serve as a place where hipsters, movie wannabes, and slightly fashionable guys who just got out of workdowntown can share the same space.

Reviews.Author: Daniel K.
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to impress your lady and show her a great view of LA at night, this is it. The place is "perched" (you see what I did there? haha) on top of the Pershing Square building in DTLA. You can also see the outdoor skating rink depending on where you sit and enjoy some n00b on ice action :D Why do I find joy in such things?Love how the place is put together. Some dim lights, foliage providing some privacy between tables, heat lamps, comfy furniture. It's a sure win guys. They have a nice selection of drinks, kinda pricey, but well worth the view. The rooftop was a bit barren, more of a stand around and chat place. They did have an open fire pit, but of course those seats were already snagged. I'd stick to the 2nd to top floor and try to grab some outdoor seats.

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: It had been a while and the manfriend and I decided to venture back.  We had an amazing experience.They have since changed chefs and it definitely shows in the food quality.We ordered a puff pastry with brie and pesto that was SO YUMMY.He had the shortribs and they were so tender and reminded him of home and I had the Chilean seabass that was perfectly cooked.Dessert was a white chocolate bread pudding that I almost wanted to eat all of.  But resisted just because I'm trying to diet. HA! FAIL already.Definitely go now that it's summer and gets darker later.  The view is AMAZING.

Reviews.Author: Robert H.
Reviews.Content: Wow, well over 500 reviews!  I guess I'll just toss out props to bartender Jenna, thank you greatly for taking care of our little group while you also held down the servers station!  I think I loss 2 pounds just watching you hustle!!Charming place, love their couches, and the view is fun!  :o)

Reviews.Author: Jennifer J.
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking views of Downtown Los Angeles.Very trendy crowd, the perfect place for a late night cocktails. Outside patio area has comfortable seating, heaters and a fireplace. The perfect place to unwind after a great dinner.

Reviews.Author: Dtl A.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooftop/view.  Ugly prices.Not sure what is up with the staff but they apparently expect you to kiss their feet for service.  Bartenders could afford to smile a bit.

Reviews.Author: Sherwin C.
Reviews.Content: Go up the first elevator, bang out some songs on the piano sitting in the hallway, go up the second elevator, order a drink, go outside and admire the awesome view of Pershing Square.This is French bar btw so if you don't know anything about French liquor, you're gonna be staring at the drink menu for a long time

Reviews.Author: Jeff Y.
Reviews.Content: Great ambiance, stiff drinks, sexy place to take a date and if you get the table on the patio near the fireplace, you're money. Live music was fantasic. The food... I wasn't impressed. I will only go here for drinks or happy hour.

Reviews.Author: Alan K.
Reviews.Content: Perch makes me want to Purge! I have to say that the food and drink service on the 15th floor was a disaster. First of all, what kind of a bad design is it to have to go up to the 13th floor, then having to transfer to another elevator to get to the 15th or 16th floor? How awful.Our waiter Kevin was the worst. Although he may be eye candy, the looks do not mask the poor service. Initially, we ordered the My Fair Lady drink. Unfortunately, we got the Marie Antionette drink (this is not what we ordered). It was a very obvious mistake because we drank it and it clearly was not what we wanted. We asked Kevin to change out the drinks to be corrected.We got the Duck Duck Goose as an appetizer. It was meager. Even as an appetizer, it was disappointing. Then, we ordered a cheese platter. We were wondering why this cheese platter took so long. It turns out that our waiter ordered us a cheese fondue, which is exactly what we didn't want. Again, we had to ask Kevin to correct this. I am getting a buzz kill at this point. So, we got our cheese platter and it was decent, although they do not give you enough thinly sliced toasted bread for the amount of cheese you get.By this point, we were at "Purge" for about 2 hours now and asked for the bill. Unfortunately, even the bill was wrong. They charged us the regular price for the appetizers (even though we ordered them at happy hour) and an incorrect number of drinks. Again, we asked Kevin to correct this but sadly when the bill was correct, it was still incorrect because the happy hour prices were not reflected again. Anyhow, he fixed it and gave us a discount for the food and drinks based on our horrible experience. Also, there is an open outdoor bar on the 16th floor, but the bouncers would not let us up there because they said that they were at capacity. Well then, the bouncers should manage that better so they don't run into this problem. I would strongly advise that people not come here. It is a waste of money as the little appetizers and drinks that they have are completely overpriced. Also, the depressing French music did not help even though I love the French language.

Reviews.Author: Lin G.
Reviews.Content: Yep, this is the second time that I came to Perch and feel that it's time for a review.  Both times were on Thursdays.  The first time, Perch was the 4th or 5th bar we hit up and the night was kind of a blur.  I thought the drinks were good and the place was busy for a Thursday night at 1am.  Today, we were there around 7pm and again, it was comfortably full.  Street parking can be annoying to find.  I had a glass of a merlot blend and a vodka tonic.  The vodka tonic was very good, it was almost fragrant.  Sitting up there above all the yellow glowing lights of downtown, I felt like a goddess with a breeze in my hair.They had heat lamps to protect us from the cold and the furniture was new and clean.  My seat had a plush cushion which I love.  Many rooftop bars have plastic or vinyl furniture, which are more durable but less comfortable.  I, for one, appreciate the soft touch.  The feel of this bar was awesome and it seemed like an easy place to mingle and meet cool,well-dressed (not Hollywood) people as well.   Best of all, I just LOVE sitting outside, especially rooftops.  The Meow Bird will have to return to Perch here again.

Reviews.Author: Kelly J.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a few times now on a Saturday night and I love the vibe. I love their gin and tonics even more. I've sat on the patio, which I think is really the best place to be. I mean, rooftop downtown? Hell yes! The view is just spectacular. I've also sat at the bar inside the lounge and had a good time there taking in the scenery. They have a decent wine list, but I would opt for perusing the cocktail menu. What I've had of the food is good to fair; cheese plate, charcuterie, olives and lamb sliders. There are other interesting things that I would like try the next time. Inexplicably, I'm always somewhat surprised to get good service and a cool, hip place like this. The staff here is really great - very attentive and pleasant with nothing but a helpful attitude.

Reviews.Author: Mary D.
Reviews.Content: I am infatuated with this roof top bar.  Something about the summer warm nights and the great view... Highly recommended! If you are looking for a place to hang out and enjoy a couple of drinks, check this place out.  Tip: make a reservation.  They do get busy on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Anh N.
Reviews.Content: I was contacted by someone from Perch assuring me that my charge will be refunded. Great. Justice. I can move on with my life, right? WRONG. Just got another call tonight from a manager at Perch about this mistake. I checked my credit card statement and saw that I still haven't received a refund!! How many people does it take to fix a mistake that THEY made in the first place?

Reviews.Author: Q K.
Reviews.Content: Best 360 degree view of downtown on their rooftop level. Nuff said.Okay, I will say some more. I don't see why people think the decor is terrible--it looked fine to me but I'm not really into fine furniture and stuff. Service was great, the bartenders don't ignore you even though you are staring at them like at most other busy bars. That's worth five stars right there.Again, remember to check out the rooftop--some of my friends that went didn't even know they had a rooftop area. Though you might want to call in advance to see if they are shutting it down for private parties.Oh, plus the drinks are cheap! $8 for a well drink. That's worth another 5 stars right there. We're up to like 10+ stars for this place.For parking (the real reason why DTLA is better than Hollywood because parking is cheap): You can valet park for $7 or park across the street in the lots for $6. Or you can try your luck on the streets. Just be sure you have a front license plate on your car because they always ticket for that! Bastards.

Reviews.Author: Brandon P.
Reviews.Content: Perch has one great thing going for it - the view.  The patio is especially magical at night, surrounded by the skyscrapers of downtown LA.  For the urban landscape, I prefer it over other Downtown skyline alternatives, such as WP24, the Bonaventure, Takami or The Standard.  Other than the view, Perch is a disaster.The night I visited, the upper half of the restaurant was reserved for a private party.  They may not have had enough staff that evening - or a large enough kitchen - to ensure adequate service to both.  My experience in the restaurant was pretty disastrous in terms of food, beverage, and service.  First negative, the lack of consistency in the preparation of the cocktails.  Perch has a great cocktail menu consisting of classics and reinventions.  They also have a good selection of wines and spirits, including ryes, scotches, armagnacs and cognacs. However, there was zero consistency in how the cocktails were prepared.  As a table of 5, we order multiple rounds of cocktails throughout the night.  Many had to be sent back because they were prepared differently the second or third time around.Second, the entrees.  I would recommend sticking with appetizers and small plates for the time being.  We were happy with the baked brie, the merguez sliders and the truffle fries.  Hard to go wrong, right?  However, the entrees were horrible.  Two of the fish entrees ordered had to be sent back.  One of them was served completely cold and uncooked.  The other had absolutely no flavor and was inedible.  None of the people in my party are quick to return food.  I can count on one hand the number of times I have returned an entree ever.  Third negative, the service.  First, everything took an exceptional amount of time to get to the table.  Our first round of cocktails arrived a shocking 25 minutes after ordering.  Establishments with a hopping bar scene typically prioritize restaurant patrons, usually by having a dedicated bartending staff for diners.  Clearly, our orders ended up fighting for their place in a queue with all of the non-diners standing at the bar.  Then, having sent back multiple beverages and entrees, I would have expected a visit from the manager and an apology from our waiter.  Neither of these happened.  An apology and a complimentary dessert would have ameliorated my negative experience, and probably spared them this scathing review.   Lastly, I cannot neglect to mention the fact that they do not serve proper espresso.  We all ordered a double shot with out dessert, and we were served something which maybe came out of a cheap Bed Bath and Beyond home machine.  It was drip coffee disguising as an americano when we asked for espresso.  No crema, no taste.  When we mentioned this to the waiter, he again did not apologize or acknowledge the mistake.  Instead, he told us to write a letter to the manager.  I wanted so badly to love this place because of the ambiance and location.  Unfortunately, the restaurant did everything possible to make me never want to return.

Reviews.Author: M D.
Reviews.Content: See Nic D's review. I'm the other half. Now engaged, with the help of Perch!

Reviews.Author: Abby G.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recently vacationing in LA, and stopped by Perch for brunch on the recommendation of some friends.  We had an amazing view of the city, and had a very friendly waiter named Jason.  He offered us some great recommendations and the food was superb.  Highly recommend the Crab Benedict!  Definitely going back next time I am in town!

Reviews.Author: KE D.
Reviews.Content: There are so many things that make this place a keeper! It feels like you are inside a postcard of the Los Angeles skyline. The outdoor fireplaces & bench seat tables add a sense of community within your group. Everything I tasted was flavorful & rich. The Brie pastry appetizer, the wild mushroom risotto and the Brussels sprouts we're my favorite items on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Risa Y.
Reviews.Content: I came to the Perch on a Wednesday night around 8pm.  I came a little earlier than everyone else because they were still eating dinner somewhere else.  Since I worked later that night and haven't eaten yet, I decided to order a Salad.  The Summer Vegetable salad on the menu was about $11 so I expected a full salad, but when it came I was a bit disappointed because it was just a peace of lettuce with carrots, tomatoes and a little bit of other random veggies that did look like a piece of art on a plate... but didn't satisfy me at all.With a "whimsical French inspired" decor and the amazing view of Downtown LA, Perch is one of the most beautiful lounges in DTLA.  I started off seated inside and once everyone came, we moved outside next to the fireplace.  I had a great time drinking and chatting with friends by the fireplace looking over Downtown LA. It almost seemed surreal. The mixed drinks are tasty but be careful because they are VERY strong~!

Reviews.Author: Anne W.
Reviews.Content: Love it!The newest thing to pop open in downtown LA for lounging and late night fun.  I have never eaten here.. but the place is two floors.. super chic.. and has a decent view of whatever skyline you want to see of LA.The crowd is half Asian... half everything else.  I did like the ample seating.. live band.. and the romantic feel of the place.  It wasn't overly crowded.. it was just right.As for rooftop bars.. the only other one that tops this is a place in NYC but that's because it was much higher up.  Drink prices are typical here as they are downtown.  My friends liked Seven Grand more.. but hey, we all have to branch out and try new things.Only thing.. there is nothing French about this place.  Maybe the mirror in the bathroom that directly faces the toilet.  Is watching yourself pee French?  Oui oui!!

Reviews.Author: Cindy W.
Reviews.Content: Granted the food was indeed tasy, I would say the location and scenery is what's got this place made. The cozy rooftop atmosphere with a gorgeous view is what you have to come check out.Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed every dish that I tried. It helped that we were with a pretty large group so I got to try a good assortment. My favorites that stuck with me were the Scallop w/Risotto, Bacon Mac n Cheese, Truffle Fries, and believe it or not the absolutely decadent roasted Brussel Sprouts.

Reviews.Author: Sarina T.
Reviews.Content: I cannot explain how fly I felt going to this place. First, the bird icon next to the elevator button already had my level of excitedment through the roof (ahem.. literally). Yeah, I'm a nerd like that.Further, going to a rooftop always makes me happier than going to normal bars on normal levels... Once you walk in, you already know you're in for a treat. The furniture is astounding, and you can't even decide where you want to sit. I had to try a cappucinno cream dessert, which i wanted to enhale but obviously had to control myself in public.  I can't even remember what beer I had because I was so focused on the amazing view of downtown. It's such a sweet spot in every way whether it be hanging with your coworkers, buddies, your significant other, or family.This place is one of my top choices in downtown LA. Try to catch the sunset because I got some amazing photos!!

Reviews.Author: Lissa -.
Reviews.Content: Reasons to go here: 1. Gorgeous view2. Romantic dateI didn't try the food, but it looks pretty expensive unless you get the apps.Secret - There's a 16th floor rooftop bar.

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: LOVELY  view of downtown!So I'm sure it annoys downtowners to no end that downtown is now turning into a mini Hollywood, complete with drunkards, skanks and lines to get in (case in point- Belasco). My bestie recently moved downtown and I joined her and some friends here for some drinks on a Friday night. You have to take two separate elevators to get up there.. they're slow as hell, but once you get up to the lounge area, it's worth it. The view is fantastic, and their outdoor patio is awesome. Comfy couches and chairs are everywhere, plus heating lamps and a fireplace. Inside there are a lot of tables and the decor is very 1900s. Cool and antiquey. When we were there it was crowded, so it took a while to get drinks at the bar. No club music plays or anything, so it's really just a great chill place to people-watch and catch up with friends. No cover too, woo!!

Reviews.Author: Michael W.
Reviews.Content: Alright alright, I'm a sucker for rooftop bars. They're so cliche nowadays, but I still like them. Perch, has a great view of downtown Los Angeles. First of all, you have to take two elevators to actually get to Perch. If the rooftop level is packed, then you only can hang out on the floor before, which doesn't do this place justice. The non-rooftop level isn't half bad though. There's plenty of couches and seats, both inside and outside. The bartenders are nice, and they make one hell of a Manhattan and Old Fashioned. From what I remember, drinks run about $15 a drink. There are two bars: one on each level.Ok, here comes the fun part. This place has an amazing view of downtown LA. It's pretty damn awesome to look over the city, before you get hammered to the point of no return. There's plenty of seating on both levels, and they do have heaters to keep you warm.Perch is definitely a nice spot to get your drink on. Great view of DT LA, not an overly trashy crowd, and the drinks are pretty good. Just be weary of how packed it get because you have to hit up the rooftop level.

Reviews.Author: Fat L.
Reviews.Content: One star for the fact there is a view, they couldn't mess that up.  2 stars for the fact you can't screw up alcohol.  The manager working evening of August 3rd is as incompetent as they come. Waiting 1 hour with a reservation for a special occasion and being lies to throughout that hour to keep us hanging there for a special birthday occasion.  No comp drinks while we wait, nothing. Instead, we had a group from Beverly Hills upset and regretting even venturing out as we've never had such piss poor service and attention.  Sadly, this isn't the 1st awful experience here or I'd say it was coincidentally just not a good night/staff.  Overcrowded, hard to even get drinks at the bar and lines galore. Definitely an unpleasant experience and just frustrating when you just want to enjoy the view and have a nice dinner.  This will be the last time we are going to come here, bottega Louis could teach this restaurant a few things about good service &food. Too bad they don't realize the group of women all have a wide network in the media. This restaurant definitely left all of us with a bad taste in our mouth.

Reviews.Author: Solomon W.
Reviews.Content: The Perch is one of the more unique bars in DTLA (I got fairly accustomed to seeing that acronym popping up in my short time in this huge city), not quite a speakeasy, not quite a lounge, not quite a bar. Even more odd is the fact that most watering holes in this city offer fairly refined grub.To find your way into this "perch", you will have to get over to this building, take an elevator to the middle level, followed by another mid-level elevator ridden to the very top.I don't even know how this booze-laden establishment is laid out, but there is a second level in the middle that offers a little more class, intimacy, and an almost Prohibition style ritziness. Though you don't have to be dressed in a way that is over the top. Though hipsters run amuck here.The top tier, overlooking a good amount of LA's downtown, nightlife, and skyline, is off the charts. We went on a Tuesday, and it must have been "hipster night." Artists galore, many an individual dressed in a Japanese-style clothing, and a really somber band. All of this is wrapped around a bar, one cranking out handcrafted cocktails--give the Old Fashioned a shot. Mighty strong they pour it.Perch boasts an enjoyable atmosphere and serves as an experience to be had when visiting the city of angels. It does seem a little over the top be an everyday after-work sort of joint.

Reviews.Author: Brandon A.
Reviews.Content: #193I like Perch. It has an entirely different atmosphere than the other rooftop bar two blocks west and one block south - for those unfamiliar, that would be The Standard. Perch is much more classic in its presentation, and I think I like that.I find myself going out more during the work week than during the weekends. For that reason, I haven't experienced the weekend crowd here - sounds like a good thing. The weekday crowd tends to be 20/30-somethings, young professional folk, and much less douche-like than you might find at The Standard. It's only a matter of time before Perch turns less cool... it's inevitable as it happens to every place worth patronizing.The top level can be nice as long as it's not windy. The security folk limit the number of people on the rooftop, which prevents the small bar from getting too swamped. There are some great views of the city from up here since you're not in the middle of all the tall buildings, but rather just outside the perimeter.The main level is quite nice as well with the bar inside, leading out through doors all around onto the outside patio. I've never dined here, but it looks to be where all the dining tables are located. There's also a nice little fireplace nook just outside the doors on the far side of the bar (from the entrance) - good for chatting while keeping warm (no blasting music).I can see it as a good venue for meeting up with friends to grab drinks or perhaps coming here on a date. It's real chill and relaxing, and I think I'll stick to the weekdays.

Reviews.Author: Nicole L.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a must see if you're LA born and bred. I've probably never been more proud to call myself a socal native after taking in the view from Perch.Good drinks, decent atmosphere (love the patio), and diverse crowd. I had no problem getting a drink (the girliest one is called My Fair Lady or something along those lines) and tipped generously as you should if you plan to return anywhere. This bar is decent in size and doesn't feel overcrowded even when there's a huge line outside. Lines can get annoying, so try to come early!This would be a super cute after date drink spot :)

Reviews.Author: Gracey K.
Reviews.Content: P retty much my favorite place to enjoy a few drinks (I'm a local).E very drink, when you check the ingredients, is VERY reasonably priced!R eally friendly staff, and they are good to their regulars :]  Love!!C annot get enough of that French 64... wowow one of the best drinks I've ever had.H aven't tried the food, but I'll be sure to sometime soon and update!

Reviews.Author: Eugene H.
Reviews.Content: This place is cooooooooooooooooooool as ice. I like it better than the Standard. Its more chill more old skool.  Check it out for yourself.  Make sure you try the Royal drinks cause they are delicious.  I heard the mojitos are good as well.  Great view but watch out for spiders! I went on a Thursday night and there weren't TOO many people. It was nice and quiet enough to enjoy your night. DJ plays werid French music. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Justain C.
Reviews.Content: So, I hate Perch.  Only because of the long lines to go from floor 14 to 15 on the weekends.  Weeknights there usually isn't a line. I hate that most about Perch.Anyways, I stopped by tonight and there was a live band playing.  Band was awesome.  The view is nice.  I like the 15th floor because there's no celiing above you, just the nighttime sky.  Downstairs indoor bar is usually a nice mix of people.  The crowd is always pretty decent.  It's like Louie.  Overpay for things because you feel like you're a part of something special and classy.  It's bourgeoisie.  Not my favorite place, and the lines are just too long sometimes.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline H.
Reviews.Content: Amazing view of LA, day or night! Great place to hang out with friends. Drinks range from $9-$13. Parking lot next door is only $5 flat rate after 4 pm on Saturday and Sunday.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: Went last thursday night for a friend's bday. When you walk in the lighting and music makes it look very elegant. There are all types of people there some dressed up, other who you can see came from work and some locals that are in casual wear. The hostess immediately attended us and let us know where our party was. Once there we decided to get drinks from the bar and unlike hollywood the wait was not very long and the bartender was attentive. The prices are decent you pay for what you get and a cocktail is about $12 but they make it pretty good and strong. I only tried some of the food and it was delicious. Overall the night was great, no creepy men trying out their lastest line. Everyone was chill and into their own group. Great atmosphere, classy people and good drinks/food.

Reviews.Author: Kimberley C.
Reviews.Content: Awesome hangout spot!   Beautiful wraparound views in a classic almost 100 year old building.  Good looking people coming and going....mostly coming.Can't believe I haven't been here until recently.  They have already been open for almost a year.  That sucks.  I could have been hanging out here Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays.   Oh well....The waitresses are ultra cute and the lamb sliders are delish!The particular time that I went was on a Wednesday after 5:30pm.  I went because I wanted to check out this place plus I needed to take my friend out for his birthday.There is $6.00 parking after 6pm in a parking lot right across the street from this place to its convenient and cheap.   Before 6pm you'll get a different price.From the looks of it..... prime time @ Perch is around 5 - 9pm.Lots of downtown corporate types and some people from West Hollywood thrown in for good measure.   A lot of prancing around looking at people looking at you.Fun!I will be back!

Reviews.Author: Benjamin S.
Reviews.Content: Look out Downtown LA, there is a new 'chick' on the block!  Hugging the top floors overlooking Pershing Square, Perch is a sweet multi-leveled lounge and restaurant that is bound to give its neighbors a run for their money.  Owners Rachel Thomas and Coly Den Haan have teamed with executive chef Benjamin Udave to bring you something new, refreshing, and unpretentiously French in both the decor and cuisine.  With Art Deco styled interiors surrounding the bars and commanding views from the terrace/patios, your initial entrance will alone want you to quickly make a reservation for your next visit. Desire an appetizer of froggie legs or a bit of rabbit?  Then do so but make room for their incredibly tasty and original Gallic main entrees.  French liquors & spirits are infused in their original cocktails that are also a must in making the evening truly complete.  The property hasn't officially opened its doors, but having just attended a pre-opening event, there is no doubt in my mind that when it does, you will be a sad, sad soul if you don't go.  The name is Perch and their motto is "An elevated resting place".  Whether you are a downtown local or a friend visiting from the Valley, prepare to take flight soon and touchdown on this fantastic rooftop!perchla.com

Reviews.Author: Crystal L.
Reviews.Content: New DTLA hot spot just hit LA Perch the French Bar & restaurant offers amazing  360'S VIEW, ART-DECO DECOR,  A GREAT AMBIANCE and the SERVICE was good too .I  Love their DELICIOUS  french drinks on the menu. The  Food look amazing but, have not tried it . Their outdoor rooftop view was breathless great area to take some cool pics.  I love the fact that you have two floors with two seperate bars one is indoor and the other on the rooftop. The music selection was French . Prices for drinks are like $12 and dinner $22 or so  Over all it's a HIP and  MUST DO spot .  It great for a quick drink, dinner or a lounging night . You choose !!

Reviews.Author: Ellen N.
Reviews.Content: Like many people say, make sure you save $6 for parking. This is absolutely of my favorite rooftop bar. (And yes, I have been to the Standard) Great drinks, friendly bartenders, very nice decor and AMAZING view of downtown LA. If you love an urban, skyscraper night view, you will definitely love it here.The only two bad things about this place are food and waiting. I would say their pricing and food quality is closer to bar food standard than restaurant. I wouldn't really recommend it here for dinner. And now that this place is so popular, unless you are here around 10 PM, it takes almost an hour and half to just get to the roof. If there is no line, get to the rooftop as soon as you can, DON'T COME BACK DOWN EVEN IF YOU HAVE TO MEET A FRIEND. They won't let you in after you step down.All in all, it's a wonderful place to hang out in a low key and have a get together with your significant half or friends. I highly recommend it :)

Reviews.Author: Alex W.
Reviews.Content: I came here for the first time this past Sat at 7pm and I really enjoyed it. The dining room was filling up but we were outside on the patio. Judging by the number of security and bouncers this place must get a little crazy later in the evening. When we there is was lively but not insanely crazy.I ordered a couple of drinks off the menu, they were a bit sweet for my taste but were obviously carefully made with quality ingredients. I felt bad for the bartender upstairs, it would've been helpful to have another person behind the counter. By 8pm there was a line at least 10 people deep. We left around 8:30 to have dinner down the street, perfect timing, the nightclub crowd was beginning to trickle in.

Reviews.Author: Sara S.
Reviews.Content: Perch is like someone plopped part of the Edison on the rooftop of an apartment in DTLA... and I LOVE IT!I can see it all now.... guys, if you take that girl that you've been playfully flirting with but aren't sure where you stand or are trying to get your relationship with her to the next "level," take her here. I can't promise anything but I know she'll be awed by the beauty of the view and your tasteful choice of venue.... & that'll score you some points in her book!The lights, which are visible from the street, enhance the glow of the gorgeous DTLA skyline and you can't help but want to cuddle up on the couch with a nice drink. You also have a great aerial view of Pershing Square. Try to sit outside if you can, although the inside is pretty nice too. Cant beat the view! We went on an off night, so it was not very crowded. I can see how it would get pretty popular on weekends though. It definitely gives more of a chill vibe, not somewhere where you want to get rowdy with a big group. I tried the My Fair Lady, which is pretty much like a Cosmo. The drink was pretty small, but it was strong & still good. For $11, I guess you could say you get your money's worth?  They also have a bunch of drinks that use cognac and brandy, some of which involved cucumber and jalapeno (2 of my most unfavorite things). Most notably imo, they have Royals which is champagne mixed with your choice of flavored liquor. Reminds me of France. It definitely has a French theme going on, and we even saw one of the staff members dressed up as a French maid! The music itself was replete with accordians and every other cliche thing you can think of when you think of "French music."IT'S AMOUR!Obviously you are paying for the ambiance, but that's no surprise. It's so beautiful you tend to forget you're forking over $$.

Reviews.Author: Katherine M.
Reviews.Content: It depends on what you are going for. Happy hour hipster atmosphere with sparkly drinks- five stars. Dinner or brunch- food is two stars but atmosphere is five with a live jazz band during brunch and  gorgeous view. The boullibase is great but they don't serve that at brunch :(.   Otherwise their $16 "artisan"  burger is Safeway quality meat (low) with GRISTLE that my manly man dining companion kept spitting out it was so unpalatable.  Salads look limp and Benedict is just okay - does not live up to the price. So my advice - go here for happy hour or have the $12 champagne at brunch with truffle fries only and call it a day.

Reviews.Author: Christine K.
Reviews.Content: Great view!Great seafood but the menu isn't very exciting...no bone marrow, no raw beef in any form, all the dishes are "safe".There were frog legs, but I didn't care for it much.The Cioppino and the Mussels were delicious!The escolar was a bit disappointing. It was a bit dry and the sauce it came with was too thick...it reminded me of gochu jang (korean red pepper paste).Truffled fries...waste of belly space imo but my friends enjoyed them.Whiskey on the rocks...is whiskey on the rocks. hahaThe ice was melted alot the second time around. Couldn't get sangria...I guess it's a brunch thing only.We were there 7:30pm on a Friday night with a reso. Didn't have to wait a second. :)Service was ok in the beginning but got really slow by the end of the night.That's ok b/c my friend was feeling real good that night and started dancing the night away...oh pat~~The best tip you will ever get:The tables by the windows/doors inside between the patio and the inside of the resto is the most perfect spot.

Reviews.Author: Janet L.
Reviews.Content: Everyone seems to be comparing this place to the Standard (which I've never been to)  so I can't compare between the two. The atmosphere and the interior is awesome at the perch. The crowd was better than I expected. 'Cause my group and I were waiting in line and weren't impressed with the crowd at first.. but once you get in, you'll be surprised. It's pretty diverse and you'll love the feel to it.The view on the rooftop is amazinnnng at night! Don't worry about it being chilly at night, cuz they have a bunch of heat lamps everywhere. So just stand around one of them and you'll be fine. Or just get a couple drinks in you and you'll be all giddy in no time :P Came here for the drinks only. Had a good drink on the level before the rooftop. Some kind of fruity mojito drink that the bartender made me. I wanted a Tokyo Tea but they don't have that.. Or my fave, Midori Sour! :( So I just told her to make me anything yummy/fruity. ^_^ My friend wanted Jack & Coke and they don't serve Jack... so he had to order Whiskey & Coke which was disgusting. Lol but my drink was awesome and got me tipsy so it was well worth the $$. I believe both our drinks came out to be around $22? Not bad at all! The drink I got on the rooftop level was horrible! I think the bartenders aren't as good up here. I forgot what I ordered but it tasted like redbull vodka which I absolutely hate. I just can't stand the taste. It's like medicine to me :( I think next time I'll be safe and stick to rum&coke.. if they even have rum.. haha. But the atmosphere on the rooftop level is def much better! You can get a whole 360 view of DTLA and it's just so amazing how beautiful it is at night. I love it! Oh! And there's no cover fee! At least there wasn't one when I went :) Def recommend. And I'll def be back.

Reviews.Author: Sarah I.
Reviews.Content: Brunch was alright, nothing special. The morning view is good, I was told it was better at night. It is worth a try.

Reviews.Author: Lei A.
Reviews.Content: I have a very mixed review about Perch, so please read it all the through. Venue: 5/5 Beautiful. Great views, cool vibe, and great general ambiance. Service: 2/5. The staff was nice, but not amazing. They kept bringing other peoples food & drinks to our table, which is just annoying and distracting. They even brought us the wrong bill.
