When I booked the reservation as a celebration dinner, I asked the host if we could go to the upper level lounge for drinks after and of course they said we could. I even called the same day to confirm our reservations since I didnt want anything to go wrong with my special evening. So after our dinner at just before 9pm we are told that the roof top lounge is actually closed for the evening and a security guard said to us "some one spent a lot of money to have this be private so I am going to have to ask you to leave"...epic service fail on behalf of the host and security. Food 3/5. The food was pretty good all around, but I found their dishes to be EXTREMELY salty.Apps: Seared Duck Breast - Awesome, absolutely delicious. Mussels - Tasty in idea, but way too salty.  I literally had to return the Mussels since it made my face cringe to eat them. Imagine that. Mains:Lamb Burger: A very delicious dish. The meat was fresh, tasty, garnished with greens and a preserve. Only flaw is that it too was overly seasoned with salt. It comes served aside some home made potato chips that have to be the best home made chips I have ever eaten. Braised Short Rib: Great dish and a very very large portion. The meat was tender and delicious. The sides complimented the dish very well. The only problem is that it was served warm, not hot. I am big on temperature when at a "fine dining" establishment and they lost major points on it. Dessert:Apple Napoleon- Yummmmay. It was very good. crisp, light pastry. A  great cap to our meal. Overall. We enjoyed our evening, the ambiance, and the food. A little disappointed in the service but will most probably give them another try. Definitely worth checking out.

Reviews.Author: Jamila F.
Reviews.Content: It's true, I never tire of a rooftop situation. But as swanky, downtown rooftops go Perch is definitely at the top of the list. The drinks are YUMMY and remind me of Jones bar, the view is breathtaking and there's so many great places to sit and enjoy it (by the fireplace is my personal favorite). I'd thoroughly enjoyed this place for ambiance and alcohol twice before partaking in any real food. When I finally got around to sampling the grub I was pleasantly surprised. The chilean sea bass was really good and only slightly on the salty side when I tried it (I would order again). The raw scallops were simple but really DELISH and melted in my mouth. I highly recommend and can not say enough about the shrimp & grits and the bread pudding. My mouth waters a bit just thinking about them. Insanely good, seriously.

Reviews.Author: Kellan D.
Reviews.Content: This is a great location. I love the views, and the cocktails are amazing. They could use a few more heaters or fireplaces on the roof for the cold nights though. The bartenders could use a space heater or something too, they look like they're freezing back there.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy O.
Reviews.Content: Perch has undeniably the best view of downtown skyline in DTLA. Their drinks are reasonably priced and also they offer a cut line for those of us that reside in DTLA.

Reviews.Author: Evegail A.
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge believer of visiting a place and falling in love with the scenery more than the actual location. The Perch is one of them! Aside from the rooftop view, the classic ambiance of late 20 somethings and over is a very refreshing crowd to be around while sipping on signature cocktails and nibbling on great cuisine. I have to say, my favorite dish is the Sautéed Chilean Seabass. HOLY...This piece of fish melts in your mouth and the combination of the trumpet cream *cue the singing choir* is exquisite! Every time I visit The Perch, I never leave unhappy, unsatisfied, hungry, or sober. See you soon, Perch-istas!

Reviews.Author: Rasien I.
Reviews.Content: FINALLY!!!!! Hearing about, reading about, and thinking about this place for a long time! I finally made it out to Perch this past Friday night with my girlfriend for a fancy dinner. I loved this place... the old school historic DTLA building, the scenic rooftop views, the loungy atmosphere, the fireplaces, the food, the drinks! I loved it all!Reservations at 9:00 pm, but werent seated until about 9:25... Boo! I Ordered what I am going to say is officially the best pork belly I've ever had... the only downside is that service was super slow... our waiter did his best effort to come check up on us to see if we had our food/drinks... but the food just came out wayyy slow. We ordered around 9:35 and didnt get any appetizers/soup until about 10:15 pm! Really?! Same with the main courses, not until about 10:45... but the food was spectacular! I had to knock off the one star for the slow food service, but other than that, you wont be disappointed! :)

Reviews.Author: C. V.
Reviews.Content: I didn't think I could love Perch more than I already did.  Then the bartender John made an old fashioned with his own special syrup and well, I found another level of appreciation.  He's just the best.

Reviews.Author: Michelle Y.
Reviews.Content: Love Love LoveFav place in Downtown LA.  It's posh, the drinks are stiff, the music is sexy, the view is INCREDIBLE, the crowd is hot, and the food is tasty!!!!My 2 fav apps:    Frog legs!!!  Beet Salad!!!***I do recommend that they add Escargot to the menu as they are French!!  :)***I like to frequent Perch because it's super classy and it embodies the swag of Downtown.  Do go..and get the Bouillabaisse!!  Good lord..it's good.  I also made up my own drink that's not too pricey!  They have a Coconut Vodka ($10) that I used to make a Lemon Drop Martini.  Excellent drink, not too expensive, and so tasty!  try it out!  You won't be disappointed!!  If you want a weekend reservation I suggest you put it in at least 2 weeks in advance because it does fill up!!Enjoy and see ya there...OH and let's just name that Coconut Martini La Michelle, right?XOXO

Reviews.Author: Matthew R.
Reviews.Content: After only being open for about a month, Perch promises to be among the best rooftop bars in L.A. The view awesome, and the drinks are spectacular. But the best part is the friendly staff. Ask for Luke or Josh the bartender. They both make some amazing drinks. I mentioned a few ingredients for one of my favorite drinks called a cablegram, and Josh pulled it off beautifully without ever having even heard of it. Chill fireplaces, heat lamps, and comfy benches make this a great place to hang with friends.I hear the menu is awesome, too, though I haven't had the chance to eat here yet. The bar is classy, yet not pretentious. Definitely check it out.

Reviews.Author: Derek P.
Reviews.Content: Good:  DTLA viewBad:  Poor service and the $/EtOH ratio is too high.Ugly:  Labeled some of the Scotch as just "12yr / 15yr". There are 80+ distilleries to choose from.  Unacceptable.

Reviews.Author: Jordan M.
Reviews.Content: From the ashes of the Must, arose a phoenix: the Perch. This restaurant and bar has earned itself the role of my favorite nightlife spot in DTLA.The view alone earns it five stars, but it is just the beginning. From the menu to the decor, you can tell the owners put tons of time, effort and thought into their product. Further, they assembled a fantastic staff from Connor at the door, who runs a smooth operation even when demand exceeds supply, to Justin behind the bar, who I can always count on to make me a tasty cocktail (I recommend the French 64).

Reviews.Author: Bethany B.
Reviews.Content: Perch is one of my favorite bars to take friends/family that are visiting me in LA. Great atmosphere (especially the rooftop), amazing views, and thank God for those heat lamps because my New England blood has thinned out after moving here several years ago.The staff is awesome. Doormen are nice and non-elitist, and the wait staff and bartenders are friendly and quick. Perch is one of the places where you can say to the bartender, "I like gin drinks. I prefer a bitter taste over something sweet. What can you make for me?" and they will consistently come up with something incredible. Will it be cheap? No. Delicious? Ohhh yes.I love this place, but why does it take two separate elevators to get to the roof?

Reviews.Author: Josh C.
Reviews.Content: The location is breathtaking. You get a pleasant view of the city regardless of the time, but it does get really damned cold in the early evening hours and the servers arent too hasty about turning on the heat lamps. Retreat to the (lush) interior when possible. There's a small security stand in the front entrance and someone leads you into a set of elevators before you step into the actual bar. Pretty fancy and French. Let me give you my top hat and cane while I'm here...And at the risk of sounding like a snob, there was one VERY unpleasant aspect about this place. I love my beer and I was extremely displeased when my server gave me my porter in an ICE COLD glass. Next time I'll just stick with the cocktails.

Reviews.Author: Nina O.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend's favorite type of food is French, he also has an affinity for LA sky lines. When I heard about Perch... I couldn't help but think it was a PERFECT place to take him for his birthday! Let me just say, it was a little far from perfect. I made reservations about a month in advance. Only to get there and have them tell me if I want to sit outside I have to wait an hour. I guess inside it is. So we sit down at a coffee table with two huge chairs on either side of it. More of a longue- drink- bar hour feel to it. Wasn't exactly the "nice dinner" experience I was going for. But it wasn't a big deal, I was going to make the best out of it!Then comes time for food...We order the Lobster Bisque and Baked Brie. Lobster Bisque--not good. At all. I literally think I could probably prepare a better Bisque. Baked Brie on the other hand- DELICIOUS! And I know for a fact I could never emulate that. So as for appetizers, it was definitely and HIT OR MISS. Not really what you expect for the price.As for main course, I ordered the Salmon Caviar and my boyfriend ordered the Braised Short Rib. My salmon was just okay. I would never ever pay 30 dollars for that again. And the Braised Short Rib wasn't anything to rave about either. It was boring, I think I could have ordered it ANYWHERE. We both came into the meal expecting A LOT and left.. feeling disappointed. I honestly would not recommend this place if you are looking for good food. If you want a view of a gorgeous skyline, sure. Just make sure you're willing to wait a while.

Reviews.Author: Carol C.
Reviews.Content: I must begin my review with some disclosure. First, I am a Westside girl through and through. I have to have a pretty good excuse to drag myself down the 10 and deal with downtown traffic and parking. Perch is definitely a good enough excuse! While the exorbitant number of helpful security gaurds is slightly off-putting, it's worth it when you finally make your way up there (after an elevator swap on the 13th floor). What a beautifully charming restaurant with a stunning view! We sat outside and enjoyed the skyline but the decor inside would have made up for the lack of view in there. The servers were lovely and gave great recommendations! We had the Broccolini Salad and Seared Dayboat Scallops & Succotash and did not leave one morsel on our plate. Partly because it was delicious and because the portions are tiny. But the strength of the cocktails made up for the size of the food;) It took me an hour and half to drink my Perch Daiquiri but it was worth it! Expertly done! My husband had the Le Libertine (which he also sipped the whole time) and love it too!So, if you are looking for a fancy frivolous night out (and you're not on a budget), I definitely recommend this spot. The lounge upstairs was cool too...even better view!

Reviews.Author: Rena D.
Reviews.Content: This review is based on my second experience at Perch. I must say that my first experience was very pleasant, however, my second experience is a reflection of the new rules that were set at Perch. We made reservations on a Saturday night at 12am. We had gone early to avoid waiting in line to go up to Perch, which is a rooftop restaurant/bar. When it turned midnight, we went downstairs for our reservations since we had originally made it so we can sit down to enjoy the view and some desserts. Before we were sat down, the hostess asked us, "did someone tell you about the new cover charge rule?" Of course, we said no since it was the first time we have heard about it. Apparently, Perch has decided to charge $40/person to sit at the tables! This is outrageous! Have the decency to inform your customers about the new rules before the reservations are made. I understand that it is a business but the main reason people come here in the first place is because Perch doesn't have a cover charge and that gives us the piece of mind to pay for the already expensive drinks. Now I can say perch is like any other nightclubs/bars, where there are ridiculously expensive drinks, long wait, and cover charge. Overall, do not expect me to come back if the $40/person cover charge is still applicable.

Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable ambiance, amazing food. It was an awesome experience. The views of the city are truly breathtaking. Rachel and Coly are very welcoming hosts. Bravo! All I can say is 10 10 10!!!!!!!!!!!!!I don't want to forget to mention our waiter Josh. Excellent service. Feel free to ask for Josh. It is all worth it!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Tony E.
Reviews.Content: This is solely based on (over-hyped) New Year Eve 2012.  First of all let me just say the Perch looks like a Great place for pre-drinks and dinner.  The views are stellar for DTLA especially from the rooftop.  That being said I may have given it a better star rating.Now on to why I wrote a review here.  We had a crowd for about 14 men & women ready to dance the new year (2012).  And for $60 what we got were a few noise makers, and hats.  NO champagne that was promise, NO rotating DJs that were promised (seemed like it was just Pandora on random), NO French circus show just 2 people on stilts, NO dancing c'mon seriously.  We could barely hear the countdown because the speakers weren't even loud enough.  We were all so disappointed that we left around 12:30a back to my place, I set up my DJ equipment and we partied til 5am.Note to Perch promoters:  Word of mouth is your best promotion.  If you say you are going to do something and charge people for it, then Deliver!  Most of your attendees are people that enjoy hanging around DTLA ,so they may talk bad about your venue, and that gets around.  We understand that you are a new restaurant/bar.  So don't set yourself up to fail.  Take this as constructive criticism. PS, If you ever need a good DJ hit me up.

Reviews.Author: Darlene G.
Reviews.Content: In LOVE with this place! First of all the view is super romantic even if you are out for a girls night out in DTLA.  I only went for drinks but food looks good too. They have a live band playing music for the heart ;) It may be a bit pricy but its worth the good times out with good company. If you are looking for something chill with friends or your love one def this will be the place, but not if you want to go for a wild/dancing night ;) Its an older and sophisticated crowd, in my opinion. I'm thinking of having my bday there just to spend quality time with my friends. I went on a Friday night and YES I waited for a bit ;( which thats the only sucky part but I didnt mind it caue once I got to the top floor and got a drink made me happy. I think it's just better to get there early to avoid the wait in line.

Reviews.Author: Vicky R.
Reviews.Content: Took my boyfriend here for a romantic birthday celebration. We loved it! Great atmosphere and great food. We went on a Monday so we lucked out... not crazy packed, but still busy. I highly recommend for a romantic night out. It's pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Author: James S.
Reviews.Content: This place has some of the most amazing views of DTLA that you will ever get. You can "perch" yourself at the top floor or you can if you're lucky go a floor below and sit and relax at tables enjoying a meal. Looking at the food menu, it is on the higher end. Their drinks are on the same boat. Among the favorites and without a factual name is the cucumber drink that the bartender mixes with fresh mint and cucumbers. It is quite aromatic. Would I be back?Definitely will check this place out

Reviews.Author: Donna C.
Reviews.Content: Oh, Perch! I had such high expectations! I knew this place had a notorious rep for unbelievably long lines, so we made reservations for 5 people at 1030pm. When we arrived, there was a long line already. I'm sure they've been there awhile. A lady at the door made sure we had reservations and told us to take the elevator to the 13th floor. We thought the restaurant was at the 13th floor, but we had to take another elevator to get to the restaurant :/ The restaurant was packed! Thank goodness the restaurant was open, so it wasn't musty or hot. The hostess checked us in, but we still waited about 10 minutes for our table (note: we were already 15 minutes late). If we had arrived on time, would we have waited an additional 25 minutes????? They seated us near the walkway, so my husband had to re-arrange himself (away from me), so no one would bump into him. The restaurant was just too small for the number of people that were in there!The food was not good at all, especially for the high prices they charged. We didn't order much since our primary reason for reservations was to avoid the lines outside and avoid paying the cover fee. We ordered buffalo wings frog legs, the truffle poutine, and another item on the menu. I didn't get a chance to taste the frog legs, but my husband said it was okay. The truffle poutine was dry and not cheesy at all and bland. The service wasn't spectacular either. She kept disappearing. We had to flag down the hostess to let them know we were ready to order and then later on, we were ready to pay! Did I tell you there was ANOTHER line (inside the restaurant) to get to the rooftop bar?! The restaurant was already packed, so adding more people to it made me feel like sardines in a can! And the wait wasn't short either. We waited about 15-20 minutes! Once we got to the rooftop, there were plenty of space, so I didn't understand the long wait downstairs! We were on the roofstop for maybe just over 1 hour because they were closing (mind you, we got there at 1045pm and they closed at 2pm. That's how long our dinner was because of bad service!) We decided to bypass the elevator and take the stairs because only 2 were operating! I think I've made it clear, I'm not going back to this place.

Reviews.Author: OMARA G.
Reviews.Content: I loOove a surprise, and Perch was a pleasant one. I had no knowledge of what "Perch" was when I agreed to meet up with a couple girlfriends un l 'rooftop, but I'm glad we listened to the little birdie who tipped us off on this rooftop haven. There's something about taking 2 elevators and being escorted all the way up until you magically arrive at your destination, it's like the elevators are time capsules transporting you to the classy times of Downtown Los Angeles.If I lived in LA I could totally see myself a regular here, the view of DTLA is just gorgeous and the night I was there we actually saw a shooting star!(pretty awesome I KNOW)I didn't have any of the food but the drinks we had were delicious! "My Fair Lady", and the flavored "Royals" pricey but good!My critiques:1) Service: The bartender was a bit dry, which kind of put a damper on the "what shall we drink" banter my friends and I were engaged in at the bar, maybe it was just a bad day for him.2) WET! The lounge chairs were damp to sit on perhaps the nighttime dew? thankfully I was wearing black but that could be a problem? So watch out for thatOverall loved the place I will be back to try the bistro.

Reviews.Author: Carlos V.
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome, I mean. The local place downstairs is ugly lol but it is dtla. But once your on floor 16 it's a whole diff. World. Very classy, romantic scene and music, and everyone is nice. If your lucky to be seated on the left corner of the entrance you'll see Pershing square and city view. We're i sat with my partner we saw the buildings and the parking lot lol but go! My bill came out around $75. For two. So be prepared

Reviews.Author: Shawn S.
Reviews.Content: Like so many of the places I go to dine, I have no prior knowledge of them before I go. I leave that up to my foodie friends. I have a friend that tries and tries to get me to pick lunch/dinner places, but in the end he always ends up picking them because it's just to overwhelming, and when you're dealing with a foodie like him, it's way too much f'ing pressure. Such was the case with Perch.I've never heard of this place, and had very little knowledge of what it was going into it. We had just gotten out of a play at the Ahmanson, and were still a bit early for the 6pm opening. So as we tried to eat up some time by walking there. Apparently, we are fast walkers because we still had some time to spare. So, we loitered around the lobby, and it's a good thing we did. As it go closer to the six o'clock hour the more and more people started to fill the lobby and get closer to the elevator. So with five minutes to spare, I called the restaurant and asked if I could get a reservation...in five minutes. They were very accommodating, and quite tickled with my request. It was a chilly night in November, so I thought for sure they were going to sit us inside. They sure didn't!The whole vibe is very 1920s(?) from what I could tell from the "uniforms" of the restaurant staff. I thought they were just weirdos who dressed up in bowler hats and suspenders when I originally saw them in the lobby, but then I saw that they worked there, it all made more sense. One of those "ah-ha" moments, but on a much much smaller scale.We were taken to our outdoor seat, and with the heaters on full blast, it actually wasn't that bad. And it just so happens all the people crowding the lobby where all one big group there for a surprise party that was happening on the inside, so the outside area was nice and quiet. We had an awesome view of Pershing Square, complete with view of the outdoor ice rink. It's the little things.We chose some wine, and my foodie friend talked me into having the fried bone marrow for an appetizer. I will try anything once, and I was pleasantly surprised by it.  I thought it funny that they served it still in the bone, but my friend did not. Presentation aside, It did make it a bit complicated. But it was actually really good on the toast and with the dried fruit they served with it.For my main entree I got the Boeuf Bourguignon Déconstruit (braised short ribs). I might not be able to say the actual name of it that well, but I could defiantly eat it with panache. It was absolutely amazing and over way too soon.The staff was great. There were a couple moments when our server took a bit too long to get back to us, including one time when we actually had to flag him down when he was inside. I do not place blame on things like this as I have worked in the industry before and sometimes nights go that way. If he was not doing it intentionally, then who cares. I ate an awesome meal and that's all that matters.I would for sure come back here. It's fun and different and the food was great. Yeah, it was pricey, but then again you're paying for a really nice view and ambiance...and that's how it goes. I will for sure be Perching again soon.

Reviews.Author: Cindy S.
Reviews.Content: I was originally gonna give this place 2 stars but I decided to give it 3 stars because the view really made up for it. This place hasn't been open that long and I think that they be going though a bit of a trial period so the food took a while to get served. Overall the food was really salty but at the same time kind of bland. All the dishes just felt like there was a key ingredient missing. The drinks weren't bad and pretty strong, which was good. I had a couple Royals in different flavors (Peach, Violet, Strawberry). Basically, I'd recommend that people pass on dining at Perch and just have drinks at the bar instead. The view is amazing and the location is great.

Reviews.Author: bene b.
Reviews.Content: Bad, bad service!Last time I checked, we are not cattles. But I don't know why we were treated like we were. This is not a place where you would want to be when a place is about to close.First, at around 1:30 AM, we were asked to have our last call for drinks. We were told by our waitress that we can take our time in drinking what we just ordered. We have the mental note that the bar closes at 2. (And later on we knew the hard way that by that, they mean that everyone should already be downstairs by 2.)  At around 1:41 AM, unruly security guys/bouncers started to tell us that the place is closed. We thought that they would give us time to finish our drinks at least since, we still have at least 15 mins more before they actually close. We have closed our bill during the last call and were enjoying the final moments at this rooftop bar. Then, came someone rudely telling us that rooftop is closed. We thought they are just closing out the open area, so we moved inside...only to be thrown out again. One of us ordered something which was never touched. If we only knew, we would have not ordered the last one.As diplomatic people that we were, we just followed and headed to the crowded elevator lobby. We had to go down 2 floors and when we got out, all our other fellow cattles were there.  We had to wait for any of the 3 damn elevators to take everybody down and the line goes by elevator. One security guy tried to stop someone from going down the stairs and recklessly bumped me without even trying to excuse himself or say sorry. I just had a drink so I was not really tipsy or drunk but even if I was, I would have remembered this happening!For the same ambiance, I would rather go to The Edison...and for the rooftop view, I would go to The Standard. It's SAD to see care not being taken by the management to make customers feel special because they do have a good location and the big thing missing is the HUMAN TOUCH. dictionary.cambridge.org…

Reviews.Author: Dorry T.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my husband somewhere new for his birthday so I googled "best places to watch the sunset in LA" (besides the beach) and decided to check out Perch for happy hour. They have a daily happy hour menu (drinks and food) from 4-6pm and we arrived around 5pm. Beautiful view of the city and sunset. The drinks and service were great. The food is nothing special (plain hard bread with the mini hotdog and my husband said the mini burger was really boring and bland). The full menu might have more favorable options, but we didn't stay for dinner. We did love all of the places to sit outdoors with heaters, a fireplace, fire pit, etc. The inside is also gorgeous with comfortable chairs and couches and good lighting. Our server didn't mind at all that we moved around from outside to inside and back outside. A great place to meet friends/group of people. Go for the drinks, the service, and the atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Lilli I.
Reviews.Content: Perch is my absolute favorite! I will (grumblingly) wait in line on any given weekend to come here because it's just...so lovely.The ambiance is classy, warm, inviting, and just...lovely. Don't know how else to describe it. You walk in and there are groups of people sitting on couches, at the tables, and amidst the heat lamps and glowing lights outside on the balcony. The view is spectacular from any angle and the drinks are tasty. Crowd is usually pretty decent...sure there's the occasional over(under) dressed girl and creeper guy, but overall it's kept pretty classy. I've met some great people and have had some great conversations here. The one time I ventured up to the top balcony portion of Perch, I had no problem. Didn't wait long and was happy to find an equally as charming setting.Note: I usually get the My Fair Lady...which I like to describe as a more chic version of the Cosmo. However...it's been pretty hit or miss, depending on the night/bartender. The first time I had it, it was perfect- not too sweet, not too strong, with a bit of a citrus twist. The most recent time I ordered it, however, it was way too strong and way too sweet. Not sure how that happens, but it didn't even look like the pinky color I had the first time. Very odd.Please come dressed appropriately. This is a plea particularly for the ladies. I've seen some girls here with their clubbing attire and this is so not a Hollywood club.Can't wait to come here again...especially now with my best friend having moved downtown! Perch, here we come!

Reviews.Author: Mary R.
Reviews.Content: I spent an hour here last Saturday and it was THE WORST.Rooftop view? Didn't get to see it.Great wines? Didn't get to taste them.What I DID get to do was hang out on the street outside of Perch for an hour (before leaving). The only reason we even waited so long was because our friend, the birthday girl, was already inside. We were a group of 10 adding onto the birthday crew, arrived 5 minutes after the birthday girl, and apparently those 5 minutes were enough to generate an hour long wait.Rooftop view? I'll enjoy the private view from the roof of my own loft, thnxverymuch. And I'm pretty sure Buzz down the street can fulfill all my wine needs. Maybe Perch is a fantastic bar, but I can only review the part of the establishment I was privy to enjoying. And that was the sidewalk. For AN HOUR.Quick tip? Besides "don't go", I suggest arriving before ten. Apparently the only way to get in.

Reviews.Author: Shelley C.
Reviews.Content: Def do not come here for the food. Come here for drinks and for the pretty ambiance.Came here around 9, started with some sparkling wine... got the pork belly ( it was ok), cheese plate (liked one cheese on there) and mussels (bad tasted fishy)... but enjoyed the ambiance alot!

Reviews.Author: Dak L.
Reviews.Content: Perch was cool the first time I was here but recently have exploded out of the blue. The spot got blown up big time and is harder than ever to get in. Sad story, they seem to be changing to the worse, as in Hollywood style. The bouncers out front were playing favorites and made the folks out there waiting. Long story short: Perch used to be good but is just mediocre now due to staff. If you want to check this place out I would highly, HIGHLY recommend you coming here early around 9ish. Come here for the amazing view leave here cause of staff.

Reviews.Author: Jesse K.
Reviews.Content: How could we dislike anything about this place? Fifteen stories above downtown Los Angeles, we had a brunch that was decadent, comfortable, and superb. We started with oysters, and they were served with a delightful shallot vinegar and horseradish - also fresh. After a bottle of champagne and a carafe of fresh OJ, we felt sufficiently mimosa-ed to get on to the real meal. We each ordered a dish to share, and a beet salad besides. Everything was great! The dishes were served rapidly and still piping hot - steak frites, smoked salmon Benedict, French toast (get the French toast!) and it was all perfect. The service was efficient, friendly but professional, and with the sunny autumn weather and music from the live band, it was a perfect brunch. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Author: Yuki N.
Reviews.Content: I had a Sunday brunch here and enjoyed East Coast feel!They had a live band playing Jazz on a balcony where has about 10 tables over looking down town LA high rise building.As a west Los Angelena, I enjoyed the view and different ambiance compared to the ocean side restaurants.  The most amazing thing for me was their friendly service.  THe waiters are all attentive and smile as if they enjoy their job for real.We ordered salad and stakes which were both great. I was going to order the salad as entree but the portion was very small so we shared the stake later.The bottle of champagne was only $12!!  I have to come back again for happy hour:-)

Reviews.Author: Jessica H.
Reviews.Content: First thought, how the heck do I get there?.. you have to go up an elevator.. and then up a separate elevator and press the mysterious button with a picture of a bird :P. Couldn't help but smile as I exited the elevator because the atmosphere was superrr cute! The servers are all dressed up and the outside looked so inviting :).  Came for happy hour, which runs from 4-6pm but was runnin late because of traffic(surprise surprise). Got here at 6:02pm but the bartender was nice enough to let us still order from the HH menu! My friend and I ordered a French 64 Cognac $7, which is one of the best cocktails I've had to date.. the only thing that would make it better is if it were a bit stronger.  Upstairs there are 2 rooftop decks with firepits, which is nice because it gets pretty chilly up there at night.  I really like this place mostly for the view of DTLA from the rooftops.  Good chill place to come to chat with a few friends.   Only down side is their HH isn't the best deal.  But the atmosphere makes it worth it.  Look forward to going here in the future and trying their food :).

Reviews.Author: Donna U.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved Perch. We went on a Thursday to avoid traffic to Downtown and it was amazing. The place was not crowded, they had live music on the Patio on 13th floor. We went up to the 15th floor - Oh my - What a view! The little fireplaces are a nice touch. I will be going to Perch again very soon!

Reviews.Author: Diane T.
Reviews.Content: 3 stars solely for the view you get from the rooftop bar. It is absolutely gorgeous.  The place is gorgeous. More of a homage to the glamor of the pass. Very classy and chic. If you're looking for a place to lounge around, grab a few drinks with friends, and  to be around a non-rowdy crowd, you would love perch.  The crowd is a bit more mature here and there is no dance floor.... Personally I don't see what the hype was. The rooftop experience was more of a scenic experience than anything.The drinks and cocktails that they offered had cute names, but nothing special. Just different renditions of classic drinks that we're use to.What was the deal breaker for me was definitely the wait. The wait to get in..the wait to go upstairs.. everything was just slow. Event he bartender didn't seem to want to be there. Will not return for sure..

Reviews.Author: Jared H.
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot for happy hour on a weeknight.  That's all I am reviewing because I haven't been here on weekends before.The view is spectacular, the small bites and drinks are great and the ambiance is amazing.  The spicy nuts are very good and paired with a Kronenbourg 1996 and the amazing view, it puts me into a good place.

Reviews.Author: Ara A.
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I don't remember much about Perch, which means it was amazing!Haha a friend and I heard about this place and thought we'd give it a shot as we were sick of the bars around our hood. What a choice we made... very cool place with a great vibe. You have to get in 2 different elevators to get there, made it seem like a ride in disneyland or something.Needless to say, we got pretty hammered. I wanted some Captain n' Coke but instead I met a little guy named Sailor Jerry, and my goodness is he strong. We don't even remember how we left the place but I can tell you we had a blast. Friendly service, classy, great vibe, great views, will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Cloudy C.
Reviews.Content: Perch tries really hard but doesn't quite hit it. The elevator ride to the restaurant is fun, very NY, James Bond.  The appetizers we had were alright, the drinks are kind of expensive, and cocktails tiny.  There is some kind of French theme (music and food) but it doesn't have the class and style of a European place. There is that uptight LA feeling, everyone looking around at who is who, the servers and hostesses on edge, not much personality, fake.   It is a great concept, views of the city, French theme but the vibe was not French and the crowd blah, though I was there on a Saturday for a friends birthday.I'd like to go back during the week for sunset and see if the vibe is more chilled

Reviews.Author: Michelle M.
Reviews.Content: I really just want to relive the days of old when Perch's dining menu was much more adventurous... Gone are the days of rabbit rillette, croque monsieur sliders made with pork belly and quail eggs and *sigh* roasted bone marrow... The drinks are still good, but for the crowd, the menu just isn't as interesting as it first was to brave the crowd.  :( Bring back those three items and I'll see you asap! Pleeeeeeaaaaasssseeeeee? They were so good!

Reviews.Author: Wes P.
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous spot. A lot of space on the rooftop but now that winter's here it gets cheeellllyFood is good but definitely cracked the bank. I'm assuming the premium pays for the view. In that case, I'll just come for drinks. Oh, those have a premium too. But they do carry France's equivalent of budlight, kronenbourg 1664! Nice spot for dates or to take someone who hasn't been, but I wouldn't consider it my drinking hole.

Reviews.Author: Victoria H.
Reviews.Content: Finding one's way to Perch wasn't too bad. After parking in the large lot across the street, you enter the building, hop onto an elevator, and punch the 13th floor button with the bird next to it. Although you get off and transfer elevators, it's rather convenient to manage your way up to the roof with just another punch of the bird. I came during happy hour on a Friday, between 4 and 6, where my friend and I managed to be seated in some cozy lounge chairs before the evening's reserved tables filled up. The decor, inside and out, from vintage wallpaper to bubble lights adoring the small trees, was delightful. The quaintly-named cocktails and wines, and appetizers were fairly priced. It's an interesting place to people-watch and city-watch, especially as the sun set.

Reviews.Author: Dikran I.
Reviews.Content: 3 bad things:1) There is sometimes a 15- 30 minute wait just to get in2) You may have to wait 15-35 minutes to get your drinks when it's super busy and you are seated.3) The food menu is not exhaustive...many items are missing and there is no full meal to be had.3 Great things about this place1) View is awesome2) There is no cover charge and no Hollywood style BS at the door3) There are tons of people dressed nice and an amazing atmosphere in which to meet people and mingle.Hope you liked my small review.

Reviews.Author: Mica L.
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at Perch. I made reservations, went in at 9pm with a group of 7 and sat outside (outdoors is definitely the place to be at Perch, although the interior is beautifully decorated as well... the bar indoors is great and wasn't too crowded, however, I figured I came to Perch for the gorgeous view of the city). Although I had made reservations, we had to wait about 10 minutes, but I didn't mind because my friends and I hopped over to the bar and waited on a big couch in the center of the room. Music ranged from jazz to French music, I would say it's pretty upbeat, but was also mellow at some points. Mixed vibes, but I liked it.We had the lamb burger (very good, plus the homemade chips on the side were out of this world!!!!!), frog legs (light and flavorful), duck duck goose sandwiches (delicious, not a big fan of the bread though), and the cheese platter (great variety of cheeses and candied fruit). Overall, I have no complaints! Walking around the balcony area and the top floor (Perch owns 2 floors) was really nice and we found a good spot at the corner overlooking Perishing Square. The city lights were our stars. The view was beautiful, I'd come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany A.
Reviews.Content: Location , location, location...love the view of LA.Love the Aperitif Hour: 4pm-6pm WINE $6Cocktails $7and HORS-D'OEUVRES are like $4- $8.What else do you want.?

Reviews.Author: Ashley L.
Reviews.Content: As a recent transplant to Los Angeles, I appreciate venues that celebrate the city with a laid back California style. This skybar is absolutely beautiful. The indoor lounge and outdoor dining allow visitors to enjoy delicious dishes in either atmosphere. In the early evening, they play standard jazz and switch to salsa/funk at night.I recommend:Appetizer: Buffalo Frogs LegsEntree: Caviar Salmon with lemon thyme risotto and chive maderia creamDessert: White Chocolate Bread Pudding

Reviews.Author: Shay H.
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! My boyfriend took me here last week for my birthday on a Monday night. Staff was very friendly and the food was super delicious! The portions were not too big which I liked. The cooks really focused on the flavor of your food and not on our big the food was. Any place you sit outside was just gorgeous with the city views. It helped a little that the day had such great weather. I also give high regards on customer service. They comped our dessert and salad after we waited a long time between our appetizer and entree!Highly recommend and I wanna go again!

Reviews.Author: Kyle O.
Reviews.Content: Great food and views, good business dinner environment or trendy later night spot.  Good wine. Pricey but what isn't these days. Cold without heaters this time of the year, so be sure to sit strategically if you are outside on the perch.

Reviews.Author: Donny W.
Reviews.Content: My gf and I came here on the Saturday before Halloween after the party we were at stunk. To redeem the night we decided to go to Perch. Little did we know at the time, this place is much much worse. We both ordered drinks with my gf ordering a mixed drink and myself ordering a glass of wine.  When they arrived they were pathetically small.  I got maybe 2 sips out of that glass. I can't emphasize enough how absolutely miniscule the glasses were.  After being a bit unsatisfied with the drinks we wanted to order a bottle of wine this time but our waitress never came again.  I can only assume she went home and didn't pass us off to another one.  After about 20 minutes of sitting around enjoying the so-so view completely baffled as to why our waitress was nowhere to be found, we just flagged down another waitress (which in it of itself is remarkably difficult for some reason). We just paid our bill and left. If they don't want our patronage then we won't give it to them.

Reviews.Author: Nicole S.
Reviews.Content: How is this only 3.5 stars at the time I'm writing my review?I had been dying to go here for months, and so I decided to have my bday party here. I called a few weeks ahead of time and reserved the largest table they had (for 12 people). We were seated at 10pm on the dot, and the whole experience was exquisite. They gave us this entire side area as a private area for ourselves. The staff was friendly, the drinks were creative (and strong- had the worst hangover of my life the following day), and the ambience was perfection. There were minor issues with people having to wait in lines-- the staff was only allowed to et up 12 people under   the rezzie, and they did keep track. However, they let up pretty much everyone, with polite requests from me and my guests. I really couldn't have wished for a better venue. Thanks, Perch!!

Reviews.Author: D D.
Reviews.Content: Awesome views, worth waiting in fake lines to get to top, never over crowded on top. Views are best, drinks weak, view is best.

Reviews.Author: Chinese D.
Reviews.Content: The handful of times I've been to Perch have always been good experiences. The only downside is the difficulty in finding parking, which goes with any downtown venture. Here are my recollections from Perch:- real truffle pieces in their truffle fries! great happy hr menu item- happy hr sliders are microscopic -_- but also juicy- Jenna, the bartender, makes a fabulous old fashioned with genuine maraschino cherries!- the happy hr menu offers red (and white) wine... woohoo!- Jerry, the security manager, is a real sweetheart, warm, and welcoming- all the staff, including the host are easy to talk to and have nice personalities- I've never had an issue with sitting. A bar stool, couch, or chair are readily available- dress up or dress down, everyone seems to fit right in- beautiful downtown skylight view from the rooftop and bar level- all in all, Perch offers good vibes and I've never been disappointed

Reviews.Author: Liza P.
Reviews.Content: I went grandopening night, and instantly I loved the decor. I would think it would be more dressy, but a lot of people were dressed very casual. Food: the portions are wayyy to small, don't go hungry. We just ordered the appetizers ie bone marrow, nuggets and french onion soup.  All were very average, the only one of those three that was pretty good was the soup.Ambiance: great  wrap around rooftop atmosphere, friendly staff although the service needs to be turned up a notch. Great to go just have a drink. and chat. Love the french feel to the place, and the live jazz band was a great touch made it a very enjoyable experience.Take a jacket, gets very windy up there, and not enough heaters.

Reviews.Author: elvira g.
Reviews.Content: View: amazing... that's it. Let me share my evening with as we just came back from Perch.Let me just start of how excited we were to eat at Perch tonight for my birthday, as we have heard and read great reviews.We sat down at 9:01I ordered the Lobster Bisque at 9:15... Lobster Bisque came to our table, luke warm and hardly no flavor at 9:52 pm. No bread, no nothing -for such an expensive place.. come now.My girlfriend ordered the fillet of beef, received at 10:10 (an hour AFTER we ordered)!! Overcooked and charred. I ordered the Fish -it was edible.We ordered a coke at the time we received our entrees, we got the coke AFTER we paid our bill.It was such a hopeful night with such disappointment.We were told the chef was in training; if a chef is in training, and mediocre food and service are delivered.... prices should not be as high.What such disappointment.The view is lovely, that's about it.

Reviews.Author: Cath C.
Reviews.Content: I had great time with my date except the wait time on saturday night. Wait time was horrible and to get drink was even worst... but once we had drinks, great view and company was priceless....

Reviews.Author: Rocio E.
Reviews.Content: This place is has the PERFECT atmosphere to hang out with friends, have a few drinks and enjoy the viewI've been there a few times and haven't got around to trying the food but would say that the crowd is more mature on a Wednesday or Thursday while the weekend tends to attract younger patrons...

Reviews.Author: Anthony B.
Reviews.Content: Very hipster rooftop bar.How did the hipster burn his mouth on a slice of pizza?He ate it before it was cool.This joke defines Perch.

Reviews.Author: Marissa B.
Reviews.Content: Went here again last Thursday with my special guy friend past 10 pm. I dressed up in a white dress with long suede leopard overcoat.We sat outside for dinner overlooking the beautiful buildings. We shared an appetizer of bone marrow, which was absolutely delightful, rich in butter, and long bones of 3. I think it was seasoned with garlic too. What made it special was there was large fat still there which did not melt away and we put it on top of the bread. I had 2 pieces out of the 3, because my friend was sweet.For dinner, we both had the Perch. He finished everything and me being the crazy girl that I am, had only half of my food or maybe 3/4. It was good, I enjoyed the large red and yellow tomatoes and green peas that accompanied it, but the fish was nice.For dessert, we shared this chocolate pudding with a bit of caramel center. I wasn't crazy about the center, but the pudding was nice.After, we had plenty of drinks and danced to some very sensuous French and European music. We had the whole place to dance in and it was seductive and lovely. It made you want to dance the whole night....I felt like I was in Europe. The staff was amazing and I love their outfits for the ladies. The velvet bowtie and French maid inspired outfit is sexy and classy. The DJ was very hip and knows what song to play for fast and slow music that we were able to pace ourselves to dance to the fast ones and relax during the slow songs.After dancing, we just took in the beauty and magic of the night.Perch is definitely romantic and a sexy scene.I saw the moon and the stars....

Reviews.Author: Krista Y.
Reviews.Content: Well I can say for certain that you won't be disappointed by the terrific rooftop view of downtown LA.  How fun, calming, and fresh.The drinks are pretty intense.I had the french maid I believe it was called and would totally get it again.It is DEFINITELY easy to spennnnnnd here though, so be ready for that.

Reviews.Author: Gee G.
Reviews.Content: It's a chill laid back joint good for date bad for pick ups the 45 mins wait ain't worth it

Reviews.Author: Kim C.
Reviews.Content: Park in the lot across the street for only $5 after 4 p.m.Love Perch. The venue alone is worth 4 stars. The double elevators are fun and the outside dining area is absolutely beautiful. It's great for Happy Hour but I would love to come back for brunch or dinner as well. The mini hot dogs and truffle fries are bomb. I really liked the Hemmingway on the Beach and preferred it over the other drinks my friends ordered. The Craftsman 1903 lager was pretty good too.

Reviews.Author: Helen K.
Reviews.Content: This review is just for the drinks/bar/lounge area. I have never eaten here nor do I plan to (unless I start hearing stellar reviews on their food).The view is amazing, drinks are good, but it can get crowded on the weekends. Sometimes the wait isn't long, but other times it can be. Please note that there is a separate line for downtown la residents (much faster line) and be prepared to show dtla address on your ID. If you don't want to wait come early or late. Or, just come during the week when the crowd size is just perfect.You can park at the nearby lots and you can also park at the underground structure for Pershing Square.

Reviews.Author: Irene B.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I had a pretty horrific experience here for my friends bday dinner back in August, but I still wanted to review because I think Perch does have its perks.Let me back-up and say if you're planning on dining here, I would say please don't. Our risotto was undercooked, the short ribs too salty, the cordon blue poppers dry, and the service was a nightmare. A nightmare in that it took forever getting our food, and our server barely checked on us (it was super crowded, but still). The only redeeming quality of that night was the kind manager who took care of us. Now, let me move forward and say that I've been back to Perch a handful of times for drinks only, and I think that it's a great spot for cocktails and a sweet view of the city. Whether it's a girls night out, or meeting up with a group of friends, Perch is classy and a place you should definitely check out at least once.

Reviews.Author: Jose A.
Reviews.Content: WOW!  Incredible view of the city.  Came by with a few friends on a sunday afternoon and was completely amazed by the views and just general atmosphere of the place.   There are two different rooftop area's, one at the very top and one that is a floor below.  Bars at both lounge areas.  The lower floor has the bar inside so you can escape the sun if you forgot your glasses or are prone to burning.  Drinks are strong and around $10.  Our group had some of the cucumber cocktails that they serve and the consensus was that they were tasty!   Very refreshing especially on a hot summer day.  I didn't get to check out the food menu but would imagine it to be on the pricier side.   Overall, awesome location and we had a great time here!  Can't wait to come back again.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany P.
Reviews.Content: A gem in the heart of downtown LA! You haven't been to LA until you've been here. Happy Hour is from 4-6pm with a breath-taking view of the city :) Great service!I ordered the French 64 cocktail with Truffle Fries- both of which I highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Oscar A.
Reviews.Content: Wow what a view. If you're in downtown LA and want the perfect happy hour this is it. My selfish side doesn't want to write this review so I won't have to share this place with anyone. But if you love her, let her go. The rooftop view of downtown LA is amazing, especially at sunset. All the appetizers were delicious and the drinks were perfect. I'm going back soon.(Pics Included)

Reviews.Author: Downtownbaby T.
Reviews.Content: I heard their food was worth checking out--and granted, the view is pretty great.  It's got a nice mix of people that come from all walks of life.  What I really disliked about this place is how badly it was managed.The bouncers are cool, they don't fall for the Hollywood bullshit of boobs, butt and a wink to get through the line...the bouncers are fair and AWESOME for this.  It was also cool that Downtown Residents got their own line.  We waited in line for 20 minutes at the Resident line (with 2 'parties' ahead of us)...What I disliked was going to the 15th floor, to find out that my friends were on the 16th floor and we were *NOT ALLOWED TO GO UP THERE*.  They said they were at capacity and would not let us in...when we got down to the 15th floor, we were nearly turned away AGAIN saying that the 15th floor was at capacity even though we were *just there*.In the meantime, the bottom floor security was continuously letting people up despite "being at capacity" only to further infuriate patrons.After waiting 20 minutes or so, security finally let us up.  It's really upsetting and the entire configuration is confusing.  When we finally got up there--it wasn't even crowded WTF?  Also, security told my girlfriend (who was celebrating her birthday) to "keep it down". WTF?Terrible management of the crowd(s) and a little too stiff for me.F- never going back.

Reviews.Author: Sandie S.
Reviews.Content: After hearing about this place for some time, I finally got the chance to make it to this place! My friend and I had already eaten dinner, but we were in downtown and wanted to check this place out that we decided to come in here for drinks and for the view.First off, you have to take two elevators to get to the rooftop but it's not confusing at all because they have great friendly staffs that lead you to the right place. After entering Perch, I was surprised because the place was much smaller than I thought. I thought the entire restaurant would be a rooftop bar, but it was more like a small indoor lounge with a patio area. But I don't mean this in a bad way-I just expected something different I guess.My friend and I ordered a cocktail each, and they came out to $14/ea. I think that's a bit pricey for a drink.. but whatever, the view was nice so I guess it was worth it. Compared to the rooftop bar at the standard hotel, this place is 1000x better. I actually liked it that they have a indoor seating area because then you get to choose whether you want to be inside or outside. My friend and I sat outside. It was very cold that night but with the fireplace and heaters around me, weather wasn't a problem :)Overall, the place was nice. Not too fancy, not too casual. Nice view, nice interior, nice staffs. A great place to come for a date, or a small group of friends.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer N.
Reviews.Content: This is only a review for the 2 bars, not the restaurant.Pretty cool to take 2 elevators to the rooftop and well worth it.  The views of DTLA are wonderful when everything is lit up.The crowd is mixed and drinks are decently priced.Don't forget to bring a sweater or jacket in case it is chilly outside.

Reviews.Author: Gina R.
Reviews.Content: This place has a really cool atmosphere that is good for a date night or a night out with friends. The bar area is really lively and had good energy. I had the fried olives and chickpeas (surprised by how delicious this was), mashed celery root and green beans. Everything was really really good. The sauces they used were practically addicting. One gripe was they wouldn't take the bacon out of their brussel sprouts, frustrating for a vegetarian. And their dessert menu seemed to be lacking - my friends and I opted for a restaurant down the street instead.

Reviews.Author: Dexie L.
Reviews.Content: Very nice view but that's about it.Our server  was not only incapable but also inhospitable. He would not provide either drink or food menu. My friends watched incredulously while I had to convince him to show us a menu. The elderly busboy was more welcoming and attentively provided bread and topped off our water while we waited 20 minutes for our drinks. When it finally arrived, the wines and champagne were okay but the vodka tonic was very watered down. I had a feeling it sat for a while before our server brought it over. The food items we ordered ranged from just okay (boeuf bourg, risotto, frog legs, rabbit and beignets) to awful (pot du creme was like jello pudding and was not cooked) - nothing to rave or crave about. (Though my friends at another table told me the mussels were very good.) Staff was plentiful but disorganized. Servers were all just standing around looking clueless or bored. The muted chaos was apparent to even the remotely observant. I'm hoping it's just growing pains for them and that they'll work it out because it's such a waste of a nice view.After a disappointing time at Perch, my party ended up at Bar & Kitchen a few blocks away where the drinks, food and service were much better.Tip: while the view is nice outside, they don't have enough heat lamps so it gets chilly. Opt for the couch seating inside which will end up much more comfortable as the evening progresses. You can always stand up and walk around the outdoor deck while you wait for the drinks and food to arrive.

Reviews.Author: Tia N.
Reviews.Content: There's been a lot of talk about a relatively new place for drinks and dining in downtown..I'm referring to the Perch, located across for Pershing square.And after reading a few other entries about this place by past patrons, I sadly would have to agree with most of the negatives mentioned.. like poor service ( I think we waited at least 30mins before anyone asked use if we needed a server).. okay food (I tried the bone marrow with toast) and drinks were strong! ( I was definitely feeling a little warm after the first drink, okay so what if I'm lightweight)I like this place.. I just don't love it. But the most redeeming and undeniably feature is the amazing view of downtown.. so definitely take advantage of the warm summer nights before the evenings get too cold to enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Rachel W.
Reviews.Content: 5 Stars for the place, 1 star for the service!  Really cute lounge on the top of an old buildling facing Pershing Square.We got there on a saturday night around 11 and there was a small line but it moved fast.  You go up the old elevator and then up some more stairs and you have no idea where you are going but finally you make it to the top and enter a swanky little lounge.  The bar area was packed.  We finally got up there to order, and the chick was an f'in BITCH.  I have not had that bad of service in a long time.  No tip for her.  They don't carry Jack Daniels or Patron...weird.  But the lounge part outside makes up for the bad service.  We were actually able to find a nice comfy place to sit, and the view of downtown is awesome. The crowd was cute, a lot of hipsters but not too pretentious.

Reviews.Author: Patricia B.
Reviews.Content: "Take me back to the late 1800's, where the speakeasies attracted the bootleggers, gangsters & the, "who knows who's, to get up in this joint."This was the first thought that popped into my head as we took 2 separate elevators to get to our final destination, entering the first level bar area. The interior and the custom woodwork of the building brought to life an old world scene. If it weren't for the modern day folk, I would have felt as if I were in a different time zone, I absolutely loved it. The drinks were good, crowd was diverse (always a plus), the wrap around patio offered seating with a beautiful city view of DTLA. This review is strictly based off the first level bar area. I didn't venture off to any of the other levels because I only stayed a short hour and a half. I'm looking forward to my next visit & hopefully I'll try the food and have time to see the other levels.

Reviews.Author: Tracy S.
Reviews.Content: I came on a weekday so I had a better experience than most others. I have tried coming on the weekend but it was absolutely packed. Line was so long that we ended up going somewhere else. So if you still plan to go on the weekend, go early to get the optimal experience!Definitely the best rooftop bar I have been to. Absolutely gorgeous and classy. I felt like I was in Paris with the French music playing in the background. There are plenty of seats indoor and outdoor. The view of the building from the outside area made me feel like i was in a cute French Chateau :). Pretty cold outside but there are plenty of heatlamps and even a fireplace! Drink prices are on the pricey side but it goes hand and hand with the ambiance you get.I plan to come back :D

Reviews.Author: Cynthia H.
Reviews.Content: Great spot for a weekend brunch!Highlights:-  View:  Gorgeous view of the skyline and architectural details of neighboring buildings-  Drink:  $12 for a bottle of champagne!!  Easily enough for 4 generous-sized  breakfast cocktails.-  Food:  Crabcakes Eggs Benedict & French Toast with candied bacon-  Ambience:  French-inspired, lovely decor.  Cute outfits for the waitstaff as well.Non-Highlights:-  Location:  The entrance from the street is non-descript and kind of easy to miss, especially from the car.-  Parking:  Restaurant does not validate and does not have their own dedicated parking; allow for time to find parking. -  Reservations:  Make them well in advance.  I called on a Friday to make brunch reservations for Sunday but they were all booked up.  Arrived at 11:00 (opening) and was able to get a seat for myself and 2 friends without having to wait. -  Shade:  Lots of sun umbrellas on the rooftop patio, but I think they should consider investing in some giant Coolaro-style shades - people were jockeying for shade and frequently asking the waitstaff to move the umbrellas.

Reviews.Author: Justine L.
Reviews.Content: I came here for the view and that is worth 5 stars alone.  We also had no problem getting a table on the roof and drinks were good (but expect DTLA prices, duh).  Weird crowd - people dressed casual, people dressed up, people who looked like they just turned 21, people who were much older.  You will see people of all varieties here.

Reviews.Author: Renita K.
Reviews.Content: Great views and good service and attractive people and no cover. Love it.I've only been for drinks so I can't speak to the food, but so far so good!

Reviews.Author: Annie H.
Reviews.Content: Great spot for downtown LA with no cover. Nice rooftop view, they really control the number of people who get inside and to the rooftop.  They make sure to have people wait on the street even when the inside is only half full.  Perhaps they're more interested in making it appear crowded from the street level than the amount of money they're making upstairs.  If you have an ID that show your a downtown resident make sure to bring it because they have two lines, and presumably if your local you get priority, even over girls.  From the half hour I waited outside it didn't seem to matter what you wore or your sex because they let people in order of their place in line.The drinks were strong, I really enjoyed our cocktail waittress she was pretty awesome.  When a guy came up and chatted me and my girlfriends she cut to the chase and asked him if he was going to buy us drinks, and yes he certainly did.One other thing that was fantastic about Perch is that I really felt that there were Many cute guys, in line and even upstairs at the bar.  I don't think I've ever said that at any straight bar ever, so this is certainly a rarity.   ***note a girl friend who was with me this night went the next weekend and said there weren't any, maybe I went on a unique night?***Most people were casually dressed, its downtown after all, but I liked the crowd people were friendly.  There was plenty of room to walk around etc.  A slight negative is that the bar is a bit limited, they didn't have tomato juice, so no bloody marys and no cucumber liquor, so no cucumber flavored drinks.The annoying thing is how they control rooftop access and entry into the bar, when you get up to perch if they turn u away at the stairwell for access to the roof, just make your way to the elevator, theres no one restricting access at the elevator.

Reviews.Author: Richard G.
Reviews.Content: Great view. Pricey, Eye Candy. Try the Fischer Lager from France, the only way to drink classy!

Reviews.Author: Donovan C.
Reviews.Content: Thought I should check this place out. Brought my gf here last Thursday. Amazing view I think I was just underwhelmed unlike my gf because I have seen views like this from the Standard in downtown LA which is also worth it. Vino was awesome I really liked the white wines they had and nothing is better than drinking wine with a sick view. The food was awesome I got the filet mignon and my gf got salmon. Her salmon was alright kinda dry but my filet mignon was DANK as hell delishhhhhhous. We also got the macroni n cheese with bacon and pork belly as appetizers. They were okay.... mac n cheese was whatever pretty unmemorable mac n cheese. The pork belly was delish but portion was small had like 2 bites lol and I was starving for more. Overall great place spent 180-190 bucks I think that for me and my gf. Only issue was the seating we were sat on a 2 person table right in the middle of two other 2 person tables. Kind of awkward seating but I'm not a complainer so I didn't mind.

Reviews.Author: Eric S.
Reviews.Content: great venue, can be hard to find a seat at night

Reviews.Author: Christine L.
Reviews.Content: Perch should be named a "speakeasy" since it's somewhat hidden as you have to enter a building and go up two elevators to reach this spot. We came here for a rooftop gathering with some friends and enjoyed the spectacular view of downtown LA and the delicious Manhattans. The drinks were definitely well-made and we met the bouncer, Rene, who was very friendly. We will return again sometime and maybe check out the food as well.

Reviews.Author: Jon S.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite downtown bar with the nice view, fire pit, fireplace, and good drinks.Just make sure to get there early or else it'll take you forever to find a place to sit.

Reviews.Author: Juliana M.
Reviews.Content: Pros-Must go for the views of downtown LA alone-Cool, urban/french/upscale vibe-The fire pits/outdoor fire places are really nice-Great bartenders!Cons-Expensive-I'm not a huge fan of French food so the menu isn't for meTip:  Get reservations for dinner!

Reviews.Author: Elysha B.
Reviews.Content: Tried the Perch restaurant/lounge for the first time a few weeks ago. I really liked the scene. The restaurant is outdoors and the waitress was very friendly.For dinner, I split the frog legs, cheese fondue, scallops, and pork &beans with a friend. The scallops were definitely the best dish. Also had the My Fair Lady Cocktail, which was very tasty & strong.After eating dinner, I wen to the rooftop lounge which has a beautiful view of downtown.

Reviews.Author: Mark b.
Reviews.Content: Overrated overpriced but has a great view , service is fair not that good the food. Requested a table next to the window but got a table Against the wall , Requested birthday cake my friend but they did not do it never follow through with it forget it and leftWill not go back or recommend

Reviews.Author: Taylor T.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic food, fantastic ambiance, fantastic service, but significantly smaller portions than one might hope. That said, the quality of the food really is stellar and the ambiance is incredible and unique.

Reviews.Author: Carmen R.
Reviews.Content: I went to pre-opening and grand opening for the Perch and have been there a couple of times there after. The views are spectacluar...360 degree and you can see the downtown Los Angeles Skyline. I'm was pleased to learn that the venue has conference rooms that can be booked for private events such as parties...etc. The Perch provides outdoor seeting for dinner or just hanging out by the fireplace. The bar is spectacular located at center of restaurant and I must say the drinks are super!If you like fish...you must try the main dish called Perch. The fish is always fresh and the dish is very good. The staff goes out of their way to make you happy and and to accommodate your party. But of course with experienced owners....you can expect a pleasant experience all the time. Wheather with friends, colleagues or on a date..this is the place to be!Downtown Los Angeles is on the map and this place is a great addition to all the awesome restaurants in the area. Try it...you will not be dissapointed! Also, stay tune there's another great bar opeing soon in same builing on ground level.

Reviews.Author: Dan E.
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of rooftop bars, and LA has a lot to compete with.  The Perch is now my favorite for several reasons.The first is obviously the location.  The surroundings are as good as it gets in the heart of downtown LA - overlooking Pershing Square, and right next to the Superman "Daily Planet Building" (E.M. Wilson Bldg).  You're sure to get a great view whether you're posted up by one of the outdoor fireplaces, a comfy couch setup in the corner with your friends, or even inside by the bar where you can look out the large windows and open doors.Next is the food... simply amazing!  I had the braised short rib by recommendation, and my girlfriend had the risotto.  The meat was melt in your mouth, and the side dishes were to die for!  The portions were large, and they were reasonably priced.  I've also heard from friends that their lunch menu and appetizers are also quite delicious!The drinks are very well priced, and the mixes they make are phenomenal!  I think the name of the drink I had was called The French Maid.  I'm definitely coming back here just for drinks with friends!The decor is beautiful - sophisticated, but not stuffy.  The environment is relaxed and not stuffy.  Of course, the staff there is wonderful!  Rick, the GM, will have you in stitches by the end of the night if you get a chance to talk to him!  All of the waitresses are cute and personable, and they can really make some great recommendations for your meal.

Reviews.Author: Kristen W.
Reviews.Content: Killer Views in the evening at Sunset! Enjoy it with a "Writers Block" cocktail!!!  The dinner was forgettable but the views....oh the views!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Laurel H.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Perch three times and I'm pleased to say;  the food and the service are comparable to the view.  I would prefer the food to be authentic french, but I still enjoyed it.I asked our waiter who the owner was, he pointed out a man that was obviously angry and uncomfortable.  Needless to say I didn't introduce myself...maybe next time!

Reviews.Author: Gintare B.
Reviews.Content: I like this spot alot! The view is simply amazing. The vibe is nice. The drinks are really good (My Fair Lady is delicious!)  It's good to make a reservation, otherwise you will stand all night long which is ok if you want to mingle with random people, we actually grabbed a table inside the bar but quickly decided that standing outside in open air where you can see the city is much nicer. Oh also, if you get there a little early, you will not have to wait in line because it does get pretty crowded after 10pm.

Reviews.Author: Christen S.
Reviews.Content: One of Downtown LAs hidden gems!!! With gorgeous views and a outdoor patio, Perch is one of the best spots in LA. They have a great wine selection as well as great food. I personally love going there during happy hour and late at night.

Reviews.Author: Lisette C.
Reviews.Content: Cool concept, great views, but needs some work.Old art, good lighting and French music playing throughout...problem is, it's trying to be too many things to too many people.  Is it a club?  No, but there are mean bouncers everywhere.  Is it a French restaurant?  I think the French would beg to differ.  Is it a loungey-bar thingy?  Maybe.  All this confusion adds a level of anxiety that you don't want to have to deal with on a fun night out.  This place also draws a VERY diverse crowd which is good...and bad. Because along with the impeccably tailored gay dudes eating foie gras, there are also beligerant drunk chicks and dudes with face tattoos ordering shots.I agree that The Standard needs some rooftop competition, and for that, this place is great!   I just hope they figure out what they're trying to be (& to who) so I can decide if I want to be there.

Reviews.Author: Katherine W.
Reviews.Content: Just realized I hadn't reviewed Perch.  Came here opening night, and been back a couple times since.  The view, of course, is just lovely.  Old and new downtown, Pershing Square, just beautiful.  The space is--perfect, they did such a great job.  Art deco-ish, classy, relaxed, open.  The inside, vs outside, vs upstairs each has a slightly different vibe.I've only had drinks here, no food except the free (!) oysters on opening night.   Actually, they advertised free bites for opening night, so while I love oysters, it was disappointing that they didn't actually have a variety of small bites.I have not eaten here because the menu looks overpriced.  Some of the wines are also overpriced.  A glass of random pinot, I still don't know what it was, was a whopping $17.  I'll have to remember to always ask the price first, no matter how much I've already been drinking.

Reviews.Author: Dora G.
Reviews.Content: I've only been there for breakfast and it was pretty good. The eggs benedict were okay nothing special but the the French toast were delicious! They are made with a different kind of bread that just gives it this yummy churro like taste. You must try them! I love the environment, live music and the view. There is parking lot about a block away which was not my cup a tea but whatever you can't have it all. Service was great everyone was super friendly. I can see why this place is so popular. Will definitely try to go back at night!

Reviews.Author: Ogz K.
Reviews.Content: hey folks, just writing a truthful review. i have gone to perch  a couple of many  times.. i just want to express how i feel about this dump. its a horrible place to go eat for bunch ,lunch or dinner. reasons why ,???there is too many !.. just to scratch the surface of perch the building is old . It has old slow elevators ,that half of the time dont work or lag and yes people have been stuck in there elevators,  they also do not let you use the stairs.unless there  are kicking you out .so it makes a messy situition on the thirteen floor(lobby of perch). the food and drinks are over priced and the food is plain greasy not to mention I had a friend get food poisoning from perch .on top of that be prepared with slow serves and this problems runns deep to the core, the general managers and assistant mangers are like snakes ,they would love to smile at ur face and act like they are gonna  help you.but I believe its there lack of leadership and management that dragging the whole est.down. Get rid if them then maybe perch can be revived .they are the  "main problem". so i urge you! that there is many different classy places to go, rather  than perch unless you feel like getting stuck on an elevator/ line ,or eating greasy over priced food and drinks  that might make u sick .with a bunch of stuck up staff. by all means go a head . we  know that perch is trying the put out a nice and fancy  high class image as a  lounge/resturant.  good thing i know images can be deceiving .. i compare perch to a garage can sprayed with perfume, its still trash just in camouflage . If you wondering about the roof top yes there is a  nice view. if you can bet there capacity . Otherwise have fun in another line . These place is such a diss appointment I had to give my  2 cents

Reviews.Author: Foster K.
Reviews.Content: Perch was a great stop for a celebratory office happy hour. I love the speakeasy feel as you take two elevators to get up there, and the vibe is straight from the 20s. I also like ordering at the bar at gazing out at the rooftops while sipping on a nice belgian ale.It's getting pretty popular, so my recommendation is to get in at opening for happy hour, and stake out an outside spot on the corner. I'm a bit wobbly around heights, so I wouldn't want to be here when it's jammed and I'm getting jostled - but that's just me I guess!

Reviews.Author: Diana S.
Reviews.Content: The Perch is brought to you by the people who did The Must... when I found this out I knew I would love Perch. The Must has sadly closed down but it used to be one of my favorite spots.  'I went for a birthday party on a Saturday night and it was packed but I still got a seat at the bar. I decided to try the food and I was disappointed. It was mediocre at best however the drinks were awesome.  I kept drinking the "French Maid" (cucumber goodness) and the bartenders were nice. The view was reallly nice and we had a lot of fun!

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: Go early and you'll have a more amazing experience... We got up here around 9ish and the downstairs restaurant was already booked and hopeless... The menu was leather bound and looked delicious so we decided to head to the roof for drinks. The rooftop view and loungy feel was awesome... cool breeze, fire pits and good drinks.If you don't come early you'll be waiting in the staircase for a glimpse of good ambiance and a tasty menu:We ordered the mosles (mussels), shrimp & grits, truffle fries, lamb sliders, and MORE TRUFFLE fries!!!Hands down everything was tasty but portions were mini! But the champion of the night was the truffle fries... I think they were the best fries ever!Expensive but worth the change! I wish I could of tried one of the full entrees cause this French restaurant Perch was legit and definitely added class to the place.GO EARLY & Truffle Fries!!!

Reviews.Author: HourLy L.
Reviews.Content: Nay: -Everyone was super rude!-Drinks are over priced-Long wait. One of our friends was doing her birthday event here and it took about an hour and a half to get in.-Yay:-Nice view -Date ambiance

Reviews.Author: Duke H.
Reviews.Content: Ambiance: 3.5SDrinks: 3.5SLocation: 3.5SIt's a bar on a higher level than other bars. In order to get to the top floor which has the "best" view you have to wait for 1+hours, lol. I think not. I was there with a few friends to meet some friends. Overall it was a just like any other place where you meet friends to have drinks. It's really what you make of it with your friends.Go and see for yourself. It's a bar.

Reviews.Author: Kat R.
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking view of east side LA. Cocktails are fun and frizzy.
