Casual, hidden, yet sophisticated.Perfect for catching up with friends due to open balcony sitting and/or a romantic ambiance because of the fireplace and tables for two.It's on the 15th floor and you have to take two elevators to get there.Follow the canary. You feel like Alice following the rabbit in Wonderland.I recommend to go right at 4pm and grab a killer seat to embrace for the next few hours during happy hour because it gets pretty crowded after office hours clock out.Read more on my blog: xophotographybykat.blogs…

Reviews.Author: Margo I.
Reviews.Content: Perch is located in a beautiful old building in downtown. You walk down a hall and take two elevators to get to the roof. We had cocktails outside and they were delicious concoctions.  At dinner the mussels were fantastic and you certainly can't beat the view. I appreciated the way the Malibu times and vintage tables echoed the lines of the park below. The rooftop bar is REALLY fun after dinner.  Lots of intimate, heated spots to lounge with great views of downtown.

Reviews.Author: Maria H.
Reviews.Content: I heard raves about Perch so I finally convinced my friends to go last weekend. I thought it won't be too crazy full on a super hot Sunday and it was an impromptu lunch so we did not make any reservation. Wrong move. Always make reservations. It was jam packed and all the empty tables were 'reserved'. The host was nice enough to promise we'd get seatings as soon as the they're available, but nobody was in a hurry to leave. Why would they, the view was amazing. The busboy was not too friendly; he report us to the host when we were about to take an empty table. :(Then they found seats for us outside by the band, under the blazing hot sun. We took the seats, only to get kicked out 15 minutes later because apparently the seats were for the other band members. Could've told us earlier, no? By that time I was truly hot and bothered and not in a good way. I had a bitchy moment and told the waitress we're leaving. Then magically we got a table right away (that was previously reserved). It was the perfect table too, right in the corner with great views both ways. We thought we'd get kicked out again but whomever reserved the spot earlier but we stayed there for hours. I felt bad for being bitchy because our waitress was so nice & friendly. She really tried to make the situation better. Food arrived promptly, she paid attention to our table and the band was very good. I like my croissant-based French Toast and the truffle fries, but my friends were not too impressed. Next time I'd be sure to make reservations & probably just stay there for drinks.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan L.
Reviews.Content: Great ambiance with exciting view of DTLA. The "wraparound" balcony is a nice touch, as well as real glasses, compared with other rooftop lounges that use plastic "glasses." Small selection of beer, although the quality is high. Would recommend as a great date spot or place to hang out with a group of friends.

Reviews.Author: Heather L.
Reviews.Content: Solid 3 star experience. Good overall, nothing great, and a few things that need attention and prevent a higher star count.1. Service - definitely a bit of an issue. Host and hostess clearly do not want to be there "working." This right at 6pm when they open. The servers then played the "confused about which tables they are responsible for" game for about 30 minutes. During that time several walked by and waited on the tables around us, all the while avoiding eye contact with us lest we ask them for something. Finally someone took our drink order but we did end up being served by 2 or 3 different people throughout the night so it seems we were "up for grabs" by the staff and no one was too interested in making sure we got attention.2. Food - decent but not great. Ordered the frog legs and merguez sliders appetizers. Frog legs are a nice alternative to wings but not much different. Merguez sliders lacked flavor; I couldn't taste the herbed goat cheese and red pepperade at all. BF got the classic steak frites which was ok and definitely heavy on the fries. I got the Bibb and Blue salad with chicken which as an entree may not be a good representation of what they can do in the kitchen. It was definitely underwhelming.3. Drinks - good but not great. Got the Perch Daiquiri, the My Fair Lady, the French 64, and a Kir with Creme Yvette. The French 64 was definitely the best of what we tried. 4. The View - I may be in the minority but I am not blown away by sitting on the roof on the 16th floor. Yes it's nice, but it is not extraordinary. And if you're going to have the majority of your seating outside, please make sure the heaters work, crank out a good amount of heat, and are plentiful enough to accommodate everyone. It may be LA but we still get chilly and when it's windy like it was when we were there you need the heaters. It took them 45 minutes to get ours working and when it did it was not sufficient to keep us comfortable. Kept my coat and scarf on the entire time and was still cold.It's a nice place to go for a traditional French type experience but the view alone will not keep me coming back. I'd much rather have better food, better drinks and better service every time.

Reviews.Author: Margaret W.
Reviews.Content: The view is amazing and they have cozy fireplaces outside. We didn't sit outside though, we sat at the bar which was nice and the bartenders were very attentive. Drinks were decent, if you order one of their specialty drinks plan on it being in a small champagne glass and spending $12-$14 a drink.  Try the truffle fries they were delish!Perch is located in the Pershing Square building on the 15th floor. You have to take one elevator to get to the 13th floor and then another to get to the 15th floor. The energy on the 13th floor is pretty strong I felt like I was in a vortex, dizzy, and this was BEFORE I had anything to drink. ;)  They say some murders happened on the 8th floor and the energy is even stronger there, in all it proved to be an interesting and entertaining evening...

Reviews.Author: Ronnie Lee M.
Reviews.Content: Perch is just another great reason to visit Downtown LA. The line can get a little long down-stairs but when you get up to the 13th Floor, you'll be glad you waited. The menu for the bar seems to be limited and you have to order before 12 midnight. The only thing I was able to try was the sweet and spicy warm mixed nuts- which were amazing. What I liked the most about Perch as the two roof tops where you can look out while having your drink. I never felt the desire to go to the second roof top above as the view was fine from the first roof top. For me, it had a sort of 50's swank to it. For those romantic minds it could very well leave you feeling like your in a movie. The crowd is generally dressed trendy cool. It's Downtown. The age range was mid-twenties up. This is not exactly the place to take someone who can't handle a great social scene or their alcohol. Bring some class. The staff was pretty nice- I found myself being asked several times if I could be helped when sitting at the bar. It did take a minute but this was understandable because the place get's pretty busy. I'll definitely go back to Perch.

Reviews.Author: Golden F.
Reviews.Content: I called ahead to see when they closed, they said 1am.  I got there at 12:35pm. The guys at the door told me they had called last call.  I went up to Perch and had to "ask" if I could grab a glass of wine.  They complied reluctantly.  As I was enjoying my glass of wine with my friends the manager came and kicked everyone out.  This was at 12:45am.  He said he would loose his job if everyone wasn't out.  I think he should loose his job for terrible service. This is the second time I've been here and the first had just as terrible of services.  Skip this place if you would like an elite night with great services.

Reviews.Author: Asally A.
Reviews.Content: Loved the restaurant. Loved the views.  Will be coming back again!

Reviews.Author: Cheri. A G.
Reviews.Content: I came here mid-week so there was no line getting in (I don't do lines).  I had 3 friends with me and none of us had been here before but I have been hearing a lot about this place from my DTLA FB group.When we walked in we lucked out because there was a 4 top opening up so we immediately had a table.  I order the My Fair Lady drink (I am a huge Audrey Hepburn fan) and it was very good.  Not sure what my friends order but they seemed happy.  The views are amazing yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb…I will have to come by and try some of the food.

Reviews.Author: Mai N.
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with the rooftop bar.  The view was amazing.  When we first got there, the weather was decent but it got super chilly and after a couple of attempts, they were able to turn on the heat lamps which made sitting up there a bit more bearable.  The swinging chair was awesome  Drinks were a bit pricey but were well made and super strong.  I had the My Fair Lady and a mojito and I left pretty tipsy.  This is a great place for a romantic couple's night or even going out with a group of friends.  I definitely would want to come back and try the food in the restaurant.  We were totally watching people eat and the food looked amazing.

Reviews.Author: Erika M.
Reviews.Content: LOVED the feel of the place (especially the mismatched furniture and the fireplace outside) AND the view is ah-mazing! However, as far as Happy Hour specials go, it was alright. FYI, happy hour is from 4-6 p.m.Had the Kronenburg for $5 & some brie cheese sticks (errr...triangles) with jam for $6....such a good mix too!  Who woulda thunk it?! We also shared a side of shoestring fries for about $4. Friends had a mixed drink for about $6. At least the happy hour allowed me the chance to check this place out. Not sold on the overpriced dinner selection just yet. I may be eating my words though. Just hope they don't cost me an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Author: Esther C.
Reviews.Content: The 3 stars is for the awesome view.I would give the food 1 star, 1 star for the waitstaff and the bouncers at the club 1 star.  Perch is a new, hip lounge/restaurant in downtown LA and well...they still need to work on a few things.1. The food was WAY to salty and undercooked.  Our waiter was was rude.  And it took about 40 minutes for our food to come out.  We complained to the manager who apologized (and hooked us up with a discount) but even then...I would never come back to eat.  I can't get over the bad service and bad food.2.  LOVE LOVE LOVE the view.  If you're looking for a place to get drinks with friends~ the rooftop during the summer is PERFECT.  Otherwise...remember that it'll take you 30 minutes to get passed the bouncers and even if you do make it that far...it may be near impossible to get great service at the bars.*one redeeming quality that I love~ all the bartenders wear bow ties.  super cute and it adds to the ambiance of perch*

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: We went to the Perch as a group of 5 a couple of weeks ago and it's a great place for a fancy dinner out. We started with drinks on the rooftop which is nice, not too busy/crowded but still buzzing and great views across downtown LA. Cocktails are around $12-$15 which is fairly standard for LA I suppose, although they are on the small side. Then we went down a level for our dinner on an open balcony; again a nice setting, plenty of patio heaters and a nice atmos. Service is good and the food is not bad, although I've had better steaks. But the ambience and view make up for it. The only downside was that after dinner we couldn't get back up to the roof to continue drinks, as the queue was huge. Something to consider when booking or perhaps just stay at your table if you can. A great place to take out of town guests, or perhaps for a date!

Reviews.Author: Alyssa R.
Reviews.Content: This place is adorable. The view, the overall atmosphere, the French music, and the truffle mac n cheese! Happy girl, I was.Came for happy hour on a Friday and was seated right away. I was told the line to get in is usually crazy. Got lucky, I guess.I ordered a raspberry flavored glass of champagne. Nothing special. The bf ordered a Jacques Collins, which was mostly ice, but delish! The fresh lemon in it was refreshing.Lots of variety on the happy hour menu, but we decided to go with beef sliders and the truffle mac n cheese. The sliders were bland and came out cold. Reminded me of the frozen kind you get at the grocery store. MEH! The truffle mac n cheese was a different story. So, so tasty!Definitely coming back.. mostly because the place is so cute and the view really can't be beat.

Reviews.Author: Lisa S.
Reviews.Content: Very romantic restaurant !!! It's a perfect for a date or special day *･゜ﾟ･*:.｡..｡.:*･'(*ﾟﾟ*)'･*:.｡. .｡.:*･゜ﾟ･*beautiful view and good is very good! Very modern fusion French!

Reviews.Author: Jimmy C.
Reviews.Content: This review is for the lounge portion of the venue, so I am not basing this on the dining experience. As far as rooftop bars go, this is on par with the standard except no cover needed. The only draw back of this is the long lines and they only let people up if people come out. But I mean, there's so limited space anyways, it's for your safety to not have people body to body.Amazing view. that's all I have to say. nearly breathtaking. they have some fire pits and overall it displays a sense of elegancy and classic charm to it. Music is not that loud so you can have conversations with people. If you're looking for hip modern energy, then go to the standard rooftop.The bar did seem a bit limited in regards to choices and amazed to see such limited beer selection as well. Other than that, I've always had a great time here.

Reviews.Author: Ace D.
Reviews.Content: Great view and food.  Definitely a wonderful choice for a romantic date night. One of the few restaurants with actual city views

Reviews.Author: Jean C. M.
Reviews.Content: Maybe I missed something about this place?Generally, I love rooftop bars especially in a downtown setting.  But this place is just missing something that could make it great....  I get out of the car, pay the Valet fee, and the doorman says we have to wait in line - a line which consisted solely of my party of two.  Sorry...no thanks.  Yes, I know that's typical for places like this.  I say forget it let's go some place else, and magically he says we can go up.  Head through the lobby and up the elevator to the landing.  Of course the place is busy but not close to packed.  Annoying!The bar was relatively filled but still has some open chairs.  They have a decent selection of spirits but not extensive (only three bourbons).   None of the cocktails were really that impressive.  I'll give them this - the leather bound menus were very cool. It seemed like an odd crowd to me for some reason.  It may be because the place had only been open for a couple weeks then and people were just checking it out.  There was not much standing room outside on the outdoor portion of the space.  The deck seemed to only wrap partially around the roof and most of the space was taken up by dining tables. There just wasn't much room to stand outside and have a drink.I know the Standard has been around for a long time, but it still just seems like a cooler and nicer option. That said, it's worth a try to check it out!

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: Somehow within a short amount of time, this place has become extremely popular.  So popular in fact, that we had to wait in a long line at around 10:30PM, because they had already reached max capacity.  The only way you could go in was if someone came out.  Once inside, I simply stayed on the 15th floor (restaurant floor with balcony) because there was even a line to go up the stairs to the 16th floor (rooftop)!Let this be a lesson to you all: arrive early!

Reviews.Author: Bentacular E.
Reviews.Content: I applaud Perch's approach to French food. I see what they were trying to do, but so far I think they have a long way to go. Apparently, the concept is deconstructed French food. This may offend classic French connoisseurs because I think the concept was great, but poorly executed. The service, though  friendly were inattentive. It takes a long time for you to get a drink from the waiters. You're better off walking to the bar, which is unheard of when you go there for a sit down dinner. One of my friends actually got up and decided to get utensils himself because the waiter took so long. While seated at the table, they had no idea what drinks the bar served. The view, though high up, was not spectacular. While at your table eating dinner, you have bar patrons wandering around you smoking something. I can say that the other Yelpers were correct when they recommended the Duck, duck, goose appetizer. It had a very rich flavor, though I thought the bread was over-toasted. The frog's legs was acceptable, but not out of the ordinary. Just like a friend said, the entrees were hit-or-miss. You would find yourself eating a well-seasoned quadrant, and under-seasoned on another quadrant of the same plate. I ordered the beef bourguignon with pork belly, which apparently was the best dish on the menu. I enjoyed it, but did notice the inconsistency in the the seasoning.Overall, I found that Perch was still finding its place and identity, and that was very apparent.  I can't say that I would want to return unless something dramatic happens, or another friend decides to throw another birthday there.

Reviews.Author: Samuel C.
Reviews.Content: The view is amazing.  The food is decent.I think they had a chef change because last time i came here I remember the menu was different.And the last time they had this lamb burger that was insane good.  I returned for that and it wasn't there. They also chucked the cordon bleu poppers.  sad face.  oh well...I had the eggs benedict; their hollaindaise sauce was thick.  You can taste the light salty yolk (which i like), It gooed over my eggs so well...  I liked it.  But I felt it was rather pricey.  about 30-40% higher than most places that are just as good.don't get me wrong I'll spend extra on stuff if i feel it's mind blowing.  but it's just... good.  not wow delicious.My date had the burger.  She liked it but wasn't blown away either...  she said the cheese gave it a distinct flavor.  ...um yeah.  that too was pricey. Then it took forever to get service, we were told to find our own table and we did.  After that, we didn't see a server or even a busser come to offer drinks until about 10-15 minutes after we sat.  AND after we ordered drinks, it was another 10 minutes or so before our food order was taken... It felt like my server wasn't interested in being our server. I literally had to walk over to a bus boy and ask him to find my server.  twice.  i wouldn't have been so pushy but i had to leave and to be honest, if you're going to be priced to attract an affluent audience, you shouldn't be giving mcdonald's style service.I figure for what I am paying, I shouldn't have service issues of that sort.I'll probably only return for drinks.   The food is good but i feel i'm not getting my value for dollar. And service leaves me left begging...

Reviews.Author: Diana O.
Reviews.Content: This place would be arite if there wasn't such a LONG line to get in on the weekends.I mean come on!!! Once you get in though, the view of dtla is very nice and the drinks are pretty good and reasonable for the kind of place it is.  It's a nice atmosphere... comfortable enough to lounge and chill, but still fancy enough to feel like you're out and about.I've tried dinner here once, and I would never have dinner there again. The food was not very good and very over-priced for what it tasted like. I can't even remember what we had - that's how insignificant it was. I probably wouldn't go back unless I absolutely had to for a special event or occasion.  Even then, I'd have to think twice because of the ridiculous line.

Reviews.Author: David A.
Reviews.Content: I've been going here off and on for the past few years about twice a month (more in the summer time), and have always had a great experience. The waiter/Barteners staff are friendly and professional. And the Food and great and the view is to die for :)

Reviews.Author: Laura E.
Reviews.Content: I didn't come for dinner, just for drinks on a Friday night. It was really refreshingly nice! The ambiance is wonderful, the crowd : very mature/fun- not sleazy at all, and the decor is beautiful. Def one of the best rooftop bars in LA!

Reviews.Author: V T.
Reviews.Content: ***Updated Review:  Received an email from Tina and she said that the smoking issue has been taken care of, and offered a free round of drinks for me and my 4 friends the next time we are there.  So, the stars have gone up to where they should be without taking the smoking into consideration.  Thanks Tina!Views/Venue: 5 starsDecor:  3.5 StarsFood:  3.9 StarsService:  4 StarsSmokers:  -2 starsBiggest complaint is that the best seats are outside. We had a nice one next to a fireplace. Problem is, while eating they let people smoke right next to us (within 2-3 feet). Since there aren't any ashtrays, they were flicking ashes in the breezy air without concern it may fly into our food, and snuffing cigarettes in plants or on the floor. One person even asked to use one of our empty wine glasses as an ashtray. Not sure if it's even legal to allow smokers there. Whether it is or isn't, it's gross and until management does something about this, I won't go back.

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.. it's beautiful, fun, saavy & cozy all mixed into one and best part of it is that its a rooftop lounge! I fell in love music & the ambiance especially with the trio concerto.cello, viola & violin that was playing on the night of my visit. Food was delicious! We ordered some Hors d'Oeuvres mussels, steak frites, cheese platter, salmon tartare,  truffle fries, frog legs(which i didnt dare try but my friends liked it.. i think)Entree we ordered the sea bass (wasn't my fav)Boeuf Pot Au Feu (not sure what kind of statement the dish was trying to make)Filet of beef (Delicious, literally melted in my mouth) The wine selection & price was decent. Overall I'd love to go there again!

Reviews.Author: Heather S.
Reviews.Content: Great romantic atmosphere. Great French food. Great view. I ordered the chicken dish with brussels sprouts and potatoes. The chicken was perfectly cooked, juicy and moist on the inside and the skin was a little crispy. I'm sure it was only seasoned with salt and pepper, and that's all it needed. I also tried the steak frites, which was delicious with blue cheese melted on top. As for the rooftop bar, it gets pretty crowded on a Saturday night, so plan on getting there earlier. Bon appetit!

Reviews.Author: Carol L.
Reviews.Content: If only the lines weren't so long...then I would definitely come back. Luckily I came with a bunch of girls, and we were able to skip the line while others waited over an hour.There's always a line to enter the building, which you can clearly see when you walk or drive by. HOWEVER, what they regret to inform you about is the SECOND line to enter the roof. You mean I waited an hour to get into the building, and now I have to wait another 30-40 minutes to go outdoors... um...On the 15th floor, you can dine and drink. It's an open area/patio where you can chill with your friends. However, the 16th floor (ROOF) is where you NEED to be! You get a nice view of downtown LA.Their cocktails are good too! I love French 64 & My Fair Lady! They're priced like every other bars in dtLA. Crowd is mixed - you get some young people and some professional people. The decor is nice and simple. They have comfortable seats around the area and fire pits to keep you warm!If you are in the neighborhood and have time to kill, definitely hit up Perch for the experience!

Reviews.Author: Luby H.
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a classy bar to hang out at, this is the place for you.It's sort of an upgrade of The Standard, where you get the full-blown roof top view, but there are also indoor seating filled with couches and romantic decor. I haven't tried the food yet but from the looks of it, it's pretty decent, especially if you were planning on a date here or a girls night out where you would need something to sip and munch on.As for the drinks, it's really nothing special, but just your typical mixed drinks, wine, and beer. So if you are looking for unique tastes, then this wouldn't be your place. Considered yourself warned though, the roof top takes about 45 minutes to an hour wait. So if you were limited on the clock, you are stuck hanging out indoors or checking out another bar instead.

Reviews.Author: Arlene C.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 starsBEAUTIFUL VIEW of DTLA!!! Came here for dinner with girlfriends on a Thursday night. We had made reservation for dinner so there was no line or wait. Crowd was mixed. There was outdoor and indoor seating. Outdoor seats are great but not when its COLD and windy. They do have heaters but a little too chilly for me. I ordered the poppers and ceaser salad. Food was okay. I would rather saved that space for the beignets. Definitely a great place for the venue and I wouldn't mind coming out here again.

Reviews.Author: Sam P.
Reviews.Content: Recommendations:1. make a reservation if you plan on getting seated and ordering food2. come before 10:30 pm to avoid lines3. wear a jacket if the weather is cold (not enough heat lamps)Ideal for:1. quieter and non-crowded evenings with friends in LA2. romantic date - grab the table next to the fireplace for a cozy spot!I've only been here once and it seemed like it was an off night. The music earlier on is smooth ambient noise and it transitions into more upbeat songs that you can dance to after about 11pm. My friends and I came here for appetizers but since we didn't make a reservation, we had to stand around for an hour to wait for someone else to leave a table. Even though we arrived at 9pm, all of the chairs and tables were taken.The view of the city is nothing fancy as this building is only about 15 stories high. That said, had we been higher up, I'm sure it would have been colder and windier.Try out the frog legs and impress your date with your sophisticated palate. That dish reminded me of buffalo chicken wings with ranch sauce to boot.Drinks are $10-13.I saw one dude who spent over $100 on a meal and drinks on his girl, only to have his girl say that she wanted to go to her place and sleep and that she'd meet up him next time. Burned!

Reviews.Author: Brooke P.
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of the Edison bar and Standard rooftop bar in LA, and was convinced that they were the best bars downtown, but after being away for a few years, Perch has definitely fought for the top spot. If you're looking for a sophisticated night out to catch up with friends, with a killer view and ambience, this is your spot. There are 2 rooftops and both are beautiful, but only the first is accessible by elevator. You'll have to wait in a staircase for the top level, and on a Friday or Saturday night, that can take 15-20 sobering minutes. The wait is worth it, though. The bartenders are nice. Even on cool nights, they have heat lamps, comfy seating, and breathtaking views. It also attracts a nice crowd.

Reviews.Author: Sennett L.
Reviews.Content: So after hearing/reading about the great view of LA, I decided to check out Perch with my girlfriend last friday.  I was thinking, if the place was as nice as it was made out to be, I might consider having my birthday party here next month.  So we get there around 10:15pm and there is already a decent line outside so we decide to wait it out assuming a 20-30 minute wait.  After about 40 minutes, we were pretty much next in line after a group of 4-5 girls, so I figured, it can't be that much longer.  So we decided to wait it out. As we were standing there, right in front of the bouncer, we watched group after group after group of people who were NOT waiting in line, walk straight up to the bouncer, talk to him and wait for 3-5 minutes and get let in before all the people WAITING in line.  At first, I just thought maybe these were all people who were part of a big group/party but soon noticed that they were random people who decided they were too cool to wait in line.  After watching about 20 minutes of this (waiting a total of about an hour and 10 minutes), my girlfriend and I decide to leave.  Keep in mind, this ENTIRE TIME, while we were waiting, we watched more people LEAVE the building than the number of people that were let in.  First time that's ever happened while I was waiting in a line.. for ANYTHING...What a COMPLETE WASTE of an hour of my precious friday night.  I honestly don't care at this point how nice the view is from Perch, I will not go back unless I'm guaranteed NO WAIT.  Even then, I would think twice.

Reviews.Author: Oganes O.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing, it has a great view from the roof top! The drinks and food were amazing. Mussels are delicious. The only thing that sucks is waiting for more than an hour in line to be able to get in! I would recommend making reservations to dine.

Reviews.Author: Diana P.
Reviews.Content: 4 starts mainly because of the breathtaking view. If coming here, you must grab a table outside, no question about that. Food is French, good but nothing incredible. Lots of garlic used in the dishes but very well prepared and served. Staff is friendly and very 'hip LA'.It takes several elevators to get to this place and you don't really know where you're going until you get there and then there's a big, AHHH that comes out.  One of those places you see on tv.Truffle fries were delicious, pasta was just ok, too garlicky and not as much flavor as I'd hope.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy S.
Reviews.Content: Food is okay. We had the pork belly, brussel sprouts, and scallops. The drinks are also average. This was my first time there and although it was a nice rooftop. The hassle of getting there was just too much to call it a place I would willingly come back to.

Reviews.Author: L L.
Reviews.Content: I was only here for the rooftop bar so can't vouch for the food in the restaurant.There was minimal decor, seating was limited and seemed like a haphazard collection of mom's-backyard-patio-furniture. Doesn't seem like much thought went into the configuration of the space, patrons stood around like we were at some awkward frat boy's pool party before everybody got drunk. Parts of the area were cordoned off, so as the night progressed, the space got more crowded with nowhere to go.Drinks were strong, delicious, but pricey.Maybe the bar was still a work in progress- it felt like Perch dropped the ball on creating an ambiance even with the stunning view of downtown skyline.**4/12/12 update**This is an update since my first visit in Oct 2011. Rooftop bar:Drinks are still delicious and strong, bartender was easygoing and friendly. There are more nice patio furniture with heating lamps and fire pits. But the center of the space still only has standing room; which is stupid unless you have music and dancing/swaying allowed. Restaurant:This is where the fun began. We were seated on the outdoor patio, waited for 10-15 minutes, flagged two busboys down and still nobody ever came by to offer drinks, menus, or take orders. We went indoor instead: Fantastic decor, furniture, and music; it's like your grandma's sitting room (that is, if your Grandma rocks a Downton Abbey style mansion). Our waitress promptly appeared and took order, but the food did not appear as promptly. Steak frites was delicious, salmon tar tar was so so. We ordered lobster bisque, but it ran out, so they brought us French onion soup without even asking if it's ok to substitute. The soup was not good at all. It's like they were running out of soup at the end of the day and decided to add some water to it. In sum: great view, decent vibe, intriguing interior design. But there's some serious miscommunication between the waitstaff that results in ineffective service and the food' s hit and miss (at this price range this is not a-ok).  I may bring out-of-towners back here to woo them, but Perch won't be a neighborhood hangout spot for this downtown loft dweller.

Reviews.Author: Hanna H.
Reviews.Content: Went for after dinner drinks and the selection of drinks was fun and unique.  The view is amazing and the whole bar is a very cool spot.  Great place to check out downtown and relax with friends.   We went on  a Monday night and it was a very relaxed atmosphere and not at all crowded.  Hear it can be pretty packed on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer J.
Reviews.Content: This place is not worth going to unless you have time to waste. I only went for my cousin's birthday rooftop party because I was visiting from norcal and the line was ridiculous. I've never waited in a line like that, not even in Vegas OR NYC (the place for all rooftop parties). You have to wait in a total of 3 LONG lines: 1) just to get into the elevator, 2) then wait to take additional elevators and 3) go wait in another line just to get to the rooftop, but they stop the line (by 9:30pm) and only let a few people go up. WHO GOES THAT EARLY??? We got sick and tired of waiting in lines and wasting our night away, so we went elsewhere. There are much better places to go to in LA that are actually worth waiting to get into. Trust me, I've been to many NYC rooftop parties that are much more packed than this place, and you don't wait in lame lines like this! HA!!  Is this the ONLY rooftop in LA?? Disorganized and lousy line system, and I've been in event planning for over 12+ years. Come here if you have a lot of time to WASTE. Not coming back here again.

Reviews.Author: Nick V.
Reviews.Content: Five Stars!This place is very nice at night.  What a view of LA indeed.  If your looking for a nice rooftop bar this ones top choice in my book making standard look, well standard.The place is classy and laid back.  Sure the drinks are overpriced but your paying extra for the atmosphere and the incredible view.  The rooftop itself is odd to get to, have to take a few elevators and what not but its easy to figure out.  We enjoyed some drinks and tried out some frog legs (lol) for the first time and they weren't bad. (taste like chicken)  Staff was awesome, friendly people. No rude security like at standard.  anyways give this place a shot.  5stars for sure

Reviews.Author: Maggie K.
Reviews.Content: This place screams I'm an ostentatious douche bag that wears Gucci loafers. It's full of prissy folks who are there more for show than socializing. That's cool.I didn't dine here, I just headed straight up to the rooftop for a breathtaking view of the LA skyline. And that's all I remember because I left an hour later.

Reviews.Author: Alex K.
Reviews.Content: Great view! Food Portions are way too small though (especially for the price). 3.5 stars would hit dead on. Some music would add to the ambiance too

Reviews.Author: Lilya A.
Reviews.Content: Great view! Came here with my friends - the girls loved the food and atmosphere!

Reviews.Author: Diana R.
Reviews.Content: Perch is pretttttty. The restaurant and bar offer some pretty stellar views and has a very NY meets Paris feel. Pretty twinkle lights, half of the restaurant is outdoors. Menu is ALL french food and well, has french food prices. It would be the perfect place for a first date. I had the risotto, which wasn't like any risotto I had. The rice grains were harder and more separated, if that makes any sense. It ran me about $20. I'd say, go for the drinks and the atmosphere - it's really a pretty, pretty place.

Reviews.Author: Eddie T.
Reviews.Content: Low key, no cover and a roof top bar in Downtown LA, awesome place. You have to take two sets of elevators to get up to the 15th floor where this is located.  The lounge itself spans two floors including the 16th which is the actual rooftop.  The decor is dark and intimate, makes for a great place to get together with friends or bring a first date/significant other.We arrived pretty early so the wait was minimal.  On the 15th floor, the bar was filled and the tables outside filled with people finishing dinner.  I did not have a chance to sample the food.  "An Oldfashioned for my friends and I."  The bartender grabbed three tumblers and placed a few thin strips of orange rinds in each, then a pestle to softly grind the peels.  He added a little simple syrup and then filled the glasses with top shelf bourbon whiskey.Delicious, though a bit too much simple syrup for me.  We ordered another round of "Old fashioned's."  This time it must have been a different bartender because it was much stiffer, but still very well made.  The bartenders put a lot of care into making their drinks, which sometimes is hard to find.  Drinks are anywhere from $10-$12. After our drinks, we wandered up to the roof and found a larger crowd and  with the majority at the bar.  We quickly found a spot to sit as there are multiple tables and lounge chairs/sofas.  We ended up chatting comfortably for hours.A perfect place for relaxing and enjoying well made cocktails/drinks.  Comfortable chairs and sofas to lounge and music not too loud to allow for conversation.  This will be a place I will be frequenting.  Will I return? YES!

Reviews.Author: Matthew N.
Reviews.Content: Great place to have a drink and take in the view of dtLA.  People here are pretty mellow and not so stuck up, like you may experience at different clubs and lounges in downtown.  If you are looking to impress someone with the views of dtLA this is a good place to go.  They have good drinks, the view is amazing (two rooftop decks with fire pits!) and the atmosphere is super chill.  Plus if Perch isn't your thing there are many walking distance bars/lounges in dtLA.I have yet to try the food here and probably never will since you can go a few blocks down and have some really good pizza at Garage Pizza for a reasonable price, plus they are open til like 4am!

Reviews.Author: Jaimie L.
Reviews.Content: Although that one "other" DTLA rooftop bar has made a name for itself, I personally like Perch a lot more. It's smaller, yes, but the ambience is much more enjoyable. None of that obnoxiously loud house music; they've got smooth jazz playing all night long and the music was so pleasant I tried to Shazam it but unfortunately, my phone couldn't catch the music. It's definitely very cozy little rooftop. Limited seating, limited space so that's why you should get there early to guarantee entrance before it hits rooftop capacity. They've got the little romantic lights for decoration everywhere too and it's just a beautiful sight to see! And their special drinks. Delicious indeed. And unique as well, fitting to the french atmosphere. Didn't get a chance to eat there but the dining area downstairs looked really romantic and cozy as well!

Reviews.Author: Samantha T.
Reviews.Content: I must say that this place is unique in its location and ambiance, however, the crowd it attracts is so-so. I went on probably its busiest night of the week (Saturday) and I was less than impressed with the hype surrounding this venue.Positives:-Venue is beautiful-Our server was witty & provided excellent serviceNegatives:-Crowded (made us wait in line outside the building for 15 mins + once inside skeezies were trying to take over our table)-Not to be rude but the crowd was kinda on the fugly side that night :(I would definitely come here again on a weeknight to have drinks with my friends and definitely avoid a Saturday night here unless it was uber early. The crowd ruins the ambiance of this place.

Reviews.Author: Simon A.
Reviews.Content: great ambiance!

Reviews.Author: Carolina I.
Reviews.Content: Delicious cocktails and gnocci!

Reviews.Author: Fabio C.
Reviews.Content: What a shame that this restaurant cannot put together a decent meal and service considering they have one of the best view of downtown LA!Food way to salty, wine list lame and service not at the level you expect for a "suppose" high-end French restaurant. What's about all the porters with visible tattoo! Are you a low class Hollywood joint?I really would like for the owners and management of this place to go and have a meal at the LA Prime at the Bonaventure or WP24 at the Ritz Carlton or Takami and then try at least to get close to that level of food and service. This place doesn't have to give the best food in town because, they already have one of the most suggestive views in LA, but at least something decent is that too much to ask

Reviews.Author: Sonya E.
Reviews.Content: We came during Apéritif Hour in October.  A bit chilly until they turned on the heating lamps and lit the fires in the outdoor fireplaces. We were seated right away, which was great because we got to see the sun set. Jacqueline was our waitress and she was wonderful! We ordered our drinks, beer for my love and a a bubbly with creme de frambois for me, and they were served quickly and  perfectly chilled.  We then ordered some Truffle Fries, which came with a creamy green dipping sauce that was great. Definitely recommend you try the fries when you come. They had an amazing creamy truffle oil poured over them which was delicious.  Fries were crispy and yummy. We also ordered the Heirloom Tomato Bruschetta. We love Bruschetta and this one was pretty good except it had shallots, which we could have done without. The balsamic glaze was a great touch, gave it just the right amount of acidity. To finish we ordered a mini hot dog and a slider. Both were just the right amount of yumminess. The mini hot dog was made with a spicy sausage and it had a little kick. The slider was juicy and delicious.  You should try at least one when you come. As we getting ready to leave, our waitress Jacqueline wanted us to wait because she was giving us a complimentary dessert to celebrate our anniversary Awesome.

Reviews.Author: Hòa P.
Reviews.Content: I randomly came to Perch for drinks one day (um, screw you Standard) and fell in love with the view from their rooftop bar.  It's an amazing view of the concrete jungle below and I especially like the trees which add to the serene vibe up there.After that day I decided to come back for brunch and had a great overall experience.  It was a busy Sunday, but had reservations and were promptly seated outside with a great view as requested. They do a special on champagne and that was all the incentive we needed to make it a tipsy kind of brunch. For food I had an omelet and my friend the eggs benedict. Both were fine, but nothing special and I really wish that I had ordered the steak frites instead as it looked amazing at the table next to mine.As for the service, it was pleasant and attentive. They were slammed, but our server stopped by several times and it didn't t take much effort to get someone's attention if we needed something.As for parking, there's tons around Union Square and we parked at the lot right next door for a flat $5.  Not sure how it is at night, but extremely easy on a Sunday afternoon.I'd give Perch four stars for the view, service and atmosphere.  The food was more like 3.5, but we had a great overall experience and I will definitely be coming back again.

Reviews.Author: Rachael K.
Reviews.Content: Occasion: Out with friends for back-to-school What I Had: Rum and coke ($8?) Food Review: To be fair, we didn't try any of the food at Perch (we arrived around 11pm), but just from observing dishes as they were being served at nearby tables, it looks good. I'll have to come back to try it. I really want to try their famous Cordon Bleu "Poppers"! The rum and coke was standard, although a little light on the rum. Service Review: There is very well regulated admission into the bar and restaurant, so the venue was full of people, but not crowded. It wasn't nearly as difficult as I had expected to get a couple drinks (maybe about 3 minutes at the bar?). Venue Review: One of the few rooftop bars in downtown LA, Perch is classy and perfect for casual get-togethers with friends or after work. They have 2 rooftop levels: the lower lower with the indoor/outdoor restaurant, a bar, and patio, and the upper level with a smaller bar. Jazz/swing music was playing on the upper level where we were hanging out. They also have heaters and small fires on the upper level to keep us warm. The rooftop has a gorgeous view of downtown LA. Overall Impression: I'm a fan! There drinks weren't too pricey, the venue is beautiful, and again, I'd like to try their food next time.  This is the perfect place to chill after work with friends.

Reviews.Author: Esther S.
Reviews.Content: I actually quiet liked it here.  Rooftop bar with antique furniture and a historical feel to it.  I never knew downtown LA could have such cool places as this.Loved the indoor outdoor openess of it all- heard there is live jazz musics on Fridays.  If I lived in LA this would be on my regulars list for sure.

Reviews.Author: Jay J.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved Perch! It has a beautiful view overlooking downtown LA. I went for brunch and the food was delicious and reasonable in price. My plate was about $14 not bad at all. However the drinks are definitely a bit more pricey. I believe I paid about $15 for a cocktail drink. So if you want to avoid paying a high bill I would stay away from the cocktail drinks. Last but not least make sure you make a reservation. I went this past Sunday and it took about 20min to get seated so I can only imagine how long people without reservations have to wait. Tip: The restaurant is located on the rooftop so look for the name on the building or a security guy outside and you have found it. He will then guide you to the elevator so you can be on your way! (It's on the 18th or 17th floor I think ) - not sure

Reviews.Author: Maria C.
Reviews.Content: Views views and more views from the main and top deck of historic downtown LA. We went with a group for dinner and were pleasantly surprised with our seafood selections. We didn't feel rushed and had the table for a little over two hours. Live band was awesome and we had a few celeb sightings. I suppose that's par for the course in LA LA land. The plus about having dinner is not having to wait in line downstairs for the rooftop.

Reviews.Author: Sara V.
Reviews.Content: Forget the Standard. Perch is the better rooftop bar.The pros: + Gorgeous view. It's tall enough to be cute, but still lower than other buildings, to give it a nice sense of intimate awe.+ Cool managers. I only met one, but he has a great attitude and seems to be implementing unique aspects into the lounge, such as an oyster night, live jazz bands, etc.+ 2 levels and plenty of comfortable, lounging space. The upstairs is smaller but more open. The downstairs has more areas to sit down and converse with your companion(s), all with a classy french vibe.The cons:- The bartenders. The single con, aside from the LA prices for drinks, but it's a big one and it manages to bring my rating down 1 star. The last call is 1:20, and they start closing up and shuffling people out early. The bartenders at the top waited until I was at their counter for a quite a while before telling me that. The downstairs female bartenders topped that by taking my drink order and then leaving without ever making that drink. They lack attentiveness and fairness.In other words, nice rooftop bar, but it needs better/more bartenders and less body guards.

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: This is just a review for the bar on the 16th floor.Perch was terrifyingly lovely. The set-up was nice, the view was very good, but it's not the biggest spot in the world and given my fear of heights, my legs were pretty much jello for most of the evening. I kept having flashes of the scene in "Margin Call" in which Paul Bettany's character says, "Did you know the fear most people feel when they stand on the edge like this is not actually a fear that they will fall but instead it's the subconscious fearing that they might jump?"Beyond the height issue, it was just kind of a random Tuesday evening. There were some painters scattered about doing their thing, a pretty woman offering to paint portraits but most guys seemed most interested in getting her phone number, and then my friend's band, which was an odd choice since it was an electronic band on acoustic night. In the end, I'd definitely recommend stopping by Perch for a drink or two if you're in the area and it might be a nice place to rent for a little gathering but overall I wouldn't say that it's a destination spot.

Reviews.Author: Beau D.
Reviews.Content: + great for drinks + awesome view+roof top bar-food is not tasty

Reviews.Author: Hahnmade H.
Reviews.Content: follow these rules and you will do fine at perch.one) park at a lot on hills & btwn 5/6th if you are coming before 6pm.  any other lots, they charge $4 for every 15 min then $6 after 6pm.two) entrance is near the subway joint, once enter the building, take the elevator to the 13th floor (look for a bird plaque next to the button).three) get off on the 13th, then take another elevator to the 15th floor (look for the same bird next to the button), finally you've entered perch.four) do not dare to sit at the table if you do not have reservations.  also even if you are slow and need a blond waitress with the 80's shades to repeat what she says, don't.  because she is going to start calling you, ma'am- i've already explaint to you w/very sassy tone.five) if you feel like, screw her then look for the exit sign and go upstairs to the roof top. there, you can grab any open seats.  HOWEVER-six) food isn't allowed on the roof, so if you happen to sneak in fries from the bar, you better eat super fast because a security guard will nicely remind you no food is allowed but finish up fast, followed by another blond gentleman will come up to you and say absolutely no food in this area then grab your plates and go downstairs.seven) despite my instruction you still desire to check it out, make sure to (boys) wear skinniest jeans and plaid shirt, if you have lumberjack beards, even better, or (gals) rock same skinniest jeans in brightest colors with 6" platforms and pile on all the jewelries you bought at forever 21.  finally) expect to wait in lines because you are about to enter Da hippest, trendiest, most pretentious, faux french House in downtown el lay.

Reviews.Author: Tammy S.
Reviews.Content: Yay, a new rooftop spot. Love the atmosphere...tons of people though. Drinks were fancy and you pay the price for it....but for a Double Gin Tonic it completely set me back $28 :( OUCH!People there were friendly and fun....maybe cause we were with a large group of females for a bachelorette (wanted something more like a lounge and not club atmosphere, and this spot was perfect) We did luck out getting a seating area for the group where the waitress did come over to check on us here and there. Never tried the food, but a great spot for drinks and meet up with friends I would say.

Reviews.Author: Sharon K.
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was a bad night, perhaps I was tired, but I didn't have the greatest first experience here.I love the concept. The view is beautiful, and the nostalgic, Tower of Terror-esque decor is charming.The roof was supposedly full, so we had to wait on the floor below. I enjoyed a gingery tom collins cocktail, which was pretty good. After waiting a while, we were getting antsy because the rest of our party was on the roof. When we tried to ask one of the bouncers(?) to let our group of 6 to go to the roof, he replied with, "uhh, okay but only 4 of you."So, FOUR of us went, and two stayed behind and had to wait longer, but the roof was not even close to crowded.Okay, I know there are safety issues, but the "only 4 of you" irked me. Also, my friend's jack and coke was weak and flat. And a jack and coke should never be flat.

Reviews.Author: Bren H.
Reviews.Content: I had really high hopes coming to Perch for brunch... sitting on the couch waiting for our table, my partner and I talked about how much we were loving the decor and what everyone was wearing. That's about as good as it got.Service: My first concern was when I asked the bartender to tell me about the Bloody Maria, he suggested I was confused. I wasn't; it's a drink on their menu. 20 minutes after we were seated, we finally had to ask someone to flag down our waitress (the table next to us had been visited 3 times by their server in that time). When she finally came, she was lackluster, at best. It was busy, but didn't seem so overwhelmingly so that she couldn't treat us as more than a hassle. She did make one more appearance and then, about 15 minutes after our plates had been bussed, we had to ask another waiter to ask her to bring our check... Service sucked.Food: Truffle Cheese fries were great. I'm not a super truffle fan, but my partner is so we asked them to cut the oil in half and it was a perfect balance. Beyond that we ordered the Pear and Goat Cheese Salad (soggy) and the Perch Burger (tasted liked burnt hot dog, which is totally weird).Friends have come here and loved it, so there's gotta be something more than a fabulous view, but whatever it is, I missed it.

Reviews.Author: Christa W.
Reviews.Content: the atmosphere of Perch is great.  My date and I sat at the bar and had 2 appetizers and drinks.  The bartendars were really friendly.  The place was packed, but not overcrowded.  The views alone are worth going for.  It was nice that the place wasn't pretentious.  You can stay on the floor with the restaurant, or go upstairs for another view.  There was a private party, so we couldn't go up there that night.We had the cordon bleu poppers and they had a fondue appetizer.  The cheese for the fondue was amazing.  The bread was really hard and didn't get softened by the cheese, so it was messy.  The fruit they served with the cheese was good.  The cordon bleu poppers were ok.  They were two bite poppers that were hard to eat.   They were a bit chewy and we couldn't bite through them.  Not  a big deal, we just cut them, but we were expecting them to be a bit more tender.   We ended up dipping them in the cheese which made them 10 times better.I'd like to go back and try some other things on the menu.  I wasn't too impressed with the food, but I was with an unadventurous eater, so we were limited.

Reviews.Author: H S.
Reviews.Content: Overall the highlight of the place for me would have to be the view and the truffle fries. I rate this a three because it was definitely a-OK (standard restaurant with a nice view- I just was NOT impressed with the dish I picked). Pros:The atmosphere was great, this would be perfect to take a date out for a different view in downtown, just be ready to spend a descent amount of money- worth to try once. It was busy but the servers were accommodating. Truffle fries were addicting. For someone who doesn't drink i enjoyed their interesting non-alcoholic drinks (the lime cucumber mint). Cons-Other than that I wasn't really impressed by their dish. The shrimp on grits made me nauseous the whole night, which kills it for me because it is a restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Lusine K.
Reviews.Content: The view is to die for!! the food is tasty and the drinks are great!! I love this place! always a blast when we go out with our friends here!

Reviews.Author: H. P.
Reviews.Content: The view! The view is spectacular! The service was a little sub-par, I thought. I will admit, though, I didn't try the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Anna A.
Reviews.Content: Great view but the service sucks! Overall horrible experience here the long line is annoying and even when you make resvestions seems like you still have a wait before being seated plus food isn't that great. I won't be coming back here for dinner maybe for the roof top bar and I will make sure to be here extra early to avoid standing in such a long ass line just to make it to the top!

Reviews.Author: International J.
Reviews.Content: Great view. Too expensive - and the bartenders are snobby. Treated me like a tourist,  I live 5 blocks away.I'll go for one drink,  rather go to spring st bar. Food portions are too small.  The place tries to be fancy--- this is downtown la.  Not manhattan .Hate the bartenders.

Reviews.Author: Star G.
Reviews.Content: I loved the view, and the cute little details like the bird posted on the elevator wall, the cute furniture, etc.But I hated waiting forever in line just to get to the bar, then being told that nothing I want is served there.  I understand if my red bull & vodka is too ghetto for them, but cranberry juice too?  Why not?So... for that, and for the abnormally long wait to get upstairs, I'd deduct two stars.But again, it's beautiful and it's a nice place.  It's just annoying

Reviews.Author: Erika E.
Reviews.Content: For me and the group of 10 Perch was a hit! Our server was Josh and he was a doll! Provided us with attentive service and lovely recommendations. I actually let him pick most of my meal and I was very pleased! French 64 cocktail is pretty freakin' delish and packs a good punch. I was a much bigger fan of the appetizers than I was for the dinner plates. The table shared the poppers (they are as good as the other reviews say they are), and I enjoyed the tomato, beet and goat cheese salad and frog legs for dinner - Whoops - two fried items! Oh, no make that 3 we all shared a couple orders of bignets too! Eh, no bother  it was good. Here is what I would love to see tweaked: The hostess desk, sorry I just don't want to stare down at a young girl sitting at a desk - where do I rest my eyes!?!!? The velvet bowties - good lord it is August! I get the look they are going for -  but sorry gotta call it out - velvet and cotton gingham are seasonally inappropriate together. Entree selections - in the middle of summer on a lovely LA rooftop - something a little lighter than braised shortribs and fish in a butter bath are in order! Bottom Line: Conveniently located right near the Pershing Square red line station. Beautiful views and architectural details, fun people watching! Can't wait to come back in fall; have a hearty meal and see some velvet! For the rest of summer I will stick to the cocktails, appetizers and salads. Thanks Josh - you were a great guide to Perch!

Reviews.Author: Shanika H.
Reviews.Content: Of course I didn't eat here - I just drank :] the view from the rooftop is TOTALLY WORTH IT. I recommend coming early so that you don't have to wait it line. a tip: don't stuff yourselves in the elevator. if it doesn't seem like a smart idea, DON'T DO IT. there are 2 elevators to get to the rooftop lounge and the second was stuck because there was eleventy-billion people on it. i had to walk up the last 3 flights to reach the top - which sucked if you were carrying a huge cake an wearing heels (not me, some other guests had to). the Marie Antoinette cocktail was pretty dope. There also was this drink served in a wine glass - 1679? 1972? i forget, but it was awesome. the mixologists have some creative tastes in their arsenal, i must say. love.i imagine the bathroom sitch could really suck on the roof - there's only one for guys and one for the girls - but there's a slightly larger restroom on the 12th (?)  floor where the lounge is. below, there are couches and tables, but they're oddly placed inside. I feel like a larger group, like the one i came with, might have a hard time finding great seating all together. Be on the lookout for the good places, like around the outdoor fir pit, or the couches facing the rooftop bar. There was a live band downstairs. mellow music that fit the retro-French theme - very nice. once we sat down in the downstairs lounge, we were never waited on. we were not there to order, but i did take note of this. I am wondering if you have to order food and drinks at the bar? they seemed really busy and there were lots of patrons (ha) milling about.This should definitely be one of the first stops on any bar crawl once it starts to get dark. I understand a crazy line starts to grow for getting upstairs and on the roof. unlike.people were a bit dressy, but i didn't feel out of place in jeans, a t-shirt and chucks. live well!

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: Stop numero 3 for me one night when I went bar hopping in DTLA. Boy oh boy was I in for a treat. First of all, the bar is located at the top of Pershing Square Building. ROOFTOP bar. Next to Pershing Square, hence the name, this bar has an amazing view of downtown and Pershing Square. Who would have thought DTLA could look so great with all of the lights.Such a fan of this place, the atmosphere and ambiance were great. There is a lot of open seating, both inside and outside. There are fireplaces and heaters placed throughout the area. My group scored the little area in the corner of the outside patio with a fireplace and rocking bench. Such a good time!Once you hit the lobby, you take an elevator to another level where you take another elevator to the bar on the roof. When we went, thankfully, there was no line and were whisked right away to the top. I hear that it can get crowded during heavy nights, so come a little early if you want to avoid lines. Drinks were normal pricing. All I can remember was the round of Tequila shots I bought for people.. it was all history from there..Oh Perch.. I'll be sure to be back to perch near your warm fireplace and enjoy the drinks, view and great company.

Reviews.Author: Philip T.
Reviews.Content: This review is for the bar. Great view.  The main area can get too crowded, but upstairs is great. They also have heat lamps upstairs.If you are looking to dance, go elsewhere. Drinks around $10. Expect a line to get in. Service was ok. Great atmosphere.Valet $10.Come for the view!

Reviews.Author: Kathleen B.
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed perch this past night for late night drinks for friends bday.  I was annoyed at the line though. We arrived at 10 and didn't get in until 11. The rest of our party arrived a little bit after midnight and had no problem getting in.   Lesson learned there - come later to avoid the line. Also, tables on the 15th floor are for reservations but hostess said weekends may require a week advance.  Once inside though we were able to find a spot on the lower patio with an excellent view of pershing square.  All the drinks were well crafted.  My first bartender was a brunette on the 15th floor. I didn't catch her name but she was very careful in making our drinks and poured a good amt of makers mark into our libertines.  I appreciate the time and care she took making our drinks instead of rushing it despite a growling line.  2nd bartender on the outside patio was easier to get drinks from and also did a good job taking care of our drinks. Very unique drink selection gives perch most of its points (check out one of their leather bound menus sometime) and extra points for city lights views, architecture and kitschy bar qualities.

Reviews.Author: Vivi T.
Reviews.Content: Finally made my way to Perch .... and we could not have picked a more beautiful summer night to enjoy it!Dinner reservations fill up quickly and we were put on a waiting list upon arrival around 8pm. Checked out the patio and we scored an empty corner table where they have full service dinner. The place was packed with diners and early drinkers and there was a private party in the upstairs lounge. This was definitely the place to be on a Friday night.Food was good but not great - it's not Church and State. Truffle Fries and the Baked Brie were delicious. Escolar with Lobster Sauce was a bit salty, but overall tasty. Shrimp and Grits, ok to pass on. We also had the "special" Cajun Ribeye which was well seasoned, but the steak quality was mediocre for the price.What sells this place is the absolutely gorgeous view and beautiful people. Combine that with a few cocktails and a jazz band and you've got a perfect evening.Tips: If you are just coming for drinks - arrive early. We arrived about 8:00pm and walked right in; we left at midnight and the line to get in was down the block!

Reviews.Author: cynthia g.
Reviews.Content: Booo Hisssss .. I had such an awful experience with the staff that it's taken me close to five days to calm down and write this review.  I heard the views were amazing so I brought a couple of my clients out for drinks.  We were enjoying ourselves, enjoying the view, ordered food, ordered drinks .. a second round, a third .. and we weren't just ordering Happy Hour fare either.  We were eating our legitimate meal, drinking our Champagne when the hostess gal came by to tell us we would have to leave soon. Huh?  Um, well, we're still eating and we're still drinking is what I told her.   See?  and I show her our table of food and my drink that I just got not five minutes ago.She walks away.  We continue to eat and drink until our bill arrives.  Our whopping bill of close to $300 !!  After paying this ridiculous bill another staff person comes by accompanied with security and told us we'd have to leave now.  Is this person talking to ME?  Is this person talking to our little group who was still finishing their plates?  Excuse me??? Did we not just pay f'n $300 and you can't give us five minutes to finish our drinks and get our things together?  Really??!   You're throwing us out??He had the nerve to say that that is NOT what he's doing.  oh yeah, so what's the big man for?  F UHe says they have a 2-hour table limit policy.   They're making room for a reservation.F your reservation, buddy.   And I'm just supposed to KNOW you have a policy?  No one told me you had this policy.  There's no placard on the table that says 2-hour limit, is there?  And why didn't anyone advise me of this policy BEFORE I ordered more drinks and more food???  I was furious.  I have never been treated so poorly at ANY establishment - and certainly not one that I just dropped serious recession cash at.   I knew I was going to punch him in the face at any moment, so I left.  If that is your policy, a 2-hour table limit, that's fine.  I get it.  But there is usually some kind of warning to the table, a placard, the server let's you know when it's last call, right?  Something.  And if our party was somehow screwing up your reservation, then make it up to ME.  I'm being punished because I'm patronizing your business?   They couldn't have MOVED our table elsewhere?  Maybe we wanted to spend more money.   They couldn't have suggested any open spaces at the bar, their other rooftop?   They went straight into kick-them-out mode and it was so very unnecessary.  This downtown rooftop is overrated.

Reviews.Author: steven t.
Reviews.Content: giving one star to a place with the best view of dtla is a bit harsh, but it only has that going for it... view... there is nothing else.food, if you like prepackaged stuff from Sysco that goes ding when its ready, then come here.really douchey crowd especially on weekends!expensive.could be so much better.

Reviews.Author: Shirley K.
Reviews.Content: I came here a few times with my friends for drinks. The first time was during happy hour and it was pretty packed. They didn't have anywhere to sit. We went up to the roof and managed to crash an alumni party or something and got a table. Their drinks were stronger than what I am used to but I still liked them. The view was beautiful and I loved the atmosphere. I definitely will be back!

Reviews.Author: Gilda G.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location! Great food! Awesome band! Unfriendly bartender and jaded servers/hosts but overall worth it!

Reviews.Author: Christine L.
Reviews.Content: I went for brunch and the food and prices were good, but I thought that the rooftop view was underwhelming and the tables were really small and tight with the tables next to us. Maybe it's nicer at night during the lounge atmosphere. The french toast was amazing! The eggs  benedict was okay.

Reviews.Author: Janel Y.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the roof top bar on a Friday night. There was a line to get in, but thankfully no cover.To get to the very top, you need to take multiple elevators and wait in the stairwell to go to the top. We decided to just hang out on the restaurant level which still had LA views, a bar and plenty of outdoor patio seating.I started off with a tequila shot ($10!) and then ordered a Sazerc Rye ($13) which was delicious. Their Manhattan was quite strong and I really couldn't finish it. Pretty crowded, mixed scene.Loungey atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Jessee A.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed eating on a rooftop in CA.  I think it's fairly rare, in comparison with other big cities.  What was also nice was there was live music on a Tuesday night.  A cool place to hang out with friends or have a romantic date.  The scene is set as dimly lit under the night sky, but with candles and stars to set the mood.  The salmon, short ribs, truffle fries, frog legs and sliders were all tasty items.  Of the mentioned items, I would say the short rib entree is the best - so savory.  Though the staff was friendly, service was slow - but understandable since it was busy (and I understand working in the service industry, so I cut some slack.)  But if you come here, be ready to spend some $$.  The French Maid and My Fair Lady cocktails are tasty concoctions!

Reviews.Author: Michelle N.
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely amazing. Besides one of the best views in LA the drinks are great. I've been to Perch on Friday and Saturday nights and their Happy Hour. Every time was a great crowd. No complaints.

Reviews.Author: Bob Q.
Reviews.Content: There's a lot to like about this place. No cover, great view of downtown, mellow ambiance. There are two floors.. the 1st has a bar, indoor seating, and a large patio. The 2nd floor has a more open floor plan with a small bar and an almost 360 degree view. I like the fire pit in the far corner of the 1st floor the most but you can't really go wrong with either level. A doorman makes sure the second floor doesn't get too packed so don't be surprised if they make you line up during peak hours.This is definitely the place to take a date, a 1st stop for an out-of-towner, or a more relaxed birthday if you're tired of clubs and dive bars.

Reviews.Author: Cherry G.
Reviews.Content: I NEVER leave Yelp reviews. Like I actually had to make an account to leave this review for Perch because I had such a great time. My girlfriend and I decided to have a weekend gateway to DTLA even though I live 15 mins away haha. We asked some friends to recommend some cool places to eat and Perch was one of them. We tried making reservations that day and I couldn't get a spot. I was later told they fill up weeks in advance.We get there and sat at the bar which we were perfectly happy with. I let out huge yawn and the Director of Ops comes over and made damn sure that the rest of our night was yawn free haha. We moved to a table on the balcony and its seriously a spectacular view of the city. The food was amazing and service was impeccable. The rooftop lounge has even more amazing views. Crowd and music was awesome as well. We only intended to have dinner there but ended up staying for hours. We loved it so much that we came to brunch on Sunday:)Perch is mos def a must see, must do in LA. No yawning allowed!

Reviews.Author: Aaron L.
Reviews.Content: Normally I don't go to bars like this, typical downtown bars. Full of guys looking to get laid and girls with skanky dresses on, crowded enough to get to 2nd base with a stranger while trying to get to the bar to get a drink, but on my Bday on a Friday night when all the other bars are full, right on. Prices are steeper than your average dive bar but not extraordinarily high if you're splurging. The cool thing is that it's on the 15th or something floor of a building so it's got a sweet street view and you just feel more awesome drinking that high up.Theres a good amount of seating, on and off the patio, which of course leaves very little standing room and forget about a pool table or anything fun like that.Would I come back here? sure. with my buddies whenever we're in DTLA. But i'd never bring a date or make this a regular place.

Reviews.Author: Hazel F.
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for nice rooftops to hang out on top of and when I happened to stroll into Perch one afternoon in the weekend, I thought I had a found a secret place. No cover, no list, no bouncer, great priced drinks, music, non-pretentious crowd, no dress code, available seats that didn't need a reservation, and a great view of Los Angeles. . Apparently, I was just lucky that day, because everything I loved about it, is now not true, but I am sure it depends when you go. Rooftops are a gem in this city, and finding one, is a marvelous and privileged experience. I will have to keep my hunt going, or better yet, own my own rooftop one day. My place does have a view, but a bartender, it does not.

Reviews.Author: M Y.
Reviews.Content: So I decided to plan a dual B-day celebration for my BF and I. So dinner and drinks were the plan. I decided on Perch for the setting and the much raved about drinks & ambiance. For setting and ambiance they get 5 stars. For drinks...I really cant' say since the drinks on the menu weren't really up my ally last night. So I stuck with an all time fav Champagne. It started with dinner for 5 and when I got to the restaurant at 8 my table was still not ready. Which was not a big deal to me since most of my guest were still on their way. I decided to get a drink at the bar, which was quite packed. I looked around and noticed that they only really packed area was inside at the bar and couldn't understand why my table was not ready. But anyways I had my drink and enjoyed the view. The service at the bar was okay. But the really bad service I have to say came from the wait staff. Our waiter was friendly and quite humorous but not very attentive. I had to many times flag him down for more water or add'l drinks. As for the busy boys/ servers they weren't much better either. My friends and I had to repeatedly ask for empty plates and dishes to be cleared due to the rather small table they sat us at. As for food well it was either a hit or a miss....their theme on food is deconstruction as the waiter informed us. One friend ordered the not so french "french onion soup" she wanted something closer to traditional onion soup. Her bad....I ordered the Fish along with another friend of mine. And my last friend ordered the beef short ribs. All in all I think my friends short ribs looked like the best dish. My fish was overly salted on corner and completely bland on the other side. The mash potatoes on the side were watery in consistency and the peas were just peas. The appetizers on the other hand were quite Delicious, we ordered both the Shake and Bake and the Duck Duck Goose. Over all I would go back to Perch for drinks and ambiance maybe but not really for food unless things improve.

Reviews.Author: Julie N.
Reviews.Content: I went here for the 1st time last week. It's another rooftoop bar in DTLA. + No cover so that makes it slightly better than the Standard. + the boss lady at the door is really sweet and way nicer than the bouncers. Now that's a first. FYI, there is a long line if you arrive after 10:30. + Diverse crowd....you'll see all kinds of people here. + Live jazz!+ The rooftop is something to experience once. I'd rather stay on the first level where there is more seating, a bigger bar, and live music. The indoor area is really cute/euro-like...reminds me of a bar I would see in New York.- Plus, there's ANOTHER line to wait in for the rooftoop. It's not a big deal, but the bouncer acts all high and mighty. I got lost and accidentally cut the line, so he told me "This ain't my first rodeo. You have to wait like everyone else!" Chill dude, apparently it's my first rodeo? -_- The view is okay....I think the Standard's view is still better.- Surrounding parking lots get full quickly

Reviews.Author: Vee Y.
Reviews.Content: The one star is because the server was sincerely apologizing for the crappy experience. My friend has always wanted to come here so we took her for her bday.  We had a party of 8 and had to have a pre set menu, which was picked about 2 weeks before the reservation.  We arrived at 7 and the hostess gave us regular menus then I asked her why we have these if you made me pick a preset menu. She removed them and gave us the correct menu. We ordered drinks and around 7:40 they came.  We then ordered our food which took another hour to get.  Not to mention they fogot one order of salmon and had to make it. At this point everyone was done eating and the one person was left to eat alone. About 3 hours later we tried to cancel the dessert but the server said no it's on the way.  We finally got done at about 10:20.  This place is a huge waste of time. The out door bar is pretty cool but the restaurant is horrible!Here's the icing on the cake: I have a bad knee and can't walk up or down stairs. I asked the bouncer if I could please use the elevator and he said no. I proceeded to tell him why and he replied nope sorry and watched my fiancé carry me down the stairs.  A hole!

Reviews.Author: Daniel K.
Reviews.Content: swanky, rooftop bar.  Drink prices are pretty high for what they are.  Would rather go to 7grand personally.Been here a couple times with a couple friends, had a good time both times.  Until...We went for a wedding party outing for my friend's wedding, and a friend of ours who knew one of the managers made sure to book seats.  When we got there, they said they double booked and said there was nothing they could really do but seat us in the corner next to the fireplace.  Another person then kindly said they would ask the other group if they would pass the table to us, and they kindly did so because they understood it was for a wedding party.  But c'mon, a swanky, upscale establishment like this should NOT be double booking; especially when it wasn't even a busy night (Thursday night)  tsk tskBUT, the food was good, so I'll give it 3 stars for that, but the service needs to be upped in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Simone F.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view as you would expect.  Staff can come across a bit aloof at times though. We've frequented the place sooooo often and yet only one waiter remembers us.  [and not during the crazy busy hours, usually we go there when it's nice and quiet].  I'd still recommend it for a nice late afternoon sundowner.  Really great location and the live music is usually really great :)

Reviews.Author: Callan S.
Reviews.Content: Ugh this place reminds me of a cheaper hybrid version of the Soho House/Spare Room. There were like 9 elevators to the top, "security" guys that talked to people as if they were deaf and the bartenders were wearing bow-ties......so hip.....I'd rather sit on my own stoop, talk real loud with a Shirley Temple in my hand and make my boyfriend wear a bow-tie. Oh...and I got a parking ticket when I left because I didn't read the 12 signs posted. Viva la Downtown! Boo. P.S. I drafted this review in January 2012 I just realized I had never posted it. Whoopsie!

Reviews.Author: James D.
Reviews.Content: As a bar, I give the place four stars. I love the ambience and as a place to just relax with a drink it's one of my new downtown favorites.
