It would get five stars if it wasn't for the flat tonic water. Not a single bubble of effervescence could be found in the glass. Not once, but three times. No excuse.As a restaurant, the place gets two stars. Unlike other reviewers, I found the service to be great. The problem was the food. A very ambitious menu that seems beyond the abilities of the kitchen staff.Bread: A single roll, at least a full day old and clearly stale.Cheese Pot: A very good fondue and the best dish we tried all night. Unfortunately, it was served with the same stale bread and apples sliced so thinly as to fall apart in the cheese.Roasted Bone Marrow: The marrow itself was good, but then it's tough to screw up. The Melba Toast tasted as though it had been fried rather than baked and then left to congeal in grease for most of the day. The last thing you want with fatty marrow is more grease. Braised plums were a nice touch but the roasted elephant garlic added little to the dish but more grease. No acids served to cut through the oil. Nasty.Rabbit Rillette: The rillette itself was pretty good though I couldn't really taste any discernable rabbit in it. I know it's supposed to be a rustic dish, but does that include throwing in a handful of bones. I cracked my teeth on at least two pointy rabbit ribs. Candied kumquats worked well.Duck, Duck, Goose: The duck was excellent and well accompanied by the gooseberry jam. The honey bread it was served on was inedible, though - incredibly greasy and stale tasting.I'll be back for the bar but I'll not be eating here again.

Reviews.Author: Jina J.
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the view alone makes this place worth checking out. I came here last night with a few co-workers for a happy hour and the decor + view = topnotch. It's definitely better than the overly hyped Standard rooftop. It's got more class, more seats, and a better vibe overall. On the other hand, The Perch has to figure out what it wants to be: a bar/lounge or restaurant. My co-workers and I wanted to eat while we were there, but there weren't many bar friendly options. There weren't many things to share, and many items were pretty small yet pricey. I don't go for drinks and ever crave risotto or frog legs. Also their happy hour menu is EXTREMELY limited. The happy hour menu they have online is not the HH menu they actually go by. We tried their Cordon Bleu "Poppers," which were good but small and not worth the $6 happy hour price tag. Once the kitchen opened up, we tried the cheese dip, probably the most bar friendly type food, but it was just mediocre. Their french soup, is more of a deconstructed twist on the original, and I was not digging it. It lacked the baked cheesy goodness of the original, and also the caramelized onion flavor. They substituted those flavors with a solid pearl onion and a slab of bacon. Beignets. WORTH TRYING! Some of the best I've ever had. light, fluffy, and a delicious jam to go with it. The drinks, as other reviewers said, are pretty strong. I bypassed their cocktail list at the recommendation of a friend (she apparently tried a few before and was not impressed with any, especially for $12), so I instead ordered a whiskey sour. It was solid, tasty, and strong. It was also only $9 compared to their floofy $12 cocktails. The service was rather slow. It was hard to get the attention of a server, especially during Happy Hour. The bartender I spoke to was extremely rude. I should have gotten his name, but his interaction with me along with other patrons just left a lot to be desired. He was offensive, unfriendly, unhelpful, and he made it seem like I was infringing on HIS time.I'd come back again for the awesome view and the strong drinks, but avoid the food and that bartender. Although make sure to get the beignets!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: Greatly improved on a happening Sat night.Love the DTLA resident line to cater to the locals.  Still a bit of a wait outside, thus the one minus star.Mixed crowd.  Good place to meet people with good energy.  Lots of separate groups, but people are open to chat.STRONG specialty drinks from the menu, but I just asked the bar tender to make something with my choice of ingredients.Was busy enough for them to open the top roof deck, with the second bar upstairs.Bring gloves in the winter.  It can get chilly even with the heat lamps!

Reviews.Author: asuzak H.
Reviews.Content: People were talking about this place how cute this place is, so we tried.It's a cute hang out place. Roof top, Fireplace, Indoor & Outdoor Seating.Food was ok. We were expecting good food but it was little too salty.Cocktails were not good at all. Maybe the bartender but it was very off.. not balanced.I asked him to make me a different cocktail the second time but still not good, so I decided to order a simple drink. Vodka on the rocks.Disappointed :(

Reviews.Author: Soo K.
Reviews.Content: Great view. Food is not that great. They could put the band on the rooftop. I think that makes more sense.

Reviews.Author: Jeannette G.
Reviews.Content: A space with a view.  Perch is situated on the rooftop of the Pershing Square building in DTLA.  A mixture of the whimsical and French baroque, Perch is a cozy open space overlooking the north east corner of Pershing Square.  Seating is available for every taste: bar, indoor and outdoor.  The French themed craft cocktails are quite potent.  On this occasion I had the refreshing Jacques Collins, with the twist of this drink being the addition of saffron that added an orange tint to the drink.  Additionally, I had a taste of the Marie Antoinette.  And, though it was diminutive in size, it was not in taste - just like the person.

Reviews.Author: Lorelei T.
Reviews.Content: Great ambiance! The food was excellent, the drinks yummy too. Nice group of people. Everything was perfect can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Author: Priya M.
Reviews.Content: Want drinks with an amazing view at someplace other than The Standard in DLA? Check out Perch. It's located on the rooftop of a building that overlooks Pershing Square, and it's a perfect place to bring a date or friends in the summer. Yes, the drinks are a bit pricey. But, you're paying for the view, French atmosphere in the restaurant, and the lovely ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Salim M.
Reviews.Content: Oof. Best to stay away.  Food is miserable, service is slow and uninterested.  Poor job of getting you the food on time, servers do not know who ordered, they don't clear plates or refill water.Crowd is rough and down market. Nice view however.

Reviews.Author: Tawny S.
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. It's located in the Pershing Square Building on the 15th and 16th floor. 15th is where the restaurant is located but the 16th, the lounge area, is where you'd want to be. Great 360 degree view of the city, decent specialty cocktails (I had the My Fair Lady) and overall pretty cool vibe.

Reviews.Author: Ida M.
Reviews.Content: A solid 3.5 star for our experience. Let me explain... Hands down, Perch is definitely worth checking out...for the fantastic views of downtown LA it offers. While it may not be as grand as the Chicago & NYC skylines, it is still amazing nevertheless.We decided to check this place out 2 weeks ago. The hostess greeted us warmly the moment we got off the elevator (15th fl).  We told her we were there for drinks & she showed us the main bar and the cool patio. We asked her if we could go up to the 16th fl for more unobstructed nighttime city views but, apparently, it's only accessible on weekends. It was a mellow Tuesday evening when we came & there were still plenty of room to move around & available seating to actually have a nice, relaxing time to just unwind & enjoy a cocktail or two.The cocktails, on the other hand, were another story. In my honest opinion, I consider it very pricey at $12 especially once you see how TINY the glasses are. I do recommend My Fair Lady, although I had to make really tiny sips for it to last me. I forgot which drink my hubby got but it was very STRONG (too much cognac) & nasty. What a waste. Since we didn't have dinner there, I can't say much about the food. Service was so-so, nothing worth mentioning for. They kept bringing us food that we DID NOT order. Clearly, they still have to get kinks straightened out when it comes to that.Will I be back? Yes, for the views. But I'll make sure to remember to just order a glass of wine next time!

Reviews.Author: Hana C.
Reviews.Content: Located at the top of Pershing Square, this is a quaint lounge/bar with a 1960's aura of elegance and sass. The waiters and bartenders were all super cute with their bow-tie outfits, pinstripe slacks and wing-toe loafers.I'd stay away on the weekends because it gets so damn packed, but the perfect weeknight spot for light drinks and catch up with the girls. Try duck, duck, goose with the French Cab as you stare off into the starry night, you'll forget you're in LA and think you're somewhere in Europe.

Reviews.Author: Pegs P.
Reviews.Content: This place is so hidden, you'd have a hard time finding it if you didn't see people lined up in front of an unmarked door of a dark building with no other businesses open around it.  I wouldn't be surprised if security created a small line so as to help first time perchers find the place.I don't have the patience to wait in line, so I went to another spot a couple blocks down until the line disappeared.  But once you're in, you take an elevator up to the highest floor. then you cross the hall and take another elevator up a few more floors (you can also take the stair well) up to the roof top.  Once you go outside to the bar, you will gasp at the beautiful view of downtown.  It's romantic, it's hip, it's quiet, and it's always a good time.  They are well equipped with fire pits and heat lamps and plenty of seating.  I do wish the bar was a little bit bigger, but I suppose saving the roof top real estate for paying customers is better than crowding the area with a bar too big. I didn't get to try any food but I plan to come back for that another time.  I didn't realize til it was too late that there are two levels outside.

Reviews.Author: Marni S.
Reviews.Content: Amazing view of the city....Security was really obnoxious about speed downing our drinks after last-call, which was announced thirty seconds prior. They also seemed to be out of half of the beverages on the menu ?? Would take out-of-towners there though, merely because of the view.

Reviews.Author: N.N. R.
Reviews.Content: Such a pretty place. Definitely worth going and having a drink with friends. It's awesome and made me feel like I was back in San Francisco, or even New York. Beautiful views, awesome ambiance!Only ordered the Mussels & the Shrimp over the Grits - both amazingly delicious. The smell of food in this place is just awesome. I am certain that all their menu items are tasty. The drinks, not a highlight...Ordered a simple Ciroc Martini but wasn't thrilled - I guess there are plenty of ways to mess up a martini - I supposed they put one of the many into play.Things took a while here, but they're quick to get you the bill and whatnot. Our waitress was nice, and I think the ambiance makes up for whatever else they lack. Service isn't horrible and the view could make you forget about a few things...

Reviews.Author: Chris n' gel S.
Reviews.Content: why only 3 stars? Well...let me first start with the positives...1. Beautiful Roof top Bar/Lounge2.Live Music (Jazz)3.Romantic4.Casual and Intimate5.lounge feel outside area while inside is the more for dinner dining. 6.View is beautiful.overlooks the downtown LA area.Negatives...1. Must take 2 small spaced elevators, first one takes you to the 13th floor. then a second elevator takes you to 15th Floor. pretty scary.2. Place is super crowded after 4pm. Good luck finding seats.3.personal first time experience here, the servers were very stuck up and not really helpful. I asked one while she wrote something on a paper if I should place my name on a list, she totally ignored me.( This is the main reason for the minus 2 stars)4.Drinks..took a while and it was not strong at all. esp for the price you pay.5.food menu...blah. noting interesting that caught our eye.

Reviews.Author: Pooja P.
Reviews.Content: Went there a couple more times and damn this place is growing on me! The bartender made the BEST My Fair Lady I have EVER had! and their cocktails are super duper delish! Not too strong and NOT watered down at all. I love love love the view, the ambiance, and the location! Since it's so close to the metro, we just hop on those for a 5-10 min ride! never have to worry about sobering up before driving :D

Reviews.Author: Dina H.
Reviews.Content: 3 stars for the brunch food:It just isn't anything spectacular.  Some dishes were just plain bad, too.  My friends had serious complaints about the 3 egg omelette.  Where was the cheese?  Without it, the omelette was very bland.  I had the smoked salmon benedict.  I'm pretty sure I could've made this dish better than they had ... I didn't get to try the huevos rancheros but it looked good.  But I happen to think everything topped with fresh avocados look good.  Also, there were lots of discrepancies between what was printed on the menu and what was actually served.  The smoked salmon benedict was listed as smoked salmon crepes.  Also, where were the pickled vegetables that were supposed to come with my Bloody Maria??5 stars for atmosphere:Old building in DTLA.  Gorgeous rooftop space with view of LA.  The interior was decorated nicely too.  There were also lots of windows and large open doors to let in the natural air and light.  I probably wouldn't come here for the food again ... maybe just drinks.  But if you do plan on coming for brunch, make a reservation or show up when they open (11).  All the good tables (inside and out) were reserved for those who had made reservations.

Reviews.Author: Jay H.
Reviews.Content: I knew better than to eat here this early.  Only 5 weeks open and lots of growing pains.  Overall, this place has tons of potential.  Probably why people are coming here and also giving good reviews.  The food needs some work.  It was already too crowded.  I'm afraid it's attracting more of a wanna-be drinking crowd, than true foodies.  Breakdown of bad things.1.  Waiter came over at beginning of dinner (before we even ordered appetizers) and asked us what we wanted for dessert.2.  Red wine would have been much better slightly chilled, but this isn't really their fault.3.  Several dinners, including us, never got silverware when our entree was delivered.4.  I ordered beef, but they never asked me how I wanted it prepared.  It arrived a little bit overdone, but I had to go find my own silverware, so my dish was already cold by the time I could eat it. 5.  Chicken poppers were way overdone, and thus chewy and dry.I only give it 3 stars because of the location, the design, and the uniforms they servers wore.  The music and fireplaces were also nice, romantic touches.

Reviews.Author: Justine L.
Reviews.Content: I went here on a Friday night with some friends.  If you do not want to stand in line, get there around 9/9:30.  I showed up around 10:45 with friends and we waited almost an hour.  We met these other people and they said they didn't even wait when they came earlier.  It was weird that it took us that long to get into a place that isn't even a club!  The way the bouncer let in people was weird though.  He separated the parties.  I went in with one friend and one other random guy who was the ONLY one separated from his group.  The bouncer proceeded to say to him, "I did this help you out so you could be with these two ladies here.  I want you to make out in the elevator."  There is another line to get up to the 16th floor, which is ONLY a rooftop area.  The 15th floor has the restaurant and patio area.The overall atmosphere was nice.  The place was classy/old school looking.  There were people there of all ages.  We spent most of our time on  the 16th floor.  It was a nice night and a bit chilly, but we sat by the fire pit so it was totally fine.  The drinks were typical price and decent.  This place is nice for you to spend a chill and relaxing night with some friends and drinks and a nice view of Downtown.  Parking is a little bit difficult, since it is LA.  Lots are full later at night.  Try to look for a parking meter so you don't have to pay for parking.  I parked in the Athena's parking lot just down the block on Hill from Perch for $8 flat fee.

Reviews.Author: Belle U.
Reviews.Content: GREAT view, good drinks, but severely over priced for the tiny amount of just OK food. Word of advice, EAT before you go or go just for a few drinks and eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Krystle R.
Reviews.Content: We went to Perch on a Friday night to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. We were just planning on having drinks, and maybe dessert, so we didn't make a reservation.  Got there around 9:30p and all the seats/sofas on the roof were already taken, so we went down one floor to the restaurant, and had perfect timing to snag a couple couches.The drinks come in smaller glasses and are pricier than I'm used to, but they're made strong.  The place got pretty packed when we were there, and once all our friends had arrived, the roof was already at capacity and we would've had to wait to go up.They also don't have a lot of the regular liquors I'm used to.  They didn't have Crown Royal, Captain Morgan's, Stoli, etc.We decided to order their beignets, which were delicious.  They come with an espresso whip cream that's pretty tasty.My friends and I enjoyed our evening at Perch, especially the chill vibe it has.  I would definitely go back with just the boyfriend to have more of a date night so we can try their food.

Reviews.Author: A M.
Reviews.Content: Went about 3 times in a week. Its more a miss than a hit.  It's that LA "i am mad at you for having dinner and not me... " thing.  The girl at check in tells us "we are 10 minutes behind in your reservation and you can sit at the bar and have a drink. Then check back."  We both say at same time, "No you'll come find us and escort us to our table."Surprisingly she did, and mid way to our table stopped pointed her fingers to the table and said, "its over there." and flipped around and went back to her post. What a bitch.  It's that type of place. Amazing view but service and attitude is hit and miss.  Food is so so. Like the Lamb Sliders but they are about the size of a half dollar.Frog legs are gross.  All bones.Brie Dry Fry. Yuck. Clump of brie with Trader Joe's sauce.Cheese Plate was so predictable cheese plate.Arugula Salad makes you miss Italy.Perch staff turns into Bottega Louie Staff what resembles a hip urban place but underlies a corporate vibe with suburban minded staff.

Reviews.Author: Nirmal L.
Reviews.Content: A friend of my showed me this place a few months ago and its awesome!! Great views and good atmosphere. Pros - no cover charge. open seating if your not having dinner. Nice bar, with good bartenders who can make good recommendations. A top level with great views. Live lounge type music.Cons - This place seems to have gotten out as a hot/cool spot, so on weekend nights, you get a lot of 20 year olds coming out to celebrate a party and dance. However, there is no dance floor, and seating is limited. Crowd - the crowd is older, late 20's to early 40's. However, it gets a lot younger on Friday/Sat nights. This place is great for small groups and dates. Not so great for large groups.

Reviews.Author: Heather B.
Reviews.Content: Great views of the city, beautiful patio, yummy food, drinks are good but they don't have a variety of options.

Reviews.Author: citizen l.
Reviews.Content: Ok. Confusing how to get there (take elevator to 13th floor then press "down" button on next elevator bank, get into the elevator and press 15th floor. Then arrive. This is probably worth a sign at the bottom explaining the process. Had a part of 12 seated at 6pm. Accommodated with a nice table. Server was super friendly and nice. Did not get attitude from anyone there as others have complained about. View was nice. Ordered lots and lots of food, most of the stuff on the menu. Absolutely none of it was special. Caesar's salad, arugala salad, little meat skewer appetizers, pork belly, two of every side dish on the menu (putine, risotto, potatoes, brussel sprouts, etc... steak and fries, chicken, a bunch of entrees... zero of it was special. It all tasted like paint by the numbers new american (take brussel sprouts, add a ton of oil. add some more oil. charge $9. etc...However... the desserts (almond cake, bread pudding, chocolate mousse thing) were good (not great but good and good portion sizes).

Reviews.Author: D A.
Reviews.Content: I always like to check Yelp and read the reviews from those who have had the experience at the venue I seek to venture.  We had a Professional networking event that was supposed to take place on the rooftop since it had the best views and the ambiance overall is supposed to be spectacular!I arrive early around 8:00pm since I wanted to avoid running into any lines that have been mentioned by other yelpers.  Parked across the street for $6.  Initially the building looked average on the outside however once you get to the rooftop yes it was a breath taking view.Let's get to why I gave it two stars, two other fellow networkers and I  went downstairs to order food since they do not serve food only drinks on the rooftop.  We were told that they were fully booked in the restaurant and if there happened to be a cancellation they would squeeze us in.  The host was really helpful and was able to squeeze us into one of the patio tables.  One of the gals in my party went back upstairs to see if anyone else wanted to come down to eat with us, we never saw her again due to the long line of people trying to get to the rooftop.I ordered:*Frogs legs-just ok, tasted like chicken wings*Mac & cheese-Really dryMy friend ordered the Filet which she says she would come back for.  We paid the bill and venture back to the stairwell to get to the rooftop however the line was very long.  After waiting about 30 min. we get back upstairs only to find the line was unnecessary there was a total of 50 people but they were saying they met capacity which is  150-NO WAY.  We leave only to find an even longer line outside of the building, again...so very unnecessary!There are so many other great places to dine and hang out I won't be back to Perch.

Reviews.Author: Megan R.
Reviews.Content: I really had hoped that Perch was a 5 star kind of place that had received a few random negative reviews. Unfortunately, my experience at Perch was so terrible that it inspired me to begin writing on Yelp to prevent others from making the same mistake I did.My boyfriend's parents and his sister were coming in to LA, and I really wanted to take them to a restaurant with a view, good food, good service, and an ambiance that stimulated interesting conversation. In pictures, Perch seemed perfect, so against Yelp's advice, I made a reservation (for 9:30PM on a Tuesday, mind you!).The parents and sister arrived early and ordered drinks from the bar. My boyfriend and I got there at 9:35PM because I had gotten off late from work. We alerted the gentleman at the hostess stand of our arrival, and he searched frantically for a hostess to seat us. There was an empty table for six in the middle of the interior area - this was obviously our table because there aren't that many large top tables.For some reason, no hostess was to be found. (Why the guy could not seat us himself is still a mystery.) Anyway, eventually six people sat themselves at the empty table that we had been standing around waiting for. A waitress instantly began serving them, so I figured that they must have a different table set up for us.At 9:50, a hostess finally comes to seat us. We follow her outside....to a low cocktail table....with four seats....right next to the very loud band. She brings over an extra chair so that all five of us have seats. Unfortunately, the table is about the height of a coffee table, the couches are slightly higher (a section clearly meant only for after dinner drinks), and the fifth chair they brought over is at the height for a normal dinner table. So, our fifth person is at least 6 inches higher than the rest of us.And then the band is playing, and it is impossible to hear anything that the person 3 inches away from you is saying unless they are yelling at the top of their lungs.It becomes abundantly clear that our table was stolen/given away, and that they have shunted us into this obnoxiously loud little cocktail area. However, we're still willing to give it a shot because we're hungry and thirsty. Except that, for the next 20 minutes, no one comes to take our order.After having worked a 12 hour shift and getting very hungry, I was becoming rather annoyed. I approached the hostess stand, told the hostess that I was aware our table had been given away, we had been relegated to a corner next to the band, and had not seen any semblance of a server during the entire experience and to please seat us somewhere quieter and where we were all level with the table. She seemed put off that I had suggested that our table had been given away (puhleeeease, of course it had). But she agreed to seat us elsewhere right away.We were brought to a table inside, which was much much better. HOWEVER - still no service! After 20 more minutes of waiting for a server, we finally flagged down another server and asked her to send ours over to us. Another server comes over and does the "Oh sorry for the mixup!" speech, takes our order for appetizers but totally misses our drink order, and then we don't see her again for, well, longer than it took to finish the appetizers. Needless to say, we didn't bother ordering anything else. And of course, we didn't receive any sort of compensation.My apologies for the long story, but it was one that needed to be put out there. And I am obviously not alone in saying that this is one of the worst, WORST places for dinner that I have ever been to in any city. We were willing to give it a try (even when things started heading south!), but it just got worse...and worse....and worse....please, save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Desiree M.
Reviews.Content: I went to this bar last night to see my friend's band perform. She was in the middle of playing her first song when the manager cut the sound. After confronting him about it, he said that it was supposed to be an acoustic night and her music was too loud. When we told him that she could do an acoustic set, he then said that music was no longer aloud after 11 pm. He then proceeded to blame the promoter. The guy was just an idiot that pulled an extremely unprofessional move.If you are musician, do not play here. The manager is slovenly looking prick. On top of that, their drinks are overpriced. There are tons of better bars in downtown that are actually worth your time and money.

Reviews.Author: Beth F.
Reviews.Content: For such lofty name I have to admit I expected much better.  The plus: It is fun to ride the elevator to the top with the first drop on the 13th floor. Perch does a great job of getting you into an ambiance right away.  The minuses: Sadly, pretty much everything else.  We came here for dinner before a show on a Friday night. It took a bit of time before the server reached us but having been slammed in a section myself I am slightly more tolerant of this. She was pleasant enough so no problems there.  We ordered cocktails (just easy things for us, so I can't comment on the specialties)  For first course we split the arugula salad which was over dressed so it ended up just tasting like vinagery -vinagrette.  Food came out pretty fast so I am guessing the kitchen is used to a show rush be it for the Staples Center or whatever is going on in the area.  Then again, they really don't have much to put on the plate.  We chose the Swordfish and Salmon for our main course and well....I am not one for huge portions but these left me wholly unsatisfied.  The salmon was over a small bed of peas, mushrooms and shrimp with a red pepper coulis.  Way. too. salty.  The swordfish tasted like it was just brushed in a barbeque sauce and thrown on a small bed of mashed potatoes which I had to keep picking at since my dish did not come with a starch.  I was hoping dessert would be better but the white chocolate bread pudding tasted like nothing. At least it came out SUPER HOT (with no warning from the food runner)  I had to skim the caramel off the top to taste something sweet.It was a bummer because this place seems to have such potential but it looks like perhaps they care about their drinks and apps more than dinner dishes and for the price...come on Perch, you can aspire to greater heights.

Reviews.Author: Kevin S.
Reviews.Content: This place is only meh for me. It gets hot as hell since they let the light in and its an outdoorsy bar with limited shade. Drinks are standard overpriced DTLA prices. They also don't serve a lot of common drinks at the bar since this place is sorta hipster.View is pretty good since bar is perched on maybe 15 or so floors up on some building.Crowd here is young and professional. +1 for thatHappy hour specials are not that great here... limited beer and wine options were on it IIRC.Would be willing to go here again, but definitely not by my own initiative.

Reviews.Author: Shruti N.
Reviews.Content: NOTE: I come here for happy hour, not dinner. I like coming here for a drink, but am not usually blown away by their food. Most of the draw is the fact that the rooftop is gorgeous and the drinks are good at happy hour...but I definitely wouldn't come here if you're super hungry as the happy hour food is small and not usually filling!

Reviews.Author: Ran X.
Reviews.Content: Freaking long line but fantastic view from the rooftop. Nice decor. $12 for vodka&cranberry. And very crowded on Saturday night.

Reviews.Author: Haiku-Project H.
Reviews.Content: We dreamed of this place.Mostly because of the view.Pray it stays not lame.We know there are kinks.Like music, service, and food.Can they match the view?

Reviews.Author: Tammi L.
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful bar with a great view and cool crowd.  It's obviously one of the newest trendy downtown places to go.  The patio was beautiful and the fireplace is awesome.  BUT, it's waaaaay expensive!  I was there right after work (7 pm) and there were certainly no happy hour prices here! My vodka and soda was $11 and served in a low ball glass with lots of ice. The appetizers were good but not a good value. There were 2 of us and the bill came to $61 before tip! We each had 2 drinks  and 1 appetizer each. I left there hungry and not a hint of a buzz goin on.  If you're looking for a romantic place to take a date or if your looking to impress someone, this is the place.  If you're looking for a fun place to mingle and get your drink on with your mates, there are many better, more affordable places to go downtown (Bottega Louie for one!).  Once the trendiness wears off, I think Perch will have a hard time keeping the crowds unless they lower their prices or offer happy hour deal at least.  After all, we are in a recession!

Reviews.Author: Erin S.
Reviews.Content: I first came to Perch to dine in February of this year. My friends and I enjoyed the burger and roasted marrow bone appetizer and felt that the prices were affordable and the food was excellent. I was so excited I made a reservation for 15 people this past Monday for my birthday.I was very disappointed to find out that not only had the menu been changed, but some of the more moderately priced items on the menu had been completely eliminated so that the least expensive, substantial entree was $25. I ordered the filet with roasted asparagus which was the tiniest plate I have ever paid $30 for. I have had a larger steak for that price at world class steak houses in New York City. This was just very disappointing. Our server was very sweet but the service was very slow and disorganized. On top of that I had called several times even three weeks before the date of the dinner to make a reservation and never received a call back to the three messages I left. I had written an article on Perch for a Food Blog that I write for and I'm strongly considering retracting my recommendation. If I do come back to Perch it will not be to eat but maybe to have a glass of wine and enjoy the view.

Reviews.Author: Joel K.
Reviews.Content: The girlfriend took me here last night. It was our first "rooftop bar" experience together and we were pleasantly surprised by both the food and the incredible ambiance. The first win of the night came with parking.  Directly adjacent to the building that houses the "Perch" is a lot with $5 parking.  FIVE DOLLARS 0_0.  In LA.  That is an obscenely good deal.  I hadn't even had a drink yet and I was feeling good.  The second win came after we ascended 16 floors and immediately felt the up-beat, hip tempo of this place.  The inside has a homey, sophisticated vibe and the mix of souls dining and hovering around the bar is incredible.  We had reservations at 8 and we're seated by 8:20 (which gave ample time to soak up the views and scope out the place).  Our view of the LA skyline silhouetted by the setting sun was amazing!  The GF's feelings of apprehension (about how cold it was) were quickly settled by a wave of warmth from the outside heaters.  After seated I swiftly ordered the recommended IPA they had on draft (Houblon Chouffe Triple IPA), which ringed in at a steep $11. We then wasted no time in ordering the Truffle French Fries and Baked Brie.  They were bomb.  The french fries are smothered with truffle cheese (which resembled blue cheese in both texture and taste).  The baked brie was slightly crispy on the outside and creamy on the side (yum) and the accompanying salad was just kind of lackluster (meh).  For the main event the GF got one of the specials for the night, butternut squash ravioli with a mushroom cream sauce, and I got the braised short ribs with horseradish mashed potatoes.  The ravioli was a home run.  The butternut squash was creamy and sweet and the mushroom cream sauce was savory and smooth.  It reminded me a bit of the pumpkin ravioli and cream sauce I've concocted in the past.  The braised short ribs were on point.  Though the portion was almost obnoxiously large.  I'm a big eater and this was a behemoth amount of meat for what I consider a "bar food/ finger food" kind of joint. But I guess $29 deservedly gets you a lot of food.To wrap up the night we got two desserts.   The White Chocolate Bread Pudding and Chocolate Pot de Crème.  The bread pudding was fucking on point.  Perfectly moist (not drenched and soggy).  It was also about as big as my piece of beef.  The chocolate custard was more like a mousse and was a bit too heavy and boring.  The bread pudding would have been more than satisfying for the two of us.  The bill came in at $115 (w/o tip).  Which isn't TOO bad for two drinks, two appetizers, two entrees and two desserts atop a beautiful spot in LA.  The most surprising win of the night, however, came at around 9pm when music from the Nick Rosen Trio kicks in.  The trio plays every Friday night and they were unbelievably good.  All in all my girlfriend and I had a fantastic experience.  The food was overpriced but you have to remember that you're also paying for the atmosphere, which is perfect for anything from a hip family outing to drinks with co-workers to an intimate date.

Reviews.Author: Jane K.
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I was only here for five minutes at 11:00 pm and then had to head out.. but damn this place is beautiful. I didn't get to eat or drink anything.. so I can't say much about the food. But the ambience itself made me want to write a review on the place! SOOO PRETTY. There was live jazz music, people casually dressed and talking over drinks, trees wrapped up in stringed lights, beautiful city view. I love it.The only thing that annoyed me was getting there. The valet was a bit hard to find and pricey ($9-- not unusual for downtown LA). Then you take two elevators and a flight of stairs to get to the roof. Drunk people, good look finding your way back down without hurting yourselves.

Reviews.Author: Poinsettia S.
Reviews.Content: It was great time there last night. Good food and nice view. We asked some bullshit question about a wine ..then "Wine Master" came. He explained all the question through his google search from his iphone. Hilarious night.lolol great place for date night

Reviews.Author: Angela S.
Reviews.Content: I liked this place when it first opened.  Started not liking it bc of how packed it gets and some personalities there.  With my most recent visit this past Friday though, I think I will be going back more often. They had their "house band," I will just call "Joey Dosik and Friends"  I hear members change from time to time and they don't have a set schedule. It was lovely having them play good songs with the downtown skyline in the background.I still will not eat here.

Reviews.Author: Nicole S.
Reviews.Content: Met some friends here for a casual Tuesday night drink. Very cute spot, and the view was fabulous. A little bit of a pain in the ass to get to with the 2 sets of elevators that you have to navigate. Unfortunately, the very top bar (16th floor) was closed, but view from the main patio area was still prime. Definitely made up of a nice, mixed crowd.The drinks were mediocre. I had a simple vodka tonic and Le Libertine. Stay away from their well drinks, they apparently don't put much effort into them. The Le Libertine was yummy, but for $12 it better have been! When we arrived it was early and slow, and our waitress was really attentive. Decor and ambiance is very french, but not obnoxiously so. I've tried coming to this spot on a weekend, but I did not have the patience to stand in line. Luckily, it seems like weeknights are totally doable.

Reviews.Author: Harrison G.
Reviews.Content: Aside from the view/location, I was unimpressed with this place.  First off, the view from the outside terrace is amazing.  It's a beautiful view of downtown and is worth a visit just for that.  You can drink at the main bar and look out the window or make a reservation to eat on the balcony.  Or, do to the second story bar and lounge about up there (by second story, I mean second story of the bar.  It's actually the top of the building).Regarding the food, we weren't very hungry but wanted to try it out so we sat at the bar and split the duck duck goose and chicken croquette appetizers.  While both were tasty, I didn't love them, especially for the price vs. portion aspect.  Of the two, the duck duck goose was better.  The entrees look appealing based on the menu descriptions but not for the price.I understand with the location I should expect high prices.  I'd recommend dining elsewhere and coming here for a drink instead so you can still enjoy the view.  The cocktail and beer selection is pretty good.

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: Update for Perch. So they have a new chef in town and I think that they are doing a good job but are just playing it a little too safe. Drinks: They have a pretty wide list of drink options to enjoy.Dinner:Mussels - a big improvement from last time, but still just average. Nothing to crave or come back for. Rib-eye Special - Tasty meat, served a bit over cooked (served Med- Well, when requested Med-Rare). The meat was good enough quality and portion not to send back. Sea Bass - Delicious fish plate. A bit smaller of a dish, but overall a nice light dinner option. Side of Fries -we ordered a side of regular Fries, (not the truffle fries) and they charged us $11. Scccccusseme? Eff that noise. I was sad to see the "duck-duck-goose" pulled from the menu. It was a delicious and fun app that I was hoping to enjoy again. Perch is a great restaurant and venue, but the new menu is a bit boring. Tasty, but again just way too safe. I would love to see the chefs really add a whimsical element to the food to help boost the overall experience of the restaurant.**Also the place seems to still have issues with sending dishes to the wrong table. I witnessed it twice in my section. Luckily it didn't happen to me again!

Reviews.Author: C S.
Reviews.Content: What a hidden gem in the heart of downtown LA! As you enter the building of 448 S. Hill St. you take the first round of elevators up to the 13th floor. As you arrive there, you are greeted by a doormen who asks you for your ID.  Once he has verified you, he will lead you to another round of an elevator and instructs you take it up to the 15th floor. And there you are at the rooftop bar. Perfect dim lighting and retro French interior. What's even better is the outdoor patio seating overlooking the downtown night view. They also have a fireplace and multiple heater stands to warm you up on a chilly night. They had an original cocktail menu, which all looked fruity and delicious. Since it was a Monday night and I wanted to take it easy, I opted for the "Royal", which was a choice of your shot of liqueur into a glass of bubbly. To my surprise, they had "Creme de Cassis", which was something I rarely see at other bars! I had to give it a try. It came in a cute little glass. Stiffness, bubbly-ness, fruity-ness were all perfect!!! What a treat after a meal, YUM :) My friend ordered a Manhattan Sidecar, which was made with plenty of Maker's Mark and fruity berries. He let me try a sip of bit and oh boy it was stiff but very delicious. My friend chatted up a bit with one of the bartenders who was from NY. I believe his name was Kevin. He was an amusing guy and seemed quite knowledgeable about mixology. I have yet to find out myself how this place will be on a weekend. First impression on this visit was very good, so I'll be returning one of these days :)

Reviews.Author: M C.
Reviews.Content: It's an undeniably good vibe with a good view here. But that's it.If you come here later than 9:30 be prepared to wait. I came here for a birthday party, didn't wait but LOTS of people waited for over an hour that I knew. I think they do that because you can't tell from the outside that there's a bar and restaurant inside. The line is a big show for passerby's really because the place is big enough to have people come in right away. The crowd is OK. Usually people come here in big groups from what I saw. The parking situation sucks. You have to park across the street and pay something like $10. Or Valet and pay that and a tip so they can park it in the same lot anyway. It was nice to try it here. But if I had a choice, I'd not come back too often.

Reviews.Author: Jessie I.
Reviews.Content: great date spot! went last night and had a great dinner-service was awesome too. EVERYTHING we ordered was great, the mussels especially! the white chocolate bread pudding is evil...too good! thanks Perch!

Reviews.Author: Chris K.
Reviews.Content: A very trendy, but not too hipster-like outdoor lounge. They have live music. I believe it was Jazz which was really cool. A group of young guys playing some great tunes.The views of downtown are amazing and sure as hell beats going to the Standard rooftop. It's a new spot, it's fresh and definitely worthy of stopping by for a drink if you are planning a night out in dtown LA.They have a very unique list of cocktails that I would recommend exploring and if your'e planning on heading there with a big group for an occasion do make sure and book a reservation.

Reviews.Author: Anna V.
Reviews.Content: I need to try the restaurant.Until then, I've been to the bar, and I love it. A great take on historic downtown meets rooftop modern chic. Great drinks.The view isn't the skyscraper one that you would get at the Standard, but one reminiscent of another time. The bar is just off Pershing Square and pays homage to it's historic roots. I love that.Only downside is that like everything great - it gets SUPER packed.

Reviews.Author: Waneka R.
Reviews.Content: When the weather is nice, I love to go here for brunch.  Although mimosas are not bottomless, the views and food make it up to me. You can get an inexpensive bottle of good champagne and a mixer and make your magic happen.  No biggie.  There is live music and a DJ on the weekends. There is a delicious brie appetizer that I love, however some of their dishes are seasonal.  Like that one (boo!). Cool and hip crowd.  Sometimes a little too hip for my taste, but hey when in DTLA do as they do.  I'm a fan.

Reviews.Author: Sheila C.
Reviews.Content: I came here with my friends for one of my friends birthday. Our reservation was 7:15 pm but was told that our table wasn't ready yet. Waited for 15 minutes and the guy said " You guys are lucky " really guy??? Anyway, So he took us outside (patio) and had to wait again he took off without saying anything then came back after 10 minutes and said "Oh let me take you to another table". Finally, We got a table and as I was reading the menu I was hit but the guy who cleans the table from the other side twice but never said sorry. My friends noticed and said "So not liking this place, service sucks and employees are rude". So not coming back!! View was very nice though.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine L.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the BEST ROOFTOP bar/restaurant in downtown LA. I haven't tried their food but have been here a few times for drinks, the drinks are reasonably priced, there's two out door patios, cool loungy places to sit and the views are amazing. This is a must spot for everyone!

Reviews.Author: phoebe k.
Reviews.Content: It was one of my fav bar/food place but now it's only my fav bar in dtla.New chef, not so great! waitress told me it was too french and now they are trying to be more american. what the fudge!!!!!I want my old chef back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Iz V.
Reviews.Content: A bit on the pricey end. It's good food but not super amazing. I had the chicken and risotto. Very flavorful. Just thought it was over priced. But, then again you're paying for the view and ambience. And to be honest...IT'S TOTALLY WORTH IT!. Summer evening and live music with some great vino..perfect date spot!! Make reservations!

Reviews.Author: Kate D.
Reviews.Content: The view is, indeed, spectacular! The night was REALLY cold and unfortunately, there were no portable heaters in our area - all of them were placed in the doorway from the main room to the patio.The appetizers were really great and the main course was just alright for the price. I've definitely had better, but also worse. The service was pretty good. A little slow at times.The appetizers: mac & cheese was delicious. I heard the sliders were good too. The baked brie was TINY for $16. Pretty good, but not $16 good. We also ordered the brussel sprouts and I was skeptical but they were so good!I think I'm getting old because I wasn't prepared for the full on bar scene that occurred around 10pm. When we left at 11:30 there was a HUGE line waiting to get in.

Reviews.Author: Alex D.
Reviews.Content: There is no comparison, it's like a time machine back to 1920's Paris. My wife and I can't stay away from this place. The food, the atmosphere, the staff. We always ask for Carlina because she's just awesome. Can't wait to go again, and again.

Reviews.Author: Liv P.
Reviews.Content: had to investigate after seeing the sign on the street: 'Perch.  An elevated resting place.  13th floor.'very relieved to learn that it's NOT a trendy new mausoleum.

Reviews.Author: Ani A.
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing experience at Perch.  Everyone is so welcoming from the attendant downstairs, to the security, to the host, to our server and to the management team.  There isn't any place like Perch in LA the views, the live music the complete ambiance is perfect.  You have no idea what you are about to experience coming into the building.The food and cocktails are great as well.  This place is a must!

Reviews.Author: Caro F.
Reviews.Content: Trendy spot. Love this place, amazing city views, great drinks and food, nice crowd.Yes it ain't cheap but you pay for the location and decor.Would def recommend and come back!

Reviews.Author: Lilie N.
Reviews.Content: Extremely long wait, they didn't let anyone in for an entire 45 minutes and it wasn't even crowded.  We were in line for over an hour, I would have left if we didn't have friends from out of town inside waiting.  At least there was no cover charge and it didn't take too long to grab drinks.  The music was terrible, but the view and ambiance was great.  I think we spent more time waiting to get in than we did hanging out inside.   I probably do not intend to come back in a while.

Reviews.Author: Yolanda S.
Reviews.Content: Cocktails: I was expecting a hand-crafted cocktail, not a quick "pseudo-we're trying our cocktails to pass as actual hand-crafted cocktails"Truffle fries: AMAZING.  I'd go back, just for the truffle friesSteak frites: delicicous. I love steak frites at french restaurants and Perch's was pretty amazing.Oysters: delishView: the reason to go here.  make a reservation on the patio, enjoy the truffle fries, and then head up to the 16th floor for the view. downtown is priceless.

Reviews.Author: Quan D.
Reviews.Content: We came here as an escape from the mini riots (LA Artwalk + Occupy LA = craziness) and enjoyed a view of the city and LAPD pushing hipsters back. The view of the city is outstanding and there seems to be plenty of seats to be had to kick back and enjoy. The line to wait for the elevator was a bit long and I wasn't quite sure why they wouldn't let us just take the stairs (burn those calories yo!) We didn't stay more than an hour so couldn't tell you much more, but it was enough to pique my interest in coming back for a second shot.

Reviews.Author: Tin Tin L.
Reviews.Content: A must check out place in DTLA for the ambience and the views only. Good wine list with mediocre tasting food thus far. The Brûlée, although not the best I've tasted was decent.

Reviews.Author: eileen h.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to come to Perch after agreeing that paying cover at The Standard is unnecessary. We came here with the pre-notion that Perch was not pretentious and had a laid back scene. To my dismay, it was nothing like that. It's like any club you would find with lines and security guards that take tips to slip the line. Even on Hollywood can you just go in with just a few girls. But here, they will make you wait no matter the gender. The only distinguishing factor of how you will enter is either how much you are willing to fork up to bypass the line or how long you are willing to wait.Prices and drinks were decent. It's a place where I would suggest going if you were going with a smaller group since there are tables situated all throughout the venue.  It gets a bit crowded as the night progresses, so if you're looking for a more tone-down atmosphere, go earlier in the evening.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: The decor is very chic and french with dim lighting and the view of downtown.  Reminded me of Edison and Standard in downtown LA. Mixed crowd.  The outdoor seating is quite gorgeous on a perfect summer/warm night.  Came here for a friends birthday, arrived at 9:30pm and there's already a line outside the entrance on a Saturday night.  Thank goodness my friend  new or spoke to someone so we were let in right away, instead of waiting in line.  Got in and went up to the 15th floor.My party were only there for the bar and lounging, as other people were still continuing with their dinner, while others were drinking.  (Kind of awkward if you tell me.) At one point in the night, there was so many people at the bar, it was hard to get to one side to another with all this furniture and seating in the middle.  Which that reminds me--  My friend made reservations for a dinner here, but apparently we were told that the reservations were never made... whhhatt?Signature Drinks = Had the My Fair Lady (kinda like a cosmo), was okay, maybe too sweet for me.  They also got your typical bar drinks too.Probably come back with a few friends, if they want to come.  Maybe check out the food next time around.

Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: I checked out Perch with a few friends on a slow Thursday night and I must say I was quite impressed with the place. Getting to Perch is a journey in and of itself, you walk into the hotel, go down a hallway, up an elevator and out and around the corner into another elevator which drops you off at Perch's front door.Perch's interior is woody, dark, old style Chicago looking and their servers dress the part too in penguin style outfits. I didn't have the food but the drinks are pretty stiff and fairly cleverly named and moderately priced... but the service has a lot to be desired.All in all I think Perch is worth checking out, it has a classy interior, nice drinks and a very upscale but mellow crowd.

Reviews.Author: Matthew L.
Reviews.Content: Located on the 15th floor of a random building, Perch features a French theme and a rooftop with comfortable furniture and a glorious view of Pershing Square and beyond. The room has all sorts of Parisian flourishes and French-language music plays in the background.The food is known to be notoriously sub-par - I cannot comment as my father persuaded hold off on ordering the frog legs. However, I enjoyed my drinks. And at happy hour, they have decently priced specials.This is a great place to show off downtown Los Angeles to an out of town visitor.

Reviews.Author: Amanda G.
Reviews.Content: I came to Perch this past weekend for a belated birthday dinner with friends and immediately fell in love with their unique drink menu, killer apps and amazing view - and let's not forget that I was pleasantly surprised by how warm they keep the rooftop patio (yes, I'm a Cali girl!!).  Not gonna lie, one of the cutest things about Perch right now is that you have a stellar view of the ice skating rink that's been set up downtown; it glimmers and shines at night and its absolutely gorgeous!I had a French Maid to start (delish and refreshing) and migrated onto appetizers once the rest of my party got situated.  Between the four of us, we split the Cordon Bleu Poppers and Le Cheese Dip (a must if you're a fondue freak like myself), and to finish it all off I tried the Lamb Burger - omg, nomnomnom.  Granted, I'd stuffed myself so full from the appetizers that it was hard to finish - but I definitely tried my hardest.It's a little pricey, but for the view and the amazing menu - I'm not going to argue with prices. I can't wait to come back with friends and enjoy some Happy Hour drinks while we watch the sunset over LA :)

Reviews.Author: Shrina S.
Reviews.Content: As someone who lives near the area but isn't familiar with the city, I ended up bringing my friends from out-of-town to the city and going around for two hours trying to find a nice place to sit, chat, and have a nice drink.  We finally came across Perch.The building is really pretty once you walk in, and you're taken up in the elevator to the top floor to where the bar is.  It's a really cute, quaint place that's quite small, but we really enjoyed it!  it's a rooftop bar with a gorgeous view, and the bartender was really nice as well.  The drinks were pretty strong, and we ended up sitting inside on the couches for a while just chatting.  It was a nice, quiet place and I'm really glad we ended up at Perch!

Reviews.Author: Ellen L.
Reviews.Content: I love the idea of Perch! My Bestie, friends and I came here for my birthday and toasted with champagne at midnight :) the combination of the spectacular night view and amazing company made it such a special night. The only problem I had was waiting to get in. The security guy was seriously power tripping. There were hardly any people outside and yet he insisted on making our group wait in the friggin cold before letting us in. Douche.Despite the toolbag, I loved the chill atmosphere of the rooftop. It was slightly crowded by the bar, and most of the seats near fire pits or heaters were taken, but we eventually got seats. This is somewhere I'll definitely be going back to for special nights out!!
Reviews.Author_Location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Bin H.
Reviews.Content: Nice rooftop view! Solid drinks!It wasn't too crowded, but there was a private birthday party, so they blocked off a good portion of the rooftop bar, so my friends & I had to resort to a small corner. No complaints there since we made our own party and probably had more fun as we headed downstairs to try their food after downing a few drinks.The service was great, and the atmosphere was cool.

Reviews.Author: Andrew G.
Reviews.Content: Popped in for drinks with the homie Raf.I like the location. It's definitely cool to be up high, even if it IS in LA. Mixological concoctions were decent The Mexican Maid with tequila, mint, cucumber and jalapeño was especially compelling.The crowd, however, was the PITS. Is this what regular people look like in downtown LA?I'll be back but I won't expect much.

Reviews.Author: Win K.
Reviews.Content: If a classy art deco-style rooftop bar, at 15th floor, overlooking Pershing Square and LA downtown is your thing, you'll certainly love this place.  It's beautiful and classy.There are tables and booths outside with servers... or you can order at the bar.  The view of the cityscape is quite beautiful.  There's a band playing in one corner.  There are two floors of patio seating (with small fire pits and heat lamps).  You can decide to stay indoors at the retro-looking bar area, but it tends to get loud and crowded.  The food here is pretty pricey (around $20 and higher), but the majority come here for the drinks.  I had the house red wine (I believe it was Merlot)--I probably should've asked for a Cabernet--it wasn't up to my particular taste. I'm sure the other drinks are just fine.So, I got here because I was supposed to meet some people here for a friend's birthday.  There's was bit of a line at the door as this place gets pretty packed.  Once you get through, you take an elevator to the 13th floor, then another one that takes you to the 15th floor (or was it 16th?).In the end, this place's selling point is the ambiance, and it manages to sell it quite well.

Reviews.Author: Robert A.
Reviews.Content: This place has a cool, chill vibe. It's definitely a place to come after work for a few drinks and tell your coworkers "Let's meet at The Perch" (sounds so LA hipster, doesn't it?)There were a lot of people ordering food so I'm assuming it was delicious. However, their Happy Hour menu/drink choices were limited and not all that cheap, so I sided with my wallet and didn't get anything fancy. Instead, I ordered an appetizer of three cheese triangles with some jam for $6 -- now don't get me wrong, it was tasty, but kinda pricey for three (yes, THREE) cheese triangles -- and my friends and I split an order of fries (OK, but nothing to write home about).Come here, enjoy the view and have a drink. The fireplace, lighting, and glass panels make this place a definite place to try; it is beautiful up here. However, I'm still not quite sold -- the pricing? the parking? I don't know what it is. I'll give it another chance, but not in the immediate future.

Reviews.Author: Guillermo C.
Reviews.Content: I want to give this place 4 stars, but I have not tried the food yet so 3.5 for now.  I went for my first time looking for an amazing view of DTLA... found it!  I proceeded to look for the bar and ordered a whiskey with a splash of ginger ale.  "Sorry, we don't have ginger ale, but I can do something with a splash of ginger beer"...Alright... I am game.  MMMM... Excellent!  Good drinks... check!  Pretty people...check!  What can I say... they got a good thing going.  Stay tuned for my next visit when I will try the food!  PS... It gets busy, so try and get there at a decent time.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly B.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful spot in DTLA!BUT you must go EARLY.We came to celebrate my friend's birthday on Saturday night and showed up before 10pm. We waited in line for about 25 minutes to get up the 15th floor. Waited another 20 minutes to get to the 16th floor and we were considered lucky. The fire marshall has limited the amount of people allowed on the rooftop to 125 people.Great views of the city. Diverse crowd. Lines suck but it's still worth visiting. I would like to return here. If you come here with a large group, be conscious of lines and how difficult it will be to get a spot to sit unless you have someone come around 8pm to stake out a nice fire pit.Great place to take out-of-towners and would be a lovely spot for a date!

Reviews.Author: Tim R.
Reviews.Content: Finally made it out to this spot after work. I missed happy hour by 15  minutes as their happy hour ends at  6pm :(.I had two Pinnacle Vodka mixed drinks and the Lamb Sliders for $37.23 (tax and tip included).I enjoyed the mixed drinks and they do have a great selection of drinks and custom drinks to select from. The three super small sliders were ok but not worth $14. The meat was good, the bun was fresh, and the sauce was special but I've had better.The bartender was very cool and helpful. The host had no clue what she was doing, maybe she was new or something. I would expect better at a busy time like 4-7 pm after work. That is when business picks up here in DTLA.Come for the view. I will be back again Peeeeeerch.

Reviews.Author: Angie L.
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't want to rate this place because I was selfish and didn't want to share with the rest of the world in fear that it would get crowded in the masses.  But what good is hoarding something so awesome all to yourself? Though the ambiance and photos might tell you otherwise, this place isn't pretentious one bit.  I mean, I don't think a bum will be allowed in.. but the atmosphere is still friendly.  The only con is that the roof space is limited, so as the night gets later, they stop letting people up to the top.  It's good because then there won't be a fire hazard up there.  However, it sucks when you have amazing friends who happened to arrive late, get stuck downstairs and not be able to unite with them.  I think they should make exceptions, if the majority of their party are already up on the roof, they should be able to prove it by going up there so they don't have to enjoy the Perch experience apart.I've been here a few times now, and each time I've been content with the general ambiance, killer view of downtown outside, and nice company.  The cocktails are good, some are hit+miss, but once you find one you like, stick with it.  Yeah, they're a little on the pricey side, but don't forget you're paying for the experience of being here.  They had casual small bands playing music in the background, they're good people trying to get a little love and provide a little entertainment.  Thank you to all musicians out there who do this.  And thanks Perch for being another lovely late-night place to grab drinks of the alcoholic kind and catch up with friends in DTLA.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: Came to celebrate a friend of a friend's birthday. It's the first time in years I've had to stand in line to get in. I just don't go to places that have a line, because all that means is it's going to be super loud and super crowded inside... which it was. We kept getting yelled at for not standing in the right place, there was no place to sit, the bar was 3 people deep, and then we had to wait in ANOTHER line to get to the roof. In fairness, it's a pretty, especially the roof: it's floor, the bar, and omg, the view(!). I hear Perch a nice local spot during the week, but it gets crazy on the weekends.TLDR: I don't understand the hype.

Reviews.Author: Yulree C.
Reviews.Content: I am a bar type of gal but once in a while I, too, love to glam up and go out on the town. My favorite place for pre-dinner or post-dinner cocktails is Perch. The drinks are good, yes, but the view is what keeps bringing me back. The atmosphere of this place is breathtaking - a 360 view of Downtown, sparkling lights all around you with live music in the background. Perfect place for a romantic night out.

Reviews.Author: Dave G.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view! Food is good.

Reviews.Author: Andrew P.
Reviews.Content: Had a dinner reservation for three at 8:15pm, wasn't seated until 8:45pm (overbooked tables) and was seated in an area that was normally for lounging (seats were way lower than the tables). Band was unusually loud due to the location, and people were standing/hovering during our whole dinner. Service was also spotty as we had to request for bread 3x and rarely refilled water glasses. Although the first visit was lovely, after this second experience won't be coming back anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Des W.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. It's almost feels like a speak easy with the multiple elevators and an obscured location. The drinks are great, the atmosphere is lovely and the location is beautiful. I highly recommend this for an early evening cocktail to watch the sunset.

Reviews.Author: Prisca Y.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building and view. Enjoyed the ambiance and everyone else except the bartender. She wasn't rude or anything but wasn't the greatest either. No smiles or small chat even though it wasnt busy. Went here only for some drinks (scotch so can't say much on how well they make mixed drinks) and to chill with an old friend. Would I be back? Only if a friend/lover asked me to meet me here. Aside from the view, nothing special. Oh oh but I enjoyed the French pop background music :) wished I shazamed it

Reviews.Author: Neda G.
Reviews.Content: This place is adorable! The food is great- it is expensive but the view and the food is great.Customer service is excellent.Last night we went and waited in line. There were three people in front of us. as time went by more people added to the number of the people in front of us by the time we were almost close to getting in their number grow to 20. The girl at the door knew they were cutting in line and she sent them to the back of the line, that was the best feeling ever when she did that. :)The location is at the heart of downtown LA there is a big parking lot in front of the building and they have Valet so you won't have problem parking.

Reviews.Author: Melody V.
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooftop view. Great and attentive service.I wouldn't bring a group of no more than 10. It's a great location, but quite small, and if you want a table or area reserved for a large group, this would not be the place to do it. Great place for casual meetings of drinks and small bites, but that's about it.It's not a restaurant that serves drinks, or a bar that serves food, I find it somewhere still in middle.Perch was less than two weeks open, so I respect it for where it's going and I will return when it matures. Perch serves pricey french food, but good. The menu was limited, though since it was 2 weeks since its inception, I'm sure the dishes will grow.My group of six friends decided to check-out the entire menu so we picked at its various dishes. The Brocollini salad is good, though I prefer the prosciutto sliced smaller. Don't be afraid of the frog legs, a good, small appetizer that really does taste like chicken. The Risotto was a bit wet, a bit soggy than what I have tried at other place. I DID love the Duck, Duck, Goose appetizer. It was great. I never had duck bacon before and it was served on small bites of bread. Savory.Now, I was not impressed with the Cordon Bleu "Poppers" tasted like chicken nuggets dipped in bleu cheese. Nothing surprising there.And, the desserts? Tasted my first gooseberry with the Apple Tart Napoleon dessert. It was a pretty apple tart served with a small scoop of ice cream. Good for one. The Beignets are those warm puffy doughnuts. Nothing special here, either. Though the strawberry jam was a treat. The Chocolate Creme pot is a chocolate pudding with slices of fruit. Drinks were strong (as I was told), and the bottle service is great.I say this place will only get better with time. Definitely a great place to go for quick drinks and good company. They should look into expanding their appetizer menus.

Reviews.Author: Elle L.
Reviews.Content: 15 minute wait outside, but great hang out, nice view of DT, can't beat the rooftop, weird rum, expensive drinks, one snobby bartender, french songs playing in the background, look at the view again, ooh fire place. Need to go back and try food but no more funny rum. How about whiskey?

Reviews.Author: Ed K.
Reviews.Content: Many locals were saddened at the closure of the downtown gastropub The Must, but as the saying goes The Boys (and Girl) are back!  Perch is their new rooftop bar/ounge in DTLA located at the corner of 5th and Hill.  In addition to the classic european style interior and decor, their strong point is a fantastic 360 view of the city, and while not as dramatic as the view offered by places such as Elevate or the Standard rooftop, what you do get is an unobstructed front row view of Pershing Sq.  Offering a menu for those who want a sit down dinner or various lounge seats for those who simply want to hang out and enjoy good company, I forsee Perch quickly becoming the new spot to-be once they work out some of their operational kinks (i.e. staff who seem a bit lost & confused and somewhat 'unifnished' look especially with the upper balcony).  For any new place these are operational bugs that will be worked out over time, because the location and real estate is simply too good to screw up.  I'll be making return visits to follow their progress.

Reviews.Author: Dimitri K.
Reviews.Content: The highlights are cordon bleu "Poppers".  The rest was a bit overpriced, esp. since the only way we got in on a weekend was to pay off the security/doorman $60 on a Saturday night.  I guess you gotta pay for that amazing rooftop view of downtown LA.

Reviews.Author: Jonny A.
Reviews.Content: Perch is perfect during three times: Midweek, starting out the night, or ending it. Any other time, you'll be thinking to yourself, 'So I waited in line for a view? Ugh, let's go.'That is the beauty of Perch and the reason to go. The view is utterly amazing, and if enjoyed at the right time, with the right people, serene. The bartenders have a pretty good idea of what they're doing. Like most high end bars, expect mix-o-logists. Go somewhere else for your jack n coke or gin n tonic. Here, they'll make you a decent concoction, that may break the bank if you throw them back though. This place is great for conversation. A great date spot, especially on a cold night if you can snag a spot by the fireplace (yes, that's right, a fireplace....outside...on the rooftop). Don't expect a swanky club, or an elaborate dance floor, but a quaint spot to enjoy a couple of drinks with good company.

Reviews.Author: Ann B.
Reviews.Content: This is a great place. I heard about the rooftop lounge and had to see it for myself, if just for the view. I was there on a Saturday night, and the place was packed. I must've waited a good 20 minutes in line just to get to the rooftop, and once there, the view was fantastic. Being that it was nighttime, I got to see a 360 view of the downtown area around me and it was beautiful. The one downside was they allow smoking, so it sorta took away from me trying to breathe in the cool air. I didn't try any of the food or alcohol.

Reviews.Author: Darius A.
Reviews.Content: The ambiance in this night spot is turn't up. Beautiful ladies abound and i'm sure the women feel the same about the fellas. It's a very nice crowd here and the food is very good. The seared ahi tuna is wonderful and light tasting (melt in your mouth type good). We also tried the buffalo frog legs and they were excellent. The view is gorgeous.

Reviews.Author: Carolyn J.
Reviews.Content: A quaint date night location with a beautiful view of Downtown LA. I'm still bitter about the fact that I can't eat 95% of the items featured on the menu but what I can eat makes up for it. The soy glazed brussels sprouts and french fries. I always opt for the Writers Block (vodka, pear juice, lime) since it is insanely irresistible. I highly recommend you call ahead of time and reserve an ideal table (preferably one out on the terrace by the sidelines). Be sure to arrive before 6 or after 10 as the time between that, the restaurant AND bar do get a tad bit crowded. I love how hidden the perch is from the chaos of the streets of Downtown LA. It's located on the 15th floor (rooftop baby!) but before that you have to stop on the 13th and take another elevator. No worries though, there are guards to guide you to your oasis. The ambience is romantic so be sure to bring a confidant you're in awe of. The interior decor is a splash between vintage and art nouveau with framed paintings of nude portraits. The Perch and The Edison are two of my favorite places to hit up late night in Downtown.

Reviews.Author: Meha P.
Reviews.Content: The first time I came here, everything was great, so I came back. The second time, the food was great, but service was pretty was disappointing. Lots of little issues that accumulated over the evening. Arrived for dinner reservation to be told that other patrons were seated at our reserved outdoor table. We were seated inside instead.  Waitress came to ask for my drink order.  It was quite dark inside so I asked if the candle would be lit. She said someone was in the process of lighting them. I asked her for a few minutes to decide on a  drink. After she left, my friend told me that it's happy hour and showed me the menu on her phone. When the waitress returned, I placed a drink order then asked for a happy order menu. She returned with 1 menu for me. None for my friend. I guess I should have been more specific.  Waitress delivered my drink then took our food order. The food arrived, but I had to ask for plates and utensils, which came later. Quality and timing of food was great. About an hour after I asked and after we were done eating, someone came by and lit the candle. A manager Alex came by and politely let us know that the next reservation for our table would arrive in 15 minutes. My friend and I left the table and I told Alex about the service problems, including not being seated at our originally reserved table due to other patrons staying longer, but being asked to clear off of our table for others. Alex assured us that it would be corrected and gave me his card.Alex, I have faith and will return.

Reviews.Author: Amelia F.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!They don't have chocolate cake shots but their substitute was AWESOME...Views awesome, but good luck find seats!

Reviews.Author: Manon M.
Reviews.Content: the tuna sashimi was delightful

Reviews.Author: Charles D.
Reviews.Content: I went here for the 1st time for a charity event. The sunset multi-layered view was gorgeous so kudos on their location. The service, however, was horrible. I was chatting with my friends when one of the servers actually punched me in the back. Granted it was a light punch but who does that? A light shoulder tap would've sufficed. I was also shoved aside when I was at the bar when one of the waitresses told me to move out of the way. Great venue, horrible staff.

Reviews.Author: niki h.
Reviews.Content: I was a big fan of The Must, and was saddened by their unexpected closure, so naturally I was excited when I heard the owners were coming back to downtown with a new concept.  After a false start a couple of weeks ago (Yelp say s they're open at 4 on Saturdays, and so does their voicemail, but it turns out they open at 6:00 - whoops), I finally got to check out Perch this past weekend. We got there at about a quarter to 7:00 and they were already quite busy.  We didn't have a reservation, but the hostess was able to accommodate us after a brief wait.  The dining space is rather small, so reservations probably are the way to go.  Having perused the menu in advance, already knew I was getting the Duck, Duck, Goose and the Apple Tart Napoleon; my friend (who was starving) also got the Duck, Duck Goose, and she, her date, and my date all ordered the Lamb Burger.The DDG is described as being three mini clubs (consisting of seared duck, bacon, gooseberry jam, mustard frills and roast tomato) served on honey bread.  They were delicious, but slightly challenging to eat.  I would say the "honey bread" is more like a crouton and crumbled like crazy every time I tried to take a bite.  I like croutons just fine but I don't think you should make sandwiches out of them (however tiny the sandwich or large the crouton), because of the aforementioned crumbling issue.The feedback on the lamb burger varied from "salty" (friend) to "a little salty"  (friend's date) to "realy salty" (date).  If only one of them had mentioned the salt, I'd chalk it up to personal preference, but when three out of three think the salt was overdone, I'm going to go out on a limb and say the lamb burgers were over-salted.  My Tart was delicious; and pretty and messy, but somehow, I didn't mind the mess so much when it involved caramel, apples and ice cream.  The dessert might seem small to some, but I thought it was ideal; a perfectly sized treat that satisfied my sweet tooth and didn't come with a side order of caloric regret.The setting itself is lovely, all the tables are outdoors, and surrounded by a glass wall that doesn't impede the view.  I do wonder though what they're going to do when the weather cools down - there's a fireplace at one end of the space, but I don't see how they'll be able to open for business in the cold and rainy months that Los Angeles does have. I will probably come back and check out the bar (up one floor from the restaurant) before summer's over, but there wasn't enough on the menu to bring me back again for the food.  I'm still holding out hope that a new incarnation of The Must will come along.

Reviews.Author: Nicole J.
Reviews.Content: Would you trade a killer view for below-average drinks?That's the choice you're facing at Perch. Check it out once for the view -- an overlook of Pershing Square in downtown LA with an expansive outdoor seating and a 1920s flapper-esque loungey feel.There were two lines on either side of the door when we arrived. The doorman put us in the shorter "locals" line, for downtown LA residents (irony here is that we were all westsiders...couldn't he tell by our friend's flip-flops?)After about 20 minutes we got in. Rode an elevator that reminded me of the Tower of Terror up to the 13th floor. Got out and hiked a few flights of stairs to get to the rooftop.I guess that's for ambiance? Anyway, no sweat. We got up there and the place was not overly busy (why did we have to wait in line?). We actually got our own table -- that's how uncrowded it was.Drinks -- here's where I was disappointed. Our waitress warned us that all of their drinks were pretty sweet. She recommended the champagne with a liquor shot of choice. I chose St. Germains Elderflower. It was good, but nothing I'd order again. One friend tried to order beer and they only had one type of beer on hand that night.Crowd was meh. We gave it an hour and left around 1.P.S. The food menu looks interesting, but I haven't tried anything.
