Reviews.Author: Angela K.
Reviews.Content: What a great place with one of the best views I've seen in LA. I'd say better than the Standard view and with no douchiness. The line was kinda long and unorganized at 10pm, we waited about 25 minutes only to get up there and see that it wasn't that full. My girlfriends and I ordered the kir royals with different shots of liquor. They were tasty and not too strong. The service was very friendly, from the security guards to the bartenders, everyone was attentive and quick. We only ordered the bleu poppers which were delicious. I'd definitely go back there for dinner and maybe watch the sunset.Minus one star for the wait outside. I normally don't have the patience, but the double decker view and service totally made up for it. Definitely make reservations ahead of time if you want to avoid the wait.

Reviews.Author: Brian K.
Reviews.Content: Came here after a birthday dinner to continue in celebration. Besides the view, everything was pretty standard.The drinks are standard downtown prices. Sadly, I would have rather gone to the birthday girl's loft's rooftop right next door.

Reviews.Author: Kazu O.
Reviews.Content: Cool place.... you gotta take two elevators to get to the top of the building...Love the view here... Nice rooftop lounge area and the drinks are pretty good... Standard 10-12 bucks a drink... Very chill spot, good for just hanging out with friends and catching up... You can actually have conversations... Place is starting to get crowded on weekends so be prepared to wait in line...

Reviews.Author: Phillip L.
Reviews.Content: Another great rooftop spot for some lounging with friends or even cozy enough to take a date. The outdoor rooftop area is actually two levels, and it overlooks Pershing Square.Drinks are typical downtown-type prices with some good mixologists, and the crowd is usually fairly lively. If you go on Friday or Saturday nights, though, make sure you get there before 10PM -- lines can reach around the block.

Reviews.Author: Sandra D.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the space, decor, and view!!Impressed upon entry of the building.Went last night (wed night) for first time. Not sure if it was an off night but I was not impressed with the clientele and cocktails. Crowd was a sort of dressed up frat type.There is a well stocked bar. For a place that serves classic cocktails, they don't measure. Classic cocktails are all about measurements. Their eyeball measurement..not so great. The barback was making cocktails as well and didn't know how to make them. ...maybe it was an off night. They did, however, have my new favorite, saffron gin.Found a cozy spot outside overlooking Pershing Square under a heater. I do recommend bring/wear a jacket.Will try again. Not sure about food.

Reviews.Author: Jen K.
Reviews.Content: GOOD FIND! A new gem in downtown. Came here for dinner and drinks with a couple of friends. Dining area is situated around the outside terrace overlooking the park at pershing square. Appetizers were amazing-- entrees were ok. I had the scallops (which were cooked fine, but flavorless). I would recommend the chicken (young whole chicken). Most of the drinks that my friend ordered were bourbon based (not a fan of dark liquor), but they were tasty! I would recommend coming for dinner/appetizers and then enjoying some drinks afterwards. Don't forget to make a reservation!

Reviews.Author: Nazar B.
Reviews.Content: went here when I was starting to date my gf.It's a descent place. The view is OK. the floor beneath the roof has seating and some tables for reservations..The bar on the roof is just ridiculous. There's two bartenders for the 20-30 people waiting to order drinks. Also they don't have a lot of the mixers, they couldn't make an rasberry lemon drop for example. The downstairs bar is a bit better, but you can't go back and forth as the roof reaches capacity.The rooftop gets REALLY crowded around 11ish on the weekends... they stop letting people up there at some point.Also the line outside gets REALLY long around 11ish as well. There were two lines when I went there, I think one was for people who live in the DT area? So if you live in the DT area the line will be shorter.I don't know if I would come back here.The lounge is descent but just OK.

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: Went for their happy hour from 4-6PM, still a lot of people, Good crowd, mostly people coming after work. I love their patio.... with a nice breeze and good amount of sun, this place is awesome. I would say romantic and trendy.  Great place to hang out and relax... One thing I don't like about this place, I think there was only one elevator that takes you up to PERCH... and sometimes it gets crowded... but I guess it's not such a big deal...

Reviews.Author: Syniah M.
Reviews.Content: YES! It is TRUE! The view from Perch is AMAZING! I love LA so to be able to gaze at the heart of the magnificent City of Angels 15 stories up makes this place worth it. That and it's uber- romantic (we were celebrating our 6 year anniversary). We sat by the fireplace and watched the sun go down drinking our peach lambic and it was perfect! I would give Perch 1000 stars just for the ambiance! (The fact that it was a warm night probably helped.)So let's talk about the service...The service was good: hostess and waiters were attentive, food took a reasonable amount of time to arrive, and they checked on us often but not too often.And now the food...Okay, so I read the reviews on the Yelp and was prepared to deal and accept mediocre food. Was it mediocre? Hmmm...it was just A-Ok (aka: 3 stars). I had the French Onion Soup, Bibb and Blue Salad, and the Shrimp and Grits; the boyfriend had the soup as well and the Steak Frites. French Onion Soup: The taste of the soup was good but the consistency was slightly off...Bibb and Blue Salad: The lettuce was kind of bitter (was it supposed to be?) and the ingredients didn't seem to blend well (perhaps more dressing would help?)Shrimp and Grits: This was pretty good...but not mind-blowing.Steak Frites: I've seen my BF eat a lot of steak, and although the BF said it was good, I know him well enough to know he meant it was just ok. The look on his face from his first bite in says it all and, well, his first bite into this one didn't say much.I hope the food gets better because I want to love this place with all 5 stars! Oh Perch! I have faith in you!

Reviews.Author: Sarah B.
Reviews.Content: I've come here for both drinks & food and was very satisfied for both. This is the perfect place to hang out on a nice summer night or just to come and enjoy the sunset. Drinks are good and if you go to the first floor bar, they can make you a mean cocktail! Ask for the Sasrak!The view on both the first and 2nd floor bar (this is all on the rooftop) is amazing!!If this is not summer, be sure to bring a sweater!

Reviews.Author: Angie T.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I read about this place from Sunset Magazine. We were so excited to check out the roof top views, food, and ambiance. We didn't have a reservation and were able to snag a table on the edge with a heat lamp. The ambiance is why you'll come here again.My vote of 2 stars is because of the food and drinks. I am very willing to pay for over $10 drinks/appetizers and over $20 entrees when it's good. Overall, the flavors were extremely flat and boring. My friend and I ordered the Marie Antoinette. According to the waitress it was her favorite...it had muddled cherries, jalepeno etc... it just tasted like straight whiskey, not much of a kick. For food we got: salmon tartare, lobster bisque, and ratatouille. Tartare needed better zip and textures, lobster bisque was orange, tasteless water, and the ratatouille has mainly goat cheese on a puff pastry with no vegetables.Come to this place for the ambiance and people watching alone. As for food and drinks...I've had way better for cheaper.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey T.
Reviews.Content: Overall, interesting dining experience. The view outside is quite memorable. A very sophisticated place to be at. You get the view of downtown LA and Pershing Square. I thought sitting on the couch to eat my food was quite the way to go. The menu was quite interesting. I was having a good time eating the Ahi Tuna Tartar. I thought it was an interesting combination of flavors with the ginger soy vinaigrette and avocado. I also had the "Pot-Au-Feu" (which I couldn't pronounce (darn french)). It was so soft and delicious. The polenta in the dish was so fluffier and more delicious than mashed potatoes. I'm a big fan of short ribs and it was absolutely delightful. I'd come back here for a big date/anniversary or something. The place certainly had this very laid-back vibe that made me just want to sit back and relax so I didn't really care all that much about how slow the service was.

Reviews.Author: Sarah R.
Reviews.Content: So happy this place exists! Yes, the reviews are true.. food and service can be hit or miss. BUT, the fantastic cocktails and gorgeous rooftop view make up for any areas Perch is lacking. This place is definitely worth trying and chances are you will be eager to come back. We tried the ahi tuna tartar, lamb sliders, truffle poutine, bread pudding and house made pumpkin gelato.The poutine- ridiculously tasty! I am dreaming of the day I can try the truffle poutine again and think the next time I will order my own serving and slap away anyone's hand who tries to sneak a taste.Lamb Sliders- have potential but our serving was a bit dry.Ahi Tuna Tartar- Not bad, but I will not order againBread Pudding and Gelato - Delicious We sampled four different cocktails from the house list and hands down our favorite was the Alabama Sling. Will be back soon!Oh! One more thing, our server was fantastic, attentive and friendly. Hostess and bartender acted annoyed they had to talk to customers..as I said, service hit or miss. When all is said and done, 4 stars, visit Perch!!!

Reviews.Author: Miriam A.
Reviews.Content: I came without reservations and just had drinks. The line was long so it must be a favorite for many people. When I got upstairs I was in awe of the view and ambience! I love the live band! I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome.  I had a fantastic meal here and the ambience and location are amazing.  It's not cheap but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Author: Alex G.
Reviews.Content: Great date night location:) Our Waitress was very good. She recommended a "Pink Lady" cocktail which I really liked. The view was spectacular, great wine list, wonderful tuna tartar, crispy duck, heirloom tomato salad. We didn't order the bread pudding but would next time. Roof top bar was also happening with live music, oil portraiture, & jewelry for sale. Will definitely return and refer others!

Reviews.Author: Marvin L.
Reviews.Content: Came here for my best friends 26th birthday.  The place has a great view, and a cool ambiance.  The only reason I am giving it a 3 is because I want to come back to try the food and definitely bring a date here.  This isn't a place where you roll with your boys to try and get "crazy".  Lol.  The food looked good and I'm sure the location would sweep any woman off of her feet so I'm thinking this will change to a 4-5 star review when I come back and don't intend on partying like an animal.  haha.

Reviews.Author: Jeff W.
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend here for our 2 year anniversary after a co-worker recommended it as a nice, classy restaurant with amazing views of downtown. And after having recently moved to this area, I thought it would be a nice place to break us into the downtown lifestyle.First of all, let me stress most importantly: Make a reservation if you want to get into this place in a timely manner. Otherwise, you will wait in one of many huge lines outside like a jackass. Secondly, make sure you bring a good photo ID because the hostess at the front of the line checked both mine and my girlfriends and you would have thought we were being examined by an FBI agent in training (despite the rest of her nowhere near resembled such a description). I've never had my ID scrutinized so closely by anyone at a restaurant or club.Once we were let through the "guard gate", we walked down and entered the lobby entrance of the building which led to an elevator.  Luckily the group of eager to party drunk women in the elevator with us seemed to know where they were going. I remember looking at how elegantly my girlfriend and I were dressed that night, me in suit and tie and her in a cocktail dress, in contrast to the girls were. It looked like they were going to a club. Not what I was expecting.After we arrived at the 13th floor we were greeted by a security guard who directed us to a second elevator across the hall. We got on that and took it to the top floor. Definitely the most exclusive restaurant I've ever been to. Makes you feel real VIP.We got to the top floor and checked into the host stand. I made the reservation online through OpenTable and made sure to also make a very specific note that this was for our anniversary in hopes they would give me a nice table in a good area. The first table choice was not ideal and a bit awkward; it was only a few feet away from a group of lounge seats that connected to the patio outside. Luckily the hostess was kind enough to give me a few other options since I wasn't happy with the first one. We ended up sitting outside on the patio next to the door and patio. The views are definitely the most attractive quality of this place. Servers are dressed casually. Prices are a bit high because it's obvious you're paying for the views and exclusive nature of the location. The good news is is that the drinks are STRONG and well mixed. I highly recommend the Penicillin (famous grouse, lemon juice, agave nectar, ginger liquor). The food was absolutely the best part! We started with the LAMB SLIDERS....highly recommended! My girlfriend got the Mussels as an entree and was very satisfied. I had the Pan Roasted Chicken Supreme. Moist and delicious! Finished off the dinner with Almond cake which is served with tangerines and gelato. Hell yes. My biggest complaints were simply that the bar gets VERY busy and the place quickly becomes much more club/lounge like than a romantic restaurant which I think they attempt to sell themselves as online. It's a great place to bring friends to chill out on the patio...unbeatable views of downtown. But not the most intimate place to bring a date in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Lena K.
Reviews.Content: Perch definitely deserves all the great reviews everyone has posted about it on Yelp.  It truly is a beautiful, trendy & happenin' place to be.  I went there because of a recommendation from a friend and I'm in love!  The view at the top is great!  You have a view of Pershing Square and Downtown LA.  I made reservations using the Yelp app on my phone and it worked out perfectly.  I initially wanted 8pm but since 8pm was taken it gave me other options.  So I opted for 7:30.  The restaurant also called me the day before to remind me of the reservation so they definitely did get it!  Once you get to the building, there is no valet parking so you can easily find parking in one of the paid parking areas.  Easily for me because I was there on a Wednesday but weekends might be harder so give yourself more time.  The parking was just a block away so a quick walk in case you are alone and/or in heels!  The parking was $5.  Once you get to the building the security guard will tell you Perch 13th floor.  Once you get to the 13th floor another guy tells you to go up another elevator to the 15th floor.  The restaurant is on the 15th floor and then on the 16th floor is a quaint rooftop area and a bar.  Next time I'll have to try the rooftop bar. The food was good.  I had the gnocchi and it was tasty!  Once we arrived there was a beautiful jazz pianist playing "Mad World" by the Pet Shop Boys which is one of my favorite songs.  Good pianist!  All in all it was a great evening & if you are going there with a group of gals or just on a date, it's definitely a place to be in Downtown LA!

Reviews.Author: Jethro P.
Reviews.Content: I have made three total ventures to this bar each time for a different occasion. The best time to go is at night to their top floor. The view of the skyline is tremendous, the lighted trees, fire pits, and chic furniture give it a classy vibe that is not in the least pretentious. I sampled some of their menu during a special event. I had no complaints on what little food I had sampled. The drinks are good and moderately priced but the upstairs level has a tiki hut sized bar with only two bartenders so it takes a long period of time to get your drink. This looks like a fabulous brunch spot. I intend to visit and enjoy the warm SoCal weather.

Reviews.Author: Erica G.
Reviews.Content: I've only had drinks here, but you can't go wrong with the ambience and views. Sorry I can't say anything about the food, but I'm giving it 4 stars because it's by far my favorite rooftop in Downtown.

Reviews.Author: Keyla V.
Reviews.Content: I didn't get to eat there but the drinks, decor and view of downtown was great! I love it! going up two elevators was a little scary for all of you scared of that sorta thing..... It's super frenchy and beautiful establishment. Doesn't open until 4 or 5pm I believe. Only thing is drinks and descriptions all have fancy names.... They had another name for bitters.... Kinda felt dumb asking what all the different words meant.... Regardless, the drinks all tasted great! Would def go back and try out the food!

Reviews.Author: Tom C.
Reviews.Content: If you come around sunset time, there's an incredible view outside on the deck around downtown.  Cool place to grab a drink - we got fries as an appetizer, took a bit of time but was decent.

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! What an Epic view of downtown. This place is not a cheap place at all but it is def worth it. We came in a group for a bday party. I didn't eat but I did look at the menu. Some of the items looked good but once again... very expensive but I do want to come back soon and eat here. The drinks are what you  would expect at a place here but I can't tell you enough how awesome of a view you get and the decor of this place. It is a must see. The staff was all very nice too....

Reviews.Author: Cassie H.
Reviews.Content: I feel bad giving this place less than 3 stars, mostly because I don't want to discredit the breathtaking view. I read the other bad experiences below with an open mind and unfortunately fell victim to the allure.I chose this place with a group of friends to celebrate our birthdays, and it ended up being a hot mess after we were told our reservation for 20 people was mysteriously "canceled" the day before. They acted it was our fault they made an obvious mistake (one of the staff admitted this happens a lot) and refused to do anything to accommodate our party. After waiting an hour and a half to see if they could work out a table for us, we were permitted to order food on the upstairs patio which was definitely not worth the ordeal. I had high expectations for the chicken poppers, but they tasted bland and the breading was gummy. The cheese plate and french onion soup were also nothing special. Perch is all about location, location, location, but if you have any other expectations, such as good service, accommodating staff or delicious food, take your business elsewhere. Despite our terrible experience I would still go back to drink in that amazing view - I'd just be sure to eat dinner before going, just in case my reservation disappears.

Reviews.Author: Aditi I.
Reviews.Content: AH ! This place is so cute! It's located at the top of Pershing Square and has an incredible view. It's a lounge so while there's no place to dance its definitely a place to relax and catch up with friends over drinks. Perch has two levels. The top most is just a lounge with comfy chairs and great views all around. Right below it, is the restaurant part of perch. If you walk through the restaurant, there's another open view balcony area with more of the amazing city view. You can go between the two levels via the elevators but I'd recommend the stairs since its just one level and the elevator can be kinda slow. Though there's a bar on both levels, I'd recommend getting drinks in the restaurant level...they have a bigger variety and faster service. All in all, I'd definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a relaxed chill night.

Reviews.Author: Christina T.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't here very long but I was impressed. I haven't been to many bars in DTLA; I didn't even know much of a bar life existed there! Yeah, I pretty much have no social life in LA. Anyway, we were walking from a previous bar to this one and then all of a sudden, we were showing our IDs to some guy in front of a doorway to a lobby. It did not look like a bar or a business at all. It looked like an apartment to me. I was like, "We're here?" So confused. We go in, take our 2 elevator rides up and step into Perch. It looked really classy to me with the door arches and the comfy looking sofas. There was also a fireplace when you stepped outside.I ordered a My Fair Lady, which was really good but really small; it cost me $12! Yeah, this place ain't cheap but you come here for the view, I guess. The view of DTLA is wonderful at night! I only got to see it from one side though (overlooking Pershing Square); didn't get the chance to make it to the other side. My friend was on a time crunch. The lights and the buildings - ah, I love DT at night! I definitely want to come back and spend more time there and have a proper evening at Perch.When we left (around 1115pm) there was there was quite a line to get in. Now it looked like a bar or place of business, not just a random building, haha

Reviews.Author: Jon Y.
Reviews.Content: Rooftop lounge is a-ok. pretty cool if you haven't been but really it's just okay.don't get me wrong...being able to see the la skyline after a drink or two is really nice....but you don't have to come here for this type of enjoyment.

Reviews.Author: monica y.
Reviews.Content: This was the next stop in our dt bar hopping. I would have to say I really like this place. It's got a large bar and tons of servers to get your drink. There's ample space inside to lounge and chat or go outside and enjoy the city view from the roof. They serve food late and people were still eating at midnight and it did look and smell delicious. The signature drinks are good and strong so don't let the size fool you! There were a couple of chi chi looking asian girls sleeping on the couches so it's not a party place but I like the relaxed classy ambiance here. I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Jessica H.
Reviews.Content: first of all we went to this place on a Tuesday night , not sure hoe different it is on the weekends... The food: OMG amaze ! so good we had the rabbit ravioli (I've  never had rabbit ) but that plate won me over although it was a tiny serving.. i also loved the Brussels sprouts which I've also never tasted.. soooo good! I would say both dishes are a must try ! everything else we had was also delicious, very rich in flavor!  The drinks to me were average.. but pricey ! The atmosphere the dining area is So crowded, but i have come to realized that all of LA is like this.a 1920s feel is throughout the entire place from the chairs to the lights and tiles ! really cute ! There was live music and lets not forget the view, it was amazing! On the rooftop was really mellow and a great place to relax after dinner... The NEGATIVE (yes there is a negative ) the bartender on the rooftop was pretty awful as in her drinks sucked and her attitude was even worse ! Our server  was super nice but not very  attentive...  and even worse the poor bus boy! oh god not once but twice he took a drink basically from hands that were not finished and a plate of food ! overall the  experience was great ..definitely  recommend it !

Reviews.Author: Cory V.
Reviews.Content: Drinks are kinda pricey here but they don't skimp out on the alcohol that's for sure.  Wait for the rooftop was like 5 mins on a friday night so it wasn't too bad except for the warm summer night which can get uncomfortable if your dressed up.  Nice view from the top but besides that, nothing special.  Relaxed setting and cool place to hangout with a almost nonexistent dress code, that's pretty much it Don't stay for more then 2 rounds as it can burn a hole in your wallet.

Reviews.Author: ALEX L.
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this simple and brief.  After a year of hearing about this place, I finally made it.  While waiting for friends to arrive, I went to the bar and ordered a martini with olive.  "Sorry, but we're out of olives tonight."  Umm... okay.  Could I have a martini onion, just for the aesthetic (we're downtown, right?)?  "Sorry, we're out of martini onions."  So I order an olive-less, onion-less martini.  And what's the cost?  $15!!!!  My friends arrive and we are seated for dinner.  There are three of us but we're given only one menu.  "Sorry, but for some reason we're short on menus tonight."  Need I say more?

Reviews.Author: Amber O.
Reviews.Content: View is absolutely gorgeous! The food is okay, not the best I've had. We had a reservation which gets you out of waiting in line. You take the elevator to 13th floor then a different elevator to the 15th. Very classy place, will definitely be returning here. The only parking sucks, but that goes with most places in LA.

Reviews.Author: Y H.
Reviews.Content: Ambience: fun and differentHad to take two elevators to go up.Have to make reservations to eat inside. If no reservations, you get to sit on the bar or go outside and eat.Atmosphere of the outside balcony is breathless of downtown, especially when you're out there during sunset.Waiter and bartender was nice and accommodatingI enjoyed eating their chicken & Steak Frites and I tried a few bites of their steak which was good. I'd definitely come back here for drinks and food.

Reviews.Author: Rhonda N.
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooftop!! I have been wanting to go to Perch and it definitely met my expectations. I went on a Saturday night. We got there early at around 8:40 pm so there was no line at all, but later it got pretty busy and the bar reached its maximum capacity so our friends had to wait in line, which was a long wait. Everything was great from the view to the music. We enjoyed the rooftop overlooking Pershing square. The music they played in the bar had a soothing vibe and there was a cool band at the restaurant downstairs that you could see and hear. I had one drink called "My fair lady" and it tasted great! The design is very cozy, elegant and warm. I would love to go back again.

Reviews.Author: M. V.
Reviews.Content: Super chill place with a great ambiance and view.

Reviews.Author: Ally H.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Perch a few times with friends and alone-just to contemplate life while looking at downtown.  I brought my family one evening for a quick meal and the service really turned them off.  I was very disappointed.  I made a reservation and it still took them almost 25 minutes to seat us and they even sat other people before us.  I ended up just grabbing a table and waiting for them to bring us plates and utensils.  So, I guess this is better for small parties...don't bring over 5 people...just my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Daniel S.
Reviews.Content: Returned for Dinner last Sat Night .....but this review is for the hot mess going on all around me........ eesh!  At night this place needs to decide what it wants to be, restaurant & bar or a lounge that also serves food... ....dunno but it was a hot mess all around in the most uncomfortable way !!!  2 stars for the atmosphere

Reviews.Author: G M.
Reviews.Content: Food: sucks.  My filet mignon came in two separate 1" thick pieces shaped as if it was one piece like it suppose to be.   The reduction sauce was just salty.  The skirt steak taste the same with greasy fries, or was that greasy cheesy fries, not sure why they were greasy.  If you want a decent meal, this is NOT the place to go.  If you want views and an experience of the location (which sucks) then you can check it out.  If you just care about good tasting food, this is not it.Service: bad.  the waitress takes your order and bring your drinks.  She does not remove plates or anything from your table.  She will see a finished plate, look at it and walk away.  Someone will serve the dish but does NOT take note none of us have plates and half of us do not have a fork and knife.  So the food sits there until you can grab someone's attention for some utensils.  Oh don't bother saying thank you,  they will just look at you and ignore you, they don't even say you're welcome. Water Service:  that was good, we never had to ask for water.Waitress:  she delivered some drinks with drinks still on her try and she turns quickly bumping into a customer.  It was her fault because she wasn't looking while the guy was going straight.  She let the customer keep apologizing for bumping into her numerous time and she just looked at him and didn't take responsibility for turning without looking or saying not to worry.  she just glared at him and walked away.My suggestion:  Don't go for the food.  If you want to go to experience the location and view have drinks and an appetizer or two and leave.  Not worth our hard earned money nor any money.  I gave two stars because the venue is nice

Reviews.Author: Patty R.
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I came here on Saturday for dinner.  Our waiter was very attentive and our meal was delicious.  The food portions are a bit small, but if you have dessert you'll feel satisfied.  The drinks were a little pricey but delicious nonetheless.  They had live music that stared at 8:00pm that was very good.  The signer has a beautiful voice and the type of music they played just added to the romantic ambiance.Had a great time and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Alessandra S.
Reviews.Content: Perch is located on Hill Street in DTLA.  You have to pull up to valet.  You then make your way to the 15th floor where you feel like you've entered a whole new world.  The crowd is clean and sophisticated.  Men wearing sports coats and pea coats and the ladies fashionably and tastefully dressed. They have fire pits and heat lamps to keep you warm as you sit on top of the 15th floor staring down at Pershing Square and enjoying the beautiful skyline.  I absolutely love this place and will take my friends there.  The drinks are devious and I highly recommend to anyone looking for a new place to hangout.

Reviews.Author: Richard N.
Reviews.Content: I won't fill this with comments on the service, food or atmosphere. Everyone with similar ratings as mine have it spot on. I do have one question though and that is who is the idiot that ordered the furniture in this place? I am six feet tall, average build but sliding my chair AND legs under the table wasn't happening comfortably! The table was probably six inches shorter than a table should be and the chairs were standard so your legs were smashed into the bottom of the table! Wonder if any one who works here ever tried sitting at one of their tables!

Reviews.Author: Steve M.
Reviews.Content: I will review the food mainly as I dont care much about a sausage-fest of men holding a drink in their hand and standing around doing absolutely nothing.Our server was Natasha. She was very nice and accomodating, it was insanely packed. Recession obviously skipped this block, wooow. People blowing money like blowing $100-billz with tissue paper. At 8pm! So packed we waited 1 hour AFTER our reservation time to get to a dinner table. The live band is very annoying and unappeasing to the eye.Views are nice, the select beers on the menu on draft are good as well as the "girly" drinks.Appetizzies are seriously off da hook. Buffalo spiced frog legs, fried oysters, melted brie in crispy bread, cumin spiced sliders, mussels, were so good we ordered them over and over. Since our meals were already ordered but completely unnecessary, had to eat them. This is where it went from 5 to 4 stars. I was ready to annoint the joint a full 5 star, until main courses arrived. I had scallops with artichoke risotto, is was average at best; wifey had the boulabaisse-very salty and nothing special. Bottom line: come for appetizers, gobble them up, enjoy the views, GTF out of there b4 10pm it gets insanely crowded. Crowd is about 40% asian, 30% white, 30% queer. Just sayin FYI not hatin.The upper-upper-upstairs there is an overpriced bar (25.00 for a double black label yowzers) and a tranny dressed in white was even picked up real quick.Had to grease the bouncer 20/couple to get access to the top-top-top deck.It felt like a great build-up of sex, and then at the end, very mellowdramatic finish of a semi-orgasm with very average main dish. But one of the best appetizzy places I have ever eaten at. Park valet or do like I did right across $6 bucks not bad self park.Dont care much for deserts except anything with chocolate in it, and in this dept. they are very limited menu-wise as well.

Reviews.Author: Kris D.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the second time on Tues night before 4th of July and it was a horrible experience! Because of this, I am dropping 4 starts to 2 stars. We were seated at the bar and we still had to wait at a minimum of 30 minutes to get our drinks each time. The bartenders were randomly choosing people; there was no particular order. Also, there is a line to go to the rooftop! I waited for 20 minutes, people were leaving but they weren't letting anyone in! Too much hype for Perch. Please go earlier in the night and choose a weekday if you want to check the place out!

Reviews.Author: Joanne T.
Reviews.Content: View is amazing! 3.5 stars for me. I loved the mojito! Could barely taste the alkie, which can be bad for you, of course. The bartender even tasted it with a straw before giving it to me to make sure it was good enough. I like that kind of extra touch. Con - very crowded on a Friday night. All the outdoor seating was taken up and we had to stand most of the night. Luckily, we found an empty table near the fireplace and just sat for the rest of the night. Kind of an older crowd. Good place to chill and relax, but definitely not a place to come party at. Parking was only $6 across the street, so everything was convenient. It was kind of weird to wait in line outside on the sidewalk for a bar, but luckily we didn't have to wait long.

Reviews.Author: Hal T.
Reviews.Content: I went to a birthday party here last night.  The setting is great of course, but any fancy place on top of downtown LA with this view would be pretty great.  I would say that that is the main selling point.  If you want this, you will love this place.Drinks are expensive - $12 for a cocktail.  I ordered a French 76 (a French 75 with vodka instead of gin) and the bartender made a vodka version of another drink called French ___ that was on the menu (nothing like the drink I ordered).  I didn't complain, but then gave the following bartender detailed instructions on how to make the drink and it was made correctly. But really, for the prices and fancy nature of the joint, know your drinks.  Also everyone in our party who ordered wine (many different reds) did not like what they got.  (This is actually why I got a cocktail in the first place, because I was told by multiple people that the wine was underwhelming.) Basically I think this places is a bit junior, for 20-somethings that want to feel grownup and 30-something.  By 30, you wil be disappointed that you cannot order a decent glass of wine.  What is a view without a decent glass of wine?

Reviews.Author: Francesca H.
Reviews.Content: Went here last night for HH as the first stop out.I love it! It's really nicely done, the service was good, it was great for conversation, very cool, airy rooftop vibe.  I will definitely return!!  The crowd was mixed in ages and styles - after-work business gatherings, friend gatherings, downtown locals.   The view is grand yet somehow intimate.Appetizers have nice presentation and are well prepared.Only thing is that I wish Happy Hour lasted until 7:30 for us people who do not work downtown (parking and traffic issues, etc.)God I love me some downtown these days...

Reviews.Author: Lea C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing views!!! I go for that alone.We had a super-friendly waiter who gave us the low down on the upcoming renaissance of downtown. I think his name was Jason (?).Drink and beer selection are okay, but I would drink anything with that view.I have only had the chef's spicy sweet herbed mixed nuts and they were awesome. Add it to the list of things I want to try and make, the list that only gets longer for some reason. I would like to go there for dinner one of these times, esp. for bone marrow (yum)

Reviews.Author: Andrea G.
Reviews.Content: Cute place.  Meh everything else.Came here on a date (this is the theme of all the reviews I'm writing today), great views, fun decor, nice to have a new rooftop place to go.  Ordered the cheese plate, it was good, though the waitress didn't bother to mention what was what.  I got the risotto, my date had the lamb burger.  The risotto was good, not great, but I kept eating it because my date had the gall to finish maybe 1/3 of his burger and talk about how he wasn't much of an eater.  I knew at that point I wouldn't be seeing him again, but I still accepted his offer to go get drinks at the bar area on the actual roof.  The chairs and fire pits and whatnot looked really cozy, alas they were all occupied (or maybe for the best, as I really did not want to get cozy with this guy).  My chardonnay was probably fine, but I was busy trying to drink it as quickly as possible and get out of there.Would come back for roof drinks with actual friends.  Not so much for the food.

Reviews.Author: Patrick M.
Reviews.Content: Just barely a 4 star, but very good.  Only French wine...  Steak Frits very good.  Cheese good. Lamb sliders good.Probably would go here again, but not close to work and there are so many good places down town.  You should give this place a try.

Reviews.Author: Jamie C.
Reviews.Content: Love the champagne cocktails at happy hour! Yes, it is pricey, but I'm not sure why people are surprised; the decor screams fancy. Get over it people--this isn't a local pub to unwind at with a Bud Light.  Just shut up and when you are in the mood, dress up, venture on over here and count on spending some money.

Reviews.Author: R E.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location and view... but food is very plain, and overpriced at that. And it's not very authentically prepared.Service is friendly but terribly slow. I thought maybe it'd get better once they've been open for a while, but it's been almost a year, been here many times, and things haven't improved.With such a great location, you'd think they'd put in some money into the furnishings, but it's a restaurant filled with patio furniture and old couches. I think they've tried to make it casual, but visually, it's not working too well. Too bad, I had such high hopes for the place, since it's close by.I live in the area, and the rooftop is noisy. The music can be heard from our apartment, it's loud and annoying! Does it need to be?

Reviews.Author: Jill and Ying J.
Reviews.Content: Caveat: we only came for drinks, so our experience may be a bit skewed.This place may be the next big thing in downtown LA.  We got here at 10 on a Saturday night, and waited about an hr in the line, with the usual LA crowd and douchy bouncers.  Apparently if you have a dinner reservation you avoid the line, so definitely will keep that in mind.  The line def creates the right amount of sensationalist anticipation.Overall, the rooftop bar was cool.  However, the whole idea of artificially created elitism/segregation-by-status totally pervades here.  There's a line to get into the restaurant.  Then there's another line to get to the 16th fl (restaurant and bar for the plebians are on the 15th).  Each guarded by overly macho bouncers.  Sure, the view is cool, and certainly worth a visit, but even the Standard doesn't have this kinda rigid segregation.  Just let us up to the 16th floor!Drinks were fine, with the usual players on tap.  Our recommendations? Come for dinner and skip out before the 'commoners' come for drinks.

Reviews.Author: Ashveen S.
Reviews.Content: The ambiance and view at this place is awesome! Me and my girlfriends had just gotten back from New York and wanted to do something rooftop because we were missing NYC. This definitely did the trick! I recommend making reservations like we did because there was a huge wait. You have to take the elevator up to the restaurant. The food was also delcious. We ordered a carafe or sangria and a bottle of champagne with our brunch. Will be going back here soon.

Reviews.Author: Gary S.
Reviews.Content: Went for a business dinner and had a great time. The food and drinks were all very good. We sat out in the back corner which was very nice and private but it was a very cold night even with the heat lamps it was a bit too cold. The view of the city lights was fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Nami C.
Reviews.Content: 16th flooramazing view~chill, relaxing, and fun-drinks are kinda pricey-rooftop lounge kinda small15th floor is the resturant area

Reviews.Author: Kam G.
Reviews.Content: Came in to type away. Great service by all staff, especially Jordan. Quick tip: bring your own bottle for a small corkage.

Reviews.Author: malisa c.
Reviews.Content: So this is the third time I've been here. I requested to be seated next to the heater since it was a bit chilly out. The host told me that she can try her best but it has to be equally distributed with all the other customers there, and said she would seat me inside if I think it's too chilly. I said ok, so I see a FEW tables opened (maybe about 7 tables) and for some reason she seats us all the way in the back. There were empty tables with heaters turned on and I did not understand why she sat us all the way in the back, especially if I made reservations - I'm sorry but all 7 tables cannot be reserved!!! And to add on to that, the area we were seated at seemed to be the 'minority' (asian, black-american, hispanic) area - if that's how you treat your customers then that's awful. I love the vibe and food here, but the customer service here needs to change. Sorry but not sorry, bumping my rating down to a 2. No wonder their rating is a 3.5.

Reviews.Author: Todd W.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for views and atmosphere. 3 stars for the pretty average food, thus the overall 4 star rating. Average food aside, I really liked this place and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Tania S.
Reviews.Content: Great food and view of the city.  Elevator up to the restaurant is a bit I convenient.  Will love to try it for brunch some time.

Reviews.Author: Sako A.
Reviews.Content: I came her for the first time about a week ago with some friends from out of town.Very cool place to grab some drinks and some appetizers. Awesome views of downtown.  Food was Ok.  Wouldn't come here just for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Ozzie L.
Reviews.Content: If ya got some money to blow in L.A. come to Perch. The views are nice as should be on a rooftop but I really enjoyed the live jazz band and all the trees and plants they added. Food was pretty good but pricey in my opinion. Tip: make sure you call and make a reservation, especially if you want to sit outside. I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Natasha K.
Reviews.Content: What attracted me to this DTLA niche was the unimpeded topside lounge with an unbelievably ridiculous view (semi-wrap-around on a starry night...oh word!). I'd say it's worth the travel up 16 floors in a beautiful historic building. Got a recommendation for this spot from a friend... And who would have known there would be a place like this in the middle of LA overlooking Pershing Square? Quite a pleasant atmosphere in a French inspired inclusive rooftop bistro with the most random Angeleno suitors. The drinks were pretty strong and I love that they have Lindemans Framboise Lambic, no Kriek though. I've asked a few patrons how the food was and nobody seemed to admire their table d'hôte, but I'll definitely have to return and try it out myself. Did I mention they offer the Hennessey Paradiso at $170? I am a Le Cognac kind of gal.

Reviews.Author: Pleasure V.
Reviews.Content: Wow the food here sucks. I had hoped that their disappointing menu was the byproduct of a hasty opening but it's been over a year and they are still serving the same crap. Such a shame for such a gorgeous venue.

Reviews.Author: Karen K.
Reviews.Content: Love the view here! The have a good happy hour hence I've only been here twice for that. I would love to stay when its dark to check out the view. The drinks are really strong. The food here is good too. I'll definitely come back at night in the summer.

Reviews.Author: Joyce T.
Reviews.Content: I really don't think that line is worth it. We came during happy hour when there was no line. Excellent food menu, but the fries (soggy mess) and bruschetta are not good. Mediocre at best. Sitting outside is nice, but the novelty is not worth the wait and it doesn't make up for bad food.

Reviews.Author: Team B.
Reviews.Content: I had the saturday morrning brunch at Perch on Saturday, Feb. 1st to celebrate my 14 yr. old step-daughter's birthday. The weather was terrific, a band played New Orleans Ragtime while we ate & our waitress even had the group sing Happy Birthday. The baked brie, truffle fries, beet salad & eggs benedict were all excellent. But The drinks are ALL weak, the food gets cold (if you eat outside) and Even though this was my 2nd brunch they failed to serve our drinks during our meal and provide salt & pepper as requested. Sigh. Almost perfect. Almost.

Reviews.Author: christy l.
Reviews.Content: LOOOOVE this place!!! Wonderful food,drinks,LIVE MUSIC,and sights all around!!! Had an mazing B-day here with fam and friends. Be sure to book in advance and ask for outdoor seating(bring a jacket)!

Reviews.Author: LA l.
Reviews.Content: the view is phenomenal!!! We all know that!. However, the food and SERVICE, or the lack there of, are mediocre. Go for the view oh and the $20 a pitcher Sunday sangria and the $1 oyster special is great too! Otherwise, it was eh.

Reviews.Author: Natalia C.
Reviews.Content: The rooftop is beautiful.The drinks so-so.Having to make reservations far in advance stinks.THe food was okay - truffle fries good, ahi tuna so-so, steak frites good but overpriced. If you are going to go here, I recommend grab a drink a couple appetizers and be on your way.

Reviews.Author: Gie R.
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 13.When: Weekend BrunchParking: Paid, lot either across or next to the buildingFor a fairly big group, reservation is of course highly recommended.The maximum for a reservation is 12. Over this number, it is best to coordinate with their event director via email.The event director and her team were really wonderful in making the arrangements for our party.  Food:  Crabcakes Benedict and French Toast (creative, yet simple) were a hit among our groupService: great - friendly, helpful, and efficientAtmosphere: amazing view obviously and the live music was awesome; it was bossa nova at the time we went

Reviews.Author: Haley W.
Reviews.Content: The aesthetics are amazing!   One of the best views in town.However the food ehh... not anything to write home about. The rolls are just ... rolls.  The olive tapenade was sweet, and not a good salty olive taste. Frogs legs - pretty average... just lightly battered and fried.  Good juiciness but not a lot of flavor.The duck and l'orange sandwiches.  - Duck was exceptionally bland and dry, and the melba toasts looked like wonder bread toasted w/ an abundance of sweet jelly on it.  It was topped w/ slivers of bacon and spicy greens which didn't have a lot of flavor.  The whole things was just coated in the sweet orange marmalade.  Pot de creme - Kind of a rich chocolate pudding w/ an out of the can cherry compote on top.  Ehh. Church and States is MUCH better. Bone marrow however was pretty fabulous! The wine good, and the service was great.  I'll try it again and order a main entree, but over all I just wasn't wowed.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Dustin A.
Reviews.Content: I feel like the hype didnt match the goods. The cheap tacky decor drove me nuts the whole time I was there. I would only go again for a weekday happy hour maybe. JUST BECAUSE ITS ON A ROOFTOP DOESNT MAKE IT DEVINE!

Reviews.Author: Walid A.
Reviews.Content: They are only doing well because of the spectacular view. However other places in downtown can offer a better view and I have a feeling more places will be popping up soon. Truth is the view is spectacular, the ambience is great, the food portions are embarrassingly small, and the prices are too high for what they are giving you. If you intend on getting dinner there, have a bite to eat at home first. I asked our waiter for some bread. I asked for bread because the over priced plate of food hardly satisfied my hunger. The waiter ask exactly how many pieces of bread I wanted. I asked for a couple pieces and I got exactly that! Just leave the damn basket at our table please.I feel the minute another competitor opens up, this place will suffer greatly. They don't know if they should be high end or common place. I vote NOT for high-end. The food is not that good. They are charging too much for the amount of food they give you and the quality of the items presented. Just go for wine and the view. Eat else where.

Reviews.Author: Linda L.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I decided to get a few drinks here on a Friday night, they had been raving about this all week, so I was beyond excited. The place is absolutely BEAUTIFUL and has an amazing view. The food and drinks were EXCEPTIONAL...we had the fried brie with cranberry sauce, beignets, and the Marie Antoinette drink (Loved the  jalapeño in it).Downside: the wait and serve....we waited 40 minutes for the fried brie and another round of drinks, which was alright because we were playing catch up. Once our server realized we had been waiting for so long...we got a round of drinks, the fried brie and beignets on the house! Talks about a wonderful turn of events. Its definitely a place to check out.

Reviews.Author: krys c.
Reviews.Content: Go here for the view, and maybe some drinks. If you decide to order any actual food, you will be very disappointed! Over priced, greasy, mediocre bar food. What happened to the croque madam sliders others raved about? No Courdon Blue? I have a feeling that Perch lost their previous chef, because most of the exciting things others have posted no longer exist on their menu. The frog legs, which they actually kept, have a completely different presentation than what I've seen in photos.We ordered frog legs, lamb sliders, and fries. Between the two of us, not a single dish was finished--not even the French fries! Nothing tasted fresh, and we both left feeling ill from the food. McDonalds would have been a more satisfying choice, especially after comparing the price!The ambiance, bartenders, and vibe are totally cool and laid back. We'll come back for drinks and the view maybe, but that's absolutely it.

Reviews.Author: Laura S.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views and ambiance! I walked through the restaurant and then went upstairs to the roof top bar. There is 1 elevator so save some time and just take the stairs. The bar is cute and has lots of seating. There are a lot of heat lamps but when it's cold, it's cold. It doesn't matter if there are heat lamps or not. The crowd is pretty mixed and hip! Most of them look like they are straight out of an Anthropologie or Urban Outfitters catalog.Also, the staff here was so friendly it was almost weird. Often security is busy taking their job so seriously they forget to smile but these guys were awesome!

Reviews.Author: Kate Z.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Friday night around 6-ish  w/ a reservation but actually really didn't need one (but by the time we left around 830-ish it was quite crowded).  It had a nice view of DTLA & really laid back atmosphere w/ the fireplace & patio couches.  Overall, good place to spend a couple of hours after work before you head out to dinner later on in the evening.Only cocktail I ordered was the French 64 (54?? can't remember which one it was) because I enjoyed my first one so much I just kept ordering that for next 2 hours.  Tried the royals some of my friends got & they were okay as well.  Quite limited options for beer on tap.-Frog Legs were yum!!! I normally LOVE frog legs but didn't think I would like them smothered in a hot sauce usually used on chicken but it was still good.-Fried Brie was also very good. MMMMMMMMM how can brie ever be bad??? It can't.-Fries were just fries. *shrugs*

Reviews.Author: Kellie M.
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an awesome place for drinks! Nice happy hour menu. Beautiful views off the rooftop. Service was perfect. My tip is to go during the week and get there when they open if you can. Have drinks on the roof and stay for dinner if you want to blow some cash. Would be a great place to take someone visiting from out of town.

Reviews.Author: Monica R.
Reviews.Content: The views are amazing! The drinks are nothing to write home about and very expensive for a tiny glass. They need another bar and more bartenders. If you're lucky to get a seat, take it. Otherwise, standing up all night is not fun. It's silly that you have to make reservations for a bar. A restaurant, I understand...but what if you're just having a drink? How are you supposed to know what bar you want to go to? The line was long and if my friends and I didn't have a RSVP, I would not have waited. When I left, I wanted to yell out, "It's not worth it - you still have time to hit up another bar".But......since then, I went there for dinner and was very impressed. The food is great! I just suggest that you don't go without a RSVP - even for a drink.

Reviews.Author: Jenny H.
Reviews.Content: What? How can this have 5 stars? When I went there a bartender sprayed me with liquid sugar, it was in my hair, all over my jacket, and no one helped. I tried to wash it out, no avail, I had work after that and had to go with sticky disgusting hair. It was insane, then, I talked to a manager who did nothing. Later that night I spent it over the toilet hurling from food poisoning. That was around 2am, so I missed an hour of my work, sucky sucky. This place sucked, service was slow and nonexistant, the food was OK at BEST and I puked it all out later.

Reviews.Author: Cathy Z.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of rooftop bars so I might be a bit biased. The view here is pretty nice at night and I enjoy having a drink or two here. I've had dinner here once and thought that the food was pretty good but nothing memorable/impressive. I love that there is a live band playing here.

Reviews.Author: Cobey C.
Reviews.Content: So I finally made it to Perch.  Been wanting to come here for a minute now.  Was it worth the hype, possibly, it's hard to tell considering I didn't get up to the rooftop.  With that being said, based on the lower half of the restaurant I would give it a good 3-3.5 starts.  My friends and I went on Saturday night.  Got there at around 10:30 to a line.  Waited about 15 minutes, then got into to a sparsely crowded restaurant.  Due to unforeseen circumstances, aka a friend forgetting ID, we ended up just hanging out in the bar, while we waited for her. Great cocktail menu, I got a My Fair Lady, which was great.  Drinks were on the pricey side.  Different selection of beers, that looked awesome.  Loved the decor, 1920s French.  The space itself was on the smaller side, but it wasn't too crowded so it was nice and chill.We would have gone to the roof, if it hadn't been for the hour wait in the stairwell.  It didn't really seem worth it, considering there was a patio on the 13th floor that still offered a pretty sweet view.  Heat lamps and ample seating made it even better.  Will have to come back and see the roof!

Reviews.Author: Hilda J.
Reviews.Content: Great food...GREAT DRINKS!!!! love the few......Tuesday nite Jazz just blends right in with city....

Reviews.Author: Mae L.
Reviews.Content: I need to update my review. We came a few weeks ago for our friends birthday and the experience was the polar opposite of my first time at Perch. First of all, the douchebag manager on duty had the WORST attitude ever. He got upset that 3 separate tables were there to celebrate our friends birthday. WHY DID HE CARE? Then the service was awful and sloooooooow and finally, our waiter kept messing up our check. Definitely will not be coming back. And if anyone from Perch management is reading this, I cant recall the douchebag managers name but he was working Friday night, March 1st and he has blonde hair. Totally rude jerk with NO sense of customer service.

Reviews.Author: Shirlene V.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite brunch spot. Live jazz, some mimosas and good service. The food is ok. The French toast is what I recommend.

Reviews.Author: Dane S.
Reviews.Content: Great views, live band, delicious food and a fancy bar.  Will visit again whenever possible!

Reviews.Author: Holly F.
Reviews.Content: i totally love this place. i feel like i'm in a different era when i walk in here.must have a reservation for dinner - the place gets busy.great food and drinks. service could have been better, but it was a saturday night so i'll give them a break.pricy, but worth it. i will return often!

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: Views of downtown LA aren't as spectacular as the Standard but I'd rather come here because the crowd and atmosphere are more laid back.  There's a restaurant down below that looked great- will have to come back again to try their menu.

Reviews.Author: Cristina M.
Reviews.Content: went here for my birthday and was bummed to see they took the swordfish off the menu, twas ON POINT! the service isn't too bad here and the live jazz on the rooftop was all i could ask for!! my fav drinks: writers block & french maid. the pork appetizer was the bomb as well as the mussels. its a beautiful beautiful view of the city as sunset hits, a highly recommended spot

Reviews.Author: Crystal M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. Best french toast I ever had. An amazing view of the city. I highly recommend for brunch.

Reviews.Author: Shaunice C.
Reviews.Content: Superb Brunch!!!! Ambiance is fantastic, drinks and food are incredibly reasonable AND the executive chef was a contestant on TOP CHEF!!!!! He was super nice and took a few pics with my friends and I

Reviews.Author: Alen G.
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful setting and great drinks, by arriving there the hostess was unfriendly argumentative and rude, i made reservation and mentioned i am taking my 12 year old son with me and was not told that he can't stay after 9:30 pm, so when we got there she said we can eat and leave immediately But Dwight the manager I am assuming jumped in helped us and gave an excellent costumer service, and made our stay very pleasant, if it wasn't for him our anniversary dinner would have been ruined, thanks Dwight. see you soon, will for sure go back.

Reviews.Author: Justin D.
Reviews.Content: This review is about a year old. It has been languishing on the internet due to the Yelp apps inability to post reviews from the phone. Since the first encounter, described below, we have returned several time and always enjoyed the opportunity.First of all: Loved it!!! Second, I like to get a little high. I reluctantly invited my girlfriend to the Standard rooftop for a sunset cocktail, as we had just gotten back from NY, spring had sprung across America, daylight savings was allowing us sunshine until nearly 8pm AND we were both working downtown that day. Alas, when we arrived around 5, there was a line of hoochies in micro-minis thronged around the entrance. Apparently, YACHT, were playing in two hours, so the rooftop was closed until then. (Sidebar: I remember first hearing YACHT about 5 years ago and wondering why anyone would want to be mercilessly subjected to these ennui-inspiring tones. So, it was particularly disappointing to have my evening curtailed by such an unfortunate and lame obstacle.)At any rate, we left for the "newly" opened Perch, which is the best rooftop bar in downtown, by far. The cocktail program is excellent. The Janis Joplin-inspired bartender we had was super cool. Perfectly making both on and off menu drinks, offering wine samples, and making drink and food suggestions, all while efficiently handling food orders and the bills for a very crowded room. We chose to sit at the bar, as the outside seating was not suitable and we weren't going to stay long enough to be seated in the dining area. We had an array of appetizers and even a second round of oysters. All were delicious. Paired with the cocktails, we had a lovely experience. I have long tried to be a connoisseur of rooftop dining or imbibing destinations downtown. As a small boy, my Aunt played piano in the spinning bar at the Bonaventure. To this day, I love going up there for a spin, but the drinks are very expensive and very bad. When I lived on 12th St, I'd pop in to Windows for a drink and even had a lackluster meal there. The view was great, to the West. But it wasn't very fun. And when AT&T gutted the space, there was only the Standard.  I was delighted when the Standard opened. There was a good month before it was overrun with d-bags and teens learning how to drink and swim. But that was 10 years ago. I still love to go there, on a weeknight or late afternoon, but it's usually amateur hour for our bridge and tunnel crowd up there. Takami is a view restaurant, not quite on the rooftop, but it has delicious Japanese fusion and adequate drinks. But the view is not particularly impressive and the design doesn't make you aware of the elevation, for some reason. So, I can never tell if I'm high or not. So, it's wonderful to find Perch, with an expansive view, intimate space, excellent food and delicious cocktails. It attracts both attorneys and hipsters, but the mix is neither excessively "office-y" like the Edison, nor the Spring Break aesthetic of the Standard. It's wonderful to finally have an excellent and romantic restaurant to supplement Takami in the good food and drinks at a higher elevation category. I can only pray that Johnny Depp will sell off his floor in the most beautiful bldg downtown. Until then, I'll be getting high at Perch.

Reviews.Author: Lana G.
Reviews.Content: Good atmosphere, nice view, nice place.  Good food

Reviews.Author: Denise C.
Reviews.Content: Perch is a welcome addition to downtown LA. The ambiance is practically perfection, with amazing views of the city, cozy seating areas, fire pits, and tasteful lighting, it feels upscale without being pretentious. The music is mellow without being sleepy. The service was great. (Thanks, Smith!) Unfortunately, there was no "specialty" cocktail service last night, so I was unable to try the much-raved about spicy jalapeno drink, but the prices were very reasonable, with a great bottle of Malbec at slightly over $30. The reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the menu needs some adjusting. The comfy couches aren't set up for formal fine dining, so the menu should reflect that, and offer plates for sharing that won't be too messy, like cheeses, french fries, etc. (I would love the same menu from The Must!) I was there with a large group but there weren't enough appetizer items on the menu for sharing. Based on this, I would recommend going for cocktails instead of dinner.

Reviews.Author: Clark W.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for setting3 stars for service1 star for value/qualityI enjoyed my first trip to Perch.  Great setting, great decor!Very mediocre food.  I go out for food quality more than drink quality, so there's a long way to go here.  (hint: rolls brought to table should be warmed).I'm looking forward to an expanded menu (I hear they're going to), since I'm not keen on things like frogs legs.  Give me some good comfort fare.Huge potential here - let's just hope it doesn't become the bridge & tunnel crowd and the locals will be able to really enjoy it without having to fight Ed Hardy t-shirts to get to the bar.

Reviews.Author: Eduardo V.
Reviews.Content: The Good:WOW the view here is amazing. The first floor is gorgeous but it looks like you have to have reservations. The second floor is a nice spot to unwind / reevaluate your life. Very romantic and shows you the charm that LA has to offer but goes unseen from ground level.The Bad:While its considered a classy place and charges like one, you can easily see where they cut corners. It looks like they spent all their money on the structure, architecture and furnishing the first floor then ran out of money for the rest. There is a weird stair case leading up to the place that is unfinished, gives you that old feeling like you're lost but been here before. It made me feel a little uncomfortable but then walking into the jaw dropping place catches you off guard and brings you back to life. Second floor has garage sale lawn furniture (Walmart stuff looks better), its comfortable but doesn't look like it belongs.I would have stayed and spent all my drinking money if they had any kind of live music upstairs.

Reviews.Author: Linda C.
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Gorgeous View -Atmosphere/Vibe/Diversity -strong, yet tasty drinks-Heat Lamps outside-cheap $5 parking lot on the corner (rare at a hot spot in downtown la)Cons:-FOOD.Cordon Bleu Poppers- kind of dry, but tastyDuck, Duck, Goose - my girlfriends said it was goodPetite Croque Madam - This was decent and probably the best food we ordered of the 5 dishesPork Confit Cassulet - Good portion since it's an entree, but very saltyRoasted Bone Marrow - utter disappointment. If you want delicious bone marrow, go to "Animal"

Reviews.Author: Kenza S.
Reviews.Content: The view is amazing ...The food is ok.The service isn't.The rabbit rillettes were tasty.The cordon bleu tasted nice but too small.A cheese plate is always a good choice ! The fondue, was ok, but the bread was some old croutons :( I will go back for the Sunset during the week.Tip : make a dinner reservation to avoid waiting on line, even on Friday night :)

Reviews.Author: Katy D.
Reviews.Content: Come here for the drinks and the view. Don't come for the food.I've been here a few times for late night drinks with friends. Love the ambiance, and the specialty drinks are very yummy. Try the My Fair Lady (their take on a cosmo) or a Raspberry Royal (champagne with raspberry liqueur). This week, I finally had a chance to go to dinner there last night, and I will say I was very unimpressed. We had their cheese plate, which was just ok. I ordered their Chilean seabass which was tasteless, and my date had their steak which I had a bite of -- salty and chewy. For the price tag, i was expecting a lot more. Also the service was not up to par, not sure if our waitress just had too many tables or what, but we did not see her enough and our drinks took way too long to come out.So like I said, it's a beautiful and great place to go for drinks, but don't go there for dinner! If it wasn't for the food I would give it four stars. But alas, it only deserves three.

Reviews.Author: Dushyant S.
Reviews.Content: Its a great place in downtown. They also have dining area.Gives a open area view of downtown LA. 2 floors.Good for a date.Downtown LA residents get in a special line, and it is shorter.Free entry.Reasonable drink prices.

Reviews.Author: Elliott D.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite spots in LA.  I love taking people here who have never been.

Reviews.Author: Glenn J.
Reviews.Content: Total chill place for a cocktail. Got there at 6 as the roof top opened up. Was disappointed no food service on the roof. The drinks were expensive but you get a quality alcohol and a generous pour. The views from the rooftop are great. We ventured down stairs for a couple of appetizers. We didn't have a reservation, without one you can only sit at the bar. We managed to grab a table and discovered we would have to give it up in an hour. Other than that the place was great, appetizers were tasty also.  Would like to go back for dinner sometime.

Reviews.Author: Anita D.
Reviews.Content: We came here for a Saturday night dinner and fun. Perch has a beautiful view and it is really a cool place, except you need fabulous weather to feel good. When we visited it was windy, all the sides were pulled down blocking the view, so we had to go outside to look at the view, which was very inconvenient. We ordered steak, mussels and scallops. The food had no issues, it was pretty good, but not something special. But what is special is the pricing. I am used to high end restaurants but this one is over priced. The reason is, because the food is so average and even how they serve it is not appealing. The only thing which blew my mind were the cocktails, they were very unique and good. Wish this place can improve on their menu.

Reviews.Author: Andrea G.
Reviews.Content: Perch is a great place to bring a date. A romantic place to go. I love the roof top! The view is beautiful. Great food and drinks. Its pricy but worth it. I've always had a great time there and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to a friend!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan R.
Reviews.Content: I'm going to be honest. The first thing I noticed walking into Perch were all the bartenders; they were so beautiful! Of course I was excited to order a drink. My friend had wine, I had a cocktail, both were enjoyable. When you're drink is served by great eye candy, things just seem to taste better.The place was crowded, but not overbearingly, so finding a seat at the bar was not very difficult. We sat and had a great chat, surrounded be a group of people whom I would categorize as young professionals, and over all, interesting. I wish I had mingled more because everyone seemed interesting. Being surrounded by Downtown on a Summer night is everything.  Definitely want to be back, especially for Sunday Brunch!Maybe the bartenders are just as great if not better!

Reviews.Author: Mohammad Q.
Reviews.Content: I went there beginning of January. Honestly, the ambiance and the view are really nice but the food is not so great.

Reviews.Author: Chandra L.
Reviews.Content: Great location, food's alright.

Reviews.Author: Charlyne A.
Reviews.Content: Great young vibe, even better view of the city. Beautiful architecture. Also good for meeting people. Plenty of rooftop space. I didn't have any proper food here expect for some fried stuff. Can't ever really go wrong with fried anything.

Reviews.Author: Kavita M.
Reviews.Content: Perch is a lovely bar with an even lovelier view. The absolute best time to come here is early evening, between 4-6pm depending on the time of year to watch the sunset. The drinks are excellent, though a little pricey. )That's another reason to come here during happy hour times.)I gave it 3 stars because if you happen to come here past 9 PM on a Friday or Saturday night, you will have to wait in long line that does not move in order to get in the elevator to take you upstairs. It can be very frustrating, especially when there is a large group ahead of you and cars keep pulling up with more  and more of their friends getting out and cutting you in line! Also, by the time we made it upstairs, we realized that we really wanted to go to the second level, only to find out that we needed to wait in ANOTHER LINE to get into another elevator to take us there. Geez. I would stick to happy hour at this place to avoid all this.

Reviews.Author: Ruth-Anne Y.
Reviews.Content: After making a reservation for 6:15, I received a called at 6:13 saying their facility was under building maintenance. The hostess suggested moving the reservation for a few hours or even waiting until the next day?! I was more than upset having already arrived to the valet area. Who suggests moving a reservation two minutes before to the next day? I felt that suggestion was completely ridiculous and unprofessional. Disgruntled and annoyed, I changed the time to 8:15 pm.I ordered the salmon and one of their drinks and also had a Creme brûlée. I have to say the food was delicious but ridiculously overpriced. They only comped for one drink after having pushed the reservation back which I also felt was bogus. Whilst eating there was a pretty decent live band playing covers. After dinner, I decided to check out the second floor where the lounge portion consisted of a small bar, a few lounge chairs, and a decent view of the city. Honestly though, I wasn't impressed and shortly after had to take the stairs down (their elevator was out of commission) and then take another elevator into yet another elevator to finally get out of the overrated place. I don't think I would go back. There was nothing really novel about this place.

Reviews.Author: Emily A.
Reviews.Content: Went here when I was in LA and it was wonderful. It was cold out side and they sat my friends and I by the fire place. Unfortunately it started raining but the staff was so quick to offer us seats inside or umbrella stands over our table. We stayed outside and sure enough the rain stopped and we enjoyed our brunch. I got the salmon benedict and my boyfriend had the burger. Both were wonderful! I really enjoyed my visit!

Reviews.Author: Allen E.
Reviews.Content: SUNDAY BRUNCH: I was blown away by this restaurant. Not only is the view amazing, but they have amazing food to back it up. The service was exquisite everyone is dressed nice and is very friendly. The entire restaurant is decorated beautifully. There was not one thing wrong with this place! I will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Author: Cind Y.
Reviews.Content: Kind of small, but nice view, and no cover charge!

Reviews.Author: Judy N.
Reviews.Content: My friend decided to bring me to Perch on this past Monday which happens to also be Memorial Day. This was the third stop of the night for drinks. The bartender was really nice. I ordered a manhattan and an old fashioned for my friend. The drinks were strong but that's how I like it. We came to the outside seating to sit and there a waiter waited on us. We tried the bread pudding and it was super delicious. The chocolate on top of the bread complemented the drinks well. We sat and talked for awhile and ordered more drinks as the night went on. The waiter was kind and kept up with the service with frequent quality checks. I would definitely return back the next time I come back to LA. :)

Reviews.Author: Joaquin E.
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was great! Awesome view, amazing food, kick ass DJ and band, service was superb, and the ambiance was perfect!

Reviews.Author: Veronica S.
Reviews.Content: Love The Perch! !! Great atmosphere atop on the roof top where you have a great view of LA. tasty drinks prepared by Josh mmm couldn't just stop with one, not to mention the delicious food. .Wow.. can't wait to go back enjoy the drinks, food & company.

Reviews.Author: Sintiea S.
Reviews.Content: After one crowded and long elevator ride, you can walk over to the rooftop and take in the amazing views of L.A. Crowd is very trendy and drinks are a pit pricy...but you're paying for the ambiance. Fun spot to go with friends and "Ohh and Ahh" over the views of Downtown.

Reviews.Author: Courtney W.
Reviews.Content: Perch is right across the street from the red line which made it convenient coming from Koreatown by train. Just a couple of stops and hop skip away. We did the whole drinks, appetizers, and main course thing but it's expensive and the food isn't fantastic. Actually, I already forgot what I ordered. We came at 6 on Friday and luckily we got really good seating on the roof overlooking Pershing Square. The view and the atmosphere are the main attractions and I would make it a point to come back for drinks on the rooftop bar with friends. This place is a great blend between posh and casual so dress to impress!

Reviews.Author: Matt G.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to go in DTLA.  Easy parking right across the street or we usually just Metro it down since it's right off the Pershing Square stop!Gorgeous views.  Like most places in DTLA, I like to get there around 9/930 to avoid lines.  But we usually come here for dinner and stay for drinks anyway!  I always recommend the brussel sprouts... they are the best in town!!  Dinners are very good, I do find the price point a bit high for what you get, but it is what it is.  The real draw of this place is the ambiance, views, and fun rooftop!  Do bring a jacket in cooler months as it does get windy!

Reviews.Author: Mary T.
Reviews.Content: The only thing this place has going for itself is the amazing rooftop view, but the wait to get up there at any given time is ridiculous.  Some busy nights I would understand, but some nights when I'm there it doesn't even seem busy.  You wait about 30-45 minutes in line outside to get in.  Then when you want to get to the rooftop, there's another line where you wait up to another 20 minutes.  When you get to the rooftop, it's not even busy.  I feel like they make you wait just to hype up the place.  There is one toilet upstairs for each gender. You want to go down to use the other restroom, but then you have to line up again to get back upstairs, so you end up waiting forever to use the restroom upstairs.   Make sure you have good company with you with all that waiting.  The decor here is nice. It has a 20s style feel.  The drinks are expensive like most Dtla bars, but I still like the place.  Great place to meet people, mess with the bouncers, and people watch.

Reviews.Author: Bella B.
Reviews.Content: HM EWWW. Both my friend and I found a LONG blonde hair in our risotto. What was worse is that the waitress didnt seem to be surprised by it or care much, not to mention she claimed there were no females int he kitchen...gross, so how did it happen???Yes they comped my risotto, but with how gross that is I'm thinking the entire bill should have been comped. other than  the that, yes the view is beautiful but that cant possibly make up for how average and bland the food is or how gross it is that they could make such an unsanitary mistake.

Reviews.Author: Nanor H.
Reviews.Content: After a week of anticipation I arrived here with a group for my friend's birthday. At first it was cool switching elevators going into a cavernous space, only to arrive at a dusty looking bar with a bizarre setup and a haunted-house feeling. The rooftop bar was not open because it was a Monday which was very irritating. The patio was open which did have a nice view, but they did not have room for us :(Many of us tried the French 64 at the suggestion of other reviews. Sorry yelpers but you disappointed! The ginger syrup they use was stringent and burned my throat, coupled with cognac the drink became even more harsh.
