I ordered the steak frites, and that was the highlight of my night, it was cooked perfectly medium over a bed of truffle fries; given the fries were the frozen straight cut type, not the traditional thin cut crispy fries that accompany most steak frites,  however the dish was missing a vegetable of some sort to cut through the richness of the fatty steak, truffle fries, and bleu cheese butter sauce, I felt a 100 lbs heavier that night. I might have enjoyed it more if I didn't receive it a full 5 minutes after everyone else at our table, considering the plates had about 2 bites, my friend was finished with her halibut before I even started on my steak. I did not catch our server's name, so he will be referred to as Mr. Mustache.Mr. Mustache was not knowledgable of the menu at all, he did not know the ingredients of the only 2 pastas on their menu, he spent most of the night at the bar laughing with the bartender, and did not realize his carelessness even after my friend had to leave the table to ask for another drink, sorry I thought the $70 gratuity we paid you entitled us to some basic service, at least on par with a McDonald's counter.  Overall I came to the conclusion that this place is all HYPE, no substance. It is very unlikely I will ever return, especially considering the number of other bars in the area. The only hardworking people in the place were their bussers.We left without being acknowledged or thanked, and thus with no intention of returning.

Reviews.Author: Ming L.
Reviews.Content: 5 Stars for the view and ambiance, but 2 stars for food. I paid way too much for my Halibut.

Reviews.Author: Eli S.
Reviews.Content: Terrible food, incredible roof-top bar, lovely decor. Go on a weird day so as to not wait in line for sure.

Reviews.Author: Tamara A.
Reviews.Content: I went here for a party before they officially opened for business. It was a fun, nicely decorated place. Pros: Plently  of rooftop action, yummy drinksCons: Unorganized and took forever for them to make drinks...they also ran out of diet coke (Since they weren't even officially open, I only subtracted one star from my review.

Reviews.Author: Stefano A.
Reviews.Content: The view, the ambiance, the tone, the music and the outside fireplace. I think those qualities and no cover charge made me a fan of the place! I am loving this downtown...sit down, relax and enjoy a drink with your peeps! Why go to The Standard with the posers when you can come here and enjoy a regular Thursday evening? Listen to me, go to Perch and save $!

Reviews.Author: Kristina G.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner with some co-workers after work...we didn't make reservations but they were able to accomodate our small party.  We ordered the cheese platter appetizer to share between us and it wasn't too appetizing. I've had other, cheaper cheese platters and this one was definitely mediocre, at best. I ordered the roasted poussin and for $25 it was definitely not that good or even large enough to be filling.I've heard their happy is nice here and the view is great...too bad it was raining when I came and the patio was closed. So come for drinks but eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: kc c.
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying we did not eat here, but planned to. I can't say the food isn't good, but the menu and vibe suggested this was much more of a party spot and it's just not a place I would come eat a formal meal. That said, for a dink spot, it's worthy of 4 stars, but it's a restaurant so I have to base the rating on such. The view here is excellent and it's a perfect spot to get drinks.  The indoor seating is not conducive to formal dining and the patio, which is set for dining can be rather cold in fall/winter. I'll come back, but only to drink and I think they should add some N. American wines to the list. I know it's French, but not everyone likes French wine, especially when California and the Northwest produce wines that are generally, imo, better than France.

Reviews.Author: Lauren C.
Reviews.Content: Lovely decor, fun location, but the service was the most agonizingly slow experience I've ever had.  We had table reservations at 8:30 on a Wednesday night.  We didn't get seated until 9:00 (we were told to wait at the bar, but the security guard kept telling us we had to move closer to the bar or go elsewhere - there was no way to move closer). We didn't get to order until at least 9:30, and main courses didn't arrive until 10:10.  All told, what should have been an easy meal took two and a half hours.  The food was good, if a bit bland.  I had the risotto with butternut squash, which could have used some spices or at least a little salt, and the large chunks of squash were a weird textural contrast to the small risotto.  My boyfriend ordered his burger medium rare, but it came out as well-done as a burger can be without being burnt.  The fries were delicious, as was the brie we had for an appetizer.  The crowd was an odd mix of people (I heard some bankers at one table and saw a man in a full-on fur coat at another), but the place isn't set up for mingling so it doesn't much matter what the crowd is like so long as you bring your own good company.

Reviews.Author: Gordon A.
Reviews.Content: Loved the ambiance.  My wife and I went to Perch for a 6:15 reservation, but after parking across the street and taking two elevators up to the restaurant, we arrived at 6:35.  The hostess gave me a dirty look for arriving past the 15 minute grace period.  She still sat us anyway.  Our waitress, when we did see her, was great.  The food was excellent!  We split the beet salad.  I had the salmon with shrimp.  Delicious.  My wife had the chicken.  Desert was the kicker.  Breaded Pudding was awesome.  So was the creme brûlée.   The staff was very attentive, even when the waitress wasn't around.  They would refill my coffee, etc.

Reviews.Author: Michele W.
Reviews.Content: I really like Perch :) The line moves fast, service is always on point, and the view is fantastic. On weekends earlier in the evening they'll have a band playing, too. We usually get the truffle fries and croquette appetizer just to munch on and they're both delicious! Better than a lot of other (pricier) restaurants. If you haven't been, def try it. You won't be sorry...

Reviews.Author: Jason L.
Reviews.Content: while i was vacationing in los angeles, my friend highly recommended this place.  now i have been partial to any rooftop club (having been to "level" in toronto), so i decided to give this "perch" a shot.well, i was floored with how amazing this place was.  we arrived around 1130am, and did not leave until 4pm...the food was excellent, and the drinks were equally impressive, especially the sangria.what did it for me was, clearly, the environment.  plush seating, combined with beautiful weather and a friendly staff really made me feel at home.right before we left, we went on the rooftop and this is where i collectively lost all of my marbles (lol) as the downtown scenery was absolutely breathtaking.perch is a place that i must visit on every trip i make to los angeles...and you should too.

Reviews.Author: W Q.
Reviews.Content: It's been a year and half since my last visit in LA, on perch's soft opening day.  Bartenders are much faster at making the drinks, the price of drinks are around $10.  There are more outdoor seating areas.  There are plenty of outdoor heaters to keep you warm in the winter. The view/atmosphere is still amazing.  Great female DJ here.  I would highly recommend visiting Perch if you are visiting Los Angeles.  It's a pretty sweet spot.

Reviews.Author: Yvette L.
Reviews.Content: Nice place to go and hang out on a fri or sat night with a few friends. This isn't a date night spot if you're looking for peace and quite though. Otherwise, the ambiance is great!

Reviews.Author: Elissa S.
Reviews.Content: I hate yet to come here during happy hour but four stars for the amazing view of DTLA. The vibe is chill and ambience is relaxing. The night that I went there was a live band and some art displays on the top floor. It wasn't to crowded so there were a few chairs available to sit. They have a menu at night but don't serve food on the top floor. Cocktails are delicious but kind of pricey. Both times I came here I didn't have to pay cover, there was no line, and parking is $5 in the parking lot across the street.

Reviews.Author: Christina Z.
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful location..overlooking downtown and feels a bit like Paris. The only thing that's a problem me was the service. They need more people working at the bar and more waiters. Everyone working there was friendly though!

Reviews.Author: Sasha V.
Reviews.Content: I am giving this place 4 stars for the amazing view. You can't beat a rooftop outside lounge with an amazing view of DTLA and pershing square. I highly recommend this place for a date or birthday.

Reviews.Author: Leslie K.
Reviews.Content: I came here about a week ago, early, on a Wednesday night for a private party event on the 13th floor. The event staff were extremely friendly and attentive. Everything went so smoothly. The service was attentive without being disruptive. the food was great and everyone was served at the same time! No small feat!  I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Abby D.
Reviews.Content: Wow...Perch is amazing. I've only been here once but it was an event to remember!! Since we got married in LA, we decided to explore the nightlife in downtown LA the night before the wedding. I have family that lives in one of the highrises closeby so all of us were able to do a little pregame there before hitting the town. Perch is definitely a fancy spot, luckily my brother has connections so our posse was able to get in without a wait. The lounge is on the rooftop so you have to go through security and take an elevator up. The views of Los Angeles are breathtaking. There is plenty of space and seating and they were staffed really well. We never had to wait very long for service and all were very pleasant. I like to think it was our joint bachelor/bachelorette party with our closest friends and family, definitely a night to remember. I feel so lucky to have celebrated that last night before the nuptials at Perch. It set a great, classy, and fun environment, making it easy to enjoy. They played great music and made some strong drinks. I want to come here every time I party in downtown LA for sure!

Reviews.Author: Katie C.
Reviews.Content: This place definitely lives up to the hype.  The views are spectacular and I was also pretty impressed with the helpfulness of the staff.  However, if you are looking for somewhere quiet - this is not the place.  It's jam packed with a lot of people just looking to drink and be a part of the "scene."  I went here for a first date and was a little nervous about being able to hear each other over the live band and the crowd.  Luckily the staff came up with a table that was far enough away from the stage that we managed ok : )

Reviews.Author: C A.
Reviews.Content: Came here last night for a special occasion. I'd heard a lot about this place and was excited to try it. We tried to make a rez but were told no reservations were not available and to check with the hostess when we got there. We did. Hostess said that no tables were available. However, during the entire 90-120 minutes we were there, plenty of tables were open. We sat at the bar. Drinks were good! Ambiance, great. We ordered two apps - the baked brie and something that we expected to be like a baked brie, with Gruyere but was more like little bread rolls. (Forget the name - sorry. You'll know it when you see it). Disappointed w/ both. Baked brie was not warm, and the puff pastry was almost soggy. My boyfriend ordered steak frites which he thought was ok but not the best he'd ever had. I had the endive salad which I liked a lot. There was a live band, which was fun.All in all - come here for a drink and great ambiance. And, go somewhere else for food. We spent $100 in total and could have gotten better food at the Italian place around the corner for probably half that.

Reviews.Author: Alex L.
Reviews.Content: came here a few times strictly for the roof top bar.its a nice view with decent price drinks. everything is great minus the wait time in line.....

Reviews.Author: Jonathan G.
Reviews.Content: Tried Perch again, just thought it had to be better....was not.

Reviews.Author: Janelle Q.
Reviews.Content: When I had friends coming to visit me from out of town or further corners of the LA area, I used to take them to the The Standard for a little wow-factor flair while bar hopping ... but as the snooty vibe has turned me off from that place on more than one occasion, I now I take friends to DTLA's new hottest rooftop bar: Perch. Called "an elevated resting place" on it's name placard yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb… on Hill St, Perch truly is just that... a classy rooftop lounge but without the pretentiousness of The Standard. Since it's opening about a year ago, I've been here multiple times to eat, drink, enjoy the live music + soak in the views both in the sunlight as well as under the dark of night. The ground floor elevator takes you up to a 13th floor level from which you take a separate elevator to either the 15th or 16th floors of Perch. The 15th is the main level featuring an interior dining room yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb… with antique furniture, the main bar area yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb…, + of course the famous outdoor patio seating yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb… with absolutely lovely views over Pershing Square yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb… to the southwest corner.  The 16th floor is a more intimate space yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb… with its own bar + slightly better 360 degree views. It tends to be closed to the public on weekday evenings but is available for private parties. The embossed menu books yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb… feature drinks (wine, cocktails, liquor list, etc) in the front pages + then a page or 2 for the food in the back... + rightfully so as the drinks are the star here. yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb… I've tried about 1/2 of the cocktails on the menu + have been quite a fan of the complex tastes of each of them... sweet, strong but not too overwhelming on either end of the spectrum so that you can savor it. They'll cost you $9-$13, but they're worth it.  I've only had nibbles of the $11 Truffle Fries + also the $14 Mussels with Saffron + Cherry Tomatoes during the dinner hour before, + I didn't think they were particularly extraordinary for the price. But then again, every available table was filled with dinner patrons on a Tuesday night so I'm sure there are other dishes that are better than what I tried.  Perch becomes quite crowded with a line forming down the block by around 10pm on the weekends so I recommend coming in the early evening to avoid the bar scene crowd wearing tiny skirts + dresses that would never see the light of day. Or alternatively, this venue can also be quite nice in the daytime with its brunch menu + lazy Sunday vibe with live music. Views, of course, are just as nice yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb…. As a umm.... precautionary warning though, I recommend being careful when looking over the ledge of the 15th floor as it can be uhhhh... very easy to drop things.... LOL! yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb… Lucky for me, there's a ledge on the 14th floor that the waiters an access to retrieve any fallen objects.  =P

Reviews.Author: Emily K.
Reviews.Content: Perch was awesome! Great views, hip-vintage decor, and a super fun cute waitress wearing a bowtie!! Food was also awesome. I spent my birthday here and it was oh so excellent! The specialty cocktails were also very good... my table had quite a few and it was well worth it! :)

Reviews.Author: Dave W.
Reviews.Content: A review for the staff and locale: both are fantastic. I shot a surprise engagement dinner here: he photos some of the best I've taken, due to the excellent location and decor. The staff however, were the shining light - they were not only extremely gracious and helpful in making sure the surprise well timed (all while keeping the rest of their customers taken care of), but they were genuinely excited and interested without being intrusive. I was excessively impressed.

Reviews.Author: Jackie M.
Reviews.Content: The best part about The Perch is the view and that's where it ends. Maybe it was OUR server but, considering the ambiance and working in the hospitality industry I tried to be as rational as possible. Forget  about creating an experience, the view is to distract how long they take on your order, then finally when your food arrives you get to admire it,(because you have no silverware).Food was good but, for the price $$$ you would just EXPECT more, I've been treated better at McDonalds!!! Take a book for those of you who will dine in( thats how long your food will take to come out) and good luck.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: 2nd time here, came for a birthday celebration on a saturday night. - Make a reservation! Daysss in advance. OR ELSE! literally...you're ass will be waiting in line for a very long time. The reservation will bring you straight to the front to a lovely lady that checks your ID and grants you access- Very accommodating! Management contacted me to make sure things would go smoothly and it definitely went better than expected! Outside seating, fast service, free drinks, and birthday surprise. Thanks maria for the relaying the msg :)- We ordered many things. Salmon, steak, fries, salad, cheese and bread, pasta... All great presentation. Very little serving and too expensive, but expected...- Waiters took the time to explain what was on the plate. - Music too loud. When you're sitting next to the speaker, it can make a conversation a bit difficult to hear. haha...HUH!? WHAT DID YOU SAY? ughhh- NOT FINISHED..hey, take the plate when I say it's okay buddy. - Once you leave, people will be swooping in to take your seat. SECONDS! fo sho!- LA lights festival tonight! bonus.

Reviews.Author: kristi b.
Reviews.Content: usually Perch doesnt disappoint.  well they did Saturday night.  Made reservation for myself & girlfriend (she is from out of town) 645 - they sat us immediately I orderd bottle of champagne, the $80 (from that price goes to $300) - we were told they had no champagne chilled.. OK ODD for a Saturday night- they agreed finally to chill some.  Appetitizers came -were great..  Champagne finally arrived chilled ok making progress.. Its now about 815 and the place is packed.  Steaks came out wrong.  Went back -came back again my friends was pretty Rare which is ok for her, mine was to be Medium Plus- NO red it came out rare.  Sent back steak -came back out its now 845 -steak back still rare and now my potatoes are cold they didnt bother to add hot ones OR even flash the ones on my plate.  Now its 915pm..  Pretty disapointing for a $200 dinner..  I will go back --hoping its better..

Reviews.Author: Melissa P.
Reviews.Content: Excellent atmosphere, incredible views, live music and decent food make for a good night in DTLA

Reviews.Author: Anna S.
Reviews.Content: Cool rooftop bar and grille. Very business like. Beautiful view of Downtown La and Pershing Square. Great bar and atmosphere is mostly people who work Downtown.But very nice and chic. You should visit at least for the view.AS-Downtowner

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: The views and music are so great that I didn't expect such good food. Have now been for dinner and brunch and say the food is excellent--almost as great as the amazing views and supper club floating above the city atmosphere. Great jazz as well.

Reviews.Author: Mary C.
Reviews.Content: Great location, fabulous atmosphere, excellent food. They really need help with their reservation system, but I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: John R.
Reviews.Content: Nice views, nice seating.  Crowd was OK.  Charcuterie (spelling?) plate was money.  Decent beer selection, but just decent.  Definitely worth checking out.  I'd return for drinks or dinner.

Reviews.Author: Ben Z.
Reviews.Content: Was just here a few moments ago. Had the snoody bartender with bangs make me a Sazerac which was $14, she gave me only $4 back. After asking for the rest of my change, she just shrugged me off. Terrible service but good cocktails. These people should learn the difference between customer service and hospitality.

Reviews.Author: SHUSHAN RAZMIG MADENLIAN Z.
Reviews.Content: Q

Reviews.Author: Dennis H.
Reviews.Content: Went to the 16th floor rooftop club/bar ... seriously I have no idea what all the hoopla is about.  You can find these places all over NYC.  There was no music and the drinks were average at best.  I'm glad I came here early enough not to have to wait in the ridiculously long line.

Reviews.Author: Steph H.
Reviews.Content: Some of their pretensions may be ridiculous, like refusing to seat you earlier than your reservation even though there's like NO ONE there, AND having the waitresses dressed in semi-weird French maidish outfits?!  (maybe that's a plus for some), but I had a great time here. Maybe it was just the scintillating company, but it really is a beautiful space. You have to take two elevators or an elevator and two flights of stairs to get up here, but the view and ambiance is pretty fantastic. Great place to get drinks and light snacks--I enjoyed nibbling on their chicken-fried frog legs (!), washing them down with fine pints of Kronenbourg 1664. If you want to impress your date, bring her here. I know I was impressed :)

Reviews.Author: Julia E.
Reviews.Content: Really the only thing going is the view... Went for a birthday brunch and the service was horrible, started with taking 15 minutes just to get menus that I had to ask for. Then out came my coffee... cold. I really wish they had better food and better service because the location is great. Food is really not memorable.

Reviews.Author: Lynn S.
Reviews.Content: love.love.LOVE this place. It's a great spot to meet up with friends for drinks or enjoy a romantic meal with a significant other. I love bringing friends from out of town here for a drink to start off the evening. Anything outdoors or on a rooftop with a scenery is a plus in my book! French maid me PLEASE!

Reviews.Author: Karly P.
Reviews.Content: Honestly the view isn't even worth the two elevators it takes to get to this elevated mediocre restaurant. Besides the fact that they forgot our order, it took them an hour and a half to get us our very average food. As much as I love paying almost $20 for an incorrectly cooked burger, I also love ordering rosemary thyme fries and getting overly cooked freezer burned french fries. Oh and to top it all off, our busser broke three plates at our feet. Honestly the only pleasant thing about this place besides the view, was our Katie Holmes doppelgänger of a waitress.

Reviews.Author: Sommy R.
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Amazing views of LA in the evening and the crowd is great.  Get here before 9pm because my friends got here after 9pm and never got in the rest of the night. Limited capacity does that to you on a rooftop lounge.  If you want to eat here, you HAVE to make a reservation. Great place to reserve a large group for any type of celebration. I had the $12 My Fair Lady but someone bumped into me that night and spilled half of it! Well, I guess I shouldn't cry over spilled cocktail.

Reviews.Author: Erica P.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite bars in downtown LA! It's definitely because of the ambiance! The only way you'll notice this place is from the long lines in front on the weekends. The Perch is located on the 13th-15th floor of the Pershing Square Building. Perfect first date spot I feel it's not too loud or too quiet! But make a reservation beforehand because the dining room is usually packed!   We haven't tried the food here but we did try the drinks. Have a French 64- cognac, ginger, and beer! It was super yummy! Or try the Marie Antoinette- cognac & cheery liquor.

Reviews.Author: Jacob S.
Reviews.Content: Love this place- great food, amazing service, and I think decent prices. The view from the patio is amazing and kept me intrigued throughout dinner. I had the roasted brussels sprouts and the filet mignon with asparagus and rosemary potatoes - everything was mouthwatering delicious. I have not been to the lounge upstairs, only the restaurant - but will definitely be back. Parking can be somewhat of a hassle though, we parked at the lot on the next corner and walked.

Reviews.Author: Miss R.
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful dinner on the rooftop overlooking a beautiful view of the city. There were plenty of heat lamps, so even on a January night we were plenty warm. Service was great, our waiter was personable and attentive. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: The Party Goddess I.
Reviews.Content: Gotta tell you I was super skeptical when making a res at Perch. It was for my husband's birthday, he's super picky and pretty jaded and I was scared it was going to just be a scene with a great view. Well, I couldn't have been more off. The view WAS ridiculous and our table by the fireplace couldn't have been more divine. Felt like I was in Paris with the great drink list, or at the very least NYC. The food was INSANE. Having studied French cooking for two summers in France, again, was ready to complain. Nope. Cheese plate with perfect amount I quince paste. Short ribs with to-die-for, not shy horseradish, veggie terrine and RIDONCULOUS white chocolate bread pudding, not a competitor in town. Really great value and even a good spot for me to make a pit stop for the next date night. J'adore!

Reviews.Author: Charlene C.
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous panorama view from the rooftop seating area. Just a great little place. Especially loved the shrimp & grits and the bouillabaisse, although the lobster bisque and baked brie were also good.

Reviews.Author: Shayla R.
Reviews.Content: Every, single, time, I'm in DTLA, I make it a point to stop by this spot. There are several secrets that are kept undisclosed for those that have had the ultimate experience here and that I'm not willing to disclose. . . just yet. Dope, low-key spot.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a Saturday night for a birthday party, big mistake.  Although some of us were able to get in without much wait around 9:45, other members of our party were held outside for at least 45 minutes without moving.  Most  in line including other members of our group decided to leave instead of waiting outside in the cold.  All this despite the fact that there was ample room inside.  I guess Perch wanted to hold the line to appear busy at the expense of turning paying customers away.  There were two bartenders at the rooftop bar.  Seeing as our group represented at least a quarter of the people on the roof, I expected to be shown a decent level of service but was completely wrong.  One of the bartenders, a brunette, was nice and served us well enough.  However, the other bartender with red hair was blatantly racist, rude and chose to serve all white people ahead of any minority customers.  While a couple of non-white customers including myself waited at least 25 minutes for a drink, she quickly served any white customer as soon as they came to the bar.I was upset with redhead's actions but decided to leave a tip for the brunette when closing out my tab.  However, I refused to leave the bigot bartender any tip and specified on the receipt that the tip was specifically for the brunette bartender.  After seeing my note, she asked a bouncer to escort me out of the building.  I left without fuss with about half of our existing group and explained the situation to the bouncer on the way out.  He mentioned that this wasn't the first incident between a patron and the readhead but that he had to do his job.Upon receiving my credit card statement I noticed that Perch charged me 20 dollars more than I left on my receipt.  I guess the redhead didn't take kindly to me pointing out her blatant bigotry and decided to tip herself on top of what I left for the brunette bartender.  Thankfully, I have a copy of my receipt and will dispute the charge.  I would advise against going here at all costs unless you don't mind being blatantly discriminated by some of the staff at Perch.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany D.
Reviews.Content: Finally came out to this DTLA staple last Sunday afternoon, and it TOTALLY changed my perceptions. Before it was a nice solid crowd pleaser, no stand out foods or service, usually very crowded, one of those see-and-be-seen kinda places. It's no wonder, there's a killer view of dtla from the 2, yes 2, rooftop areas! The bottom has tables and connects to their indoor loungey area. Go up the stairs and go to the more open, casual rooftop. That's where I like to hang out. Amidst the christmas lights, views of the building that was in Batman (the gothicy looking one, just imagine the gargoyles added in to make it Gotham), and the pretty people, you can't help but feel like this is where the young and cool come to play after a long day at FIDM or somewhere close by. Added perk for night time is that they have a separate line for DTLA residents, which moves much quicker. Bring your ID or a piece of mail showing your DTLA address and you can practically skip the 30plus minute line everytime! It's great. Take the elevator up to the 13th floor, then move over to another elevator to the 15th or 16th, pick your pleasure. No cover ever, that's a beauty!BUUUUUT on this sunday afternoon, with perfect LA sunshine streaming through, good friends, and seemingly all the time in the world, perch took on an entirely different light. It was casual, it was chill, old but comfortable. Not stuffy. Not crowded. Chairs to lounge around everywhere, separate DJs spinning in their own little worlds. Just lovely.Stayed here for hours. The cutie bartender helped, as did the amazing cucumber drinks that he made. And we noted they do sunday brunch now, with $12 champagne bottles. That's going to circulate into my lazy sunday routine for sure.So come, experience DTLA at it's best, and try the cucumber drink. It's all divine.

Reviews.Author: Zentinii T.
Reviews.Content: A nice place to mingle and lounge or on a date. Not a place for dancing. There's a rooftop bar that overlook the city with fireplace/pits, however its still VERY cold if your wearing a dress. I highly recommend bringing a coat...not sure if they have coat check. You will definitely get a cold breeze. The music is "lounging" music, can't dance to it. Mixed crowd in late 20's to 40's. Young professionals. Parking is hard to find. Long line by 11pm, but you get in after 15 mins wait. There's two level, 1st level serves some food and drinks, top level if for drinks only (stairs inland elevator to the 2nd floor).

Reviews.Author: Tina C.
Reviews.Content: Sooo...this is my first dining experience here and I have to say that I'm quite DISAPPOINTED in the FOOD. However, our server Sean was pretty good and I thank him for accommodating to our request to send things back!  Sorry, dude but tell the chef the customer is RIGHT! I feel like I was on Restaurant Impossible with Chef Irving from Food Network, except for the decore...was OK.I had the mixed green salad with candied walnuts, sliced pears (VERY THIN MIND YOU) and sliced red onions (TOO THICK), with a "couple" of raspberries as a garnish I assume?  It was a typical salad, nothing to whoot about. The dressing was good, but the onions overpowered the taste of the pears and the lettuce.  The nuts were perfectly sweet and crunchy which kind of mellowed out the flavor of the onions, but please explain the 2 raspberries!  It had no business being in that salad except for adding "color".  It actually threw off the taste when I ate one. So be it.  My main course was the escolar.  Ok, I have never had this white fish before so I was excited to try something new.  When the dish finally came out my first impression was "Wow, what a small pc of fish (THIN cut too) and small plate to go along with it. I was sharing my plate with a friend and when we cut into it, it was tough and over cooked, and tasteless. Other friend had the same dish, but hers looked quite different than ours and she claims hers was cooked perfectly.  So, what happened to ours???  So, we called the waiter and told him the situation and to have him taste it too. He forked into it (could tell it was not tender) and took the pc back to the chef to show him the dry pc of overcooked fish. He comes back and tells us that the chef explained it is just the "crust" that is hard and the middle is soft. NOT!  So...was this NOT cooked right?  Hmm.  For $30 bucks I expect a nice pc of plump fish that is fork tender!!!  Thank you!  So our waiter Sean suggested to maybe try the other fish on the menu which was the salmon, so we did. It came out pretty quickly.  The salmon was on a bed of super cheesy risotto topped with fish roe (not sure which one- but not salmon roe) and micro greens.  The dish looked colorful. So we took our first bite of the fish.  It was tender and cooked perfectly. Tasted alright.  However, the fish being on top of the risotto that was too cheesy and somewhat undercooked did not compliment the fish at all.  It overpowered the flavor of cheese vs. fish and it definitely lacked texture, as well.  In my opinion I think this dish would have been better if it had some sort of green vegetable for some added texture.The fish roe did add a tiny bit of 'ocean' flavor, but again with the cheese risotto it just threw the flavors off.  I thought in the "culinary" world it is not kosher to serve cheese with fish. Anyways, this dish overall was basically bland.  We didnt even finish it.  Oh, the cut was a little bigger than the escolar. For the drink I got this ginger flavored cocktail...the waiter did warn me it's the least favorite amongst everybody but I decided to it anyways bc I love ginger flavored drinks. So It comes out (mind u they have tiny drinks for $$$) I take a sip and bleh..it's SUPER nasty! Like, really nasty with no obvious ginger flavor at all.  It tasted like gasoline.  So the waiter was nice enough to let me exchange it out for a mojito (my typical when I don't know what to drink which is quite often). Lastly, the  Dessert...bread pudding and creme brulee. Both were not the best I have ever had either. SIGH.....The bread pudding was buttery from making it with croissant but lacked any sweetness and was a bit on the dry side. Edible. I'm a big fan of creme brulee and this was a little grainy in texture whIch was displeasing in my mouth. Overall my dining experience was a disaster. But thank goodness the desserts were compt!Nightlife after dinner:  So we decided to stay, but went down to the car for something and by the time we got back-10 min later) there was a huge line forming downstairs JUST to enter this place.  REALLY? But they let us back in bc I told them we are here for dinner.  Anyways, there are 2 rooftop outside lounge areas.  Half of us were up on the top, which the rest of us below were not able to get in and the line is ridiculous! I'm sorry, but I am too mature to be standing in line to get a drink and for a mediocre view, so we just ended up staying at the lower level rooftop area. Ha it sucked so bad. Unless you were right next to the dj playing on his computer, you could not hear any music.  The servers are not too friendly and these ppl think this is some POSH place. NOT!  And I will never come back here for either food or entertainment.  I am tired of spending $$$$ at crappy a$$ places. OH, and I find out this place went through 3 chefs already, getting their 4th...and they are unsure of their identity. I live in DTLA and this is the first time I have ever heard of this place.  No wonder. Sorry Perch, D-.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia C.
Reviews.Content: I have attended this place well over 6 times. The night time door staff are very friendly, the vibe of the place is very cool. Great place to take out of town folks to get a great view of Downtown L.A. I have attended for brunch as well. Brunch is good & the staff is friendly. My only complaint is that when you attend brunch as a group they only take one credit card for the entire party. I have never heard of this at any restaurant. If you are in a group (the bill will likely be pretty generous) it is only in good standing to take multiple credit/debit cards. It's the right thing to do to make me want to return and give more business to The Perch. I had to ask the birthday girl to spot me for her birthday and I had to reimburse her at a later day because of Perch's lame policy. That is just dreadful. I was not the only one that had to reimburse the birthday girl. Lame.

Reviews.Author: Roberto B.
Reviews.Content: Perch is that awful marriage of appalling service, underwhelming food, high prices, and unmet expectation. All of this would be troubling enough, if it wasn't that Perch aims very high- and fails spectacularly. I called at 6pm to make a reservation. Let me point out that in the past, I tried to make a reservation but got a recorded message stating they were not accepting reservations "at this time". Well... at 6pm on Thursday, I got lucky. Someone picked up the phone. I asked for a table at 10pm that same night, for two people. And I was told that the latest they take reservations is 9:45. So I agreed and that was that. Table for two, 9:45. Boom. I was at an event with my lady, and I purposefully left the Q&A early because I didn't want to be late for Perch. I didn't want to show up 5 minutes late and have them tell me that the kitchen was closed, or that they could no longer seat me. So I showed up at 9:43. PERFECT GODDAMN TIMING. The place was bustling. It's a very cool looking spot, what with the view and the retro decor. I walked up to the reception area, where two employees were manning the reservation desk. A dude and a chick. The dude goes "um... we're waiting for a table to free up- you should go upstairs and we'll call you. Have a cocktail". Call me? As in, they'll physically find me? "No. We'll call your cell phone. Make sure you have it on you because it gets loud up there". Our lovely, romantic dinner has already started to sour. Why? Because standing around in the bar area, with my phone out, waiting to be called by the Gods, is definitely not my idea of a lovely romantic dinner.So now we're upstairs. We're sitting around. We're waiting. I look at the watch. Minutes go by. We're surrounded by financial dudes and hipsters. My lady is diabetic and she's starting to feel funny. I look at the watch again: it is now 9:57. Almost 15 minutes past the reservation time.I run back downstairs. I calmly go over to the reservation desk. I ask about our table. And I get the same answer. "We're still waiting for a table to open up". And I basically become very agitated. My side of the argument was that I made a reservation for 9:45, and it was not respected- but what REALLY gnawed at my nuts was that I was told specifically to get there on time, since they don't accept reservations any later. The answer: "we keep the kitchen open later than 9:45". I also tried explaining that this was simply bad scheduling on their part- because NO restaurant that takes itself this seriously would have a customer waiting for 15 minutes while they wait for the previous party to leave- and after that customer made a reservation. That means that the staff overbooked, or is not very good at arranging the space. One employee's sarcastic remark was "we don't like to kick people out while they're still eating". Much like the current west vs. middle east ideological conflict, it seems that Perch and I have two very different views on how a restaurant should be run. FINALLY we got seated at a table. And here comes the fun part. Our table was impossibly wonky- I am talking about "we are on the Titanic and shit's sliding all over the place". I asked to get it fixed THREE TIMES. At this point I am dying for a drink. So I order my go-to anxiety medication. A Negroni.Well. Guess how many attempts THAT took? Five. FIVE. The third attempt actually resulted in a dude bringing me a Coca-Cola, which was hilarious. In a frustrated daze, I actually burst out laughing at the ridiculousness.We ordered food. Truffle fries, tuna tartar, duck with gnocchi, sea bass.I would rate the food, overall, a C-.The only thing that was genuinely good was the duck. It was very nicely cooked and the balsamic reduction wasn't too overpowering.But the rest was simply disastrous.- The truffle fries were smothered in cheese, with nay a hint of truffle oil to be found. --- The tuna tartar came in a comically large, long plate. On one end were three chips, and on the other was the tartar. Which was completely tasteless. - The gnocchi. Oh. My. God. Apocalypse Gnocchi. Chef needs to learn the SALT THE WATER before putting the gnocchi in. They were completely tasteless. Regardless, they were overcooked. - The sea bass. Also overcooked. Instead of being flakey and delicate, it was tough and lumpy. It sat on a bed of gross risotto. You know when risotto has not been amalgamated properly? When the rice grains and the liquid are not one? Yep. Welcome to Perch.Truthfully, the view was beautiful and my lady and I were too amused by this train-wreck of a restaurant to really take it badly. But my goodness... with places like Water Grill, Baco, Parish and Gorbals around... these people need to learn to do two things:1) Run a restaurant.2) Cook.Once they've figured those two minor details out, Perch has the potential to be fantastic.

Reviews.Author: A H.
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at Perch this past weekend! It was the perfect setting to celebrate a birthday with a cozy table by the fireplace and the band playing in the background. The staff was very accommodating with our requests. They made beautiful personalized menus and customized our dishes to fit the birthday girls favorites. The My Fair Lady cocktail has to be one of the best drinks I've ever tried! Everyone loved the view and after dinner we continued the party upstairs on the rooftop bar. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Akiko T.
Reviews.Content: Ooh... rooftop restaurants.  I'm typically smitten with them like white on rice!  I mean what's not to love!  Well aside from great company and great views I found both the food unacceptable and service underwhelming.  Upon seating on their wrap around veranda, the blinding uplights next to my chair knocked the wind out of me.  I looked over at our neighbor's table and it was obvious that this guest was bothered by this obnoxious lighting since she placed her napkin over the actual light.  I asked the hostess to do the same on mine.  What are they trying to do, make us wear sunglasses at night so we could look like douche bags?After 15 minutes and having to flag someone down, we finally got our drink orders taken.  Their Kir Royale list is kind of fun as they offer different shots of flavors other than cassis and had mine with a shot of St. Germaine.  These Champagne cocktails are served in those old school wide glassware as opposed to flutes.  Love the retro chic!On to the food, we'd selected some snacks to graze on since it was late.  The food was unfortunately the worst part of this place.  You would think that the investors who blew some serious cash to renovate and transform the space to what it is today would have the smarts to hire a mind blowing chef who micromanages everything that's brought out to tables...*  Broccolini Salad, prepared with Cold Poached Broccolini, Prosciutto, Poached Eggs, Sturgeon Caviar, Olives & Meyer Lemon Oil.  Sounds fabulous right?  It actually was awkward since the broccolini was almost raw and really hard.  This salad would have rocked my world if the broccolini was grilled or at least cooked all the way through.* Caesar - seriously, if anyone could screw up a Caesar this one will take home the trophy.  The lettuces were dull, drowned in dressing and plain weird.  They did not use hearts of romaine but big, awkward, leafy pieces of lettuce.  It also came garnished with big, awkward pieces of parmesan tuille as if they were to be eaten like crackers.* Cordon Bleu Poppers - Sounded fun until they arrived.  They literally looked like glorified Chicken McNuggets... processed breaded chicken stuffed with prosciutto and swiss.  Seriously.* Bon Bon Risotto - Risotto with fresh corn and pea tendrils.  This was probably the best thing we ordered... Wait, I should re-phrase that.  This was the most edible thing we ordered?  Corn and peas in a risotto sounded farmers market-ish and interesting when we ordered but it's really not as satisfying as a wild mushroom or butternut squash would be.I can't finish this review w/o saying something nice so I guess I would like to graciously comment that the library shabby chic-esque interior is quite charming, the veranda and the views are stunning and it's the perfect place to meet friends for cocktails with nice French Café ambient music in the background.

Reviews.Author: Mirna L.
Reviews.Content: This place is BEAUTIFUL........came here today with some  good friends for brunch, I had the french toast with fresh berries. It was delicious.....all the ladies and me look forward to coming back soon. :)

Reviews.Author: Will C.
Reviews.Content: There's nothing that really stands out about this place as being the best of the best. I've been to restaurants in LA with a better view. I've been to restaurants in LA with better food. I've been to restaurants in LA with better service. Maybe Perch is better thought of as a lounge that happens to serve food and not as a restaurant that happens to have a cool lounge. But then again, the wine and cocktail list at Perch also happens to be mediocre at best too.Whenever I check out a new place, I like to order up more than I would normally so that I can get a good sampling of their menu. I was not really impressed with anything that was served. It's not that the concepts are bad -- they sound very good on paper -- but the execution is flawed with many dishes being very unbalanced. And I am by no means a wine snob, but when your Syrah looks like engine sludge, you probably should change up bottles. The Pinot Noir was better, but with a very heavy note of barnyard on the nose. Our server -- who was very, very good and the highlight of the experience -- explained that the manager liked earthy wines. Earthy is fine, but these could only be described as swampy. Alice's martini was pretty good though. I probably should have gotten one or three of those.Highlights/Lowlights:- Cordon Bleu Poppers: first cousins to Tyson frozen chicken nuggets.- Duck Duck Goose: the mini club sandwiches are delicious, with the delicate toast points crumbling nicely after an initial give. Loved the combination of textures. But, if you eat it as a sandwich, the filling gets pushed out. If you eat it without the top toast, it's too salty. I think the way to go is to put the top toast under the bottom toast. I wish I had thought of it at the time.- Roasted Bone Marrow: I've never met bone marrow that I didn't like. The fleur de sel has a nice mellow, savory taste as opposed to a sharp saltiness that rounded out the richness of the marrow nicely.- Boeuf Bourguignon Deconstruit: it sounds good on paper, but the thing that makes beef bourguignon taste so good is the melding of all the flavors. By deconstructing the dish, you lose all that makes beef bourguignon great, and are left with bland beef and limp veggies on a plate.- Perch au Noisette: the filet was good, but the tomato carpaccio was made from unripened tomatoes. I've bought better tomatoes at Ralph's.

Reviews.Author: Ingrid V.
Reviews.Content: "Perch is an elevated rested place, a whimsical French inspired inclusive rooftop bistro.  Due to its surroundings Perch offers an unobstructed view, one truly feels as though they are floating at the skyline.  At Perch there really is something for everyone. With two outdoor fireplaces, various fire pits, both lounge and table seating. On any given night you may come to see a live Caberet act, a funky jazz trio, indie bands or a late night DJ, Perch is sure to be a magical scene."  --Taken from the Perch website, 'about' link.  Perch truly is a beautiful location.  The rooftop setting makes for a gorgeous venue that can set the stage for a very memorable evening.  That said, the incredible location is just about all that was memorable that evening.  I was there for a family reunion, and the overall consensus was, "underwhelming."The Good: - Incredible view  yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb…- The Bowl of Fries were very tasty (appetizer)  yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb…- Parking. Surprisingly easy to find.  many of parking lots nearby.  The Meh:- Salmon was good, but Risotto was very dry and overcooked. yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb…- Steak Frites ordered medium rare came out medium well.   yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb…- Chicken Supreme according to my guy was "no better than airline food chicken." yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb… - The rest of my family mentioned that the food was "ok", but nothing memorable.  The Bad:- Seating SUCKED!  We had a party of 12 and were smashed into little wicker chairs that "should" have seated 3.  The only way three people comfortably can fit, is if they are children, or very slim adults. My cousin and her husband who shared the seat with me are both thin people, and we were having a hard time not colliding elbows. I was also smashed up against a very pokey plant.  yelp.com/biz_photos/K-Fb…- Service was incredibly slow.  Another cousin did not get his appetizers until 20 minutes after the rest of us did.  We had our main courses before he and his wife got their starters.  Refills on water were very slow.- That same cousin had to go to the bar to get his alcoholic beverages, since again, service was slow.  - Bussers only cleared half the table and left the other one full of empty dishes for the entirety of the evening.- Dessert menus were handed to us, but orders never taken.  We were given the bill while a few people actually wanted dessert.  - We were seated next to the only heater that was non-operational.  Many family members froze their chi-chi's off.  When we asked staff to fix it, they said, "Oh that one is broken.  It will probably do that to you all night."  WTF?  Why seat people there then??The Ugly:- My cousin who got the short end of the stick for the most part, repeatedly asked for a manager with the server.  We did not see one until almost half an hour after (who actually resolved the issue.)  One person who looked like they might be of relevance came out, but just went to my cousin's wife and ran off before my cousin got a chance to speak to him.  So you can imagine, he was good and hot by the time a manager actually took the time to speak to him.  The Recovery:The manager was actually a nice, understanding woman who, as I understand, took care of a portion of the bill.  The gesture was very much appreciated, and I give her credit for her professionalism as my cousin did not go easy on her at all (as he was considerably wound up at the time, and works as a culinary school instructor so I'm sure every misstep was very acute in his eyes.)  I myself used to manage large restaurants, and I can respect what it feels like to be on the receiving end of a very angry guest.  Her response was commendable.

Reviews.Author: Lucy C.
Reviews.Content: I stopped by for drinks last night, and while this may seem obvious, this place is amazing.  Great views, great drinks, and see Nicole for outstanding service.

Reviews.Author: Clark F.
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful birhday gathering here with friends! Was a bit surprised that they don't serve dinner on Sunday, but we still had a wonderful time enjoying the amazing view, atmospher and cool vide that Perch offers. Fun, relaxed and all of the appetizers were good.

Reviews.Author: Jane D.
Reviews.Content: A-Ok, review. I booked a reservation online for my husband and I's anniversary, thought that was pretty convenient and easy, It even had a section where you could add notes or ask questions, ran into a problem there, it took a while to get a response to my questions and even then they were not fully answered so I decided to call in and speak to someone (no better line of communication than directly talking to someone, so I thought) I had help from a hostess that assured me I was going to have the best table in the house, out doors, in front of a fire place, a more intimate quiet area for our anniversary celebration! So I was stoked about that! She also helped me changed my reservation to a later time, which was easier than dealing with changing it on line, I also wanted a special dessert to be brought to the table without ordering it, she said she would talk to the chef and get a direct answer and call me back before the end of the night...well, That didn't happen. I called back the next day and couldn't get through to anyone so I resorted back to email, I did get  a response from a Melissa who assured me she had everything set and ready to go just as I requested! The night of our reservation is upon us and the building is super neat! convenient valet for 8 bucks! a really nice door man to direct you up to the top floor! Great looking crowd, the ambiance was great! I tell the hostess I have a reservation for 8:30 her and another man kind of stare at some sheet for a while, she asks if I want inside or outside, I then reply with, we had a "special" table reserved we're here for our anniversary and she kind of seemed a bit confused on where to put us, she then takes us out side to a private little sector or the restraunt  and sticks us in this small little table NEXT to the fire place table we were suppose to have, like I was told on the phone. I was quite irritated about that seeing as how that was obviously the better table and we were getting stuck with the less appealing table. I started to say something about it, they apologized. No big deal we were going to get on with the night...The view was beautiful! The seating was a bit uncomfortable as it was a pretty tight space, there were three other tables out on this small patio and although intimate, if you're sitting next to an obnoxious drunk couple making out the whole time and talking very loudly about obscene things well then....your romantic atmosphere is SHOT! (That's what we had to deal with) The entire dinner I was just waiting for them to leave...not to mention they were the ones that snagged our table...So i was extra irritated. The lighting in that particular seat is non existent so it was hard to read your menu, we had no silverware, the waiter was a bit un-noligable about the restaurant and menu, he kept trying to rush us, and that was a bit annoying. We had to keep asking for things, he wasn't so bad but definitely could step up his server game! We started with Salads, both great! and then the main course, Steak Frites and short ribs, I LOVED my steak frites and my husband thought the short ribs were so-so. For the price I will say I was expecting a bit more, but It was a lovely evening, we enjoyed ourselves. I would like to come back another time and be closer to the live band and be in the mix of the restaurant a bit more. They did manage to remember my special dessert I had ordered and it was REALLY good, I think it was creme brûlée with vanilla ice cream. Super tasty! I would recommend this restaurant but If you're having a special event I would arrive a bit earlier then your reservation to make sure you are getting exactly what you are anticipating, because if not, it kind of puts a damper on your evening.

Reviews.Author: Richard C.
Reviews.Content: what can  I say about this place ... you have to come and check it out the food is great service wonderful and the view awesome i recommend bringing your significant other to share this with

Reviews.Author: Syv P.
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I decided to have my birthday brunch here. The ambiance, food and service were amazing.  My friends and I are all HUGE fans of Perch now!  I'll definitely be visiting again soon.Tip: The Truffle Fries are sooo Yummy!

Reviews.Author: Joe P.
Reviews.Content: My favorite bar to hang out now that Casa is closed. The rooftop bar is way cool. I met some of the friendliest people. I have not had the food, but I definitely like this joint to hang out

Reviews.Author: Sean C.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view.  Decent drinks and bartenders.  Great spot for a date.

Reviews.Author: Sydnie B.
Reviews.Content: Went here for my birthday on Sunday.  It wasn't too busy because we got there when the kitchen had closed so we just sat and talked and drank.  The waitress started off super helpful and she could tell out little group was eager to eat so she assured us that she would put in our order the second the kitchen opened up.  Little did we know that meant taking our order 15 minutes after the kitchen had already opened.  The food was okay, but I was definitely still hungry.  Our waitress only checked on us maybe once...if that. We had to ask to get more water, multiple times.  We had also asked for a dessert menu after we had finished eating, but I don't think she heard us because she never brought one. We let the manager know that our table was feeling neglected and that our waitress wasn't doing a very good job.  It wasn't busy and there seemed to be more than enough people working.  Even if she didn't hear us say we wanted the dessert menu, she still had us sitting there doing nothing for at least 25 minutes. It started off great and the view was beautiful, but the poor service made me choose two stars.  I might go back, but just for drinks on the roof.

Reviews.Author: Sheila M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely in love with this place. I've been here twice and both visits met my standards to come on back for more. Not only is the venue is absolutely adorable with its French theme but the view is awesome. (Come during the sunsets... You won't regret it!)The first time I came here was for a dinner date night with my boyfriend. I've heard of this place from one of my gfs. The view was beautiful and the service was great! Atmosphere is intimate and very chic LA with live jazz to entertain you. As for the menu one of the things we ordered, that we will never forget would be how freakin' yummy their BREAD PUDDING was! Gees. It was something me and bf kept talking about since we both have a big sweet tooth. We have tried many sweets and bread puddings in our day and ... Goodness this was an awesome one!!  & highly recommended. As for my second experience at the Perch, I planned a birthday Sunday Brunch with 12 of my bestest gfs. Please be aware they can't make a regular reservation for such a large party. I spoke with one of the events coordinator, Jamie Lagoyda. She's an absolute doll! She returned my phone calls with the quickness and as well set something up for all my guests as they arrived. This was all done 4days prior to the date I reserved it for. Hands down they took care of us and it was definitely hassle free. I've planned plenty dinners with a large group of friends and this by far was the fanciest that we've ever gone. It was very impressive, memorable and within budget!  :) please believe it!! I wish I could remember the name of the guy that made sure everything was ok the day of for Jamie... He was very sweet and welcoming. Hands down The Perch La really impressed me both in a simple dinner date aspect of things and as well as an event coordinated aspect. They aren't the uptight -fancy-pants-too cool for school type of staff .. They are definitely the jazz cool/welcoming&stylish type staff :)You'll definitely see me back here for more!

Reviews.Author: monica m.
Reviews.Content: ***Restaurant review only, not the bar***I usually start my reviews by going on n' on n' on about the space and decor and blah blah blah but for this, I have to start with the food. It was that bad.Perch is marketed as an upscale French, classy restaurant in downtown Los Angeles. Well,....it is in downtown LA but that's about it. I came expecting at least the likes of Comme Ca, Papilles or Le Comptoir. I was sorely disappointed. This was over-sauced, overdone yuck food. (I recognize how immature that sounds but really can't come up with anything more accurate.) We started off with the baked brie (brie wrapped w/ puff pastry served w/ pesto cream & baby salad). I think it's quite difficult to mess up baked brie because even Trader Joe's does it right! It was a circular pastry, appropriately flaky but lagking in that buttery goodness. There was scant amount of brie baked inside and was served room temperature and thus, was congealed. Baked brie is supposed to be warm, flaky and simply oozing warm brie goodness; this dish was none of that. The best part were the scattered heirloom tomatoes on the side of the plate. The day I choose pretentious tomatoes over a baked cheese pastry is a bad day.Bummer but chin up, because we had frog legs on the way! I have only had frog legs at Papilles (deliscious btw) and was excited to try Perch's version which was buttermilk marinated frogs legs tossed in house made buffalo sauce w/ blue cheese sauce. Ummmm, I could've sworn they were serving buffalo chicken wings from Pizza Hut! It was so disgusting, I took it personally. The sauce was very, very strong, obliterating any benefit the "buttermilk marinated" step may have had on the frog legs. The sauce was so overpowering, it could've been slapped on anything; chicken wings, frog legs or tofu cubes and the dish would've tasted the same. Yuck.Ok fine. So no luck with the starters but the highlight of the evening was yet to come; the entree. I went with the salmon on a bed of lemon thyme risotto and topped with caviar & chive maderia cream. Sounds amazing, right? Wrong. Uugghhhhh. The salmon would've been fine-nicely cooked, but it was simply dripping with the caviar and chive cream which was extremely salty and too strong for the delicate flavor of salmon. The risotto? same story. It was like a lumpy bed of salt. We didn't even bother with dessert.Again, keeping in mind that Perch is advertised as one of LA's finer dining establishments, the wine list was much like the food- it didn't live up to the reputation. It was average, at best, but heftily priced. The service added insult to injury. Everything took so very long and that's just the necessities- taking our drink order, taking our dinner order, serving any food and bringing the check. Any service beyond the previously mentioned basics, did not exist. Our waiter did not stop back to offer us a second glass of wine. Our entrees were served by someone else and our waiter didn't bother to stop over to see if we needed anything to accompany our meal or to see how the food was.The only thing nice to say is that space is beautiful. I'm too disheartened by the experience overall to muster the energy to describe it, but it's certainly worth checking out. Just sidle up to the bar for a drink. Having said all of these bitchy things, it was so pretty here that I WANT to like it. Maybe brunch is better? Can they mess up eggs, french toast and mimosas?

Reviews.Author: Erin B.
Reviews.Content: Great location and atmosphere...service was a little slow but ambiance made up for it. There was a bus boy names Paul Hughes who was very attentive and came by to assist. This young man should be promoted to a server. Great personality and even sang a song for us :)

Reviews.Author: J J.
Reviews.Content: Despite coming in with reservation, Perch staff had us wait. We came one Friday in Feb and everything was in disarray.  The doorman on the ground floor was rather threatening than helpful when he told us that they were only taking cash that night because their "system was down". We should have heeded that, because it was just a start of a totally disastrous evening.Upon checking in upstairs, we were told to wait, as we were about 20 mins early. When I saw the hostess bringing in walk ins 15 mins later, I thought I'd ask how our reservation was looking. She looked at me blankly as though it was the first time she's seen me that evening. Later when we got to our table, I was able to appreciate, or somewhat appreciate the view Perch is known for- I read about them thru Conde Nast.  However, we were made to wait 10 mins to be even given the slightest acknowledgment - " I'll be back shortly" - says the man I'm assuming was in charge of our table. 10 more minutes and he seemed real busy. At that point I've soaked in the Downtown LA view and was ready to move on- after all it was already 1030 pm and dinner had yet to be served. We left hungry and frustrated but happy we got a warm welcome and great food and service in a nearby steakhouse. Oh what a night.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa H.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a private party on the roof deck on a sunny Sunday afternoon. Amazing views of Angels flight and downtown.  Servers offered up mini lamb burgers, mini sausages in buns, fruit plates, cheese plates, wines -- yum!  Cool decor.  You will have to take two elevators - the elevator button marked with a tiny gold bird to indicate where to go. Apparently too cool for lettered signs.

Reviews.Author: Christy G.
Reviews.Content: I liked this roof top restaurant. I took my girlfriends there for brunch and enjoyed the atmosphere. I also went there to have drinks and listen to live jazz. Its not just food that makes this place special.Its location it unique. Although parking may be at a distance, it is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Shirley H.
Reviews.Content: Lounge review ahead! LA needs more lounges like Perch. As other yelpers note, the venue itself is lovely and has great views of LA, but more importantly, this place is super chill. There's no cover (even for guys), no denials of entry in general, and the music and noise levels aren't so loud that you can't hear a word the person next to you is saying. Crowd is mixed but leans towards young and trendy, with girls wearing anything from skinny jeans and sandals to cocktail dresses. Guys should probably stay dressier to keep it classy. You can alternate between spending time on the restaurant level (a mix of indoor and outdoor) and the rooftop deck. Drinks are expensive as they always are in LA. My best tip (if you haven't read my quick tip) is to get here early, before 10 PM if possible, or you will end up spending most of your night in line. Perch gets full pretty fast, and they don't like to pack people in. I would shoot for 9:30 PM. Other than that, this is definitely one of my favorite drinking spots in LA.Edit: You can also come past midnight and there will usually be no line.

Reviews.Author: Whitney W.
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite bar in LA!  The rooftop views are incredible and the ambiance is just so lovely and warm.  They have my favorite drink- Kir Royales with maybe 10 different liquors to choose from- blackberry, strawberry, cassis, violet, peach, lillet, etc.  I just had to try them all.  Ok, not all, but maybe one too many.  Also, the truffle fries are probably the best I've ever had.  And they have an oyster bar on the roof as well which are fresh and so tasty.  Will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: Perch is an excellent choice in restaurants if you're headed Downtown. Let's just start off with the amazing views of the city (because it is rooftop). You get to take this very "exclusive" feeling elevator from street level up where you're guided to the restaurant/bar area to either hang out for a very well-made drink or sit down for a nice dinner. The bartenders are awesome and really know their mixology and the waitstaff is both friendly and knowledgeable when it came to the menus. Overall excellent service.You have a choice to sit inside on an eclectic set of antique couches for more of a group, yet intimate setting or you can sit out on the patio to take in all the views (there are heat lamps don't worry about cold nights). Either, a great choice. The food is delicious as well. I've had quite a few things on the menu, none of them I regret ordering. I completely forgot to mention they've got another level to the VERY rooftop. Just a bar, no food service. But it's such an awesome space. I have nothing negative to say about Perch. Definitely check it out for yourself!

Reviews.Author: Thom H.
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful gem in the heart of downtown. I made a reservation after seeing Perch in Sunset Magazine. It didn't disappoint. Super friendly and fun service, and a true city view. Next time I need to impress a date, I'm heading here.

Reviews.Author: Lin Lin S.
Reviews.Content: the reason for 5 stars is the ability to dine outside on an elevated level with a pretty view of DTLA (you're not just looking at the roofs of dark buildings, but you can also see the lit up skyscrapers and of Pershing Park). BUT bring a jacket since LA weather at night tends to drop about 5-10 degrees. next time, i would like to come earlier in the evening to catch the sun setting colors in the sky. high ratings also go out to the food: broccolini salad with poached quail egg and proscuitto (drizzled with a light vinaigrette), and the deconstructed boeuf bourguignon (large chunks of beef and a little bit of pork belly on the side) was so flavorful and tender as well! it could've use a bit more sauce but nonetheless, this is a hearty satisfying dish of rich savory flavors. i love braised meats. This is a great place for a small dinner (perhaps 2-4 people) on the patio, but also great for bday get togethers (they have an outdoor fireplace, but also indoor couches/tables/bar seats for groups to gather with a multitude of libations (cognac and scotch were popular among the males). outdoors is more for dining, indoors is more loungey.

Reviews.Author: michael r.
Reviews.Content: Went for dinner on a Saturday night. The decor is lovely, the view is fantastic, our waiter was animated and attentive, the cover band on the balcony was good and not overly loud, and the place is generally a treat.  The food?  Mediocre at best.  It wasn't bad; there was just nothing wonderful or even memorable about, and the portions are pretty small for the price point.  They do allow wine for a corkage fee of around $25, but if you bring a good bottle (or several as we did), it works out in your favor.  I'd go back, but I'd probably stick to drinks and appetizers and that wonderful view.

Reviews.Author: Katy N.
Reviews.Content: Went to the Sunday afternoon party, complete with Mario Cotto from KCRW, and it was fabulous, but will be much better once Perch starts serving brunchy food and (please!) Bloody Marys! And once it starts warming up more...for now--bring a sweater! It's breezy on the roof.

Reviews.Author: Flo F.
Reviews.Content: I went on the weekday for dinner. The view was wonderful. Waitress was great. Everthing was great except for the food. The cheese and meat platter was pre cut. Cheese should not be dry. Meat dry. If it was cut on the spot it would taste and feel different since cheese sweats. It's obvious that it was pre cut and left in the refrigerator. So we exchanged it for mussels.  The second it was brought over. ..the smell of the sea hit or faces. I approached the manager to let him know the problem. He said he will call me to discuss the incident. He had my name and phone number. ... over a week and I received no courtesy call. I like the ambiance and the service but I assumed that it would be a great all around. Very disappointed. Management service was horrible since they lied about giving me a call back. So unprofessional.  They are lucky I gave them any stars.  People here seem blinded by the life and know nothing about how food should be presented and they maynot know what fresh food Taste like orhow realsaid should taste like. I say this becausethe quality is super low but people are chasing the lifestyle that these people are wanna be's so the foodtaste ok since theydon't know better. These are not true foodies. Jaded by the life. Also. . A French restaurant without French onion soup. More disappointment. Horrible all around

Reviews.Author: Randy L.
Reviews.Content: Overrated. There was a long, oily hair in my napkin, which happened to be wrapped around my utensils. The experience was very discomfiting, that I did not enjoy my salmon crepes. I did not enjoy my bread basket. I was so afraid of someone spitting in the food, that I spat on my own food. Needless to say, it was all I could do to keep myself from hurling...um...myself....down into the churning DTLA morass below. Hair apparent. .oO (Grow up, you're not punny at all. Oh, but it's so much fun.) Please go to Takami instead. Get the view, minus Le Pew.

Reviews.Author: pauline c.
Reviews.Content: Food:The food at perch is good, but not worth the terrible service.  But first I shall detail the dishes, then dish on the details (ha ha ha, you like that?).  We started with a plethora of hors-d'oeuvres.  The formage plate was delightful.  Cheese paired with truffle honey and fruits.  Sadly, the cordon bleu poppers were not on the menu.  The fried brie was crispy, gooey in the center and came with the most delicious berry jam.  This was probably the best item we had.  The frog leg drumsticks were good though I expected them to pack more of a punch.  The fries were pretty good, though if you messed up fries I'd seriously be worried.As for the main items, the butternut squash risotto was a bit over cooked and a bit bland tasting.  This is coming from someone who doesn't eat much salt on a daily basis, so if I think it's not salty enough, then you've definitely got a problem.  The braised short ribs melted off the bones and were cooked pretty perfectly.  Good accompaniments and glaze.  The perch filet was also perfectly cooked and tasted like butter.  Service:Now here's where it gets upsetting.  They said they were understaffed for the night.  There was nothing past curt formalities to let us know of the situation, which was OK in the beginning.  They were a little more rude than what you'd consider typical "French" service, if that's the theme they were going for.  Our first round of drinks took about 40 minutes to come out, and food took even longer.  This had us scratching our head because they could at least bring the bread out.  Instead, they brought out 4 pieces for 8 people.  Was it supposed to be 1 per couple?  Anyway, shrugging that aside, we asked if they would bring out the chacuterie and cheese plates first since you'd think all they needed to do was to cut and place it and this could be done rather quickly (mind you, this was already almost an hour into waiting).  WRONG.  They must, in fact, be waiting for the cheese to ferment and the meats to cure.  It was bizarre because when we asked our server if she could check a couple times, she didn't really bother to come back to tell us.  Instead, she was actually rude and responded to our questions like we were children.  The tone was definitely not nice.  While I am typically okay with mediocre service for mind blowing good food, I can think of no excuses when we were polite and had to wait longer than an hour for appetizers to come out.  At least assure us the food is coming soon or say something nice, instead of rolling your eyes, right?After an almost $100pp meal, we then tried to go to the roof top (as did a bunch of our friends), to be turned away by the "security" saying it was max capacity.  By now, my friend was pretty upset since it was actually my birthday we were celebrating.  She went straight to the manager to complain about the bad service and terrible experience, and then we were let up to the roof, where, it was definitely not at max capacity.  There was something like 20 people up there.  If you're going to come for the scene, do your thang.  If you're going to come for food, good luck.  If you're coming for the roof top, arrive early or you aren't getting up there.  The views are definitely nice and it has a little more urban feel than wp24 and the standard.

Reviews.Author: Leah Fit W.
Reviews.Content: What get's better than a rooftop French lounge/restaurant with an beautiful city view, amazing food and great service? Absolutely nothing. The moment I walked into the Perch I was astonished that I've never been to this hidden gem before, the atmosphere makes you feel like you're literately a little bird on a perch in France, from the romantic decorative interior to our "serveuses" wearing french  attire. This is my new favorite restaurant and will be visiting very often!

Reviews.Author: Marcos C.
Reviews.Content: The view is intoxicating. Similar to the other rooftop bars in DTLA area.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly W.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were staying at a nearby hotel, looking for somewhere nice but laid back to hang out and have some good drinks, and we could not have found anything better than Perch.  We strolled over a little after 9 or so, and at first, I was worried we wouldn't be able to find seats because it was so crowded.  I spoke to a very polite hostess who explained that all the tables were reserved for the night, but we could sit at the bar or go to the other bar upstairs.  Luckily, we found a couple of seats at the downstairs bar a few minutes later, and we were very well attended to by one of the bartenders who made great suggestions and even better drinks.  The kitchen was open pretty late, which was great for our late night snacking on a cheese platter, and their food selection was impressively unique.  We ended up sticking around for a few hours, and when we finally paid our very reasonable bar tab at the end of the night, we walked home tipsy and happy.  Can't wait to come back!!!  (though probably will make reservations)

Reviews.Author: Steph C.
Reviews.Content: There's something about rooftop bars that seems to attract an unpleasant crowd.  The most obvious example of this strange phenomenon is the frat bro butthead demographic of The Standard downtown.  The clientele at Perch seems less overtly terrible, but I did see a man approach a table of about ten fresh off the plane Japanese girls.  He hit on them feebly while his friends made jokes about yellow fever that were not meant to be overheard or understood by any women, Asian or otherwise.  Aside from this group, the crowd at Perch was still notably different from that of other downtown bars -
