less hipster, less yuppie, but not necessarily worse.Matt B. and I came to Perch for after dinner drinks, and we were happy with the experience.  I didn't mind the multiple elevator trips, as they brought a sense of procedural grandeur to the entrance, whether intended or not.  We did a quick runaround of the lower level, which was dominated by diners, before settling ourselves at the very top.  There were no seats available, which was kind of annoying as there was plenty of space for more seating.  We made do by leaning.  Matt did not like when I leaned on anything close to the edge of the roof.  The view, though, was worth the minor inconvenience.  Downtown spread out around us, and it was remarkably pretty at night.  We took in all the buildings, old and new, and we had a bird's-eye view of Pershing Square in its holiday ice rink glory.  I'd recommend bringing out-of-town guests to Perch when they insist that everything about L.A. is ugly.The drinks were good and surprisingly reasonable.  The cocktail list was short, and I had a French Maid at the bartender's recommendation.  This had cognac, lemon juice, simple syrup, and muddled cucumber and mint.  The mixology factor wasn't quite the same as at The Varnish or like places, but the drink tasted great and it was $10, with the price of the view included.  Matt's Le Libertine wasn't as good, but it was still fine.  This was a French Manhattan with Maker's Mark and blackberry creme de mure.  It tasted vaguely medicinal, but it wasn't bad.  The bartenders were great, friendly and fast and handsome in oversized bow ties.I don't have a strong desire to eat here, but I'll come back for the drinks and the view.  There aren't many good rooftop bars around, so Perch will be my go-to when I want to drink close to the sky.

Reviews.Author: Lizzie S.
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake, Perch is a hot spot. Partially inside, partially outside with lots of seating options. Perfect people watching as you have patrons who are clearly local and people driving in for a night on the town. All sorts. The vibe is elegant and lively, accessible and youthful but still adult. Food was decent. Lamb sliders were delicious, steak was solid, very nice heirloom tomato and beet salad, coq au vin nuggets weird but tasty and the mussels were serviceable. Our waitress (Alex) was top notch, and every one else who assisted her in serving us was efficient and friendly. I look forward to going on a week night when there is a little less madness. Still, I would never say no to coming to Perch. It's yet another downtown winner.

Reviews.Author: Samantha B.
Reviews.Content: I love the view, the atmosphere and the jazz music! The food is good, but not great. A cool place to go in LA.

Reviews.Author: Patricia G.
Reviews.Content: My weekends normally go by so quickly that I never feel rested or recharged. This weekend was totally different. I went for lunch at Perch on Sunday, and felt like I had been on a mini vacation. The rooftop restaurant in December on a gorgeous sunny day is really without compare. The food was fabulous and the staff caring and attentive. I can't wait to share this experience with my friends. They have really created a unique amazing restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Diego M.
Reviews.Content: All around worth it. Classy. Respectful. Enjoyable- and the sunset view i had was ridiculous.!

Reviews.Author: Christina M.
Reviews.Content: Asian party seated next to us were the most obnoxious people ever. There was a point where one of the guys  was standing on top of the table and actually ran down the length of it. Not really sure why management didn't take initiative to stop that? And on top of that, the girls kept squealing every 5 minutes for no reason. Please. Just. Don't.

Reviews.Author: alek p.
Reviews.Content: Best rooftop in downtown. Good ambience, Great view of Pershing square. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Juan C.
Reviews.Content: Great service!..great food.....will def come again!

Reviews.Author: Maggie A.
Reviews.Content: First of all, I know the other reviewers are raving about it too, but what a view! Food was terrific, and the drinks, while not cheap, were delicious (and the bartenders were generous).

Reviews.Author: Nicole V.
Reviews.Content: Pros- The view- The decor- Cool place to hang outCons- The rude hostess that was outside last weekend- ServiceI will never, ever be returning to Perch. I went there for the first time last weekend to celebrate a birthday. We had called ahead the day before to make sure that a large party wasn't going on the next day to ensure that would get through the line in a timely manner. We ended up waiting in line outside for almost an hour and were told there there was indeed a party that would be ending at 10:30pm, and then we would be able to go in. People who answer the phones at this establishment should know when large parties are happening because we would've brought our business elsewhere had we known that we would all have to wait for so long. It gets worse. When we (a group of about 25 of us) finally got to the front of the line, I checked in on Yelp (did not write a review, just checked in), and apparently this pissed off the hostess? She proceeded to ask me if I was ok and I said yes and asked why she was asking (because I was fine, just a bit irritated about the whole line situation). Then, the bouncer says something along the lines of the following to me: "she has to ask if you're ok because we can't have you go in if you're too drunk." I was NOT drunk, and the fact that both of them reacted like this about me checking in on Yelp is embarrassing to them and insulting to me. Next, all of the girls were let into Perch. After I walked away, the hostess was talking behind my back (to MY friends) about how rude I was, how I shouldn't go in if I'm going to be writing Yelp reviews, and how I need to be nicer. I waited a week to write this review because I still honestly cannot believe that all of this happened. I'm generally a very nice person who doesn't complain, but this really put me over the edge. Also, if you can see that I'm active on Yelp, wouldn't you try to be nicer to me? When everyone finally got in, the credit card machines were down so the already slow service that I've read about on Yelp was even SLOWER. It's unfortunate that the outside hostess/service at this place are so bad because it's actually a cool spot that nobody in our group will be returning to.

Reviews.Author: Krystal K.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! I recently went to Perch for a friend's going away party and I have to say I was impressed. I never even knew this place existed. I first walked into the indoor seating area. You can get a drink and have a bite to eat. I didn't try the food but it looked good. I really enjoyed my drink and liked how their signature drinks were unique. Eventually I made my way upstairs to the open air lounge area. I loved how laid back it felt and the view was amazing. There was a few places to sit and not too many people. I always like to find new places that allow my friends and I to have a few drinks and enjoy each others company. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Nic d.
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend Perch enough.  If I could give it 10 stars I absolutely would.  I chose Perch as the perfect location to propose to my now fiance.  Downtown LA, the classic/art deco side, is special to us, and the views from the rooftop bar can't be beat.  It was the perfect spot. But, while the setting was perfect, I hoped the meal that followed would be as equally perfect.  I had never dined here, so I took a chance.  I couldn't be happier that I did.  While the views are memorable, it was the rest of the night that really made our evening magical.  The food: First up, the portion size is great.  This is not a restaurant that needs to wow you with oversized portions.  Oversized portions are just a chef's way of compensating for something.  The food here is well done, flavorful, and artfully plated.  My fiance's steak was cooked masterfully.  It had just the perfect amount of char on it to give it perfect flavor.  I had the short rib, which fell apart with the touch of a fork.  So the view and the food= five stars.  The service brings Perch up to 10 stars.  Everyone here bent over BACKWARDS to make my special night go perfectly.  Seriously, everyone went out of their way, above and beyond the call, to make my night amazing.  Camille, the manager, even went as far as getting them to rewire the sound system so they could hook up my ipod and play _our song_ as we sat down to eat!  That's a movie moment, and they made that happen for me!  Our waiter, Sean, gave us a night of the best service I think I've had at any restaurant.  We felt special, without feeling hovered over, and that's a hard skill to master.  They gave us a table with perfect privacy, and yet any time we needed someone they were RIGHT there.  I can't thank the team at Perch enough for making me look very very good on a day that my future bride and I will remember for the rest of our lives.  Now the wedding is going to have to live up to some very high expectations.  Perch sets the bar very very high.

Reviews.Author: Joe K.
Reviews.Content: I've gotta say, this place is really really nice.  I've been twice.  The first time was on a Wednesday night and we were easily seated.  The second time was on a Saturday night and we had to wait in a line to get up to the top patio but it wasn't more than 15minutes.  The view was amazing, the drinks were good.  As much as it could appear to be just another cheesy LA spot, it really is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jenna M.
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I own a place right across the street and decided to have my birthday dinner there....all I can say is holy crap this place was everything I thought it would be and more. Great food, amazing desserts, sweetest waiter and the atmosphere was dreamy. My new instant fave Thanx to the Must  gals for another winner

Reviews.Author: Lily K.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! It has an amazing view, great service, great drinks and a relaxing and beautiful vibe.  I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Author: Ed A.
Reviews.Content: The views alone are well worth the trip here. Located on the 16th and 17th floor. These are art deco buildings from when down town LA rivaled Hollywood for night atmosphere. You get amazing views of downtown LA. They have "the cucumber drink" which I don't know  what it is called, but that's how I ordered it. That is summer in a glass. It's crisp, refreshing.

Reviews.Author: Mindy H.
Reviews.Content: Valet parking is $10 and worth it in my opinion.  Back in the day, when I was still in my early twenties, I was still adventurous and well, quite the cheapass (read dumbass).  I'd drive around and around and even park on Skid Row so I could save a few dollars on parking. I'd have to walk by transients muttering violently to themselves while women with breasts bared would parade past me with long overcoats.  I'd even had a guy or two shadow me while I made my way to drink spots like the Golden Gopher or the Varnish.  Not this time.  Now I'll fork over a measly $10 for peace and safety.I went here for the second time on Friday.  The valet recognized me - how odd is that? He said he remembered me from last time because of all the stickers on my window.  Yes, they are parking stickers to the garage at school.  Thanks for reminding me that in just a few days' time, my last spring break will be over and I will be instead toiling away as a law student once more! But his observant eyes came in handy later when I came back to get my car.The elevator ride is a little odd - it's shaky, turbulenty and shuddery all the way up.  But once you get to the top (after pressing all the buttons with a bird next to them) you immediately forget about the jankyass ride because whoowhee the joint is swanky!  My girlfriend and I walked up to the top level and grabbed a few drinks, then meandered our way down to the maitre d' to ask for a table for dinner, but found out we needed reservations, so we snagged a seat near the door to the first level lounge.  We ordered white truffle cheese fries and the shrimp and grits.  It may have been because I was ravenous, but I didn't think the food was too bad.  The grits were creamy and thick while the large tiger prawn had a delicate snap, was fresh, and lightly sweet.  Mmmn.  The white truffle cheese fries were also crunchy, the truffle oil was apparent but not overwhelming nor lacking, and the cheese was pungent, salty, and rich.  I really enjoyed our little snacks whilst sipping on full bodied and tart wine.Overall, I really like this place.  I like that there is no cover and there is no dress code (ahem, I'm talkin' 'bout you, Edison Lounge).  I was discussing this with a friend of a friend I ran into while here - even though there is no dress code, the people who come are still dressed appropriately and look professional.  The crowd is also more 30s, but as I get older, I realize it's the 30 year olds who are the ones who know how to party. The place is spacious with outdoor seating and dining on the first level while there are lots of room to roam around upstairs (but you may have to wait in line to go up after a certain time).  There are also washrooms upstairs, so there is no need to leave your coveted seat behind to make your way down two flights of stairs to use the wc. The crowd is also very mixed and diverse, which is good for my girlfriend, who digs only white guys while I, admittedly, have a thing for Asians.In the end, as I was leaving, I was aghast to find that my valet ticket was nowhere to be found. But, as I mentioned earlier, the valet recognized me and brought my car around anyhow. I gave him a nice tip and though the night could have ended in disaster, it ended pleasantly and on a good note.  I'll be back - mayhaps for my birthday with the girls in the coming few days??

Reviews.Author: Jodi F.
Reviews.Content: WARNING: DO NOT COME HERE!I am going to start this by saying if I could give "0" stars I would... I have never been so appauled by an establishment in my entire life... Why you may ask?? Here's the scoop. I went to Perch for the first time to celebrate my friends birthday. It was a Thursday night. I rolled up around 10 or 10:30, pretty excited to know there is another rooftop joint DT.Everything was going great, the view was amazing, the beer list is decent, the service was ok (nothing to complain about.) We were having a great time and then all of the sudden the tables turned. Me and a few others had seperated from the group to catch a different view and smoke a cigarette. At that time, the bouncer came over and announced "Last Call." It was like 11:35. We all had full drinks and were debating on getting one more to close the night out. Before we could even finish our smoke, the bouncers came back to announce "Ok folks, you gotta go." We were definitely a little taken aback, they literally just gave last call 2 minutes ago. We got up and walked back to our group, followed by the bouncers. Once we get to our friends, he tells us again to hurry and finish up and go. I tried to talk to the bouncer, he wasn't having it. It got to the point where I asked to speak to a manager, he told me "No." I asked he bouncer "And your name is, sir?" "None of your Fucking business."WHHHHAAAAATTTTTT????? I had only had 2 beers at this point and luckily was able to keep my composure. I went to the bartender (still being followed by this ogre bouncer,) and asked for the manager. While I did this my girl (the birthday girl) went to talk to the owner about what was going on. Finally the manager came over, I explained what happened and the behavior of the "security." The manager offered no condolences and was basically like "what do you want me to do?" I told him that I didn't know what he should do, but that I was going to write a review about my experience here. The managers response: "You think I am afraid of a Yelp review?" Now, at this point I am done with the ogre who just cursed at me and I am done with the management, my girl is still talking to the owner and we are all waiting for her (STILL being harrassed by the security guards who are STILL rudely barking at us to get out.)Finally, I was done waiting, and I just wanted to get out of their before I lost it. My friend finally left the owner (who did nothing about the situation, NOTHING,. maybe because she was drunk... maybe she just doesn't care about her business and her customers)The owner of this place used to own The Must. Any DTLAer probably knows what a great place that was. Sorely missed when they closed (now I'm starting to wonder if The Stray Cat isn't so bad afterall...)Anyway, if you are looking for a rooftop spot DTLA stick with The Standard or Elevate or find a friend with a sweet rooftop at their apartment..... whatever you do, DO NOT GO TO PERCH!!!!!

Reviews.Author: D B.
Reviews.Content: Could I ask for a better 1st date spot?  No!  This was definitely a killer place to enjoy a charming possibility.  French influences are obvious at this roof top w/  LA's perfect weather.  Plenty of places to have an intimate conversation or if u want to dance - have at it or drink, flirt, flirt while people watching or maybe just bask in the incredible sights from this roof top.  Tsaziki (sp) sliders on crisp but soft thyme buns = yum to my tum and the baked Brie dish on top of pesto was killer.

Reviews.Author: James M.
Reviews.Content: Star Breakdown,Rooftop view: 2 starsService: no starsFood: no stars, or more fairly, N/AI had a table reserved for 10:15, arrived at 10:00, my friends showed up a few minutes later around 10:10.  We were finally seated at 10:30, at a table that was open the entire time we were kept waiting. I had walked by the empty table many times while checking out all the beautiful views of Downtown Los Angeles from the 15th floor.A server did not come to our table until we had waited long enough to feel annoyed and were about to complain, but suddenly He appeared to take our drink order. Surprisingly, the server discouraged us from ordering food because the kitchen was backed up and any menu item, from appetizers to desserts, would take at least 45 minutes to an hour to be brought out. Someone fire that guy. It must be hard to run a restaurant when your staff tells customers not to order anything because they will have to wait a long time. I was hungry too. So after finishing our one round of drinks, my friends and I departed ways in search of food. Some ate tacos, others ate cheeseburgers, but no one ate at Perch.

Reviews.Author: She W.
Reviews.Content: This place is great for brunch! One of my besties made the reservation here and wow, what a great view and the food was on par! Truffle cheese fries were really good and the crab benedict was tasty! I recommend for an excellent brunch experience.

Reviews.Author: Kurt V.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars... Can be a little bit stuffy and crowded on the weekends, but all things considered, its a fun and vibrant atmosphere for drinks or dinner with a rooftop view.  Good looking crowd.  Nice bartenders.  Good food.

Reviews.Author: Wendy C.
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to grab a sophisticated drink after work, have dinner with the boss or colleagues, or an have a sweet dinner/drink date with a lover. This place is swanky with a dash of urban city life. Dressy, classy, gorgeous city views. I had a drink called the French 24 or French 64, very refreshing, very nice. Also tried the chocolate mouse dessert, very rich, flavorful Drinks avg. $10. Street parking, or valet. The waitress was not the friendliest, but the waiters were very nice and good looking with their bow ties. The french euro dance music mixed with french soul was AMAZING! Will most def go back.

Reviews.Author: Jiyeon S.
Reviews.Content: beautiful rooftop, food wasn't amazing but good, service was mediocre.

Reviews.Author: Rod G.
Reviews.Content: Don t go

Reviews.Author: Jay C.
Reviews.Content: Another fantastic evening at Perch, every time I go here I feel like I'm in another city far away from the madness that is Hollywood.   The band was fantastic, great soundtrack to the night.  The manager Steven was amazing once again, totally made sure we were taken care of grabbing us a table and the such.  It just seems like this place runs smoothly and intelligently which for an LA spot is far and few between. One thing, I wish there were more seafood or veggie options on the menu, it's a bit limited.  See ya soon Perch!

Reviews.Author: Aubrey F.
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend here for her birthday. It was everything you could dream of - a tremendous view of downtown, fantastic old-school French inspired drinks, heat lamps, beautiful decor and a top-of-the-line clarinet/drum/piano combo playing some early 20th century favorites. I could not recommend this place more.

Reviews.Author: Peter L.
Reviews.Content: Review for saturday night lounge and drinks.  Came for a birthday party.  The view was amazing, the bartenders were awesome, and the people are dress properly.  I like going to places where people dress nice instead of the typical t-shirts and jeans.  A nice jacket with a tie can really get you good service. TRUST! Maybe I just went on a good day, but it was bougie and classy.  Had a great time here and would come back.

Reviews.Author: Robin S.
Reviews.Content: Good looking bar in DTLA but not so good looking patrons. Girls came off a bit rude and I have no idea why that is when they're are all so mediocre. Bartender was super slow and kind of snooty. Ick...

Reviews.Author: Maria G.
Reviews.Content: I ended up here for work dinner. I am pregnant, so I cannot comment on the bar or on the drinks. What I can comment is on the food and service. Let me go straight into the details:(1) We were seated, and had to wait about 10 minutes or more to get the menus. When we did get the menus, there was not enough to go around. (2) We had to wait another 10 minutes to have the appetizer order taken, which at the time, the waitress would not take our dinner order. (3) The appetizers were nothing special. Good fries, OK sliders. I could not have the tuna tar-tar & brie because of me being pregnant and all. (4) After the dinner orders were placed, the food was brought out 45 minutes later, and not all at once. The brought out 2-3 plates at a time and they were all were cold (5) I ordered the spare ribs on a bed of polenta. The meat was not bad, maybe because I was starving...but the polenta had to be the WORST polenta I have ever had. Polenta is a very simple dish, never thought I would complain about it. The polenta tasted as if they poured a whole cube of Knorr beef bouillon into my single serving. GROSS (6) My co-worker ordered the bouillabaisse, which according to my cookbooks and Wikipedia (yes I wiki'd it!!) is a stew with broth. Apparently, Perch has a different take on it because it did not have much broth. The ONLY reason we went to Perch was for this dish since my coworker (the one that ordered it the night was there) had it previously and raved about it. According the manager (WHO WE HAD TO SUMMON 3 TIMES AND FINALLY HAD TO TRACK DOWN PERSONALLY), the menu had changed...but since when has bouillabaisse changed??? STRANGE! The manager did offer to have another order made, but at this point the whole table was disappointed, and we just wanted to leave. We did not want to wait an hour for her replacement meal.  JUST AS A SIDE NOTE, THE TABLE BEHIND OURS WAS A FAIRLY LARGE PARTY, WHO SIMPLY WALKED OUT - IN DISGUST OF THE POOR SERVICE. We at least stuck around to pay our order, but we should have just walked out too. As you can guess by now, I will not be returning to Perch, nor will I recommend it to anyone; which is a shame because the location is wonderful. There are better places to go in/near Downtown LA, so no loss for me and those I know. I cannot see this place in business much longer if they do not improve their service. Once the hipsters find a new place to go drink, this place will be lost be lost (shame).That's it folks, thank you for reading.

Reviews.Author: Kasey E.
Reviews.Content: First off let me make it clear that I never made it to the second floor of the bar.  It was far too busy even though I tried several times from about 10pm to 12 on a Friday night.  I did wait about 25 minutes to get in and had a nice laugh at the "downtown resident line" that didn't seem to move any faster than my line.  The whole door situation was a bit to scene for me to be honest.  When I first arrived I got a drink without a problem but by the time I was ready for a second round the bar was 4 or 5 deep and I just gave up.  In general I was put off by what seemed like a extreme number of security guards and waiters trying to snake their way through crowds with plates of food.  The lower floor terrace was nice and they had a great live band that unfortunately ended around 10:15.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra G.
Reviews.Content: Went to dine here last night and was impressed from the moment I walked into the building.  I am a dork when it comes to buildings, so any old building that has been properly cared for rubs me the right way.Upon entering Perch - you are swept with a 1920s Paris dark room with a downtown view that will take your breath (& I say this being a location scout and seeing lots of views)  The vibe was busy as it was a Saturday night but it was perfect way to spend a Saturday.  The cocktails are excellent & creative.  The food was mouth watering.  Please have the mussels & the lamb burger.  I haven't been eating meat for a couple months & when I bit into that burger my mouth watered and it was worth not being veggie for a moment.  However, for the veggies out there - you have options here: great salads, a cheese fondue, pasta, etc.  I am interested to visit perch again on the weekday & check out a sunset happy hour. PS.  Must also say that the owner Coly was remarkable and made sure our eve was a special one.   Impressed.

Reviews.Author: Nancy B.
Reviews.Content: Well, can I just say how gorgeous and historic this place is?... Absolutely stunning views and I mean VIEWS of all of downtown... great firepits and fireplaces outside... and then there is another bar two flights up that is sort of a VIP thing with an alfresco bar and more firepits. Really lovely! I would like to go for happy hour next time... Monday through Friday 4-6pm. See you there!!

Reviews.Author: Palak K.
Reviews.Content: So we started the night kinda late since the trains weren't running on schedule. As we got here, there was a pretty obnoxious guy harassing the pretty gal at the front. The bouncer held his cool, and took care of business. He was attentive and didn't let the LOUD pretentious btards (excuse my FRENCH) ahead of us. Rico Suave of him to do so. Then we get about Half way up, and BAM, piano leading to another elevator. Interesting. Onwards to the rooftop lounge. Packed, awesome DJ who played Knightrider, so she instantly won my heart (since I'm East Indian). The bartender serves up his famous: My Fair Lady, delish. Next tender makes it happen with something lemony and basil-esque. I THINK SO! That made for an eventful night followed by some late night eats with the bestie and her hubba bubba! Schwarzenegger said it best: I'll BE BACK!

Reviews.Author: Yvette C.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a friend, on Sunday, for brunch. The food was very good and the oysters to live for! We shared the dish with egg beans tortilla, the steak medallions w/rosemary potatoes and eggs, French toast and 1/2 doz oysters (3 salty 3 sweet). The bubbly was 12$ per bottle, which had us feeling nice and bubbly! The band was good, the view was also and the bathroom clean. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is the service was REALLLLLY slow to start. Once she finally came service was friendly. I'll be going back in the evening!

Reviews.Author: Diana D.
Reviews.Content: Great view and good for drinks with friends.Food and service are mediocre.They have a French Bistro influenced menu, but their food doesn't use seasonal or fresh ingredients.  The fries are not french, more like the ones you get at Wendy's. Frites, I think not.The tomato salad didn't have the ingredients it listed on the menu, it was bland, and the tomatoes had no flavor at all.The service was spotty-took too long for the server to take my order and the items came in the wrong order.These kind of details are specific to my experience - that's probably not usually how the service goes, but if you're a foodie, skip the menu.I'd go back for drinks and the view.

Reviews.Author: Teresa T.
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the worst restaurants I have ever eaten in.  The service was horrible, the food was tough, and I could have made much better skirt steak for a fraction of the price.  Over priced and over rated, YUCK!!!!

Reviews.Author: Carla D.
Reviews.Content: Love love love the views... & the drinks are super yummy too!

Reviews.Author: JaimieLauren F.
Reviews.Content: Aaron the bartender makes phenomenal cocktails...and has amazing blue eyes too

Reviews.Author: Journey ..
Reviews.Content: Classiness, thy name is Perch. Excellent food, and excellent booze. Plus, you can't beat the view. Perch was started by the same visionaries responsible for The Must, and the attention to detail and love for quality is just as evident here as it was there. Enjoy a romantic dinner, and stick around for some delightful cocktails at the rooftop bar. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Diana J.
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised no one pointed out the stench of strong cheese? Did no one smell it? It smelled like borderline stinky feet :PI went Halloween weekend and came to Perch with "Psy" and felt very underdressed because the waitresses were wearing sexy costumes like catwoman and the other woman patrons were dressed in their saturday night best. I just came from a casual dinner that led to classier bar hopping.VIBE/PLACE:+The woman bouncer was nice and told us we can only go upstairs if Psy danced his horse dance LOL+No coverRESTAURANT/BAR FLOOR - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -+it was decorated kind of like a haunted building. Actually got the chills a little+Most of the workers were dressed up in costumes-bouncers/security act like they are protecting some royal person somewhere... +/-Majority of people that night in the restaurant floor were old. like late 30s, 40s, 50s. Seemed pretty classy-No seating available because it was busy+Live jazz music and singing. Beautiful view of the city with pretty strings of light everywhere.-bartenders are not personable at allROOFTOP FLOOR - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - --had to wait in line. people come down, you go up. Luckily the line wasn't too long+younger crowd up here-not much seating at all, so most people were just awkwardly standing with their drinks and just looking around. Wish there was more seating-small/limited bar, again bartender was not personable and not smiley-tequila shots were not cooled + but at least it was really smooth+beautiful view -The workers here act a bit pretentious...VERDICT:Best place to hang out at Perch would definitely be at the lounge area near the live music. If you like the older crowd and want to be classy this is the place for you. I'm sure this can be an intimate place but seemed like most people came in groups and were relishing the city lights; the vibe; the food; wine, beers, cocktails while dressed up quite nicely.I would come here if I'm dressed classy sexy and my friends and I just wanted to sit and talk while sipping pricey drinks in a nicely decorated environment with a killer view

Reviews.Author: Rosalyn E.
Reviews.Content: I had such a great time here last night. It's really cozy and beautiful. Then u get to the roof top and it's like the cherry on top of an amazing sundae. The service was excellent, music was good, and food was yummy. I can definitely recommend this spot.

Reviews.Author: sabrina c.
Reviews.Content: Really pretty bar and place to grab a bite to eat. The waiter was the most honest waiter I have met, we asked which white wine he recommended, and he said honestly most of them i am not familiar with because it has super long french names but these two over here are the most popular. It ended up being a good choice, so it was win/win situation. A really good place to impress on the first date.

Reviews.Author: Vivian C.
Reviews.Content: A lot of my friends have been talking about the Perch. So I finally went. I've been there twice already and overall I really like it. I love the environment because it's at the top of a building. I love how the building gives me this classical vibe because of the old school looking elevator and a random piano before you enter the 2nd elevator. Food there is pretty pricey, but fairly good. Although the blackened swordfish was a bit saltier than I wanted. The drinks are pretty good, but they're limited in choices because it's not a fully stocked bar. Be sure to make reservation because it's always packed there!!!

Reviews.Author: A B.
Reviews.Content: Awesome mussels! Good food! Should try this place out.

Reviews.Author: Maria R. G.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the view, it's beautiful! For food only I'd give 3, if that.  We had a fancy named French dish that I can totally do without next time. It wasn't bad, but then again it wasn't great. I would just recommend to come for the drinks & view.

Reviews.Author: Tony G.
Reviews.Content: Romantic lounge, food was really good, great view of downtown, good spot for couples.

Reviews.Author: Darwin B.
Reviews.Content: I had been promising to take my wife to the perch after friends said "You should take your wife. she will love it".  So I did.  it was a two block walk from my residence.  We walked in and the doorman called the elevator for us.  While we waited we saw an amazing aquarium with a white eel.  Pretty impressive. When we got on the elevator the doorman pressed 13 and when we got there it was a transition floor where we  got on another elevator to go up to 15, and that's where the Perch was.  This place was like being in someones home, Albeit a great home with an amazing view of Los Angeles.  There was a combination of large and small dining tables and couches with coffee tables.  A combo of living room and dining room with a very nice bar in the middle. Very warm tones and colors.  there was also outdoor seating, where there were heaters, fire pots and even a fireplace.  And again both dining and relaxed seating. I showed my wife the views and she thought that it was amazing.  We then went up the stairs to the roof. where there was more relaxed seating with heaters and fire pots. and oh yes, an even more amazing view of Los Angeles. We sat there and ordered cocktails and took in the view.  All so very nice. Afterwards, we made our way back to the 15th floor and ordered some lamb sliders. They were simply amazing, Made to perfection.  I highly recommend them to anyone who likes hamburgers.  We sat there and talked and laughed and ate and had an amazing time.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer G.
Reviews.Content: I hope that people will give this venue a chance.  It just opened and they are trying to iron out the kinks.  As with any new venue you have to see what goes wrong first and improve with time.There was a lot of money, time, and passion that was put into this venture.  They have to right people in place and patrons should be patient.

Reviews.Author: edamame f.
Reviews.Content: this place has such a pretty perspective of downtown.  it feels like you're in paris, on a highrise rooftop, with LA weather!  Shazzam!!We had a great time for my wifes bday.  there were 4 of us and everyones food was great.  I loved the Perch au Noisette, which was really nicely done.  I'm also a Caesar Salad snob and this one made the grade.  I've learned over the years that service hiccups are usually present when places first open and are described by other reviewers here, even though ours was good to go!i'll be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth T.
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot and great addition to the growing downtown bar scene. What was the most remarkable difference for us whenever we pop by perch is the how smoothly we always get our drinks and how great all the staff is - not to mention it's just a generally fun but chill locale. Big ups for perch.

Reviews.Author: P S.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view. Great food. The bread pudding was really good too.

Reviews.Author: Marco N.
Reviews.Content: Great space! Beautifully designed and great city views. Just a cool place to have a drink with friends, or make new ones with the supper cool staff.

Reviews.Author: Robert D.
Reviews.Content: The perch has 2 levels. Located on Pershing Square, the top floor of the purchase has an excellent view of downtown. I came for a DTLA meetup and had a great time. Clientele is classy, it's not packed, and a panoramic view of the sunset that our polluted atmosphere makes so beautiful. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Author: Beatriz U.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came here on a Friday night at around 10 PM to grab a couple of drinks and check the place out. I've never gone out in DTLA and this place was a great first time out there! We waited outside the building for about 30 minutes before being let up through countless floors up the elevator (a useful yelp review mentioned to just follow the bird. it'll make sense when you're there!) to the bar/restaurant. Then we were told we had to wait in another line to go to the rooftop bar. If you're in good company, the time goes by really fast and we were able to go in within about 15 minutes. Upon reaching the rooftop bar, I was pleasantly pleased! There was a live band playing covers of hip songs below at the restaurant and the music echoed to the bar. I ordered a mojito, which I watched the bartender make. Though I know he put lots of Bacardi in it, I could barely taste it--I thoroughly enjoyed the drink! I also tasted my friends' tequila sunrise and rum&coke -- all with bursting flavors and just enough alcohol. Needless to say, the expensive amount you're paying for your drinks is compromised by its taste and the experience you get when you're there. There's plenty of lounge-y chairs, rocking seats that all face the view of DTLA. There's nice places to just stand also. It's a nice place to see and be seen and to just BE, catching up with friends with tasty drinks in hand. As the night got later, more people came. The crowd is also a mixture of twenty/thirty-somethings. Attire is hip-classy or businessy. If you look like you just came from work, you're good. This is probably not a place to get drunk (as it'll be quite expensive and let's keep it classy please), but a place to just kick back and relax with a few drinks!

Reviews.Author: R R.
Reviews.Content: Adequate food (sort of), horrible service, all the attitude and little reason for it.  Wear Armani and perhaps they'll treat you like a person.If you want a drink and a great view not a bad place.  At some point someone will buy the place and it'll be great.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth F.
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Perch on a Friday night.  We were able to get reservations for dinner in the restaurant that was located below the rooftop bar.  We had appetizers and they were all delicious!  The lamb sliders were especially good.  The service was excellent.  During dinner there was a slight mishap and some wine was spilled -the waiter and manager were both very sorry and to make up for the mishap the manager took us up to the rooftop bar and bought us a drink.  It was very generous of the restaurant.  The rooftop space was fantastic! The night was clear and with the music from the GREAT BAND-who was playing on the deck of the restaurant below -it was magical!  I would recommend going earlier than we did as there is an issue with how many people can be on the roof so if you don't go early then you have to wait in a line at the bottom of the building to get in.Overall a great experience and I would go again!

Reviews.Author: Kristopher V.
Reviews.Content: I came here for happy hour but the drinks at the bar didn't seem any cheaper. Our bill was over $50 for four drinks. I ordered the Jacques Collins which hit the spot. The view was pretty spectacular and I highly recommend you come her at least once.

Reviews.Author: Amy K.
Reviews.Content: Came here on the fricking day of the mayday demonstrations, which btw in the future I say to everyone, avoid at all if possible. It was a huge mistake coming down here.After a long company meeting, we came here to have dinner. Parking was SUCH a bitch. Street closures, cops stopping pedestrians, weird ID checks, the fucking works. I saw there was parking near the building on 4th and Hill (the lot) but the cops wouldn't let me park there and told me to find another lot so what am I going to fucking do? Disobey the cop and go back to Canada? SIGHHHH so we parked another block down. So my coworker and I would've only had to walk TWO blocks to the Pershing building but EFF the cops also blocked us again, said no pedestrians, so instead we had to walk FIVE!! additional blocks up the hill and back down the hill so we could go where it wasn't blocked. The atmosphere wasn't exactly the most pleasant because there were helicopters hovering above, loud music, screaming, misc noise just coming from below and above. Also, one complaint I had was that they had the music SO loud, their little french jazz or whatever that I couldn't really carry on a conversation without semi shouting and straining my ears to hear what others were saying. However, the food was decent. The baked brie was good, but not as Brie-ish as I would've liked, the brie was warm inside, but not enough that it was a little bit melted and gooey. We also had the truffle fries which were good taste-wise but texture-wise a miss. They were extremely soggy and not crunchy. I could definitely taste the truffles, but there was also like cheese melted into it making them soggy so it was just overall kind of eh. The cheese and charcuterie plate was good, especially enjoyed the one white goatish cheese. I ordered the caviar salmon which was the best thing I'd eaten that night. The salmon was cooked perfectly and was moist. The caviar provided just the right amount of saltiness. The lemon thyme risotto could've definitely been cooked more, because there were parts where the risotto was really hard and chewy, seemingly undercooked. The Bouillabasse looked really good and I had a bite of fish from my budbud and it was tasty.Also had two bottles of malbec and a syrah-pinot blend called c'est la vie, but the malbec was much better I think. Overall, simply A-ok.

Reviews.Author: Pam R.
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Perch on a Sunday afternoon.  We had already eaten nearby but while walking around downtown L.A. came across this palce.  What a great surprise.  The host & hostess were very welcoming. They greeted us right away as we stepped off the elevator. The host asked if we wante dto sit indoors or out.  We told him we were just going to have cocktails, & he still gave us a choice.  We decided to sit at the bar.  Great service, fabulous views,  The bartender was also very friendly; she gave us some nice suggestions for cocktails, & checked on us several times even though it was pretty busy.  Nice looking brunch, lunch & dinner menus.  It was nice to see people dress up for a Sunday afternoon. We look forward to having a meal at Perch.

Reviews.Author: matt b.
Reviews.Content: Great view and open space.  Bar on roof top was fun and lively.  We had dinner and it was great.  I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Alice W.
Reviews.Content: Gave it 2 stars for the view. Service was alright except the day after, MY CREDIT CARD WAS CHARGED TWICE! I called and the manager told me its common to do that ?!?! But the other charge should "fall off in about 5 days" so they're holding my funds for no good reason for FoUR days?!?!  Food was subpar -- mussels were overcooked and tiny (size of my thumbnail) and their steak frites was bone dry thin and overcooked with the fries soggy. Where the hell did they learn to ruin French far this way and call it edible?! Just gross. Go for a drink on the terrace. Save your money for a real restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Brenda S.
Reviews.Content: Came here twice.  Once in the top floor and once in the level below.  Both great views, no difference at all really.  Never really tried their mixed drinks...had a white wine there once which was good.   Great way to see dtla

Reviews.Author: P Y.
Reviews.Content: Perch is an awesome place to try if you are in L.A. My boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary in the evening and the view from the rooftop was beautiful. The server was very friendly and made some great recommendations for us while we were there. Personally, I wasn't a huge fan of the drink menu (or maybe it was just the drink that I got) but the food and dinner menu was awesome. I got the Duck Confit which was fantastic and my boyfriend the The Pan Roasted Chicken Supreme which I thought was also very good. For dessert we tried White Chocolate Bread Pudding which was also amazing. Definitely a great place to try with great ambiance. However, I will say that the inside of the restaurant where the bar is is VERY loud, if you want to have a more romantic evening I would highly suggest securing a table outside. Perch is also a bit on the pricey end -expect to spend $100 plus for two people (assuming you get drinks and possibly an appetizer).They also have live bands play outside which is nice :)

Reviews.Author: Christianne R.
Reviews.Content: The drinks were good, but the food was average. More disturbing though, is the fact that I was charged for a drink that was not mine and was never reimbursed. The shift manager tried to revise  but the bank says it never went through. I can never get anyone on the phone so I wrote their website and sent copies of my restaurant receipts and bank statement and a month later still have never heard back. Granted it is only $15 I am out, but still this seems very unfair and unprofessional for them not to correct. Sorry Perch, you are now on my "never going back" list.

Reviews.Author: Dawn G.
Reviews.Content: Perch LA: BrunchUtter Disappointment... (Based on Meal Alone)There are restaurants with tons of hype, especially throughout Los Angeles. With a surge of talent and culinary variation, to be such an epic letdown is something I find nearly unforgivable. There is a great deal of talk of how amazing Perch is, how extraordinary dining there is, and while I cannot deny the plausibility of such an exquisite location, their Brunch Chef needs to care FAR MORE about what is sent out. (And let me just say I'm not alone.) Sure, every chef has an off day but...We order the champagne: Pol Clement with a side of pureed peach. Without missing a beat, Paul disappears and soon reappears with an ice bucket, a bottle, two glasses, and the peach puree. He pops the cork and pours it effortlessly but once the glass is filled, we realized we need a stirrer. As we surveyed those around us who had ordered the same thing, it seemed that was the one little necessity this cocktail warranted. (So Perch LA if you're reading this, suggestion would be to serve the Bellini with a glass stirring stick that goes with your lovely vintage theme...)Now as our appetites long to be fed, we begin with asking about the oysters. They're not available - in the process of finding a new supplier. We go with the salmon tar tare as well as their wedge salad. The salmon arrives and it can be summed up by saying it was a cute idea: the salmon, bread, quail eggs, and avocado compote is resting on the plate creating the "visual" a little "food" man.I take the bread, smear on the compote, put the shiny salmon atop it and ice it with the half of a quail egg. First bite: way too gummy, not enough citrus, and a strange barrage igniting an unfortunate lack of flavor. The aftertaste was like someone left the slimy guts of the fish and forgot to actually get rid of the waste. It wasn't good. And I really wanted it to be because it was presented so playfully, which I appreciate. Next - the wedge salad. While I love a good salad, at a restaurant like this, I find it highly lackluster to have to even make the next comment: at least the salad was good. Well, at least at the first couple of bites were before the sun began to completely misappropriate the lettuce, overheat the buttermilk dressing, and rob a salad that may have actually been - dare I say, great - no ... no, I don't dare say. But, this really was the best dish of the entire meal. (And while the heat had its way, I ate almost every bite and it was good ...)As we contemplate (rather hesitantly) what exactly we are going to order, we decide to share the "two filet medallions served with mushroom and rosemary potatoes". We spark up conversation w the two gentlemen sitting beside us. We saw their Eggs Benedict arrive and asked them how it was. Without pause, they looked at me and said, "AWFUL"and then the one gentleman said, "if I can be honest, it was the worst breakfast I've ever had" and then his friend chimed in to add, "I'm certain they used store bought English muffins and I mean the bargain brand". YIKES! The highlight was we sat down to an amazing duo shared Sangria and Bellini's and waited for our final dish to come. It did.Oh boy where to begin with this dish! The "filet medallions" looked like dried up pieces of meat that were NOT cooked medium rare with truly deplorable excuses of mushroom stalk resting atop them. The potatoes looked (and tasted) like day old leftovers and surprise surprise - not a sprig of rosemary in sight. I couldn't even take a photo - it was that ugly. Really? For a restaurant so notable, so revered, what in the world happened?! This was by far the worst brunch I have ever experienced. Thank god for alcohol!The only positives I can add are these: the server was wonderful, service overall was good, management was accommodating, the drinks were fantastic, but the meal was not even "Denny's" grade. A hundred dollars later, stomachs in disgust as the alcohol kills any further trace of bland and "over-hyped", all I have concluded is Perch is NOT where you go for remarkable food. Clearly this is where you go for exquisite ambiance, ear candy with an impressive selection of live music, and loads of mysterious cocktails by way of fun mixologists like Jenna who you can find perched in the bar nest above at the highest rooftop bar on the premises. So when you feel the urge to come the only day they're open for brunch, STOP and ask yourself, "Is this worth it? Is it worth the long wait? Is it really that good?" - Save yourself the trouble. The answer is a hearty - NO. It's not worth it. To my dismay, any longing I had to try dinner here has been snuffed out by my brunch experience which is a shame. So - Perch LA - you've got some undeniable work to do and I'd start with your standards of quality and taste. You are capable of MUCH better (PLEASE! Do us all a favor and rise to the occasion...)

Reviews.Author: Mony B.
Reviews.Content: I'm huge on Guest Service... And as a first timer here... I must say that tonight's evening team, in relates to the customer service was impeccable! From the bus boy to our waitress Jackie and to the manager Khoury or Corey for the complimentary dessert for the BDay girl And especially Tony.. He made the evening worth writing a review.. This amazing gentleman was extremely professional but made my first experience here at Perch a memorable one. I felt welcome and appreciative of my business... The ambience was sexy and modern with young professional occupying the lounge, a group of attractive people makes the venue more appealing to the young and mature single..  Highly recommend for a social gathering. Thanks again for a great experience!! -Mony

Reviews.Author: Sarah C.
Reviews.Content: View-PRETTY!!!! In between buildings...so nice! This place is so cozy! Feel as if I'm dining a small luxurious apartment! went to the bar first... Got some drinks... Then went for dinner! At this point, I wasn't at my normal state in mind cuz of the alcohol...SO... Everything to me was so tasty!! The lady recommended some fish? I forgot what the plate was called.. But it sure was good! Ad my hubby got steak! I took a couple bite of his and it was yummy!!!! I enjoyed my time there... Ambiance, view, food, service was all great... But then again, I wasn't in my normal state! Haha I think the bill for the food and drinks came out to be like $150? My hubb said that the food was blehhh...and the portions were small! It WAS small... Cuz when I got home, I was still hungry! And ordered a box of pizza! But from what I remembered, I had a great experience and would go back... SOBER!:)

Reviews.Author: Christopher L.
Reviews.Content: Fun place old school art deco building roof top bars and patios. Food and service where good

Reviews.Author: Jessica B.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the ambiance at Perch. The staff was very friendly. The truffle fries were amazing. i had the braised beef short ribs over polenta and the flavors were really good but as i ate more of the short ribs the majority of it was fat! after eating that bite i couldn't eat any more although the polenta that the short ribs were on was the best i've ever had. so overall i'd love to come back to try more dishes and this time be able to hang out at the rooftop bar as it was closed when we went due to the rain. oh and the band (went on a friday night) added the perfect touch to the ambiance. definitely coming back :)

Reviews.Author: Rae S.
Reviews.Content: I went to Perch about a two weeks after it opened. I had been searching for a new rooftop bar and thought I had found a gem. The elevators weren't even finished at the time. There were still slabs of test paint on the interior walls. Once you are inside the restaurant, you realize that whoever decorated the place is probably stubborn with terrible taste. They killed the authentic Art Deco elements of the building with the shabby chic Loews patio furniture. First, were seated at an outdoor patio woven coffee table that went below our knees. For dinner. We asked if we could have a regular table, like, a dinner table. When they moved us, my knees were hitting the legs of the woven table and Im 5'1. So uncomfortable for myself and my husband who is 6'2. His friend ordered the chicken kiev or cordon bleu, which came with peas. It looked and tasted like one of those children's microwaveable dinners. Clearly the food was frozen and poorly covered up. At over $30 a plate, I know I was just paying to stare into the amazing penthouse next door and imagine I was there.The drinks were good. Unique and strong, I like that. I have considered going back because of the drinks and the view.But I cant imagine waiting in line to get into that elevator which upon my first experience, was still under renovation. Hopefully they have gotten the rest together.

Reviews.Author: Manoj N.
Reviews.Content: After having food at Badmaash the Indian gastropub close by, my friends suggested going up to Perch and checking out the view from the top. So the 4 star review is only for the view of downtown LA from Perch and not for food or drinks. Great view and highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Christine A.
Reviews.Content: Wow, it's been a while since I wrote a review! But since my experience here was so bad & I want to let people know how much I didn't enjoy this place, I decided to write a review right away! I've been here for drinks & dessert. Loved it. Loved the view. It was definitely on my "good list".However, I recently came here for dinner & had a horrible experience!First, even with my reservation which I made about a week in advance, with a note saying I want outdoor seating, they said I cannot get the outdoor seating, where there were clearly open tables! I said I'd wait, but they said they are over booked. I actually had to wait for my friend for about 10 minutes, but they made me sit by the elevator, even though the table they gave me was few steps from where I was standing. Instead, I was given probably the worst seat possible with no view at all. We waited a bit, then asked again, and they FLAT OUT LIED TO US saying that the table outside that was open for a while is for a special engagement, for an anniversary celebration. But what did we see? Two guys dressed super casually, almost inappropriately for somewhat fancy place as Perch; no, they were not a couple which was way too obvious. More than anything, it was their super snobby, almost bitchy attitude that ruined it even from the beginning. Then the food. Okay, I already knew the food was bad, but all the "recommendations" were HORRIBLE! Especially the baked brie, which had NO BRIE whatsoever...Ummm... where's the cheese? Other food was bland and came out cold. But once again, fine. I already knew their food was not acceptable.To add to my horrible experience, my friend's water cup was broken and she almost cut her lips! But all they said was 'sorry' and took away the cup before we can sue them.Overall, please, Perch...You really need to step it up...I am sooooooooo tempted to give it a 1-star, but because I had an okay experience the first time, I will be generous and give it an extra star.

Reviews.Author: LO L.
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat this view and feel in downtown LA.  The drinks are a little pricey but this isn't a place you treat yourself to every week.  It's great for birthdays, dates, get together s, and other special nights!  The food is pricey as well, but everything I've tried has been delicious.  ( Swordfish, surf and turf sticks, ceasar salad, the chicken, steak frittes, braised short rib with polenta, and the  bouillabaisse.)  My only complaint is that the three times I have went, I've made reservations, and have had to wait more than an hour for our table.  They always have some excuse as to why our table isn't ready.  One, the band set up where our table was suppose to be, but the band is always in the same spot, so I didn't get that.  Another was, the party before you is finishing up their desserts.  Hmmm, one hour later than expected on a work night makes a difference.  So, reservations or not, you will end up waiting!

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: loving the vibe.. and the food ..couldve done better if they have more selection of bar drinks (most of the cocktails we requested they were out! even olives lol)service..is a hit and miss especially on busy days or nights

Reviews.Author: Andrea M.
Reviews.Content: Truffle Fries are a MUST! Bartenders are cool. Bartender Joel is quite attractive.

Reviews.Author: Annmarie B.
Reviews.Content: This ia a gorgeous place. The view from the restaurant outside is perfection on a perfect, warm Fall night. We celebrated a bday dinner here and the staff was really accommodating. Even though they were full, they still took us 20 minutes late (typical traffic, we should know better!) and gave us a great table, not punishing us. We ordered specialty drinks - the Lolita was really refreshing and I liked the Light and Balmy rum and ginger concoction. Our server was really sweet and not snobby. And we always had water in our glasses. The food is REALLY good - most memorable was the surf and turf skewers - yes please - again and again. And  you MUST have the white chocolate bread pudding. I think we were all fighting for the last bite. They didn't have candles, but actually, I don't hold that against them. It's not that kind of ambience but our birthday girl loved it anyway and felt spoiled and special here. Would definitely come here for a date night with the hubby. We didn't hit up the after dinner action there, as we had to get to another location around 10, but it was getting really crowded by then. All ages. Dress nice. It's not a casual place but with the spectacular view, your fancy self could only compliment it! Lastly, I don't think it is expensive, I think if you live in LA you are used to paying $13 for a drink and $13 for an appetizer at any place that is hot, happening and matters. Once you are seated, you really don't care. It's just that great of a place.

Reviews.Author: James C.
Reviews.Content: Go on a week night if you don't like waiting. I like this place a lot. Very cool atmosphere and view. Friendly professional staff. Food that we ordered was good and not crazy expensive. Cocktails were crafted very well, though very small glasses for $12. I'll definitely be back though, a lot of effort has gone into the decor of the place.

Reviews.Author: Sandy H.
Reviews.Content: Visited here once again, but came here much earlier in the evening. There was a decent wait outside and even longer wait in the stairwell to enter the rooftop bar. Had the best Amaretto sour here. Still as busy as ever!

Reviews.Author: Apollo B.
Reviews.Content: If there's one thing to take away from Perch, it has got to be the VIEW of downtown, hand's down. This is the perfect spot for a nice Sunday brunch. Every Sunday, they have live jazz. Add a pitcher of some nice sangria, and what more do you need? They have nice, attentive service. So good, we were approached by someone as to what we would like to drink, after our drink order had already been taken. The food was also decently priced. I pay the same prices at restaurants in LA for bad ambiance and views. For food, I got the Perch Burger. One word: yum! With a fried egg slipped in there, it reminded me of Europe. I guess the modern French pop playing in the background helped with this. My sister ordered the Huevos Rancheros. Something I normally think of as heavy, was made light and refreshing. It came with black beans, which I think made all the difference. I guess the Smoked Salmon Crepes were a bit bland, but nothing another glass of sangria and a look out at the city won't distract you from! If I have one thing to say, it's that pictures won't do justice to how beautiful this place is, so it's definitely a hot spot in LA I would suggest!One tip would be to make a reservation if you're going to brunch here. Luckily, we made a reservation, but looking up, I'm pretty sure almost every table there had a "reserved" sign. I would love to see how this place is at night! Checking out the lounge/bar scene here is something I definitely will check out soon.

Reviews.Author: Tori S.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place! It's so fun and the views are great. It has a 20s-ish vibe, way better than the Edison in my opinion. Went here for a friend's birthday and then a couple weeks ago we had a work event catered here. I definitely will be back more this summer!

Reviews.Author: Emma W.
Reviews.Content: AMBIANCE/ENVIRONMENT: nice evening view of downtown LA skylines, similar to Standard.SERVICES: goodFOOD: drinks are good/decentRECOMMENDATION: a weeknight spot for a date, weekend spot for group hanging out, classy get together spot.

Reviews.Author: John T.
Reviews.Content: Super cute place, been here a few times...foods great! Drinks are ehhhhh, & service is a tad slow. The location & view is breathtaking & rooftop is amazing. Will definitely be back :)

Reviews.Author: Laura S.
Reviews.Content: Awesome awesome awesome date spot.  The ambiance is very sexy, but you're really there for the view, which is maybe one of the best in the city.  The food and drinks are interesting, nothing jaw-dropping but definitely good.  If you want to make the most of dining here make sure you make a reservation specifically for the outdoor seating.  Decent happy hour too.

Reviews.Author: Glenn A.
Reviews.Content: The wait is too long to get in...

Reviews.Author: Jaskaran U.
Reviews.Content: Not a really great place to hangout in my opinion

Reviews.Author: Chris V.
Reviews.Content: We went right around 4 and it was definitely busy when we went, only getting busier as it got later.  Passing by around 11 the line was ridiculous.

Reviews.Author: Seth L.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. The food is delicious. They have a few good craft beers. The service is friendly. And the atmosphere is really enjoyable. If you happen to get a seat on the outside deck that overlooks downtown LA, then even better! Got a date you wanna impress? This is the spot.

Reviews.Author: Brandi P.
Reviews.Content: Don't be deceived by the name Perch. Although it is a fish, the menu does not consist of seafood. The name is derived from the perch a bird would sit upon on top of a city, because that is how it is. You sit above the entire city with glass walls and it is absolutely BREATHTAKING!  Yes! The view is amazing.. The food.. is Superb! I was fortunate enough to try a majority of the menu items and I was so impressed.. This french themed restaurant has an amazing Chef that is sure to knock your socks off. The menu boasts selections like frog legs, beet salad and bone marrow. So tasty and so different! I love this place. I wish I could live here.. Eat awesome food and watch the city from my Lil PERCH!

Reviews.Author: Meghan B.
Reviews.Content: Planned a party here and was not disappointed.  I love the venue and the staff was excellent to work with and accommodating the night of as well...The atmosphere, including the happy hour clientele and view, gave it this professional, chic "Paris in New York" feel.  For a professional networking event this is an event planner's perfect downtown choice.

Reviews.Author: Dave K.
Reviews.Content: Great rooftop bar.  Nice vibe and views, although most of us older people (i.e., over 35) should probably clear out by 9pm otherwise the lines and crowds get to be a bit much....  :)

Reviews.Author: Martha E.
Reviews.Content: Classy rooftop bar with excellent selection of cocktails. Unfortunately the kitchen closes quite early (7pm on a Sunday when I went) so couldn't get any food with drinks.

Reviews.Author: Lolo N.
Reviews.Content: If you love daytime parties definitely check out Perch!  Its the perfect place to relax to some good vibes and music.  Love the drinks too.  Been to a couple of the events and I must say I always have a amazing time.

Reviews.Author: Eliot H.
Reviews.Content: Perch Sundays, what can I say other than it's a nice new spot for me to hangout and groove. It's a nice change from the other LA rooftop scenes with its classy decor and view. My one gripe however is that the music could be louder. no offense but there are some of the best talent coming through here and people just want to groove. My friends and I definitely are coming back, just turn up the volume and it'll be perfect. cheers!!!

Reviews.Author: harold w.
Reviews.Content: Been here three times b/c I'm an idiot and new to LA.  Every time was made to wait, even when coming late around midnight with no line, and with more females than males.  They say the wait is due to the fire code or whatever, but every time after we get in, the place isn't packed.  Pretty stupid b/c most people end up leaving rather than waiting 1+ hr.  Drinks are also expensive here, and watered down.  The only cool thing is the view, which is cool for about a minute.  Shitty bar, will not repeat.

Reviews.Author: Tiana G.
Reviews.Content: Perch is oh so romantic and has one of the best views in the city. I went there for happy hour and I was really pleased with menu selection and prices. We both had a rozay which was really nice than a white chardonnay which was even better. I really enjoyed the whole experience from the elevator ride up with the cute little bird next to floor 15 or maybe it was the romantic kisses on the way up...but the view is spectacular, the server was beautiful and sweet which makes her even more beautiful and she took some of our photos. Yey for Perch Love Love...cant wait to try their brunch.

Reviews.Author: Nazy J.
Reviews.Content: I had heard a lot of good reviews about this place ... Been to many good and bad restaurants but what I experienced here was unbelievable :( we were a big group of 11 for my friends birthday .... We had reservations but our table was not even ready for 30 minutes but it was ok because they were really nice about it and tried to make us comfortable around the fire ... But then 3 things happened ... 1. I asked my waitress to split the bill in the table but she refused because she had already put the orders in, So I didn't want to inconvenient her ... 2,They brought the orders out one by one w 10 min intervals so nobody ate together and whoever waited gave up because we were outside and everyone basically had a cold dish...3. I ordered the steak and waited for it for an hour and 10 minutes until I told a busser to cancel my order because it was 11:50 pm at that time and everyone had had their dinner at that point besides me ... I asked for the manager 3 times and he never showed ... This is so unacceptable ... The waiter made it seem like she did me a favor by canceling the order I could not believe it .... I never complain ever but this is not right :( since nobody wanted to listen to me there hopefully somebody will read this and fix the situation before they lose more customers ....I'm not complaining for me but restaurants should care :( cannot believe they didn't .
Reviews.Author_Location: Marina Del Rey, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Tim C.
Reviews.Content: This place is shit. Setup is probably the worst I've ever seen, service sucks, food sucks, view is okay at best.

Reviews.Author: Cat B.
Reviews.Content: this was a fun place to take out of town visitors! pretty hip place "perched" on top of a building with fantastic views at sunset. you can sit outside on lounge chairs or inside at a table or bar. the food was pretty good (i had the seabass) and entrees run around $30+. portions are sort of small though. service was good considering how packed the place gets. plus, the servers weren't pretentious at all. i definitely would come back, if only for the view!

Reviews.Author: Arthur P.
Reviews.Content: It's on the 15th floor so it'll take you to elevators to get there...

Reviews.Author: Chris P.
Reviews.Content: LA hipster on a rooftop with decent views.   Brunch was spot on with a great live jazz band.  service was a little slow, but the mimosas helped with the wait. I would definitely recommend this place for a lazy sunday afternoon.  I bet evenings would be great, but expect a big crowd.

Reviews.Author: Ava T.
Reviews.Content: If you want to relax after a long week from school or work, I would recommend this place. The view of the city light, cool breeze, relaxing ambiance,music, it all adds to a unique and very relaxing experience. I will definitely come back. Came here with hubby and friends and everyone had a good time.

Reviews.Author: Buo Z.
Reviews.Content: What's the big deal? It took forever to get inside the building and then there was another wait to get to just this place. Roof top views are great but most of the roof was sectioned off so there was only a small area for hanging out. The drinks were OK. The crowd was a little bit older than I expected (30s).

Reviews.Author: Stacy K.
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Saturday night and it was a really cool place. It was a chilly night but they have heat lamps and bonfires set up outside so it was perfect and it was nice to enjoy the downtown view. I had 2 pineapple gins and it was around $16 the first round... then the 2nd time I got it, it was $28 ish?... hmm.... oh well, They played very lounge-y music and it was overall a nice place to go if you want to go out with your friends but still have conversations.

Reviews.Author: Armen T.
Reviews.Content: The food and drinks are amazing!! You will get downtown LA's best skyline view. Great service and friendly staff! Going back very soon....

Reviews.Author: Mien B.
Reviews.Content: Perch was over all one of the best dining experiences I've had in a while. My guest and I sat outside near the band so we could enjoy the music.  Food was fantastic, especially rabbit ravioli and the Mac and cheese. Our server was great but the person that really completed our experience was the manager Cory! He brought a warm vibe to our dinner, he made great suggestions, and he was pretty funny as well. He continued to check on us to ensure we were having a great time, something we very much appreciated. Love this place and will definitely come back!

Reviews.Author: Monique B.
Reviews.Content: The ambiance, service and mushroom risotto were amazing!!! Unfortunately, one of my dishes did not turn out as I expected, but Michael, one of the managers went out of his way to make sure I was happy with the rest of my meal!!! I really appreciate the way the server and managers responded to my concern, and because they provided such great customer service, I will definitely be going back there again. Michael also took my boyfriend and I to the rooftop and the view was spectacular! It's really nice to know that this place puts so much emphasis on providing great customer service and I was very happy with my first experience there!!

Reviews.Author: Cindy C.
Reviews.Content: I can see why this place has such mixed reviews; it is a lounge after all. The trick is to go early to avoid waiting in line. Anytime you have to wait in line, score goes down automatically. As for us, we arrived at the restaurant around 8:45 for a dinner party, so the experience was quite astonishing.The elevators set the swanky and urbany tones. The restaurant itself is decent sized; it feels spacious because it's half open on the rooftop. I didn't get to top floor but we had out table set up out in the patio on the 1st floor of the restaurant. As everyone else has mentioned, amazing view and the ambiance! I especially love the retro couches/chairs and painted tiled floors. It sort of reminds me of Edison where a flapper dress would've totally fit in.I was with a bday party of 13 so we sort of ordered and shared bites tapa-style, and mostly appetizers. - Complimentary bread with butter and olive spread (5 stars). I'm not just giving it 5 stars because it's complimentary, haha... I loved how they were handed out individually by the server onto each one of our plates, and as many as you wish. The rolls were fresh, and the olive spread was a nice touch.- Cheese Dip (4 stars). This is a great sharing dish, perfect munchy food with drinks too! Love the Balsamic swirl on top of the cheese.- Duck Duck Goose (3 stars). 3 finger sandwiches with smoked duck meat; I liked the flavor of the meat and the european lettuce, but the bread tasted stale. - Porkbelly sliders (5 Stars). Deeeeeeeelish little smoked pork belly sliders with fried quail eggs on top! YUM... the porkbelly was extremely aromatic, smoky and crispy (think extra-thick sliced bacon), not fatty at all! And how cute are these tiny little fried quail eggs, perfectly cooked with runny yokes. *Note to self - steal the idea and add lil fried quail eggs to sliders at the next dinner party or potluck*- Steamed Mussels (3.5 stars). Quite generous for appetizer portion and for the price. Decent flavored broth, nothing amazing.- Shake-n-bake Frog drummies (3 stars). I was impressed with the originality and the presentation, but underwhelmed with the taste. Tasted very bland, like under-seasoned chicken. - Shredded Rabbit (3 stars). This dish is a bit confusing. It comes with bread and kumquat puree on the side, like a spread. But when you fork into the meat, it just falls apart (not spread-able). There is no binding, instead in the texture of pull pork (without any sauce). Interesting dish but forgettable.Dishes on the other end of the table looked interesting too. The restaurant is definitely keen on presentations. Overall this isn't a place you'd come to pig-out and expect a revolutionary culinary experience. But for the beautiful lounge atmospheres and superb service (both bartenders and wait staffs!), I'm very fond of this place. Crowd: Older, more mature yuppies.Price: $$. (We expected to pay more, turned out reasonable. That's always a plus!)

Reviews.Author: Vic N.
Reviews.Content: Had dinner with another couple and had a good time.  Sophisticated ambiance with an excellent view of the downtown skyline.  The food was good and the live music made dinner that much more enjoyable.  Given the view and live music, this was a resonably priced evening.  Right now, among the top 5 places to go in downtown for drinks and dinner.

Reviews.Author: Vince A.
Reviews.Content: Great seating, location, and service. I went for happy hour with a group of colleagues and only got to sample appetizers. I will be back (with a reservation) for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Toni S.
Reviews.Content: Good food and fantastic view of downtown. Decor is nicely done and love the bonfire and fireplace in patio lounge area. I went on a tuesday night for some wine & dine chilax fun and it was just that. Chill french music playing in the background and very wide age group (maybe bc it was a wk night?) but none of the drunken frat boys and obnoxious tourists. yay! Although, after reading previous reviews, i'm not sure how i would feel about wknd night here. Dealing with bi**hy bartenders and power tripping bouncers is the last thing i would like to deal with for any price. However, i'll give them a benefit of doubt and try it out bc i had such a lovely time past tuesday night. As for the food, although it was really good, i've had better at A.O.C. for cheaper so... but with a fantastic view like that, who's complaining? Bon appétit~

Reviews.Author: Donald R.
Reviews.Content: Place is more chill than the Standard rooftop bar.  It's free too!!! even fridays.  Mellow people and friendly security.  I even played the piano before heading down the elevator, and the security was like, you can't stop playin! sweet.

Reviews.Author: Karen H.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 Stars.. 4 if the service was better2 elevator up and a beautiful surprise.. would not know that this existed from the bottom level. There are 2 levels. The rooftop is strictly a bar and the open level below it has a bar +dining. Great ambiance. I noticed a lot of couples on a date. DTLA is really becoming kinda cool. Rabbit Rillettes -- Great app to share. Good portion. Loved the candied kumquats. Mussels- This was my favorite. Will definitely order again. Excellant Saffron? broth. Nice addition of Spanish chorizo and cherry tomatoes. I wanted to ask for more grilled sourdough bread to sop up all that yummy broth. Coq au vin- This was an entree but the portions were more of an appetizer.. Did not resemble a traditional Coq au vin at all.I was expecting a braise or stew.  Enjoyed it , but would have preferred they rename the dish.. it was more of a fried popcorn chicken with a red wine reduction. $27 for this dish was pretty steep. View is spectacular. It's a nice addition to the Standard  and Elevate.. Let's see if the Standard and Elevate still has the nerve to charge $20 entrance Sats.. ServiceHostess were not too friendly.. come on this is DTLA not Hollywood. We had a reservation so we didnt wait very long. It was pretty busy for a Thursday night. As we were seated we were greeted by one server than was switched to another server. We wanted to order a bottle of wine. So we asked the server what he recommended.. I told him I did not want something too spicy or high tannins. He kept pushing the Malbec which I don't typically like.  So when we got it it was very high tannin and spicy.. exactly what I did not like.
