I asked new rockbilly looking pin up styled server if I can change it for the bordeaux and she said "oh we dont' have that one". I"m thinking so why do you have it on the menu. So she went and gave me a sample of the cab. When I told her I liked it she brought a new bottle and took away the glass that had the sample. Why would you take it away... what a waste. Didn't understand that. In the middle of the meal my friend asked if they had pomme frites. Server said NO.. Isn't this a French themed restaurant. A little disspointed. Also felt the need to wave down our server the whole night for things. Overall I would come back for drinks and apps. But the entrees left you wanting more. If you are going to charge close to $30 for an entree it should be an entree size. Management should really straighten out the wait staff if they want return customers.. people don't like to come back to small portions, expensive prices and bad service.

Reviews.Author: Charlene L.
Reviews.Content: Ah, The Perch!! I've been here twice.  The first time about a week after it opened last summer 2011 and the second time was for my cousins 30th bday!  Parking across the street, or on the street, or valet.  You know, typical LA parking.Drinks normal LA priced from 9 to 11 $$.Get there early if you don't feel like waiting in line for an hour, maybe even more.Crowd is fairly older maybe mid to late 20s & then some.First time: My friend and I had the absolute best time.  Lol.  With a few smiles, and innocent conversation we were able to get some free drinks. The crowd is pretty nice I must say, although I did have a slight problem with an older gentleman.. or guy should I say.  Ugh, forever traumatized.  Anyways, unfortunately the very top top of the bar was closed to a private party, but luckily, we were able to get up there thanks to "the boys" & good ol' Tim the bouncer!! He probably doesn't remember us anymore. lol.  2nd Time: We had to wait in line for a ridiculously long time.. okay, maybe not thattt long compared to my cousins other friends because they didn't even get in!! Terrible!! seriously though if you plan on coming here, GET THERE EARLY.  Also, the top top floor was closed to a private party again!  I guess people really like renting the place out, I don't blame them.. the view isss pretty nice! :)  Anyways, we were able to sit down on the couches inside and let me tell you, what a show we experienced!! Basically we watched this doctor/chiropractor/iforget get at the girl sitting opposite us on the couch.  She had a huge bruise on his arm, & with a little bit of persuading and flirting he managed to get permission to attempt to get rid of the bruise.  So he started to massage her arm, and in about 15-20 minutes the bruise was gone.  Amaaazing much?! Mr. doctor must of gotten lucky that night. Lol.  It was definitely a funny thing to see, especially when one is drunk!!!Overall, Perch is a great place to go & have a good time with friends.  I'd suggest summertime is best because it is freaking freeeeeeeeeezing during winter months!

Reviews.Author: Linda L.
Reviews.Content: Security guy at the door was an idiot, accusing everyone of having a fake I.D. Other than that, the atmosphere was mellow, decent view from the roof top, and the crowd was slightly belligerent the night I went. Took about 30 mins to get a drink. Probably wouldn't go back unless it was for another friend's birthday celebration.

Reviews.Author: Nhung T.
Reviews.Content: I have to say, the roof top view was amazing (5 stars) and their lounge area was awesome, has a gas fire place!!!! The food, however, was just okay. I do have to complain that the service sucks!!! Our waitress was not attentative at all, literally in a span of 1.5 hours she came by twice. We had to flag her over, not cool! Ended up ordering the buffalo frog legs, I didn't like it at all because the two didn't sync well with each other (2 stars). I think the frog leg was better off deep fried and topped with garlic or something. Okay, if any restaurant failed in lobster bisque then it was a sign. It was too watery and where was the lobster (1 star), the Bouillabaisse was really good especially the broth - I just love all the seafood in it (best dish of the night 4 stars), Steak Frites was cooked medium rare but it wasn't tasty at all, kind of chewy (2 stars), and the Filet of Beef was good. I think this was an awesome place to lounge because of the live music!

Reviews.Author: peachpie p.
Reviews.Content: love the ambiancelove the drinksservice was smooth & easy goingWe had an awesome spot overlooking LA and the crazy party that some folks were having the building over. ..just a really chill place to hang out with some friends after dinner to enjoy good company. Will be coming back again

Reviews.Author: Thanh T.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came here for my pre-birthday dinner. We've both been at Perch before for drinks (which are fantastic), so we thought the view was worthy enough to try it out for dinner. Sadly, we were both wrong.After introducing herself, the waitress didn't come by again for another 45 minutes, even though she had walked by us multiple times. Once we ordered, it was another 30-40 minutes until we got our food, which was COLD and soggy by the time it reached us. We had to ask the bus boy to get us our check because she happened to disappear after that, only showing up to pick up the check.I knew it was a bad sign when the people at the table next to us told us that she had spilt a tray of drinks on them earlier, but I wanted to give her the benefit of the doubt. I have NEVER not left a tip before, but unfortunately, that is what happened. On top of all of that, my friend ended up with food poisoning that night - likely from the cold food.I ordered the hangar steak with truffle fries - the steak was OK, although it might've been better if it was hot. And the truffle fries were cold and soggy. Such a disappointment.My friend got the chicken supreme, which was also cold, but he said it tasted good...at the time.Moral of the story is: go for the drinks and the view, NOT for the food. Or at least hope that this girl isn't your waitress.

Reviews.Author: Brittany S.
Reviews.Content: its really hard to give this place only three stars because the view is unbeatable, and the service is fantastic!the food = horrible. we had the cordon bleu poppers which is a chicken nugget with proscuitto and swiss. these tasted like they were frozen, something you would get as a free sample from costco, but worse. then we had the "not  so french onion soup"= the menu's name for this item is spot on, for all the wrong reasons. this "soup" literally tasted like soy sauce and eel sauce and extra salt all mixed together and passed off as soup. i don't even think there were onions in it. complimentary bread = cold. but i'm glad its complimentary. the drinks on the menu are great! super tasty and affordable. you cannot go wrong if the get "my fair lady."

Reviews.Author: Damon M.
Reviews.Content: People make your business. Stop studying your books. You are your people. Good job Camille.

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: One of my girl friends texted me during the week inviting me to go hang out at The Perch. At first, my response was, "No". But when it came close to Friday and having it being such a long work week, I decided to go. The bad part was that you had to edit on line to get in and wait in the second line to go to the rooftop. The good part was that the view was beautiful and the environment was relaxing. A good go-to place on a Friday night.

Reviews.Author: Joe M.
Reviews.Content: Loooovee this place!!!Drinks are great, food is excellent!Service could be much better, but it's a french place, they don't care.... lolAwesome!

Reviews.Author: Gabriela G.
Reviews.Content: The perch is what LA is about. The architecture in which the bar is located is outstanding. The ambience is calm and the people that go there are trendy. The background music is not too loud so you don't need to have a shouting conversation. This place has a great view of the city from the outside patio. I would recommend this bar for someone looking to celebrate a birthday in a chill sort of way  or someone looking for a cool place to go on a date. There's no dancing here but the French music playing is the perfect background noise for this bar. Drinks are expensive but there's no cover fee. You just have to be willing to stand in line for a while but believe me it's totally worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jodi B.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view & decor, but some kinks to work out... pros: interesting & delicious drinks, stunning views, good people watchingcons: 1) confused and/or inattentive staff members- Some weren't sure where we were supposed to/allowed to sit to order drinks while waiting for our dinner table. We were told to go ask the hostess ourselves, then had to flag down one of the several waiters walking back & forth to order. 2) underwhelming food- We ordered the broccolini salad, the tomato/beet "salad" (if you call 4 slices of beet and 4 cherry tomato halves a salad), chicken/blue cheese appetizer, and the duck club appetizer. *The duck clubs were delicious and the only dish I would order again.* The other dishes were pretty to look at, but not too exciting to eat.3) dirty napkins- yes that's plural (lipstick stains! really?? Hasn't it only been open like 2 days or something?), 4) no happy hour or food at barOverall, I would give Perch 3.5 stars if I could. They have some really strong points, but definitely some things to work on. I'm looking forward to going again to check out how it develops.

Reviews.Author: Stevie R.
Reviews.Content: oyster bar, roof top, art deco skyline really all this equals 4stars.  food is a close second.  defiantly a place for a cocktail and a snack, was there on a weeknight and the bar tenders were trying to be cool mixologist... but there were just douches with bad attitude.  heads up best bartender in the world is your friend.  not an asshole.  had the short rib... been on a never ending mission but maybe that why i did not love it cause i have had sooo many great ones lately.also tried steak frites ok.

Reviews.Author: Marie r.
Reviews.Content: this review is only for the servicei have not tried foodwe came here for dinner, was seated and waitedthat's pretty much all we did. waitasked for a server twice - no one came25 minutes later - someone came and apologized for the "confusion"they said they were switching out staffby then, i'd lost my appetite and walked outtoo bad - i was really looking forward to this place :(

Reviews.Author: roger w.
Reviews.Content: only the balcony is nice...but too many ppl to have a good experience.....

Reviews.Author: Duane Kip O.
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing location ! 2 floors of dining, lounges and bars overlooking downtown LA, Bunker Hill and Pershing Square. I was very urban the night I went to the Perch, took a goup of people via the Metro form the W Hotel Hollywood, fast easy. Interesting mix of crowd, local and bridge and tunnell.  (The better dirnks are upstairs)

Reviews.Author: Sher Y.
Reviews.Content: Had a long line to get in. After getting in, the vibe was nice. Views were good, but not great. I didn't go upstairs, so I can't say much about that. No one really 'served' us, they didn't seem to care much. Other than that, decent loungey place to hang with friends.

Reviews.Author: Sarah Jayne D.
Reviews.Content: My good friend recommended Perch for my 30th Birthday because I was looking for a venue that had a good balance between young and mature; trendy and cultivate; quirky and unassuming; busy and quiet setting all in one place! I can't believe I found it!!! I spent so long trying to research a few places in DTLA, Hollywood, Silverlake, Westside, etc for the right restaurant/lounge and Perch was wonderful. I was so happy to find a place with good food, great service, awesome music, and not to mention a beautiful view. My birthday was on a Thursday this year so the place was quiet, but I heard that it can get very busy during the weekend. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to spend their special occasion at very special venue.

Reviews.Author: Twelve J.
Reviews.Content: no cover charge. early arrival is a must unless you like standing on the street in line w/ a bunch of obnoxious lounge goers.15th floor has the restaurant area and bathrooms. walkways are crowded so mobility is precarious if you're holding a drink.there's a line to access the stairwell to the 16th floor rooftop. great ambiance and view. seating is limited, lurking for a spot is customary. ladies, don't wear heels you won't be comfortable standing around in for about an hour. the bar upstairs is pretty fast. drink prices are the usual LA prices. ($10/Jameson on ice) good standing around mingling spot. if you want to dance, Bar 13 (on the 13th floor) is dark and small but the music is entertaining, as is the people watching.i would recommend it as a nice spot to check out.

Reviews.Author: Michael W.
Reviews.Content: Perch sucks.  I feel sorry for the people who actually wait in the line to get into the place.  Oh, and the bouncers i.e. doormen perfectly exemplify the doucheball stereotype; I hope all of them get a glimpse of this post and realize how low they sit on the food chain.

Reviews.Author: James M.
Reviews.Content: First time being at this place. Awesome view and atmosphere.  Even with the thick clouds the view was great.

Reviews.Author: Ali G.
Reviews.Content: This place has the worst customer service, with the excemption of the bus boys. its impossible and quite uncomfortable to stand anywhere, let alone sit down. the bouncer and waiters constantly move you out of the way because it seems as if the whole floor needs to be clear for them to walk. drinks over priced, minimal selection. the only good thing about this place is the view!

Reviews.Author: Martin Z.
Reviews.Content: Mixed; the view is stunning and the ambiance top flight.  Our waiter was excellent.  However, I left my credit card when I dined the 2nd time and called the next day a little after 4 p.m.  I was told they were busy just then but would look and call me back.  I had not heard back as of 9:45 p.m. and called again.  I was told they would call me when they had time to look.  I said I needed to know now as we were talking about a lost credit card.  I finally got her to go ask the manager and after waiting on the line for awhile, they said they had the card.  Totally lame customer service!

Reviews.Author: Nancy A.
Reviews.Content: I am giving this the stars I am for the ambiance. Loved going up the old elevator to the 13th floor and changing elevators to go up to this great spot. The dark and heavy decor was cozy, inviting and romantic with a bit of creepiness that I loved. Other than the young Katie Holmes hotess, the servers had a gothic vibe and so did the whole place. Loved the wrought iron tables on the patio with the lovely view. I faced the window and the bar though and was just as happy. The music was fab- French mixed with some familar oddities (ie. Grace Jones). Service was impecable and loved the small French cocktail glasses as a fresh change from martini glasses... but my drink was a bit too sour. The food for me was so so. Many of these French places pride themselves on bone marrow and meat and since I do not eat meat, I ordered accordingly. My mushroom cassulet with soy sausage served in the dim light started to make me think non stop of Sweeny Tod. Would I go back? In a heart beat- but I would stick to straight up martinis, salad and dessert.

Reviews.Author: Erika D.
Reviews.Content: Okay.. I was first in Ahhhh of the view, the bartenders and the ambiance of Perch. After experiencing NYE, I have to say.. it was very disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Olivia K.
Reviews.Content: Great view. Pretty ambience. Rude incompetent service. Poor to mediocre overpriced food.

Reviews.Author: Faye W.
Reviews.Content: The food was only acceptable for the price.  The service was completeley unacceptable.  We had an 8 PM reservation, were seated after 10 PM with attitude from the serving staff when we complained.  I should add, I was 8 months pregnant and forced to stand from 7:45 when we arrived until we were seated after 10 PM.  No offer of a seat was made to me, despite obvious discomfort after the first hour and a half.  To placate our complaints, we were offerred an alcoholic drink... Thanks, but I was 8 months pregnant.  Way to go genuises.  My friends just suggested a party there, but I will never go there again due to the rude staff, and incompetent management.

Reviews.Author: Noah D.
Reviews.Content: Well me and my friends went to perch for a birthday party. It was my first time there and I must say that, after waiting for a table the view was amazing!!! We had the shrimp/grit thing, salmon tartar, baked Brie and the frog leggggs which I must say all were amazing. We all shared entrees and love the whole evening.And our service was great as well.Thanks perch for making it special, will be back for sure

Reviews.Author: Cathy Y.
Reviews.Content: relaxed and comfortable.  live music as well to enjoy. the food was great and the additional lounge upstairs was an added bonus!

Reviews.Author: Billy T.
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a beautiful restaurant in a beautiful building, but their service is horrendous. To be so slow you'd think this place was extremely busy every minute of every hour of every day.  Their food is good but not consistent and priced way to high.

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: this place is awesome! beautiful view, comfy seats, nice decor with a variety of drinks/food and good company! perfect to chill with friends or for a date night! seats and views were so comfy i could take a nap on the balcony.truffle fries were a bit soggy and greasy..but flavor was nice. huge portions too

Reviews.Author: Sophia L.
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous!!!!great food... amazing view...Doesnt get better than this!!!

Reviews.Author: Monika S.
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous restaurant, architectural gem, high floors, elegant, romantic, stately. Bar service exceptional. Wait staff hmmm could be better given the price point and standards the restaurant is trying to set. Lovely view. The fresh fish was not fresh and smelled fishy even masked in cream sauce and it upset my stomach the entire rest of the night. I would only go again for a glass of wine - that is worth going to the building!

Reviews.Author: Rhonda G.
Reviews.Content: We went on a Tuesday night so maybe it was an off night but the service was extremely armature. The table was small there were four of us and after we gave our order they didn't take all the menus which didn't fit on the table. Finally I just put it on the floor  where it stayed the rest of the night. We ordered muscles which were a bit spicy and before we finished them the our entree came and the waiter just wanted to push the muscles over on the table but the table is too small so the muscles left unfinished.  The timing was very off. Wait until appetizers are finished , not a new concept.I had steak frites. The steak was delicious but the frites were cold and then were also soaked in steak juice. So they were not only cold but wet as well. They were returned and hot ones, in a separate bowl, were brought out with a smile. The servers were very nice but someone forgot to train them and when you are paying high prices for food the expectation is that the service is above the average. I may go back for a drink and the music but not the food. Also the chef is leaving soon so who knows what will happen to the food. Hopefully the new chef will have higher expectations for his servers.

Reviews.Author: Eric t.
Reviews.Content: Great good looking crowd. Nice beer selection, decent drinks. the door staff has always been nice, which is great to see in a place so "hot". Great vibe and ambiance all around....views amazing but can get crowded.

Reviews.Author: Kay K.
Reviews.Content: A little crowded but worth it for the view.

Reviews.Author: Gus L.
Reviews.Content: Where do I start.... I found this place through a friend's recommendation in the quest to find the prefect place to propose to my fiancé.  After meeting with Anne (Day Resturant Manager) during the daytime, I knew that this was the place. The view is beautiful during the day, and absolutely breath taking at night. On the night that everything had to go prefect, Anne and Tony (Resturant Night Manager) made sure it did. They paid attention to the littlest detail. We had delicious meal prepared for us, the drinks were perfectly poured, and had a beautiful layout at the rooftop lounge. The only way my fiancé can describe it was " magical ".... And she did say "YES". Thank you to everyone that made this a memorable evening.

Reviews.Author: Betty H.
Reviews.Content: I love this bar! Didn't try the food, but had a glass of wine and despite the long wait to get upstairs and then to get up up stairs, i really enjoyed myself. not too crowded (once you're in, you're grateful that they manage the crowds) and the service was prompt and friendly. Two glasses of wine for $23, including tip, not bad. I would definitely come here for a group birthday dinner or some sort of celebration. You can't beat the view and the ambiance. And they play the music pretty loudly...and there is actually some space for you to dance - but one out of every hundred people dance. myself included.

Reviews.Author: austin b.
Reviews.Content: it is an awesome space and COULD be the best but it was lucky to get 3 of my stars.they seemed a mess and didnt have tables but within 5-10 min at the bar we had a seat outside. out side was great but who decided to get rid of the best seats on the deck(on the corner) and put their singer and band there. waste of space that could have been 4 tables with an awesome view.also the tattooed kind of cute bartender BLOWS. i asked for a manhattan and a pinot. after 15 min of my bourbon sitting in ice and my friend still not having her wine. he hands me my drink and say "sorry there are a few things missing, that will be 22 dollars". are you fucking kidding me?!?!rad view but the place really lacks the rest. if it wasnt for the view i would have given it one star. figure it out bro

Reviews.Author: Joseph W.
Reviews.Content: Terrible service! They need to better train their waiters and not argue and debate with customers.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: Can anyone say rooftop party?  This place has an awesome environment.  Granted it does take a few elevators to get up, but the view from the top is absolutely stunning.  I like that the atmosphere is classy without being pompous.  The bartenders are quick, and keep the drinks stiff all night long.  Expect to pay standard LA prices for cocktails.  I hear the food is great too, but I usually stop by only for drinks.

Reviews.Author: Kristin C.
Reviews.Content: Hated it! The crowd here was terrible. We waited an hour and a half for our table (with a reservation) sat outside and the view was nice, but it also smelled like pro pain gas the entire meal from the heaters around us. The food was WAY over priced for what we got and the quality of the food wasn't even that good. I will NEVER go to this place again. and I love going out to restaurants downtown. Not worth the ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Angel N Marissa O.
Reviews.Content: So I am offically popping my yelp cherry with this review...I came here last Saturday for a friedns birthday celebration. Showed up around 9:30 (right before the line formed) It is surprising placed on the rooftop of a building in Pershing Square. After a trip up two "vintage" elevators the doors opened and we were in a parisian rooftop bistro. Being a lover of Los Angeles and everything it has to offer, I was floored by the beautiful architecture and 360 degree views. The layout is an open floor plan with plenty of lounge seating. I rated this place 4stars versus 5stars because of the restroom availability on the 15th floor, mainly because there was a private party on the 16th floor and the bar clientel had to share the restroom with a wedding reception (sloppily drunk wedding guests @10pm is not my cup of tea) Besides that this place is amazing and definately a MUST SEE!

Reviews.Author: Artin O.
Reviews.Content: To sum everything up in one sentence, we were there for 2 hrs and 1 hr and 15 min was in line. I would not wait 2 min for this place next time. If it wasn't for a girlfriends birthday we would have left much earlier and avoided the rude security guards, rude door lady( who would randomly walk by the line and pick people and send them in regardless of how far behind in line they were) and a bar who told me they have no bud lights no energy drinks and no crown royal(they have more liquor at 7-11) Overall Just plain ridiculous avoid this place Netflix is more exciting.

Reviews.Author: Christina G.
Reviews.Content: We set Perch as our Bachelorette Party Destination...... what a mistake after all being greeted rudely upon our arrival with the front desk hostesses to going upstairs on the rooftop area only to be told that because a big party was being reserved at 9pm there will be no happy hour served on the rooftop area. We found an area big enough for the 18 of us but the manager was quick to introduce herself rudely I might add and mentioned that we could not hold that many seats due to the reserved party downstairs that wasn't to start for hours. Head of Security wasn't any nicer either we were told that usually our party favors wasn't allowed and that if any of it ended up over the edge that our entire party would be kicked out! Never in my life have I felt any less accommodating for hosting such a large party. Usually being the customer we are to feel welcomed definitely not here at Perch. Without the happy hour their drinks are overpriced and water downed! Definitely will not be coming back and neither will the other 17 people in our party either. Luckily we left early and not have our night ruined and we were able to not only get food but also drinks and hospitality at Blue Cow down the street! Sorry Perch but you really are a big disappointment I don't care how nice the view is!

Reviews.Author: Kelly C.
Reviews.Content: Nice place with a downtown view.  Good drinks.  Its perfect for happy hour but not good for romantic dinner.  A good place to chill With friends after work or on weekends but i personally would not dine there for a date unleds the couple is looking for a hip place and they are in just having fun night out. For downtown the decor is nice-Like a library with nice antique furnitures...  nice like little bit cozier for a place like this.  Its more like restaurant / lounge... I would say.  I don't like how you have to park across the street and run to the other side of the building.  Its another popular place to go in downtown but its not for people do not like downtown scene.  Price is medium to high (not too cheap. Not too expensive).

Reviews.Author: Margaret L.
Reviews.Content: This place is a hidden little gem in downtown LA. The view from the balcony is amazing and the drinks and food are not bad. The best time to come here is for happy hour because you don't have to wait in line for a long time to get up there. While this place is not a club, there is a decent line out here after hours due to the fact that you have to take two really old elevators in order to get up there.

Reviews.Author: Brittany B.
Reviews.Content: Perch has been on my bookmarks for about two years, and what better occasion than a birthday HH to check it out? We went on a Wednesday evening, arriving at 5:45. All tables (even the couches) on the 15th floor are reservation-only, but the three of us found seats at the bar. We grabbed a drink and some HH grub (yummy mac & cheese!) while we waited for the upstairs to open. At 6:00 we headed upstairs. Initially one of the hostesses told us the top floor was closed for a private event; but fortunately another hostess set her straight and said that it was only partially closed. We headed upstairs and found seating on the patio-type sofas. There's a separate bar on the roof and the climate is pleasant on a summer's eve. My friends kept buying me drinks, so no idea of the pricing. But it was a great place for tasty drinks and nice conversation. I was seriously buzzed in no time. Something about this place put me at my ease, and I felt just a little closer to heaven. Sure, there are better views in DTLA, but I have to say that Perch will always hold a special little place in my heart for the lovely memories.

Reviews.Author: Donna S.
Reviews.Content: preparation//there's usually a line on fri/wknds...and whoever designed the building wanted to make it all fancy and exclusive so there's an awkward switch of elevators to get to itambiance//***it's like stepping into someone's house w/ fanciful fireplace, cush sofas, and open bar area....the patio is lined w/ dining tables and heat lamps...second floor has a wait and is pretty much the same as any other rooftop bar*bonus* excellent view of dtla from just the right distance~service//****for a place that is always busy, the people are surprisingly nice~ everyone from the bartenders, waitstaff, even the ones that regulate the lines to the rooftopfood & drinks//***i've only snacked on the food and not eaten a full meal....so i can't say muchdrinks are decent and well stocked whether you want to sip on wine or go for the full bar~*~it's more for the view than anything else~^^

Reviews.Author: Kaylee T.
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience here. We were seated right away, service was great. We order the prime rib and kobe beef. It was delicious! The portions are a little small but you have to expect that with a french restaurant. I enjoyed the ambiance and the character of the place. I'd recommend this place for lunch, early dinner.

Reviews.Author: Amy R.
Reviews.Content: I really liked the restaurant and give 3 stars for ( outside , the patio) the fire place, live music, and the amazing view.its a cozy place to go with your lover or friends.But the food was not worth of paying that much.

Reviews.Author: Elton W.
Reviews.Content: I like Perch.  Been here quite a few times.  Great view and overpriced drinks.  Good service.  Tasty truffle fries as well.  The venue makes it worth it.

Reviews.Author: Asuka N.
Reviews.Content: I came here with my buddy around 5 PM on a Tuesday night in the same gear we went jet skiing in, so that may explain the skeptical/dirty looks that the waiters gave us when we wandered up here before the business crowd came up. It probably explains why none of the waiters bothered really engaging in conversation even when we tried to chat them up, which annoyed me a little - don't be afraid of the out-of-place guys wearing swimming trunks...That aside, the view of Pershing Square and the rest of the downtown area is fantastic. You don't have many tall buildings in LA outside of the office buildings that the aliens in 'Independence Day' (as you may be able to tell by now, I haven't been to downtown LA much in the past), so you get a nice view of the city. That said, the sun beats down on you pretty hard until you get a breeze blowing in as the evening goes on...it would have been nice to have some of the patio umbrellas around to provide a little shade to those of us without sunglasses. The beers were okay - I wasn't terribly impressed with the standard Kronenberg 1664, but the blonde wheat ale (for some reason, the waiter inexplicably didn't tell us the brands of the non-happy hour beers, so I am not sure which one it was) was pretty decent. I also got an order of the cordon bleu 'poppers', which was a very solid deal for $6 - basically are breaded pieces of chicken with prosciutto and swiss cheese. They were very well-prepared; the chicken was moist, and the cheese was at its gooey best...only complaint was that it was hard to pick out the prosciutto.All in all, a very nice rooftop. Even by the time we left around 6:30, there were still some spots to be had, and I think there's another level to the rooftop where there is additional seating. It's hard to beat a view of the New York skyline, but on average this probably tops 230 Fifth in NYC (which would be the rough equivalent, IMO, for my benchmark back east).

Reviews.Author: Celia C.
Reviews.Content: My opinion could have been biased once I realized after the fact that this is the same place my roommate had a very bad experience. Overall, I love the venue. Stellar view, nice buzz, and great ambiance. They had live entertainment playing Frenchy-type music and the service was expedient. I only had drinks here, but I heard from co-workers they need serious improvement on their happy hour menu. They ordered a chicken app and were served cafeteria-style nuggets. I guess this place is perfect for a night cap cocktail.

Reviews.Author: Anna K.
Reviews.Content: musselsrisotto lamb burgergreat great ambience.everything looked and soundedso nice and promising.even the plating and presentationis great.but once you taste it,mehhhmediocre execution of food.the group did agreethe mussels were actually pretty good.but that's it.go for the view and a drink.like wine.by the fireplace.

Reviews.Author: Kevin B.
Reviews.Content: Great rooftop bar in downtown LA.  The penultimate floor opens up to a patio that surrounds the building and going up to the highest floor is a open roof top.  The drinks here are nice sized and strong.  There are some cool ones because unlike most bars, there are actual mixologist here.  I didn't try any of the food but most of the stuff the servers were bringing out look appetizing.  The crowd is late 20s -30s young professionals, mixed diversities, and generally better looking.

Reviews.Author: Jenna C.
Reviews.Content: You can't help but feel swanky LA cool when you visit Perch's rooftop bar/restaurant.  Ahh, pleasant views of Downtown LA with clouds of... smog.  Anyways, this is a cool place to bring friends or family to talk over slightly pricey drinks and appetizers.  It can get quite chilly, and the heat lamps don't work that well, but it's a cool experience.  I wasn't too pleased with my organic merlot selection (I've had better from house red selections at lower-class restaurants), but I guess you pay more for the ambiance than the quality of what you're consuming... Although, I can't speak to the food, since I didn't try it.  I'd come back here maybe, but there are so many other options.

Reviews.Author: Joan H.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful!!  I agree with Anne Marie G. -- all about the ambiance.  What a fabulous place for a date!  We arrived early -- 9ish -- got up to the 15th floor, took a look around, and then went up to the 16th to meet our friends.  Even at that hour, most of the chairs around the fires and heat lamps were already taken.  We immediately got in line for the bar -- and it's a good thing we did because that line grew and grew as the night went on.  The bartender wasn't the friendliest of all gals, but let's credit her for being patient and for being a trooper.  It took me a while to order and she was the only one behind the counter for a while.  They don't serve certain types of liquor (e.g. Crown, certain gins) as they specialize in cognacs and all things "French."  I ordered a "My Fair Lady" which was a little girly sweet for me but it did the trick.  I got my friends the Libertine and the French 64.  Libertine was STRONG and French 64 was fruit and delicious...!  Cost was $38 for those 3 drinks.  There is one bathroom per gender on the 16th floor.  Take note though - if you're going to travel between floors, you may have to wait if you try to come upstairs due to the max number of persons that can be on the roof top (fire marshall).  The crowd is a little older, a little classier -- attire was pretty mixed, but I would absolutely suggest a cardigan for the ladies since you may not be able to get near a heat lamp.  Street parking is a long shot, so save yourself the frustration and park at one of the many public lots.  $4-$7

Reviews.Author: Hamed M.
Reviews.Content: if the weather is cold, this place is horrible. it's just windy and chilly.the main floor is too bright for a bar, and the thin female bartender can be very curt, rude, and immature. the upstairs bar has too long of a line.all in all, i will only go if there's a special occasion, and even then, i might pass or seriously try to change the location.

Reviews.Author: Tamara T.
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was in a Ciroc commercial and P.Diddy, Adrian Grenier, and Jesse from Breaking Bad could've easily been on the roof top smoking stogies and doing that whole "This is the life!" toast with the glasses in the air. Really chill and relaxed atmosphere with awesome mix of French music & good looking, non-ghetto, people. No club like atmosphere like The Standard's rooftop. Favorite drink was the French maid. Voila!

Reviews.Author: Anna W.
Reviews.Content: im gonna give 4 stars for the beautiful view, ambiance and the decors. But Im gonna give only 3 stars for the food. I guess they still need to improve their menu. I just like the truffle fries, it was sooo yummy! but the merguez sliders (spiced lamb patties) it was too dry and it was very salty (im literally saying it is really salty!!) I didn't even finish one. The service was kinda slow, they just let me us finish our bottle of wine got almost drunk, and took them almost an hour to finally serve our food.

Reviews.Author: Carolina O.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Thursday night around 8pm. Nice view. I almost wish they had a couple of more things on the menu however, but they were still tasty. We actually had pretty good service, and the place was full. You do need reservations in the evening btw. Food came also came out pretty fast. Nice vibe, Business Casual. All in all a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Author: Kyu L.
Reviews.Content: one of the most unnecessarily complicated venues ive ever been to in my life.we were in town visiting from norcal and our friends took us here...raving about the rooftop bar area.we walked up around 11something and saw that the line was like 100 people deep.  we all got in line and waited for some other friends who we were still waiting for (damn "asian time" laggers...) the friends who lived down the street were able to walk right on in with a few other friends (apparently there is a "hook up" for residents, but its like that everywhere "apparently")  after waiting like 40 minutes, we finally get to the front of the line and we started seeing all the groups of chicks start to walk up to the front.  after seeing some groups of people get in and other get rejected, i realized that if you want "line cuts" at Perch, you better just have a legit dinner reservation or really "know, know" the door guy.dont matter if your hot or fat and ugly...if you "know, know" him then youre good to go.anyway, after being in the front of the line for like 20 more minutes (several people walked up to the front because they "knew, knew" him...we were able to get in.then you wait in another fucking line to get in the elevator to go to the 13th floor...then you wait in another fucking line to walk back downstairs 1 or 2 floors to get in line to go back UP to the very top of the roof...i didnt care because we "cut" everyone to walk up to the roof...but trust me...its not worth it. dont bother waiting in line to walk upstairs okay. just trust me on it.drink wise, very average.  the selection of whiskeys and scotches were "aight"  i suppose this is what LA people do. wait in line, to wait in another fucking line...that is, unless you know the doorman.yay. city of angels.....do it.

Reviews.Author: S T.
Reviews.Content: I visited perch on a saturday night. It took forever to find the place seeing as how it's kind of hidden with a rather small sign in a dark area, but once we figured out where it was located everything was great after. The atmosphere, food and overall service was great. I recommend the herb crusted salmon. Come prepared to spend here, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jay M.
Reviews.Content: Great views and a hip environment, but overpriced and mediocre food & service.  It's almost like they can't keep up with their own success.  Too bad.

Reviews.Author: James Renny C.
Reviews.Content: The Fried Oysters and Short Ribs over Polenta were amazing.  Great wine selection also!  It is a must when you are downtown.

Reviews.Author: Jenn L.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place to just have a great time with friends.

Reviews.Author: Megan I.
Reviews.Content: Super cute lounge area with really neat views of the city. It wasn't too crowded when I visited and I don't think I'd be a huge fan of a large crowd here (the only plus is that since it's a rooftop, the chances of overheating are at a minimum). Nothing else that really stands out, the atmosphere in my opinion is the star.

Reviews.Author: Raquel F.
Reviews.Content: I just love this place too much to not give it 5 stars. Perch my new favorite rooftop happy hour and brunch spot resting on the 15th floor of the Pershing Square Building in DTLA. Now, to my friends who say "I'm scared of DTLA or thats TOO far to drive down THERE", Perch is absolutely worth the trek! It's a magical place with beautiful decor and unparalleled views of downtown (we know how much I love rooftops!). Erin, my current happy hour partner in crime and colleague decided we would check out the Friday Apertif Hour (4-6) pm. We ordered the sliders, bruscetta, truffle fries and the truffle mac and cheese. The truffle mac and cheese is amazing and it was devoured before I even had the slightest chance to take a picture. For those of you looking for healthier options, they have a great fruit platter too! They also offer wine, beer, cocktails and kir royales. We opted to try ALL the kirs settling on the blackberry as our favorite.I enjoyed the happy hour so much that I decided I would be back on Sunday to check out the brunch from 11am-3pm. I have to admit, I was lured in by the $12 bottles of champagne. I found the brunch to be pleasantly delightful (even before the champagne kicked in). We ordered the BAKED BRIE with creamy pesto sauce & a baby salad to start then the FRENCH TOAST with banana maple syrup and brown sugar bacon - YUM! Elle tried the THREE EGG OMELET with pan seared mushrooms, spinach, gruyere cheese and potatoes.Definitely "perched" at the top of my go to list for happy hour or brunch and worth the drive downtown! I can't wait to host my next event there!The only thing I would love to see at Perch is a slightly longer happy hour maybe going until 7. That way I'd be able to visit more often :)ps I had the pleasure of meeting their events coordinator since I had inquired about hosting an event there. Michelle was fabulous!Brunch tip - parking is free downtown on Sunday and definitely make a reservation!

Reviews.Author: Nan J.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place. Came here twice. First was during the week and it was nice. Good drinks classy crowed and gorgeous view. Second time I went was on the weekend and it was awful! Wayyy too crowded! There was not even room to stand! We waited in line to go to the highest roof part.. we waited for 30 minutes and when we finally got up there it was only slightly less crowded then the other part of the place.  hey let too many people in. It totally killed from the romantic ambience and reminded me of a dirty vegas club.  Not really my type of spot so if I come back I'll stick to midweek only.

Reviews.Author: Aimie B.
Reviews.Content: absolutely gorgeous.  everyone must see!

Reviews.Author: Tony S.
Reviews.Content: Perch is more of a lounge/bar scene. I was hoping to have a culinary experience but all i got was a Incredible view of downtown LA at night from the perch balcony located on the roof of the building. Im not saying the food was bad, but it was nothing out of the ordinary. Steak was perfectly cooked & the french fries where very delicious as well.

Reviews.Author: Lauren A.
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times the view and ambiance is spectacular! The food is okay, you are definitely paying for the view, however, the drinks are pretty good and moderately priced.

Reviews.Author: J K.
Reviews.Content: Cool ambiance/nice view...drinks a big pricey, but the old-fashioned was delicious!  Can't stand douche-y wait outside even though it's not crowded outside b/c it's cool LA lines.  Didn't have any food.

Reviews.Author: V A.
Reviews.Content: Perch. The name would imply a patio? And a patio on a sunny day would imply sun? Without any expectations for food, simply seemed like a great patio brunch location... well, all in theory, it could have worked. Bir it didn't. The roof was retracted, so the sunny patio, turned into a dark, cold cave. Service was a sad, sad disaster. The brunch cocktails came after the food... unacceptable by any standards. Oh, and  not surprisingly, the food orders came out all wrong. Again, everything could have been forgotten, we could have enjoyed the sunny patio on a beautiful sunny day. Dark, cold, brunches in a cave aren't really my thing.

Reviews.Author: Marilynn L.
Reviews.Content: Pricey food. Strong drinks are a plus. Decor is just okay (not fancy - cheap finishes and incoherent theme). Views are spectacular though.

Reviews.Author: Erica S.
Reviews.Content: Aside from the disorganization that comes with being a new restaurant, and the bratty waiter who kept yelling "Perch! Who ordered the perch?!", this place was lots of fun. There is a bar on the roof with a great view but not enough seats, and the restaurant serves delicious food. But really, how can you go wrong with pork belly and chitlins??? The waiter made ammends by serving us doughnuts in the end--and those were good too!

Reviews.Author: Gil K.
Reviews.Content: very french menu, i had the rabbit rillette, and the fiance had the spare rib and pork belly. the view is great, you can see the other buildings and beyond them to the rest of LA. service is fine, nothing special. Again, this is very french so don't expect fusion or anything like that. I woudl coem here again, but this time, we were in a little bit of a hurry, just wanted to check it out and grab a quick bite, so we didn't get the enjoy it with more drinks. the rabbit rillette was a bit dry but that's fine, they had some jellies to eat it with, apricot, prunes and carmelized onions. the spare ribs were so moist as well as the pork belly. lots of the fat section, so it was succulent and teh flavor was very savory. the potatoes helped with the fat. the carrots were undercooked but it was ok, i like carrots.I will come here again when i have more time.ps, you will want to make reservations..this place gets busy.

Reviews.Author: Katy C.
Reviews.Content: Great Place.. Love it. Its all the way up on the rooftop of a building which gives great views of downtown LA.. .from the top you can see Pershing Square. When you get up (after taking two elevators) it feels like you are in a big city like new york, etc. It is more of a "grown up" place or more sophisticated older crowd. The atmosphere is nice, you can actually hear each other talk. I would def come back here again

Reviews.Author: Becks C.
Reviews.Content: Yes, the views are spectacular.......but let's get to the important part, the food! The stand outs are duck duck goose and the bone marrow (you can NEVER mess up bone marrow, let's face it!). Everything else was just ok. I do like the vibe and atmosphere, very 1920's Paris. Tres chic!

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: Worked an event here and really had a great time. If your not worries about spending and just having a good time this is the place. It's affordable though. So amazing. The view of Los Angeles is to die for. The wind in your hair, the nice French style decor, the food, the atmosphere. Just so amazing, I heard they do a pretty incredible brunch with live jazz music and a great deal on mimosas!  Can't wait to come again.

Reviews.Author: Brenda R.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view of the city, food was good, our waiter Sean was awesome and Ambiance was amazing. Was not thrilled with having to squeeze into the elevators, and the dance floor was tiny but the view of the city made up for it.

Reviews.Author: Kenny M.
Reviews.Content: Drinks were great, views are nice and food was delicious. Every table is different, every chair is different. This is just a fantastic place to have drinks and dinner.

Reviews.Author: Jermaine C.
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at PerchLA.  I drove up from Orange County on a Friday night.  As expected, there was traffic and made it to Perch 15 minutes late.  I called to advise I would be late and they were completely accommodating.  As soon as I arrived my girlfriend and I were seated.  It was a cool night and the table adjacent to us, which was closer to the fireplace, became available as soon as we were seated.  I asked if we could be moved and almost without hesitation, first checking to make sure that the table wasn't already taken, we were moved.  Not only that,  our server was very very attentive.  I would definitely recommend Perch to anyone and will definitely be coming back!  I am now excited to check out their Sunday Brunch!!!

Reviews.Author: Beth O.
Reviews.Content: The view was outstanding.  The deck was beautiful.  Loved the ambiance.  We came for dinner.  Had a party of 6 with a reservation.  The appetizers were fine.  Nothing special.  Oysters, shrimp, mussels and Ahi.  Filet Mignon was wonderful.  Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: Nicole D.
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 4 enjoying Saturday brunch here, and it was GREAT. We had a good waitress, ordered a bottle of champagne that was only $15, got a jug of OJ and made our own mimosas - yum. The french toast was excellent here and served with fresh fruit. The eggs benedict appeared to be good as well. A couple of people in our party ordered an omelette which they were a little disappointed with due to it not having as much filling as they had anticipated. Overall, it was a great time. The waitress didn't rush us at all and let us chill out for a while and take our time to talk and relax. We were seated on couches with a low table, so it was very comfortable and relaxing, and a nice way to enjoy being outdoors with a pretty view of the city. Eventually, the automatic roof thing extended and we were covered, but still had a great view of the city. There was also some live music going on to add to the ambiance. I'd definitely come back here for a weekend brunch.

Reviews.Author: Seda G.
Reviews.Content: my boy friend took me there yesterday for my birthday. I loved it! Alive music Chello :) I love it... Sunset view is fascinating ;)  Food is very yummy stuff is very nice and friendly since it was my birthday they servedus deserts for free.. but still I have to warn you portions are small and not cheap... but it is really best place to go for a date if you want to impress someone or for a  special day. People were dressing smart causal :) everyone looked like enjoying :) I loved it seriousl I loved it if you are looking for a place to take your girl friend I strongly recommend...

Reviews.Author: Mark D.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy going to Perch, but the experience isn't always the best.  I have to say that the majority of the time it's great, but a few times have been less than desirable.  The atmosphere and the food are always great, the service can be hit or miss.  Regardless, it's worth the gamble.  Go check this place out and have fun.

Reviews.Author: Thithien N.
Reviews.Content: The customer service is terrible here. I was a regular, but now I am a non-regular. I purchased a round of beers, and I ended up getting a nice "over charge" on my debit card. Tried contacting management the next day but never got a response. I tried again and the same happened...What's the point of having a business when you can't contact anyone who knows how to provide customer service to issues such as this?! Simply put, ridiculous and unprofessional, and if you do go to perch pay in CASH only and check your receipt!

Reviews.Author: Sam S.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for view and location, 3 stars for drinks and food. We went there on a Monday night, so the topmost lounge was closed, but it was also uncrowded with lots of seating options, both inside and out. I would definitely recommend sitting outside for the great views of downtown. I know a lot of folks from NYC have been sniggereing about the 'roof top views', but in L.A. it is unique, and also unlike NYC we have great weather and so can be experienced and appreciated year round. The day we went was warm (over 90* in the afternoon), but the evening was quite cool, with a steady breeze blowing. However they have heaters coveniently located next to each sofa/ seat and quickly turned ours on, and that provided enough warmth. As far as the service is concerned, it was top notch. Our server Todd was not only friendly and knowledgable, but very attentive. He looked like he stepped out of a 50's Hollywood movie (you'll know what I mean, if you see him).Getting there is a breeze. The door is around the corner from 5th on Hill. The elevator takes you straight up to the 13th floor and then another elevator to the 15th (follow the bird as others have said). There is aparking lot right across, but do what we did - take the red or purple line metro! The Pershing Sq station is right across the street and trains run past midnite weekdays and 'till 2 AM weekends.The food was okay, but pricey as were the drinks.A great place to take a date or go with a small group.Happy Hour is from 4-6 PM.

Reviews.Author: Samantha N.
Reviews.Content: LOVE the view and the fact they had a DJ on the roof. I had jeans on and didnt feel judged at all. Pricey of course, but the view of the city and the atmosphere is worth it. Would give this place five stars, but when we ask for an umbrella to shade us they gave everyone one but us...so odd. Awesome place though!

Reviews.Author: Lauren Z.
Reviews.Content: Review for bar/lounge...not restaurant/food. 5 stars on the view, 2ish stars on the atmosphere/ambiance. Waiting in a long line seems worth it at first; the view, yummy drinks. French Maid is my fave & both the bf and bro really like their Old Fashion. But then after you get used to the view & yummy dranks -- and after you drain your bank acct on a round or two -- you kinda ask yourself "was that wait really worth it?". Of course the company you're with matters, but still, the vibe could def be better here. Down to come again as long as there's little to no line.

Reviews.Author: Elyse K.
Reviews.Content: Food is just OK, views make up for it big time.  I'm definitely not one to forgive mediocre food, but for some reason, I can give this place a pass.  It's probably best to come by for a couple glasses of wine and a cheese and charcuterie course than for a full dinner.The setting is french country terrace in the middle of the city.  Painted tiles, sconce light fixtures, wood paneled interior and a marble outdoor fireplace are just a few of the details that create a comfortable yet elegant brassiere setting.  Pick the corner fireplace seating area for your group to relax and mingle on tufted linen cushions and a swinging love seat.I've been to Perch twice, once for Happy Hour and another for dinner with good friends.  Happy Hour offerings are limited to select wines and small bites, but adequate enough as you're really there to soak up the outdoors, not stuff yourself on light french bites.  For the full patio experience, show up 20 minutes before sunset and you can catch the reflection of the pink and orange sky glimmering off the mirrored towers.  As the sun starts to set, and the city lights begin to twinkle, you will want to linger for as long as possible.  There was quite the buzz and crowd on a Wednesday night and while we didn't have a reservation, we were seated within 20 minutes or so. To start, order the rabbit rillettes and the cheese plate as both were sizable portions for four to share.  Shake and bake frog legs and the cordon bleu poppers will be suggested by the server, but don't bother, both were tiny portions and nothing outstanding in execution.  After so many small plates, we really didn't need entrees, but if you must, our friends enjoyed their lamb burger and our coq au vin had nice elements but sounded more exciting reading the description from the menu.

Reviews.Author: Joanne D.
Reviews.Content: This place was jus OK.  Great location.  Love the view.  It almost doesn't feel like you're in Downtown.  When it came to the food...it was so so.  I ordered the Perch and it was really good.  My friend ordered the lamb burger and it was very very dry and tasted real gamey.  Our waitress seemed like she wanted to jump off the bldg.  She didn't smile once.  She was great as far as customer service but seemed like her head was somewhere else.  I also felt like I was being rushed to eat and leave.  There was some big party happening in the lounge area so I'm not sure if that had anything to do with it.  Not sure if I'd come back.

Reviews.Author: Derek L.
Reviews.Content: Went for drinks on a Friday night.  Nice rooftop bar/lounge.  Nice views, but not the best.  Drink prices are a bit high.  Plenty of room to sit and mingle.  Didn't have the feel or a hot spot.  Just somewhere relaxing and somewhat upscale to enjoy a drink with friends.

Reviews.Author: KebShi L.
Reviews.Content: great place to have drinks with friends.  make a reservationsif you want to have dinner on the 15th floor. use the 16th floor if its just drinks. prices are comparable to other dt bars.

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely beautiful. I think I'm a bit too young for the crowd though so maybe when I'm 28-30 yrs old. Regardless, absolutely stunning view of DTLA. Its pretty breath taking.

Reviews.Author: Jack H.
Reviews.Content: Would have been better if the female bartender actually paid attention to who's waiting the longest and smile occasionally. Place is small and can get crowded, but you get roof top view of parts of LA. Crowd is mix.

Reviews.Author: Raquel L.
Reviews.Content: This place has the BEST view of downtown Los Angeles in my opinion! It is hidden and not many people know about this hidden jem... You have to go to the 13th floor then take a separate elevator to the 15th floor for dinner or *16th floor the rooftop!! Drinks are kinda pricey but delish ... I wouldn't stay here all night but it's a def. must see ... The elevators are kinda scary they jump

Reviews.Author: Cherie T.
Reviews.Content: I hit the restaurant and the rooftop bar for a networking event. Beautifully tiled doorways and terraces create a sexy and elegant setting. There's nothing like drinking with friends on a city rooftop as the light twinkle around you. The restaurant bites were so yummy. Try the Fried Brie, Pork Rillette, and Merguez sliders. Also, you can never go wrong with pork belly! For cocktails I tried the French 64 and the My Fair Lady. Both were very tasty and modestly priced (I thought) for the quality of the drink and quantity of alcohol.  I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Sophia C.
Reviews.Content: get here before 9 and you dont have to wait in line downstairs. this place is pretty cool because you get to go in two elevators in order to get to the roof. then its an inside/outside restaurant/bar. the food is super amazing. try the bone marrow! the cool part of the outside bar is that its split into two. theres one thats a higher level on the other side that consists of just a bar. just walk around the side and you can find the entrance there. its super romantic because you can see the view of downtown. great date spot!!!

Reviews.Author: Mark T.
Reviews.Content: The view is awesome.  The food is not.  Been here several times and it is consistently mediocre.  Only the view will keep me coming back.

Reviews.Author: Scott E.
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan, great views. Kind of pricy...and the drinks are good - not great. Maybe for another area they'd be great, but for downtown you go there for the view.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine K.
Reviews.Content: I love Perch! Yes, it is overpriced and overly crowded on the weekends but come on! The view is amazing and it is in the most gorgeous building.  I love taking the elevator up- you feel like you have entered a different era.  I went for drinks and happy hour and it was good but not amazing (plus, I didn't really eat).  However, you go here for the ambiance and the views!  I am planning to make reservations for dinner here soon and will write another review.

Reviews.Author: Elliott K.
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my birthday here and at the Edison. Chill spot with amazing rooftop views of downtown LA. Azn spot, so practice your "Ni Hao"

Reviews.Author: L M.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came to Perch on a Wednesday night. It wasn't too crowded and the ambiance was very nice. Its hard to get a table right away and the drinks are nothing out of the ordinary. They had an oyster bar on that night and I thought it was pretty good. It is a nice place to go to have a relaxing, fun evening.

Reviews.Author: V L.
Reviews.Content: The trip to Perch may have been one of those nights when someone calls and says " I read about this fabulous place in your old neighborhood.  It has the best view of the city"  Really? Have you ever seen Pershing Square after dark?  Girl, downtown is coming up but honey bear, its still shady.  Whenever I feel the urge to see the city I will usually ride Red Elevator at the Bonaventure until my little hearts content,  up and down from the first floor to the 30th floor, i swear it feels like Willy Wonkas elevator, everytime.   Back to Perch, it is an interesting place, perhaps with they will figure things out.

Reviews.Author: J S.
Reviews.Content: The view is nice but the food is nothing special, and the service is very slow, the best thing to do is to come for the ambiance, perhaps a drink at the lounge area before or after you dine elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Clay B.
Reviews.Content: The place is nice. Their sliders are good but it's ridiculous when it comes to the rooftop bar. The guys at the door makes everybody think it's crazy busy up there and make people wait forever but in reality, it's not.  Not too crazy bout this place cuz the service sucks.

Reviews.Author: Sharon E.
Reviews.Content: A-OK!  Looking for a cool roof top hang out?  A place with a great view?  Perch is where it's at.  Drinks...slightly pricy.  Chill atmosphere.  Can go in jeans or in a sexy dress!

Reviews.Author: Gina C.
Reviews.Content: I visited Perch one beautiful winter night after work. It couldn't have been more perfect I love the old buildings and architecture of downtown LA and took in every restored nook and cranny as we were whisked to the rooftop. Music and Appetizers were delightful as we enjoyed the sunset overlooking the lit up skating rink above Pershing Square. As we were devouring our over priced, but delicious dinner I took in all of the different genres of age and culture dining. Reminded me a lot  of what I love about New York.  Guys, Dolls, a perfect date place to get cozy together and enjoy all the bliss of LA, or a little single mingle after work.

Reviews.Author: A C.
Reviews.Content: This place is on top of an historic building in downtown.  You take an elevator ride to the 13th floor and take another private elevator to the top of the building.  The decor is Art Deco.  The vibe is upscale casual.  I came here for a late dinner and had coq au vin and French onion soup.  Basically, coq au vin just translates to "rooster with wine".  It was very good but not great.  The alcohol cooks off in this dish, but the flavor of the wine is imparted, along with smoky bacon, garlic, onion and rosemary.  On the food alone, I probably would give 3.5 stars.  The French ambiance and the view of downtown are what you come here for.   At night, it's a very romantic spot to have a chat with a date.  Servers were very friendly.  The crowd was sophisticated and fun.  After dinner, we sat near the bar and actually had a fun time chatting with people next table.  It was a memorable and fun visit.

Reviews.Author: Anna B.
Reviews.Content: One of my to places for Sunday Funday! The views are amazing. The dinner menu is not very impressive. They could work on their menu to offer more options. Not my to go place for french food. I prefer other french restaurants in the dtla area. The co I work for has frequent events here and the food they provide is terrible.

Reviews.Author: Renee N.
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Can not beat the atmosphere and the food was really good. Would go back in a minute!

Reviews.Author: Johanna C.
Reviews.Content: I only love Perch during the week! The weekend is another story! There are lines everywhere! So If you want to enjoy the rooftop bar ambiance and want the bartenders to pay attention, go during the weekend.

Reviews.Author: Steve Y.
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience. The food was delicious and the view was amazing.

Reviews.Author: Van N.
Reviews.Content: oh man dont go for the food! i finally went OUT out to perch and it's bombastic!!! no cover, pretty fun dj music, and just a great chill time with a great view! a lot like the standard rooftop bar but much classier! fyi, we walked in easy peasy on a friday night but there was a long ass line on saturday :(

Reviews.Author: Clarissa H.
Reviews.Content: Group of friends came here for dinner on a Saturday evening. We actually got great service, I think our waitress wanted us to hurry up and leave but that wasn't our plan. ha.  We started with the merguez sliders, I dont like lamb, but these were tasty lil burgers.  I also had the beet salad, skip it.  I then ordered a plate with chicken, sorry I dont remember the name, with mashed potatoes and it was very good.  Juicy, tasty and the mash was delicious!  After that we ordered the raspberry creme brulee which was also very good.  Our friends ordered different plates, I remember the swordfish and truffle mac n cheese and all of them were satisfied.  The ambiance is cool with live music and awesome views of downtown.

Reviews.Author: John-Eric C.
Reviews.Content: The thing that sells this place is the fantastic views of LA that you get. Great ambiance, decoration, and vibe to the place, and a low key atmosphere that makes it a fun place to hang. Drinks were great, but definitely on the pricey side, and the service came with a smile. Came by on a Saturday night and the line seemed outrageous, but my experience on a weeknight was a breeze. I'd definitely go back again, and next time for a romantic dinner.

Reviews.Author: Lisa A.
Reviews.Content: Just went there for the second time. This time I accidently stumbled upon happy hour between 4pm-6pm. It was perfect - not crowed so we could choose where to sit and the beers were only 5 bucks :-) Not much food in the happy hour menu but it is a lovely place to grab some afternoon sunshine!

Reviews.Author: Alex L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing view and atmosphere.  Too bad the bar is extremely slow and the drinks average

Reviews.Author: Justin F.
Reviews.Content: I can see my house from here !

Reviews.Author: jessie f.
Reviews.Content: T'was a Wednesday evening and I sat at the bar. The hosts were nice and attentive and gave me the run down on the seating. The bartender was cordial but not overly friendly and the drinks were well portioned. I had some sort of salad and the chicken with truffle fries. The food is tasty and the ambiance, unique. I might come back and try to find a spot on the outdoor patio for this "amazing" experience the previous Yelpers claimed to have.

Reviews.Author: Ani K.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a joint birthday party here on a saturday night. Location is beautiful on the rooftop. We came early to reserve a spot for our friends and family. We were able to get a spot pretty quick. The music is perfect, the drinks were great. Few cons: there was a long wait to get drinks---at least 1/2 hour to get drinks. Friends who came after 10/10:30 waited an hour to get in. Appetizers are not served unless you reserve ahead of time---the reservation for that is $100/person. But if you don't reserve, you just have to get there early to snatch a spot! We had a lot of fun---We had cake pops and balloons for our party and they allowed us to bring it in :) It was a nice rooftop with great drinks. Fun times!

Reviews.Author: Ridersdiaries D.
Reviews.Content: Great ambiance, we need more places like Perch in Downtown Los Angeles. Beautiful people, relaxing atmosphere and an amazing view. Check it out when you re in DLA.

Reviews.Author: Teddy W.
Reviews.Content: So I went again, because I'm not sure you can beat the rooftop spot in DTLA, got the eggs benedict, truffle fries, 3 egg omelet, and 2 egg plate.... and champagne and we got drinks on the roof afterwards. EVERYTHING WAS PERFECT.... everything except the shade ha but no complaints, we were able to move umbrellas so that all 3 of us were sitting in shade. Next time I'm going to make a reservation. There were no open tables so we had to linger around the lounge area for a table to open up, that was our own fault. A little hot now that it's the dead of summer but no big deal, definitely worth it. Drinks upstairs were amazing. Didn't see either waitresses that "helped" us last time so that was a plus? lol

Reviews.Author: M. M.
Reviews.Content: I had a large group here yesterday. We stayed 7 hours!! Maybe a little more. We had a group of 12 for brunch (with tons of champagne) and had at least another 12 or so drop by to hang out and have drinks afterwards... So overall, we may have been close to 30 people there, mingling, drinking, having fun. And our waitress and all the bartenders were AMAZING. The food and service were great without any mistakes or flaws. The vibe was awesome. It was a perfect day and I can't thank these guys enough. LOVED it .Thanks, Perch!!

Reviews.Author: Lynn B.
Reviews.Content: Oh man, I was SO looking forward to a weekend brunch here!  We made a reservation online and were promptly seated....and then we waited.  And waited.  The place has a nice vibe and a great view (but if you don't like small or old elevators, you might not enjoy the ride up).......oh, by the way, we were still waiting for our waitress.Then she appeared.  For a place with a really small menu and items such as $15+ burger....once would think the waitstaff would be pretty professional and "high-end."  NOT HERE. She did not speak politely and quite frankly, she just looked a little trashy....like she did the walk of shame that morning....right on into work. We asked about the cheese plate which came with a "selection of cheeses."  Response:  "Um, yaaah, let me go check.  I don't really know.  I have to check with the chef."  Ok cool.  Go check.  10 minutes later....she returns.  She can barely pronounce the names of the cheese and when we ask (nicely) if one of the types was goat or cow she responds again:  "Um, yaaah, let me go check.  I don't really know.  I have to check with the chef."   SERIOUSLY?????  There are only like 12 items on the brunch menu b*itch.....if you can't get that down, MAYBE you should work somewhere like IHOP or In and Out.  Jeez.  Another 10 minutes passed and then she returned.  No explanation. No apologies.   I was pretty much done and starving.  I have never left a restaurant before eating, but just could not deal.  The people on either side of us were complaining about how long they had been waiting for their food.  I knew this situation was not going to get any better. We offered to pay for our coffee and diet cokes and informed her that we were leaving.   I might come back for happy hour drinks on the rooftop (it was closed that day)...but SCREW BRUNCH.  There are so many better places for brunch with decent wait staff and you don't have to spend ALL fricken day just to get waited on.Sorry Perch.  I wanted to love you.

Reviews.Author: Mariel L.
Reviews.Content: Perch is a fun place for hanging out and getting a few drinks around downtown LA. My friends and I arrived around 11 PM on a Saturday night, and thankfully, we didn't really have that long a line to wait on. The guys checking people's IDs were very immature, though, but that's a slight hiccup. You go up two different elevators to get to Perch, and once we were inside I was reminded of another rooftop bar I've been to in Minneapolis (yes, THAT Minneapolis): classic yet trendy decor (with lots of birds, of course), moody lighting, a lovely buzz from all the patrons, with the added bonus of a DJ and a drummer on one corner. Drinks are around what I expected; spent $25 for three drinks, one of which was ginger ale. Everyone wanted to be outside, and we were lucky enough to grab a couple of chairs and create a makeshift seating area by the glass barriers. We had a gorgeous view of the financial district, and it was just warm enough, but you could also sit by the outdoor fireplace if you'd like. Just a lovely place to hang and catch up with friends. Oh, and I especially liked my mojito; mr. bartender did it right with the perfect blend of everything.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer F.
Reviews.Content: Took my best buds to The Perch.  Hmmm.  Door man in the lobby was attentive but unfortunately he was the only one in the whole place that viewed us as customers who love to spend money.  Now mind you, we dressed for the occasion, 2 women in mini's with bodies to match and an escort that was a double for Smith in Sex and the City. So we  thought, this being L.A. and all, that we would garner some attention from the staff.  Apparently not this staff for it seems they were too busy trying so hard to be "cool" in nerdy outfits that being friendly and welcoming was not in their vocab.  Two guys and a girl at the podium?  Not kidding.  Would you think that meant there were definitely enough of them to offer some service?  Nope.   It was almost 10pm.  To their inquiring look we announced we were there for drinks and desserts.  They looked around a lot, acting as if it was a hard decision when we could see the place wasn't full. They huddled and decided it was ok if we wanted to sit in the bar and one of them waved in the general direction.    Isn't ordering desserts and perhaps appetizers considered dining?  Apparently not to the staff at the Perch who stayed at the podium rather than attempting to seat us. We acted as if they had actually helped us...and walked ourselves over to a comfy couch and sank down into its comforting cushions.  We were facing the bar, so we had to crane our necks around to glance at the skyline which was magnificent and made me think it could be a spot for romantic dining, that is, except for the "welcome" thus far and the horribly loud "unce, unce, unce" pumped out by the lone dj in the corner which made conversation impossible unless you had your lips literally shellacked  to a receiving ear.  Did we get in the club by mistake?  No, not possible, I know no "accidentals" get into their club.  Is L.A. just determined to compete in the snob charade marathon of all cities in the US? 10 minutes...and our waitress decided to pay us a visit.  Not a word of "Welcome to the Perch"  or " Can I get you started with drinks this evening?"  No.  We got someone who was obviously tired, not much up for conversation and hailed us with a  direct, "Have you decided?".  I guess everyone that goes to the Perch has the menu memorized?  I mentioned a menu would be nice, but not knowing when we'd get the next chance to order we ordered a round of drinks and water to start.  She popped back with the menu and left  again.  Fortunately we had a LOT to talk about...because 15 minutes later...precisely nothing had happened while we sat and watched  a string of waiters and bus boys running  back and forth, none of which meant to serve us.  Did I say 15 minutes?  Try 20.  Even when the table of six on our left cleared out and a 4 top  on the right got up and left.  It was getting close to 10:30 pm on a wednesday night....and we were sitting at a place that thinks they're hip while the idea of service is unknown.   So finally, the drinks came....and we got a chance to order  some appetizers.  The baked brie and the mixed greens with pears and candied walnuts.  The couple sitting across from us, with the girlfriend that was all over him trying to block his view of us, finally left....so we slid over to face the view as fast as our high rise stilettos would allow, except for Smith of course who walks in comfortable Italian shoes.  The waiting time got better...just 15 minutes for the appetizers.  The salad was amazing, crisp, fresh and full of little savory elements like the sweet bites of pears and crunchy walnuts.  The Brie, wasn't anything special, at least I toast slivered almonds and roll the brie in them before I bake it so it's a melting, delicious globe of Brie goodness with crunchy bites of almonds with my favorite holiday cheer.  Lucky for us, dessert civilized us again.  The creme brulee wasn't overly sweet  and the glaze was crunchy while the custard was ohhh so smooth.  In contrast the bread pudding was baked to create that slightly crunchy top that slides open to reveal a moist custardy vanilla and creamy bread melange.  But wait, how about that hot rich, espresso and the aromatic teas that we ordered?  But I can't wait, the spoons keep dipping into the irrisistible brulee and the bread budding is cooling too fast to wait or so I think while the minutes whip by and I try to resist while my spoon hovers and hovers.  We ordered our coffees and teas at the same time as dessert, didn't we?   And  the waitress just couldn't manage to time them together?  I could understand some slippage with a 4 course meal but dessert and coffee arrive so far apart the desserts were demolished before the coffee arrived?  Aw come on, chef, do check that your staff has the basics in hand, for those of us who actually enjoy sipping a beverage while savoring every bite of your winsome desserts.  You're making it very hard for us to frequent The Perch more than once.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca V.
Reviews.Content: The roof top bar provides a gorgeous atmosphere.  The line to get into the bar however is not so pleasant.

Reviews.Author: Matthew G.
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at Perch and I have to say it was a very pleasant experience. The rooftop was very cozy (especially after a few drinks) and featured wonderful views of dtla.  For a Friday night the wait to get in was not unbearable especially if you are among good company, however the bouncer at the front was a little creepy haha. He would open his eyes really wide when he was matching faces with ID.  Seems like a cool hangout spot for the younger working crowd, definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Amy G.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had reservations for 8pm on a Friday night. When we got there the hostess told us it will be a while wait before we get seated because they are backed up for the night. We were pretty hungry and we didn't even have an estimated wait time. I asked for the manager, Eric. He was so nice and so professional. Within 10 mins he arranged a table for us, and even bought us a bottle of champagne, ( our choice of drink) and the appetizers we had ordered.
