He took care of us so well that night for the incontinence of not seating us down at our reservation time!! The food was good too, but the ambience is just amazing! This is the kind of service that will draw customers back in! We absolutely had such an amazing time, and Eric really set the mood for that.

Reviews.Author: Helen K.
Reviews.Content: Have to start out by saying the host staff was really nice and guided us to an amazing spot outside to have my cousins birthday. The 2 stars are actually for the service. We got there at 2:30 to be served brunch which ended at 3. Our waitress came to take our drink orders and didn't come back until 3:05 (without our drink)  and let us know brunch was already over. Then we pointed out my cousin who stepped away to use the restroom to bring out the cake and she bought it out without him even having returned. Not the best experience.

Reviews.Author: Maria V.
Reviews.Content: Was driving by it when my friend mentioned how she's heard about it and wanted to check it out. So... I pulled into valet and decided we could pre-party here first and then continue to our destination. There was a small line but waited only two minutes to go up. We were able to get a seat in the patio on the first level. The décor is nice and the views amazing. There was a live band outside where we sat and enjoyed our first round of drinks. Went inside and had some hors-d'oeuvres, which had great flavor, before deciding to try round two on the second level. This is where it lost one point....there's a line you have to wait in to go upstairs!!! We waited about ten-fifteen minutes to go upstairs but I'm glad we waited. The décor and view from upstairs is even better. It's a very chill and intimate place. I would go again but not in a group, more like a date or with just one or two friends.

Reviews.Author: Jackie R.
Reviews.Content: It's a cute place. Crowded but all places in downtown are. Staff was nice. Drinks were good. View & design of the place is beautiful. Music was okay dj was kinda out of it... But good for background music. Theres were two lines; One to get in to the place. Then one more if you want to go to the very top rooftop. It's a nice place to go and see atleast once. Just need to be able to tolerate the line and some drunk people. But if u go with a fun group of people I'm sure you will have a good time.

Reviews.Author: Cyndi B.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like to Perch SOOOoOoOo much, but oh, how sorely disappointed was I.  Other than the view, there really is no reason to return.  I know that sounds harsh, but hear me out people.  I came here for a friend's birthday for dinner and drinks and the service was RI-DI-CU-LOUS-LY slow!  The weird thing was, it was slow for stuff that you would assume would normally be the quickest part of service...like soup.  Uhh...are you JUST sending out the lobster fisher for my lobster bisque when I place my order??  And then when it finally came, way after everyone's entrees and several reminders to the wait staff mind you, it was not good--really fishy and salty.  Eck!  Two separate members of our party ordered the sea bass with mussels on top.  One complained of a rotten smell and taste coming from her sea bass and the other just said hers was really fishy, like the sea bass was not fresh.  After passing around the rotten plate to the rest of the table to play "What's That Smell?", it was concluded that the one of the mussels on top must've been sick or gone bad, and its juices flowed down into the sea bass.  Oh!  And I ordered a ceasar salad that came with what appeared to be raw anchovies.  Of course I tried it since I'm all for trying new things, but it was no bueno.  bleh... After all this, one would think that I would've only gave them one star, which, to be honest with you, they probably deserved.  I mean, they even brought everyone's alcohol with the exception of one person's for over half the meal, once again, even after several reminders and even rounds for the other people.  But, the reason I gave them two stars instead of just one is because my salmon with lemon risotto and bread pudding dessert was actually pretty good and of course, the view is amazing.  I mean, even though the service was slow, our waiter was really nice.  I even thought I may return to just the bar upstairs for drinks and the view, since that's where we headed after dinner, and it was very lovely.  But, then a very snooty bartender ruined that as well.  I definitely won't be going back...not by choice anyway.

Reviews.Author: Mrs C.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place. It is on the top floor of the Pershing Square building, and the food is amazing.  If you can, I highly recommend the lamb burger.

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: The view is spectacular.  I arrived with some friends from out of town to find out it was "friends and family night".  "But I called an hour ago and was told to come down", I said.  "Oh well just go on in then." the large bounce said.  Fast forward, we get up the two sets of elevators, and first elevator stopped on the 13th floor and yes there was a 13th FL button .  Next we crossed the hall and followed instructions that had been taped to the wall.  We found elevator number two and made out way into the bar.  The creamy white and dusty blue deco tiles were stunning and the place was alive.  We found out the drinks were free which was good because the first bartender messed up my old fashion, he squirted lots of soda water into the drink, made it into an old fashion spritzer.  Anyhow, the views were killer.  It'd be a great place for a date night on one of the slower nights.

Reviews.Author: Jenn M.
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my bday at Perch. It had just been open two weeks when we arrived last Saturday night. We didn't know what to expect, but we were looking forward to the rooftop bar. We heard the views were magnifique! We had a reservation at ten, but we arrived at 8:30 and had planned on just hanging out. When we arrived though, to our surprise the table was already ready! Our table with a little reserve tent just waiting for us. We were really surprised to learn that it was, "our table" all night long..meaning we could go upstairs to the rooftop bar at any time and come back down and our table would be waiting for us. Sounded to good to be true, but three people confirmed it for us, including our awesome waiter Josh. We started out with drinks and appetizers and all was delicious. We had the French 65 and one of their champagne mixed drinks and they were sooo good. Let me stop by saying Josh was amazing. He was such a nice guy and was there for every thing we needed/wanted. Always with a smile. He was super fun too and I would recommend you ask for him by name!We had their Duck Duck Goose, their Cordon Bleu Poppers and a Cesar Salad to start. The Duck Duck Goose was awesome and while I wasn't a huge fan of the poppers my friends really liked them. The Cesar was also really good with real anchovies served on top. For dinner I had the Perch au Noisette. Really tasty and fresh. I admit I was a little confused with the whole Perch idea. It was Perch fish, so I assumed the whole namesake thing was on the fish, but then on their site and if I remember correctly on their menu there was a bird...a Perch. So, maybe it's just anything that's a Perch...not sure. Should have asked. My friends if I recall had Boeuf Bourguignon Déconstruit and the Pork Confit Cassulet and everyone seemed to really enjoy them. So all around food is a major plus.Some of our party ran late, and I'll say although it all worked out, this was the strange thing. B/c this is the hot new place  it gets pretty crowded towards the end of the night. So, a line starts to form downstairs. We didn't see any of this when we arrived at 8:30. Two of our friends arrived around 10 and they got stuck in the line downstairs. Now, most people downstairs were waiting to go to the bar on the rooftop. They wouldn't let our friends up even though they were part of a dinner reservation. We had to engage Josh who engaged the Manager who engaged Security who called for our friends. We had to do it twice finally getting the Manager to walk down with one of our friends to actually pick them out of the crowd! It all worked out, but that was a little weird. Our thoughts were that if our friends were part of our dinner party and not for the bar they shouldn't have to wait in a 30 min line. After dinner we went to the rooftop bar and the views were totally amazing. The weather was just right too. Overall, Perch was a success and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Elva E.
Reviews.Content: Best view of DTLA ! I loved the drinks and appetizers on their happy hour menu. The staff was nice and friendly. I will definitely coming back for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Ken Y.
Reviews.Content: Being that I live across the street, thought I would leave a review:Pros: The former owners of The Must have done a great job of building a great rooftop venue.Doorman isn't a doucheDrinks are relatively priced well, generous poursView is great, if you like looking at Pershing square and the Skyline facing WestFood is ok, but I'm not a real fan of french foodCons:There is a line occasionally at the front doorCrowd can somewhat be tools and douchebags.

Reviews.Author: KristynJoseph T.
Reviews.Content: definitely a change in scenery. LOVE the night lights on the rooftop. go on a warm day and sit outside or reserve the table next to two fireplaces. the night we went was pretty windy even after we switched to the inside table. can be romantic but also works for non-romantic occasions. food was good - salads are good!

Reviews.Author: Yadira L.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING views! The ambiance is intimate and very romantic.  I was there on a Friday night and it wasn't crowded. We sat by the fireplace and I was smitten by its warmness. I love the fact that they played French music. I tasted their Rabbit Rillette which was pretty tasty.  I also had their frog legs which were okay but not for me.  Overall, this place is really lovely.

Reviews.Author: Andrew W.
Reviews.Content: It's worth a visit and therefore 3 stars because of the view. The service is work in progress.

Reviews.Author: Megan Y.
Reviews.Content: My friend took me here to check it out since it was a rooftop bar. We didn't experience the restaurant portion of Perch and mainly stayed on the rooftop. The restaurant portion is on the floor below. The view was nice. The drinks were interesting and different and pricing was standard (~10) My friend really enjoyed a drink with jalepano in it. It definitely had a kick to it, but for me who doesn't handle spicy, it just numbed my tongue for a while after a sip. Wish they had more seating. The way they arranged the seating, there is probably only enough for about 5 groups or so. Haven't explored all the possibilities, so maybe might come back here again.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer W.
Reviews.Content: I am giving this place three stars based on the combination of food and atmosphere.  First, this is a really great place for dinner, drinks, apps, whatever.  My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's Day (the day after), and it was great.  We sat outside on a couch right next to the fire, and even though it was chilly, we were nice and toasty.  We shared three items plus dessert - lamb sliders, french onion soup, and steak frites.  All were really delicious, comfort food.  For dessert we had the beignets with espresso cream and blackberry jam.  Delicious and fun to eat.The drinks are also amazing!  The ginger syrup in a lot of them makes them great.  We had the French Daquiri and the French 64.  Both were similar in flavor, with ginger syrup and other yummy flavors.  Strong but tasty.Overall, I would recommend this play to anyone.  And as I said, the food is tasty, but you wouldnt only come for the food, but also for the drinks and the ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Victor V.
Reviews.Content: The Perch is a nice change of pace establishment. We went for my friend's wife birthday. Very crowded, but amazing views of DTLA. The price is a bit steep, however, I guess you are paying for the views. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Author: Raymond H.
Reviews.Content: Food was not worth the price. Drinks were overrated. Only things that save this place are the great view, ambience, and friends.

Reviews.Author: Mika O.
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's on the rooftop so the view is gorgeous and all that, but food was not so impressive at all. I tasted a lot of dishes there since we shared them among our big party, but most are too salty and had very similar flavor profile. They call their food French, but I thought it was very Americanized, emphasizing sweetness and saltiness. I'm okay with going their for drinks, but probably not for a dinner.

Reviews.Author: Kim H.
Reviews.Content: I really dug this place.  Just went with a few friends for Sunday brunch and dined outside.  Arriving early, I bellied up to the bar where a bow-tied master mixologist whipped up some gin, jalapeno, and cucumber concoction that was like summer on the rocks!  The food was not what I'd call exquisite, but certainly good.  Service was attentive, eclectic crowd, nice live music.  Yep, would definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Pilar R.
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised this place has good reviews! A group of 11 of us went to celebrate and have dinner for my girlfriends birthday and I must say the service HORRIBLE!!!!!  it took 30 mins to receive our drinks, once our appetizers arrive it took them another 20 mins + to provide us with our utensils. The food is good but not worth the terrible service the restaurant provides. Our actual  entree took about 45 mins or so to arrive. I will never go back to this establishment!!! Save your money and especially your time and go somewhere else!!!!

Reviews.Author: Breck O.
Reviews.Content: service needs work, A LOT of work. we have been here twice: brunch and dinnerBRUNCHwe had a late start for brunch (like 2p/3p) and we were seated outside on the patio amongst other empty tables. it was pretty busy but the place wasn't packed. most of the crowd were drunk already for sunday brunch. no one came to the table for 30-40 minutes, not even to offer us drinks or give us water. we walked out with our menus, gave them to the hostess and said we are leaving. we then complained to the manager who happend to be standing right next to her. he brought us back, gave us complimentary mimosas and we were temporarily satisfied. the food was ok, steak is really good. the caesar salad with chicken was not... the chicken tasted like it was frozen and heated up.DINNERwe made a reservation for 6 people but were told to wait at the bar, it seems like reservations don't really matter there. other walk-in patrons were seated sooner or at the same time. we overheard the hostess and a server say that there was a mix up and they seated another party at our reserved table. service again was slow after they took our order. food came out 40-45 minutes after we had our orders taken. steaks again were good, gnocchi was good too. but another thing we didn't like were the bartenders, we ordered drinks at the bar and were given the drinks without being told which one was which as if we were supposed to know AND their old fashion with regular ice instead of a large sphere or cube ice. if they don't serve it with a sphere or large cube ice... don't put it on the menu

Reviews.Author: Lauren F.
Reviews.Content: Amazing view, amazing view, amazing view!Great place to meet for drinks!Completely unappealing happy hour food.  It's easy to trick Los Angelenos into thinking food is good if you serve it in an attractive venue or charge a lot of money for it.  It didn't work (on me) at Perch.That said, I've never sat down to an actual meal there- perhaps they take more care in that department.

Reviews.Author: V M.
Reviews.Content: Went there for brunch with friends. Great view, great atmosphere, great staff. Awesome Bloody Mary. The live jazz was nice too. Food was really nothing special, we had the Eggs Benedict - salmon and crab and the chocolate desert.

Reviews.Author: Jade S.
Reviews.Content: This was my third time at Perch and I have yet to be even slightly disappointed. A girl friend and I had dinner on Friday night. The food was delicious and the ambiance was great. She had the chicken and risotto which was very filling and I would recommend getting if you're hungry, while I had the golden beet salad which was excellent and perfect if you are looking for something lighter with lots of flavor. If you plan on having dinner you should make reservations before hand, because the place is guaranteed to be packed and rightfully so.  What made the Perch stand out to me was the service.  Our wait staff was extra friendly and very accommodating. The manager even introduced himself and personally made sure we were having a great night. After dinner we headed to the rooftop bar which has breathtaking views and is now one of my favorites in La.  The cocktails at dinner were delicious (My Fair Lady- so good) and the drinks on the roof that I had were nice and strong :) All in all the Perch has a great atmosphere and is a awesome venue with a cool vibe. Great for a girls night out, date night or just to meet friends. Perfect downtown spot for dinner and drinks. I will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Author: Russell I.
Reviews.Content: was impressed with the scenary and view and the service from the waitresses. wasnt impressed with the lady at the door handling guest  its one thing to not let guest in, understandable, but don't talk badly about them in front of them very disrespectful and unprofessional

Reviews.Author: E L.
Reviews.Content: Views are great! Drinks very expensive. Sometimes there is "reserved" seating on the roof which drives me NUTS. Have only eaten mac and cheese here and it was excellent. May go back with tourists in town but I'll order a beer.

Reviews.Author: Ruz B.
Reviews.Content: One of the best rooftop restaurants in DTLA. The view is amazing specially at night. Went there with coworkers after work, the place was packed. It's defintely is pricey  but no complains about the food or service.

Reviews.Author: Yukon D.
Reviews.Content: very nice for a date nite but go mid week

Reviews.Author: Trey H.
Reviews.Content: Not really sure how to grade this one....Ambience was cool; Drinks were pretty good (some are kinda pricey but that peach beer is fan-effing-tastic!!).....My only concern is the menu is VERY thin (just 5 entree offerings [one of each meat type - fish, chicken, beef, vegetarian and pork])....Not sure if this is gonna get people to come in....but the view is AMAZING!!  And quite a few hotties of ALL genders working there....so it's a mixed bag for me.....probably wouldn't go there to eat but hanging out there could definitely be in my future.....

Reviews.Author: Sarah G.
Reviews.Content: I like Perch. Friendly waiters, tasty snacks, good drinks. It's not particularly inexpensive though, the cheapest beer is about $10. The crowd can get a little too corporate. It's a nice place to sit and chat with a friend over fancy food and wine. It's pretty romantic on the dining level. Oh- and don't take the elevator at the top to get to the top floor unless you need to, I hear it gets stuck a lot. You get past to mish mash of cheesecake factory decor and a sort of Viceroy look, and I think it is a great spot for a cozy night.

Reviews.Author: Daniel C.
Reviews.Content: Perch was very good. Be prepared with a jacket, however, if you're prone to chill from night breezes.It's posted that Perch is on the floor 13. In fact, it's on floor 15. The first elevator goes to 13, then you use the "penthouse elevator" (the best way to describe it) to 15. Imagine that you have a family member or friend with a posh downtown penthouse that has a generous balcony. This describes Perch's space. Just off the elevator is a casual and spacious room that is the restaurant's lounge and bar. It's filled with comfy looking chairs and sofas, has a full bar with bar stools, and the vibe is lively. I can easily see myself here to meet friends after work for drinks and to unwind.There are a few tables in the lounge for dinner, but the main dining space is the balcony. The furnishings here are wicker love seats and coffee tables (four-tops), as well as compact French style metal tables and chairs (two-tops). French pop music plays constantly and at a pleasant sound level. The view is dominated by the glorious 1930s concrete building across the street. One can argue whether the view is better facing north or south, but see about being near the fireplace on the north end on cooler nights. When the dusk-time breezes blows through, not even the gas heaters are up to the task of warding off those sudden chills.I started with:_Aperol Royal (there are a number of "make your own" Royal)_Rabbit Rillette (served with three condiments: vanilla-shallot marmalade, braised plums, and candied kumquats; and thinly sliced and toasted rustic bread)_Marrow Bones (served with a side of seasoned salt, coarse sea salt, arugula, and toasted pain de mie)_Duck, Duck, Goose (three little sandwiches, each with a variation of prepared duck, with greens and toasted pain de mie)The first thing of note is the perfection of the toasted pain de mie. They are quarter-inch thick slices of precisely toasted fine-grain bread. At first a revelation of technique, they become monotonous. Of course, that's what I get for ordering two hors d'ouerves that happen to have them.The weaker of the three starters is Duck, Duck, Goose. The toasted pain de mie takes away from the subtle flavors of the duck fillings. Also, stacked as a sandwich, the lack of give from the toasted bread makes biting into them an awkward effort.The Marrow Bones are textbook delightful. The hot and oily marrow soaks into the pain de mie, turning the bite into a glorious beef version of shrimp toast. With a sprinkle of salt and a pinch of arugula, it's wonderful with the Viognier that I ordered after I finished my Aperol Royal.My favorite starter is the Rabbit Rillette. It looks huge, but the large timbale form of meat is light, fluffy, subtle, and well seasoned which makes it easy to finish. (Beware of a bit of bone or two. Oh, well.) Also making it easy to finish are the condiments, especially the candied kumquats which--for me--is the real reason to order this dish. I would love to have a bowl of those candied kumquats and bowl of toasted mixed nuts. With a drink, of course.Not quite full, but not needing any more meat, I ordered Wild Mushroom Cassoulet, one of only two vegetarian options. (The other is a risotto with saffron.) I also asked for a glass of Bordeaux. This dish was mildly disappointing. The flavors were very good, but it's size was about the same as my starters. I'll admit that the quantity was fine after polishing off three starters, but I was expecting more of an entree size. Adding to the disappointment was the dry state of some of the mushrooms. They were obviously oven-roasted, which is great for flavor, but the kitchen left them dry and a little leathery. The final disappointment are chunks of what I think were pork shoulder. There is soy sausage in this dish, but I know meat fibers when I bite into them. When I showed the server a chunk of the meat (I even pulled it apart to help identify it being meat), she was apologetic and can't imagine how that happened.In the end, I was satisfied and not too full, so I skipped dessert.Bonus: Perch has a rooftop bar. A mellow space compared to the hustle and bustle of the main bar downstairs. Of course, being on the roof and outside, I suppose most visitors of that bar are spending their energy keeping warm. I presume it'll be livelier come warmer nights.

Reviews.Author: Suzanne C.
Reviews.Content: Wow.  Simply terrible.  Bad wine (watery with the flavor of sawdust--how does that happen?), bad food (tasted like it came straight out of the freezer), bad cocktail.  The only reason they are getting 2 stars is for the great service and the beautiful surroundings.  Great live music as well.

Reviews.Author: Jalpa S.
Reviews.Content: The Perch has a beautiful romantic and classy setting on the 15th floor with an outdoor balcony and great furnishings with city views.The food was straighforward and tasty (sliders, pomme frittes, mussels, cheese plate) which worked great with their French wine list.The only negative was the staff.  The hostess told us in the middle of our meal that she may have to take our extra chair (with a person sitting and dining in it) for the "reservations".  We found that extremely rude and snooty.  Our waiter was very nice but as the place got more busy (on a Wed night) the service level dropped exponentially.Great place for the ambiance, setting, food, etc.  The staff is snooty and not experienced.

Reviews.Author: Cee P.
Reviews.Content: Must write update.  The other times I visited Perch were late at night, but I had the opportunity to hit it up for happy hour last week.  Normally, this is a pretty pricey place.  If you go with one friend, get two drinks each and an appetizer, you will have a $60 or $70 bill.  But, happy hour was great, the drinks were cheap ($4-$7) and apps were discounted too.  View, service remain great.

Reviews.Author: Scotty K.
Reviews.Content: Neat place to gather some friends together and hang out.  Nice aura and when its a nice night the patio areas are great.  I think Wednesday and Friday nights they have live music.  So, if you're looking to lounge around and chat it up with friends, its a pretty awesome place to go during those nights or any night.  Only thing is you gotta watch out for the crowds on the weekends.  Have fun and invite me!

Reviews.Author: Steven B.
Reviews.Content: My rating is really a 3.5.  Here's what isn't said:  90% of the tables are outside and there are not that many heaters...dress for cold!  Celebrated some good happenings at life last night with dinner at Perch.  After all the reviews I was hesitant...and the reviews are largely right on.  Made a reservation at 7pm for 2.  You go into the building and up to 13, and are greeted by a guy who cards everyone...my best friend and I are 50 so ...?, but fine.  Then it's up another elevator to the restaurant/bar.  We were taken outside to a mediocre table (but great views outside), but opted for an inside table.  After much hullabaloo about trying to put us in a stupid little "end" table I asked for the next one over, got it, and all was good.  Sat there for at least 20 minutes with no one coming by.  Went to the host to ask for service, and the waiter arrived in 5 minutes...from that point forward the service was great.  Food:  good, not amazing.  Had yummy garlic fries to start with their version of a cosmo (good), then heirloom and ceasar salad (both bland, overpriced and lackluster), and then steak fritte (delicious and we both substituted the fries for salad...more lackluster salad...$26 each).  Dessert was white chocolate bread pudding (amazing!).  Dinner for 2 without tip $156.  Summary:  space - outside is truly amazing in the sky with the views.  Indoors is beautiful, but jammed to the gills, super noisy, and feels like a hotel lobby.  Food-good, not amazing.  Service-understaffed, took too long, servers a bit "much" but the busboy person excellent.  Prices-steep, but you're paying for venue.  All in all, I'm glad I went but will not rush back.NOTE:  no valet before 8/9pm, but there's a $6 lot across the street.

Reviews.Author: Di W.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a weeknight with the hubby after work. Great place to hang out on a gorgeous day (which is everyday in socal) and enjoy the views of DTLA from the rooftop. This place is a hip and trendy spot to hang out, enjoy the live music while you sip a good glass of your most favorite libation. The food and service do not disappoint either.

Reviews.Author: Tyler G.
Reviews.Content: Went here during dinner and really liked the atmosphere. I ordered a drink off the menu and although it was a really good drink they charged me extra because it wasn't on the menu. It gets really crowded later during the evening so make sure to reserve or else go really early if you're coming here for dinner. Also don't forget to order the truffle fries. I would recommend this place to take someone out on a date. Has an amazing view of DTLA.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan B.
Reviews.Content: This place is a scene and far over-hyped. To be fair, the setting and view are phenomenal. Drinks are also exceptional, but take an exceptionally long time to get on a busy night. If you go, stick to appetizers....merguez sliders, fries, tartare all memorable. Unfortunately, that's where it ends. My party of five sent two entrees back and three drinks. While the other drinks were delicious, the remaining entrees were just passable. The management is very poor and overwhelmed by their 'scene' status, meaning that diners get snubbed, wait a long time for everything that is of poor quality. If you want to go for the view and drinks, make it a mid-week date, try the Marie Antoinette and the Libertine with the sliders and fries, enjoy the view, and leave!It's a shame, with good management and a better kitchen, the caliber of food and service could match the setting, but until that happens two stars is the most they'll get from me.

Reviews.Author: Nikki D.
Reviews.Content: Very nice view. Customer service i give 5stars to host dwight. We waited but really accomodated us very well considering we are on wait list!thanks dwight.will be back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Jason A.
Reviews.Content: the poutine here is great,  awesome view of downtown la and great outdoor ambience

Reviews.Author: Pixie B.
Reviews.Content: This classy restaurant/lounge is now my favorite.  The service is great and the view is to die for.  It is perfect for a romantic dinner date, or even a place to relax and have a few drinks with friends.  I loved the atmosphere and crowd.

Reviews.Author: Britney K.
Reviews.Content: Went to the roofbar bar which had a beautiful view of all  the dt buildings.  Loved the atmosphere!   Perfect for a summer night to grab a drink with a friend.  Didn't get to try the food there.

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: Simply put:  Speakeasy Whiskey Bar meets The Standard Downtown meets Bouchon.Easy Going crowd 20s-40s.   The 2 reasons I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is I tried to make a large dinner reservation and they are really bad about getting back to you (they require a prefix menu with large parties).  I was told I'd get this menu but never got it, in short I hear the food isn't that great- I'm eating somewhere else first then coming here for drinks after.  Second reason is I had friends waiting in line outside and the bouncer saw some of them were ASIAN, and he said out loud "What is this, Chinese arithmetic?!"  A lot of the young professionals that live downtown are asian, and therefore dtwon bars on weekends can tend to lean that way... regardless thats unacceptable. People shouldnt complain about the interior if they've ever been to Paris, the interior and terrace look VERY French...thats the theme here.Living downtown you have many bars at your disposal, being a young professional I prefer going to places with people that are intelligent/educated but aren't overly hipster.  I think perch has found a good balance between the two.  This place has many special bottles on the top shelf that many people aren't accustomed to.. it makes me sad seeing people ordering college drinks like a long island or adios at a place like this.  Venture out and ask for a recommendation from the bartender, they seem to be decently up to par on rare scotches and rums.  Seating is ideal for a party of 2-6 any more and you will have to split up, which isn't too bad considering the setting.  The lower bar and balcony feel like the true Perch, whereas the uppermost level still feels incomplete and awkward like I'm on top of a friends empty rooftop apt.Theres no cover, they discourage shorts and sneakers although I have seen it and it reminded me of sharkeez in newport.Oh ya, if you order scotch shots, they usually give you doubles!!

Reviews.Author: S. I.
Reviews.Content: The Bird IS the Word! But get there before 9pm on the weekend, for sure, if you don't want to wait in long lines to get in. Upscale drinks at upscale prices, but the view is worth it!

Reviews.Author: Dani B.
Reviews.Content: I like this place. The atmosphere is very nice, and I like the laid back energy, its classy yet unpretentious in that sense. I thought the service was very good considering that its not fine dining. Decor is very well done, and it's awesome to be up on a rooftop.I was a little confused by the menu...I get that its supposed to be unpretentious french inspired, but the dishes read way more complex off the menu than they arrive at your table. It's more like simple french inspired comfort food - and they could probably do well to simplify the menu and let the food speak for itself. I was underwhelmed with the presentation of the dishes that came based on the descriptions from the menu. It was pretty hit or miss, the fondu dish wasn't fondu like at all. I was impressed with the flavors in the rabbit dish, and the coq au vin nuggets. I really like that they offer frogs legs, rabbit, bone marrow and other such adventurous dishes, for the price range. The menu needs tuning up and it needs to be presented more humbly, so as to wow people when the food arrives, not the opposite way around. Unfortunately the entire experience was ruined by the fact that the bone marrow dish contained a garnish that was drenched in truffle oil and salt. I had one mouthful that was so gratuitously salty it almost made me throw up and I had to spit it out. I mean, I literally had a mouthful of pure salt. It was nasty. Truffle oil is a completely unnecessary ingredient that is a poor substitue for real truffles, and is a sign of an amateur chef. I recommend they consider using real truffle shavings instead of the oil. And sort out the seasoning....mouthfuls of salt are unacceptable.

Reviews.Author: Kristen M.
Reviews.Content: The view is absolutely magnificent and the interiors are a nice nod to French decor, but not totally obvious. I had the fondue and it was rather tasty; warm, nutty with some interesting spices. Worth sharing with some friends. You cannot say enough of the view, it is unlike any other downtown. Truly magical. I was also rather impressed with the unique drink selection, I had to order a couple because there was such a variety. I also was also struck by the organization of the waiters and staff, they were pleasant and attentive. I had a totally pleasant experience at Perch that I would recommend it to all Angelenos and visitors alike.

Reviews.Author: Jared M.
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view. Food sub-par for the prices. More of a drinks type place. The band on a Friday night was good. Crowd not too bad all things considered.

Reviews.Author: Julie K.
Reviews.Content: I was here for an evening of drinks, so I stayed on the rooftop bar area (second floor). The rooftop bar and restaurant area (first floor) are both decorated stylishly, but also comfortably. There are lots of inviting couches and seating arrangements to relax in while enjoying the great view and listening to the live music.I got there around 9:30ish and didn't have to wait in any lines to get to the rooftop bar.On the rooftop, if there is no line for the restroom, you should use it. If you don't, when you really have to go, there will be ten people waiting in line because there is only one men's restroom and one women's restroom.The first floor restaurant area also has restrooms (only three stalls for the tiny women's restroom!), but if you go down to the first floor, you will most likely have to wait in line to get back up to the second floor. It took me about 15 minutes to get back up.Lastly, on the rooftop, don't sit or stand near the restroom area. The area smelled a bit funky. To me, it smelled like fried calamari that had been sitting for a while. To my husband, it smelled like fermented sewage.

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: The food was mediocre. I ordered the chilean seabass and it was a little dry (not soft and flaky like how it normally tastes), and it somehow managed to taste gamey.Service was not good - Husband ordered his steak medium rare and the server told him that it WAS medium rare and that he's been in the restaurant industry and he knows what medium rare looks like.Then few minutes later server walks back with his iphone and shows him a picture of the steak that was sent back and says "Doesn't that look medium rare to you".....I think the whole table was in shock, it was too hilarious.On top of that we were celebrating 2 birthdays - and I pre-called it in to order 2 "surprise" birthday desserts for the 2 Birthday people and they were totally confused or forgot what I originally ordered....so it did not end up being a surprise because I had to leave the table 2 times to go talk to the front desk about it. Best thing there is probably the bread pudding, it was delicious and the cucumber martini was good too.

Reviews.Author: Davis A.
Reviews.Content: Please get new kitchen staff.  Your food is disgusting and you need better seating in the lounge if you expect people to sit in there and eat.I would eat here weekly if the food was any good.Instead - after 3 attempts - I'm DONE!You can't eat at a table with a low seat that brings your arms 5 feet away from your food.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany F.
Reviews.Content: Really nice place for after work  cocktails. It seem like some secret society club do to the fact we had to take two elevators to get in. Once we arrived it was crazy crowded and the other patriots were staring at my sister and I as if that had seen a Ghost. We were meeting friends for drinks, the crowd decrease so we were able to sit at the bar. The house Merlot kept me totally sane from the chaotic crowd but our night was top off with the truffle fries and lamb sliders very scrumptious taking that I dont care for lamb. Two thumbs up I was visiting from Atlanta reminded me of some Atl spots but except with a more uppity crowd. Sorry LA but overall it turn out to be a great Thursday Night Downtown LA. We enjoyed Art walk afterwards. Try it for cocktails.

Reviews.Author: Paul S.
Reviews.Content: Awful crowd....awful food....awful service....great location...awful awful awful!!!! They should be ashamed of themselves!

Reviews.Author: Rodrigo M.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. I love the environment, the staff is very professional. You should make reservations at 7PM so you can experience Los Angeles from day to night. The night life is beautiful. I want on two dates here. First date was terrible but the second one was amazing. BUT the Perch was great both times. =) Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Diane G.
Reviews.Content: great service

Reviews.Author: Janna V.
Reviews.Content: Went here with some of my friends for my birthday. We got there around 9 and there was already a line outside. Waited for 15 min or so..was gonna wait longer if it wasn't for my friend telling the bouncer that she was cold so he let us in right away ;). This place is great if you come really early because there is limited seating at the rooftop bar. It was difficult to just stand there with my heels on...for hours, waiting for someone to vacate their spot (never happened btw), which was weird because I can last for hours with my heels on when I go clubbing. They only have 1 restroom upstairs so if you decide to go downstairs because you can no longer hold it in, then that's it for you..they won't let you go back up and you have to line up again. The drinks were pretty strong in my opinion..contrary to what people have been saying here and were also expensive. I got the my fair lady and it was okay, not worth $12..but I guess its standard LA drink prices. Crowd was mostly 30's so we felt kinda out of place haha jk. Now, the view was pretty cool! We took so much pictures that it was obvious it was our first time there. Overall, it was okay.

Reviews.Author: Walter L.
Reviews.Content: super fun place!!  Great drinks

Reviews.Author: Tara T.
Reviews.Content: Amazing roof top bar!!!!! If you want to feel in the center of LA's buildings no better place! I love it here and its always packed! The drinks are a little pricey but what do you expect going downtown! Go there its fun!

Reviews.Author: Lisa L.
Reviews.Content: Perch is everything you hope it will be. It has a fantastic ambiance, the service was friendly and attentive and the food was delicious.  But for sure the best part was the drinks!  My girlfriends and I enjoyed all the different cocktails we had. Definitely the best dirty martini I've ever had. We got there at 8 and we were out by 11. It looked like the crowd and the vibe changes at 11 so we were happy we were there for the earlier jazzy vibe.

Reviews.Author: Warner Y.
Reviews.Content: nice view, food sucks

Reviews.Author: Lucy W.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Wednesday night - Oyster and Jazz night. This place has a great view of downtown, nice ambiance, and seriously some of the best oysters I've had (5 Stars for the oysters, not sure if it was just the perfect timing but the oysters were even better and fresher than Hungry Cat, Swan's Oyster Depot, Santa Monica Seafood, and Blue Plate Oysterette). However, the service from our waitress was awful - she was not attentive and slow. She was not rude but just seems like she didn't really care to do a decent job or care about the customers at all. I also saw her checking on her make up on a mirror on a wall. I would come back for the oyster (so good!!) but would be cautious of service and might just order everything all at once (so that I don't have to wait for the service to come  if I want to order more things). The jazz band was average - nice for the ambiance but i've seen/heard better.

Reviews.Author: Gabriel A.
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times now, but this time was a bad experience. Other than Dwight who runs the front desk, the staff was incompetent and showed little to no regard for our experience. The server, who never told us her name was very slow; didn't bring out a dish we ordered. The wine showed up 5 minutes after our food. One of the dishes we ordered was completely different from when we ordered it before And the server said they were running low on cheese so she guessed the kitchen took it upon themselves to replace cheese with more meat. She didn't save our table or tell her staff that we were going to have a cigarette on the side even though she told us we could do so. My girlfriend's shawl was take from the table by a staff member. Then after I had that returned, another staff member moved our untouched desert that had been served while we having a cigarette, to use our table to set up a bigger table. How is it that a restaurant with such a good rep could have such poor communication between staff members? I've worked at restaurants most if my adult life and I know it's not difficult to tell your busser or hosts that the guests will be right back to the table. Then when the staff member realizes what she had done to our table, she sets it back up and we sit down to our desert with no plates, no napkin, no water. Our server stops by seemingly oblivious to our needs and we asked for plates, There's no way she didn't realize what had just happened but she didn't apologize (she wore a stupid bowtie so fare warning, if you get her, don't expect a good night). If it weren't for the view, I would give this place 1 star.

Reviews.Author: rosa f.
Reviews.Content: Simply the worst meal I've paid for in years.The view is nice, but it's not smashing. The service is attentive and good -- that's why I give it a star.But the mushroom cassoulet was something out of a Junior League amateur night in the kitchen. Anyone who gives this place two stars must be a personal friend of the wait staff. Anyone who gives it three or more must be related to the owner. ( Never forget that businesses hire people to put positive comments on yelp).My advice? If all you're after is ambience, a great view and so-so food then I think you're better off at  Yamashiro.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer I.
Reviews.Content: Really great venue with a spectacular view over Pershing Square. Heat lamps help at night... you can't get food at the roof level-- just drinks.... I just love the place. My friends always hang out here for drinks after work! Great place to go on dates. :)

Reviews.Author: Ida B.
Reviews.Content: We came here for a chill but swanky night for a friends after-bridal-shower.  Nice building and a GORGEOUS view ... Pershing Square has never looked so good. It's a little crowded/ cluttered, but then again, what late-night spot in Downtown that's worth it's salt ISN'T?We were too late for the food but were able to procure a few cheese plates. Good cheese but it literally came with 4 thin slices of bread and 3 large chunks of cheese. When we asked for more bread, any bread or even crackers, they claimed that the kitchen had nothing left. The crowd is cool and the decor is nice. The service is friendly, but security definitely has a stick up there a**. We waited in line for awhile and when it got to us, the security pulled my bf aside to tell him to make sure his suspenders were on all the way. Uuummmm ..... ooook. Anal much? When we rode the elevator upstairs, the security guard had radioed ahead to the person there and told him to be SURE that the suspenders were up or else he could not enter. He was made to take his jacket off to PROVE it. We ended up taking them off completely and I was irked but chalked it up to them wanting to have a certain dress code to upkeep an image ... too bad the first person I saw when we got out the elevator was a girl in a completely sheer top and neon bra and denim cut-offs with the pockets hanging out in front and her a** cheeks hanging out in back ... .A few tweaks here and there ... including finding a security guard that perhaps isn't so discriminating ...  and this would be a much better place. Overall I'd come again ... sans suspenders

Reviews.Author: Karoline E.
Reviews.Content: Perch was the perfect setting for my birthday dinner and Wendy was a great help in putting it all together.  Especially considering how busy i am and how hard I am to get ahold of, somehow Wendy managed to make sure it all worked out and I had the best birthday dinner for 20 that I could ask for.  The onsite event team was also amazing and guided our evening on the private balcony perfectly along, with amazing food and service.thank you again and I look forward to the next time i make it to Perch!

Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: Lively, crowded and noisy. If you like a quiet experience, I'd suggest early in the week when the music is a jazz combo. We are a group of 60-something friends and we had a great time. Food acceptable and cocktails excellent. The service was very good and the whole atmosphere quite welcoming, which sometimes doesn't happen for older customers in hip environments. But the real treat is the view--spectacular as evening falls.

Reviews.Author: Taline K.
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends had 8:30 reservation at Perch last night to celebrate her birthday. It was our first time at Perch, we were so excited. We arrived at 8:28 all happy and excited to sit outside and enjoy the view. The hostess asked us to wait until they prepared  a table for us. We stood aside and waited for a while. I am pregnant so my back hurts when I stand up for too long. We asked them if our table was ready after seeing many people who arrived after us being seated. Their respond was you have to wait for your turn. It was 9:20 when they finally seated us at a table that was so low that it was for people to hang out and just drink. We asked our host to seat us at the table next to ours because it was a little higher and we were there to have dinner. She said sure let me clean it up first and move you guys over. As soon us the table got cleaned we moved over and just when we sat down another hostess came over with new guests arguing with us, saying that we can't sit there. That's when we asked for the manager. She said sure and told us to sit down and wait for him. Another girl came over and we asked for the manager still no sign of him. 15 minutes passed and we had not received any water or menus or had seen the manager. A waitress showed up with water and we told her we are waiting for the manager, she finally got the manager. At this point it was 9:45 and we were starving. Our night was ruined, I started getting heartburn from hunger and my friends birthday mood was ruined. We informed the manager and he apologized and said the first two girls had not informed him. That's when we decided to leave the place and go to another restaurant (The little Door) where they gave us an amazing service right  away. We finally ate at 10:30 pm.

Reviews.Author: XManLA X.
Reviews.Content: Went for happy hour. Very cool, laid back vibe with sweet city views.  Unfortunately, they need to step it up in the drink front and get a real-deal mixologist on staff.  The drinks are way lame.  Even the straight-up liquor and mix drinks are lacking.  I'll stick to beer and wine next time around. All we had to eat were the mixed spicy nuts and they were fine.  The people there seemed nice with zero 'tude.

Reviews.Author: Monica G.
Reviews.Content: So Perch is really really nice like everyone has stated BUT I think its only worth going there if you can sit outside and enjoy the view of Pershing Square and DTLA.  I went there on a gloomy night and the heaters/comfy couches made me forgot that its sprinkling and chilly.  Parking can be a hassle and your options are valet ($9) or parking down the street for $5. Our server was very attentive so no complaints there.  I took one star off because I was not impressed by the food and drinks.  From their HH menu, we had the truffle fries and I ordered the Jacques Collins.  The drink was not really strong and the truffle fries were drenched and clumped together with truffle.  If you are planning to have a birthday party here, be prepared to spend major bucks as I inquired regarding using a corner for 15 people and was quoted $3500 for 3 hours betweem 6-9pm.  That means each one of my guests would have to throw down $233 worth of food and drinks to meet the minimum.  Since I am not a baller and my friends are not ballers, this was not an option for me.

Reviews.Author: Claire R.
Reviews.Content: The brunch on Sundays is delicious! The view is great and they had a three-piece band come entertain the patrons. The food is wonderful. I had the french toast and its buttered croissants grilled and put with bacon and syrup. It melted in my mouth. We got the truffle fries for the table and turned out to be a great app. The only thing I wish they had was a bottomless mimosa option on the menu as well as better air flow. It was in the low 70's and the restaurant got a little stuffy inside. I recommend asking for a table outside so that you can enjoy the view and the amazing food.

Reviews.Author: ERIC M.
Reviews.Content: number 1 favorite place in DT LA

Reviews.Author: Lush Liz ..
Reviews.Content: love love love this place. try the muscles!

Reviews.Author: Stacy L.
Reviews.Content: Great for tourists!! The view is amazing, and the vibe is even better! I am not sure about their food because I havent had it yet. However, I am planning on having a birthday here..update later!

Reviews.Author: Vince N.
Reviews.Content: Always have a good time here. Michelle the new bartender was awesome enough for me to write my first yelp review! Made good strong drinks just how I like them. Docked one star just because the lines get a little crazy around in there, but still worth it.

Reviews.Author: Samantha A.
Reviews.Content: Best rooftop bar I've ever been to! Way better than the standard rooftop if you're looking for a chiller vibe. Be warned that beers are $9 and cocktails are pretty expensive.

Reviews.Author: Meredith P.
Reviews.Content: yeah.so I went here a few weeks ago...and I'm still confused.it seems to be a crazy juxtaposition of feelings that has left me dumbfounded and not really wanting to go back.  for example:- I made it to the roof where it is located, but at the same time I didn't because there was another level above that I couldn't get to because it was at "capacity"- there were cool people there, but there were also weirdos--- like the guy in a hoodie and new balance sneakers (ummm downtown dress code violation, perhaps but whatevs) and a hipster girl braiding a hipster dude's very unruley, should have been dreaded hair while sitting at the bar.  hmmm.- there were a lot cool cocktails, but at the same time the options were limited.  Do not ask for a tanqueray and ginger ale.  They do not have either.- it seems super exclusive due to the matrix-like maze you have to travel to get there but at the same time it seems like everyone and their mom is there when you arrive-the staff is friendly, yet kinda not with it....this might be because they are new?and the list goes onso Perch furthers my theory that you put a pretty face on a nicely located space in DTLA and throw alcohol and primo "foodie" food on the menu you have yourself a profitable business.  I would rather pass and hit up Bar 107 any day.

Reviews.Author: A A.
Reviews.Content: This place has gone downhill. After my last horrible experience with the extremely rude manager, I went there again Friday night for an event that started at 8pm. By 830 there was a long line that we decided to wait in.. After waiting for nearly an hour.. When we got up to the rooftop it was no where near full. They obviously did that to make it seem like a desirable place to be. This place has great views but service is horrible!

Reviews.Author: Jas H S.
Reviews.Content: Look, let's be real and let's not act like your sh*t doesn't stink.  Perch has the most ridiculous door policies ever!  Veiled under the pretense of 'staying at a capacity within the Los Angeles regulation and requirement, they make getting to their 15th and especially their 16th floor uber-exclusive and overall not fun.  Trip #1 - post wedding we arrived at Perch at 10ish and proceeded to wait about 1.5hours.  Had we had the balls to leave we would have, but our friends were there celebrating a birthday so we just 'had to get in.."  Big mixed group of boys / girls all separate groups but there for the same event, we were told numerous times about the "capacity limitations" as we watched random people getting in with code words & promises for sexual favors.  Getting into the bar, their bar selection was limited and they didn't host the liquor that made Tupac, Biggie & P Diddy rich.  Very limited selection, limited customer service and annoying constant "at capacity" excuse except for the h*es with their t*ts hanging loose.  Trip #2, very reluctantly agreed to go again since it was 9pm.  We get to the 15th floor easily, but again, we just can't get into 16th floor.  I come to find out, you have to go through a staircase and the security guard has to let you up through that to get to the ROOFTOP BAR.  I tell a security guard this is really not fun, it's like a lame game with only one player and he tells us he'll let us up "in a bit..." but really at that point, I am tired of sticking out my chest under my blazer and flowy dress.  It's hard to keep pulling down my top to get the A+ seal of approval by "the men in black."  We end up leaving and going to KTOWN where everyone speaks the universal language of $$.  Perch, never again.  I don't care if you don't think I am pretty or slutty.  My money will better used elsewhere.  Good luck losers, see you in BK.

Reviews.Author: Sophia M.
Reviews.Content: Brought my bf here for his birthday and we loved our food and drinks. Views are stunning and outdoor patio is very romantic! Staff was very helpful throughout our whole meal...I love the decor of this place, reminds us of when we were in Paris :)

Reviews.Author: Ani T.
Reviews.Content: We went to have dinner at Perch with some friends and we had a really great time. We had reservations and we arrived early and had some drinks before dinner. The ambiance was great. Service was very good, we were seated on time and the staff was attentive. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Emma W.
Reviews.Content: Amazing view, beautiful place. Great for drinks and catching up with friends!

Reviews.Author: Leslie C.
Reviews.Content: It would be a 5 star review if you didn't have to make a reservation to sit outside--where the views are spectacular (far better than the Standard)-- and if they had a larger specialty cocktail list.  But the decor had a cute french theme and all the bartenders and waitresses dressed in velvet bow ties.  Fair warning, I'm a huge francophile so I might be biased.  My friend and I came here on Tuesday around 6:30pm and ordered two Mavericks & Goose cocktails at the bar.  The drinks were beautiful and delicious--just wished I could taste the gin a bit more.  We sat outside and enjoyed the view for an hour until the hostess informed us that the tables were reserved for 7:30pm.  No worries, we sat inside near the bar and decided to order the duck appetizer and beignets. The duck appetizer was really good, but I wished it had more duck on all the buttered toast it came with.  The beignets were amazing!  I highly recommend the beignets even if you're not hungry.  The staff was also very friendly and extremely attentive.  Perch is a great addition to Downtown.

Reviews.Author: Natasha G.
Reviews.Content: Happened on Perch a few weeks ago after a Pershing Square concert, checked it out with a few friends, nice view, crowded, loud, the usual. But decided it would be a good LA-spot-with-a-vew to take friends visiting from out of town, so made reservations for dinner last weekend...and it was AWESOME. Beautiful cocktail sunset at the rooftop bar, then we all 8 of us were seated, right at our reservation time, at a great indoor table surrounded by French doors (I think) open to the patio and the gorgeous summer night. Every staffer, from doormen to hosts to bar and wait staff was ridiculously friendly, helpful, accommodating. Food was way better than I'd hoped for at a lounge/bar kinda scene. Especially loved the shrimp & grits and the insanely yummy merguez sliders. Loved the singer & 3-piece combo on the patio, she had a gorgeous, soulful voice, such a perfect closer for a fabulous time with friends. Don't know what all the hatin's about on this page. I'm picky and critical as HELL, and I seriously loved my night here. Will be back @ Perch soon!

Reviews.Author: Fred W.
Reviews.Content: This place is great! I've been twice during the week on a Wednesday and the crowd is decent, doesn't get too packed and the drinks are pretty strong, tasty and reasonable. The best thing about this place is THE VIEW!!! AMAZING views of Downtown LA looking every direction. The staff is super friendly which adds to the warm, cozy environment inside. Outside there's more of a bar atmosphere with fire pits and lounge furniture. On Wednesday nights, the bar on the 13th floor has a jazz band and singer that take you back in time to the late 30's early 40's. I had such a great time, I can't say enough good things about this place. I hear it gets packed to capacity on Thurs, Fri & Sat though so I can't speak for those nights. As far as the menu goes, I had the burger which was superb and the chocolate pot of creme for dessert which I am still thinking about the next day. It has salt lightly drizzled on top which is GENIUS and gives you a little salt with your sweet at the end of your meal leaving you completely satisfied! Perch is my new fav place and I think I will be visiting Downtown LA more often!

Reviews.Author: Jay Q.
Reviews.Content: The only reason I give them 3 stars was because of the nice view... the food and services was just okay, not worth the price they charge...

Reviews.Author: JJ L.
Reviews.Content: Food is average, but great venue and view.

Reviews.Author: Lisa C.
Reviews.Content: great place great atmosphere!2 bars one downstairs one upstairs. downstairs serving tables as well for dinner /lunch etc.other bar is on the roof fuckign amazing view. crowd ages between 23-50s? very diverse crowd every color was in the room it was beautifulmy only wish is that it had bar tables around the area so we dont have to be sitting down always.

Reviews.Author: Ron P.
Reviews.Content: fantatstic space... a bit bridge and tunnel.

Reviews.Author: Elke K.
Reviews.Content: Had a fanTAStic time here last night. Our waitress hit the right notes of friendliness and reserve, and provided great service. The happy hour drinks and food menu, while limited and a tiny bit confusing for newbies, included very tasty everything. Sitting outdoors with beautiful views in wonderful surroundings was a big plus. Everyone agreed we'd be back.

Reviews.Author: Scott B.
Reviews.Content: Having lived in DTLA for over a year now I can say that Perch is one of my favorite places to hang out and have a stiff drink. The food and drinks are all very tasty, but the view is the best part. On a few occasions I've been rewarded with great live jazz. Nothing like drinking an old fashioned and listening to some great live music, all while taking in a breathtaking downtown LA view.

Reviews.Author: Chris V.
Reviews.Content: The Perch is a definite hip spot.  In that, you'll find many hipsters here.  But I love it.  The food wasn't my favorite.  Although, the bone marrow dish was amazing.  But here, it's all about the ambiance.  You gotta eat outside near the edge of the building.  And I love the bar up on the 2nd level of the roof.  The lounge chairs and the fireplaces are just incredibly chill and it's just a really dope spot to just hang out with friends while enjoying the amazing views of LA in all directions.  It's nice during the day and amazing at night.  I'll definitely be coming back here for a couple drinks up at the 2nd level bar.  The restaurant/food? eh...I might try it again.  A good date spot for sure.  The service is very good.  But for the price you pay for the food, the food should taste better and be better quality.  but of course again, i'm excluding the bone marrow dish because it was really bombtastically delicious.

Reviews.Author: Sammy B.
Reviews.Content: I went to Perch on a Saturday night - we had 10:30pm dinner reservations. (side note: I highly suggest making reservations because we just went straight up, didn't have to wait in line, which was looooong). We were seated outside, and the entire area was extremely cute. Because it was a Saturday night and really crowded, the service was really slow. Our server kept getting lost and a few other servers came and checked in on us when our service went mia. We ordered a couple of drinks (I ordered the "Writers Block" and my friend ordered the "French Maid" -- both of which were very good, and I felt reasonably priced for downtown LA). We also ordered the wild mushroom risotto and the surf n'turf skewers. Both of those were delicious. The risotto could have used a bit more salt (but then again, i love salt) but the skewers were amazing. The beef was grilled perfectly (very tender) and the shrimp was seasoned really nicely. It did get a bit cold outside, but the heating lamps (and the alcohol!) helped with that ;)
Reviews.Author_Location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Tatiana P.
Reviews.Content: When you think of New Years Eve celebrations you envision balloons, dancing, fireworks basically a celebratory night.  Being that this was The Perch's first NYE I won't be too harsh.  Yes, The Perch has a fabulous view, it's classy and trendy.  With that being said, when you pay to get into a NYE celebration you wouldn't expect it to look and feel like any regular night.  The first mistake they made was charging $60.00 for general admission ($100 for dinner which is totally worth it, the food is delicious.) there were no NYE decorations, the rotating Dj's played maybe 3 songs that were danceable which you could faintly hear on the rooftop and the countdown started but again no one could hear it!  I'm going to assume that this is the consensus for us all when I say, if we pay for NYE we expect a little something extra!  Two people on stilts, a drink ticket, the bouncers and the bar tenders made the night a little entertaining BUT not $60.00 worth.  Maybe next year they will get it right.  Again, this place is great to go on any regular night, but NYE fell a bit flat.

Reviews.Author: Megan K.
Reviews.Content: Basically just a rating on the nice location. Pretty fun view (coming from a person who pends about 85% of her time in downtown, in many different buildings). Get there early and make sure you have reservations or you run the risk of eating while standing or becoming a table buzzard, eerily glaring at other patrons wishing they would eat faster and get the heck out of their seats. Food was decent, assorted meat platter appetizer, steak (new item on the menu), chicken, vegetarian tarte... all were pretty good not amazing. Saturday night was bustling, the 7am crowd was the older crowd in suits, 10pm crowd are the hipsters/wannabes, midnight crowd is apparently snotty Valley/OC Asians (I can say that because I'm Asian). Standard drinks run about $8 a pop, not too bad for downtown. If you find yourself stuck outside like a sucker, do not wait in a line, it's not worth an hour wait... you can WALK (gasp) to a dozen other bars. There are OTHER rooftop bars (ION, Pangean Garden, Standard Hotel, Takami, Bona Vista Lounge) and other places with better drinks and food in downtown.

Reviews.Author: Tony A.
Reviews.Content: not all that view is great long is long and dome , food is not that good , customer service could be way better

Reviews.Author: Michelle Y.
Reviews.Content: alright, this place is pretty dang classy, or should i say france-y ! don't forget -- pinky's up!!!its a really nice lounge to chill at. great view of dtla, you see pershing square, and the great thing is the crowd is diverse. it's a chill crowd, artsy fartsy. last time i was there,  a live band was playing. definitely added to the ambiance. minus one star for having to go up multiple elevators to get to the top. and minus one because the lines can be RIDIC! (the first time i went, waited an hour, then decided to bounce). so, make sure you get there early, like 1030ish (no cover)drinks are kinda expensive (cringe).

Reviews.Author: Melanie F.
Reviews.Content: worth going to for happy hour! such a great spot to check out the views of dtla.HH appetizers are good.HH drinks are limited but decent.

Reviews.Author: J G.
Reviews.Content: Food is good, tried several different appetizers and sampled different entrees. Nice to go with a big group so you can do this. Nothing really blew me away but there were a few stand outs. Buffalo frogs legs were moist and had a great spicy kick! Bacon mac n cheese was creamy with Canadian smoked bacon, pretty good. I ordered the steak frites, and the steak was a large cut of beef so much so that I split half with my boyfriend. The steak was good, nothing exciting. A friend had ordered the pot au feu (braised short ribs) that was excellent! I am coming back for Sunday Brunch to try more food items. The Perch has a fantastic view in the heart of downtown. Above the restaurant is an outdoor roof with a bar, lounges, fire pits, and more view!  They have a live band playing during dinner, then switch to a DJ later hours.. Place was packed the whole time we were there. Fun place to go with friends.

Reviews.Author: The Wing Man C.
Reviews.Content: Great place for drinks and first dates, women dig the view.  Call in advance and make sure your table has the best view.   I am not much of a fan of the food however I am picky eater and only like healthy and gourmet food.

Reviews.Author: Alice S.
Reviews.Content: atmosphere is cool, although the rooftop thing can get cold at night. had dinner here with a friend recently and the duck dish was the highlight of the menu.

Reviews.Author: Rob C.
Reviews.Content: quite the nice ambiance, but weird access through 2 elevators.  was happening pretty much after work hours and later, with a slick rooftop vibe.  complex will be made into more night venues per the manager.  menu has changed apparently and was not bad.  only had an heirloom tomato salad, which was fine for this sort of place.  truffle fries a little too soggy, mussels ok, white seabass, fresh caught and soft, chilean seabass also juicy, but more covered heavily in sauce (per others).   desserts were straight forward with fresh berries, chocolate bread pudding and vanilla creme brulee, all executed fine.  overall, come for the view.

Reviews.Author: Judy H.
Reviews.Content: Went there on a Sunday afternoon with friends.  Great DJ's / music.  Beautiful and classy.  Love the view.  Very open and airy.  Perfect place to relax and hang out with friends.  Good for people-watching too.

Reviews.Author: Rose K.
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed!!!!I called to make a reservation for dinner.  We were celebrating my husbands 45th birthday. I made my original reservation for 6 people at 8:00 with Alexandria.  I called back the next morning to add on 2 more guests.  Alexsandria tells me she doesn't see a reservation in my name, ok.. good thing  I called back.  She apologized and put me down again for 8 guests, but had to move our dinner up to 8:45, I agreed because I had already told everyone.  We had a couple visiting from out of town, so I called back too see if I can add on 2 more guests.  Now Rachel cant seem to find my reservation.  Rachel went on to tell me that there is no room for us til 10:15!!!!!! It is about noon and I have 10 guests that will be showing up at PERCH for dinner  that night and no reservations!! They never called be back, I tried calling to speak with a manager, no one picked up, I left a message for a manager to call me, no one called.  They ruined our dinner plans, I had to find a new place to accomadate our party, unfortunaltey I only had a few hours to do it.  How can someone F@#K-up your reservation, TWICE!!!

Reviews.Author: Ramesh R.
Reviews.Content: We 4 couples have been going to new fine dining restaurants almost every other week. On June 8th Friday we went to Perch, we went there mainly due to rooftop location and its views. When we got there we were greeted by elevator hosts welcoming us. The inside restaurant ambiance is more like a fine bar with sofas and couches. Tables were bare wood (no table cloth) deserve only 3 stars. Food menu limited, they ran out of French fries and few other appetizers deserve 2 stars. We were seated inside due to group of 10; however we walked outside at patio area, wow what a view and GREAT ambiance plus live music outside too. Now you must wonder why is that I am still giving this restaurant a solid 4 stars ?, well when we complain to the manager for running out of the appetizer and not enough choices on menu, to our surprise she offered special chicken dish to accommodate us furthermore she offered comp desert and coffee. Saving money or being comp for deserts is not a big deal, the reason I am giving 4 stars is because how she was so accommodating to our needs and how she handled the situation. A good manager can make a big difference on customers and for that she (the manger) on duty deserves 5 stars. We will go again and will reserve to sit outside on patio area. Good for small groups or couples. Oh, by the way food tested GREAT too. Thanks.

Reviews.Author: Rissa R.
Reviews.Content: Have heard a LOT about Perch in the past year..basically that the place has great rooftop ambiance.  I'd agree with that, but after waiting literally 35 minutes in line (in a stairwell at that), I had even bigger expectations of the place rather than just a chill rooftop that could have used a DJ.  The entrance to the place was confusing too.  It was very easy to get through the front door on street level..so I thought we were in.  Then we took two elevators and I really thought we were in at that point, before realizing that was only the restaurant.  So finally, when we saw the actual 'perch', that prompted the wait in the stairwell and I was a bit peeved.  What I did like was the ambiance, the crowd was truly young professionals, the drinks were delicious.  The bartender even asked me how I wanted my gimlet, more sweet or more sour - appreciate that!  And the place is located right next to the metro, Pershing Square station.  I just feel it was a bit anticlimatic.  I can see going for an hour before heading to somewhere with more entertainment within.

Reviews.Author: Greg B.
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and it has an unbelievable view, but the reason I gave them 3 stars is their food.  Their menu is bit different from most since they are going for French theme, but I don't have a problem with that, it's the execution.  I tried pretty much all of their menu, and nowadays I stick to a couple of appetizers.  I find their food to be at best average, but the view and the vibe is great.  So, I'll gladly upgrade them once their food quality goes up.

Reviews.Author: Hank W.
Reviews.Content: are the pours getting smaller and smaller?

Reviews.Author: Olivia C.
Reviews.Content: This place has a beautiful atmosphere but terrible food. My first meal (a seafood dish) came without the main food items and instead with others that weren't ordered. After waiting 45 min for help and a meal change, I ordered the chicken. I ate half of it before realizing it was very uncooked. The overall experience took 3.5 hours in waiting time and all the while, I hardly ate a thing. If you go, go for the drinks and atmosphere but stay away from the food. Trust me, you'll feel sick.
Reviews.Author_Location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Joe F.
Reviews.Content: I had my first experience with this place last Saturday for a friends birthday party.  I was pretty excited to check out a new place and I have heard good things.  When I arrived I got to the elevators to find that they just went out of service.  This caused about an hour delay to get to the place on the roof while the firemen and technicians figured out what the problem was.  This did not put me in the best of moods from the get go.  Once I finally got upstairs to the 16th floor, which is all outdoor lounge area, I was well rewarded with the expansive views of downtown that you can see from there.  Immediately I was calmed down and forgot all about the issues when I got there.  I proceeded to go to the 15th floor, the main bar and restaurant portion, and I got a drink from their specialty drink menu which was a version of a manhattan.  The drink was pretty good and not too expensive, about $11.  This place looks like a great place to bring a date.  I can't comment on the taste of the food, but everything I saw looked good and the place was pretty packed so it had to be halfway decent.  The crowd was of the mellow type and didn't feature anything that could be considered a frat scene which was a nice change of pace.  I would say this would be a great place for a casual night out to hang with your friends and have a conversations with each other that you can actually hear.  The decor is old school French style with lots of oil paintings on the wall and low key electronic music playing in the background.  This place was definitely worth checking out and I think I might have given it another star had it not been for the rough beginning I had.  On a side note they have a locals line, which is great to see places have even if I am not part of it.

Reviews.Author: Dth S.
Reviews.Content: the views are just like the ones you get at the standard downtown...&the drinks are good. the ambience&decor are beautiful&nicely flowing...&i kinda like the split level outdoors bar thingy they got going on- tho the elevator to go up to the upper level is 'monitored' & 'rationed' so that's kinda annoying...! but omggg it's like i landed&opened my eyes in south east asia (on the weekends anyway)! i shit you NOT- it's ALL asian college kids here&i emphasize KIDS!! most likely USC kids that live nearby. hopefully during weekdays (at least for happy hour or something) they have more 'corporate' types that come in- geezh! ;(

Reviews.Author: Padraic A.
Reviews.Content: Went last night for date night. It's a beautiful space with an incredible view. Our first problem was our server. After we complained that our olives tasted off (didn't want a free anything mind you) our server let us know we were wrong and that all the olives come from the same place. Nothing like being wrong about our taste buds. It took another 20+ for the salads to arrive. Salads were fine although charging $2 for Lardon that are actually bacon bits is pretty tacky. Halfway through the salads our entrees arrived weirdly timed. The filet was delicious. A truly great steak. The asparagus and potatoes that came with it were horrible. The goat cheese tart my wife got was even worse. A wheel of goat cheese put on some puff pastry with some pesto. No one wants that much goat cheese. Even the baby goat would've given up. Would go back for a drink.

Reviews.Author: leslie c.
Reviews.Content: this is my 2nd time coming to perch and yet again was it a GREAT experience.the service was amazing.the staff at the bar was quick and attentive~~and the foood was so yummy!!i ordered the the cheese plate and the truffle fries and let me just say the TRUFFLE FRIES ARE TO DIE FOR!!:)i would definiately come here again.

Reviews.Author: Agnes V.
Reviews.Content: Food is bad. View is amazing, so come here for the view.

Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: Views are fantastic. Food was Ok. Service left a lot to be desired. Our server Sweet Pea? was ineffectious and when we were seated a waiter came over to shoot us a dirty look and said he thought we walked out on him from bar service. Not a good vibe to send to a guest!

Reviews.Author: Sierra R.
Reviews.Content: The view in this restaurant lounge is amazing. You see a side of downtown LA that you usually don't see. Apart from the sky rise lounges like The Standard or Elevate Lounge this lounge is relaxing.  From a long day of work, it's nice to have a dinner here with a date or just your friends.  The menu selection is limited.  There's not really much to choose from when you order food, it's French, so don't think of anything more.  It's a little pricy for food and their drinks, but it's downtown in a hip area, so be prepared to pay $10-15 for a cocktail or beer.  This place is hidden and you might miss it if you don't know LA downtown area since there's so many one way streets!  The best way to get in this place is if you reserve a table.  On their busy nights, the line can get long to enter the place.  There's 2 roof top areas.  The 1st rooftop area is for their restaraunt and lounging area with a bar.  The 2nd top floor just has a bar to mingle around.  I would come back here because I like French and the drinks are delicious!

Reviews.Author: Valerie V.
Reviews.Content: We went for a dinner reception and they seated us in the reserved corner in the back which had a little fireplace at the end and private.
