The view and atmosphere were very pretty! overlooks pershing square. (though there's other places in dwtn for views too) This is a nice place to have drinks with friends, take out of town guests and also meet people. Young professionals and nice looking crowd. We arrived around 4:30 thursday and it was about 75% packed. Our server was very attentive and friendly. We had a large party and the couple hosting preselected our menu. Their printer broke, so they weren't able to print out menus as planned so they comped us with spiced nuts. The nuts were sweet, salty and slightly spicy. Addictive. They put 3 baked bries on the table and we all looked at eachother like hmmm.. we have to share? it's so small, like biscuit size and super soft, my husband could eat that in 1 bite. Should be for 1 person max. It was good, but a tease! We had an arugula salad to start, chicken stuffed with pesto with potatoes and chocolate pudding with fresh berries. Salad was ok. Chicken was good, but not the best. Our friend seated next to me quickly asked for salt and pepper. The portion was actually bigger than we expected. (we seriously already planned to hit up del taco or jack in the box afterwards in case we weren't full) My son had burger sliders and fries and some guests jokingly wished they got his meal. The fries came with some great garlic sauce that tasted like the one from Zankou Chicken, so I used it on my chicken and potatoes!! lucky me! We had a 1y & 3 year old in our party and they loved it out there and looking through the glass. It's not a kid friendly place, but since we had a reserved section and it was a wedding party we took them and they were very accommodating. They even had the high chairs ready! So they DO have highchairs which is good hahah. Overall everyone had a great time! (and a lot of drinks) It's a nice place to consider having a big dinner party if you are willing to pay a lot. It had that nice wow factor for guests. We left around 9 and it was packed. Glad we got to try for free. I suggest going to happy hour to get a better deal on drinks and food since it's pricey. Parking lots nearby $5.*****updateSo earlier today, I was telling my husband how surprised I was that my son tasted ketchup for the first time last night and must've liked it cuz it was all gone. He goes, oh I finished it, I was dipping my potatoes in it. Yes that's right, his roasted fingerling potatoes. (ghetto i know! but he said it tasted better) So I guess that makes 3 of us adding our own seasoning.

Reviews.Author: Josh M.
Reviews.Content: We went to perch for happy hour on a Wednesday for the happy hour. When we made it to to the top we were greeted and asked to sit outside. She said she could but the tables were reserved and would have to move when they got there. Um OK, thanks. She said she would give us a good table and seated us as far away from the view as possible. We asked to move by the view tables and she said OK but would have to move our asses even earlier. We sat down got the menu. There were only like 5 things on the menu and found out happy hour was only beer and wine.  Everything  was way over priced.At this point we had already decided to stay for one drink and bolt. When we finally had to flag down a waitress, we ordered 2 absolute dirty martinis. She left and came back 5 min later to tell us they only had sky vodka. When we got our martinis they were teeny tiny and cost 12 bucks and tasted very watered down and nasty. We enjoyed the nice view and the one piece of free bread and bolted to villains to have a real drink and some fun.

Reviews.Author: Lynette B.
Reviews.Content: It was my friend's birthday yesterday and she decided she wanted to celebrate her birthday at Perch. I wasn't too thrilled driving to downtown LA especially on Friday's because traffic can go way into the night. When I arrived to this hotel it was 10:30pm and there was already a line outside.  There was parking across the street and it only cost $6.00- not too bad considering other parking lots close by were charging $15. The hotel security guard was slowly ushering people in small groups to go into the elevator. You have to ride two elevators to get to the 15th floor where the bar is at. I was not too impressed by the outside of this hotel but was pleasantly surprised how nice the resturant/bar was. Cute French looking decor and awesome view of downtown LA.  They had a live band performing.  There were many business type people who were unwinding after work. There were so many beautiful people here.  Nice crowd.  This place is a little  pricey and I was disappointed that they closed the kitchen early.  Drinks and deserts start off at $10 and portioning were small.  For that reason I gave it 4 stars.  If you do decide to come here, a lot of people were ordering a drink called my fair lady. Even guys were ordering this girly drink.

Reviews.Author: Bobbie W.
Reviews.Content: everyone's been raving about perch so i finally took a trip out. getting a table here was a pain. if you don't have reservations, you can snag one of the first come, first serve tables. first come, first serve tables are a bad idea sometimes. i was lucky enough to grab a huge sofa area when i arrived since i had a large party coming. the bad thing about reserving it by myself was that the server had told another couple one of the sofas were open so they came and sat down. i told them i was saving it and they said the server told them to sit there. the server came over and said she could add more chairs when my entire party came. pain in the butt seating part one. later when my entire party did arrive, the space was too small so the server told us to wait for a table which we then migrated to. another woman, a snotty woman might i add, sat down with her two guy friends at the end of the table and gave me attitude when i told her the table was for us. the server had to get involved again and they were moved, naturally. pain in the butt seating part two. after getting worked up and wanting to punch the snotty woman, we were finally seated. the situation was pretty shitty but the server was really nice and you could tell she was really trying to make things work. +1 star for the server.we ordered lamb sliders, mussels, salmon tartar and heirloom tomato salad with chicken. all were very meh. the sliders were very gamey. the salmon tartar was bland and fishy. the "heirloom" tomato salad wasn't really heirloom tomatoes but cherry tomatoes instead. the chicken on the salad was dry and bland. the only good thing was the mussels. the other redeeming thing about this place was the white chocolate bread pudding. if you're gonna come here, make SURE you order this. it was AMAZING!! we also got the chocolate pot de creme which was whatevs. +1 star for the bread pudding.i didn't try any of their specialty cocktails but i really don't think they could've wowed me to like this place more. i really don't see what the hype is about and to be quite honest, the view is whatevs too.

Reviews.Author: Jay S.
Reviews.Content: SOOO hoping this would be THE place for a dream date with my girlfriend . . . especially with that terrace view.  But, unfortunately, we were really let down by the sluggishness of the staff and the very mediocre cuisine.  My steak was chewy and hard to cut (especially with the butter knife provided).  By the temperature of the plate, I could tell it was under a heat lamp for a while.  The fries accompanying were soggy.  My girlfriend's lamb burgers were also under the heat lamp and she said there was some gritty "sand" in her meat.  Spent way too much money and will never go back.  It's a poorly managed, glorified hipster bar.  Nothing more.

Reviews.Author: anthony r.
Reviews.Content: Terrible service.

Reviews.Author: Thelma W.
Reviews.Content: yay! finally, another rooftop bar in downtown LA!  i love the vibe here so much better, much more chill, and a french bistro-esque theme.  i love that there are no lines and annoying hollywood ppl.  there are definitely more locals that kick it at this spot for now, i hope it stays that way for a while

Reviews.Author: J L.
Reviews.Content: Went on Saturday night, it was a nice place to lounge at.  We sat on the roof top 2nd level. Bar service was decent. The female bartender was a bit slow serving drinks, staff was great, Rene made our stay great, turned on the patio heater for us and made sure we had chairs to lounge in.  Great service overall, no bathroom lines, and the view is to die for...

Reviews.Author: minna p.
Reviews.Content: a hidden gem in dtla. the scene of dtla is beautiful here. can get a bit crowded at night but def. give this place a try if you want to go somewhere chill with your friends.

Reviews.Author: J M.
Reviews.Content: can't argue with that view...or their pisco sour.

Reviews.Author: Magali R.
Reviews.Content: 1. View is great.2. Live band is great.3. Food is ok. 4. Service? Here's the story. Arrive for dinner and drinks on a Friday night at 7pm (without a reservation) with a friend. Hostess tells us it's an hour wait and we can have a drink at the bar in the meanwhile. We agree, have a glass of wine each and the wait ends up being closer to 20-30 minutes. We are asked to close the tab at the bar, then are walked over to our table. I notice there is a piece of cork in my glass. I look around and find an employee ( man with silver shoes) nearby and tell him about it. He tells me I should get up and go tell the bar about it so they can change it. I don't feel like getting up so I just pull out the piece of cork myself and ignore the incident. We wait around for AT LEAST 20 minutes before the server comes. Asks us what we want before having brought menus, and when ordering a second round of wine, we indicate we want a different type, and she asks which one. In my head I think "I don't have the menu memorized! I don't know" but instead kindly ask to see the wine list to make my selection. Long story short, there is a lot of waiting. We could not find her to get our check so I instead get up and ask the bartender (super nice guy) to direct me to the manager. I share with him the various details of our experience and he was EXTREMELY courteous, apologetic, and grateful for the feedback. I think they just need to train the servers better, but had a great experience with management. They took care of one round of drinks and food and the manager gracefully bid us adieu. Leaving on a positive note despite my issues with our server will definitely make me come again.

Reviews.Author: Peggy C.
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS THE WORST PLACE EVER! THEY DO NOT KNOW THE MEANING OF CUSTOMER SERVICE! It was my friend's birthday and there were 11 of us out celebrating. None of us had ever been to Perch before. It looked like a great, upscale place to celebrate so we went. We soon regretted it. A few of us had been upstairs already and we came down to find our friends as we took four different cars to get there. We we first arrived there was no one at the front door. When we attempted to back inside one of the bouncers who was just upstairs was outside with this really tall, thin, incredibly rude "hostess." We walked right by her as we did not know who she was, nor did she present herself as someone who needed us to stop off and check in with. There was no line to get in or any indication that I needed to check in with someone before entering. I was the first one who walked by her. She asked me where I was going and I advised her  "to Perch." She twisted her face in a rather stuck up was and said "Um can you come back here please?" So much attitude was presented it was ridiculous. So I obliged her and returned to the front door. Then she stated, "I need to see your ID, in fact, I need to see all of your IDs." Please keep in mind- I am in my low 40's and my friends were also no where near 21. While I have been told I look 35 by lots of lovely people, I know there is no way that I look younger than 21 nor did any of my friends "if you are reading this- sorry guys" I looked at her like you have to be F---king kidding me! The bouncer looked at me and advised her that we had just come downstairs and to let us back up. We go upstairs to the 16th floor. We wait in line for 40 minutes before getting to the front of the line for the "mixologists" to work their magic. By the time I got to the front of the line- I was like screw this-I am ordering 2 drinks because there is no way I am waiting in this line for another 40 minutes. I order a shot of Kettle One and a Kettle One and Cranberry. The mixologist made the Kettle One and Cranberry and then sits a glass on the counter for the shot. I see very clearly that there is lipstick on this glass and don't say anything at first as I figure as slow as she is moving she has to see this. In the time it took her to make the drink and prepare the shot I could have made four drinks- no wonder it took so long for me to get to the front of the line. Anyway, She is about to pour this shot into the dirty glass and I stop her and say "You aren't going to pour that in that glass are you?" She rolls her eyes- yes I said rolls her eyes and says to me "Well, what would you like me to put it in?" I reply to her "A glass with no lipstick on it please." She then removes the snotty how dare you question me look from her face and gets another glass. She never apologized or anything! The lounge area sucked as well. There were only a few couches out with a fire pit and one other heater- My friends and had to stand the whole time we were there and we froze our butts off. The people on the roof top were complete snobs. Other than the snobs I could not believe the complete lack of any kind of service at this place! This is supposed to be upscale? I think not. If you want to pay for someone to treat you like crap- Then this is your place. As for me, this place will never see my face again!

Reviews.Author: Jay B.
Reviews.Content: a lovely rooftop bar perfect for showing guests..the decor is cute..& there are some good-looking peeps. however, i don't feel the mingle vibe. everyone just kinda sticks to their own. something about the formality makes me want to run over to la cita where u can talk to anybody. great drinks & service. for some reason the top roof floor is very asian whereas the middle floor is more mixed.

Reviews.Author: Brian J.
Reviews.Content: Very solid rooftop bar Downtown LA. I've been here probably 10 times over the last year. Very reasonable drinks and you have to love that city view!!!! It's the closest thing LA can rummage up to compete with NYC, even though it's totally different vibe. I just love being up high, and wish there was a bar that was like 30 stories up. That would be amazing!!! But for time being, Perch will do. Great place to bring a date, I've had many heart to hearts leaning over the glass railing on the upstairs deck. There's something about heights that gives people an added sense of freedom and curiosity. If you're like me, when you're on a date, you want to really find the substance of the person. Not necessarily on the 1st date, you don't want to get too deep too fast, just something about having that dialogue bridge the gap between silly fun, and real life wishes, desires, and dreams. There's something about the feeling of being up high that liberates the spirit, and removes the hindrances of our own imagination. When you are free to think, free to dream, you can really start conveying your heart in a more meaningful way, which leads to more sustainable intimacy. Plus it's a great place to keep your date warm with the gentle and strong embrace of your arms and chest. The rest is up to the chemistry you build with your date...

Reviews.Author: Glenda R.
Reviews.Content: Drinks are perfect and ambiance is just as good.  Definitely a fun night spot to hang out with friends and take in the views.

Reviews.Author: Luis V.
Reviews.Content: Nice place and awesome view, BUT horrible hospitality from the bartender.

Reviews.Author: Carole S.
Reviews.Content: LOVED THIS PLACE.  the ambience is wonderful and the food is great.  we had dinner at sunset and it was amazing.  so beautiful.  Great Vibe.  The shrimp was so delicious.  the surf and turf was excellent.   the cesar was good not great and they could do a bit better with better bread.  It still was wonderful.  we did not have entrees but they were reasonalby priced for downtown LA and a place this nice (18 to 36 dollars).  we had small plates and shared and it was great.  the bread pudding was excellent.  the staff was friendly and welcoming.  I will be back!!!! With Friends.

Reviews.Author: Janice M.
Reviews.Content: 4 stars for the ambiance; 2 stars for the food. balances out at 3

Reviews.Author: Roberto M.
Reviews.Content: Worst. Service. Ever.  Hostess was inept.   Food was not that great. And to top it all off, despite having made reservations months in advanced, they suddenly weren't able to accommodate our party. We had to rearrange tables around ourselves because the wait staff was completely useless. You've been warned.

Reviews.Author: Sharlene G.
Reviews.Content: Cool place. Great views of Downtown LA. Drinks are good. Music can be a little loud inside; sometimes a live band or a dj. Fire places outside. Sometimes a line in the front; no cover. Parking is convenient ($5-7 right next door).

Reviews.Author: Jenelle L.
Reviews.Content: A stunning view combined with great live jazz makes for a pretty good evening.

Reviews.Author: Marge E.
Reviews.Content: I love Perch! I was there last night to celebrate my birthday and whoa!! I must say! My party of about 30 loved the place! It's a gem in downtown. Because I had such a great experience, I decided to write this review.. (Yes! My very first review). I had dinner reservations at 830 for 12 people and then about 25-30 people were going to trickle in for drinks on the top level after.  Tina who I spoke with a week ago suggested that in order for me to avoid the $1000 deposit, I should reserve dinner for 12 instead of 20.  Totally loved that she suggested that! So we arrive around 835-840 and sat us in a private area just for my party! =) I went to the 16th floor  with balloons to reserve a space and when I got there, it was packed! The bouncer Tim, called Tina to come and in less than 5 minutes she was there =) She told me that there was another party of 30 there and that I should have arrived much earlier to reserve but I told her I wanted to be considerate that I was not taking up space since my guests were not arriving till 10pm. It seemed like her hands were tied at this point.. but she said "let me check!"  Then, Tim got a message on his earpiece that I can still have my party up there.  Tim was amazing he told me that he would take care of everything and even put reserve signs!! Then i was off to attend to my dinner guests. On my way down, Tina met with me again, and she was kind enough to tell me not to worry because she took care of everything for me.. AMAZING I say!  The food took forever!! A little pricey but it's worth every penny! I must say that they kept serving us bread and butter to make up for the lateness but it was worth the wait!  I had the Beignets and it was fresh and scrumptious! Tasted a little of my friend's veggie risotto and again it was mouth watering! The Lamb burger looked amazing! The endless fresh bread with butter and olive tapenade  was ooh lala!! And the drinks, oh wow! Great prices!! After about an hour, my 10pm drink guests were starting to trickle in and we were still not served our dinners!  So all my guests were sporadically located.  I went back up to apologize to Tim for our tardiness and explained that we've been waiting for food.  He was soooo nice and said just come and ill will take care of your party!!! TIM IS AWESOME!!! So why the 4 stars? 1/2 a star for the time it took to serve the food.  Another 1/2 was for our server (who was having a bad day because of shitty customers who were sitting next to us, but still..) HE was not too friendly.  Although he did put one of my drinks on the house.. he could have been nicer/friendlier.  Aside from that, the night was a success! The place is new and you can tell that they are still ironing a few kinks (like every business would during their first couple of months), but with the rate of how they're going, PERCH will definitely be one of DT's greater restaurant/bars!  And again, thank you to Tina and Tim .. You made it a special night for me!

Reviews.Author: T P.
Reviews.Content: Took friends from out of town there last night.  The view and ambiance are AMAZING!  The food was a bit so-so.  For the prices they charge and the beautiful view you would think they would have a better chef.  Overall i would still go back, but i think i would plan on having drinks and the very tasty  MUSSELs appetizers only.  Our Cesar  salad was VERY bland; the short ribs were just ok (although the waiter said this was THE dish to get).  I wish the food was better so I could give this place 5 stars but it's simply not there yet.

Reviews.Author: Jessica Y.
Reviews.Content: current fav neighborhood spot.  nice pretty view.  usually good music.  bartenders are easy on the eyes. bouncers are gentlemen.  only thing is drinks aren't always strong.  but love this place nonetheless.  just not really as a pre-party/starting point.. if it's one of THOSE kind of nights.

Reviews.Author: Kate C.
Reviews.Content: Came here for happy hour and sat outside in the patio. It's a nice view of the downtown high rises. Their hh menu is very limited and the drinks are okay. They have an interesting selection on the hh menu, including buffalo frog legs.  food was not very good and not recommended. Overall, the vibe is nice but not the drinks or food

Reviews.Author: Loving L.
Reviews.Content: This lounge is a treasure in Downtown LA!  The Perch is located on Hill Street, walking-distance from the mainstream downtown bars and restaurants.  You'll ride up two sets of elevators in order to arrive at the Perch-- the first floor has mostly restaurant seating- although it also has a bar.  If you plan to eat dinner, make a reservation a couple days beforehand!  However, if you are just there for drinks, head up to the roof-top and vulture for seating-- if you're lucky, you'll get a seat near the fireplace.  I visited the Perch on a Saturday night, and there was no rooftop waitress service--the lines to order drinks were short at around 8:30 but much longer around 11 pm.  The bartenders work quickly and make awesome drinks.  I got the digestif made as a cocktail and it was delicious, strong, and relatively inexpensive ($8).  Some people were wearing jeans while others were wearing dresses--it seems like anything goes.I plan to go back!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa R.
Reviews.Content: escargot... and I don't mean on the menu! the service is painfully slow, especially for a not-so-crowded weeknight. the food is okay: asking for a bloody filet mignon, i mean exactly that... maybe the french don't eat it this way??? hmmm... no steak knife to be found, asked twice for one, we sat outside so by the time it came my food was cold. off with their heads! the redeeming factors: their drinks are awesome, nice and strong, the staff though slow is friendly, the view is gorgeous and the ambience is idyllic...just the way I like it. follow the birds on the elevator buttons, restaurant is on the 15th, lounge is 16th and you gotta make a stop on the 13th :D parking lots near by and there is valet on the weekends. wanna impress a date, this is the place...well for drinks anyway...go straight to the lounge (never been here on a weekend, sounds like chaos from previous reviews, no thanks!)wanna eat real French food, this is not the place... make an effort and overlook the hipsters and go to taix in echo.park, really.

Reviews.Author: Akash M.
Reviews.Content: Best rooftop bar in Los Angeles, you have to wait on Friday nights, but not too bad.  The bartender was very friendly, took take care of me, wasn't hard to find a place to sit, all the patrons were lots of fun.  If you are looking for the nice part of downtown LA, look no further.

Reviews.Author: Jenny G.
Reviews.Content: I heard about Perch from my friends and decided to try it for my birthday as I wanted to go someplace special. I was not disappointed. I had reservations and arrived early so went right in- after being wished a "Happy Birthday" by the bouncer. The view is gorgeous and there is no cover charge! The drinks are great- pretty strong and different than the usual offerings at the other downtown bars. I only got dessert- the bread pudding- but it was delicious. The music is laid back and the ambiance is super cool. I will definitely be back

Reviews.Author: Rae G.
Reviews.Content: I went here last Thursday with a group of friends. Great experience, would go again!

Reviews.Author: Maria T.
Reviews.Content: We went to Perch last night. It's definitely more of a social, bar-type place than a real restaurant. We had made a reservation a week in advance and when we arrived we were seated outside, but had to ask to be re-seated twice because the waiters kept walking by and hitting our table ( nearly dropping HOT food on us!) They forgot to give us bread, which wouldn't have been such an issue had the food not taken an hour to arrive. We ordered the asparagus salad, the steak frites and the Beouf pot au feu. The salad was nothing special. The steak frites came with frites with truffle oil but they were completely soggy and while they tasted fine, they really were a nasty texture. The pot au feu was nice, the horseradish mashed potatoes were STRONG and the peas were super dry, most defiantly frozen. We had the pot au creme and berries with whipped cream for dessert which was lovely. Overall, it was pretty disappointing. It gets very loud and crowded after 8ish so enjoying dinner can be tricky. Overpriced, overrated. Best recommended for drinks..although those weren't amazing either. Put simply, your paying for the view. **the decor is sort of wonky, a little bizarre the restaurant floor looks more like the cafe in Friends than anything French...a bit cheesyTry the bar at the Standard for a more refined experience, or the Water Grill for an amazing meal!

Reviews.Author: Sandy L.
Reviews.Content: I came to this place on a thursday night to meet up with my friends. I was by myself and when I got there, there was a short line to get in. I went to the doorman and told him that I was by myself and my friends were already in and he asked me if my friends had a reservation. I told him I wasn't sure but I was just one person. He refused to let me in still so I called my friend who told me that unfortunately they did not have a reservation. So I'm standing in line and I hear him go if you live in downtown then you can stand in this other line so I go up to him and ask him what if I work in downtown and he gives me this crap about how the manager only said people who live in downtown because they'll come more often. Case in point is they will make you wait even if the place is empty which it was when I finally made it in. I did drink up when i got in and the staff inside were definitely a lot nicer then the guy outside. The drinks were pretty tasty but a little bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Author: bobby b.
Reviews.Content: cool laid back spot to drink and chill.. great view!!

Reviews.Author: Bahar F.
Reviews.Content: was here last sat night for apps and drinks.  service was friendly but sooooooooo slow!!  parking was a pain in the arse, as was getting seated.  place was PACKED at 8??  music was too loud!!  i couldn't hear the waiter say the specials (which was actually quite funny).  the food?? meh.....nothing special or delicious, but not bad either. the fact that it is a gorgeous spot is its one saving grace.  it really is very beautiful inside and out, and i guess that's what you are paying for.  all in all i give it a B-/C+.  I may come back for drinks during the day just cos it's so pretty on the rooftop.

Reviews.Author: Tif Y.
Reviews.Content: As a bar/lounge; just gorgeous. Kinda small elevators going up, but they did a great job with the place and it's beautiful up there on both floors. Food is pricey and a little disappointing... but drinks are great and the view is fantastic.  Definitely my favorite dt rooftop bar!

Reviews.Author: Darren M.
Reviews.Content: I've been to this place 5 or 6 times and always had a great time.  Amazing views, somewhat expensive, but awesome drinks, live music on Fridays and Saturdays.  However this last trip I had a problem with some of their staff.  Their rooftop area was closed for a private party until 1030pm, which is fine.  At around 1040 we walked over to the stairs and there was a line forming on the main floor near the bar to go up to the roof, fine we waited in line.  A large group ahead of us went up, then the bouncer stopped us, and told us to wait there near the bar.  Around the corner there was a second line forming on the stairs which go down to the main elevators.  A group from there went up to the roof next, I assumed they were alternating lines.  Then another, then another.  I asked the bouncer who had asked us to wait when we would be going up.  He said, "The line is down the stairs, why are you waiting here?" I told him that HE had asked us to wait where we currently were.  His reply was, "Why would I tell you to wait here, this is nothing." And then turned to his colleague to make a snide remark.  I have never had a problem with the staff prior, they were always polite and professional, but this really rubbed me the wrong way.

Reviews.Author: larry m.
Reviews.Content: Good food, service and atmosphere. Group of eight tried many appetizers, entrées and deserts. Top picks: butternut squash tortellini, Escolar, and bread pudding. No longer serve watermelon and tomato salad although it is still on the menu. Great views and popular bar - reservations recommended.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany N.
Reviews.Content: I made reservations three weeks in advance for a friend's birthday, but still waited 45 minutes to be seated.  The hostess rolled her eyes at me when I asked her how much longer we'd have to wait.  While waiting to be seated, I bought my friend a drink at the bar.  After taking a few sips, she put it down and a waiter took it.  After being seated, I spoke with the manager (Eric(k)) regarding these things.  He offered a table with a better view and a round of cocktails.  This was the least he could've done.  I don't recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: J N.
Reviews.Content: Perch is a very pretty place. Very elegant, classy! Great view on the roof top. Haven't had the food yet but I definintely like it for lounging and having a few drinks. I would go there again!

Reviews.Author: robert m.
Reviews.Content: We visited perch and had a great experience.  I am not going to try to review the food, but even if it was bad, the service would have compensated.  Going and expecting to get the usual too-cool treatment from arrogant service staff, I was happy to get the complete opposite.  The environment was great, views terrific and drinks accurate.  Thank you Perch.

Reviews.Author: sue s.
Reviews.Content: went to perch to celebrate my birthday. there were 10 of us. first time there and had a great time. we went early (7-ish) and grabbed a spot on the highest rooftop area. it's limited seating and its first come first served so if you want a spot, get there early.  people were all standing as it got later just waiting for someone to leave. there's a full bar there. only drawback is they don't serve food up there. you have to go downstairs if you want food and eat it there. it got really crowded around the 10 o'clock hour. if fact when we left around 11, there was a huge line to get in. great view, great ambiance....i'm a fan.

Reviews.Author: T J.
Reviews.Content: Very nice and relaxing environment with some mellow french music. Very good mussels and house burger.

Reviews.Author: Hermina S.
Reviews.Content: First, the Good: Great ambience and view. Perched on top of an old building in LA, the view was amazing.Next, the mediocre. Slow service. Very noisy atmosphere that you had to yell to have a conversation.Lastly, the bad. THE FOOD. There were barely 8 appetizers and when we were seated by 9:15, they were already out of two. How do you run out of food so early on a Friday night? So, we ordered salads as starters. The tasted like they were just plucked from a plant in the kitchen- tasteless and bland. Their ingredients just did not blend well and I forgot if there was any dressing at all, as it was just so dry.The rest of the food was just as bad. The lobster bisque was devoid of even a single piece of lobster and was like watered down milk with an orange coloring. The chicken was dry. The ribs my friend had were bland. The only decent dishes were the fish. The Escolar I had was fresh and cooked perfectly and another friend said his Salmon was decent.Even the drinks were poorly made. The two mojitos we had were not mixed right (they took them back and did not charge us). We even complained to the manager about the slow service and lack of appetizers. She promised us free desserts and coffee. When the bill came they only gave us 50% off the desserts and charged us for the coffee. For the high prices for the entrees (average of $30/dish) one would be better off going to McDonalds for dinner and coming here to enjoy the view.

Reviews.Author: christopher c.
Reviews.Content: Everything at this place was great, from the 2 starters, 2 entrees and the 2 yes count them 2 deserts. The menu is small, I think this will expand since they just opened the night before we went....my only complaint of the night is that the wait staff is slow at clearing away your plates before the next course comes to the table and the waiter was not that friendly. But, on a side not another waiter (Josh) came over and was wonderful so when i return, and we will return. We will make sure to request his section and I think our experience would have been perfect....thanks for a good night out in downtown. C.Cromwell

Reviews.Author: Bob R.
Reviews.Content: This is the newplace in my neighborhood.  VERY nice wait staff and hostesses.  We didn't have a reservation on a packed Saturday.  They couldn't give us a table but they were so cool that instead of turning us away we could order drinks and appetizers at the table that was being held for a reservation but when the reservation showed up they'd let us know and we'd have to move to the bar.  Totally worked for me and my partner.  We then walked around and enjoyed the view from above.  I'd give five stars but the appetizer wasn't great.  Maybe in a few more weeks of being open the food may improve but really it's the great views, friendly service and drinks that you go for.

Reviews.Author: Ryan M.
Reviews.Content: By far the best views of downtown LA I have ever seen and I have lived in LA my whole life.  This was actually the second time visiting Perch. The first time I would give it 4.5 stars because the rooftop lounge was open (be aware that the rooftop lounge is only open on the weekends, we went on Monday), but this time we went specifically for dinner.  We had a reservation for a table of 7 people for my parents anniversay and were seated at a nice secluded outdoor table.  What they didn't tell us was that it was their smoking area.  The service was pretty good and most of the night went well until some people sat at the firepit nearby and started smoking (they couldn't have been more than 10-15 feet away.  My father a former smoker gets sick everytime he smells it and was very irked.  Perch management may not be aware of the LA City Ordinance that bans smoking at outdoor dining areas within 10 feet (clkrep.lacity.org/online…).  Hopefully they will remedy this situation and post non-smoking signs in appropriate areas, or at least not seat diners in the smoking area.  Besides this some of our food came out cold, but most of it was very tasty and inventive.

Reviews.Author: Alexa A.
Reviews.Content: I was there satturday night. It was 6 of us. We came to bar to get drinks. I asked vodka/pinaple, but bartender said they dont have pinapple and redbul. He was mean. He said its NICE bar-they dont have stuff like redbul. What kind of bar is this if they dont have redbul???? If they want to make high class bar-then make a DRESS CODE!!!!!! Some of people looked awful... Waitresses is soo slow. And to get a table even worse. Crowd, long line outside (25 mins)-doesnt worth for a regular bar.... One thing-awsome view.  ( Sorry for my english i m russian)

Reviews.Author: Ara R.
Reviews.Content: This place is horrible I do not recommend it for birthdays or large parties. If you want to have dinner the food is not too bad but good luck getting a table at a convenient time, the food is the only reason I gave it a star. Most people rave about the roof top lounge which is cool but already exists all over DownTown and Hollywood. The problem with this place is the service, access, and organization. The servers are all gorgeous and nice but don't have a clue about capacity and hosting. The bouncers are rude, young, inexperienced, and obviously there is an issue with the elevators. The part that turned me off and actually caused me to leave midway between my friends birthday was the bartenders, especially the gentlemen who bartends on the roof top. The bartenders lay out olives, cucumbers and other drink topings RIGHT INFRONT of you. There is no sign to not touch or for bartender use only, its literally RIGHT THERE... so my friend wanted an olive and as usual they are so overpacked and busy my friend will have to wait 10 years before they notice him for his freaking olive so he reaches half a foot forward and takes an olive thinking hey they are for the customer, me , I paid I want a damn olive... all of a sudden the bartender yells HEY what are you doing, thats disgusting don't use your hands use a toothpick! why are you taking olives?!!!! he freaks out on my friend and keeps insulting him calling directly DISGUSTING... my friend trys to explain but he keeps on insulting until my friend fires back with a warning and then security comes and man handles my friend kicks him out. OVER AN OLIVE! The same thing happened to 3 of my girl friends at the same night over a cucumber at the bar. Rude and stupid staff. Good luck staying open. Never again for drinks or parties. I recommend ELEVATE LOUNGE or the STANDARD for partying rooftop.

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: Great Place! Awesome atmosphere, and even better food. We went last night and they had fresh oysters from France, the best I have had. Also met Rick the GM and he recommended some wines that you won't find anywhere else. If you have never been here you should, but go early because there is always a line.

Reviews.Author: S W.
Reviews.Content: Had a good time here.  Beautiful on a warm night.  Ignore the hipsters.

Reviews.Author: Ilegend P.
Reviews.Content: does anyone know if you can take pics on the roof from this spot....?

Reviews.Author: karin l.
Reviews.Content: Brunch at Perch! - It's SO amazing to have a wonderful meal, outdoors, atop a historic building in Downtown.  The atmosphere, food and drinks are amazing!  They have great live music too!

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: I must admit...I like this place.  So much so that when I wanted to celebrate my last day at work, I planned to celebrate here.  I called on a Monday and inquired about reserving a table on Tuesday.  The gal who answered the phone told me I couldn't reserve a table but that the place would be open on Tuesday and to just show up.  Imagine my shock when I and a group of coworkers show up (after about an 8 block walk...) only to be told that Perch is closed for a private event.  NOT COOL!!  If someone has specifically called to ask about a specific day, it is completely unacceptable to not inform them the place would be closed.  We'll see if I ever decide to give them another chance.  For $14 martinis that only come half full, it'll be a tough sell.

Reviews.Author: lisa S.
Reviews.Content: The rooftop view is great (beautiful tile work and eclectic seating on chaise lounges, benches and chairs and plants with an interesting "view" from the 15th floor of downtown LA-- in other words, the open air is the best feature), so go to Perch for cocktails only, but be prepared for a surly female bartender (long dark hair).  The plan was for my clients to meet me for cocktails on the roof at 7, with an 8pm dinner reservation.  Even though they'd called me earlier in the day to confirm my reservation, when my first guests arrived ahead of me they were told there was no reservation.  The maitre d' acknowledged their mistake, but then tried to seat us early for dinner when the entire party had not yet arrived for cocktails.  They finally seated us LATE for dinner at a table for six (there were eight of us, so two people had to squish together at each end of the table).  The server was awful, the food was slow and just okay, the wine menu was pathetic (a selection of six red and six white, except they were out of both the red or the white that I ordered).  AND, who knew that at 9:30pm a DJ would set up next to our table and start playing Pink Floyd while the clubbers started crowding in?  Back to my first line: go for cocktails on the rooftop, endure the surly bartender, and go somewhere else for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Jody F.
Reviews.Content: Went to the first Sunday Brunch of the season and had a fabulous time!  First of all, the ambiece with the view of LA is lovely, it was a gorgeous day and the jazz band was perfect!  I totally felt like I was on vacation.  The food was delicious and the service was very attentive.  There were 7 of us and we tried lots of things so we could share.  We had the truffle fries...omg, delicious,  we had to have two batches!  We also had the raw oysters, salmon tartare and the baked brie, all delicious.  As for entrees, the crab cake benedict with the light and lovely bernaise was unreal, really delicious.  We also had the Chilean sea bass and that was to die for on a pesto risotto.  The other dishes were the regular eggs benedict, the salmon crepes, and the french toast.  We also shared some desserts that were great.  I definitely will go back and I'm sure it will be packed for Mother's Day.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Billy W.
Reviews.Content: best brunch spot in la !  amazing rooftop views, great live music and delicious food.  we had a blast and will be back soon.

Reviews.Author: Laura S.
Reviews.Content: We went to Perch to celebrate my birthday.  It is an amazing spot in terms of the view and the vibe.  Really fun, and they have all these little seating spots with outdoor fires and love seats.  I'm not sure how you arrange for one of those, but find out before you go.  Because otherwise you are sitting at a table so small and packed in that you have to get up and move anytime anyone in the area needs to use the restroom.  It was the food, however, that was so disappointing.  We both ordered the ribeye steaks.  It took at least 30-40 minutes before our food came.  For the price, we were surprised that the cut was so small but okay...  then we tried them.  It was like the toughest pot roast ever.  I rarely send food back and it was so bad we both sent them back and ordered something else.  Another 30 minutes and the fish arrived.  It was good, but at that point, we were both so uncomfortable after being squished into our small table and waiting and waiting.  No offer of a comp. dessert or anything.  I would say if you want to see a really fun place in LA, go there for a drink, not dinner.  And get one of the cool spots.  Otherwise skip it.

Reviews.Author: Fzarond K.
Reviews.Content: great views, nice drinks. plenty of space to wander about.

Reviews.Author: Ruth F.
Reviews.Content: We went to Perch for a friend's birthday last Saturday night.  The location was awesome, the decor was cool, the view is probably one of the best in downtown L.A.  The service however left you wondering if you were considered a customer or a nuisance?  I felt badly for our waitress because I knew she wasn't calling the shots.  It was the owners and management.  We had a couple of tables that we were using for the birthday party guests.  A couple of my friends had ordered drinks and had just gotten their meal when the waitress comes over and tells them they have to move because the owner said they had people waiting for that table.  So they moved their food and drinks to our table and brought them some sort of table lamp?? Really?? You're not going to let them finish their dinner?  Then as the night went on.  My friend and I went to use the restroom and I hear from the stall that security is arguing with a woman in the bathroom that she's taking too long and that the janitor needs to bring in toilet paper.  All I heard is the woman saying "You're seriously standing here in the women's restroom arguing with me"?  As we were freshening up and washing our hands, we kept hearing security knock on the restroom door.  The food was just ok.  I'm not a big fan of French faire so maybe that's part of it.  We did order some sort of chicken appetizers, which were a little dry.  Everything else sounded not super appetizing, mutton sandwiches, pork sliders, frog legs.  We would go back for the view and cocktails but eat before you go and expect to be treated like you are an American in France.

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn K.
Reviews.Content: came here for the first time this past friday, only to return back on saturday. guess you can say i'm a fan. the view is breathtaking. but i might be biased cus i'm in love with all things dtla. drinks are fairly priced and the bars were never too crowded. plenty of seating around, along with heat lamps and there's also an inside area. friday night was a bit more packed and interesting. saturday was emptier and rather dull to be honest. the bouncers are actually honest and down to earth compared to others i've encountered. there's a residence line (for dtla-ers) and a line for all others.   the only thing that sucks about here is the different levels and one may be at full capacity meaning if your friends are on that level, you cannot get in but it wasn't too big of a deal. definitely check this place out. the view alone is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Daniel H.
Reviews.Content: The entrance is next to the Subway on Hill.  There's a guard in a booth to direct you to the location.  First off, we came only for happy hour, so my comments on food are limited to that.  However, must say that the view is amazing!  Went at sunset and you can see all of DT and the nice red and orange hue (caused by pollution) falling over the blue and green glass high-rises.  Love it!  The food, on the other hand, is ok.  Had the rabbit rillette (which is pasty mush), the salty and sweet nuts (which are just nuts), the poppers, and some drinks.  The menu is limited and you can't order off the dinner menu until happy hour is over.  There were also a lot of gnats flying around.  The service was chill and nice.  But the view is why I'd recommend this place to anyone coming from out of town.  You get to sit on the roof of an old-school building overlooking both the old and new financial district.  So you see a mixture of great, old buildings, including the beautiful Eastern Columbia Building, as well as the Biltmore.

Reviews.Author: Roisin C.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars if that were an option.  The decor, view, and ambiance are wonderful.  Jazz on Wednesday night is especially enchanting.  However, the food and service are just okay.  Frog legs were a bit soggy, not crispy, and the beet salad was just fine.  The coq au vin was delicious, but the menu does not warn that the chicken is fried and the dish does not really resemble coq au vin.  The boeuf bourguignon is good, but tons of meat without enough sauce.  The pot de creme au chocolat is a very American version of the dessert with far too much sugar and mediocre chocolate.  The service was friendly and attentive for the most part, but the server was not knowledgeable about the menu, her French pronunciation was terrible, and she was not very courteous when I sent back the Le Coq Rouge (worst wine ever).   Overall, i think it is worth going to for the views and ambiance, but order carefully and don't overspend.. the food isn't worth it.

Reviews.Author: Masami M.
Reviews.Content: great view and good for happy hour. 4 star:)
